reviews.review: Fun area. Fun area to hang out. Great shops and eating places. Live music usually going on on the streets. Lots of people.
So much to do.... So much to do so little time. Great souvenir shops amazing restaurants and was even able to take a helicopter tour from here. Also had a great night here with friends

Amazing!. Truly an amazing place to visit the Wharf in Cape Town in the afternoon. It mostly closes at 7 so be sure to get there at least around 4 to get to see everything open. Beautiful shops, restaurants, hotels, bars, and shows! a MUST when in Cape Town!

great place to eat and shop. Great place to eat, shop and just hang around.
Very good restaurants, food court for lunch and dinner.
What's especially good about it is that it's open all day.

Great Restaurants and shopping. Lots of waterfront restaurants here after a busy time shopping.
Easy to get to local bus, taxi or hop on hop off bus.

Good if you are up for some shopping. Nice shopping mall with a lot of different types of shops and styles - worth a visit.
Is in the middle of Waterfront so it can be a good option to kill some time before dinner.
Great for food and shops. Great place to see the views. Lots of shops and restaurants for you to chose from, all a reasonable prices. You can also get lots of trips from down by the waterfront.

3 night stay in the area. Stayed within walking distance of the V&A. Very safe to walk to and from our hotel and no sign of trouble anywhere. Plenty of good bars, restaurants and shops. Would recommend booking restaurants in advance as were not able to get a table in the first one and had to wait for a table in the second one. It's a big area also and would recommend a map so you don't miss anything.

There are seals in the harbour !!! . It is good to walk around and breathe the fresh air. And I got the complimentary harbour cruise ticket to enjoy it by boat. I could see a lot of seals in many action. So fascinating !!!

Beautiful . The waterfront in cape Town is absolutely beautiful. So many shops and different varieties of restaurants. There is this beautiful shopping centre that has a lot of North American shops which give it a homey feel in case you forgot something. Large Faris wheel which allows you to see the waterfront from up top. Great experience! Highly recommend visiting when in Cape Town
Victoria and Albert Waterfront. A very nice place to spend your time to relax.Plenty of things to do and to shop for souvenir.An ideal place to watch sunset
Fun day out. We had a great day at the waterfront..first great retail therapy then a smart lunch followed by a trip to Robben island which was really educational and fun

Enjoyed but over rated . Visited the V&A a few times, was expecting something amazing but no different on the shopping front than any other well known shopping complex.Lovely views of the waterfront ,full of bars and restaurants that are not expensive bearing in mind they are in a well known shopping area.Well worth a visit.

Loads to see. Made several visits for shopping and eating out.Also visited the Springbok Museum across the road. Lots of big stores and smaller craft shops of every description. Local food markets are fantastic with huge range of foods for sale from fudge to fillet of beef ,coffee to waffles and crepes. Centre for booking a wide variety of boats/helicopter trips too
Great!. Safe place to hang out. Shops, good food, some attractions, we felt great. Close to the sea, good air.

Touristy, But Some Worthwhile Attractions Too.. The V&A Waterfront is a reclaimed piece of waterfront with beautiful views of Table Mountain and the waterfront right out to Robben Island. It consists of a lot of touristy shops, malls, restaurants and hotels. However, we found the craft market building to be a hidden gem with many quality, local crafts that were suitably priced. We also enjoyed the food market next door, with its many booths of tasty, local delicacies. Coming soon is a new museum of African Art which will be housed in a beautiful restored building. Another reason to visit!

Great place for tourists and locals. This has it all, shops hotels and restaurantsA must if you are visiting Cape Town. Try stay near by so you can be in walking distance because the traffic getting in and out is a bit hectic.

Good tourist spot with something for locals too. The V&A Waterfront can be pricey, but if you know what you want it can be a rewarding experience. Some of the foods are awesome and the Cocktail cruises are incredible, at a fair price.

Ok. But not much different from other commercial shopping arcades . Plenty of shops and restaurants but lacking in individuality. If you want the shops that you would see in most major European cities then they are here. Some street entertainment too. Would perhaps have had more atmosphere if shops and restaurants round the marina. For local buzz and individuality recommend heading to Long St .
Fun with Family. We always enjoy our time at the Waterfront. The atmosphere, poeple the view from the big wheel. My kids love the outside entertainment, especially when it's school holidays.

RELAX....SHOP....EAT....CHILL OUT. By far the best shopping...eating and fun place all within a stone throw from Sea Point....There the mall, Aquarium...CITYSIGHT SEEING BUS pick up point, ferry to Robben Island...some small Museums for the fairer ones...DIAMOND MUSEUM...is one of them...and of course some gr8 places to eat...its a wonderful location for all ages

Monster of an urban redevelopment project. I felt that the waterfront area development was very disjointed. The shopping was mostly high end. A great variety of restaurants at differing price points. Certainly one would feel very safe shopping in this area but it felt a bit sterile to me.

Heart and Soul of Cape Town. Almost everyday we used to come here for something or the other...... huge mall with all types of shopping experience, good restaurants, hang around areas... we did one hour boating from this area.... it takes you around the bay and gives a panoramic view of Cape Town.
Amazing. Beautiful place for buying and having dinner or launch. An amazing vista towards the sea. There are a lot of good shops and good brands of every type.

Very nice area with surprices. This area is relatively new with a huge shopping mall, great walks around the waterfront, many different types of restaurants and bars and felt very safe but, like anywhere, do not show expensive jewellery etc. In the shopping mall, there is a Woolworths which is similar tonthe UK Marks & Spencer with clothing and a superb food hall where you can buy that essential South African wine at very low prices. You can spend a lot of time here if you like wandering around, take a short boat ride or just eat/drink and peoples watch.
Many street entertainers. Very touristic in a relaxed way. Many restaurants, art and handcraft shops, live music an street entertainers. Specially on Sundays it is lively compaired to the city.

Ok. Nice, but busy and touristic place. Is hasn't got unique aspects really. And shopping is not more then average. But it's a famous place in Cape Town and walking around for an hour or so won't hurt you. There are one or two nice restaurants and V&A is the right setting for an outside diner.

World Class African Space. You can't have enough of it, lots of retail, car, hospitality, parking and restaurants. You world is complete here you don't need to look any further. A real world class African location from 0 age to maximum entertainment. Always good to be here.
A cape Town must.. A definite must to all coming to cape Town. Amazing scenery and some really nice restaurants and loads of other activities.

Awesome. The place is picturesque with views of the Table Mountain and the Atlantic ocean. With all sorts of entertainment from street performers to cinemas and internal retail stores. Boat cruises also available.

Lots to do and see!!. amazing experience, lots of shops and restaurants right next to the water; you can also book a tour or Robben Island at Nelson Mandela Gateway at the V & A Waterfront, then return and dine with the seagulls at the numerous eateries, take selfies and play giant chess too.
Another mall. A popular shopping dining and hotel area developed from old docks. Good to have all this in one place, but it's just another mall in the end.

Good night out. For the hussle and bussle of Cape Town in a commercial setting this is where to go. With ample parking, brand names, smaller shops, and restaurants, it has more than enough of everything. It is divided into sections with one section catering for hand created items, and souvenirs, and another that has street food. Of course the normal franchise restaurants are also available to meet and eat. Good vibe , with buskers around and feel good atmosphere of most people

Shopping and entertaining . Our Cape Town Waterfront has been a real trendsetter in our country which not one of the other cities have managed to get close to. This area has everything to offer from shopping in boutiques, high end jewellery stores. Then to do small boat trips to Robben island or around the corner fopr sundowner trips. Food and restaurants that cater for all as well as cinemas to go to catch up with the latest movies.In the amphitheatre they have artists performing on odd occasions as well.Great place for the whole family.
shopping and food. We liked V & A, very vibrant area with lots of shops and restaurants. The atmosphere is great. good for an afternoon.
Great atmosphere . If you time and money you can spend the whole day exploring the many attractions and restaurants The bug wheel is very very slow and I would not recommend it

V & A Waterfront experience. The V & A Waterfront is a fun area to visit. We stayed 7 days and were there most day shopping, eating & drinking, taking the Hop on Hop off bus on the many route they offer. The Tourist centre and shopping beneath are just beautiful, original wares, light and colourful.

Quite a place. The V and A Waterfront is a vibrant place with many quality stores and numerous restsurants that range from fast food to top of the line places to eat, many of which serve fresh fish. Our hotel was within a three minute walk of the waterfront so we visited it on three occasions. One day there were musical groups and dancers that gave the V and A Waterfront a very festive atmosphere.

Easy and Convenient!. I was a little biased against spending much time at V&A Waterfront based on all of the reviews calling it a tourist trap, but I have to admit it was super convenient for any time we needed a quick bite to eat or to go shopping. The restaurants are all top-notch, the scenery is beautiful, and there are local artisan stalls as well for unique souvenirs. Don't skip it!
lovely place to visit. excellent place to spend some hours. sopping, food, music and nice setting. in a nice weather beautiful to seat outside for coffee
nice place to visit in the evening. nice area and lots of restaurants and shops. The Robben island boats depart from here too. Must see in Cape Town.
Great for shopping. This attraction has great shops,restaurants and many tourist attractions.It has a good view of Table Mountain.

Nice mall and places to eat, but no view!. It was nice to visit and stroll around the mall, but if you plan to go there for a nice view, may it be the sea, a beach or any nature scenery, you are going to be disappointed. It is like sitting in the backyard of a harbour. We went there for Marcel's frozen yoghurt - yummy!!!!

Overall . For me Cape Town is far overrated especially V& A...overcrowded like the all the popular cities...but it's romantic for a weekend away.
There is a lot around & many luxury hotels...
It's not cheap...
Apartments are a cheaper option...
There is a shopping mall...but not many famous designers.
Capetown water. Front. The Victoria and Alfred Water front doubles as a shopping area, restaurants as well as a dry dock. Lovely to walk around.
Safe, vibrant and fun.. Lots to do and see. Soak up the atmosphere, visit the African Trading Post and enjoy the many and varied restaurants. All that set to a theme tune of street musicians.

Lots of shops and places to eat. A good place to spend a few hours shopping in the several covered Malls followed by a choice of restaurants to eat in. Good atmosphere often with local entertainment next to the Ferris Wheel. Particular interest is the Water Shed which contains several small stalls selling crafts and, next door, an area selling traditional food which is well worth trying
A muts see in Cape Town. We had a good relaxing walk around the waterfront. It has a good view of the Table Mountain. There is also a lot of restaurants and souvenir shops around the area.

Plenty to do here . Restaurants, bars, shopping centres, sight seeing, local performances etc.
There's loads going on here and some great restaurants.
It's a fabulous place to sit and people watch. Would meet the needs of all types and all generations.
Grea place to walk around.. Great place to walk around and people watch, do some shopping, or grab a bite to eat. also good for a drink and some night time entertainment..
Lively! . Nice lively area with plenty of good restaurants and shops all within walking distance of each other.
Hub or tourist activity. Lots of restaurants, shopping and attractions to wander around. Good location for tourists as all in one spot.

Wonderful. Excellent hotel & location. Staff were efficient, friendly & helpful. Breakfast was good, especially the champagne & Buck's Fizz. Outdoor swimming pool in a lovely quiet location across the road. Lots of restaurants, bars & shops in walking distance.We have visited this hotel on several occasions and would highly recommend it. The Victoria & Albert waterfront area is definitely a must to visit when you are in Capetown.

Mixed feeling. Visited while travelling and had mixed reviews on the place. It was very busy and lots of people trying to sell which makes it a bit awkward when you dont want to buyLoads of shops though and really enjoy the food and craft marketsWorth a visit if in the area and have not alot else to do
Clean and well maintained . The place is really clean and well maintained.There is a small bridge which opens up for crossing of a small ship.The view is really satisfying and interesting.
Not a big thing . Nice place, yes; but nothing on your must-seen-list. In you go here, visit the good food market! The other stuff is just for (not very cheap) shopping.

good for shopping and entertainment. you can buy almost everything there which is known in the western world. Especially we enjoy it always after coming from the country. You can treat yourself with luxury goods and even get entertained with music outside.you can do harbor cruises from there and it has safe parking in front and underground.
Lovely Views and super shopping. This area contains a mall right on the waterfront. It also has lots of quirky shops and gobs of restaurants. We enjoyed our time there.

Nice place, good for food and shopping too. Nice introduction to Cape Town harbour and some good local crafts run by the artits themselves. Good restaurants and views across Cape Town and to table mountain too

A real fun place to spend a day.. Lots of bars and restaurants and shops selling everything one could wish for, especially a very good high quality range of African handicrafts. For amusement were the Marimba Bands which really livened up the atmosphere, with quite a few dancing to the hypnotic beat.
Nice place to wander. Nice looking location to walk, shop (from supermarkets to boutiques) and dine. Big parking lot. For those who are interested there is an aquarium and an heliport.
Overrun Tourist Trap. Plenty of shops, tons of crowds, lots of people trying to sell yours, trips. Not my kind of place. Two redeeming things -/- seals and the warehouse with the craft market.

Excellent place to shop and eat. Me and my wife came here twice during the duration of our honeymoon. Brilliant for shopping and suits all of your needs (and varying budgets), in fact I actually ended up buying more than her which never happens.Also a great place if you want breakfast or lunch (dinner as well but wasn't here for dinner. Loads of places to eat inside/outside and also a great food market outside as well. Loads of lovely food cooked right in front of you with very good prices.Can't recommend it highly enough if you visit Cape Town.

Pleasantly surprised. We spent quite a few hours at the waterfront, to our surprise.Head out early in the morning to avoid large crowds.Lots of beautiful & higher class shopping stores with zero haggling and pressure.Nice scenery of the harbour.We really enjoyed the watershed and the market for shopping and food. They have some really spectacular and original stuff.We had the most amazing breakfast at Vovo Telo! Head over there and order a fresh squeezed apple juice! Yummiest thing ever!Get your picture taken in the table mountain frame and stroll around.Very safe, good for all ages!
Busy spot. The waterfront area has a variety of tourist activities, many decent restaurants and and amazing mall. Street entertainment common in evening and on weekends.

Family outing . Always suitable for families. Something for everyone to do. We often visit as a family but also take our international guests there. And always they find this one of their favorite visiting destinations

Great shopping in a stunning venue. You would be hard pressed to find a more beautiful venue for top class shops, restaurants, hotels and other entertainment. Overlooking Table Mountain and/or the Harbour, on a sunny day, the V & A Waterfront is gorgeous. There's plenty of parking, public transport from the City Centre and a safe walkway from town. Plenty to do if shopping's not your game. Abundant restaurants and cafes. Lots to do with kids.
Vibrant atmosphere with lots to do. This is an attractive tourist area with lots of trips available and plenty of places to eat. There is lots of secure parking.

Always a treat. We visit the V & A regularly for a variety of reasons and always come away with a feeling of "that was fun!". Be it for restaurants, movies, attractions, shopping or just plain being there, the V&A is worth the visit.
Very busy. V&A was very busy over December and had to wait everywhere to eat. Parking was also a problem. You will be in for a lot of queuing during December everywhere.
A very busy place. We had visited a few times over the years so knew what to expect. Getting very up-market, but well worth a visit for the experience
Great Shopping and Atmosphere. Such a nice area to walk around and shop for souvenirs for yourself or others. On a nice day this is a great and easy activity.

Ultimate shopping experience. V&A is the perfect place for someone with a full day to wander about and shop. The collection of shops there is amazing with all the greatest brands found in one place. The restaurants there are equally amazing.

One of the must do's in Cape Town. I spent a morning mooching around the various attractions here learning about the history of the city along with a little shopping and eating. The weather was not great on my visit but there's plenty to see and do so even that didn't deter me from having a great morning in the area.

Brilliant place to wander around. This is a great place really eclectic from the marina, shopping mall, coffee shops, food court, craft market and the outdoor stage all in the shadow of table more mountain -wow
We had a great day wandering around browsing through the markets and watching street performers finished off with a fantastic meal by the water
Can't recommend highly enough

Waterfront has lots to entertain. V&A Waterfront has many different restaurants - you can even try African cuisine, bars, shops and hotels. There are street performers and there is a small mall of stores. We found a very good liquor store of South African wine.

Fantsatic experience for shopping, eating and sightseeing.. A great place to eat, shop and see great sights. There are historic sites in the waterfront area as well as fantastic shops and eateries from Macdonalds to high cuisine.
loved it!!!. it is a lovely and popular place in cape town, with restaurants, shops and everything. It is were you will find tour desks, tours can be made by boats,helicopters or buses.

Great Shopping & Dining Venue. Everything you need all in one place. Great shopping, excellent restaurants and great views of Table Mountain and the working harbor. There is live music at a few of the venues on weekends at nights. Always something to do or explore.

Great happening place. This is the place which is frequented by the locals and tourists both. Lots of activities to do. The roadside musical jigs add to the charm. Wonderful shopping areas and outdoor views.

$$$$$ . Good atmosphere, totally tourist oriented, the surrounding shops are high end so take your credit card (or keep it in your pocket as we did). Lots of restaurant choices, including the popular franchise's not necessarily what we were looking for, we missed the food market to the right of the main entrance but heard it was much more local and fresh. Boat trips depart from here, so it's busy and bussling, there was a Busker competition on while we were there which made the atmosphere more fun. Worth one visit.

Must Do in Cape Town. If you have a few hours to spare come down to the V&A Waterfront. There is so much to do. From the fabulous mall with lots of shops to suit everyone to the picturesque waterfront to stroll along. The Water Shed is located here with all its lovely crafts and curios as is the wonderful African Trading Port. The aquarium is definitely worth a look at or if you wish you can have a meal at any one of several great dining options.

Only if you want to shop. Touristy and high priced shops and restaurants. Raining the day we were there so didn't explore the whole area. But based on what we saw I would not recommend tourists spend their time here.

What a fun place this is!. The Waterfront area has beome the real center of Cape Town for tourists and locals looking for lots of restaurants and shopping malls built around lots of open space. It's beautiful both day and particularly at night. The undependable ferry to Robbin Island leave from this area.

Lovely place to be. Went there in July and September when we were in Cape Town, walk there from sea point, loved it every time, you can get everything and eat anything you want there, don't miss it , you'll love it!

Amazing shopping mall. Is the waterfront with wonderful sea and other activities, features a lot of local and international brands , various restaurant , a stage for shows , the Cape wheel displays the beauty of the place from the top and there is african dancing and singing shows, really it's difficult to describe the beauty

Nice chillout day. The shopping centre itself is not worth a visit if you want something more "local", especially for European visitors, as all the shops inside are chains and franchising that you'll find everywhere in Europe (and more expensive obviously).It's nice to go there on a sunny day, have a drink or lunch and admire the view of the ocean and Robben Island. There is also a nice food market where you'll find dishes from all over the world, as well as an arts and crafts market just behind the food market called Watershed.

Buzzing and vibey V & A Waterfront. You need to like crowds and the overwhelming hit on the senses that being in the Waterfront brings....where do you go first? I always begin at the Red Shed, which is full of very interesting boutique stalls selling all kinds of beautiful items ranging from exquisite wooden bowls, sculptures etc., through to amazing jewellery with semi-precious stones and copper, nickel or steel wire, clothes of all sorts and naturally some wonderful beauty products - mostly organic. Then out to the mall, and then one is truly gobsmacked, as there are two floors and every shop possible from exclusive boutique lingerie through to Cape Union where one can buy great clothes, camping gear, etc. plus two cinemas....plus several great restaurants....plus plus plus....and then outside, more lovely restaurants, a small stage where budding and well-known musicians perform regularly....and it does not end there. If you are not tempted by any of the food on offer there, walk down to the fish and chip shop and get a great meal, wrapped in paper, and sit and enjoy whilst looking out on the great view, and finally....take a trip on a boat round the harbour which is especially lovely at dusk, with a glass of sauvignon blanc or an ice cold beer to hand....all in all a treat!

Main Tourist Attraction in Cape Town. Plenty of shopping locations here, along with pricey restaurants. Enjoy the reggae bands while strolling along the cobbled streets. A convenient Pick 'N Pay supermarket is located in the basement here, for the more budget minded.

Great stop while in Cape Town. We stopped here a couple of times to enjoy the ambience, shopping and restaurants. There is also a small museum as this area was the embarkation point for Robben Island during the period the island was a prison. The museum is very small and free but worthwhile. The shops and restaurants are great. There is also a large ferris wheel and a number of other attractions. This is definitely worth checking out if you have time during you stay in Cape Town
Great place to walk. There are some great markets in this area and great views. If you like malls this is the place for you. Great eateries as well.

Good spot for a first time visit. We stayed at a hotel at V&A waterfront. Highly recommend the Watershed and the V&A Food place. THere's also a good sushi place in the Mall. The rest is kind of touristy

Cool place. My family and I spent few days in Cape Town very closed to V&A so we had the chance to visit the place. It has lots of places to eat and drink and looks like a very popular place. We loved it! Great place also for families with kids.

A lovely place to wander around. We spent several nights in Cape Town and wandered around most nights. There are good shops on two floors and lots of places to eat. There is a fast food hall in one location on the ground floor and lots of restaurants scattered around the Marina area. The food hall market and the craft hall are well worth visiting. We sat out in Freedom square eating a snack looked on by the statues of the 4 great men who brought freedom to this country. There is a definite lack of bars to just sit and have a drink. but a great place to just chill and watch the world go by.

Lively waterfront area always safe and busy. It's worthy of a visit as it is a key central and focal point of the waterfront with shops, markets, boats and people. It's a safe place to browse and walk along the boardwalks as irbid a hive of activity day and night. But beware that the food places are very average and lack the creative edge and quality of the nearby De Waterkant area.Unlike Sydney's Darling Harbour or Auckland's Viaduct Basin it does lack in bringing directly to people to the water's edge. You are simply enclosed or surrounded by shops, buildings and on warm sunny days you'll need to navigate the people walking by.There's a big shopping centre to escape the heat, lovely markets with cool wares or typical tourist souvenirs and a Ferris Wheel probably half the size of The London Eye.

Good vibe, nice view of table mountain. Lots of restaurants, street music, nice waterfront views as well as a view of table mountain. You can find a variety of food from cheap eats to fancy restaurant.

Good Restaurant, Shopping and Bars .... Galore. This is place with many people, many restaurants, bars and shops ....A mixture of high class and ordinary - the is something for everybody including a "cape Town Eye"

Holiday to Remember . This is definitely the place to stay in Cape Town, if only for the sumptuous leisurely breakfasts served along the waterfront. We were fortunate that our breakfast table offered us a front row seat to a leg of the world triathlon series in the lovely autumn sunshine.The traditional breakfast menu was supplemented by delicious local fresh fruit, cold cuts of meat and the best oysters I have ever tasted, complimented by a constant supply of champagne. It was so good we spent two hours over a late breakfast almost running into noon, it was rather special.The rooms were adequate without being luxurious, but more than met our needs.The staff were friendly and very helpful in meeting our touristy requirements.It is so well located as to be almost perfect.We stayed for a few days following a wonderful cruise through the Indian Ocean from Hong Kong, via Singapore, Penang, Colombo, Mauritius, Seychelles, Reunion Island and Port Elizabeth with CapeTown possibly the most memorable. We will certainly return, hopefully to the V&A!

Disney in Cape Town . Lots of shops yet we bought nothing....Lots of ok restaurants but we didn't find one that was more than okLacking in decent bars. We found 3. They were all crowded because there were only 3!Do the harbour boat tour if you canDo the Food Market and don't forget that there is an upstairs!
Very commercialised and for tourists. Stunning location, good for tourists. Great restaurants and atmosphere and expensive tourist retailers
Definitely a tourist destination. So much to see and do here! Boat rides, big wheel, shopping, historic sights...you name it and it is here! And of course all the hustle and bustle that goes with it.
Nothing special. This was underwhelming. The area is just like any other waterfront/marina one would find in western countries, teeming with western stores and chain restaurants.

Awesome. There is something for everyone here.Hundreds of shops,good quality restaurants including all the fast food take aways.Outside are the boat rides and across the bridge the Clock tower.Great big interior car park cheap and easy to park with some bods that provide a cheap car cleaning service.All the big named brand stores on the top level right down to Pick n Pay on the lower level.

Must visit.. So vibrant in a clear sunny day . This is a very good area for bars and restaurants and also Kids have much to do.. Really worth a few hours at least to people watch and just take in the boats water and ongoing vibe .. Think a very hood regeneration of an old waterfront wasteland
Great vibe. Lots of shops, restaurants and seals playing in the harbour. Well worth a visit. Trips to Robben Island go from here and you can take harbour tours and helicopter tours.

Nice area, lots of renovations taking place. Felt safe through here. There are tourist police everywhere. Shops are a little over priced but expected in a tourist area. Many restaurants, cafes and bars to choose from and the area is clean.

Nice and sanitized. Stayed 2 mins walk from V&A and glad we did. Super location for tourists, bars, tours, restaurants etc all really close together......if you want to have a safe night out, look no further

great place to wander. We had a few hours to kill before leaving the city, so spent our time looking around the V&A. There are plenty of shops, bars, restaurants etc, to suit all tastes and budgets and a great viewpoint for Table Mountain down by the harbour side.
Ideal experience. Good for shopping, dining and sightseeing. Pleanty of things to see and do, you can spend several hours enjoying the experience.

Clean, organised but expensive and has no soul. The only reason I go to the Waterfront is for the following reasons: 1) apple store which don't exist anywhere close by 2) Movies for the same reason. The Waterfront is a very "American" like artificial place without any soul. When you walk out of the movies at midnight, there is no one left except maybe a security guard. Very depressing place ! The restaurants are 20% more expensive than in town, especially the ones next to the harbour. I suppose the tourists don't know any better. If you look for vibe, rather go to Long Street from wed to sat.

Great place for shopping, beautiful view of the ocean and meet people from all over the world. Great place for shopping, and the shops closes at late at night, the place is always buzzing, You have all the shops in one place, I always get lost trying to locate my car at the undercover parking.

Great for food and drink. We had a lovely couple of evenings strolling around the V/A. There are plenty of places to eat and drink. The atmosphere is great and you can while away the hours just wandering around. A visit is a must

A cool place. You can see lots of seals here. Plenty and plenty but very naughty,
They take rest on the auto mobile tyres that are hung in the Boat bay. Looks very funny

Lots of shops, good food. I especially liked the markets there. You can find a lot of south african art, pottery, woodwork and food there.
The shopping centre offers all international stores and lots of food options.
From VA Waterfront you can take boat or helicopter tours.
Bus 104 stops there.

Clean and Friendly Nightlife - Great Restaurants!. We loved that this area was so close to our hotel! There were so much going on here each night and such a great variety of shopping, restaurants, and bars! It was also SO clean here and security was always around, especially at night.

Nice spot to stroll, dine and shop.... We were staying at the Table Bay Hotel in the waterfront. We enjoyed being able to walk about and see the harbor, shops and restaurants. Often there would also be performers in the main area. Since the weather was nice while we were there, we enjoyed some nice outdoor meals.
For fun. For sure the place to have some fun, food, views, tourists, attractions... Everything in a single place in Cape Town.

Great home for our tourists. The V&A waterfront is a great destination to see and smell the sights of Cape Town. To think that this location was the den of iniquity many years ago and to experience what it is now is simply wonderful. Many great restaurants and many great shops present South Africa well to the tourist.

Lots to do!. We visited the Waterfront many times during our stay in Cape Town, to eat out in the evening, to buy souvenirs and just to have a stroll. It has a very vibrant and modern feel to it and felt very safe.

Fabulous Location. Lots of designer shops, shops, boutiques, restaurants, souvenir shops, cruises ...just a vibrant and busy atmosphere, and a cloudy but warm start blossomed into a beautiful sunny afternoon. No rubbish, no hassle from hawkers, lots of families enjoying the start of the school holidays. We had a lovely lunch at a fish restaurant overlooking the waterfront, which served delicious South African white wine and obviously a favourite with local residents. Throughly recommended. Super place and lovely people.
Fantastic use of the old port area buildings.. This was a fantastic area for shopping/eating/ tourist attractions.Beautiflly restored buildings, very well presented.

Great vibe and waterfront location . There is loads to do here. I deliberately chose a hotel nearby as there are loads of great restaurants and great shopping. The ferry to Robben island departs from here. The Craft Market for me was a real high quality African products.

Just a mall!!. Okay the positives.....its a smart mall with restaurants and a good variety of shops. Very modern.
Negatives.....its a mall!! I heard a lot of hype around this place and do you really want to visit Cape Town and be stuck in a mall?? Just like every smart mall in the world - nice but missable.

Vibrant - A Great Place to shop, eat and relax. The V&A is simply lovely, It is the hub of lots of activities - trips to Robben Island, Whale Watching, Harbour tours etc. It also has an amazing array of shops - local and well known brands. The choice of coffee shops, restaurants and places to while away the time are in great supply.
Must visit. The shops are first class and so new. I love the restaurants also with the different kind of things to experience such as traditional singers every 150meters.
Touristy. This place in a tourist trap, if you like malls and overpriced junk and marginal food this is the place for you.

Great spot . What a lovely welcome to CT you get from this place.
Loads of activity, plenty of security so you feel safe too. A plethora of eateries and drinkeries!

Excerllent Area. We have recently been staying in the area as part of the Titan "Tracks of Africa" tour and have loved the V&A Waterfront. So much activity and atmosphere to absorb. Plenty of shops and eateries. Day trips available from boats, helicopters, Hop On/Off Buses etc. A really buzzing area with plenty of interesting buildings to take in too.

"Nice area for dinner and shopping". The area is great to exchange currency with the banks and ATM's available. There is plenty of shopping and restaurants and you can book bay cruises among other activities at the dock.
There is a giant ferris wheel with nice views and great views of Lion's Head and Table Mountain. It's a neat place to hangout for a few hours.

Beautiful & safe city. We only had 2 full days in Cape Town but wish we had more. The V & A Waterfront is a beautiful area and you feel completely safe walking around - day or night. There are a number of lovely restaurants over looking the waterfront and you can get great food at a cheap price. Unfortunately there was a lot of building works going on during our stay so without that it would have been perfect. There are plenty of things to do around the area with the Robben Island Tour, Table Mountain, shopping mall, SA Rugby Museum plus the winelands and beaches are not too far away. Definitely want to return to Cape Town soon!
must visit in cape town. nice to visit but other than sight seeing there is nothing interesting compare to other part of the city

Retail afternoon :). What can I say, these retail Malls are all over the world, all particular to their own location containing quality and tat in equal measure, great places to eat and drink, take a trip on the Lady J and see the sights in the Harbour

Worth a Walk. Lots of shopping, restaurants, some street performers, water-views with the backdrop of Table Mountain. Well worth the walk to enjoy the knick knacks and other items on sale as well as people watching and a great choice of food on offer.

Good . Spent 5 nights here .... a little too long Recommend perhaps 4 days max .... It's a good base to go from , plenty resturant s etc close by ..... But 4 days is enough After that you feel a little bored (you don't feel like you can walk too far away from VA front for safety reasons ) tho maybe this just my feeling !
Place to spend a nice evening . If you're looking for a place to spend an evening shopping, eating, relaxing and just roaming around, this place is the right choice. Loved it.!
Very nice. The V&A is a great part of Cape Town with lots to see and do and plenty of places to eat and shop, we really enjoyed walking around here.
Shopping, food etc. Thoroughly enjoyed my trips to the waterfront, great place to shop and eat. Can get very busy on the weekends and evening.
Shopping malls Galore. Enter any of the shopping malls and find high end stores as well as discount. The best part about the malls are the fabulous restaurants housed inside the malls.

Fantastic Place!. Great place to wander round, listen to street musicians, have coffee and people watch. Buy african crafts and experience wonderful restaurants..I felt safe and the shopping was excellent but all contained so you don't have to walk far to see everything. The waterfront can be done in a day but we went back 4 days on the trot!

If you like shopping or have time to kill. We had a few hours to kill before our flight so we spent those at the waterfront. For us nature lovers it's nothing special. It's modern, it has a lot of food and expensive shops. Also some tourist places to book tours. Tip: if you're buying souvenirs here it pays to compare prices between shops. We bought something for R200 that's sold for R300 two doors down.
A great, safe place!. Lots of shops, street bands, restaurants, people, the malls, aquarium, and.....the views!!! A great place to relax!
stunning. This is a must see the best place to be in it has everything the mall is sooo huge. its a tourist attraction you can go shopping and enjoy a great meal in your favourite restaurant

Love this place! . We have been there 3 times since arriving 3 days ago. Great music on the boardwalk along with an acapella choir not too far away. Plenty of good food, great shops, and views of the waterfront & table mountain. Our favorite place to shop is the Trading Post. Large selection & great prices. Im sure we will go here again with only 2 days to go before we head out to our 14 day safari.
Great place to hang out. Good shopping and dining, atmospheric and good for sunsets. Lots of options for both but touristy so expensive. We enjoyed it

Beautiful and expensive. We reached at dusk so could not enjoy waterfront as such and a small fire broke out in parking so we went to the shopping arcade. A wide variety of shops, restaurants with local and international brands are located inside. A tad more expensive and not a bargain.Saw some beautiful flowers at a florist's.

Loved the atmosphere and food. My wife and I, both in our late 20's absolutely enjoyed this place. We went in the early evening hours and window shopped in the mall. We later went for dinner at Karibu Restaurant. We made a reservation for the lover's lane seating, which is four tables seated next to where they stored their wine on an elevated platform. Not much advantage in sitting in "lover's lane" as opposed to the open areas of the restaurant as we are all pretty much in the same area. The shopping at the Waterfront is expensive so I did not end up buying anything here, but, it is a nice place to walk around for a few hours and enjoy a meal at either the food court or an upscale restaurant.

Spend a day ( or two, or three)!. I remember coming here as a child to watch the seals' antics at Berties Landing and marvel at the big Union Castle mailboats in Duncan Dock. That was it! Now, with the development and revitalisation of the Waterfront, it is possible to spend days here and still not exhaust all the activities concentrated in this area.A drawcard of note, the Two Oceans Aquarium, is hugely popular; if you like old buildings and are interested to see how some of them have been repurposed, then you are in luck, because dotted around the Waterfront are at least 30 buildings which have accompanying plaques, informing you of their history; there are eateries to suit every pocket; trips around the harbour and to Robben Island can be done - the possibilites are endless. Dont let bad weather deter you from spending some time here, the IMAX cinemas, museums and the inevitable shopping experiences are ideal for days where the sun doesn't shine!

beautiful place to walk around and have something to eat. loved it here, loads of shops, market area, waterfront with boat tours, 12pm cannon fire, and eateries galore. an easy half dayer could be sent here watching the world go by.

A must-have piece of jigsaw puzzle to complete a visit to Cape Town.. I went across V&A Waterfront as a happy surprise for me. The place provides various kinds of shops that offer a large variety of goods from local to international with reasonable prices. Street atmosphere is very nice with great live music from local people. The waterfront is also rich in history, with good interpretation. A number of restaurants provide great atmosphere with delicious food. If you look for a quick break from the city, V&A Waterfront is the place.

Interesting and Varied. The waterfront offers a safe environment for families. Not cheap, the poor Rand doesn't seemed to have effected prices in the shops so if looking for a bargain go elsewhere. But a good time in safe surroundings is offered here.
A mall at the waters edge in Cape Town. Interesting, similar to malls one experiences the world over. Convenient to walk around and see other harbor attractions as well.

Afternoon visit . Had a red bus boat tour and we were a bit early so went and walked around the waterfront. Plenty of shops and stalls with a lot of similar products being offered. Very touristy I would say. Restaurant for all tastes

A large open air shopping mall. Everyone raves about the V&A waterfront but we were left underwhelmed. Its possible that we missed something but all we could identify was a loose collection of tourist shops, bars and restaurants. We had hoped the food market would provide some local delicacies or something unique, however, it largely had brand named food chains and only a few market stalls, all of which pitched their prices well above what we considered acceptable for their fare. The one redeeming feature was the great view of Table Mountain from the Nelson Mandela Museum on pair one.

Nice Waterfront. Nice area to walk around with a good selection of restaurants , shops and bars ,  Also has some things for the kids to do along with the local entertainers, visit the local indoor market for gifts ,

buzzing atmosphere. The waterfront is a vibrant, buzzing place to be. It's great to sit at one of the bars watching the bridge lifting to let the yachts in and out of the Marina and generally doing a bit of people watching.

Plenty of atractionss. Popular development. Since 1992 the waterfront was transformed and now features everything from buskers to the giant wheel or' 'eye'. Extensive shopping mall, restaurants, bars, food hall and hotels. Starting point for the many harbour cruises on ofer and plenty of entertainment for all.

Attending conference. . In day of arrival my wife and myself went on a quick shopping spree. It's always good experience. Our famous shopping spot is at Woolworths where we normally buy household items as well as clothing for the kids. Despite being a Monday, the place was buzzing with people. The taxi stand was good and driver who dropped us back to hotel was friendly and courteous. A must place to visit with lots of food outlets.

Spend some time here!. Part of the waterfront is an upscale mall, but once you get out of that area, there are great stores shopping for unique, local souvenirs, lots of restaurants featuring all sorts of food, a ferris wheel, local entertainers singing and playing instruments. You should at least spend a couple of hours here, just wandering.

nice. Like almost all the waterfront, is to take a walk and nothing else. It was near the hotel so here is comfortable to walk and buy some souvenirs. It's enough to have a few beers and food fair at all restaurants. if the hotel is not near the waterfront, do not waste your time going to see it. Also see Table Mountain and the sea, both views are very nice.

Loved the V&A Waterfront area. We stayed at the lovely Table Bay Hotel with direct access to a great shopping mall and the wonderful waterfront. Lots of great restaurants and shops in the waterfront area and access to the Robben Island ferry and tour. Lovely area to stroll and take in all the great sites - even ride a Ferris wheel.
A day out shopping. A must see when visiting Cape Town. Perfect for shopping, lunching with friends or a boat trip. Clean, safe with secure parking.

Great Experience. I like that the waterfront has something for everyone, whether you are on a budget and looking to take in the waterfront and enjoy a budget meal, or whether you are looking for high end shopping and fine dining experience. There is a gem for every need

Lots to do. Stayed at the Table Bay Hotel which is at the furthest point on the waterfront. The closest hop on hop off tour bus is at the aquarium which is a ten minute walk. There are hotels closer to the stop. Many restaurants as well as fast food shops are at the waterfront. There's two major malls on the waterfront. Plenty of shopping and sightseeing charters. The cape Ferris wheel is operational day and night. Lots of live music at the pubs as well as outdoors. Very visible security. It is kept clean and has great views. Sunset harbor cruises are available. Opposite the table bay hotel is a long boardwalk for ocean viewing

Great place to explore with great shopping. Shops, restaurants, maritime and rugby museums. Amazing history and all around a working hard our with large bulk carriers and fishing boats, dry docks and aquarium something for everyone

Shopping, Walking, Relaxing. V&A Waterfront is a nice day visit with plenty of shops if you like shopping or just to walk around and browse or have a nice meal or even just sit down for a drink. Also a nice photo opportunity with Table Mountain in the back ground. Wide variety or shops and things to see big variety of food types if you like to try different cuisine...

Amazing. Lots of people. Very safe and lots of activities. Took a boat ride on the marina. There was entertainment outside by musicians selling their cds. Lovely feel. We bought lots of gifts and changed our currency here

V&A Waterfront, where you can do almost everything on your trip to Cape Town. Now that I better understand the centenarian history fo the V&A Waterfront and its relatively recent revival, it has suddenly become more interesting. It is a touristy place that attracts up to 25 million visitors yearly and is still growing as a tourist industry attraction, with new services added and renovation and extension under way.In the cold of this winter, you can shelter in V&A from the very changeable CT weather from 9 morning till very late.You can shop, dress up, freshen up your look, eat, watch films, see a Doctor and even book other trips and attractions. Other interesting attractions are within walking distance and the Hop on Hop off bus is also nearby. Do wear good walking shoes though.

Great place to visit day and night. Enough shops to amuse any woman on the planet plenty of very good quality restaurants to feed anyone's desires. Just watch the world go by over a drink. The fur seals in the bay are very cute and interesting to watch. They even have there own pen at night so that they feel safe.

just because it's there.... Excellent for restaurants, bars and shops but not much to see apart from a very normal harbour. Bars and restaurants average level is quite high on the waterfront and prices are reasonable.
Very Clean and Fun. The entire property is privately owned and cleanliness, walkways and storefronts all work together. You could spend all day meandering around, having lunch and shopping.

Ground Zero for Shopping and Restaurants in Cape Town. Several very nice restaurants sprinkled among the hundreds of shops in a very nice setting along the waterfront. Very nice, upscale area, great for tourists and locals. Nice harbor views, and great views of Table Mountain.
Must Visit in CapeTown. lost of excellent restaurants, shopping and history; excellent view of the Table Mountain; take the wheel ride at sun set and enjoy the sceneries.

Every visit a new experience. A visit to the V&A Waterfront is every time a new experience. There us so many things to do and see, a variety if restaurants to eat, the 4D Nu Metro Cinema is a must to experience, although bit pricey.

Over commercialized.. This seems no different that any cruise line stopping port. I would compare it to a multi-level shopping center with little south african influence. South Africa and Cape Town area are filled with so many different cultural and nature experiences, that this area just feels out of place. Lot's of restaurants and overpriced restaurants where the food is just mediocre to begin. If you want great restaurants, make the drive or hire a driver to take you to any winery in Stellenbosche. This is a Tourist Trap.

A bit medicore. If like us, you were in Cape Town for over 2 weeks, then it make sense to go just to say you did, but if you've only got a few days, there are far more interesting places to visit.The shopping mall, is... well a shopping mall. Nothing exciting, slightly confusing to navigate through if anything.Outside by the waterfront is nice, lots of restaurants to suit all needs which all all look appetising, but they are overpriced for SA. Still, about a third of the price compared to the UK so I can't say that bothers me. Same as the "traditional African shops", these are super aimed at tourists and overpriced for questionably handmade items. If you want some genuine, handmade African items, go to people with stalls selling on the side of the roads, or Green Market Square. Far more interesting items too in my opinion.Parking is easy under the mall, which is always a bonus. So yeah, if you've only got a few days, give it miss, but if you're not pushed for time, worth a walk around and a nice lunch.
Lovely place. The place is lovely and is good to see. We though didnt find it being exceptional but quite normal for a waterfront anywhere else. It still has local character and should be visited.

Nice waterfront. An amazing place to spend the evening overlooking the water body, happening place with lots of shopping outlets and food court. Children play area all in one place. Great place to spend in the evening.

Pricey but Fun. We visited after going to the Robben Island and the shops seemed to be over priced. It was a great place to get dinner and enjoy the view but the mall was way over priced. There was a great store with big statues and figurines outside that had good souvenirs but other than that, we weren't impressed. Be prepared to pay more than anywhere else in Cape Town.

Hub of Cape Town. This is the hub of Cape Town. Lots of restaurants, shops, activities (large ferris wheel like the London Eye). We took the ferry to Robben Island from here to see the prison where Nelson Mandela was held. Our hotel was in the area as well. There are lots of great restaurants in this area or relatively closeby as well.
Shopping and restaurants!. Tons of great stores and restaurants set in an amazing harbor and waterfront. Very clean place that is a must to see in Cape Town.

On a 3 night Tour. Found the V and A Waterfront absolutely gorgeous. The shops/ restaurants/ weekend family activities is a big draw. Mandela museum (one of the) where you can buy a ticket to go to Robbin Island

Lovely way to pass half a day. Lovely place to wander around--lots of coffee shops --an amazing food hall with good variety of food at very reasonable prices.Also lots of craft shops --especially the Watershed--lots of craft shops.Also a couple of big malls

A must see. If you visit Cape Town, definitely a must see. There are many restaurants, an arts and crafts market, selling local crafts & you are near the acquarium, which is lovely for young and old. From the V&A you can catch charters out to do shark diving, whale watching (if it is season) and there is a huge mall as well.Parking is available, so there is enough to see and do.

Nicest part of Cape Town centre. We spent a lot of time at this place during our visit. If you want to shop there are plenty of opportunities to do so in the huge mall which could be anywhere in the world. The more interesting parts are the markets and sheds around the site especially the Watershed and the Saturday farmers market just round the back of the maincar parks towards the stadium. If you like wine visit the Cellar in the City in the Watershed and try a fantastic wine recommended by Ash along with a local cheeseboard and listen to the artists playing by the steps. A great way to spend an afternoon
Great spot. Buzzing crowds, big variety of quality shops, restaurants and great location. Have a craft beer or coffee too!

Great Area.... . We visited here a few times whilst in Cape Town there are some nice restaurants also places to visit including the Springbok experience the diamond museum also went to Robben Island from there to.Seals swimming in the harbour...Great and lively place.Great views of Table mountain.Must visit place in Cape Town.

A huge place for shopping and dining.. This place is full of activities and s starting point for many ocean-going venues. We had one of the best seafood dinners in one of its restaurants. With the rand being so weak, we even splurged on a plate of abalone which was cooked just right. A $100 US buys you a briefcase of rands or locally made goods, You would never have known that college students were rioting and burning down some campuses nationwide demanding lower or free tuition while we were at this place.

Nice shops and restaurants--good place to stroll around. We enjoyed walking around the outdoor areas even without good weather. The tourist shops were good for souvenirs and there were some nice mainstream shops as well. Good selection of restaurants.

Tourist friendly area safe and always full of life.. I realize it may be considered a touristy place but V&A Waterfront is popular for a reason. It is a beautiful, safe and friendly place with lots of attractive activities, lovely views, nice restaurants, talented performers and gorgeous views of the Table Mountain, Atlantic Ocean and Table Bay Harbour. It is pleasant just to stroll here searching for this perfect place to eat, browse through numerous stores or visit the mall. We like stopping in Market on the Wharf which is such a fun place for foodies. We also like Den Anker Belgian restaurant where ten years ago we had our first impala.The area has a draw bridge and you can watch the sail boats arrive or depart. The tours of Robben Island depart from V&A Waterfront. We enjoyed our sunset cruise with champagne one evening which allowed us to appreciate the beauty of the Waterfront also from the harbor and ocean side. One of the areas near the Nobel Square almost always features talented South African performers made so popular by Paul Simon a number of years ago.There are some really good souvenir stores with pretty costume jewelry and mementos of your trip. "Two Ocean Aquarium" is open all year and is a good option for a rainy day.V&A Waterfront is actually a walking distance (well, somewhat longer walking distance..) to many center city hotels and Convention Center.
Very nice. We enjoyed the waterfront. Has many restaurants, shops and stores. Also many local entertainers. Give yourselves at least an hour to walk around and enjoy it.
Awesome complex. This shopping/dinning complex has something for everybody. Good local food, great shopping made by local artisans.

Must-see in Cape Town. Great place for tourists, several restaurants, shopping, Ferris Wheel (with discounts for airline crews!), museums, scenic views and hub for several tours and activities. You cannot visit Cape Town without going here. Note: some construction work in progress at the moment.

a Great view of Table Mountsin. A wide variety of shops, restaurants, tour companies along with some educational exhibits. Visitors also have an unobstructed view of Table Mountain and an opportunity to visit Robbin Island. In one area there is virtually non-stop free entertainment. the performers rely upon free-will gifts. Visitors will note a diverse group of people. Taxi service to/from the Waterfront is readily available.
Great place to spend a few hours. Lots of choice with entertainment, retail, restaurants, bars, snacks and photo opportunities. A must visit place in Cape Town

Artificial tourist world . It's just a huge tourist center with lots of shops (the kind you find in any other mall in Europe or the US), restaurants and the typical tourist amusement like street music, offers to book a helicopter or a boat ride etc.It's clean, safe and sterile...if that's what you like, this place is for you. I can't think of any good reason to hang around here for too long. We strolled a bit around after our trip to Robben Island but seriously...I didn't come to Cape Town to visit H&M.The only locals you meet here are staff, the rest are all tourists. It's an artificial world.

Saturday afternoon visit to V&A. I live in CAPE Town and haven't been to the waterfront for ages, so decided to take a visit with my daughter in law and granddaughter. It was such a lovely afternoon, we strolled around feeling a bit like tourists. Love the festive atmosphere. I forgot how much there is to see and do. Really enjoyed the Food market and we enjoyed really good coffee and brownies. Yummy. A pleasant experience and will definitely drag my husband along one weekend. Forgot how much fun it is. Only negative is the cost of parking.............they must make a killing

Most Fabulous place to shop at Waterfront. For tourists and locals alike, the Victoria & Alfred Waterfront in Cape Town is the perfect place to be anytime of the day or during the evenings. Spending a Lazy Sunday just walking around the dock and shops and the crossing the bridge to get across is by far the best experience. Even going so much for the special priced boat rides at times just R40.00 for half an hour to an hour. Prices are pretty reasonable and the atmosphere is awesome! There is an abundance of restaurants to tickle your tastebuds. Various art and craft shops for the arty and creative persons or just chill walking along the waters edge on the boardwalk is an exhilarating experience. You cannot get any better. Take a ride on the wheel and get to see the beautiful sunset views and city views, which Cape Town has to offer. Do not miss this opportunity. <3<3

Pretty much the tourist hot spot of the City. Pretty much the tourist hot spot of the city. Shops, bars, restaurants,tours, aquarium, food markets, movies, theater and so on. A great place to wind away a few hours.

Excellent. You got to be there to actually witness the festive mood on the weekends It's like people all over Very nice and water sports as well Of international standard Shopping and food and entertainment all aroundIf in capetown at least keep 5/6 or more hours for the waterfront and have a meal there as well
Charming but too much construction detracts from the atmosphere. some good views of signal and table mountain and we enjoyed the waterfront indoor food market -good eats!

An Evening stroll at the V&A Waterfront. It was a Saturday evening and my wife and Daughter with her Husband stroll trough the D&A Waterfront Cape Town.A incredible experience! The vibe and people were great to experience. The shops are expensive but with great varieties.We had drinks at Q4. S bit noisy but expected on a Saturday night and an weekend with the Cape Marathon the next day.

Family holiday. V & A as locals call it was very busy when we visited even though it's not their season. We had a great meal at the waterfront tavern. There are a couple of shopping centres that you can buy all the usual things... As well as a food lovers market where you can get local street food from. There are lots of stalls & shops outside the shopping centres that sell local goods, carvings & trinkets. You can also get these in the Victoria quay. The Alfred Quay is a bit smaller & across the swing bridge. The Roben Island museum is also here. It's worth a look if you're visiting the V & A waterfront. You could easily spend a day here.

Great environment...total tourist trap. This is a great place to enjoy eat shop and relax. Its a complete tourist trap but one youll fall in love with. Most hotels offer a free shuttle here and you can get anything yu want from grocerys to diamonds to high end bags. FUN TIMES!

You can't visit Cape town without a visit to the V&A waterfront..... A great place for people watching, shopping, craft fair, dining and nightlife. A visit to Cape Town would not be complete without visiting the V&A waterfront.That said, it is commercialised. It does feel rather touristy rather than local, the shopping centre feel around the dining places is slightly less than convivial, but you can find some really super restaurants. The place certainly has life. Expect to pay a little more. We stayed nearby at the Waterfront Village which was a great location for the V&A so ended up in the V&A on three out of the four nights we were there!

Shop till you Drop. I'm not much of a shopper, but I really enjoyed this experience. We were especially impressed by the Watershed where hundreds of local artisans are represented. So much to admire and purchase that we are going back for another go at it.

Beautiful location and great shopping. The V&A is excellent for strolling around as there is so much to see and do and it's relatively safe and exceptionally clean. There is a large choice of restaurants from fast food joints to haute cuisine from around the world. The harbour is very pretty and you never know what yachts will be around. Several four and five star hotels are located in and around the V&A along with a number of art galleries. If you love shopping you will not be disappointed by the wide range of international and local stores. There are also useful establishments like print shop and internet cafe, supermarket, banks, forex, cinemas and Computicket for show and event tickets. If you are lucky there may be live performances in the amphitheatre or street performers.

Fun Place to Go. V&A Waterfront is somewhat typical of a wharf area without the fishy smell and fewer places selling fresh fish. There are a ton of designer stores, small shops, restaurants/ cafes, and even an indoor mall. It has some fun things to do too, including a Ferris Wheel, street performers, and all kinds of tours. The ferry to Robben Island starts from here. It's definitely worth a visit. The Hop-on Hop-off buses all stop here too which makes it easy to get there.
Pretty. Touristy but you have to go. Outstanding mall if it is rainy. A great few hours and good place for lunch.

Good choice for a daily alternative. If you've done safari, wine tour, visited Camps Bay and Table Mountain and still have free time, go there for a time consuming alternative. But at the end of the day, although it is really big and very nice to spend time, it is a mall.

Ride the Big Wheel and see the V&A waterfront from above!. If you think of going to the Victoria and Alfred waterfront in Cape Town, most of you will think of a shopping experience, but don't forget about the Big Wheel ride! This was such a wonderful way to have a birds eyeview over the city as well as seeing the entire waterfront area from above! You can even see Robben Island and Table Mountain looks as if you can touch the rocks as the wheel goes round.A bit daunting at first, but we soon got used to seeing the ground beneath our feet, as the wheel stops midway up - you get a chance to take photos and look around intensely. the entire ride is about 15 minutes, and gives you enough time to really enjoy this experience! The cabin can seat 4 adults easily and are air conditioned - so its absolutely like a breeze up in the air.

A great Shopping Center. We visit V&A almost every time we are in Cape Town. It offers alone for strolling around and shopping. Information is only available at an Information Centre. More Info facilities would be helpful due its size. Lot of parking space is available.
A Mall on the Water. Great place to shop and take water tours around the area. There are a lot of great restaurants and hotels. Definitely worth the visit!

Devolped Waterfront. Lots of shopping and restaurant choices clean safe and festive.
Take a ride on the Ferris wheel for great views !

food market is a must. Going to a shopping centre may not seem like an overly exciting prospect, but this one really is! The layout is fab with high street stores on the ground level (such as h&m) and pricey outfits on the top (gucci, boss) making it all the easier to navigate. There is a food hall area which leads outside to more restaurants overlooking the harbour. There is a clock tower by the Nelson Mandela gate museum where you can watch (and smell!) the fur seals swim and nap. The outside area has a playarea and fountains to splash in, and near here local musicians play on the street side and on the stage/amphitheatre. There is also a separate building full of boutique shops, again proving how well thought out the area is. There is another building which houses and incredible food hall with the most delicious food stalls ranging from chocolate to zebra to samosas and everything in between! Further back there is another warehouse called the watershed in which there are a plethora of independent stalls. My favourites were beautiful sunset candle makers and an outlet which sold beautiful decorations made by women who needed to support their families as part of a township programme. Behind this is the amazing two oceans aquarium which is also well worth a visit - it's safe to say there is something for everyone here!
Day of relaxation. Very relaxing, very clean, nice food and drinks, good intertainment, very friendly restaurant staff, lot to do.

Safest area of Cape Town, great food!. This area of Cape Town is very safe for tourists, one of the few areas where you don't have to worry about walking around with your camera around your neck and your iphone in your hand.The place has great entertainment with traditional African singers, the Two Oceans Aquarium is nearby, and best of all, there is a food market where you can get food from all over the world for a very decent price.I recomment visiting the Waterfront to everyone, it is a good program for a sunny afternoon.

Graet Place to spend a half day. The Waterfront area has lots to offer from hotels through boat trips to shops. There are several malls and a number of stand alone attractions. There is a food court area and often live entertainment. This is a great place for retail therapy and/or a meal out. very friendly and safe.

Lovely location with food, activities and shopping. Touristy? Yes. Very. But still very enjoyable....eat at the V & A food market. Shop at the Watershed for African crafts and styles. Eat at one of the many restaurants. Go to Robben Island. Take photos with the Table Mountain 'frame' (GPS coordinates, and large frame including waterfront and Table Mountain). Take a sunset cruise. Watch all the people passing by.Do it!
Always worth a stop. Whenever we're in Cape Town we'll pay if a visit. A good variety of restaurants and shops in a nice atmosphere right by the sea.

Nice for a stroll.... We really enjoyed walking around the Waterford as the views of the harbour and restaurants all around are beautiful. There are also so many options of great bars to choose from and a great selection of shops.

Shop till you drop. Based at the waters edge the V&A offers a wide variety of shops and restaurants from normal chains to exclusive options.
Parking is ample and well priced.
The facility offers something for the whole family including boat trips, craft markets and aquarium.
A must to visit no matter your lifestyle or age.
Restaurants, shops and the Cape Wheel. Great place to spend the day or evening with a variety of waterfront restaurants, shops, a mall, and the Cape Wheel.

Safe to wander, fantastic food available and great shopping. Spent 6 nights in the area, ate out each night, loved the fish at the Fishermans Wharf Hotel, and live music. Security visable throughout the area. Great shopping at fixed prices. Tour booking booths and a great atmosphere to the area

Visually Appealing. Very safe with an abundance of restaurants and shops. Love seeing the ferris wheel! There is an aquarium. Also, walk by Nobel Square with the statues of four South American laureates.

Shopping Haven. Buzz of people, activities, life and song.
Awesome views and holiday feeling.
Shops shops shops .....full day activity .
Restaurants and coffee shops around every corner.
What a place!!!
A lot happening. This is a busy and popular tourist, retails and scenic precinct. You could spend an a day there if you wanted, many places to eat, great variety of shopping, with easy parking.

This is the place to be!. I really like the waterfront. Perfect for a mooch in the shops, lovely for a coffee break or a nice evening meal. There is lots of options so don't jump at the first place you see. Take a long walk around before you make a choice. This is another beautiful part of Cape Town to see. Worth a visit 100%

A Sensory Experience. The VA Waterfront is the best one stop for a days activities as it offers high end shopping experience, street performers, Tourist shops, great food outlets and walking distance to the food market and lots of picture taking moments. As it is a tourist zone it can get quite crowded on the weekends but it is worth the experience. During the holidays it is quite mad in terms of crowds.
Lots to do. Located on the waterfront, the V&A is a hub of activity. It's part mall and part port. There are a lot of stores and restaurants. Just walk around and explore.
Pretty waterfront lots to do. This is a great place to come at night with shops and restaurants to choose from,plus it felt really safe. We came on our first night and we had a really chill night.

Great shops. We took a shuttle to the Victoria & Alfred waterfront. It had tons of shops and lots of restaurants to choose from. I saw they had the English toy store Hamley's, H & M, Zara, Mango, bookstores, electric stores, records and nearly every store you can think of. All very nice and the stores are open until 9 pm. We had a great meal at Karibu

Great atmosphere. We spent a couple of hours at the waterfront and it was very busy and vibrant. Lot of restaurants and entertainment is available. Very nice or a couple of hours and well worth the visit.
Awesome atmosphere. We love coming here for the worlds best seafood and awesome shopping. There are so many shops and restaurants and movies and friendly people.
Everything you need in a few blocks. An excellent way to spend a day or an afternoon. Lots of shopping, restaurants, and activities in area.

Great mall for tourists. Had everything I could ever look for in one place . Didn't have to bother going into the city for shipping, from the expensive Gucci and prada shops to the everyday pick and pay supermarket to the h&m's and Zara's everything was right here. Very convenient indeed.
Never disappoints. Always refreshing to be at the V&A, every occasion feels like it's the first time. The restaurants by the dock are my favourites.

Shop, eat, activities. The V&A is a popular destination with lots of interesting shops, especially the craft market, plenty of eateries to suit all tastes and pockets, and lots of activities for both the more sedate and the adventurous such as helicopter rides, a variety of boat rides (if the sea is choppy, not recommended for motion sickness visitors) museums, artworks, a ferris wheel, live entertainers, and it is the starting point of the daily boat trips to Robben Island (weather permitting). It is a hive of activity, morning, noon and night.

Plenty to do. Definitely need to have a visit here when in Cape Town as its a place to cater for lots of peoples needs. P!enty of shops especially curios along with a great choice of restaurants. Always something going on. Make time to get that pic of table mountain using the picture frames or visit the aquarium.

wonderful views and great shopping options!. this is an unusual setting to have a "mall" on a waterfront with Table Mountain as a "backdrop".The scenic views were great and the number of store and restaurant options were amazing.lots of highend designer shops etc.

Very Touristy But Fun Stop. Visited here twice on my Cape Town stay. Once while waiting for ferry to Robben Island and a second time waiting for the Hop On Hop Off Bus. Both times were met with great shopping and great food. I don't know that you would need to dedicate a lot of time here but I am glad that I checked it out! The food court is really a great experience!!!

Wonderful Atmosphere. This area is definitely worth a visit, if only to have one's picture taken beside the statues of four great South African men (pick your favourite...) Or to take in the sights and sounds of the port. Great food, drink and shopping available. Different musical groups can be heard at different times. One can find ATM's at banks.
Enjoyable. Many choices for restaurants & shops. Good place to people watch and relax with friends over drinks.

Exploring the Waterfront. The V & A Waterfront offered wonderful activities to share with friends. The Diversified entertainment of the city was wonderful. Witnessed the local talents drumming, singing and performing. A great mix of people gathering to hear and enjoy the performances.

Beautiful. Loads of greenery and types of trees! The whole area is surrounded by crisp white buildings as well. There's a walkway along the riverfront which is peaceful to walk on.
There's a little construction going on but it's not so bad. There are loads and loads of shops from touristy to jewelry and bunches of restaurants.
Nice evening out. Restaurants and shopping galore. Cape town is over loaded with good ones and the ferris wheel is such a great view at night.

Best by far. It amazes me how this place is expanding at a rate of knots and still
Manages to capture its original
Charm. Lot more restaurants and location is unbeatable

Exciting. If you wish to experience to cool life of Cape Town, then this is the area for you. Bars, shops music marina, history, museums etc.....
It provides a haven to relax from the hectic tour trips.

V&A worth the walk. The Waterfront always seems to be teeming with activity. Good selection of shops and restaurants. Walking it provides a close-up view of both the working seaport and the tourist areas.
Happy Shopping and Eating. Love The Waterfront for shopping and sushi lunch. Really nice to stroll around and hang out for a day or two whilst in Capetown.

Ferrymans to watch RockSteady. Awesome time spent with friends listening to Rock Steady a band with great sounds and Josh the lead guitarist with a very special talent. Good food but service could be sharper. Nevertheless a great even enjoyed by all

Victoria & Alfred Waterfront (Cape Town) is an excellent place to visit. This is an excellent place to spend anywhere from a couple of hours to most of the day. Lots of security staff everywhere I went, and I found it very safe and very pleasant. Quite a range of food places from a food court (good food, and fairly cheap), to cafes (very nice food, and again at reasonable prices), to upmarket restaurants with gourmet meals. Lots of interesting sculptures and artworks scattered all around.I also visited the Two Oceans Aquarium, which was great. Lots of marine life which most of us would never see close up (fish, penguins, invertebrates, seaweeds including giant kelp). Good place for adults to visit, but obviously hugely interesting for children too. That was very good value for money too.Wandering around the greater waterfront area is all free - but obviously you pay to go into the Aquarium, pay to go out to Robben Island, pay for anything you want from the shops or cafes . . .
Very cosmopolitan.. Many places to see, lots of restaurants and lots of shopping to do. This Place has many designer shops and its quite expensive too.

good mixture of shops and restaurants geared for tourists. Safe and central place to do your tourist shopping. There is a great indoor market with local crafts made and sold by the locals no cheap imitations. I think it is called Watershed but don't quote me. There are also a few good photo opportunities as well as the start point for Robben Island.

Breathtakingly beautiful. We went in a guided tour which is not essential but a good idea for the insights provided.The area is amazing.
