Spring is apparently a great time to visit as although not all the falls are flowing your ability to take photo is fantastic. We are told in the wet season the spray from the falls is so great you can barely see them.It is about a 3 km round trip walk along easy to walk paths. The track is flat so accessible for all ages.We also did a helicopter flight over the falls also great for a different perspective on just how significant the falls are. I had no idea before my visit. Just amazing!
Great waterfront location. A fairly typical tourist-oriented group of shops on a waterfront. Very gift shop style. Tourist retail shops. Nothing special. Reasonably good food available.
Too commercial . Feels very commercial / tourist type place and no real heart and soul. Quite pricey too - we saw a sculpture at 10 times (literally) the price we saw at a street market.

V & A Waterfront. The hub of the CBD. A good place to people watch; which is full of shops & restaurants. The Robben Island Ferry departs from this area. It is also a stop on one of the HOHO bus routes.The views of Table Mountain are great from here. There is a taxi queue, so there are no issues with hailing a cab, when needed.For those who are concerned; this is a very safe area.

Don't leave Cape Town without visiting. Spent my evenings here on a three day visit to Cape Town. Some of the finest dining experience in Cape Town. Fantastic restaurants and equally good clothing stores. The mall comes alive at night with lights and plenty live displays at night. It's a must visit if you are in Cape Town.

Renowned brand under the same roof. Walk around the waterfront and enjoy watching people strolling on this stretch in the evening. If you like to shop for branded goods during holiday, this is the place you can make your grab in Cape Town. LV, Gucci etc are available here.

so beautiful on the waterfront. Its so nice here. the big debate is do you stay on the waterfront or long street. Hotels are pricer by the waterfront, but cabs are really cheap. But I love the waterfront, totally safe to walk around, I'm solo female traveller and was so worried about my safety. never had a problem and didn't walk around paranoid, Its like being in any other city, except its really really beautiful. I stayed on long street and just hopped a cab to the waterfront. lots to see and do.
Favorite place in Cape Town . Great ocean view, lots of shops and restaurants. Gift shops and luxury stores. Safe all the time. You can get cruise in the harbor
John. A very helpful and pleasant welcome hotel under renovation but rooms very comfortable and staff helpful and friendly

Nice, Clean Safe - Craft Market. This was a welcome relief to be able to wander around freely without worrying about "street boys" or other unsavory characters.The Crafts market is well stocked, with authentic products at fair prices. Many nice shops and restaurants to choose from.My hotel had a free shuttle - metered taxis are plentiful and there is a private security team maintaining almost every aspect.

A very good addition to Cape Town. Cape Town has been improved significantly by the addition of the V&A Waterfront. It is definitely worth a visit. There are plenty of good quality shops, restaurants and attractions.
Amazing place. Very good choice for a walk, shopping and a good dinner. There are plenty of restaurants and shops to choose.

The heart of CapeTown. The Waterfront is exciting and busy. Lots of good restaurants to eat at. Singers, musicians, and the Wheel make it a nice place for everyone. get your cameras ready to spot the seals in the sea as you are strolling, and interesting statues and art work.

Great spot for lunch or dinner and a bit of shopping. We almost missed a big part of the Waterfront, make sure you have enough time to check out the whole area. Lots of very interesting nooks and crannies, complete with seals who come up to laze in the sun.

Mr Farouk Khan . A lovely place to spend the whole day , lots of shopping experience, lots of restaurants to choose from. The outer sections offer quite a bit of facilities, boat cruises helicopter rides and much more.

High End Waterfront. If you are looking for some high end shopping or a nice place to take a stroll, this is the destination for you. Full of hundreds of different stores and a Ferris wheel, this place can give you something to do for an afternoon. It's not THE must on my list, but does have some great views.

Great place . Very lively, lots of good quality bars and restaurants plus access to the Robben Island tours (book ahead if you can as it was fully booked for the duration of our stay). Also on the route of the city sight-seeing bus tours.

A good experience. Any day will do. It is also nice to walk around and watch the seabirds, robs etc. There is a good sea life there. Watch boats coming and going. The noise is also pleasant to listen to. There are beautiful views toward Table Mountain. Lots of dining out places, shows to watch and movies to go to.

Smart with a view. The waterfront is a bit like London meets Africa. With lots of tourist trappy jewelry curio leather smart high priced the Waterfront is a one stop venue. Smart hotels, assorted restaurants an array of good craft shops if you want it all under one roof including the Sea and a few seals thrown in for good measure then the V and A waterfront is your stop. Movie Cinema a mini big wheel, sea food restaurants with a view and African entertainment it is worth a trip! So inhale the salty breeze grab an ice cream from San Marco and enjoy the Red Shed craft centre.

Enjoyed the waterfront. So much to do and see! I spent quite a bit of time at the waterfront. There were many different dining options as well as plenty of shopping. There were many tours that departed from the waterfront as well. The waterfront was clean and people were friendly.

Day outing. Had a leasurely day while waiting for my family to join me. Walked to Clock Tower and watched bridge opening for catamaran, many many visitors, loved the local music being played around the Wharf

Good place to hang out. I was in town for only two nights so I spent the one full day here. Sadly the views of Table Mountain were obstructed by fog but the waterfront is a very safe, relaxed place to hang out, with a great range of food and shopping establishments, and adequate bathrooms everywhere. For anyone contemplating staying at a nearby hotel, they are all pretty upscale but once you leave the property you will be surrounded by crowds virtually everywhere you go. Lots of boat rides and sales agents trying to get you to buy-in to their offerings. But the vibe here is pretty exciting so I would definitely plan to return here in the future.

Victoria & Alfred Waterfront. Lovely area at Cape Town harbour area. Lots to do. Lovely shops,restaurants,movie theatres and a Big wheel as (in London eye). Also the place from where the trips to Robben Island depart.
Shopping and eating only. If you are not keen on shopping or eating, stay away. Shops are overpriced. There are many lovelier sights to see in Cape Town.

Lively place and definitely worth a visit but a little too touristy.. We combined a visit to Robben Island (the boats departs here too) with a visit to the V & A Waterfront. The shopping mall is ''just a shopping mall'' and I expected some more unique shops (which more unique South Africa products/art etc..). There are lots of restaurants and bars which make it a very lively place. The view of Table Mountain is great and also at night we felt very safe here.
Fun. Walked to the waterfront from our hotel on arrival. Nice to see all the energy of Cape Town in that location

Shops and restaurants are plentiful. There are loads of shops here from African arts and crafts to H&M, Zara, Guess, Woolworth and many designer shops. Great choice of restaurants, Den Anker and Mondiall are great, be sure and book especially at weekends. Mugg and Bean for coffees and huge muffins. Boat trips, canal cruise, hop on hop off canal trip, sunset trips and diving with the Sharks all leve from here. There is plenty of security day and night and it is very safe to walk around but taxis are cheap just be sure you use a metered taxi. There is also a big wheel.If you like walking there is a walk right around the coast, sea on one side and lovely apartments on the other, again all very safe.

safe at night. Most shops and restaurants similar to what you can find in any city in the world but here and there there are beautiful spots.
on weekends the place comes to life
Great Location!. Great shops and restaurants especially the food court for lunch. It has a great vibe and fun in the evenings.

Pretty. It was nicely located and there were plenty of bars and restaurants. However if you don't like shopping there's not too much to do. It was nice for a few hours but I was bored after a bit. They had some lovely live music and dancing which was fun.

Always a buzz. There is always a buzz at the V&A Waterfront. I enjoy coming here at night for the views and enjoy dinner at one of the many restaurants. Safe parking and environment. During daytime there are also activities like boat and helicopter rides.

Beautiful Location. The V&A is located right across the road from the sea so the views are fabulous. The centre itself is filled with designer shops so bring your credit card!! There are a number of restaurants inside the shopping centre but I would suggest a visit to the fast food court and then sit outside on the benches as invariably there is some impromptu music that will start up.
Very eclectic site. There is a mall and a barn like mall for local vendors. It's a beautiful area and prob one of the safest in Cape Town. There are restaurants in this area as well.

So Much to See and Do!. The V & A Waterfront has so much to do. Just a short taxi ride from our hotel (President) to shopping, eating and things to do. We took a sunset cruise on a catamaran, Ferris Wheel ride, ate very well and shopped in the very well organized commercial area.

A really great place to visit. Wonderful views, sights and street entertainers plus a huge variety of shops and restaurants to suit all budgets make this a must-visit attraction. Try and take a trip round the harbour to see the seals if you can.

"LOVELY,MODERN WATERFRONT". Me and my family walked about,did a bit of shopping and had some lunch.Great shopping and eating areas,very busy when i visited.Booked a helicopter flight over cape town on the waterfront,lots of attractions and excursions there also.Well worth a day shopping or a night out

Still more to be explored . The v and a waterfront is large area with so many things around. Should definitely plan well before visiting. 1.there is cape wheel worth visiting. 2.scratch patch mineral world where kids can enjoy playing with different colour stones. 3.shopping malls to go around. 4.there is a Hamleys train takes kids and family around v and a. It is opposite to cape wheel. 5.v and a watershed market with artifacts. 6.two ocean aquarium with penguin encounters. Jelly blooms which is very informative. 7.there is also watershed market with good food courts and shops to eat and buy. 8.diamond museum is also situated near clock tower which we visited. It was also nice visit. 9.cruise is there one could opt for 30 minutes to one hour with young children as it goes in ocean the breeze is so cold. So one need to carry sweater and jacket. Great to visit and keep visiting to explore more.....

Interesting variety. V&A Waterfront is always good for exploring, a stroll, historic items, good restaurants, free music/dance performances... you name it. It's never boring and a must see/visit in Cape Town.

Definitly worth a visit. Although it is not so much focused on Africa it has a lot of shops and restaurants and the occasional live performance. There are also boat trips which take you out which is an absolute must. You get a great view from Table mountain all the way.

Just a crowded place. There is no much things to see in this place.
Shops are a bit expensive. Only a good place here is Two Oceans Aquarium.

Lively and Vibrant!. Features a mall with lots of stores, boutiques, restaurants and coffee shops. Has street entertainment outside the mall and a food market. Ferries to Robben island leave from here. Is also a stop for the Cape Town hop on-hop off bus. Has a section with arts & craft stalls as well which shouldn't be missed. Good for buying gifts for those back at home.Undoubtedly 'touristy' but well worth a visit when in Cape Town.
Great fun and bargains in a seaside location . The waterfront is amazing ! It was my third time there and I found lovely meals , great shopping and a safe international atmosphere

Shops and Food Chains. Everyone I know who has visited Cape Town has raved about the Waterfront, I was very disappointed. It is a collection if shopping malls and food chains. There is one mall with African craft stalls that is worth a visit but as for the rest you could be anywhere in the western world.

Over-rated tourist attraction. I was disappointed the the V & A Waterfront. The shopping mall is similar to that in many cities across the world. The shops are not unique nor do they reflect the culture of South Africa. The harbor is fine but does not compare to other cities. On the other hand the view of Table Mountain is superb. This is the place to pick up the boat to Robben Island and I would suggest visiting V & A at that time and not make a special trip.
Very much a tourist place. Victory & Alfred Waterfront is very much a tourist place with many shops and restaurants. Could be anywhere in the world.

Fabulous. Great expanse of eating places brewery food places & shops. Very upmarket .. great quality of items centred around the gorgeous capetown harbour. Easy acces to harbour boat trips. Hop on hop off bus leaves centrally from here. Lots if African art & handicraft. Top end hotels like Victoria & Albert. Lots of places to book trips. Robbin Island trip leaves from here. Buskers.. great vibe. Well done Capetown.

Buzzing with shopping. I stayed in this area due to its proximity to the Hop on Hop Off bus, shopping, safety considerations, and the general ambiance of a waterfront. With only a few days in CT, this location worked for me. The bus got me around town, I could walk everywhere else that I wanted to explore, and the opportunities to purchase locally made crafts (I highly recommend the Watershed) were endless.

Picturesque . A must visit when in Cape Town. Stunning hotels if you're looking for accommodation close to a mall. Loads of restaurants to pick and choose from. The mall is extensive with loads of stores, boutiques, coffee shops and book stores. Movie houses as well. All sorts of entertainment happens outside the mall- to keep the crowds entertained. Boat rides can be had from here as well etc. Bit of a one stop for all. A lovely day out for the family.

very touristy and mostly high street shops but still a few nice places.. Some will call it a must but I don't think hundreds of (high street) shops together is anything special. Go to Bree or Loop street to find nice original shops, galeries and restaurants.
A real treat in Cape Town. Tis vibrant exciting redevelopment of the harbour is a credit to the people of Cape Town.It is world class and must not be missed if you are in town.

Very touristy. I wasn't too impressed with the Waterfront, it is your typical tourist hotspot. We did a sunset cruise out of the Waterfront so we went to dinner there before and walk around. Part of the area was under construction and it took us an extra 20mins to find the entrance to the restaurant we were looking for. There was some good street theatre going on. It all depends on what you like and what you're looking for, it just happened to be too busy and just wasn't for us

One for the tourists. If you go on a trip to Robben Island (which is a must) you will need to find your way to the V&A Waterfront. It is actually quite an attractive area even though it is geared up towards the tourist trade. Some of the buildings here look 'period' and are well maintained.There are plenty of shops across a whole range, and different restaurants as well, depending upon your time, budget and appetite! We ate at a restaurant and the McDonalds and have lived to tell. The tourist shops are also interesting, with gifts heavily biased towards the local wildlife. To suit all budgets as well.So it's an ok place to be with a good happy feel. There are seals in the harbour area and there's also a big wheel there if you get bored.
Lively!. Beautiful, one can never get bored.. Shopping, bands, activities, food, cafe... V&A has it all!! ROCKING!

Interesting place. V&A is a place where you can find quite everything around. All amenities available, its like the heart of Capetown. One of regular place to have lunch and diner. Lot of restaurants, hotels, shopping center. Like it :)

Great for shopping. If shopping is your thing, this is a great mall in a fun environment in Cape Town. We were in Cape Town on a rainy day and thoroughly enjoyed cappuccino at the San Marco restaurant and walking around the mall!

Lots to do and see, good food, great shopping. There's lots to see and do around here, tons of street artists and restaurants around. The V&A mall had tons of shopping and the restaurants were great for value and quality was on point. Lots of picture taking ops. Definitely worth a visit

Favourite Cape Town Shopping Destination. The V&A Waterfront is one of my favorite shopping destinations, start off with grabbing a coffee on the go at Love. Hate. Cappuccinos whilst you stroll through the likes of H&M, Zara and the Black Betty Design Pop-up store. Their jewellery celebrates Mother Nature's bounty and her essence. The handcrafted pieces have a timeless quality and you can get some statement pieces there.If you are hungry over lunch time, visit Sevruga for their sushi specials until 7pm

Nice. You should and will probably visit the V&A Waterfront. It's mostly shopping but there are street entertainers and the food market is pretty good. We went here almost daily for one thing or the other. In addition, if you'd like to visit Robbin Island, the ferry starts from here.

" A MUST ". the famous v & a waterfront is a very popular tourist attraction, it has a very festive vibe with many restaurants , stalls , curio shops , tours , live music and entertainment , excellent views all round , mall , hotels , aquarium ,arts and crafts stores , jewelry stores , etc. the list is endless. access is very good with lots of parking , public transport, private taxi's , etc the marina is very impressive . it is a must if your visiting capetown .

Shoppers paradise . Still one of the nicest place for shopping in Cape Town with a huge array of local, overseas,mid to expensive stores. Lots of restaurants movies,always something going on outside. 2 large supermarkets a great outdoor market and a curio market. A fun day if it's raining
Great shopping and lovely restaurants!. Highly recommend spending some time walking around the waterfront to have a look in the shops and maybe then finish off with a cocktail by the water.
Nice. Nice place to walk and have dinner or lunch, a lot of people and music! a safe place in Cape Town. to visit.

Nice waterfront and shops. Lots of eating places, nice pubs, African craft markets, mixed food markets, cafes, wheel with a view. Also up market shops with all the brand shopping. The quay side is lovely. Spend at least 1/2 day, particularly evening with shops open until 9 pm and food later.

vibrant area.. The waterfront is a mix of shops and cafes with a few other things thrown in for good measure. The shops are the same your find in any city around the world plus the usual tourist traps. The cafes/restaurants cater for all budgets, live music in several spots around the harbor too. Its a stop on the hop on hop off buses. A nice place to spend a few hours on a sunny day. But be aware of pickpockets we were targeted by two, just let them know you know their there and they move off.

Fancy and beautiful. The fancy and beautiful part of Cape Town, touristy and expensive, but , also, interesting.Nice marina, cafes and restaurants, kids playground, good looking people.A good place to buy some presents and spend time between tours in the nature.

So much to do here - if u dont like it then you must be crazy!. RestaurantsShopsBoat trips in harbourRobin Island small London EyeBy sharing your experiences, you're helping travellers make better choices and plan their dream trips. Thank you!

pleasant stay. Room with waterfront view is excellent. Spacious room with comfortable bed. Good variety of food within walking distance. Handicrafts as souvenoirs at The Wharf. A good base to organize your other tours. The tour counter at reception is most helpful

Great shopping. Loads of shops. Great "tourist" spot. Lots of restaurants to choose from. Nice atmosphere.
Can take helicopter rides from V&A as well as cruises from harbour.
Trendy shopping and dining.. A very nice indoor/outdoor shopping area with many restaurants and leading shops. Probably the nicest mall in the city!
V&A Waterfront Cape Town. Delicious cuisine. Wide variety of everything. A scenery to explore. Vast variety of people places chain stores, boutiques, sweet treats and modern
Lots to see and do. Lots to see and do, the watershed market is great and so is the food market. Lots of boat tours and other tourist attractions. Can't go to cape town and not go here!

Nice environment. When all is said and done it is just a shopping mall with bars and restaurants but somehow it forms a focal point for Cape Town. There is plenty to see and a lively marina where boats depart to the various tourist attractions in the area.

Credit to the city. This waterfront development offers so much to the Cape Town tourist...everything from excellent restaurants of all levels of sophistication, many food types/cuisines, specialist tourist shops and tour operators, massive shopping complex, bars, cinemas, scenic views, start and drop off point for cruises, buses, helicopters, many hotels all in a very smart mix of the old waterfront with new additions. A world class and very safe place to start your Cape Town adventures and to use as a base.

Cape Town remodelled. The Waterfront is always a must when visiting Cape Town. They are busy with some renovations so some of the charm and smooth is missing, but it (smooth) will certainly be back.Enjoyable.

A very nice place to spend an afternoon!. Beautiful waterfront, good place to wander around for an afternoon. Plenty to see and do, wide choice of restaurants and plenty of excursions on offer. Great views and good place to relax for a while.

Mrs Cheryl Amos. Me & my husband LOVE shopping in Waterfront we are both born & bred Capetonians the hustle & buzz in the waterfront just make us come Alive from busy shops &lots of different people (races) from all walks of Life come together if there's shows in Amphitheatre especially singing & dancing everyone in the crowd has the urge to dance with in summer its Jam packed & we still flock to waterfront where everyone & everything just comes to Life
Find the seal lounge, near the hop on hop off boat. Lots of restaurants and shops. We watched the seals move on and off the lounge platform for about 20 minutes,

Playground and shopping for Cape Town's wealthy. Worth a visit for the beautiful views, bike hire, boat trips and food market. Also children friendly. The mall could be anywhere in the world, aside from one or two locally-focused shops. If you're in Cape Town and you've done the important stuff then visit here, but don't forgo anything to squeeze this in, unless you're subjecting yourself to some kind of global tour of identical malls in different places.
Frenar place to visit. Uta really worth to go there. Good restaurants, nice shops (also with wine). You have nice view of Cape Town and of the table mountain.

Nice location . The V&A mall is a beautiful mall at the waterfront of cape town for people who shop with designer labels there have quite a few of them at the last level , it's a bit crowded on Sundays.

Favorite . The best shopping destination in Cape Town. There is a very wide vatiety of shops and restaurants. Iconic and luxury brands such as H&M, Hugo Boss & Calvin Klein. Also many affordable brands such as Cotton On and YDE. The restaurants also give shoppers a wide variety. From Willoughbies to Mitchells.

Posh shops, posh restaurants, not much character. V&A is somewhere I used to go to regularly until I discovered Camps Bay (much better waterfront) and Canal Walk (much better shopping, much much bigger and more variety, better cinema etc)Good collection of nice eateries in V&A. If you want a meal out, you won't go wrong there but cor shopping or seafront - there's better
Good shopping. Great location on the river front, good shopping, many eating places and activities for families. The place to be in the evening!

Must do cape town. Great enviroment good food good atmosphere various activities daily and just one of those highlight areas of Cape Town and great city centres as a capetonian just dont get there enough as we have great areas near us in Durbanville as well but if your not a local it is a must see for all ages and compares to any holiday place in the world where you can relax and soak up the air sea and culture

Nice dining and shopping options. If you're looking for a comprehensive shopping experience and a variety of food options, this place has it. Dining ranges from food-court style to fine dining, and many places have a view of the harbor. It was a convenient stop for dinner most nights.

Great place to get high quality SA food and an interesting place to shop, if you're more into the later. . Great place to get high quality SA food and an interesting place to shop, if you're more into the later. Have to try one of the fish restaurants (i.e. Bahia)

Sites that still surprise a local!. I live in Cape Town so I can go to the Waterfront whenever I want. Problem with that is you often don't, just because of that reason. But whenever I go, I am grateful I did. It's beautiful with a little of something for everyone. Whether you like rustic, fancy, local or just gazing at the ocean, the V&A has it. Definitely worth going.
In love. Beautiful surrounding, amazing shopping and entertainment throughout the day. One could easily spend an entire day here!

Ok but not enchanting. Good entertainment's. Perhaps we didn't see this at its best. August in the Cape can experience cold weather, and it certainly did on our visit.It was raining & cold so we headed to the V&A for indoor/warm activities. Although we both really enjoyed the restaurants, aquarium, craft shops & food courts, the waterfront itself was not that attractive. Some of it was hidden by building works but i think you would be disappointed if you went there to take some lovely photos of an old harbour.Having said that, it is a lively area, with plenty to see & do, so I recommend the attractions the area (Museums, aquarium, shopping, restaurants & cafes) but not the waterfront itself.

Excellent. الوترفرونت مكان جميل جدا . و تتنوع فيه النشاطات طوال اليوم . يوجد الكثير من المحلات التجارية والمطاعم والعروض الحية . كذلك يوجد الكثير من محلات بيع التذاكر لمختلف الانشطة في كيب تاون . كذلك يوجد متحف عن جزيرة روبن ويوجد عجلة كيب تاون . عموما في هذا المكان الرائع لن تصاب بالملل طوال الوقت . تحياتي لكVery beautiful . And vary the activities throughout the day. There are plenty of shops and restaurants and live performances. There is also a lot of shops selling tickets for various activities in Cape Town. There is also a museum about Robben Island and Cape Town left wheel. Overall in this wonderful place will not get bored all the time. greetings to you all .

Lovely Marina. Victoria and Alfred Waterfront is an amzing place. Clean, safe, nice and where you could spend a wonderful day.In the are athere are a lot of shops and restaurants for different budgets and taste.To sum up I really like the atmosphere of V&A Waterfront.

Nice Area but expected more to do. The waterfront area was very pretty, with an extremely large mall set up with lots of stores. Many of which you can find in other places, but a few nice little boutiques and unique places to shop. There is a large variety of places to eat from fast food and casual pubs to nice sit down restaurants. I think one day is plenty of time to see everything unless something catches your eye and you want to go back again. We went twice as we wanted to try a couple different places to eat. There is a neat shopping section that is closest to the Aquarium and has some nice local crafts and different SA oriented art, etc.
All of Cape Town comes here on a sunny day!. This is a great combination of shops, restaurants and attactions - definitely a place to see and be seen.
interesting. Every store you can imagine and lots of restaurants. Nice to wander the wharves and we took a sunset cruise.

great fun. Spent a wonderful day of shopping and dining here. Great artisan collections, good food vendors and restaurants for breakfast lunch and dinner! Live music for all ages. Great family atmosphere.
The most preferred place. V & A is The most preferred placed for most of the tourist for shopping, restaurant and other entertainment من أفضل الاماكن للسياح.أنشطة متنوعة من أسواق ومطاعم الخ.

taste the flavours of Cape Town. World class tourist destination with endless shops, restaurants, craft markets, aquarium, rides, entertainment and stunning views. Enjoy boat trips around the harbour and watching a working harbour in action. Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco is vastly inferior to the Victoria and Alfred Waterfront
Lots to See an Do. Didn't spend a lot of time here, but was very impressed with what we saw. Plenty activities, and restaurants galore!

Cape Town City break. Love this attraction. Great shopping experience and a huge selection of eateries. Very lively atmosphere with lots going on. A place you can visit any time of day and see something different. The views of Table Mountain from here are superb.

Shopping galore!. If you are looking to set trends and visit all the branded shops, V & A Waterfront is the place to be, but if you just want to spend some time with the family walking around and enjoying the sights, sounds and food then you are also at the right place! Easy to access using the MyCiti bus or own transport. Always busy but it because of its size you do not notice that there are so many people around you. It offers everything and anything from shopping for your groceries to a romantic sunset cruise with a loved one.

V & A Waterfront: World beater. Always a pleasant experience. Easy parking, movies, restaurants, coffee shops, specialist shops, retailers and of course Exclusive Books. The views are fabulous and you can be a tourist in your own country.

Pompous, decadent and the wrong way to make tourists come to South Africa. It is basically the epitome of modern day capitalism and it really does count on rich and well earning tourists from the west (as well as it caters to the growing, well earning crowd of people from the CPT).
lot of shops. this was pretty place along the water. Had lots of different shops and eating places. We ended up going here several times during our 4 days there.
loads to activities. the V&A waterfront is one of the main centres in Cape Town. it hosts a large shopping centre, hotels, museums, aquarium and loads of restaurants. A must while in town
Fun. The V&A has everything that is expected for a fun filled day with the family as well as a huge variety of restaurants.....

Lovely Atmosphere. Ok its a tourist spot, and you know it but was lively and everyone was friendly. Nothing nicer than sitting outside in the sun with a cold beer looking at Table Mountain. Lovely! Make sure you agree a price in the taxi when you leave, our ripped us off!

the place to be. No visit to Cape Town is complete without having been to the V&A Waterfront....such a variety of shops and wonderful restuarants to go to. We sipped white wine and ate prawns and shopped till we dropped.

Best Address in Cape Town. Lots of activities to choose from when visiting the V&A Waterfront. Beautiful views of the picturesque Table Mountain. Safe (visible security personnel). Some of the major international retail brands /stores can be found here. Home to some of Cape Town's most luxurious hotels. A must visit!
Spoilt for choice. At least once a year, we visit here. There is such a freshness about the Waterfront and parking is always available. Great place for family gatherings and outings.

good location to stay for week in Cape Town. good location to stay for week in Cape Town, very safe and secure but with a pleasantly mixed use, probably a little biased to overseas tourists, nice markets, eateries and Robben Island of course

Great Entertainment & Shopping . Nice restaurants, shopping malls with international brand names, local stores, and small mom and pop style vendors. There is night time entertainment with singers, dancers, and a variety of acts. Also, a great scenic view. A wonderful night or day out but will make you want to come back for a second visit.
Terrific. Great area and wonderful restaurants! The waterfront area has lots to offer and the views are just superb!

Vacation . The Waterfront is absolutely great. Mall is huge and prices are reasonable. Lots of decent restaurants to satisfy all your needs and budgets. Good shopping. Seals, walking the piers, are all fun things to do, as is the big Wheel. Stay as close to the Waterfront as you can. You won't be sorry.

Busy, varied, friendly. Spent a couple of nights in this area. Retail good, informal drinks good, evening meals good. What's there to dislike.... Maybe the crowds around the fast food places and, when we were there, the amount of reconstruction work - it was late winter in SA - but overall, a key place to visit when in Cape Town. Very San Fran!
Always great fun. Overly sunny day to stroll around. The food market is so vibey. Such a shame it and the water shed close at 6pm. Am sure there's a market for evening shoppers.
Emergency shopping. After all my stuff got stolen I needed new cloths etc. It's a nice shopping area where I managed to get what I needed, get some food, and take a look outside. Very happy.
Great vibe. if you are a local and you want to feel like you on holiday in another country even if it is just for a few hours then the VNA Waterfront is the place to be.

Nice spent of half a day. Lots of restaurant and Cafe. Very relaxing to have a meal there overlooking the waterfront. Big shopping mall but not much to shop as mainly mordern shops. Pricey. I did get a big 5 charm in Pandora which is only available in Africa. Worth getting if someone just seen the big 5. There is Abigail ferry wheel but no one on it. Still nice to take a picture. There are many boat ride and fishing excursions available there if one is interested and have time. There is also a MacDonald Cafe there, less pricey than cafe around there but more than a normal MacDonald. Still nice to sit on their terrace to enjoy sip of coffee.

A must-see in cape town!. It has everything from shopping to amazing restaurants, great views of table mountain, amazing atmosphere to arts and culture. So many 5 star restaurants to try our if you're into markets, there's the food market that had good from all around the world. Theres always live bands or culturally themed dances to watch as well
Interesting starting point. We went in with low expectations but fell in love with this place. Awesome views of the mountain, great seafront location and a lot of good choices of places to eat.

Afri-Can guitars & much more. As a guitar player, and with limited time in Cape Town, I wish that I'd been prepared to purchase an 'Afri-Can Guitar'. At the V&W Waterfront, with all kinds of shop-owners selling all kinds of African items and drawn by the sound of music, I stumbled across the booth selling guitars made with actual 5 liter oil cans as the guitar's body; not what I expected. How cool! The guitar's neck, headstock and pick-up system were not the cheap quality that you typically see when travelling. Most musical instruments you purchase while travelling wind up hanging on your living room wall. These guitars were actually very well-crafted electric guitars that you could actually play live. If you're a guitar player, make time to visit and purchase one of these guitars. With two weeks still left in my vacation, I'm not sure how I would have gotten the guitar home in one piece, but I'm certainly regretting not purchasing one in Cape Town. Also enjoyed the young lady playing guitar on the steps of inside of the mall. Tough gig!
Great way to spend the evening!. Lots of restaurants and shopping, a little pricey but not so bad. We spent most evenings here as it was close to our hotel.

Don't waste your time -- could be anywhere in the world. Lots of great shopping and restaurants, but this could be any city in the world that is locted on water. If your time is limited in Cape Town don't waste your time -- go to the things that are unique to Cape Town like Table Mountain.

Must visit!. Lucky enough to have this pretty much as a local shopping centre, but there is so much more to do.Love popping in for my groceries over the weekend, but having a chic coffee and then having a great lunch with an awesome viewCaters to all budgets and is always a stylish place to be. We never tire of the V&A!

Big Build Up Big Disappointment. A lot of people had told us that the V & A Water Front was the place to go in Cape Town for shopping and good restaurants. On the two occasions we visited the water front we experienced overpriced shops and restaurants considering that there were equally as good restaurants and shops away from the Water Front. Just another Water front shopping Mall.

Centre of attraction. If you are looking for some life in Cape Town after dark then head down to the V&A. There are bars and restaurants to suit most tastes and pockets and plenty of sights and entertainment too.

Good food, good drink, good shopping.. This is the vibrant heart of the cape waterfront. Bustling and noisy, even in winter, it's a great place to wine, dine & shop.The main shopping centre has shops for every budget, is bright, airy and feels safe.Outside the main shopping centre are the restaurants and bars. All offer a good variety for any palette at a range of prices to suit every pocket regardless of depth.It's also the gateway to any of the offshore activities so a visit here will no doubt feature on almost every itinerary in Cape Town.A great place to settle down for an evenings dinner, drinks, music and the compulsory people watching....Enjoy....
Worth a visit when in Cape Town. Worth a visit, great atmosphere, nice restaurants and great shopping spot .Boat rides, face painting for kids and Cape Town's Big Wheel

A Regular Visitor. My wife and I manage to get to visit Cape Town twice a year and always make a point of visiting the V&A waterfront. We find the whole vibe of the place exciting and uplifting. There is a wonderful array of shops and eateries to suite all tastes. Besides waterfront itself is a hive of exciting activity with an assortment of boats and yachts to feast your eyes on. A genuine must see for any visitor to Cape Town.

Perfect day out!. There is so much to do here for adults, families, teenagers and children. The choice of restaurants is huge and you can always find one offering a good special, especially during winter.We particularly like Meloncino and Balducci. The City Grill is okay but definitely not as good.You can get all day parking for R10 if you drive past the hotel and to the end of the mall!! (after the last roundabout)

Full of life!. The V & A Waterfront area is just so interesting, with shops and restaurants all around! Such a lively place. We discovered some neat places, like the VA foodmarket and the Water Shed. VA foodmarket has a variety of foods that you can buy to eat there or take out. So many choices!! The Water Shed is a huge warehouse-like area filled with stores selling African-made things -- clothing, arts and crafts, jewelry, etc. The Waterfront is also where a number of museums are and the Robben Island tour sets off from here. Lively area, must visit place! Take time to enjoy the ambiance and to browse around the many shops!

Amazing place..vibrant atmosphere. We spent a whole day in the waterfront area.. they had a food festival going on, which offered so many different options of both food and desserts. The Watershed offered shopping from various local artists and the stuff was amazing.. almost similarly priced to Green market (no haggling though). The V&A mall also offers a lot of choices for those who love to shop.. you have everything from local to international brands like MAC and Body Shop.. if you get tried of all the walking and shopping.. you can happily stop for a cup of coffee at one of the many restaurants lined up.. an amazing day spent amazingly at waterfront..

What a spot!. I love the waterfront. We went in the early evening and just strolled through the mall - sitting watching the beautiful harbor and the wonderful atmosphere. Loads of people having a drink , eating and just generally hanging out ! Such a selection of eating places and wonderful shops and stalls!

Great place to visit in a sunny day. It was very nice to visit this place especially from the outside. Amazing view of table mountain and cape town marine. Few minutes from two oceans aquarium. There was some street food, and every thing we ate was very good

Great vibe. We visit this beautiful place at least yearly. Plenty shops and great restaurants. Ample parking. Beautiful view of Table Mountain and the ocean. Taxis available. Nice vibe and unique sounds of the harbor.Eerste lesing is onder tong & 2de onder arm.Within walking distance from Cape Town CBD.
Place to chill. This is one of my favourite places in Cape Town: loads of restaurant options and shopping outlets to relax after a long day

A lovely location but too busy. The V&A is a great place to visit especially if you are going to Robben Island (or doing something equally exciting), fancy some shopping, visiting the Two Oceans aquarium or are in need of a place to eat. The arts and crafts shops are expensive compared to prices of similar items bought elsewhere. The restaurants and fast food outlets are nice but there are other options around Cape Town which can offer a similar experiences. Traffic at rush hour is a very busy so it is worthwhile bearing this in mind if you are travelling into or out of the V&A at these times.

Chill. It's very nice at the V&A Waterfront. Lovely view, good food and a lot going on there. There are a little bit too many tourists, but it's alright...tourist spot.
But it's worth it.

Visiting is a must. People watching is superb. Spend an afternoon walking around, definitely worth it. Ferry to Robben Island leaves from here. Nobel Square is tucked a bit out of the way, ask around for it.
Very nice. Nice view , Take a boat round as well . Taxi services are not that great , Too many taxi drivers assemble and try pulling you.
Excellent . As always, this place is excellent and has tonnes to do. Family, couples, whatever. International standards.

Victoria and Alfred Waterfront. Very nice regenerated area of restaurants, shopping malls and places just to sit and watch. Also an observation wheel, which I did not use, Good view of Table Mountain, once you know your way around.

Shopping & food. The waterfront was fun to visit . There were all types of shopping from African Art to high end stores. Part of the mall was indoors . There were lots of restaurants to chose from with a variety of menu choices .

Need to see the center of Cape Town. It is magnificent to see the seals resting on the docks in front of Table Mountain. You just enjoy every moment of a clear view of this mountain. You can enjoy boat trips from V&A (recommend to ride on a speed boat, great fun), go for shopping in the malls, see the African market in the former ship dock (attention: becoming commercialized more and more), go for the food market hall. Parking is rather affordable for a prime spot. Don't forget, you might experience traffic jam, when you are heading out in the evening.

Vibrant, Tons to do. The waterfront area is very vibrant - and a big mall to boot! The mandela museum and the ferry ride are awesome. The restaurants are all top notch. We enjoyed sitting outside and watching the world pass by.
Plenty to see and do. Big wheel, Aquarium, Shopping Mall, Restaurants, Boat trips, Docks. Enough to keep a family busy all day.

Pleasantly surprised. Cape Town has several natural attractions, so V&A Waterfront would obviously not be the first port of call, but shouldn't be dismissed as a mall either. Its pretty, entertaining, and has some great restaurants. Good to spend some downtime between the more strenuous activities.

Great Mall. I've been here everyday of my time in Cape Town. Our hotel provides a free shuttle here every hour and back every hour, making getting here very convenient. There are many US stores as well as exclusive stores to Africa. There are also lots of restaurants available. A great hang out with free wifi!
Lifely ambiance. Hard to believe it was a place to avoid until some years ago. Now it is a place full of ambiance where you even forget you're in a country with some ackward crime statistics

Best hanging out place in town. Good place for shopping and getting African souvenirs. Wide range of dining options. Fantastic waterfront view if you want a postcard photo view. This can be taken from the top floor balcony of Victoria Wharf building
Your standard shopping area. The waterfront is famous, but it's mostly a collection of stores and malls. Not a highlight as far as I'm concerned.
Most see in cape . Exceelent mall and place to eat and stay. Very very crowded . You should visit it if you visiting the cape

Victoria & Alfred Waterfront. We went to the V & A waterfront for an afternoon/evening visit. It was a great place to be. The people were friendly and helpful. We arrived from a taxi arranged by our hotel and was picked up by the same method. I rode the skywheel which provided a great view of the V & A waterfront and was not overly expensive although you could have a VIP experience which was quite pricy. There was a wide variety of places to eat. I especially loved the bakery. Some of the Mall is under construction and there are 3 great restaurants which are hidden away by the construction. Overall an excellent afternoon was spent walking around and taking in the sites.

A vibrant place. There are many people who detest the kind of commercialism which the Waterside exemplifies. There is a mixture of upmarket shops, restaurants and bars in the old docks. The development has been done with some respect for the location. Some old buildings remain and these have been put to good use. The food market and the WaterShed are well worth a visit. The Food court is of a quality rarely seen in such places and the pubs and bars are interesting. There is usually some entertainment going on and the Waterside is mercifully free of beggars. It attracts tourists but also Cape Town residents. We visited in August and I reckon it will have an even greater buzz in summer.

The buzz of Cape Town. We traveled with German visitors to give them a taste of Cape Town. Not having a lot of time we did a one hour walk through the Waterfront starting at the Aquarium and ending at the old Prison service departure building. It was sufficient for them to experience the buzz of Cape Town and the diversity in our city.

A treat. I love the V&A waterfront. It's truly my favorite part of the weekend. I tend to go almost every weekend since H&M has opened and the kids just love Hamleys. There are so many international shops to visit and the restaurants are amazing. There is always entertainment outside and the vibe is great. I love that there are so many different ppl from all over the world. Makes me feel like I am in a different city each week. There are amazing views of the harbour. And there's a lovely food market. No visit can be complete without visiting the V&A.

Pretty , but nothing I would go out of my way for. This place is a shopping mall and a few nice gift ships. Just like every other shopping mall and a few nice gift stores. It has a lot of souvenirs and food. The Food Market was the best value we found for a big variety of international foods, although it was busy and crowded ( Think Yogi Berra) . It is a nice place to return to, before or after seeing Robben Island. I would not make this a must see destination unless I had never been to a souvenir store or gift shop. Nice that the waterfront is on the water otherwise I would not want to see it.

I could have spent my entire vacation here. The waterfront is an entire "city". There is so much to do here. Great shopping, restaurants, activities for people of all ages. I can't get enough of this place!
Too commercialized!. In a country where poverty and unemployment are rampant, the shops here are very opulent and unobtainable for many. Caters to the tourists.

We love the waterfront. As Capetonians we still really enjoy the waterfront. Somehow it manages not to fall into the "tourist trap" category? Although some of the restaurants are totally overpriced. Such as Balthazar, some others are worth visiting even as locals. We prequent San Marcos and Primi, and not many places have the same quality of external design. If you dislike large malls, this is the place to go shopping too.

Waterfront has my heart. Best place ever...shopping eating kids entertainment...had a ball here. Newest clothing ranges...amazing restaurants...friendly people and a lot of tourists...kids paradise too so much to do

seals,mini golf, a pier , restaurants and more. An all inclusive place for family fun.the place includes restaurants seal watching,boat rides,giant wheel,mini golf,music artists and other performers.loads of decent restaurants , that can be a bit expensive.

nice environment to be lived. The area has been recently restored using a portion of the old port; a pedonal area has been obtained, with several commercial centers, restaurants, and attractions (including acquarium). The result is a very nice environment, full of live and people around.

I love this place. What a great experience, the V and A has it all. Nice shops, great environment, excellent places to eat and a place to relax and experience all that Cape Town has to offer. It is a photographers dream

Great eclectic experience. Do the traditional or do the commercial......up to you! Lovely atmosphere, very clean lots of great restaurants, not just the normal commercial take aways! Some great boutique artist shops! Have a look at Jewellery Art for some amazing one off metal design 3 D pictures as a master piece you could take home! They ship around the world. Just down to the V & A clock tower and follow it through over the canal bridge and you will find them! Well worth a visit!

Brilliant . Lots to do, plenty of shops & places to eat. Lots of near by attractions including aquarium, open top bus stop, Ferris wheel, boat tours, the watershed and the food mall. Great to spend a day exploring.

Perfect place to enjoy South African hospitality.. This area of Cape Town is full of top rated restaurants, bars, retail shops and coffee shops. So much choice! Need to spend a good couple of days here to fully appreciate all there is on offer.
Great place!. This is the place to stay..hotels, restaurants, aquarium, the wheel, stores..you´d be close to everything!
Great place to visit. Great range of activities, restaurants and bars. Well worth an afternoon. Views of table mountain one side and the ocean on the other.

A Cape Town Must. I have been to a lot of waterfronts in other cities/countries. This one isn't the best, but it certainly is a great place to spend an afternoon or evening. Lots of good places to eat and interesting shops.

Not as upmarket as it used to be. Was used to visit regularly during my visits.A lot young noisy people running around.Some restaurants missing: Paulaner and Royal Bavarian Bakery .The standard of the shopping mall is decreased.

Plenty to do. The Waterfront is well worth a visit because of the conveniently laid out shops, the good choice of restaurants and the presence of the Wheel and the Aquarium. You can always just sit at a cafe and watch the bustle of the place. Be warned about two things. On a rainy day the covered parking gets totally full, but you can get out again without paying if you leave quickly, and you'll always find space outside. There are many pretentious shops with ludicrous prices - shop around a bit, particularly for cosmetics, as you'll sometimes find the same items at less than half the price.

You can get 2 for1! visit and still get a great view of the table mountain. As you can tell form my picture, I got to see 2 attractions by visiting one! LOL,Great shopping arcade and outdoor sit out, I particularly loved the men who played music by the entrance...I couldn't stop dancing!

Red us tour. I took my 5 year old grandson with me on a rainy July winter day. We were the only ones on the bus as we got on at Constanta Nek. The children are given activity packs in which there is a list of things to spot, it helps on the hour and twenty min journey to the waterfront where we got off . The sun was shining, even though we are local this is the 2nd time on the bus and I have nothing but the highest praise for it

Cool area for shopping, eating and night life. Went here a couple time and really enjoyed the atmosphere. The mall is so nice and full of great shops. There are really good restaurants in and around the mall too like Willoghby and Balthazar (we loved both restaurants). The aquarium is right there as well and the hop on hop off bus stops there too. It's a great place to start or end the day. There are activities outside as well and in the evening the pub has live music sometimes.
The water front. Super area. Very clean,safe and lots of place to eat at affordableprices. Lively entertainment throughout the day and evening.
Great shopping and restaurants. The restaurants were quite good and reasonably priced. We had a dinner of game on our last night which was simply amazing.

Mall with a lot of restaurants. If you like shopping the V&A this is the place to be. Furthermore you can find many restaurants (open 7 days a week except some fo them are closed on the 25.12. and on New Year). The range involves everything from pizza places to sea food restaurants. My favourites are Willoughby's (Sushi) and the Cape Town Fish Market. The aquarium and a new craft market are within the area.  If you have more time you can give one of the two cinemas a visit or you enjoy an evening at the comedy theater.

how to spend a great week. Go here - stay here - eat here - enjoy here. Wife and I spent a week at a nearby hotel and walked 5 minutes to great restaurants, shopping, and street entertainment. When we return - this will be our focal point. Join us.

Safe area full of restraunts and shops in a nice modern area. Large variety of shops and places to eat with other things to do like booking trips, hiring bikes and boat rides, starting point for bus tours and Robben island tour. will keep you occupied throughout the day and evening and also feels secure with a security guard presence. Plenty of transport links

At the foot of table mountain. A wide array of international brands mixed with amazing cuisine. Is excellent for a quick stop at the convenience store or romantic dinner for 2 at any of the top class restaurants. Does get extremely busy during the summer period but well worth the visit.

One of the "Must Visit" attractions in Cape Town. I always love to visit the Waterfront when I am in Cape Town for the day. Always a wonderful vibe, lots of lovely restaurants to choose from, shopping, and of course, entertainment. From the Big Wheel, where you can get a bird's eye view over Cape Town, to the local artists performing and entertaining the crowds, there is always something to see and do.If you want a really great experience, take a trip out on one of the many yachts available for a trip around the bay, from where you have a wonderful view of Table Mountain and Robben Island. You also might be lucky enough to see a whale in the bay. The Jolly Rodger is a Pirate Ship, that is very entertaining, especially for the children. The "pirates" on board put up a great entertaining show.You really should not miss coming to the Waterfront when you visit Cape Town!

Great place to visit and a great walk along the sea.. Excellent views, historic buildings, shopping areas, restaurants, pier and attractions. You can see the Table Mountain from there and there is even a huge shopping mall.
Great dining, views and shopping. Loved this area of Cape Town. We dined here a lot and had a fantastic time shopping in many stores. Would recommend to any who visit this area.

Touristy area but still a pleasant visit . This was our first visit to Cape Town so, we wandered down from our apartment near the city Centre. Lots of restaurants to cater for all budgets and retail shops. For those wanting to book activities, this can be done here too. From helicopter tours to safaris, they seemed to cater for all adventure requests. Our primary purpose was to have dinner, which we did (at Ferrymans) and highly recommend this venue.

Where the World Meets. The attractive feature for me about the V&A Waterfront is the fact that it is still a working harbour. It demonstrates the genuineness of the waterfront as opposed to a tourist trap. It is also a venue steeped in the history of the Mother City, Cape Town.On any given day numerous languages are heard and it is a place where the world meets.The shops, restaurants, hotels & features are well maintained are are world class with plenty of visible security. It is well signposted and easy to navigate around.A must see for any visitor to Cape Town

Shopping highlights. There are 3 malls: 1 is a mall with modern shops, one with local crafts and a food mall. U can do harbour cruises and helicopter rides from here. There is a Ferris wheel, plenty of bars and restaurants, as well as street entertainment.

CAPE WHEEL. The waterfront reminded me of Covent Garden in London; full of trendy shops and arts and crafts too. Lots of nice restaurants. Also safe enough for lone female travellers. The view from the Cape wheel was fantastic , and unlike the London eye there is no need to stand for hours in a queue.
Day visit. We always visit the Waterfront when visiting Cape Town... Shopping always good and beautiful views.... Now is the Big Sale time and I enjoyed it... Some very good eating places....

A place from which to begin your adventure of the Cape.. The Waterfront is an ideal spot to plan you adventures of the beautiful Cape, there are so many places of interest and departure points to thE ocean as well as inland. One can do the famour Robben Island trip or the various Hop-on, Hop-off bus trips which take you to a variety of destinations such as Table Mountain, Signal Hill, Hout Bay and many more beautiful places.

Great Vibe and Felt Very Safe. We spent 3 nights at the Waterfront Apartments in the V&A so spent quite a bit of time just wandering around the various shops and also going to the Aquarium, riding the Cape Wheel and eating out. The whole area felt very safe with lots going on. It was quite quiet on weekdays but found it much busier on the Saturday we were there. Lots of foodie places to choose from - recommend Balducci and the Food Market (could have eaten here for days and always had something different as there was so much choice). Also check out the little cookie and ice cream van parked near the Watershed but be prepared to queue. Perfect place for just chilling out and watching the world go by. Spot the seals playing in the water and watch the various street entertainers.
Tranquil and beautiful. Stunning restaurants, lovely relaxed feeling. Loads of upmarket shops and restaurants. Renovations are in progress at the moment but it does not interfere with your day out.

Nice Shops. We enjoyed walking around the waterfront. We spent a lot of time craft shopping at the Watershed. In fact we bought a bag lunch for Robben Island at the breakfast place at the far end of the Watershed.
shopping and dining area. The Victoria and Alfred waterfront is a nice area for just strolling around and shopping and dining.

A great way to spend an afternoon/ night. Very touristy, but great for quality souvenirs and great street food for lunch, as well as a dinner out. shops close a bit early for being a tourist hub. Quay Four was excellent for drinks, with live music every night.

Loads To Do!. My ship was docked in the waterfront for 4 days. I love how much there is to do in close proximity. Tons of shopping options, a comedy club, aquarium, Gateway to Robben Island, lots of outdoor performances, playground for kids, running trails, inexpensive and high-end eateries, cafes, taverns, Ferris Wheel, and close to the City Sightseeing bus stops. Easy to catch a taxi to go to city centre or Lion's Head. Very safe, busy area with beautiful views of Table Mountain.

bit crowded but worth the visit. my boys enjoyed the shopping mall, I enjoyed the sea food. Was a good stop. You can find quite a few different shop here for small gifts and even a Apple i-store which came in handy

Always worth visiting . We have been several times now, both out of seasons and at the busiest times of the year, no matter when, there is always a festive atmosphere and a great deal of things to do. Well worth the visit.

For tourist not locals. This is the problem with been a local Capetonian. The nicest places to hang out are made for tourist and therefore charge tourist prices however the market section is fun and reasonable for a day out.

Cape Town Centrepiece. This is the crown jewel of Cape Town, if not Africa. There is so much to do and see, from the shops (over-priced) to the amazing variety of restaurants (at every price point) to the museum, aquarium, pending art gallery, ability to charter a boat for a day or sunset cruise, and bustling street scenes with buskers and musical acts. Nothing captures the spirit of Cape Town (and maybe South Africa) - for better and worse - than the V&A Waterfront, A tad commercial at times, but absolutely free to walk around and take it all in.

waterfront shopping!. We visited the area as tourists and not for any specific events. It is at waterfront with great views and is a great area for shopping, from food market to high-end brand names!! Great area to hang around for a lay back afternoon.

Great area. Loads of quality restaurants and shops. Feels really safe too. Market on the wharf was a personal highlight. But don't just stay down here.....'real Cape Town' is just outside the waterfront and it is an amazing city.
Mrs . Loads to do for the whole family . Awesome vibe.Good restaurants Great shopping Something to do for everyone . Boat cruises etc
Museum Nights. Oh what a lovely night to enjoy all the museums and attractions for free at least for the day, pleasurable place to hang around and meet the world.

An entertaining vist to the V&A Waterfront. A vibrant area with loads of activities to do. Wide spectrum of restaurants, catering for a wide variety of budgets. Shopping at the mall is fun, too. Many different shops, depending on your needs. A good area to enjoy Pokémon Go too. Good tourist attraction.

The best South African shopping venue es. The best South African shopping venue ,all the shops , the boutiques, the really big names,and many new discoveries of specialist stores. Spoilt for eating choices ,and all aspiring to deliver a great experience.The atmosphere ,an international flavour and experiential visit payback even if only wandering around and ogling .

A good place to explore. Plenty of things to see and shops to visit. I enjoyed walking around the waterfront, looking at the old buildings, boats in the harbour, trying the drinking and eating places spent an hour in one fantastic three storey shop full of old african artifacts. An area of the city where it is easy and safe to while away a half day or more....

The Food Market. The food market was my favourite part of the waterfront. Go early as they do tend to run out of ingredients. The vendors only accept cash. There are ATM's nearby though. The rest of the waterfront is pretty much a very busy mall. There are however usually cool acts near the wheel. The amphitheatre is also open and usually playing music on a big screen. The waterfront is always busy and parking is sometimes difficult.

Great Shopping and Tourism. I throughly enjoyed V&A Waterfront. There's diverse shopping for everyone, great dining, entertainment, museums, etc. If visiting from the U.S., it's a great place to shop since the dollar goes very far. Splurge here at a designer shop. It's a beautiful venue situated on the Atlantic Ocean.

Entertaining area. This is a very nice area of Cape Town. Lots of shops and restaurants that meet everyone's needs. The views are very nice and there are activities around (Sky wheel, aquarium). Worth going for a meal and to do some shopping.

Great mainstream shops. This was a great mall for a rainy day. You could really be anywhere in the world they do have many of the usual designer shops with some local ones mixed in. We enjoyed an afternoon there and then had diner at one of the fish restaurants which was really good.

Beautiful area! . We spent a lot of time wandering around the V&A waterfront, looking at the shops and watching the street performers. It is a lovely area and completely geared towards tourists. It felt very safe and there were lots of security guards around. The shopping was great as were the restaurants and bars.

Lovely place . Very lovely place , suitable for all the family.Needs many days to discover the various activities. Has many restaurants that satisfy everyone.Watching the beautiful sunset was a great time .

Tons to do. The view from the waterfront is beautiful. If you take a nice stroll through the area you'll see nice art decor, restaurants, and shoppes. There is a mall and a market giving you plenty of opportunity to shop until you drop. There are also different kiosks selling tickets for different excursions like the safari, water taxis, or table top mountain. I enjoyed myself and the food is good and inexpensive. Plenty of restaurant options and coffee shops.

Over built and over run with toursits. This used to be a nice place to visit. We originally visited in 2006 back then it was a lovely waterfront wharf area, now it is over built and with no end to the construction. Even has a mall no, the charm that it had back in the day is no longer there, now it is a tourist trap!Sad to see how over developed it is!

Lots to do. Lots to do and lots to see - Really enjoyed the 45 min harbour cruise - shop around for your cruise - the cheaper ones do the trick really as all you're really interested in is seeing Table Mountain in all its glory

WONDERFUL FOR KIDS, TOO. I spent a whole day just walking around the waterfront. There was an exhibition of Anne Frank, where i lingered for a while. Then it takes about an hour's walk to just get a feel of the place. There is an amazing farmer's market, where i had delicious uthentic local food, at a a very reasonable price. i bought a few authentic spices here. also ate some of the famous "samosas", piping hot. then there is the shopping arcade, a bit expensive, but i realised later that this is the only marketplace selling south african gemstones. even in joberg or in downtown area of cape town, i could not see any shops, selling such varieties. so i had to go back to make a few gemstone purchases. evenings you have live dance, music shows. you have sportshops selling a to z of travel items as well. lovely to chill at the waterfront.

Beautiful setting and plenty to do. The V&A Waterfront is really beautiful. There is a vast amount of restaurant / take-away options here, as well as plenty of shops, markets, street art, street music, a kids playground, a giant ferris wheel for great views, and many boats for trips to Robben Island or just for a cruise out to see. It's also a super location from which to view Table Mountain in all its glory.

Touristy..... Touristy, if you are looking for the touristy spot in Cape Town, this is it. Expensive shops and restaurants. Reasons to go? The Ferris Wheel provides great views of Table Mountain and the waterfront. Also catch the ferry to Robben island.

Great day out . Absolutely loved it.It's a great way to spread your day for all who would like shopping indoors and also for a relaxed fun and chilled out day .Amazing opportunity to spend a day with kids outside as well As they have good play area and some fun stuff for kids too.Food wise you will find fantastic options.We tried the restaurant "Bukhara " Indian &Asian food options.Also the cafeteria close to the play area was fantastic as we saw kids play while we sipped our hot coffee..

Very nice area with a great view to walk around, eat and shop. If you're looking for a few hours to while away during your stay in Cape Town after a morning of hiking or exploring the surrounding area, the V&A Waterfront is a great place for this. A nice, clean, modern area at the waterfront, full of shops (many arts & crafts and local goods & curios), restaurants and food courts, there are some amazing views from the water's edge with boats, nice buildings and Table Mountain in the background. We had great weather, but if you're not as lucky, you can duck into the Two Oceans Aquarium at the Waterfront to see some interesting fish and penguins (although don't expect too much).

Best shopping mall and not only. It's a great place to do some shopping, where you can find famous brands and restaurants, ranging from fast-food to gourmet. It's difficult to put into words how many things you can do here, you must go there and see for yourself. For sure one of the bests in Cape
Great spot. Good shopping, friendly atmosphere, and good food. V&A definitely deserves its spot as a destination for travellers.

Great place to shop. I stayed at the Table Bay Hotel and this complex leads directly from the hotel. It is a modern waterfront development featuring a variety of shops and restaurants on two levels. There is a wide variety of shops from designer downwards. There is a food hall for a quick/cheap meal and on the harbour side there are the better quality restaurants including local fare and seafood specialities. Well worth a visit if you are in the area.

Wonderful place to eat and shop. What a fab place to go to especially for sailing eating and shopping the resturants are especially good and he shopping pre nt is 5 star.good for sailing trips especially on the katamaran.

Beautifull place. We stayed in the appartment next to V&A waterfront just to have as much as possible fun with activities around the area, there are so much things to do in the vicinities with a lots of restaurants, shoppings and turism attractions. The family had a fantastic time over there.

Best place in Cape Town . This is one of the nicest places ive ever been! There is such a great vibe around the place. The views of table mountain are spectacular. There are a number of different bars and restaurants to choose from. The food market was the best in my opinion, lots of different food stalls. Set down at the harbour there is live music and two shopping centres with lots of different shops.Its just a brilliant place to eat, drink, shop or just even hang out. Very safe also-Loved it!
Overrated!. Although beautifully made, this is an overrated attraction. Extremely expensive stuff (Most brands are cheaper in India). The best part is the architecture of the mall.

Scenic shopping area. A large shopping area with lots of well known brands but nothing really special. There is one nice craft market with some locally made products.
Lots of good food to enjoy as you browse.

A Buzz. This precinct comes alive at about 12 noon. Plenty of tourists and security. There are buskers and street entertainment and, beware, touts. Importantly for me, the Tourist Bus for Cape Town also leaves from here.
Plenty of restaurants, bars and cafes.
A must if visiting Cape Town.
Waterfront . Great place to browse around and shop. I visited before this was developed and it has certainly added to the area. Even if your not shopping its a good place to sight see too

Food and shops . Best place for food and start your tour in cape town
The hotels there is a class different kinds of food and a lot of them is hala but the price is expensive this place is for tourists

So pretty, I went here a few times and found lots of wonderful things to look at. So much to see and do but my favourite part was the Wheel. i never usually go on these things but this time I though what the heck and so I did. I really enjoyed it as you get to see everything and you realise how big it it. I also enjoyed sitting by the wharf watching the sea lions frolic in the water.

Must Do. Our hotel was 5 mins walk from here. All the food and drink and entertainment you could want in such an historic quaint area. Very similar to Darling Point in Sydney but older they have kept the old buildings and done them up while keeping it very quaint. Love this place. So much to choose from every cuisine covered.
Standard. Nice harbor and view. Otherwise typical touristy fare. One visit is enough. Get out and exlpore the rest of the city which is much more authentic.

Good atmosphere, great restaurants. The waterfront always felt safe walking around in the evening, as there were plenty of security guards. The big wheel is quite a sight, but we found the quality of the food available to be simply awesome. There are a variety of restaurants, and great cafés for breakfast. Definitely worth a visit!

Something for everyone. There is something for everyone. Pricy shopping and reasonable shopping. Excellent restaurants and fast food outlets as well. Awesome markets for visitors to browse. No visit to Cape Town should take place without spending time at the Waterfront. Also visit the Springbok Experience when you are there.
v&a waterfront. sea and shops a wonderful combinations. places to sleep and eat, relax and spent time with friends and family

Best waterfront in the world. This has to be the best around and I think I have visited most! There is everything here and it is a working harbour so you really get up close to how it all flows. Top hotels, restaurants, shopping and experiences such as aquarium that is first class and plenty of different boat trips.

Great for tourists and locals. I was struck by how similar this area is conceptually to fisherman's wharf/pier 39 in San Francisco. The difference here is that it was also popular with locals and this made the atmosphere so much better. spending the day snacking in the market was one of our favourite Cape Town activities.

Enjoy the day with lots of choices. Loved the open air market offering goods made by locals, nice retail stores as well, and great food & wine choices. A mall is there as well but I prefer the local flavor and was most satisfied with my FULL day there.
Touristy. There plenty of restaurants here. The offer good food options. And also plenty of tourists visiting the area.
Worthwile to see while down at the waterfront. If you make it down to the revived waterfront, make sure you take the time to visit the Victoria and Alfred Waterfront.

The most happening place. If you go to Cape town it is essential that you visit Victoria and Alfred Waterfront..The place is buzzing with a lot of activity especially on the weekends.. With performances in the open area..
Lots and lots of shops for buying souvenirs.. Restaurants for good variety of food... It is also the gateway to robben island

The waterfront is the perfect mix of local and international. from shopping to dining out, to tourist activities, this place has something fort everyone.
the view of the harbour and table mountain from many Oceanside restaurants , along with the good overall quality of the restaurants and food, means you are spoiled for choice and I have never been disappointed here.

NIce vibe. has a lot of restaurants and bars.
Loads of choices and different cuisines.
Shopping mall is ok too.

Busy busy busy shopping!. Offers a variety of stores with something for everyone.
Best is the many options for restaurants and coffee shops.
The location is amazing with views of the waterfront- especially at sunset!!!

Very touristy, but worthwhile. The V + A Waterfront is full of tourist attractions like restaurants, shopping movie theaters, etc. Plenty to do in good or bad weather. It is a very safe and clean area. Unfortunately, there are other areas of Cape Town where you need to be vigilant. The Waterfront is well patrolled and we always felt comfortable.

Shopping, food and musical performance always on offer!. The Waterfront offers a shopping experience so great you will want to come back. Pop into South African chain shops for affordable goods as other shops are targeting tourists and are quite pricey. The atmosphere around is a bustle of locals and foreign tourists. One is spoilt for choice when it's time for the stomach to be fed. There is always a cultural musical performance around.

Lovely Day Out and Sultry Evening Stroll. This was a day trip for me and it was lovely. Tons of historical elements to the V&A Waterfront to be had. However, please please please don't buy your souvenirs from the shops there as they are HIGHLY overpriced. I almost bought something that would have cost me the equivalent of $35USD and another tourist stopped me and suggested that I try elsewhere. Traffic around the waterfront can be very hectic so if you're taking an uber (which I HIGHLY suggest - very affordable), please meet your uber in front the front of a local hotel. The shops are nice, the fast food like KFC was great and fresh. Oh yeah, the seagulls... those creatures are scary and disrespectful to we poor humans, lol. If you're going to have lunch at an outdoor restaurant, you will have to contend with birds nearly attacking you for your food. They will viciously swoop down and steal your food. If you think I'm fibbing, ask the waiters. Other than that, its just so lovely you can't help but making a trip or two or three while you're in cape town. One more thing, ride the ferris wheel. Its a touristy thing to do and its just fun!! Go for it and have a blast! Enjoy.
best shopping / event mall in cape town. lovely and unique shopping, food court mostly halaal. must go on the Cape Wheel. can get boat cruises and helicopter rides.

Lovely place to spend an evening. The Waterfront is a beautiful place for one to spend time just wandering around and taking in the sights and sounds. Boat rides to Robben Island and other interesting activities can be explored

Day out at waterfront. Lots of things to do and see . Lots of restaurants and shops in the building. Lots of attractions going on outside. Live entertainment. Lots of shops to buy curios. Boat tris available. Great place to visit for averseas travellers .
