Great place to visit; LOTS to do. Visit during the South African Winter (July) was a unique experience for someone from Florida. Beautiful shops (I had a classic Barbershop shave at Mr. Cobbs, right in the mall!) Everything from upscale restaurants, to fast-food eateries. Great shopping in the Mall, and lots of thing to see an do on the Waterfront.
Always busy and crowded. A tourist trap. Always very crowded and horrible during peak season. Good shopping selection and some good restaurants.
Amazing mall. Very good for shopping and varities for dining and shopping.Was very bear to our hotel and also the informaton desh team are really good in advising where to go inside

Standard mall these days. Good sized mall with good food and out door area. Lots of shops ranging from luxury to budget...somewhat like westfield in London. Prices are similar to UK prices. It's clean and safe, most hotels offer a shuttle service to this mall.

Great entertainment and its free. Have watched the waterfront develop over more than 20 years. Each time I go there is more going on. Performers, crafts,the market and shops , boat trips and the land train and of course loads of restaurants...something for everyone

Beware construction. This hotel is in a great location at the waterfront. Unfortunately, it is going through a remodel. Because of the remodel it can be very noisy. At times we could hardly talk to each other. We had to move rooms because of the construction noise which starts at 7 or earlier. The manager was gracious and moved us which made the rest of our stay tolerable. The construction, lobby and restaurant is suppose to be completed by end of August. Im sure it will be fantastic!

Must spend an evening here. From coffee shops, to dances, to the cape wheel, to stores and the restaurants with the sun setting is really worth an evening while in Cape Town. The bakery near the entrance has amazing stuff to eat. Highly recommend.
Great area, great center. Great place. A nice area outdoor, with great view to both the sea and the table mountain. Big shoppingcenter.

Certainly Worth A Visit. A nice shopping centre area next to the waterfront with both regular and "brand name" shops. Many restaurants and bars throughout and a pleasant way to spend a few hours. Compared to Australian restaurants, the prices of both food and drink in the restaurants were very attractive - about half of that in Australia. Quality of the food (and quantity) was also very good.

lots to see and do. Reminded me very much of Pier 39 in San Francisco, but much cleaner and less accessible by public transportation. I'd suggest walking there as traffic is quite congested and parking limited. Great restaurants and shopping, rugby museum all located here. I especially enjoyed the building housing locally produced arts and crafts, located adjacent to the aquarium and the artisanal food mall. All sorts of local flavors and well worth the trip
Nice relaxing experience. Always a nice place to visit with numerous shops including a lot of the high end international brands restaurants and bars for all.

Beautiful Waterfront with so much on offer. Whether shopping, touring the historic sites, sampling the many fantastic restaurants, sipping a glass of wine or beer or visiting the tourist centers, V&A has it all. Felt very safe and easy parking. Spotlessly clean. Check out the resident seals by the Clock Tower.
So many shops and restaurants under one roof.. Everything you need under one roof. A shopping experience of note for the whole family. Restaurants, movies, shops.

Queit with amazing views of the ocean. We stayed at the Table bay hotel which was located in the waterfront. It was queit and everywhere u walked you would see amazing views of the ocean. The location is superb as we were first timers and enjoyed walking about the waterfront.

Fun for everyone. This is a fun destination for adults and kids. There is something for everyone. From shopping, to restaurants, to kid-centered activities it was a blast. We went there almost every day. There are street performers and a mini theater for outdoor musical performances next to the cape wheel located outside the mall. The cape wheel was also a great attraction. I just recommend you go to the cape wheel itself in the day so you get a better view of the skyline. Overall its a great location with lots of activities for all.

Loved it. We loved the Waterfront area of Cape Town, from its shopping malls, to its small restaurants, curio shops and street entertainers. Lovely location with everything you could want. Definitely worth visiting for half or full day.

Nice spot for shops and lunch. A safe and attractive part of town, with fine shopping and an abundance of bars and restaurants. Great views of the coast and Table Mountain. Well worth spending a few hours there to soak up the ambiance, buy some bargain price luxuries and have a fab meal. If you go to Cape Town, you will almost inevitably be drawn to go there. We had a seafood lunch with excellent wines for very little outlay, such is the current exchange rate.
The food hall is a must.. On our trip to Cape Town we really enjoyed the food hall with the different cultures food. Very interesting . Very well done. The prices are also reasonable.

Birds Eye View. We visited V&A Waterfront on a beautiful clear day - so the decision to go in the Big Wheel was an easy one. We got to see so much more from up there. I can imagine summer being the perfect time for one of the many boat rides on offer. The brass band playing lends to the atmosphere of Cape Town.
visit. the waterfront mall is just amazing,you get to see everything you ever wanted to see in a mall,variety of shops,restaurants,rides and a whole lot more

Entertaining. We reached here hunting for a good place for brunch.We surely did get a lot of options for brunch and remained here for about 4 hours after that enjoying the other options they had to offer.
Shop till you drop. Lovely shopping mall and eateries for every budget. Biggest H&M I've ever seen. Lovely marina and this is also where the ferry takes you to Robbin island.
Exactly what you would expect. Shops, food, Ferris wheel, music. Perfect way to spend an afternoon. Plus it has a Hamley's toy store.

A joy to visit. A shopping haven with not only some of the best shops in SA, but some of the most breathtakingly views of table mountain from the harbour and excellent restaurants, movies and a joyous get-together of all the nations of the world.

Great hub for things to do. Fantastic place to visit is very touristy but so what great place to shop, eat and walk around. Cape wheel is located in front and also close to harbour so can walk around and see the inlet.During the day lots of activity going on with street performers etc also options to book tours around the city and outside cape town and you get a great view of table top mountain.Go and check it out and have some fun.
A bit of everything good here!!. V&A is a great venue for shopping restaurants and amusement as well as boat trips . Everything here is quality and yet not over expensive for food drink etc.

Shopping area with many attractions. Enjoyable place where Children and parents can have fun. Aquarium of Capetown, kiddies playground and many shops and restaurants. A safe place as many policemen look around. The Big wheel and a little train will pleased the little ones, as Hamsley shop in the little mall. Many taxis and hip/hop red and blue buses.

Safe and interesting. Great location to stay and great to visit. Safe and interesting - lots of good restaurants, food, security, shopping. Not so comfortable at night (too few people around). Great location for day trips as well

Everything you want when on holiday is here. Staying near the V&A Waterfront provided us access to all services that you would require if holidaying. As it was our first time in Capetown, we found everything we needed to make our trip memorable. Services included - Restaurants, cafes, gallery, supermarket, bus sightseeing/tour operator (double-decker buses that drive around tourist spots for a fee). Only drawback was a lot of renovation happening in the vicinity which could make walking slightly hazardous in various areas.

Great atmosphere. Victoria & Alfred Waterfront buzzes with activity at all hours of the day. It caters to tourists and residents alike, boasting beautiful views of Table Mountain and the Atlantic Ocean. There is a wide array of shopping venues, restaurants and other attractions. V&A Waterfront has a lively atmosphere and numerous street performers will keep you entertained for hours! Not to be missed :)

Vibrant Waterfront area, good for daytime, but probably not at night. The waterfront at Cape Town has many wonderful shops, restaurants, and entertainment. It is a great place to visit during the day, but not recommended for night time. Prices at the shops seem pretty reasonable and many of them will bargain. You leave for Robben Island from the waterfront as well as any other water excursions. We had several good meals there and enjoyed the street performers which are dotted around the area. The Ferris wheel gives a great view of the area. Cape Town has a very high crime rate, and while you are probably safe during the day, and even at night in the area, you still have to make your way back to your hotel and the hotel staff will warn you that really isn't safe.
Tourist point. Excellent town square with many restaurants, Cape Wheel, souvenir shops, hop on-hop of bus stop, shopping mall, bars. . . perfect tourist spot
Typical waterfront. What can I say, it's your typical waterfront restaurants shopping nightlife. We had a good time there is good food but your typical waterfront
Love it!. Great restaurants with variety of foods. Huge shopping malls, great view of the Table Mountain, you got to come here if you are in CT.

Nice for shopping, dining & other attractions. The V&A Waterfront boasts a nice mall with ample local as well as all the well known international brands. A lot of dining options, from take away to high end restaurants is available for dining. Also boat, yacht trips from the pier is available.

Tourist Spot. Lots of shops and places to eat. Nice spot to spend time with great views. The aquarium is close by and the Food Market was also a great spot for trying variety of food and little shops.

Great way to relax and spend a few hours. We visited the V&A Waterfront twice while we were in Cape Town. The first time we spent several hours just wondering around and enjoying the scenery. There are a wide range of restaurants and bars as well as shopping arcades. The aquarium and the Robbin Island departure point are also based here. We walked from the centre of Cape Town to the waterfront in the day time and it was very pleasant.

Pretty but very touristy!. We visited in July and it was lovely to walk along the water front in the winter sun warmth. Some good spots for holiday snaps. There's plenty of window shopping to do down in the mall. Aside from Willoughby's (sushi with actual Japanese chefs), the rest of the food down there is very hit and miss. Mostly miss to be quite honest. Especially Baia :( Was such a let down.
Excellent for Shopping and Eating. A huge shopping and restaurant complex. Everything is in one place with the Marina for the boat trips at the end.

So much energy. This place is gorgeous if you love energy and food! It's beautiful and street performances bring the place to life. Loved visiting here every day just for the energy it has. Watch out for the seagulls!

An Amazing Must See. This is a one stop shop. V&A Waterfront has everything from, eateries, shops, tours, post office, entertainment, pubs, parking and a host of many other wonders. Do Not Leave Cape Town without one visit there.
Worth a visit. Lots of good shops and restaurants - clean and tidy - plenty of security. Good atmosphere and lots to do in harbour area with shops of all varieties including crafts and art.
Vacation in South Africa. Beautiful breath taking view of the waterfront. Good for a nice evening walk with the chirping of the sea gulls
Best attraction.... If you are travelling to Cape Town stay adjacent to V&A. You can find the aquarium, port, resturants, food market, Cape wheel, mall, art shops. You are where you want to be.

A good place to hangout and spend a day. Nice and clean waterfront area. Has a large mall. Small eating joints. Cape wheel. Some attractions for children. Live music going on. Sometimes people performing some date live.. Good lighting and weather.
You can an entire day easily.

Best tourist destination in Cape Town. As we live in Cape Town we are regular visitors to the V&A Waterfront. It is a great venue for shopping and the choice of restaurants is endless. My favourite is Sevruga which is right next to the boat landing where the various boat trips commence from.
It certainly rates up with the very best Waterfront venues in the world.
Great place to eat, shop and relax. They have everything down there and you could spend hours and hours there. It has a vibrant atmosphere with very friendly people there.

Kinda weird and crazy, but some hidden gems. We had to fill a wet and windy day so headed down to the aquarium and waterfront. Walked around the Water Barn and the main shopping district. In short, it's a big shopping experience with a bit of history of an operating harbour sprinkled in. If you look closely you'll find some stores that are gems. But there's a lot of run-of-the-mill stuff too. Definitely worth the experience if you have to fill some time.

Best choice of restaurants and fun activities for everyone . Visiting the V&A waterfront is a must for every tourist!!! Everything to do from mini golf for the young ones to riding the big wheel to feasting on the best cuisine and flushing it down with a Mitchells beer, taking a boat trip and visiting the aquarium....all while being in the best city in the world with amazing views of Table Mountain or the sea.
Holiday eats. Large selection of restaurants and pubs available. Nice mall. Lots to see and do, little shops to browse.

Enjoyable. Lots to do at the Cape Town waterfront. Information office was helpful. All sorts of food and shopping at the waterfront. Post office for the philatelists. Live music has been playing every time we were there. Had some really good lunch and dinner at the food market.

Great variety of shops - plenty to see here. We spent several hours at the V&A Waterfront visiting the shops and having lunch. Very nice variety of shops. This is a great area to do some shopping and spend an afternoon.
Beautiful but more expensive . Its a place you must also visit and the trip from the harbour to robben island - it has expensive high street shops and restaurants and you will find it all here
Mall. Our hotel offered free shuttle to and from the V A which made it convenient as an endpoint for HOHO bus tour. Did not shop wives did but did enjoy the street musicians.

Great redevelopment of harbour. Great and safe place to stay in Cape Town with plenty of nice restaurants. It seemed to the the tourist hub of the city with tour buses and boats to Robben Island leaving from it. This made it very easy to get around.

Lovely place just to hang out and of course, shop!. Great shops, nice restaurants and lovely people watching! We bought some artifacts which we had shipped and ate dinner in one of the restaurants...altogether very pleasant!
A Tourist Dream. The shopping, the people, the experience of walking along the Waterfront was amazing. We enjoyed the entertainment in the central area as well.
Wonderful. Fantastic environment, buzzing wit bars, restaurants and shops just a short walk from our hotel, Cape Grace
Shopping. Shoppers Paradise, the V&A Waterfront is shoppers dream and a center that caters to all budgets and tastes

The food market was our favorite . Food Market: About thirty different stalls, each with something slightly different. Prices are all VERY reasonable. Everything here smelled wonderful. We ate from the variety of samosa, got some coffee at another, and then had to leave for another engagement. We will definitely be back. The artisan market right next door also caught our eye.The rest of the waterfront was hit or miss. Do yourself a favor. Eat at the food market, shop next door in the two story yellow building filled with artisan wares.... And only walk around the other areas of the waterfront.

An afternoon at V and A waterfront Cape Town. A pleasant place to wander around for an afternoon. Lots of restaurants to choose from and reasonably priced. Great souvenir shop - African Port - cheaper on some things than the markets. Quite safe area to visit.

So much to see and do. As this was my first visit to Capetown, I'm glad I stayed at the Waterfront. Very safe, great shopping and restaurants. Easy to get anywhere in the area from here. Great views of Table Mountain!

Interesting place. There are many stalls and stores that offer a variety of items. We were on our way to our sunset cruise and didn't have much time to wander. Next time, I hope to have more time to explore this place

A stunning tourist trap I visit every time when in CT!. With all the pre-season construction going on, it is somewhat dusty and noisy, but it still remains a great place to relax, enjoy all its views, and have a go at the great restaurants and bars lining the docks! Cold or not, it is difficult to NOT enjoy all its offerings and activities!

The Place To Be !! Super Lively. Loved the V & A Waterfront.Was at Cape town for 4 days and visited the Waterfront 3 days!! Offers multitude of Dining options, a superb multi-choice organic food market offering healthy but tasty juices, smotthies, wraps, rolls, oriental, Lebanese, Indian,,,you name it they have it. Also widest range of shopping - handicrafts, brands, quaint knick, knacks, everything. And ofcourse a gateway to Robben Island - the Memorial for nelson Mandela & Anti apartheid fighters.

All in all an overall great experience of entertainment. normally a shopping mall is just shopping but the waterfront is much more than that, it also great eating spots, entertainment and lots more for everyone. the waterfront constantly evolves and gets better all the time.It is an asset to the City of Cape Town

Great mix of options. We were staying in a hotel minutes away so we visited numerous times over three days, doing anything from restaurant dining to food stall munching, craft shopping and mini-golf. Clean and safe with a good variety of activities to last an hour or a day.

Worth a stroll!. This is definitely worth a visit. Lots of shops, bars, restaurants and even seals and sea lions in the water! Have a look soak up the atmosphere, the people and have a drink at one of the numerous bars.
Vibrant but very little for toddlers. Very exciting visit for family with toddlers. Although some restaurants might claim to have kiddy friendly seating, we have yet to find one

Nice place for a beautiful sunset and calm evening . Beautiful place in the evening. One of the best sunset I have seen. It was chilly winter evening. We strolled in the area. There is beautiful shopping and eating centre in the area provides shopping and dining choice. Must visit in Cape Town.
Mall Food and more. The V&A waterfront is buzzing with activities with a big mall, restaurants and market place etc. Good place to spend a day.
So much to do. Loved visiting the waterfront. So much to do and so many places to go to. We were there in a long weekend and it was very very busy!

Lively but really not unique. I had heard a lot about this area. To me it is like a Cape Town version of south bank in London. Really nothing new. Even has its own wheel. Very lively, and likely to be enjoyed by family with younger kids. Seems like a convenient place to shop, as shops are open till 2100- then again, the mall has all the standard western shops. There was a little area with "African souvenirs" at inflated prices. Not overly fussed regarding this area..

Always a hit with teenagers (and parents). Our family with two teenagers have been going to the waterfront for years. It never disappoints. Loads to do Ito live entertainment, boat rides, cinemas, etc. a wealth of restaurants and shops. Amazing views of table mountain and the coast. Love the cosmopolitan atmosphere. Can get too busy from 12 noon onwards so come early.

Wide variety of activities . Lots to do at the waterfront. Wide range of shops in the mall. Lots of restaurants to choose from. Legendary red bus tours nearby. Boat cruises and chopper flight. Spectacular views.

The Shopping haven of Cape Town. The V&A waterfront is iconic as it is magical. The setting of the surrounding shops, restaurants and boat tours makes this an all year round experience for everyone, young and old. Whether you head off early morning for breakfast at one of the many outstanding restaurants, or a lunch time getaway, or dinner supreme for a romantic night out, the Waterfront sets the occasion for each visit. Shopping is perfection for the discerning traveller, and can as quickly run up your credit card bill with all the goods on offer. As a Capetown ian, the Waterfront is never boring, and is entertaining for the whole family.
Excellent views, wonderful shopping. This is must do visit on your first and subsequent trips to Cape Town. Probably one of the shopping centres based in the most picturesque setting.

Weekend visit is good. Busy and vibrant at weekends with lots of free entertainment by visiting performers. Renovations are currently being done around the restaurant areas which limited the dining experience., but still worth the visit. Lots of choices of bay trips and activities for young and old alike.
A great area to eat, shop and enjoy the scenery. Our hotel was across the street from here. We enjoyed the many different choices we had for dining, shopping and strolling to enjoy the scenery.

What a beautiful place to spend a few hours.. Plenty to do to appeal to all ages here,great shopping and plenty of eating places to choose from, activities and entertainment as well at the huge stage and roving buskers.

A very popular destination - for locals and tourists. If you love the bustle of crowds, this is a great place to spend a few hours. Shops and eateries range from mid-range to high-end and there many areas to just sit and people-watch or admire beautiful and very photogenic harbour and mountain views. Even the cinemas cater for general public and those who prefer art movies. Then there's the beautiful aquarium and museums and street entertainers. Despite the thousands of visitors, the centre and bathrooms are clean. Traffic flow is generally good with ample parking.
Excellent Shops in a Great Atmosphere. Shops, Restaurants, and Coffee Shops in a magnificent visual experience. Clean, well lit and wonderful variety
Too expensive for South Africans buying with Rands and not Dollars. The food places was all fine but the prices at the watershead and shops were too expensive for the local South Africans.

Bustling, crowded and fascinating waterfront. This was my third time to the V and A Waterfront. (The last time was 9 years ago). Loads of development has taken place over these past few years. While I certainly enjoyed visiting it again, I found the crowds to be pretty overwhelming! Where I returned frequently during my last visit, I found that once was enough. There ARE lots of great food options though; and plenty of ad hoc performers; and of course, the required ferry to Robbins Island!

Waterfront Shopping. Wanted to get some real African momentoes and found limited supplies only. The shop at Kirstenbosch Gardens had a better selection of quality products but enjoyed the visit and lunch of kudu and zebra was very tasty if touristy. too many international brand shops for our liking but the Craft area had lots of interesting possibilities even though we knew we were paying Tourist prices.

Always something happening. There is always something going on at the V&A Waterfront. At the weekends at least. Lovely African voices singing in harmony. Welly Boot Dancers (originating from the gold miners). Cape Fur seals basking on their platform (rather smelly) and fun to watch sailors trying to get past them to board their vessels without being snapped at. Catamarans to Robbin Island leave from here for a trip around Mandela's old prison. Plenty of upmarket shops, an indoor market for hand crafted goods, dozens of first class restaurants. Spend the day there.

Oh Cape Town, my Cape Town.. There is something about feeling the sea-breeze in your hair, while sipping a delicious local white wine, sitting on a plush outdoor couch in one of the many trendy eateries, where statuesque Table Mountain meets the sea, sun on you face, shopping bags at your feet, laughter in many languages drenching the atmosphere with a touch of the exotic. And you can say all of that in one sentence, because at the V&A Waterfront you can find all that you can dream up.

Five day stay in Cape Town. The water front is vibrant and safe, pick a hotel in Cape Town which is in walking distance from the Waterfront. We went down there every day good eating at very reasonable prices

great food/shopping - even for locals. We enjoy going for a quick lunch at waterfront - even for locals - the food is excellent - easy parking - and its got a wonderful atmosphere near the sea. Also worth going to the oranjezicht food market next to V&A near the grand restaurant on a Saturday morning starts at 9 am - 2 pm - and if you have the energy the park run in Green Point
Walking distance of cruise port. We wandered the shops and stopped for dinner -- We could have spent a few more hours here! Lots of choices for meals --

Great fun, huge array of eateries and shops. Perfectly safe and comfortable place to experience the waterfront --- dozens of restaurant choices (or so it seemed) and dozens of shops ranging from clothing to African crafts.
Fun, food and shops galore . Roaming around the V&A with family. Enjoyed the street performance, shops and food. Although targeted at tourists it still offers a wide range of experiences.

Great food and shopping options. We really enjoyed the food market, which featured an eclectic array of food options from small vendors. We also really enjoyed the crafts market adjacent to the food market. I would recommend staying away from the mall area, which is overly commercialized and charmless.

More than just a mall. Sure, it's a big shopping centre full of glitzy international brands and touristy curious to catch visitors' attention, but it's also where the locals do their shopping. I often come here to shop for clothes or groceries, go to the movies, grab a coffee and do a little people-watching (there's always such an interesting mix of people). Bonus: Postcard views of the mountain and the harbour.

Exciting waterfront. The V& A Waterfront is vibrant, exciting, interesting and has something for everybody. You will find up market shops, classy returns, yachts to charter , helicopter flips, sunset cruises, a big wheel, rugby museum, art galleries, even a pirate boat or a mini tug are available to take you on a trip in the bay. The ferry to Robben Island leaves from here

Exciting destination - V and A. Nothing is more exciting for a visitor to a region or city than to find one destination with many outlets. Victoria and Alfred Waterfront, fondly known as V & A, is such a destination. There is a multitude of cafes and restaurants, including a Spur steakhouse, and MacDonalds.There's Ocean Basket for seafood and good old-fashioned fish and chips, with Quay Four for a pricier but more varied option for delicious seafood, a charming view and a pub feel with live music. Belthazar for steaks, seafood and South African wine with a seafront terrace is a more elegant, higher end option for a diner, while Mugg and Bean is immensely popular for their breakfasts, comfort food, delectable cakes and oversized burgers and portions.But V and A is not just about food. it is essentially a family place with a movie complex, amphitheatre and outside seating for more casual visitors. Seasonal free music shows remain a huge attraction. This destination also extends to a romantic getaway of boat rides, a show and an intimate dinner.
Great place. Lovely place to visit. Go on the wheel and wander around the whole place. Lots of busking etc. many food outlets from cheap to expensive.

Food. If there is one thing Cape Town does right, it's it's food and the v and a has some great eateries!! You won't be disappointed and very reasonable price and all eateries have great quality ingredients.My favourite part of the waterfront, is its safety. I don't think there is anywhere else in cape town you can feel this safe.The city itself has you constantly looking over your shoulder, but not here.If you like shopping it has all your standard clothing labels, with a few designer labels upstairs.It's a great place for the family or to just sit down eat a meal and read a book Don't forget to visit the local seals

Plenty of Tourists, but plenty of fun too!. The V&A Waterfront has a massive variety of shopping, dining and entertainment options. Access is simple and plenty of parking otpions are available.Very convenient for a day out during winter school holidays if you are looking for indoor activities for the kids.

Mr. Perfect place to soak up some of the local Cape Tonian atmosphere. Sit in one of the many outdoor cafés or restaurants (or inside) & people watch the locals. Wide variety of shopping/restaurants/facilities/services

Touristy Stuff and a Large Mall like any other. The waterfront is the gateway for the Robbens Island Ferry and a lively tourist destination with a large variety of generally over-priced so-so restaurants. Views from any restaurant are beautiful. The Mall is enormous and has all the stores you'd recognize and find the world over, plus a few African craft shops and at least one lovely dress shop that specializes in beautiful clothing with an African design edge. There's also a historic walking tour available for the area which we did not do. Although Im some thng of a history buff we felt we had a rather clear understanding of the role the waterfront played over the course of Cape Towns long history by virtue of the many other town tours we did and didn't really need to know what every building used to be.
Ride the Ferris wheel!. The views are worth every penny!!! Some of my best pictures of Capetown were taken from the Ferris wheel. There are wonderful restaurants and shops at VA Waterfront.

Beautiful place for dinner and a spot of shopping. Very scenic, we went late afternoon and had dinner while the sunset. we enjoyed seeing the place in both light and in the evening. Everything is open late and I recommend having dinner at the Cape Town fish market restaurant. Good food and great service.

A breath of fresh air. The V&A Waterfront is undoubtedly one of the most picturesque attractions in Cape Town. With a wide variety of dining options, shops and activities, it is most certainly the ideal place to take the family for the day. Take a walk along the harbor while you inhale the fresh aromas of the sea and experience the different traditional cuisine at the V&A Food Market. It was most certainly a day well spent!!

All the things I love about tourist traps. It's exactly what you would expect - shopping, restaurants, a ferris wheel, outdoor entertainers, and lots of tourists. A reliable place to find food and browse, in a clean, safe environment. Very comfortable for nervous travelers, and easy to get to.
Best shopping mall in S.a. Had a great time here and its so beautiful with all the nice weather; not to forget the beautiful view of the table mountain which is so hillarious
stunning view on the ocean and table mountain + wharf. Superb waterfront with plenty of nice restaurants and great views around. Very nice for an evening walk and for a dinner.

Amazing location!. This is the second time for me to visit. It's a great hotel that provides great service and has a great location. The hotel was undergoing considerable renovations during my stay, which was fine since it's the winter off-season. This is a great place to stay when you want to enjoy being at the Waterfront.

Nothing unique here. This is a fairly standard 'tourist trap' with all the outlets that you can find in any other city in the world, Most food outlets here are considered to be of average quality at best, and with indifferent service. Time could be better spent at other attractions in Cape Town.

Must see in CP. On a nice day, there are a number of activities that can be had from the waterfront. Namely, shopping, Roben Island ferry, Aquarium, hop on/hop off bus starts and terminates here for all tours.
Great Restaurants and Shopping. V and A waterfront has great shopping and world class dining. We got happy hour lunch steaks for $8 US. Amazing prices

Lively even off season. On our first day in Cape Town we had a chilly and rainy day however we decide to walk around the V & A front. It was beautiful even in this kind of weather. This is where we found our hiking boots. Everything is available - a very wide shopping selection. Make sure to ask for a special receipt at shops, to be able to claim your VAT tax back for any shopping done over R250, once at the airport, if you're not South African. Lots of lovely cafes, food vendors and restaurants to suit any budget. We saw two different bands performing and selling their CDs outdoor, which made for a lovely atmosphere. It must be even more beautiful in summer.
Always a winner. The waterfront never dissapoints and with ample shops and great dining venues you will not be sorry. One of our firm favourites in Cape Town
Great place. Recently visited this place its an excellent place to be, great atmosphere lots to do, good restaurants, a must when in capetown
Pleasant place to stroll around. Bustling with shopping, dining , entertainment and the huge Ferris wheel, a great place to spend a few hours

a really lively commercial area with very clean surroundings in the harbor. I normally do not rate commercial centers. This is worth a non-work evening visit evn though shops close at 9 pm. Nice bars and restaurants - some interesting shops and a small amusement area.

Visit to the V and A. We spent a day at the V and A with 8 family members. As we ranged in age from 70 years down to 10 years obviously we had different interests.
The shopping and restaurants were world class as was the Cape Wheel which cost R100 each.
I would definitely recommend a visit to this area.

Have to go to the Waterfront! Something for everyone.. Whenever I am in Cape Town which is at least every 6 weeks I make at least one stop at the VnA.Out favourite sushi restaurant Willowbuys is there and there is great shopping as well.Great for chilling as well. There are many bars, coffee shops and free seating to enjoy the vibe that the Waterfront offers.A definite for any visitors to Cape Town.

A calm and serene waterfront with lot of eating options. This place is the main attraction of cape town. There are lot of eating options and entertainment options all around the waterfront.A must evening out if you are visiting cape town

Rated in Top 10 World Sites. I spent many days exploring the restaurants with foods, desserts and drinks featured from around the world, an architecturally spectacular shopping mall with many high end shops, historic museums, tours launched to Robben Island, Seal Island and Penguin Beach. Fun markets with local goods, trinkets and health services for healthier living, ships from around the world and peoples all anxious to learn where your accent comes from. My favorite hang spot for music, performances and people watching.
Such a beatiful place. I love this place. Its filled with lots to see and do here. Victoria & Alfred Waterfront is a must to go visit if ever in Cape Town.
Nice place. The waterfront is a nice place in Cape Town! It is SAFE and beautiful, a good pace to live whilst in Cape Town :) Shopping, good restaurants, safety, nice hotels, markets etc
Great place to visit ; especially after dark.. Great atmosphere , good places to eat & drink & if you like shopping then even better. Good place to stay.

A definate MUST!!!!. The V&À Waterfront is certainly a MUST visit for everyone, young and old. Lots of shops, eating places, and lots of other interesting places etc. One could spend an entire day there without becoming bored.

Amazing place - love it!!. LOVE IT!!! LOVE IT!!! LOVE IT!!! Safe to walk around by yourself. Easy to reach by red bus. Stunning view. Great vibe!!! Nice bars and restaurants. Big shopping mall. Go for Cape Town Wheel. It costs only 100R. From time to time it feels like Amsterdam. 💛💙
lovely marina. restaurants and environment really lovely. it's modern. nothing authentic there. as said just lovely.
Nice to see. Lots of shopping variety and restaurant choice but it is expensive. The harbour is just beautiful. We had a great day with family

Great experience. The V&A Waterfront is a must see when you visit Cape Town. There is a taste of Africa mixed with water activities along with cosmopolitan stores and restaurants. My sad observation was that there are more international stores now than South African stores so the local market is being edged out. Who needs Hamleys or H&M? Doesn't South Africa have it's own brands that we should be displaying proudly?Skip the Haagen Dazs shop and rather go to San Marco for awesome and VERY well priced gelato.The V&A Waterfront is always a great family day out.
Excellent attraction . This is a must if you are in Cape Town. Hundreds of shops, restaurants, bars, entertainments. Most of the wordwide brands have outlets here. Even McLaren & Aston Martin!

good food. the only place we had our dinner for continuesly 3 days, lots of choice for food,try greek fisherman( nice seafood)tried the local food with various of meat the other day which also nice ;)they have champagne (sa style but abit spicy for me )
Vibrant. Brilliant area with some fantastic bars and restaurants and a great market for food and goods. Felt really safe, had a great atmosphere and looked better by night, all lit up.

Pier with lots of shops, restaurants and live shows.. Definitely fun to go to. I believe locals know that it is visited by tourists but they too like it for its vibrancy. Many places to eat including a hot dog stand (try Peri-Peri sauce if you like spice) and seafood restaurants. There are few live shows including rope skipping, dancing to music and soccer tricks. Many local hotels have shuttles to this location. Lot of security around and do not hesitate to ask them for help, they are very helpful.
Coffee & shopping. Great coffee, interesting shops (bought a few local items to take home), great walk around to sightsee - loved the statuary and harbour activity. Great to photograph.

Good place to spend evenings. We were in cape town for 4 nights and spent most evenings at the water front. It is a good place to shop with a lot of eating options. There is a giant Ferris wheel and evening cruises which are good. The place is extremely safe to walk around and for going back you can get taxis from the mall which are safe. All in all great place to spend time.

Worth visiting but one of the more touristy areas. Our hotel was relatively close to the waterfront so we visited. It is worth walking through and has quite a security presence for tourists but it wasn't what I would call really visiting the heart of Cape Town.

Lovely and Picturesque . The V&A waterfront is a great place to visit. I love going to the red and blue barn. However, I have seen the prices skyrocket over the years. The restaurants are pretty cool and diverse. But my favorite food is seafood, so I am blessed to get the some of the best seafood in the world at the Waterfront! The ferris wheel is absolutely beautiful at night all lit up! It is worth a trip or two or three while you are in Capetown to go down to the waterfront!

Shop till you drop. Whatever you want you'll find it here, shop till you drop, from souvenirshops till exclusive fashion.Tip: go to exclusive bookstores for roadmaps and detailed travel guiges for SA and Namibia, also good selection of African cookbooks
Something for everyone. Shopping, restaurants, bars and the Mandela museum.....day or night his is a good place to visit. Many restaurants with different cuisines to choose from
Fantastic!. We were blown away by this mall and waterfront. The view of Table Mountain not withstanding this was fun,stylish, great value for money and had everything.
Nice day out . Plenty to do, plenty to see and located in a truly beautiful part of the city. Citysiteseeing cruise for forty bucks will give you a lekker tour of the harbour

Plenty to do for everyone. Something for everyone here - shops, food, entertainment and beautiful mountain views. The mall has all the usual international brands as well as some local ones. There is a wide selection of fast food to fine dining options, and some amazing coffee outlets. There is a cinema and it is also next to the Aquarium and Scratch Patch. There is a great food hall nearby with a wide selection of artisan foods etc - TRUTH coffee!. Also next to the Watershed, which is home to many local artists and some beautiful local items, as well as a Wellness Centre for massages etc.

Something for everyone in a gorgeous historical port setting. Cape Town did a very smart thing in turning its long-established port into a waterfront destination for locals and tourists alike. The buildings and functioning port remind you of its purpose, while the bevy of good restaurants, shops (including a large mall and smaller boutiques) and attractions provide much else to do and enjoy. I liked staying right in the heart at the Victoria & Albert Hotel and particularly enjoyed the Watershed, home to smaller vendors of crafts, clothes, jewellery and housewares.

One of Cape Town's absolute must visits.. When visiting Cape Town there are a few things one has to simply do, going up Table Mountain certainly being one, having sundowners at one of the many roadside venues in Campsbay being another, but an absolute "must visit" is most certainly the V&A Waterfront.Lots to see and do for big and small, be it sightseeing, eating, having a drink, going for a boat trip around the harbour, shopping or just people watching.Well worth at least half a day in your travel agenda and that is if you don't also visit the world-class aquarium or take a trip across to Robben Island, as that requires spending a whole day in and around the Water Front and believe you me, it's well worth it.

All things to most people..... What a wonderful place to spend a morning, rainy day, afternoon or evening. The vibe changes and adapts to the time of day and seasons. There is a beautiful new craft and art market, restaurants galore, indoor and outdoor dining, including downstairs with direct views on the docks, trinket and curio shops right up to the high end couturier designer shops. A beautiful place where you are bound to find beautiful treasures, see beautiful people and eat beautiful food while gazing onto the beautiful waterfront. A MUST in Cape Town.

TOURIST DELIGHT. If your in CT and need a pop of tourist delight this is the place for you.A wonderful mix of places to eat, buy your gifts, relax, sightsee, enjoy the mood of CT. You can go wrong.Some worry about safety, well dont, just as any traveller in another large city you should always be aware, its as simple as that.You will be here for hours and hours, its a delight.

Not impressed . Most hotels seem to get you there by shuttle. So if you tired it makes for an easy way to get to food. But Americans it looks like a mall it is a mall. Food is more expensive then anywhere else in the cape area from what we are hearing. Maybe if you have kids this would be a good stop at night.
Vibrant. Lively place to be at all times of the day and night. Plenty of places to eat and drink and the people watching is superb. Access to many other attractions and shops
lively. I would recommend getting a hotel here as it is a safe place, guarded and lots to do in the evening. There are street performers, many bars, restaurants... and many shops to go shopping.

Bustling!. Supposedly a touristy place but you could find lots of locals as well in the malls and restaurants. Always busy especially in the evenings when the restaurants are overflowing. You could find enough of them to suit your budget and your palette. Children would find it interesting to watch the ships & boats and the occasional seals in the water.

Tourist trap, but not in a bad way. You have such a huge variety of activities here, you will almost not realise that it was designed to serve the tourist market. So, everyone can find something to enjoy here.

A beautiful place and a must in Cape Town. For some action in Cape Town, a must place for tourists. With plenty of shopping, restaurants and walk along the waterfront are truly beautiful. The dance, the music and the Cape Wheel add further charachter to the place.
A must- do shopping experience. The Waterfront complex is a wonderful place to do shopping, dine out , watch a movie or just people-watch.
Love this place. Some say it is touristy and manufactured but honestly this place feels authentic and honest. It is simply beautiful so just go. You can easily spend a whole day wandering the shops.

Ship Ahoy. The V & A Waterfront is another Tourist attraction but also quite popular with the locals of Cape Town. Get to sail for an hour or so on the many boats, lots of shopping and plenty of places toeat. The two Hotels - The Cape Grace & the Table Bay Hotel both offer first class accommodation but are by no means cheap.
Shoppers dream. If you have a deep wallet and lots of time, this is your place. Always great just to walk around and do sight seeing - even for the Cape Town folks.

Commercial but fun. Yes, this is mainly a restaurant and shopping location but I spent a good day taking photos of Table Mountain, the boats and other scenery here. Some of the shops are pretty unusual so there is something for locals and visitors.

Always a fun place, for family, friends or the impressive date.. i always enjoy coming here, whether it be with my family, just to hang out with friends or on a date with my husband. this place has something for everyone.

Family and friends. A day out with family and friends. The kids enjoyed their ride on the hamleys train. Enjoyed the experience in their shop as well. The markets are interesting. Lots to do for everyone.

Vibey Experience. Such a bustling centre, always something new and exciting to see there, has such a good vibe, so many lovely shops and the restaurants are so varied, there is something for everyone there.

A must when in Capetown . It's great to contrast Capetown central with V & A Waterfront.
We did the tour of the harbour which gave a good commentary. A lovely market, restaurants and shops.
Lively.

Nice place with plenty of things to do . The waterfront is very large place to visit with many things to do . There is an arts & crafts section - which items are quite expensive when compared to places downtown. The shopping centre is ver big and good range of shops for all ages . The Ferris wheel was a good experience as you get a great view from the top of the area around you . Great restaurants to eat - a must place to visit when in Cape Town
Good experience . Good security and s number of acts with artists and bands. International and local shops. Excellent restaurants and hotels.

Starting point - for tours, for shopping, for dinner. We had an Air Bnb that was walking distance to the Waterfront. Whenever we were in doubt on what to do - the answer almost always was to start at the V&A Waterfront. It is a great place to catch the Hop-on/Hop-off bus, to do some souvenir shopping, or to grab a bite to eat. Spent a little time selecting the best place to eat based on your requirements - for us that most often involved a good view of the water and on occasion some great music from the local performers.

Rands or Dollars?. A bit of a tourist trap....so it's very suitable for overseas travelers.....SAFFA's might find this environment a bit too touristy and even plastic....a must see for all..but seldom an annual repeat visit for locals I suspect~ NOT the Mother Cities finest moment in my books..so much more to offer...

TRENDY PART OF CAPE TOWN. V&A waterfront is the trendy part of Cape Town , offering ample choices to shop, dine and merriment. It has activities for kids too, like the Aquarium, Ferris-Wheel and Hamley's toy Train. Plenty of Curio shops too.

A ton of options with great people watching!. We didn't really seek out the Waterfront as a destination but were nicely surprised when we went there to pick up some last-minute souvenirs. There are lots of great food options, the views are spectacular (ok, where aren't they in Cape Town?), and it feels very safe and comfortable. We wanted to check out a bookstore and purchase some local music and easily found both at the mall there. We were also glad to see that locals seem to frequent the Waterfront in addition to us tourists! While I'm glad we stayed in a residential neighborhood, I can see why people enjoy staying there as it's probably one of the only places in Cape Town where you can feel comfortable walking around after dark.
An entertaining place.. Good and safe parking, lots of shops and a busy place to visit. Also you can arrange a trip to Robben island.

Good for shops, eats and chilling. An abundance of shops, good restaurants and the aquarium. The waterfront always seems busy, with ships coming and going. Also gives you access to the boats to Robben Island
Best location . Great service . Would highly recommend this as the perfect location on the waterfront . Will get 5 stars when the renovations are finished .

Cape Town V & A Waterfront is awesome full of entertainment and fun.. The excitement in Cape Town starts with the most popular shopping mall in V & A Waterfront where you get to see all sorts of popular clothing shops stocked with all sorts of popular local and international name brands, restaurants are plenty fast food and formal restaurants with set menu. The next excitement will be the yacht area where you can see all sorts of fancy yacht and boats. The next excitement is the ferry boat to the Robin Ireland to visit Dr Nelson Mandela's cell where he was detained for 27 years.

Great Place to walk around. Great place to people watch, take in the sights from the restaurants, boats and nearby mall. Take your sneakers if you venture in...It will take you a long time to hit each shop
perfect. I was able to shop, eat, do my photography, people watch, and take a ferry to robbed island. It was perfect. No complaints. Great for a leisure family/couple day. Something for everybody.
PACKED!. Not as exciting as I hoped but good place to buy Springbok shirts.Wall to wall people. Make a reservation in advance!

Beautiful area. Lovely architecture and marine scenery. Look at the boats, have a drink or a meal (all prices catered for) or simply enjoy an ice cream or coffee in the sun. Plenty of boutiques for the shoppers.

Ideally located Shopping Mall. The location of the V&A is pretty good. One can spend a good amount of time hanging out outside of the Mall. The place is basically a shopping mall with shops of all the major brands and overpriced items.
So do not waste your time if you are a traveler. There is nothing to see. Only shopping.

Wonderful place. Our hotel was a few blocks away. We enjoyed dinner there twice and lunch two days. We really liked the vibe and the shops. Great mall. We used the Pic and Pay in the lower level....great supermarket for wine and snacks. This is also where the ferry to Robben Island is. Lots of fun, great people watching and night life.
V & A so vibrant. V & A is so vibrant and entertaining. Bands playing, singing artists, etc. Lovely restaurants and shops, there is something for everyone. Love Cape Town what a great City.

Good location but just another shopping mall. Sited on the waterfront at Cape Town the V&A provides a mixture of shops & restaurants.As a mall it has the usual range of up market and mid range shops. An attraction within Cape Town but replicated over the world.A great rainy day activity but if its sunny - get out & see Cape Town.Some very good restaurants.

Historical Walking Tour. The highlight of this wonderful area was the walking tour we did with Matthew from the Chavonnes Battery Museum (11am and 2pm). Great knowledge and insight to bring history to present day. We'll worth it.

Always buzzing. Love the Waterfront, shops, street singers and players give a real feel and enrich the atmosphere. All restaurants serve good affordable food. Quite a bit of regeneration going on at the moment but we didn't find it detracted from the overall experience. Except for us our favourite restaurant was being refurbished. Hope its open next time we visit. Great view of Table Mountain.

Beautiful Waterfront . A must see place on your Cape Town sojourn . Has a good mall attached to the waterfront which attracts crowds in larger nos. The key are the restaurants and pubs/bars . Food ranges from Afrikan cuisine to sea food to continental cuisine to bar food ... Great place to visit
Lively, Delicious food & great fun. Lively, delicious food & great fun. This is the place to stay and eat in Cape Town if you want to fully experience all this amazing city can offer.
Romantic paisage. Beautiful and unforgettable place, very romantic, peaceful and quiet. Safe for walks, and near most places.

Must visit. The first place of call after we reached CPT. We entered from the Tower clock side. There are multiple entry points to this beautiful place. From this side, the Robben Island deck is nearby as well as few restaurants. On crossing the bridge, you come to the busy area. There are multiple areas where one can relax, eat, drink and indulge in different activities. In Dec, the place was crowded and buzzing. It was lively. Visited the waterfront again in April when it wasn't as crowded. However, my preference would be to visit in December when it is summer as April was quite cold.
A must. Great place for food, drinks and a general wander. You get the boat from here to Robben Island. Really great views of Table Mountain.

Dining and shopping place. Nice walk for a 10 - 15 minutes. Nice old buildings around. It is perfect for one dinner if you want to see and experience the mood of Cape Town. We had nice dinner in one of the restaurants. See it once and that's it. Shopping is very similar to any european shopping center, so nothing special - just a big shopping mall.
Waterfront is the place for all. It's a beautiful place to spend a day.. A lot of options to eat, sit, shop or just linger around.. Kids bands play excellent rock some days..

Always a pleasure. Had not visited the V&A for over two years, so was pleasantly surprised to see the upgrades and additions that have taken place. Firstly, shopping, there are loads of shops from luxury boutiques to toy shops. Great to see Hamley's have opened up as well. Some lovely quirky stores, bespoke chocolate stores, and your souvenir stores. Eating places galore, from franchises to fine dining available and all tastes covered. A decent food court is also available.An array from boat tours, helicopter tours, shark tours, Robben Island tours are all available from the quays in front of the V&A. The Pirate Cruise looked like great fun. There were also 'speed boat' tours available that should provide an adrenalin rush.The 'Big Wheel' was constantly busy, and I am sure there would be a decent view from the top of the wheel.We parked in the under cover garage opposite the waterfront and it cost R10 for two hours.Always worth a visit when in Cape Town and a must for foreign visitors.
Opulent .. must return sooner, rather than later. outrageously modern and restaurants to die for.. special recommendation ... der akter belgium restaurant at southern end over water.
Just another shopping centre. I am not one for shopping centres. This is just another one in addition to being a tourist trap. Only went there with family. Not my idea of fun.

A world class attraction in Cape Town. This world class attraction ranks among "the best of the best". So much to see and do. Restaurants, pubs, shopping of note, markets, museums and more. Part of Cape Towns nautical history. There are helicopter and boat rides to do. The list seems almost endless. Close to the city. Lost of parking and security. Considered a safe place. A must, must do when visiting the Cape.
V and A. Its lovely, nothing spectacular except the views. Place to visit on a rainy day. Same old stores as every other mall

Most happening place. This is the most happening place in the while of South Africa. Nobody can do a trip of SA and not visit this place. Right from shopping , eating , entertainment to yatch and helicopter ride, there's everything here. All our evenings in Cape town, we spent here. You have lot of choices for eating also. Whatever you do the whole day make sure to spend your e evening here.
Very festive place to be. It's impossible to ge tbored on the CT waterfront. The V&A has bars, restaurants, shopping and various busker groups playing bongo drums and penny whistlers.

So much to see and do. Victoria & Alfred Waterfront is loaded with tons of restaurants and shops and things to see. You need 1/2 day to walk around and browse and take in the scenery. Be sure to research where to eat so you'll have a good meal. The shops have everything and anything you're looking for. We had a great afternoon here on our free day with Tauck Tours. Make time to come here and enjoy what they have to offer. It will be well worth it!

Great shopping . This place is ideal for a bit of retail therapy. Medium to High end stores and many souvenir shops. Loads of things to do around, very good restaurants and bars. The aquarium is also a short walk away. If you are visiting the currency exchange store walk with your passport and drivers license. If you work for airline, walk with passport and airline id.

Must see in cape town . definitely one of the more touristy areas but that doesn't mean it's not a great time! there's many shops and cute restaurants on the water and the area offers great views of table mountain. I also felt extremely safe here
A great place!. This is a great area to walk around during the day or at night. Lovely shops and stalls, a great market and a great choice of restaurants.

Upbeat and Upscale. The V & A Waterfront has so many different things to offer. Restaurants, shops, high end merchandise, beautiful sights, and even a Ferris wheel!! There are a variety of restaurants and places to eat scattered around as well as some grad and go all under one roof. We loved the shopping in the mall and all the handicrafts in the market. Nice way to spend a few hours and hang out with the locals!!!
Still good. Bursting at the seams, but still very good. Loved loved the Quay Four restaurant, good food, lovely view, good atmosphere

Great Place, South Africa Rocks. I was invited to south africa for a scientific event. But turism in Cape town was amazing. The waterfront, is a bulevard like mall, with a lot of restaurants, pubs and shopping places. But the amazing here is the view, I mean, you´re in front of the ocean with table mountain on your back, all in one place while you´re drinking a beer or a cocktail. I totally recommend this place.

Fun!. It was nice to walk around day or night. Lunches and dinners were good. Ferris Wheel ride was fun and the view from the top was nice! You could find everything you need at the mall there and lots of souvenirs in the shops.

a jaunty bubbly place that has something for everyone. its a beautiful mix of history commerce and beautiful views. The first thing that struck me were two huge ships that were being painted in a dry dock and opposite to it was a office block and across as square was the restaurant "capetown fish market. The jumble was delectable. You could go around quays and dock fronts with touristy umbrellas housing various waterborne tour companies promising to take you out into the harbour for every conceivable reason. On one end there was a food market selling gourmet food items and a market selling handicrafts and other collectables. It has a capeunion mart store bang in the middle and restaurants circling the area. Simply a place to spend your day in a jolly mood.
Enjoy the waterfront. Great place to shop and check out the sights. Lots of restaurants and places to eat. Lots of parking...pay by how long you stay. Fun way to enjoy day and get souvenirs etc.

A SPECIAL VIBE WHEN VISITING CAPE TOWN. The Victoria & Alfred Waterfront is a great place to visit. There are numerous restaurants and interesting shops to visit. The Waterfront has the Big Wheel which is an amazing experience. The Bay Hotel is absolutely fantastic and going there for tea or coffee is such a treat. The service is incredible and the hotel beautiful.
Great to while away time. With many attractions, sights and shops, great to walk around and spend a weekend afternoon. Later the time, the less crowded, but shops open quite late.
The food is incredible. Aside from fantastic food at affordable prices, there is a huge shopping mall and a great comedy club, which was probably our highlight of the urban cape town experience.

a westernized place with good view. v&a is like any of a typical tourist attraction in any of a western country. It's has a huge mall in which you can find everything that you're used to buy in a mall at home. It also has a great food market. The cape wheel worths a ride.
Beautiful. The harbor is a great view. There are different stores and good site seeing, like the Aquarium. It is actually where the gateway to Roben Island is situated.

Family friendly. The V&A waterfront is very touristy however it should not be sold short. The area is filled with great restaurants and shops you can get lost in for hours. There is street entertainment around every corner. The area is very well lit and safe to bring young children.

Modern and delightful shopping mall. A modern and delightful shopping Mall with gift shops, clothing shops and restaurants, A couple of Pharmacies for the respiratory bug you picked up on a plane. All staff I spoke with were helpful and friendly. A wide variety of food from fast to silver service food. A really beautiful site around waterways with old ship and other historical sites nearby.
Nice quiet place to walk.. Even though there was a Terror Alert during our stay, there was no fear in us or anyone else who we met. Safe, Clean, Things to see, Places to eat, People to meat.

loved the waterfront. beautifully crafted waterfront/marina ,can see many luxurious yachts parked , also the V&A mall on the waterfront is a great shopping destination.The place is well guarded, parking is available in the mall and then one can walk around the waterfront. Loads of restaurants, fun activities, must visit for sure.

Fun shopping and eating. Lots of places to eat, people watch and shop. Don't be put off by the "typical mall" look of the Victoria Wharf, there are shops inside that feature African goods. There are also many small shops throughout the waterfront area. There are many restaurants but don't miss the Food Market near the entry.

Waterfront and Mall Area for shopping. We visited the Waterfront after visiting Table Mountain and was late evening. the Mall was loaded and was a big property and surely is a nice place to shop for brand concious people. We didnot do much here as it was our first day.
Shop till you drop. We visited the V & A with a group of friends and had a wonderful shopping experience. Great selection of shops and restaurants.

Restaurants, shops, people watching!. Of course this area is touristy but that's part of the fun. There are loads of restaurants to choose from, lots of good shopping, and best of all, plenty of opportunity to watch the goings on.

A place of many attractions. V&A as it is know to locals has a huge amount of hidden gems. Stroll across to the Clocktower and take in some great views of the harbour entrance. Get a close up look at the seals as they relax in their own free access enclosure by the Ferry Terminal. Seek out the "Walk" that you can take through the V&A properties, it is well marked and you get to see all the harbour has to offer. The museums/Art gallery also on the Clocktower side are brand new and very interesting especially the History of Golf Museum above CTFM It really is much more than just a shopping centre. For those who want a good value meal stop in at Tribakery next to the Robbin Island Ferry Terminal, they also serve a fantastic strong local craft beer available nowhere else called Jwarha, try it. The only slight negative is the Robbin Island Ferry, it is not well run and the tour and the island are great but the ferry is not reliable and we were let down twice.

Not just a tourist attraction. A visit to the Victoria & Alfred Waterfront is a must for every traveller to Cape Town. But one has not go into the shopping mall. There you find everything what you would find in other shopping malls. Look at the old buildings around you, enjoy a good meal with a view to the Table Mountain.

V & A Waterfront. Love going to the V & A, even as a local.It has everything one needs plus a great location - next to harbour and a beautiful view of the mountain.Dining inside or out is always great.Love just to wander around and look at all the different people. Free entertainment!!

Great place for shopping, entertainment, good food and of course coffee shops.... The V&A Waterfront Cape Town is a great place for the whole family, shopping options are excellent, great food and coffee stops as well as entertainment.

Shopping/eating/history/waterfront/scenic. A lovely place to hang around all day. There's lots to see and do. Its like one size fits all kind of a place. Its got something for everyone's taste. From shopping to eating to sightseeing. A must see for everyone. Good choice of food at the food market, an aquarium to bring back the child in you. Hop on hop off bus tour centre to get a glimpse of the city. Ferry to Robben Island starts from the waterfront, a good view of the city's iconic table mountain and water front in one single frame. You got to visit to experience and enjoy what this place has to offer.
Superb restaurants and shopping. Ate Greek,Portuguese, superb sea food,and a super Ostrich steak at City Grill. lots of shops in the malls and a great atmosphere.

Big Modern Mall. Huge modern Mall with hundreds of shops and lot's of Restaurant's. Little expensive for South African's so you mainly find Tourists and wealthy locals. Unlimited shopping choices and delicious dining spots.

Best Harbour Waterfront development in the World!. I've been to the so-called "famous" San Francisco Waterfront area, which, compared to the V&A Waterfront in Cape Town, is mediocre and by far shortcoming. The V&A Waterdfront in Cape Town is unique and by far the best anywhere in the world. It is also by far more compact, user friendly and awesome than the one in
Sydney, Australia.

V&A Waterfront Cape Town. It's a beautiful Mall the Waterfront to have nice day off the book inside outside of the Waterfront you can let the children play see the ocean and watch the attraction after that if you want to see him a guy you can go on top second floor and watch your favorite movie when you're finished and you're hungry you got the ocean basket you got KFC you got the best burgers that you can eat is in Woody's Burgers in the food chain outside of the Waterfront you can also have a nice Cruise in the ocean or you can have her bicycle and just go around the waterfront I love it and even in the sunset you can go on the wheel and watch the sunsets in the ocean behind the mountains with your family

Interesting place to spend an afternoon. You can wonder around taking in the sites, listening to live performances, shop, eat, or just people-watch. Tours leave from the waterfront as well, including the hop on, hop off bus. There are many good restaurants and coffee shops for lunch, dinner or an afternoon snack. We enjoyed shopping in the Watershed which included some vendors with local products. It can get chilly in the winter so bring along a warm jacket.

Interesting. This is a special attraction of Cape Town. No visitor to this beautifull city should miss it. The shops are all rather interesting and the restaurants caters for a wide variety of tastes. There is a lot to see and enjoy and it is certainly a part of Cape Town of which the Capetonians can be proud of. The cleanliness of the complex is impressive.Perhaps not a place for bargain hunters. Certainly a "must see" when in Cape Town

Must visit the waterfront. Lots of shopping and restaurants. Ate at quay 4, Greek salad is fantastic and can't go wrong with the fish and chips. Very generous potions. The Cape wheel is great during the day. Can get really good pics of the harbor area.

LOTS OF SHOPS,BARS AND RESTAURANTS. Very touristy I must say but it gives you a good impression of Cape Town's vibrancy. There are plenty of restaurants with a view of the harbor and Table Mountain to choose from. There curio shops where you can buy high end local art crafts too. A good place to get lost in and while away the time.

Great place for food. Was staying near the Waterfront and had opportunity to explore the place. The area is vibrant with lots of restaurants and shops. Try the food market if you are looking for a more casual eating environment. There is a supermarket and the basement of the shopping mall which sells tons of interesting stuff. Do check it out too!

So much to do! . Plenty to keep you busy and coming back many times. We love shopping at the mall and in the Water Shed. The food market is great - get the samoosas! Great lunch and dinner options. We like Den Anker a lot! You can even take a fun boat cruise or just hang out and listen to live music!

Fantastic area with plenty to do. Loved this area, it has something for all.From a shopping centre for local crafts to high street shopping centre.Bars, cafes, restaurants, live music, boat trips, helicopter tours and much more.Spent lots of time here. It seems to be the main tourist hub and is not to be missed

Lot's of Choices and More!!. Whether it's shopping, dinning, hitting the Aquarium, talking off to Robben Island, and so much more, it's all at the V&A Waterfront.The Ferris Wheel during the day or night is fun to do, and there is a play are for the kids that can keep them busy.Absolutely spend time there, as it has so much to see and do and buy, and eat and drink. Lot's of choices and more!!!
Great shops. Lots of shopping and restaurants. It is vast so be ready to walk as there is a mall within this waterfront but if it's something "local" you looking for stay on the outskirts.
nice. great restaurants and bars, nice and buzzy and felt safe, would recommend to stay around here, lovely views of waterfront from restaurants

This is truly a feast for the senses!. If ever you needed a choice of hundreds of different but delicious meals - this is the place! The variety of cuisine, price and experience is vast. From simple take-away to 5 star+ dinning - all in this beautiful setting with the majestic Table Mountain in the background and the hum of a multicultural nation in the foreground. It does not get much better than this!

a great day out. There is really something for everyone here: an excellent range of shopping, restaurants, bars, a craft market, a food market, exhibitions and a bit of history, all in a safe and animated environment. A gentle first day in Cape Town after a long flight - a great way to relax into the atmosphere.

Great Place to Eat and Shop. First time to Cape Town. Visited the V&A waterfront to eat at Willoghby's and take tour of Robben Island. Many stores and restaurants. Very clean and enjoyable to walk around and people watch.
waterfront. I heve been there several thimes,I just suggest to everybody to go thereGood restaurants,goob sigthweiw

One stop solution to everything . The place is centrally located with adequate parking available... It has everything one can desire or need... The mall is huge with loads of fun activities going on.. Quiet decent restaurants.. And amazing view of the bay.. Must visit once you are in Cape Town
The waterfront. I must say the best mall I've being to . Beautiful location . All your the shops and restaurants you need . A must see in Cape Town . Don't miss this

Half day visit on the day off . Took the hotel free ride to V&A Waterfront and spent 6hrs there windows shopping. Not a great day for sightseeing as it was cloudy and drizzling, can't see table mountain at all. Lots of shops, restaurants and interesting things to see at water shed. 2 oceans aquarium is also a place not to be missed.
Very civilized shopping and eating. The malls have all the usual US stores plus local crafts at a high level. The restaurant choices vary from sushi to wonderful local seafood of all kinds.

Lovely area. We enjoyed exploring the Waterfront area. I've never been to S.F. but this is what I would imagine it would be like. Lots of shops and dining. A brochure map of the area would have been really handy for all the shops and dining places.

TOURISTY..Fun and lively. Last February i visited cape town with mu husband. it was recommended to us that we stay close to the V&A waterfront area. thankfully we did that! While in cape town, we usually took day trips which ended about 5 in the evening. so we would have evenings to ourselves. cape town is not a place where you can roam hassle free in all areas at any time. we were advised to stick to the V&A area in the evenings. this is quite a happening place. always full of people (in a nice way). its lively, has many restaurants (serving all cuisines - even indian!). they also have a plethora of shops. the waterfront area has a different feel during the days and a completely different one at nights. as per indian standards, the shops shut early, but the restaurants are open till about 11. Anyone visiting cape town - do stay in this area (ensure it is within walking distance. cabs are slightly expensive in cape town)
Great place. Fabulous markets lots of great paintings jewellery,restaurants ,big shopping mall.Helicopter rides walking distance in the area to the Cape.

Interesting place to visit. Plenty restaurants ,take aways, and loads of shops .Everything one needs is under one roof. If you like crowded areas then you will enjoy the V and A waterfront. The area is incredible indeed with something for everyone. Its a great place to walk around. The place is full of activities. Don't miss out the waterfront of yoi visit Cape Town.

Tourist heaven. One could hardly miss the V&A on a trip to Cape Town, it is rather pretty and all but totally aimed at the foreigner... Locals are not in the habit of buying couture clothing and the likes. You may as well make a visit as this is where you would get the boat to Robben Island and that one is not negotiable :-)

Various bars and restaurants. this is a buzzing place like London,New York,Japan etc. a lot of shoppings, restaurants, bars etc.We came here with teens and they looked enjoy the crowded place. The restaurants were nice.
Everything in one place. Anything you want you can find here. Awesome restaurants, beautiful shopping center, easily accessible.

Mmm.... This was the first place we visited in Cape Town. It's much like my other reclaimed waterfront area in many cities. You probably need to go and look around but it is huge. A couple of great shopping malls within the whole area.

Touristy but still worth visiting. We kind of felt like we were in San Francisco warm here....but while in Cape Town it makes sense to visit. The Shed provided some nice crafts to take home as gifts for ourselves and family. Lots of restaurants, and a very large newer shopping mall if you are looking for this

Lovely shopping/eating. Lovely place to visit, really well presented. Loads of bars, restaurants and shops to visit. Great view of Table Mountain. Must visit the local food market hall, great selection of things to taste and try.
Unique shopping experinece. Cinema, shopping, food and entertainment. All put together is V&A Waterfront. You want you get the best brands. Fine Dinning. A day is not enough.....

V&A Waterfront. Love this place has such an international vibe...there's various things to see and do here other than being an upscale mall.it has stunning g restaurants overlooking the iconic table mountain.defjnate must visit if u are in Cape Town.

Wonderful place to explore. We spent the day wondering around the V&A Waterfront. There are markets that sell boutique goods from clothes to art, jewellery and everything in between. There is the Robben Island Jetty Museum, the shopping centre, the Clock Tower, Diamond museum (cover charge), Rugby musuem, Gold musuem, Maritime musuem and much more.
Basically a big mall. Basically a big mall on the waterfront, its safe and has a variety of bars and fast food along with a ferris wheel and markets for souvenirs.

Great place to hangout and spend a day! Typical waterfront place. We spent a day going to the V & A and it was good. The food markets were awesome and shops were typical tourist stuff. Lots of buskers that play traditional music and overall you felt very safe being there.

OK venue, but great restaurants. The Waterfront in and of itself is tourist and kind of lame. The big ferris wheel does not give very good views of the city. The mall is overpriced- I can find stuff cheaper in the states. However, this is a good collection of restaurants. We ate at Balducci's and at Harbor House, and both were excellent. Still, there were lots of tourists around and it didnt feel really authentic.

Beautiful Combination of Food, Shopping and Site Seeing. We spent a couple of hours here just browsing through shops and when my husband got tired of shopping with me, he had a place to seat and relax while watching the world go by (on the water). Perfect venue for everyone.They have a wonderful selection of food and drinks. You can simply stop for an ice cream or seat and have a delightful dinner. Because we were going out to dinner we just had drinks. It was a lovely and relaxing visit.
Experience . My husband and I went on a quick boat ride. R50p/p for 30minutes. We really enjoyed the boat ride. The V&A is pricey (food and drinks) but the view makes it all worth it.

Historical point with a view and location. This is harbor point but well maintained for view as well as partying with shopping. Wonderful place to spend day and evening. Lots of bars and shops to eat and have fun with view of ships. You can also take ferry or jetty ride

Smart shops, oodles of eateries and other interesting nooks and crannies. A place to go and wander around, people watching and window shopping.Main mall has all the top range shops (too rich for my blood, even at South African prices) - hint, first place we came across was a McLaren showroom. But there are lots of other shops to wander around for those of us with shallow pockets.
