Similar story for the food outlets, from top class restaurants, to fast food and takeaways.Would be a good place to go on a poor weather day.

Great late night shopping. I was in Cape Town for two months for work and loved the fact I could wander around safely after hours and shop and get dinner and my nails done! (Until 9pm) Convenient parking also for supermarkets and a huge range of dining options. The market place which closes a bit earlier (7pm) had great dinner snacks which were very diverse! Always busy and bustling but never seemed over crowded

You could spend DAYS here and not see it all.. The mall here is huge and easy to get lost in, and the restaurants are everywhere. Tons of people and great night life. We spent a good bit of time in this area and found it to be fun and very safe, Highly recommended for folks with families too.
Awesome place to go to. Any one who visits cape town and misses this place will regret it. The place has everything and is very beautiful as well.

Some interesting points. If you like crowds and his sell then you will enjoy the waterfront. Nothing particularly special but there is a good market with some nice choices of authentic cuisine and craft beer. Lots of tourist shops etc. if you have spare time worth a look see .

lovely way to soend an afternoon. The day we visited here was a lovely, fresh, sunny winters day. Lots to see as you leisurely walk around. Loads of shops, and entertainment. Dont forget your camera!!

something for everyone. This area at the waterfront is incredible. So many restaurants and shops, plus a huge shopping center connected. You can rent a boat at the docks or shop for authentic African wares. Impromptu music happens all the time and makes for a fun atmosphere. There is even a ferris wheel in the center of this area.

The place to be!. Great to wander around - lovely bars and restaurants packed into a fully working wharf. Also brilliant views of Table Mountain.The only thing we did not like was the shopping centre - it could have been anywhere in the world i.e. the Trafford Centre - but we are sure that many others will love the shops!
Cool atmosphere...great place to walk around. The V and A Waterfront is a great place to walk around to get the vibe of Cape Town. Lots of energy, shops, food, and sights

Vibrant and bustling Waterfront. I loved spending time here. It's a working harbour but has been beautifully re-developed, with a vast array of dining options ranging from food market to upmarket restaurants. If you like shopping there is a large mall and there are several craft stalls selling jewellery and carved wood souvenirs.You can catch the Hop on Hop off sightseeing buses here as well as cruises and the ferry to Robben Island.Or you can just wander around enjoying the lively views with a backdrop of Table Mountain and sit and people-watch. I came here both during the day and evening and, although I took the usual precautions, I always felt safe.
Guter Ausgangspunkt. Du hast alles dort: shopping, restaurant, blick aufs meer und den tafelberg. Hot spot in cape town. We love to have dinner at the front.

v & a waterfront best shopping,dinning & full of activies..... v & a waterfront best shopping,dinning & full of activies.... could spend your whole day in shopping,eating & doing multiple activities.must visit as its different from other waterfront in the world.

Entertaining & very engaging. Probably the most engaging and fun place in Cape Town, V & A Waterfront has a number of things to do, places to eat, stores to shop at - some things for everyone..
You can also go there repeatedly and not get tires or bored. It's great energy and lovely people coming there

Superb place to hang out. A vibrant place signifying the heart of cape town- a place for all ages and seasons - certainly manmade and probably pales in comparison to the natural beauty of the city but a refreshing place to hang out in the evenings after the attractions have closed.

Great Restaurants and Mall shopping . The waterfront is unique to walk around and see people but a lot of it is standard western mall and a few tourist shops. Restaurants are pretty top notch in the area with a wide variety to choose from. I had to get some clothes after my bag was delayed and this was a one stop shopping mall for that.

Great shopping and cosmopolitan vibe. If you're a keen shopper head straight to the Waterfront. There are great craft markets and up-and-coming South African fashion designers in the Watershed (near the V&A Food Market), and established and upmarket brands in the Victoria Wharf Shopping Centre. The food offerings are a mixed bag - some great little cafés and restaurants are around, however a number of places at the Waterfront are quite touristy and aren't great value for money. The area around the V&A Food Market (and food stalls inside) seemed to be the pick of the bunch.

Awesome shopping! . The V&A Waterfront has a lot of shops selling international brands. There is something to do for everyone from shopping to hopping on a boat and going to Robben Island, sundowner cruises and even just having a nice lunch with a stunning view of the harbor.

An experience not be missed when in Cape Town.. So much to see and some wonderful shops.Not spoilt for choice on eating establishments.Street entertainment was so varied.Don't miss the Chavonnes Battery Museum a Visitor Attraction about the early History of Cape Town.All in all a good day out.

Bay of Babel. Find yourself surrounded by people speaking many different languages on any day of the week while you shop to your hearts content at the various stores and boutiques. The V&A offers mainly upmarket clothing boutiques with about three affordable stores for the average person. There are African curio shops, a winery and other different stores as well. The restaurants offer a wide range of cuisines to suit your palate and pocket. If you want something quick to eat there are fast food restaurants. It's a viby place to hang out at and in summer it's a must to visit. Buy a delicious ice-cream cone at Gelato Mania and take a walk around and admire the bay or just sit on one of the benches and get a tan. The boat trips are a great way to spend a summer afternoon, with a few going to Robben Island as well. It's an awesome place to while away a night. The bars are packed and music playing attracts many bar hoppers. But it's also a nice place for families to enjoy, with a jungle gym outside and the Scratch Patch to explore.  Avoid the V&A like the plague on New Year's Eve!!! I went there once on that evening and never will I again.If you like being jostled by hordes of sweaty and maybe( highly likely) drunk Capetonians and tourists go ahead and jump in there and go crazy. It will take a while for your hearing and sanity to return to normal once you've stumbled your way back to your hotel room. If you can find it if you were among the tipsy ;).
Very clever!!!!!. A shopping complex & loads of great & interesting restaurants & things to do & see. One can spend the whole day at the Waterfront
Amazing Place. This is one of the best market place marinas that I have ever visited. The food is amazing, The value is amazing! the scenery is even better!

There's a little something for everybody here!. I love the energy of this place! You get a variety of dining choices when you get hungry from all the shopping. You can choose from a dozen bayside activities like ferries or get on the a ferris wheel. Enjoy a show by street performers or just stroll around!

Good place to spend evenings. Lots of Shopping, restaurants and some fun activities like the cape town flyer/ eye and some entertainment activities around the water. You will find a lot of high end luxury brands in the mall

Worth a visit . This area is the major tourist area with the main attractions like Robben Island pier and Two Ocean Aquarium.
Good shopping malls and nice restaurants within walking distances.
Plenty of choices!

Spur resto. Resto at Century city .Ritz hotel revolving resto on top. At Spur steak house , one of the best steak I have ever tasted.good wines as well.At Century city, the ground floor resto, u can eat very well prepared dishes of shrimps( very big plate) at a very good price(value for money). And at the Ritz Hotel, The top revolving resto is so magnificent, enjoying the town views while having yr lunch or dinner.Of course don't miss the Table Mountain which looks like a far away planet.
Nice but very touristy. Nice views of the mountains, good (but expensive) shopping and restaurants and lots of business people and tourists.

World in one point. Great place with shops and local performer. African far seal resting point to have sun bath. Way point to Robin Island great attraction of Cape town where Madiba spent 17 years in prison.

Worth a visit. Most attractive setting, lot's of shops selling locally made gifts, great if you want presents to take home. There is also a shopping mall and a number of places to eat ranging from snacks to restaurants.
Nice place to visit all day. this area is good for family or couples as it is always busy and location is amazing, a lot of malls near as well hotels with all services any tourist is looking for.

Food shopping and activities. We stayed in a hotel very close by and we were so pleased by the variety of shopping and eating experiences available. Also the hop on hop from bus begins here so you don't have to go looking for stops.

A really fun place to stroll, shop, people watch, and enjoy nightlife. .. The shops were great with lots of African craft stores, good restaurants, jewelry shops and very nice people to help at the information center.
Touristy but beautiful. Lots to see! Quite clean and inviting. Stopped for some ice cream and took in the sights. Make sure you set aside a good chunk of time to take everything in!!

The place to hang out in Cape Town. Shops, bars, restaurants. Lovely place to be. Most bars have wifi. There is an aquarium. And, you can pick up tickets for the hop on hop off bus near the aquarium and for table mountain too. Don't miss this out of your trip it's great.
Bustling area with Big wheel and tons of shops. Plenty of shopping, cheap food court, pubs and restaurants - seemed very safe and clean. Good meal at reasonable cost.

Good part of CapeTown. Lots to see, many shops and restaurants and bars. You can spend here lots of time and feeling safe and good. Atmosphere is good. But know, it's still a part of CapeTown so, beware your personal belongings.

Very nice place to while away a few hours. The V&A Waterfront is a well developed, pleasant touristy sort of place. The shops are interesting, with lots of different things for sale. I heard two live bands when I was there, and that was fun too. If you get tired of walking, I recommend the frozen yogurt shop for a quick pick-me-up.

Good Mall... always busy. Good array of shops, food stalls and cinema. Lots to do!
Tip: Pop round the corner and the beach is a winner, never too busy but with a beautiful view

Great shopping and restaurants, lovely mall. Whereas there are currently major building works outside the V&A mall, and most of restaurants directly outside the mall are closed, the mall remains one of the best in South Africa. The retail area of the shopping mall is well-designed, and one is cleverly steered towards upmarket, middle-market and lower-end shopping areas. The fast food area is also clearly designated.Suggest that you explore the area near the Cape Grace, there are interesting markets in that area, and restaurants with great mountain and sea views.The parking below ghe mall is very expensive, but it is cheaper if you park somewhat further and take a short walk.

Great place for dinner. This was a great place to watch people and have either dinner or lunch. You can do some shopping here in the souvenir stores but they will be much more expensive than the green street market.
Shopping, Restaurants and Bars, Oh My. This is a great place to hang. Lots of security, lots of tourists and a great place to book lots of adventres.

Shopping, food, art, and more shopping.... Such a fun place to visit. You could spend all day here...and then another day here. Lots of place to eat (nice, casual, and sweets!) and wonderful places to shop and just walk around and enjoy the day. You could walk in and out of the mall, sit in one of the cafes and just enjoy the day. This is a must see on your trip.

the best of cape town. It s in the near of the atlantic ocean You can find lots of food and shopping here. I like the foods so much... and you must visit two ocean aquarium. You feel so good here. and It s a cool city.

A must visit while in Cape Town!. Not only the shopping centre with amazing shops and cool cafes on the square, also there is an organic food market and the newest place is local handicrafts shops are a great added value to the Waterfront area. Also do not forget to jump on the bus for a great sight seeing tour.
Love V&A. You feel like you are in Europe. We went sightseeing on a helicopter. What a lovely view. Cape Town is amazing and scenic. I would recommend that people add Cape Town on their bucket list.
Touristy. It is very touristy and a lot of it is just shops, but there are some great restaurants and a nice vibe

Great food and markets. The vibe here is very nice and much safer than the city! Easily spend a day or 2 walking around and taking it all in.
Keep an eye out for the wild seals sleeping on the docks.
Good family fun. We do not go to the V&A Waterfront regularly, but it is always a treat to visit Quay 4 for breakfast of lunch. We visited the Titanic exhibition and enjoyed it thoroughly.

It's the place to go. A must visit. Lots to do see and partake in food, drinks and tours. It's safe to wander day and night.
Good shopping although it is touristy.

great shopping. There is lot of shopping here and some street artists as well. There are some great food choices as well. If going to Robben Island, you will leave from here. We spent the afternoon here after spending the morning at Robben Island.
Pleasant area. The Waterfront is a nice place to stroll, shop and eat. After doing all of those things we picked a waterfront restaurant and had a very nice lunch.

Busy but lots to see and do. Weekends are crazy busy but there is lots to see and do. Markets outside are great! Shops inside are busy but there is a lot of restaurants to eat at. Try Willoughby & Co. And Tasha's are worth a visit.

food and shopping experience. real good place for food, you find all restaurants serving very good food, helicopter rides, speedboat ride, two ocean aquarium, crafts market and a juice center selling variety of juice at crafts market, Gelato ice creams in foyer, performance by african artists, amphi theatre is wonderful experience

Beautiful!. The Victoria & Alfred Waterfront fondly referred to as the V&A Waterfront is a lovely area. Full of shops, bars, cafes, entertainment venues on the waterfront, this is a lovely area to spend many many many hours. Trendy, funky vibe and fun.

Great!. I always stop by the V&A when in in Cape Town. Most of the stores are on the higher end of the spectrum when it comes to budgeting there are stores that cater to a more humble budget. There is a great selection of eatery spots. Even if you just go window shopping and saunter along the waterfront and listen to the live musicians you'll have a good time. This is definitely one of the gems of Cape Town
Wonderful area. Music, shops, kids playground and so many wonderful restaurants. They have activities and tours from this area and lovely places to eat and enjoy the beautiful scenery.

Touristy but easy to access and fun to people watch. We walked to the Waterfront and found it touristy. There was excellent people watching and lots going on, but not really worth spending a lot of time here.

Relaxing place.. I've been there in september 2012 after a white shark cage's week in Simon's Town. I spent my last afternoon before take off in the waterfront area. Very interesting and relaxing afternoon.

Water Wonderland. This is one of the "hubs" of the city...thousands of locals and tourists wandering around....lots of shops, hotels, restaurants to relieve you of your well earned cash...an open air alive music auditorium, a wheel that 's Cape Town's answer to the London eye ...altogether a good place to while away a few hours....but be warned...everything here is at a premium price...

A one stop tourist (and even local resident) location. With the backdrop of Table Mountain and the nautical theme AND the sea! So many 5 star restaurants to choose from and then cheaper options for the locals.... here is something for everyone ! do not miss if you are visiting Cape Town as a tourist. Aquarium, boat rides, museum, huge Mall, cinemas. And then of course hotels to die for .... One of South Africa's best locations!!!!

Got to visit the wonderful food market. Found the food market by total surprise and what a fine, go hungry as there is so much choice, wonderful people to serve you with their delicious delights and something for every appetite... simply delicious!!

Good for Evening till Night. V&A Waterfront is actually a small port from where boats and small ships are available to travel to other nearby places over sea. There is also a market-place/mall. This place is good to enjoy at evening hours.

When you've seen one luxury mall you've seen them all.. Meh, as far as the shopping is concerned. None of the shops seemed especially unique to South Africa or to Cape Town. Perhaps the view of the harbor from an upstairs restaurant would be more engaging during the day.

Mall mole heaven. As malls go, this is probably the best one I've been in. It is part of the lovely harbour development, and offers good shopping and eating for those in need of retail therapy, and caters for a fair range of price points. It's small enough to find your way around relatively easily, and has plenty of parking.

Amazon Africa. For visitors it is angst to ne there.
There are a lot of super restaurants to choice of.
Very friendly and helpful people around in the different shops.
The atmosphere is just superb.

OK. Perhaps I missed something major, but the "main" area was simply a wharf with a mix of commerce and rental vessels, and resturants with overpriced food. The shops were seemingly inauthentic in that the goods could be found most everywhere else in Cape Town, and the mall was a typical mall, as well. Down the road a bit is much more impressive, with a nice walkway by the water, and park areas.
Nice!. We visited in 2010 and last week, they were busy with upgrading. They have loads of things for the kids to do that is a huge plus for us.

Great Place near the Harbour. Perfectly situated, used to be a warehouse in 1683 but the hotel is 21 years old, the breakfast room is amazing with glass doors around you so you can feel near the harbour. The food is great. Thee are original artifacts all around the hotel. Rooms are of good size. Great location, you can sign and use facilities of the Dock which is opposite too.
Fun. A gorgeous development at the Waterfront filled with good resturaunts, interesting arts and crafts, African musicians, children's play areas and shopping. Well worth a visit!

Interesting shopping centre. We enjoyed our day here looking at the many shopping opportunities on offer, and chose a number of items as presents to bring back to the UK . There were a number of food outlets from which we chose our favourites, and were able to buy some local SA spice mixes to bring home too. A starting point for the city bus tours and trips to Robben island, ware front is definitely a place to come to in Cape Town.

Modern and safe place to visit. The V&A waterfront is undergoing a lot of redevelopment still but has lots of things to see and do. Lots of inexpensive restaurants, good shops and a big wheel as well as harbour trips. Great place to spend a day, or two.

Well done but hardly unique . The waterfront looks fantastic and there's lots of hustle and bustle. Plus the seals in the harbour are beyond cute. But you'll be hard pressed to feel like it's "uniquely Cape Town" It's a shopping district aimed at tourists.
Great place to hang out, shop, eat or drink.. A nice place to hang out for a morning, afternoon or evening. Lots of shopping, eateries, bars etc... definitely worth a visit.
Great variety. A vast array of shops and restaurants. Everything you could want. Currency conversion made things a lot cheaper, particularly food

Amazing. What an amazing place to visit, restaurants and shopping...spoiled for choice and the weather was amazing. My first visit and certainly won't be my last. The only negative thing I can say is trying to park was a bit of a nightmare

Great fun at the waterfront. The water front is a great place to wander around. I enjoy the boats, people, and history of the place. There are good restaurants and shopping here as well but more expensive than other parts of Cape Town. This is definitely a place to visit for anyone coming to Cape Town.

Safe place to shop and eat. Really the best/only place in Cape Town to shop, wander around and it has a huge selection of restaurants across the spectrum of prices so there is something for everyone. The Aston Martin dealer is also there in case you want to bring one home with you. It is the place to go as it even has a ferris wheel that provides you with an excellent view and a must for taking pictures.

Looking for Food Fun and Entertainment????. Victoria & Alfred is the place to go to. Man, this place is busy 365 days of the year. Its a one stop shop if i may call it that. The mall itself is massive - you are so spoilt for choice.Too many deli's, restaurants, bars, etc to mention. All i advise is for you too have a good pair of walking shoes and a light jacket.As for tours kiosks they are right there at your doorstep. Make a booking and have a time of your life.As for the night life - its brilliant. Never a dull moment once you are down there. Entertainment from groups at different times. The wheel is a must for a 360 degree view of the fairest city Awesome! awesome! awesome!

Always a must if you are in Cape Town. Everything that you can think about you can do or buy at this jewel in Cape Town. A lot to see so much shops to see and to shop at. A couple of markets with everything thing from regular to out of the box. The big wheel also a must to do.
The most frequented venue by foreign visitors in South Africa!. Excellent in all respects! Restaurants, shops, entertainment, atmosphere, views parking facilities exc! 24 million visitors in 2014!

Tourists and locals enjoy the amenities. Our hotel was nearby, so this was the place to go for dinner. The eats range from fast-food to upscale, so you can find whatever you like. If you are into shopping, there are many, many stores from trinket sellers to top brands. I enjoyed looking at the variety of boats in the harbor. This is also a working port. There were also many "statues" some of which were humorous.
Very nice place. Nice atmosphere with an awesome view. Very good restaurants in a good price. Nice stores and some of them are really cheap!
Great place to walk and eat. There are a lot of great restaurants at V&A where serve fresh food and great fish. The service is great and the view from the restaurants is also very picturesque.
Always pass through here. Nice place to get a bit of the Cape Town vibe. If you are not a local you will not know where to go and the V&A gives you some of the Cape Town vibe.

An Energetic Attraction. It was the intense variety of people and places that makes the V&A Waterfront so dynamic. There is the water with sea gulls, gentle waves and ships that are always so calming. Here are ships being repaired, ships docking and ships sailing. Surround this with shops, museums, restaurants and art filled with people from around the world and you have the opportunity to explore to your heart's content. It took us two days to thoroughly explore the area and each day brought about new revelations.

he World at Your Fingertips. We live in nearby Hout bay & make the trip in to the V&A always when friends visit but also just on our own for dining, fantastic shopping & great movie theaters. The place is absolutely massive in scale attracts literally every segment/nationality of local as well as tourist which makes for world class people watching. Grab a bench! There are lots! It can be actually too crowded during high season especially on the weekends. The harbour is gorgeous!

The best in Cape Town!!. We were in Cape Town for 4 nights & spent almost 2 days at the waterfront. Such lively atmosphere especially on a Sat. Live music at a bar, kids in the play area, a variety of restaurants! Activities to keep you busy, shopping...a day well spent!!

Must visit. Whole day. Iconic landmark. Must see. Plan whole day. Aquarium. Stalls. Restaurant. shops.Comedy Club etc. Start your Hopp on Hopp off Red bus city tours from here. End days tours here. 18:00 . Still time to catch many shops and attractions open.Under cover motorcar parking R 75 per day.

Very Nice walkabout. Lots of boutique shops to browse and lots of places to get something to eat. We were there on a nice sunny day and it was a lot of fun. You can easily spend several hours wandering around. The aquarium is located in this area and it is also definitely worth taking the time to see.
Everything that you need. Lovely place, fine dining and fast food, quality shopping and great trips. We enjoyed our visits. Would have liked the chance to enjoy a sunset cruise but didnt have time.

Nice to stop by. It is an interesting place with so much to see and do. I am not a big shopping fan but I am a foodie and there are plenty of restaurants to try at the waterfront.It is a central place for most tours so it does get busy but it is definitely worth a visit.
Busy, touristy, but alot of fun.. This place is hard to beat on a sunny day. Lots of restaurants, great entertainment, superb craft beer, sublime views. What else could one ask for>

Darling Harbour clone?. A must to see in Cape Town but really is a clone of many similar waterfronts around the world.
Great for a feed but the tourist location forces up prices.
Best to get those souvenirs and gifts elsewhere

It's a mall. In a nice location.. I've never quite understood the idea of liking V&A in itself. Yes, it's awesome that there are so many great restaurants in one place, yes, the dock is lovely, yes, you feel safe when you're there. But it's a mall, and maybe it's just me, but shopping is not what makes Cape Town stand out to me. So yay for making it easy for a visitor to kill off a few hours, for adding to Cape Town's general appeal and for enhancing the chance of you running into a friend. But V&A could never get a five from me simply because it's not really anything in itself and its components need to be rated separately.

Generic. If you are in Cape Town, you can't help but go to the Waterfront. The ticket office and point of departure for some of the popular tours (for example Robben Island) are at the waterfront. So are many restaurants, many shops, and many more tourists. View of the harbor is nice. But it is only the view of the Table Mountain and the souvenirs in the shops that tell you are in Cape Town. Otherwise, I thought the whole Waterfront lacked character and was rather generic. Of course, you need to visit it, but try not to spend your every evening there.

Hectic. This is a great place to experience the views of Cape Town, see great talented people perform in public and eat wonderful food, but it is a tourist place that few locals can afford. Everything that a tourist needs is right there. It is safe and clean. A good place to begin your Cape adventure from.

fascinating. The V&A waterfront is a great, lively interesting place. Lots to do and see. I loved the food market lots of tasty morsels to try and buy. At night it is lit from lights in the avenue of trees. Street bands entertained us. we ate at the Quay4 restaurant a lively busy place. the food was basic but very good. Lots of boats bobbed in the harbour. Intriguing carved animals,life sized made cute photos.
The Exlibris of the City. This is the PLACE in Capetown.Nobody goes to the City without visiting the v & A.Great Restaurants .bars and Shoping
Inmense shopping mall. Modernized port area with many shops and restaurants in a safe area to visit at day or night. Hotel shuttles are available

Very worthwhile . Wow,what a great waterfront. Specially shops, arts and craft stalls, a very helpful info centre (thanks Helen)well laid out waterfront, plenty of places to eat, excursion booking offices.
Vibrant. What a wonderful place, lively but not over the top, places to eat both during the day and for a evening meal range from cheap to fine dining.

Watershed at the Waterfront moment!. Well you won't find many Capetonians floating around the Waterfront as it is largely a tourist trap. It's very secure, contains some excellent hotels and many dozens of excellent restaurants covering the whole gammet of differing cuisines. It is a stunning and vibrant place with a huge array of shops, cafes, pubs, restaurants, cinema, aquarium etc etc. The Waterfront is a must see on anyone's first visit to Cape Town. Be advised that the prices are geared more for the visiting tourist than the savvy locals. This being said though, it is the ideal place for tourists to walk around with families doing the inevitable holiday shopping without having to worry about security, the car and being hassled as is often the case in the centre of Cape Town. The fact that it's a working port adds reality to the port locale and makes for an exciting day/night out.

Went Here Everyday. I was in Cape Town for a couple weeks and always managed to wind up at least once a day. There is so much to do and the cool thing is there is always something else to discover. If you have time just go get a drink or food at one of the many restaurants and look around at everything.

Loved the V & A Waterfront. A great place to stay & very close to lots of places to visit & things to do in Cape Town. The Waterfront has a really good vibe with lots of choices of some amazing restaurants..

IMO, the center of the city. This place reminded me quite a bit of the Inner Harbor of Baltimore, for anyone who has been there. Tons of restaurants and shops, luxury hotels, plenty of things to do and see and eat and drink. You can definitely spend a couple of days here, especially if you like to shop. The mall itself is pretty impressive, easy to get lost in, and all the outdoor restaurants just add to the environment. Plenty of bars for nightlife as well. Not sure what the hell you are doing in Cape Town if you don't hit this area.
😍😍😍. Awesome place to beNice and huge shopping mallAmazing shops Nice view of the harbourGreat for boat trips especially that of the red bus tour.Its a must to go there in Cape Town...

The V and A Waterfront. The best place for tourists to be , good restaurants , a must visit for every visitor to Cape Town. There are however great restaurants to visit at a much cheaper price than the Waterfront

Love the V&A Waterfront. No matter what the weather, always a great place to wonder, plenty of shops, restaurants, cafes. Can take boat trips, book tours and generally enjoy the vibe here, also the Aquarium here worth a visit.A must visit for any time of year.

Great views and atmosphere. A world class shopping and eating experience in a working harbour with accompanying sights and sounds, with the most beautiful view in the world, natural wonder Table Mountain. 5-star hotels in abundance, live music, markets and museums, aquarium and departure point for sightseeing tours. Nice cosmopolitan buzz.

Most visit shopping centre. This shopping centre has it all - a huge variety of shops, great choice of restaurants from fast-food to more fine-dinning places. The atmosphere is cosy and warm and at the same time you have a magnificent view.

You deserve the luxurious experience!. Excellent service, excellent food and wine, beautiful and peaceful venue for selective dining - roll out the red carpet! A must if you have a craving for the luxurious! Food so delicately prepared and served, table settings top notch!

great dining and shopping. The V & A Waterfront has non stop shopping and restaurants for all tastes of food. There are plenty of entertainers and activities and great views of the Table Mountain and there is plenty of activity on the harbour.

Nice rekreation and shopping . THIS area Will provide everything you can ask for
Nice restaurants beautiful view all kinds of entertainments and tors
Do not miss a visit

Awesome. There are so many restaurants to choose from. There's from hamburgers and chips up to seafood platters with crayfish. There's entertainment in the evening and it's very busy. Definitely the place to be especially at night

Fantastic place with great views. What a great place to stay, so many different things to do, great restaurants, cafes, shopping, also you can do lots of tours from here, Robben Island, Cape of Good Hope and not to mention the cable car ride to the top of table mountain. Too many things to mention. Stayed for 5 days and always had something to do. Loved it.

History and fashion side by side. V&AWaterfront is a fascinating mix of history and modern shopping all in very close proximity. The area is based around the old harbour, with modern shopping malls and market stalls offering everything from high fashion to traditional African cultural items. The quays are the centre point for boat trips around the bay, ferry trips to Robben Island and helicopter tours of varying lengths and prices. Also, there are restaurants of every size, nationality and food groups, with plenty of choice and price range. No trip to Cape Town would be complete without a visit to the Waterfront area.

Beautiful shopping/restaurant/bar area. We enjoyed walking around this area each night. There is plenty of security so we felt very safe walking around. So many choices for good food and drink. It was a bit chilly in the evening so we sought out places with outside heaters. The only disappointing thing was all the smoking...even places that were posted as no smoking, people were smoking anyway.

Used every night for evening meal. Loved the waterfront. Felt safe. Great atmosphere . Very interesting with some great museums. Great restraunts and cheap. Great service with a great attitude. Everywhere we went we were treated with kindness. Friendly and helpful everywhere .
Large Mall. This is a large indoor mall by the waterfront. Plenty of shops and restaurants. Very clean and nice. If visiting Cape Town and in need of something, this is the place to go.

This is a bustling shopping, dining and entertainment area neighbouring the Table Bay harbour. The Victoria & Alfred Waterfront in Cape Town has sweeping views of the Atlantic Ocean, Table Bay Harbour, the City of Cape Town and Table Mountain. Adrian van der Vyver has been credited with the design of the waterfront that is tourist friendly.

V&A. Lots of places to eat and drink to suit all pockets and tastes . Beautiful surroundings. Variety of shops. We took a trip on the sightseeing boat which was most enjoyable , around areas of the waterfront we would probably have not seen otherwise.

Watershed the stand-out attraction. The heart of the tourist city, but for me not the heart of the real Cape Town.Lots of shops, bars and restaurants, where prices are higher than in the streets behind - mainly because their customers are chiefly tourists for whom the inflated prices are still cheaper than in their home countries.Great place for shopaholics with most of the high-end and high street brand names familiar in the UK but no real advantage on price.For me, the stand-out attraction was The Watershed craft market - one-stop souvenir shopping heaven. The goods here aren't cheap, but so unusual and well-crafted that they are great value.

Overrated, unless you came to Cape Town to shop. Beautiful area to enjoy the views looking up at Table Mountain. Not much to do other than shop—if that's what you're into, perfect! We had fun walking around and looking at all the different boats in the harbor from all over the world.

Fun and refreshing during the day, romantic at night!. We came back to the waterfront 3 times during our trip! Great variety of restaurants, lots of little shops for jewelry and beautiful handmade goods, places to have brunch, lunch, dinner, drinks, whatever! You cannot miss going here and just walking around with some ice cream for the afternoon. We even did the Ferris wheel, but it isn't necessary. Just walking around the area made our day!

great for kids. this is great place for kids including kid friendly food joints also adults fine dinning and african crusine as well as a masive shopping mall and seal lookout area a must see as well as many attractions in a 5 minute walking distitnes a must go place

Good Shopping and restaurants. We were staying at the Table Bay hotel so this was ideal to while away a day. You can access the hotel directly from here and there a a lot of restaurants around the perimeter or inside, Lots of shops some high end if thats your interest.

A must visit place in Cape Town . It is an excellent place to visit in the evening which has a good shopping area with all popular brands. It has all Kind of restaurants Italian,Indian, Chinese, Mexican etc. The view and air is great. It has been a life time experience. Every visitor make it a point to visit V& A waterfront. It is close to Victoria and Waterfront hotel.

vibey and expensive. This tourist destination may be very cheap for the foreign tourists but for locals it is too exclusive.Nice to see though and a good experience,The Food market looked good but I did not eat there
lovely place for outings. we went for dinner in the place, very well organized with lot of brand shops and fine dinning with stunning views
Fun but don't expect to see locals. Absolutely the biggest tourist trap around.....Worth a visit but not the true cape Town. We went 2 nights in row as we didn't know any better. Better places around

Enjoyable place to spend a leisurely afternoon. We explored the waterfront on our 1st day. We grabbed dinner at one of the Italian restaurants and strolled the shops. It was a great way to wind down as we were adjusting to jet lag.

A good feel for Cape Town. If you want a good feel for Cape Town and its diversity along with a beautiful view and good shopping, you need look no further than V&A waterfront. From local artisans to delicious food, it has an array of almost anything you could need

Shopping mall with views, local and international brands. This is a nice way to spend a day. The mall has local and international brands. There are many restaurant and food court options. You can also catch a boat or yacht cruise. There is also a few other options like the aquarium, adventure golf, scratch patch, cinema, market, etc.

Confusing layout for first timers but.... I love window shopping so enjoy the V & A. It has some "different" shops , but also lots of the same as my home town JHB. Love sitting at a restaurant and looking at all the comings and goings on the waterfront.

Lively place especially for families and eating. The place had a buzz. It was mostly eating places with a craft market, small shopping mall and children's attractions thrown in. Worth a visit but expect that it comes into its own at night.
waterfront. nice place to have a walk ocean breeze,boats nice shopping mall and many good places to eat with a view,the best was the boat trip to watch sunset

Lots to see & do!. Tons of shops, restaurants & bars. There is even a Ferris Wheel with great views of the harbor. A calypso band plays in the late afternoon to early evening. Across the street is the great interactive Rugby Museum. There are plenty of people milling about so it's a great place to sit and watch the world go by.

Professor. Jam-packed with shopping and restaurant experiences equivalent to anywhere else in the world. Definitely has to be on the itinerary of anyone visiting Cape Town from anywhere else in South Africa or from abroad.

V&A Waterfront. A vibrant place,full of restaurants, bars and shops. An open-air amphitheatre hosts frequent musical events, and street entertainers are often there. The covered Watershed houses many local producers and at one end is a small bar where you can have a tasting session with many of the local wines.

Great place to spend a day or two. Spent a couple of days around Cape Town before heading here. What a mistake. We should have come here first. Top rate shopping, excellent fine dining as well as small French cafes, great live music, and everything is clean. What a great experience. And great views looking back toward the city and Table Mountain.

Great Location. While not one of the top hotels in Cape Town, the location of this one is really top notch. Right next to the waterfront, you have easy access to shops, restaurants, a supermarket and some of the cities best tourist attractions (boats to Robbin Island leave nearby). The breakfast buffet is really spectacular, with a wide range of foods for every palate, and wonderful fresh juices and sparkling wine to start your day off right!

Reasonable place. Was here to find some last minute presents before heading to the airport so I could put them in the case. The place was big with a number of eateries and great selection of shops. Could get lost very easily but they do have plenty of information points throughout the building.

Great variety and good prices. Given the 3 days of rain in Cape Town, we spent a lot of time in the stores at the waterfront.It was interesting and gave us something to do during the day. Got lots of nice items. Went back on the Saturday during a sunny day and it was even better! Loved the watershed with the unusual and well priced local crafts.

Everything you could ask for. This area is one of the main highlights of Cape Town and an absolute must for any visitor. There are excellent restaurants that are reasonable priced, great souvenir shops to suit all tastes, a huge supermarket, wide range of shops, great bars and spectacular views.At the weekend there are lots of activities to keep children occupied, and throughout the week the atmosphere is always lively.

Good for shopping . This place is good if you wish to shop but not much else going on here. The shore is pretty boring and everything is very expensive. Skip the Ferris wheel as well, is not worth the price of it.

Vibrant dining and shopping. Vibrant place for dining and shopping or just strolling along the stalls. While the majority of the places offer good coffee, my favourite, however, Truth Coffee at the V&A Food Market.

Lovely waterfront. Nice place for relaxing and many things to see. Lots of Shops aroundBoat rides are amazing. Nice big mall with a variety of Shops that offers a variety of things. Big wheel ride was so nice.

Shopping spree. If you re looking for a nice and beautiful mall that s the one. Some nice and upper market stores. The other regulars as well. Nice Tasha's and other good restaurants. The movie theaters are nice and spacious. It s such a nice shopping mall.

The centre of Cape Town. Lots to see and walking around is a real pleasureThere are many restaurants and many things to see. Ships going out the harbor. Seals in the harbor and many birds as well.This is Cape Town at its best and nearby you find beautiful beaches as well. The water is always (too) cold as they say but you maybe lucky
Good atmosphere. It is not just a shopping mall. There were a lot of nice outdoor restaurants. Street performers. People are enjoying themselves.
Fabulous for shopping, dining and drinking. Extensive shopping, beautiful bars and restaurants with sea views. Other entertainments include the Cape Wheel for views of the city and sea

Shopaholics paradise, great views & lots of places to eat.. There is always something interesting to see at the V & AHundreds of well known brand named shops for the shopaholics.Boats rides around the harbour.Come here if you want to visit Robben Island (book well ahead)Hundreds of restaurants and plenty inexpensive eateries as well.Try the cheesecake at the Coffee Bean its huge and very tasty.

Lots of Shopping and Restaurants. If you want to do any shopping this is probably the place to do it. There are also many restaurants here as well. I gave it a low rating only because t was a dining and shopping area that you could find anywhere. there was nothing particularly south African about it. Lots of good shops but there are far better and more interesting places to eat.

gorgeous!. We loved this place, lovely views, lots to see and do, the aquarium is worth a look too! We travelled here on honeymoon and stayed in THe Table Bay Hotel just near the waterfront, a gorgeous hotel in a gorgeous area! Highly recommend!

Lovely vibe. Safe with excellent shopping and great activities. You can do a harbor tour, visit the aquarium, book your diving excursion, go to the movies, enjoy a relaxing massage, shop and enjoy lovely meals. All in one place.

My favorite shopping centre. This is simply the best shopping centre in cape town the place has something for everyone amazing places to eat or buy that special outfit exclusive books is a favorite just to browse at the huge collection of items and to for much needed cup of coffee after all the walking

A mixed bag of awesomeness . Having not been here for more than 16 years it was wonderful to revisit this vibrant place. The weather was great, and wandering around the shops and listening to the live buskers gives one an opportunity to experience Cape Town at its best

Bustling with activity. Lots of shops, markets & restaurants. Plenty of activities (street bands, entertainers etc) and stops for the red bus sight-seeing tours of the city. Trips to Robben Island from here.

One stop shop. We arrived in CT just when the weather turned which made it too cold to truly enjoy the sea, mountain and forest. The V&A Waterfront was the ideal place to find refuge from the weather. There are a multitude of restaurants that cater to all preferences and budgets, a variety of stores to buy warmer clothes, and entertainment for kids.

Lively and buzzing waterfron. Loved wandering round here. There's a version of London Eye ie giant wheel, although we didn't go on it. There are good quality souvenir shops, good restaurants, museums, ticket office for Robben Island, where Nelson Mandela was held (you need to book weeks in advance at peak times - we didn't and so didn't get to go). The marina is pretty and we were blessed with really good weather. Definitely recommend.

Seaside shopping . The V and A waterfront is a great mall with lovely seaside views. Many great restaurants can be found along the waters edge with stunning views of the mountain. Lots of retail therapy can be had inside with all the big names of the fashion, electronic and food retailers. A must do when in Cape Town.

Eclectic Vibe. The V&A Waterfront is the ideal place to catch up with friends, grab a bite to eat and relax! Enjoy the wide variety of musicians, artists, entertainers and the views. Shopping is a definite plus too!Definitely a must when visiting Cape Town.

The Hub of Cape Town Tourism. When I first arrived in Cape Town, I spent a few hours walking around the waterfront. There's plenty to explore with some excellent views of the harbour and Table Mountain. Once you've explored it, you'll likely find its your hub for the city. There's plenty of restaurants here, and Citysightseeing buses pickup and drop-off from here.

Incredible shopping and dining . The V&N is an incredible place to shop and dine.
With the many stores and boutiques, it provides a great shopping experience for all.
The eating houses are plentiful and one will find a place to suit their budget.
The movie house is great for the family.
Lots of activities and experiences for all.

Such a nice place to visit . Very similar in feel to Darling Harbour in Sydney, the V&A Waterfront is such a great place for tourists to enjoy the amazing harbour, fantastic food and great shopping. Not the cheapest place in Cape Town but well worth a visit for a great meal at many restaurants, great nightlife and a very safe area.A must visit when in South Africa!
Lots of action, day or night. We loved being near the water/marina and visiting all the retail shops. Lots of places to eat. Good vibe in the area. Fun place to be

Lovely . I really like that part of Cape Town. There is good restaurant, great bars, shopping and all by the water. There is usually music being played. It's very experience for Cape Town but still nice.

European Flair in The Mother City!. The V&A never fails to stun you, regardless of where you venture. I love just walking all over the space, peeking in shops and eating in the restaurants, hanging in the bars. Lovely space for locals and tourists alike.

You don't travel halfway across the world to go to the mall - but actually really well done and worth the time.. We came here on our first morning when it was raining and we couldn't sleep due to jet lag. The stores and restaurants weren't open yet and there were a few other Americans walking around looking like zombies. I thought, what is so special about a mall, but it is actually really well done. There is a good array of local African shops as well as typical luxury brands. Great restaurants and good, clean, safe setting. We came back a few times for shopping and the little market across the street (highly recommend) and to pick up a few items. I even got my haircut here. Don't cross it off your list just because it is a mall. It is worth the time to visit, and is a good spot to come after some of the other sites are closed, especially at night.

Good location stunning view. Very nicely located with shops and restaurants at sea side. It is a huge complex neatly maintained and you can find all things here. Weather was nice when we came here. I bought something from the pharmacy on the ground floor.

Great place for dinner, shopping and people warching. I ate here a couple nights, walked around and enjoyed the buzz of the city. There are tons of restaurants with all types of food. Lots of shopping options, including locally sourced, non-conflict, diamonds.

Great outdoor restaurants and shops. The location is really nice, at the sea side, very clean and well mantained. A lot on all the time: street performers (good ones!), some of the best restaurants and bars in the area, and the blue house ( I don't remember the name), containing the most fantastic African art and highest quality artisan pieces, of highest quality, difficult to find somewhere else! I really enjoyed it!

Great shopping and food. I just can't get over the food,lip smacking. The wharf had small food vendors turning out 5 star quality food. The Alfred mall had all the big brands offering a perfect shopping experience. Can easily spend an entire day there with the break given by the aquarium.

The waterfront is lovely, but the mall....meh.... Well, it is big, with lots of dining options (a couple were very good), and lots of shops. It felt a lot like every other mall I have ever been to however, all the same western brands etc.Walking around on the water front was very enjoyable, but the large mall I could do without. Thats just me though...Im not much of a shopper. I will say, if it were to be a rainy day, and you are looking for a place to go walk around, the waterfront would be an excellent choice.

Good shopping and eating. There's always lots going on at the V & A -- entertainment, shopping, restaurants, play areas for the kids, movies and more. It's a great place to spend an afternoon or evening.
A vibrant place to visit. Great vibe with lots of restaurants, bars and shops. Pretty place which has had a lot invested into it.Well worth the visit
Waterfront V&A. Fantastic place to visit Great shops and even nice restaurants.Great place to relax and meet friends or just to chill by yourselves

A VISIT TO CAPE TOWN MUST INCLUDE THE V&A. Perfectly positioned, well maintained with a wide range of shops, restaurants & activities. Well worth visiting.During my recent visit, I discovered Hamley's now have an outlet there. A boon for children and a threat to parents' wallets
Nice place to shop and to see. Nice place to shop and to see, good restaurants and creative African shops highly recommend to spend some time there.

Vivid and interesting. You can spend hours here just strolling around, watching local band shows and browsing handicraft shops or just enjoying the atmospheres with seagulls trying to attract your attention to feed them :)
Best spot in Cape Town. One of the best areas in Cape Town to relax and for shopping, there are plenty of good restaurants and cafes. It is touristic but you can still get very good food.

Nights at the waterfront. Waterfront and me have always been good pals. Well. Aside from restaurant queue's, hussles with parking and the confusing mall ( i really cant get my head around the mall). It is a beautiful place. Mostly prefer it at night though. The variety of restaurants is good as well.
Just great. We loved to go there. Nice shops, nice cafes, people are just easy and friendly. Prices for Europeans very good ;-)

Best place to get acclimated to Cape Town. It was my first visit to South Africa and the V & A definitely impressed. We rented a condo at the waterfront village that was perfect. The views were remarkable and it was walking distance to many restaurants and shops and security was great....We always felt safe. I will definitely be back !
Lots to do.. Very nice to walk about and lots to see and do..... and it isn't finishes yet. Numerous eating places at reasonable prices and access by boats to Robben Island.
Buzzing Atmosphere. This is a really buzzing place lots going on and lots to do. A great selection of bars and restaurants. Or just sit and take in the atmosphere

Great place to wander!. Basically a shopping mall with every store you've seen in London, New York, etc., but there is Willoughby's for the best and most inexpensive sushi you will ever have this side of Japan. Many other restaurants, bars and plenty to do to fill an afternoon.

Great Vibe and atmosphere. We enjoyed the music and all the visitors just strolling past, looking at the boats and all the restaurants around the waterfront. The shops are great and busy till late. This place is great for night life with lots of activities and people around.

Shopper's Paradise. Typical expensive waterfront tourist location you find any many places. It's nice, it's pretty, it's safe. But it's not South African so please leave the waterfront and venture out! Also they say they have free wifi....they don't. It may exist but doesn't work, probably too many people.
ok. It is a nice place to walk by, specially for shopping. The view is also nice and it is somehow easy to park your car. Be aware that you may face some traffic to get there.

Visit to VA. I last visited the VA in 2004. There have naturally been some changes but this is a must see for a visit to Cape Town, either with or without children. It is basically the place to go for food lovers or shoppers or both.

VIBRANT, ALIVE AND SAFE. The Waterfront is the place to visit, for great restaurants, watching the active port, the sculptures, shopping, harbour cruises or just strolling around and drinking in the carnival atmosphere. Not to be missed while visiting Cape Town.
Nice place to stroll!. Love this place with small and big shops, local crafts and souvenirs. Enjoyed my breakfast at Quay 4 - great idea to start a morning at Cape Town!

The Place to Visit in Cpt. This is absolutely a must in Cape Town. The Waterfront is full of atmosphere, life and good events. It is the place to go for shopping, for enjoying the atmosphere, good food, great wines etc. It is always full of happy and joyful people who get there to have som fun. Very good restaurants everywhere you go and plenty of shops. All levels of shopping is possible from designer shops to more general shops. Go there and enjoy!!

Walking and shopping around Victoria and Albert water front. I love walking around. .. so much to see ... so many beautiful shops and restaurants. Get a travel pass which allows you to hop on and hope off the bus plus visit botanical gardens and you go on canal trip around the water front. Visit the craft market. .. standard is so high and yes it is pricey!.. go to food market .. really unique food which you can try. Good vibe

Fun place to visit. There was so much to see and enjoy here. We saw the swing bridge open and close, watched the various tour ships arrive and depart, learned a good deal of history at Nobel Square, listened to amazing music and spent quite some time deciding which of the plethora of restaurants to eat at. Definitely recommend.

nice. An expensive area, but it is geared to the tourist trade. We loved the many shops, and restaurants. I would have like more interactions with locals, but it is a pure tourist destination. I would go because of the many different events like the aquarium, robben island ferry, and the many different activities that leave from here. I also enjoyed the restaurants, but again it was hard to get a feel for Cape Town by just visiting the tourist area.
Great place. Lots to see and do here.lovely shops resturants, well sign posted to get around, very clean, local entertainment.
gorgeous fun spot. there is so much to do and see here. It's a fabulous place! Not to be missed. I'll be sure to spend more time here when I return to Cape Town at some point in the future.

Always a pleasure . The V&A water front gets better each time! There just always seems to be something new and interesting to do. From the markets to restaurant to stores to boat trips it's a fantastic day out every time.

Exciting venue beautifully developed. One of the most exciting venues I've been to. Many excellent eateries very reasonably priced due to currency changes. Free shuttle to it from most hotels. A place to linger in and people watch then eat and drink.

New area. This area is relatively new with a huge shopping mall, great walks around the waterfront, many different types of restaurants and bars and felt very safe but, like anywhere, do not show expensive jewellery etc. In the shopping mall, there is a Woolworths which is similar tonthe UK Marks & Spencer with clothing and a superb food hall where you can buy that essential South African wine at very low prices. You can spend a lot of time here if you like wandering around, take a short boat ride or just eat/drink and peoples watch.

Food wine and entertainment. Plenty to do in this area of Cape Town . Shopping , fine dining, casual dining in a pleasant environment. Enjoyed good food from the markets, and casual lunch on the waterfront, watching a seal playing in the water in front of us.Lots of activity specially on weekends.Recommend a visit here for everyone who visits Cape Town.
Nice but not amazing. This was a nice place for shopping or walking around, but don't make it your first stop in Cape Town if you have a short stay.

Difficult to fault - spoilt for choice. We were lucky enough to be accommodated in the Table Bay Hotel for a couple of days following a cruise. This is situated within the V and A waterfront development, so we were easily able to explore the area at our leisure at all times of day (and night). It is a key element of modern Cape Town, with a real buzz about the place. The shopping mall is extensive, housing every high tag designer outlet. It is well designed, offering a safe environment with friendly and helpful security officers around for when you get lost!The waterfront offers a wide range of points of interest, ranging from a Comedy Club to modern art statues, a large workspace for artisan crafts and a host of replica and historic marine memorabilia. There are also rugby and diamond museums to name a couple of other places of interest.Around the waterfront itself there is a plethora of restaurants, catering for every taste and most pockets. The waterside avenues are pleasant enough with lots of features, statues and walkways to interest the tourist. Routes are easily accessible for those who would otherwise struggle over the steps and cobbles that sometimes characterise such areas. A main pick up point and ticket office for the Ho Ho buses is also located here. (near the aquarium)There are activities for the kids...of any age... but we did not find anywhere too overcrowded...maybe over the New Year period it would be as there is so much going on. I have written reviews elsewhere on the restaurants we frequented; suffice to say we were very happy to eat there - in fact we were spoilt for choice.

A lot to do. Tons to do here. But, does get very crowded. The food market is impressive, and I was able to get many crafts to take back home. The restaurants are very touristy and the two I tried were so-so.

Clean & safe. New, clean and safe but not one for the history buffs. Visited the Victoria Wharf - Willoughby's seafood bar and beautiful florist with sea shells for sale but otherwise I only saw regular shops and restaurants. Admittedly this was a flying visit. Over the road is the beach and amazing views. Visit at the end of the day and hear the birds roosting in the newly built eaves of the mall. Driving away, we spotted the Rugby Experience museum devoted to Springboks. Clearly there is far more to the sprawling V&A waterfront and the redevelopment of the former docks is impressive. For us, however, there was no wider context and without the Table Mountain views, it would have been hard to say where we were exactly.

Lovely to sit out and watch the world go by. However the few restaurants we ate in were not very good. If it were not for their location they would probably be a lot quieter. Still it is well worth a visit.
trendy vibe. Cool trendy vibe with cool bars and street performers. Prices were good and they catered for the nightime drinkers and the daytime eaters. Worth the visit

Tourist Trap. I often hear people saying that tourists need to visit the Waterfront, but I don't get it. It's a mall by the sea, with seagulls all over the show. The restaurants are insanely priced for locals and parking is expensive. Sure, they are nice restaurants, but there are plenty of better alternatives. If you like malls and that sort of thing, this is probably going to be your Mecca. For the average tourist with pounds or dollars, go there for lunch but rather spend more time in Camp's Bay area if you like trendy restaurants with a better view.

A great place for a visit - sights, food and ambience in spades!. The V&A waterfront has been beautifully developed. Lots to do and see here with plenty of good restaurants to choose from. Well lit and very safe, we enjoyed spending our days and evenings exploring.

One of the key attractions of Cape Town. The Headquarters of Cape Town! anyone and everyone will definitely visit the Waterfront whilst at Cape Town. Definitely a great place to be at especially in the evening with street performances, shops, cafe, ice cream vendors, coffer bars.... malls etc etc. Maybe a bit overrated.
Always a good place to visit. Love the waterfront. So many things to do and see. Any type of food you can think of. Great place to meet with friends.

A shopper's dream. Although I wouldn't say this was our favourite place as it felt a bit like Darling Harbour (for those who don't know, a tourist hub in Sydney Australia) we enjoyed a few hours wandering around, perusing the shops and then dinner.
For those looking for a good choice in restaurants, shopping and space for kids you'll enjoy this spot.
Great day out. Walking, alot of walking! So enjoyable, safe and convenient. So much sightseeing within walking distance

A cool spot. Yes it's touristy - but who cares.
A very cool spot where you can comfortably kill half a day. Great places to eat (try Harbor house) a mall with everything you need, tourist shops outside, a very cool food market, and lovely views of table mountain.
Love it. Love this place. All my favourite designer shops under one roof and loads to keep the kids entertained.

Family winter Vacation . We love the V and A Waterfront - it is all round excellent and it's our favorite place to hang out at - Great restaurants, clean cinemas which offer the latest technology eg 4D movies & Partners Salon is of course the best in the country

Always a great place to go, diverse, lively, fun.. The waterfront is always a great place to go whether you are a family/couple or friends, there are restaurants for every budget, and a lively fun atmosphere. There are markets, shopping centres, and an aquarium, I love it here 😊

Great Buzz. We first visted on a Friday evening and the place was really hopping, music, shops, bars, bands and all the activities one would hope for in a vibrant city centre. The restaurants were reasonably priced and good quality.To compare with Fishermans Wharf, Albert Dock Liverpool, Monterey, this place is miles ahead. I was a little surprised that after the the shops closed at 9.00 the buzz diminished considerably. Capetown is an early night sort of place, but none the worse for that.
Touristy. Pretty harbor with lots of shops, restaurants, and tourists. You should probably make a trip here to say you saw it. There is a nice view of Table Mountain from here.

Nice Views but Overpriced. I didn't shop here and only walked around it because it really is a giant tourist trap for those who are too intimidated to go in to the city and find similar wares for a cheaper value.

Atmospheric and varied social area. There is a lot to do around here it has a great feel to the area and I really felt a draw back to this area many times during our stay. Daytimes for shopping, people watching and the food market then the night times for drinks and good food of all varieties to choose from.

Great spot. Somehow a visit to the V&A always makes it on to our itinerary, when we are in South Africa.
Great variety of shops, stores, markets, food and drink. A bit of a tourist trap, but well worth dropping the extra cash for a coffee or meal.
Let's be honest though, it's all about the location and the views!
Breathtaking views of Table Mountain. Many restaurants, beautiful views, and playful seals are only part of what makes this area so special.
Such a great place to eat with a view . Great views of table mountain, all resteraunts are top quality and plenty of choice. Shopping is also very good with a good range of shops

Lively Waterfront. The V&A Waterfront reminded me a lot of Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco but cleaner, less smelly, and with more activities. With that said, it seemed like a bit of a tourist trap with junky souvenir shops or overpriced retail shops. There are plenty of restaurants in this area to choose and entertainment. Ferris Wheel, Noble Square, Ferry to Robben Island, and the shopping mall are all at this location.

A real treat!. Love going to the V&A. It has a special buzz about it. There is always something happening! Boats coming and going, people, shopping Centre, seals sunning themselves on the Jett's and the most wonderful Aquarium!
Has it all. Shops, restaurants, art and handcrart makers, colours, flavours, places to see, things to discover. Love it.
Loads to do, always fun!. Always great toVisit V&A waterfront - amazing shopping, lots to do, see, experience, never a dull moment!
Great location for activities, shopping and restaurants. A great place to visit while in Cape Town. There are no shortage of very good restaurants and plenty of shopping.

Lovely to wander around . Nice spot to wander around and have lunch or dinner. Plenty of activities for all ages and cuisines for food preferences. Be sure to get a taxi or uber back to your accommodation if visiting at night (after 5pm).

Waterfron. Nice job on developing the waterfront. Pretty high end stores and shopping- definitely set up for tourists. The Quay 4 restaurant is very nice. If you get a chance go to the Grand Beach Restaurant great pizza and nice beach. Great place to sit outside waterside.
Happy Shopping. Always a pleasure to go to the Waterfront. They have a variety of shops that suits everyone's budget and a great selection of restaurants. The Centre is wheel chair friendly.

Nice day out for the family.. Lots to see and shop around here. Plenty of parking closeby and a bit further, not to expensive. Kids will love the ferris wheel and the playground at the mall. Some good food to be had here as well. If you like cars, there is a McLaren dealer on the premises. Nice photo opportunity with the Table Mountain as background.

A great place to spend a day. I spend a lot of time here when travelling solo through Capetown, and my husband and I also enjoy it when there together. Fantastic restaurants, great shops, a movie theatre, and always some sort of entertainment going on. Never gets old

Shopping mall. This is just another shopping mall. Its huge and there are lots of shops. Not my thing to visit shopping malls, but there are lots of different restaurants with different cuisine to choose from. Attractions like the aquarium are well worth the visit. In the evening the flair changes and it becomes a lively assortment of places to wine and dine and hang out.
great vibe in the evenings and super restaurants. I loved this area from sunset on...street artists, bands, dancers in the area - great to walk and shop
Great alive place. This relatively, newly developed area is worth a visit. Lots of shops,restaurants, music and people. Definitely a tourist place but fun. Loads of eating and shopping options.

Pretty view of the waterfront.. There is a food market and local craft market. Also in the waterfront is a huge shopping mall if that is what you enjoy. High end shops as well mid-range shops. Good for a rainy day excursion.

Exciting!. My first time at the V&A Waterfront was to the PickNPay at the Mall to shop for groceries at night. Next time was also at night when i went to Shimmy's for dinner (the smell can be horrendous).A few days later I went back to V & A and saw some seals, went to the aquarium, shopped at Watershed, had lunch at the food market and watched local performances.The ambiance is fun and thrilling!

Great activity center for all the family. You have it all:A shopping mall, an active port, a Ferris wheel, food market, art market, many restaurants and fast food venues and many other activities.Great parking (and relatively cheap), very safe and clean.

Great place to hang out. There is so much happening here. Places to eat, drink, the mall and a wonderful indoor market with African vendors who are so proud of what they sell. We saw the triathlon taking place one morning. Visit the food market. People are keen to let you try.

Very Pretty, Lots to Do. While Cape Town really isn't lacking in things to do, V&A Waterfront provides a nice place to hang for a day and/or night and offers a wide variety of activities in one place.The views of the sunsets are usually pretty spectacular and there are dozens of restaurants and bars where you can grab a bite or spend the night with friends. There is also a mall with a movie theater conveniently located right there.While we were visiting there was also a great market with local goods, however it seemed temporary so it may only be there for the weekends. This was where I got the majority of souvenirs I brought back home, so I would highly recommend checking it out if you can. The variety of goods and wares is pretty impressive.If you are looking to visit Robben Island, this is also the jumping off point for that--the ferry docks here. In short, a nice spot to walk around, be around water and do some more touristy/shopping oriented activities.
This is all you can get in one place!. Shopping, restaurants, attractions, tours, music and lots more. This is a spot to end everyday when staying in Capetown.
The best place in Cape Town!. This is a fantastic shopping center! It is the place where Cape Town's beautiful people gather! On its patio there are lots of artists and performers. I recommend!
Food and drinks. Fantastic variety of bars and restaurants and very good shopping, too. Good vibe. Great place to sit and people watch.

A big tourist attraction ,in the harbour. We came from Robben Island ,and vusit V&A Waterfront.its a busy commercial harbour with many restaurants,shops,market,and movies.you can see the table mountain ,the marina and harbour, the clock tower.we had a close view of seals,boats, and walk at the nice marina.you must go !!!!

Excellent shopping and dining experience. World class dining and shopping experience.The wheel offers the best views in Cape Town.Cosmopolitan eateries African,Italian,Greek,Belgian,German,Indian etc.Kerry safe with ample parking.

Shopping heaven!. Shops to cater for all tastes and pockets. From International designer labels (didn't see many shoppers in these shops!) to "normal" clothing chains like Woolworths, Truworths and H & M. Lots of South African curio shops and eating places. The Aquarium is well worth a visit and a gentle stroll all along the waters edge is very enjoyable too. Seals and dolphins can often be seen in the Harbour.
Victoria & Alfred Waterfront. Great to visit plenty of shops and restaurants also a stop for the open top buses. The place is buzzing.
beautiful. I loved the mall beautiful place for friends and family to visit great restaurants and very people great place

It's Christmas every day of the year here!. The V & A Waterfront in Cape Town is a must do, must see, must explore and experience attraction for any and every visitor! If you are not a 'designer label' shopaholic, then there are those lazy boats going past. There are almost always local musicians playing and seagulls entertaining those who wish to see and hear the sounds of nature here. There is an extensive selection of restaurants catering to your every taste bud desire. Be picky... you can afford to be here - the seafood is fresh, the meat dishes are large, the beers are wet and the vibe is always truly happy Capetonian!

Its all happenning here. Home of the Big Wheel, the aquarium, numerous fabolous restaurants,Malls,all you shopaholics will be in seventh heaven .!,gateway to Robbin Island, Seals galore ,museums and lots more, Have fun! Enjoy!

A bussing MUST. A visit to Cape Town is not full filled if you have not seen Waterfront! That is where the buzz is - for shopping, eating, drinking and simply looking at other visitors or Capetonians. Everyone is there.

An Amazing place. The V&A waterfront speaks for itself it is an amazing place we really love it there!! The whole atmosphere in and around is just so relaxing and also gives you a festive feel with the live bands and entertainment etc!! You cant go to Cape Town without a Vistit to the V&A!! Awsome place it really is.
V&A Waterfront. A fantastic mix of shops, entertainment, restaurants, things to do. Plenty of parking - well signposted.

V&A Shopping with a View. The V&A is a must see in Cape Town, the shopping, activities and the atmosphere are all noteworthy. This "private island" in the middle of Cape Town is HUGE and offers so much, the food market is great with plenty of options of various cusines, the amphitheatre area has constant entertainment and a great kids jungle gym, aside from the shopping and eatery establishments there are museums, exhibitions and plenty of sights to see. A great people watching place too!

Long weekend getaway. Great nightlife, a huge variety of bars and restaurants to choose from. Enjoyed "Waking the Dead" shooter at Ferrymans, its double shot of espresso with I think 3 shots of tequila in a glass, a must try if you require a boost.
Beautiful waterfront to visit. Beautiful waterfront, great shopping and restaurants. The harbor is a working harbor and it's interesting to see the workings of the harbor.

A great place to wander around.. Our cruise ship was berthed in the port of Cape Town and it was a short walk to the Waterfront, which is a very pleasant place to wander around. There are lots of eating places and an interesting market and a couple of museums.

Always the best place in cape town. Stayed at the waterfront for 3 days at this really good hotel:the protea breakwater lodge. The waterfront has not changed that much since my last visit 7 years ago. But there is a fantastic food market where you'll have the chance to sample amazing food. The fish box stand is amazing. I have tasted the most delicious hake fillet wrap there. Mind blowing!! Also the wheel is very interesting. Shops are diverse as usual. And do not miss the seagulls and the museum of robben island.
Shopping. Great space and has soo many shops. Theres wide variety, food,n entertainment..The mountain is right there Beautiful view.

Shoppers paradise. If you want it, it's here! The front mall is mostly locally made items- exquisite. The big mall has it all. Great places to eat. Very 'with it ' happening place. Just stroll around, you'll have fun.

Nice place to visit but a bit pricy. If you want to shop in Capetown, prefer Cavendish than Waterfront, where the prices are for more fortunate people... with less choice of shops. But it's a nice place to visit with your kids and friends, not far from the Aquarium and the food market (don't miss that one!!!). Big H&M with large choice of clothes for the whole family!

Shopping Mecca. Filled with a wide variety of shops, you are able to buy anything your heart desires. After your shopping is done you can choose from the many eateries where you can relax with a view of the boats on the water.
A good way for the shopaholics to spend the day!

Spoiled for choice.. Shopping, eating and entertainment all in one place. Scenic views and a good chance to see the seals close up. Safe place to stroll around at night according to the locals. Some nice views of Table Mountain too.
Vibrant. Shops bars amusements museums art - and fantastic eating opportunities, The USB of course being it is a working port.
Evening Entertainment. Visit the V&A Waterfront for a great evenings entertainment, huge choice of restaurants and activities.
Not bad but just a shopping area by the port . If you are interested to do some shopping then come here. Restaurants and shops are around and you can do a walk around the port
Place to be . Great place to shop and just hangout with lots of fancy restaurants. The high end stores seem to be pricing for the tourist market!

not what you travel a long way for. I felt safe at the V&A, and there are certainly a wide range of restaurants and shops. But I did not find it all that interesting. It felt very similar to other, similar waterfront redevelopment projects in other parts of the western world. I wouldn't discourage anybody from going there, but I would definitely prioritize themany things that are unique and special about Cape Town when planning a trip. The V&A Waterfront doesn't have as much unique local character.

A tourist trap - but a nice one.. Remains of huge success, with a winning combination of shopping, attractions (such as aquarium and big wheel), views of Table Mountain and many restaurants.
