It is also interesting as it is still a commercial harbour with ship movements and a ship repair yard (hours of interest for a bloke to watch- how do they get such big ships out of the water?). Make sure that you visit the seals that are near the clock tower, which is also the departure point for the Robbin's Island tours.More a general comment but be careful of people approach you at cash machines, our colleague got scammed when a cash machine near the Waterfront didn't work and a very 'helpful' passer by tried to assist with the transaction.

Beats San Francisco's waterfront hands down.... Shops, restaurants, the Food Market, Watershed, the statues (shortened) of South Africa's heros (Mandela, Bishop Tutu, Ghandi and more), a kids park, a stage, the famous Clock Tower and the Ticket Office for the Tour to Robbins Island (with tours given by former prisoners...our guide had actually been there with Nelson Mandela).

Nice place to shop and dine. V&A waterfront is a nice, safe environment with access to shopping malls, artisanal stalls and many cafes and restaurants. The red bus tours also start from here, so it is a nice location to have a look around whilst waiting for the next bus. It is quite lively in the evenings with a nice relaxed atmosphere. If looking for a European type restaurant with South African twist try Dan Anchor. The ferry to Robben Island goes from here. if interested in maritime affairs there is a small museum with the harbour's colonial history which also holds exhibitions.

Everything you will Ever Need in One Place!. Restaurants (try Melissa's Bacon Jam, it's sinful!), stores (whole new wardrobe from Woolworth's), movies, souvenirs, boat rides, access to Roben Island... Endless amount of things to see and do!

Victoria and Alfred Waterfront. We stayed in a hotel in V&A Waterfront during 5 days stay in Cape Town. The location is self-sufficient with hotels, restaurants, bars and shopping area etc catering to visitors. It is crowded most of the time in the day, virtually every day during our entire stay. Visitors are mixed with both locals and tourists. Entertainment and eateries aside, it is most important that the area is extremely safe and security guards were visible in most places. One caveat though is that the area is not inexpensive and almost everything situated there is of high-end. There a beach within walking distance toward the sea-front where one can BBQ and enjoy basking in the sun.

Hub of activity. The V&A is a great place to explore, really a lot going on all the time. Would definitely recommend a stop if you are visiting Cape Town. Plenty of great restaurants, yacht cruises and a good base to find info on adventure trips, helicopter rides and much more. Be warned though, it can get very busy, with a lot of tourists.

Lively place to visit. We walked to the Waterfront from the hotel. It took 10min. We really enjoyed our visit to the Alfred Waterfront. We started out with a bite to eat at the Ocean Basket which was recommended by the locals. Ordered seafood platter for 2 with a strawberry milkshake...yummy. Good service. Then proceeded to walk towards some live music playing from an open restaurant. The locals seemed to know each song being played . I enjoyed watching the children dancing in the water fountain. Everyone was having a good time and we ran into very friendly people. Nice shops, street performers and a ground outdoor chess set. I lost to my son:< and the onlookers were cheering us on. It is a nice place to spend for a half day.

Waterfront Wonderland!. A must visit if visiting Capetown this attraction boasts scenic views, spectacular shopping, scrumptious fancy, waterfront dining, fine dining, budget dining food court options.There are plenty of African souvenir shops and craft markets, food markets, amphitheatre with entertainment, buskers playing African rhythmic music. A children's playground with wet and dry play areas. A little train that toots and takes children around the area.It also boasts the Capewheel that has air conditioned cabins that rotates taking visitors to new heights to show them spectacular views of Capetown City. Plenty of seafood restaurants and watering holes for the party animals! A busy, happy, hectic place that also offers all kinds of cruises and adventurous activities or nust a city tour of Capetown. Come at any time, morning or evening, the experience will be refreshing! A must do if you are in Capetown, suitable for all ages.

Huge, Classy and something for everyone !!. A huge shopping mall with a wide range of eateries / bars both inside and outside. If you need something and you can't get it here then just stop loooking !! A lovely place to walk around and take in the wonderfully characterful venue that is the V&A Waterfront.

Amazing part of Cape Town. The V&A waterfront boasts lots of exclusive views of Cape Town. Everything is just so perfect. Things are slightly expensive but worth it. I spent three days in a row there and not a single regret. As you walk along you come across local artists with their instruments, paintings, singing, etc. You can shop till u drop or just enjoy with a few drinks and observe. Totally beautiful view of the table mountain. The big wheel is also right there. feel free to message me with any questions

More than just a shopping mall. The V&A Waterfront is a hangout for tourists and locals. It is a shopping mall with a difference, as it is located in a working harbour. The mall is a mix of designer and regular shops, including various restaurants and coffee shops. In the nicer weather, visitors enjoy the outdoor cafe vibe, while enjoying views of recreational and fishing boats entering and leaving the old harbour. Recreational activities are also on offer, especially in the summer season, such as watching shows at an outdoor ampitheatre, taking a boat trip around the harbour or out into Table Bay, watching local performers busking in the open areas, seal watching, etc. However, there are also indoor activities on offer such as Cave Golf, an Aquarium, a Scratch Patch (for picking up chips of semi-precious stones), Cinemas, etc, so this is a popular venue for any time of the year. Access is within walking distance from the City Centre and the Waterfront is also on the MyCiti Bus Route.

As a tourist - a must, but you need time. If you want a vibe and want to find something to do I have no doubt you will find it here. Could be time consuming so give yourself plenty of time to get around. In the area there is food, drink, art, music, an aqarium, boat trips, people and more people.
relaxing and eating. They have really did a great job renewing this area. It is a safe place to walk around people watch get a bite to eat or drink and just relax and watch people

on tour. on tour with the barmy army i very pleasant area in cape town great views ,and plenty off restaurants and bars a must see area nice boat trip around the harbour or out to robben island nelsons prison

Escape the early winter and Indulge freely at the V&A. The V&A waterfront alows me to shop for my monthly groceries but at the same time be tempted by the many new international shops. I am always amazed at the amount of foreign tourist from many diverse countries visiting this center. This adds a dimension not expiernced in other shopping malls in the area.I can do my banking and pay most of my monthly bills and still be protected from the harsh cold and wet North West wind,is an added bonus.The V&A is part of a living Harbour and has interesting visitors.
Evening out. There is just never ever enough time visiting this front. Shopping is excellent and so is the restaurants and just watching the harbour traffic.....

Shoppers Dream. Talk a long slow walk in this busy attraction where anything and everything is available.. from luxury up market brands, artisan markets, favourite fast food vendors, fine dining establishments and grand harbour views, passing time here is one of my favourite things.

A must!!!. The Cape Town Waterfront is just one of those places that's a MUST on any Cape Town visit. Modern, vast but well laid out, and with breathtaking views across the harbour and majestic Cape Town. It has ample parking but note it gets busy and full quick so get there early. There is a range of restaurants for everybody from junk food outlets to fine dining overlooking the twinkling Atlantic Ocean. Sitting in one of the restaurants watching the world go by should be on your to do list. Shops too many to mention although they are mostly designer and expensive. You definitely need a day to fully enjoy everything the V&A Waterfront has to offer.

Just love the vibe. For young or old, couples or families this is the place to spend a few hours. Lots more to do than just shopping, although the H&M is a drawcard for me. The variety of stores and restaurants caters for all budgets....Just having an ice cream whilst sitting on a bench overlooking the water is just such a relaxing feeling. Many activities take place in the amphitheatre.

Just Chill!. V&A Waterfront is different to, lets say the Caudan Waterfront in Mauritius - as much more & for everyone - families, couples, friends get together, business, solo or only the lonely.......There are exclusive shops with name brands and there is shops which caters for the 'budget' conscious. Open Air Amphitheatre, Kiddies activities, Food courts, Aquarium, Walking distance from the Cape Town Stadium (5mins brisk walk or 10mins slow paced). Visit the coffee shop - Myatt Café & Chocolatier but service can be slow but take time out from all the shopping or browsing.Another eatery to visit at the Red Shed close to the Aquarium - Hoodies Burgers are fantastic. Keep in mind, it is not all about food but the there are stalls for the Health fanatic or just a massage? Clothes galore for everyone. There is a 'Husband Day Care Centre' at the Quay 4 Restaurant for those wanting to go off for some retail therapy (keep in mind...take his credit card). The Eye is located at the V & A Waterfront.Entrance to the actual waterfront is free but parking fee applicable. Keep in mind that if any event taking place at or close to the V&A Waterfront, parking fills up extremely quick thus get there quite early thus check with your Concierge re events close by on that day or preferable, the day before.Exercise fanatics....I am sure that you will do much more than 10 000 steps in the 1st hour.

Retail therapy . The V&A shopping centre. A must for everyone visiting Cape Town. Great shopping...awesome restaurants... Boat rides...ferris wheel...fabulous aquarium...scratch patch for semi precious stones...movies... shopping and much much more. A must do!

Great area!. I stayed in this area and I am so glad that I did because literally everything is centered around here. There are Restaurants, Robbin Island, tour bookings and shopping. You name it, they have it!

So much more than you would expect. I anticipated spending an hour or two here but in fact ended up spending the whole day and still hadn't done everything. I had a leisurely breakfast, strolled the waterfront, visited the unique shops, tasted samples at the food market, a fantastic venue for all dietary requirements, played crazy golf, caught the ferry to Robben Iskand, had a glass of wine at the harbour and dined fine style as the sun set behind the big wheel. I also had a fantastic cheese and wine tasting and pairing at the waterfront. Music played, the sun shone. Just go and do it.
Happy place. It is a nice place, crowded with tourists and families. What I liked most is the happy environment.Outdoors cafes and restaurants add a charming touch to the beautiful layout.

Great shopping outing. The shopping at the waterfront is always great. The big clothing retailers are all there with enough floorspace and their best version of their stores, and there are enough boutique stores to find that something else. The new H&M is great!
Incredibly amazing. Waterfront has beautiful places where one can have fun. Beautiful view of the ships harbour. I had the chance to see seals as well. A fresh breeze from the sea as well.
Best spot in Cape Town. We love the Waterfront for it's vibe,stunning restaurants and the market. The shopping is great as well. It has much to offer for all ages.
Good range of shops and eateries.. An enjoyable experience. We went twice and on both occasions the places we chose were very good. Food and service were excellent.

A very vibrant waterfront!. You can spend several evening strolling along the waterfront packed with tourists shopping and trying the different restaurants!! There is a huge indoor mall. No need to shop anywhere else in Cape Town. The restaurants here are also very good. Should get a reservation as they tend to get very busy.

Beautiful setting with good restaurants and a pleasant shopping experience. There can't be many more beautiful settings in the world to have a nice meal at a reasonable price with such a good selection of shops
Must go in Cape Town. This place is for all ages..lots to see and do..boat trips etc.. nice restaurants..quay 4 a must for good seafood. The big wheel awesome..

Stunning waterfront area !. One of the must see place in Cape Town. Stunning waterfront marina, with lots of restaurants, shopping mall, museums. A must for everyone to walk around, eat , shop ! Dont miss !

A relaxing day out. A great way to spend a day relaxing, plenty of bars, places to eat and if you like shopping there are shops, you can board one of the many boat trips on offer for a few hours out into the bay or just simply wander and explore.As I was only in Cape Town for 6 days with trips and tours for 5 of them I took a day out to relax down at the V & A just across the road is the Springbock museum well worth a visit and you get a free voucher for a drink at a bar in the V & A with the admission fee, food and drink prices are reasonable you can also get a boat to go across to Robben Island

For Foodies & Retail Therapists. Everything is here, yes it's touristy, but the restaurants we tried were of good quality, the shopping was good, local and international brands, start point to adventures/tours like Robben Island etc.

Massive shopping centre! . Seeing is believing.... There are so many shops and restaurants the mind boggles. You need to set aside multiple trips over multiple days to see everything there is to see. I was especially pleased to see seals one night while dining!

Well worth a visit. We arrived in cape town after sailing from Singapore on the aurora. We had arranged to hire a car from Around About Cars which in turn arranged from hire to come from Tempest Car Hire. Around about cars had arranged to collect us at the cruise terminal and take us to the office for Tempest to collect the car. However we phoned Around about cars and arranged for Tempest to deliver the car to the cruise terminal (for an extra fee - 275 rand) - worth every penny when u see the cape town traffic and not really knowing your way around. There are other options -Get it delivered - more expensive but most convenient and less stressful.Use Around about cars and be collected and taken of car hire - still to face cape town traffic and takes longer.There are lots of taxis at the cruise terminal at Duncan dock and it is not too far to any of the car hire offices, so fare would not be too expensive but u still have to face cape,town traffic. If u are heading north on n22 then it is relatively straightforward from cruise terminal but a bit more complicated from central cape town especially if u have not driven in the city before. Cosf was approximately £80 for 5 days plus fuel plus delivery charge. Good value for money.Used the hop on hop,off bus with a 2 day pass - really useful - took u to all the parts u would wish to see. Also did an excursion to Cape point, chapmans peak, simonsfown and wine testing in constancia with Llamburdo tours (not sure of spelling) - good tour and the excursion team were excellent- all booked on line.Endive S
A Must Day or Night. The waterfront is amazing for just pottering,taking in the sights,eating,soveneir or serious shopping.Restaurants range from the posh to the takeaways - something for all.

Spent a lot of time here. Never felt safer!! Securit everywhere which was very reassuing.Such a lovely place we spemt a lot of time here. Nice shops and lots of options for food to suit everyone.Live music, just an absolutely brilliant place. Taxi rank and guys to help you get a taxi also.
Interesting. Very pleasant morning wondering around the Waterfront .. If you have a few hours to kill it's definitely worth a visit ..

One night at the Waterfront. Our visit here was very short, but I've been here before and as always we enjoyed it thoroughly! My teenage boys went on the big wheel while we sat opposite and watched the mini train come around and pick up the little kids to take them around and back again.We went to Quay Four for supper and as usual they were bustling and busy. Situated right on the water with seagulls hovering in the hopes of a patron filling themselves to bursting and leaving some as fair game. Quay Four has very good food and the seafood is highly recommended. There is an atmosphere there that makes you want to stay late into the night with live music playing, loud chatting and jovial laughing going on all around you.We stayed in the Cullinan hotel, which is about 1,3 km from Quay Four, so the evening stroll there and back was quite enjoyable.

Shopping and food. A great place to have a bite to eat. So many places to chose from and many Halaal places that are certified. A great tourist destination for going to visit Robben Island, boat trips around the harbour. Great view of tables mountain. While you there also try the Cape Town eye. There's also a Muslim prayer room at the V & A that caters for Muslim visitors and tourists. You can also take the Red City Tour busses from the waterfront. And if you simply want to shop you can bring a big or small budget there's something for everyone. The Fresh Food market is also a great place to taste what's on offer from the local vendors. Definitely a place you have to visit in Cape Town

Nice Shopping and Dining Options In A Modern Mall. The V&A is a nice place to eat and wander around the shops in Cape Town.There is entertainment and bars as well and the atmosphere is while a bit geared for tourists is very nice. Some wonderful restaurants along the waterfront as well as high end shops make this a nice place to visit in the evenings in Cape Town.

Variety. The V&A Waterfront provides a wide variety of activities to engage families, couples and singles. There are bars & restaurants, supermarkets, (for self caterers) a variety of shops, entertainment in many forms- aquarium, boat rides, bus rides, big wheel, big screen, music and more.Prices are variable from free to high end - while some may be on the high side for S.A., they are mostly cheaper than comparable sites in the UK.Prices for 'souvenir' type shopping are no more expensive than other destinations on the 'Garden Route'

Many things to see/do here. The V&A Waterfront is full of shops, restaurants, and attractions like the aquarium, the Hop On/Off Sightseeing bus stops here, and this is where the ferry to Robben Island departs from/returns to. There are buskers for entertainment. Do watch out for pickpockets, and recommend taking Uber back to hotel at night instead of walking.

Worth the visit. Lovely to walk around. Lots of places to eat and shop. Various activites available, such as helicoper rides and harbour cruises. Wanted to do the Robben Island tour, but one needs to really book this trip in advance as very popular.
Not our Cup of Tea. If you want to go do some shopping like you get at a Mall, go here. A bunch of eating places and the waterfront area is not real attractive.
Entertainment for all. From shopping to entertainment to scrumptious meals the Waterfront has it all. Quay 4 is a well priced value for money pub/bistro.

V&A visit. We spent quite a bit of time at the V&A Waterfront on our recent holiday to Cape Town. There is just so much to do here from boat rides, restaurants, museums and many shopping opportunities to buy those curios. There is something here for adults and children alike. A ride on the Cape Wheel is also a good idea to see this whole area from above. Highly recommended visiting.
Flash visit but enjoyable. We only spend a few hours at the waterfront which has lots of things on offer in safe setting with colonial architecture.

Lovely. I have been to the waterfront a lot over the years. It has some lovely restaurants, nice views and a lot of good shops. There are various activities to choose from for kids and adults e.g. aquaria, scratch patch, market, comedy club, children's playground, amphitheatre with a bit screen, cruises, Robin Island departures etc.

Very nice. Very nice place, clean, fresh and plenty to do.
Highly reccomended, you could spend a couple of days here.

Good but you don't need to go to Africa to see a mall.... When walking around the Victoria & Alfred Waterfront, it is quite a challenge to feel in Africa. This looks more like a mix between a shopping mall and Eurodisney. Shops and restaurants feel like anywhere in Europe or North America.

Beautiful Moments. Beautiful moments don't need to have a heavy price tag. Spent an evening at the waterfront with my pal. We joined in on some xhosa singing and dancing, had a lovely cuppa by the water with lovely view of the numerous yacht parked, did some shopping at the souvenir store and also watched footy on the big screen for free. When next in Cape Town put the V & A waterfront on your to do list........

a total gem of a place. had a great 4 days here sightseeing and travelling around. felt safe and comfortable as long as you remain sensible. Try all the markets esp the guy who sells the Biltong fantastic
Something for everyone. Lots of individual shops as well as 'usual' ones. Great choice of restaurants, lovely views of the bay and Table Mountain. Great place to wander round safely at night.

Good place for shopping. I have visited the Waterfront several times over the past year, and there's always something I had not seen before. Lots of shops to stroll around and find almost anything you can think of, from African art to jewellery or designer clothes.

this place is awesome. head down to V&A for everything you can think of, entertainment, shopping, ferry rides to Robben island, amazing and extensive array of restaurant and cuisines. The vibe is happy and lively, it is a safe area, morning , noon and night. Close to some great accommodation and nearby beach front for a stroll.

A fabulous shopping experience. V & A is a great shopping destination, with many trendy shops as well as luxury shops and many good restaurants both indoors and outside with views of Table Mountain. If you're visiting SA and want to go to one mall, this should be it. You can also take boat trips from the V & A around the harbour or to Robben Island.

Fabulous shopping and eating!. wonderful place to while away a few hours along the waterfront, full of interesting boutiques and shops, and a fun Food Market with unusual items to try out- munch on the Gourmet Samosas, with unusual fillings, and slurp on a Bubble Tea, which I'd never heard of before but loved!

Very picturesque and lively atmosphere!. We walked here from our hotel and ended up spending the entire day just strolling through, browsing the various shops. Really great way to spend the day. A must visit.

Waterfront Fun. Lots of people,and people watching.Lots of shops, so you can browse or buy.Lots of restaurants,we had barbeque. The day we were there, lots of entertainment. A lot of people were fascinated by a luxury boat that was docked. I would say the waterfront was lots of fun!
Such a buzz. A fantastic place to shop, stay, have a meal, have a drink or just chill out. A fabulous setting in a working harbour.

For Dining, Shopping or Just a Stroll. The Victoria and Alfred Waterfront is essentially a mall on the water. Lots of places to eat with a wide range in both foods and price. Obviously there are many restaurants serving fish, but other menu choices also abound. Not hungry? No problem because you can work up an appetite just strolling around and enjoying the lovely views and perhaps shopping for some souvenirs. ATM machines are easy to find, but just about everyone takes credit cards in lieu of rand notes.

Probably not the reason you came to Cape Town. Seriously - you came here for the ocean and spectacular views. Still when you feel like a bit of entertainment, shopping and civilization - this is a seriously fun place to be. Stroll to the food market, go shopping in the mall and just sip a beer whilst people watching. We enjoyed it as a day off from our kiting trip.

The city within a city.. We found the waterfront to be an exciting place to visit. It has lots of shopping areas and restaurants. However, shopping here is rather pricey and you would rather go to other places within the city for better prices. However, most other shopping areas in Cape Town close down as early as 5.30pm while The Waterfront remains open until 9pm.

Tourist hotspot. Great place to visit for all Tourist and even locals - a nice change from the normal scene, make you feel like a tourist in your own city. Prices are aimed at tourists but still a great time to be had - nice shops and awesome scenery of the bay and Table Mountain.

Touristy, but worth a visit.. The V&A Waterfront is definitely only for tourists. We had a taxi driver to the airport tell us that as a local, he's never been been there because he can't afford it! It's made up of hotels, shopping and a huge luxury mall. It doesn't feel super authentic, but it's definitely worth visiting, especially for dining and shopping. We ate at the mall on our first night in town at Willoughby & Co. It was highly rated and when we realized it was actually in the mall, it felt a little odd. (The meal was good though!) The V&A Waterfront is not lacking in shopping, but our favorite place at the Waterfront was The WaterShed, which was a huge building turned into a market, selling art from local vendors. We picked up a lot of nice art and souvenirs there. I do recommend visiting the Waterfront for a walk on the boardwalk or a nice dinner, but I am glad we didn't end up staying here. While it's a hub for activity and a great central location, it seems like it would have been noisy for sleeping.

Nice but very touristic. VA Waterfront is touristic kind of boulevard by the harbour and ocean. There are lots of shops en restaurants. Nice to walk through. If you are really shopping for souvenirs it is better to go to market in Cape Town. They sell the same products but it is much cheaper. There is also a nice view window were you can pose in front of the Table Mountain. Makes a nice picture.

Amazement. We stayed about 10 mins walk from the Waterfront and ate there every night of our stay. There are numerous places to eat and prices to suit all pockets. On our first day we strolled round taking in the atmosphere and the views, an excellent one of Table Mountain. We had a ride on the big wheel there and had our photos taken just to prove we were there! There are so many shops, bars, cafes, restaurants and hotels, too many to count. The place is a really good place during the day but it is at night that it really comes to life, music, lights and everyone just enjoying themselves.

A great experience. Everything, from the real-time update on how many parking bays are available at any moment at any of the many parking garages to the running of the various water activities on offer - works very well indeed. The ice-cream is over priced.
Stunning Time at the Waterfront. We visited the Waterfront on a splendid day weather-wise. The sun was shining. Very little wind and lovely and warm. It was beautiful.

A must see in Cape Town. . If Table Mountain is a must see in the natural side, the waterfront is a must see on the man made side. Great views. Good food. Better shopping..and much of it high end.
Tip: go to Woolworths food court and buy a picnic lunch.

Wonderful Atmosphere. Well,worth a visit - a major attraction. Don't spend all your time around here however though as very touristy. great restaurants in the city and safe to get too - just take a taxi

Nice for shop fanatics . It is a nice area for eating, shopping and buying souvenirs. There is also a nice look out point very you can make a beautiful picture of Table Mountain. The area has magnificent old buildings.

Tourist heaven!. Very successful redevelopment of a once thriving dock, although it is still a working port. The area has some great restaurants, gift shops, bars and a shopping mall. The converted warehouses have some interesting local craft stalls and some wonderful eateries/snack bars. Well worth a visit, During the weekend it's worth booking in advance if you want to eat at one of the restaurants.

Fun place to stroll around. The Waterfront is much larger than I expected. We had a nice time wandering around the different parts goon in and out of boutiques, stopping for a glass of wine, coffee and a bite of food. There were fun musical street performers too. Overall a nice place to shop and dine. We felt very safe.

dissapointing, souveniers and huge amounts of tourists.... local shopping such as in Kloof street.Just a crowded place with a lot of restaurants and frankly quite boring shops. Most of whom sell the same tourist centered souveniers.No interesting buys whatsoever.when in Capetown focus on other aspects that you can not fins anywhere else; nature and some parts with

A very picturesque area with a great view of Table Mountain. A great area to stroll, eat and soak in the scenery. There is a shopping mall for those who need a little retail therapy. A fabulous bakery called Vovo Telo that made the most delicious selection of freshly baked bread and coffee to match. There were also a couple of art galleries for wonderful local art as well as African Trading Port for souvenirs. It is also a wonderful example of biscuit tin Dutch architecture.
Breakfast lunch and dinner. What a great place to eat with views of the Quay and ocean. Large verity of restaurants. Great vibe lovely shops movies museums etc a must visit when in Cape Town
It never sleeps. An extraordinary experience at the V&A. There is something to do for everyone when it comes to shopping...

Lively, entertainment, food, shopping. Victoria & Alfred Waterfront area is probably the best place is cape town for tourists to go to in the evening. When in cape town, we would mostly do day tours that would end at about 5 (this is generally standard time for day tours to end). after short refreshment in our hotel, we would head out to the V&A waterfront. this place really comes alive in the evening. the area is also the safest to be in during late hours (would like to mention that many parts of cape town can get notorious post evenings). food here is excellent, there is a little bit of all cuisines. you will find outlets of all brands here. there is even a movie theater. just outside the V&A wharf there are often live performances, singing, magic shows, etc - these are free to all and are at times quite interesting

V&A Wasterfront - what a tourist's delight. Very well marked, clean and all facilities are disabled friendly. We had lunch at Quay Four - fish and salad was excellent, however service was bad. Shops are expensive for SA citizens. Overall a good day's outing with lots to see. A facility to be proud of even though it appears to cater primarily for overseas visitors.

Anniversary trip. My wife and I were in Cape Town for our 20th anniversary. V&A was the first stop on our tour and we had a lovely day. The weather was perfect, the atmosphere on that Easter Week holiday was buzzing with so many people and we really enjoyed our day. We had lunch on a cafe terrace with the famous Table Mountain in our view and met so many nice people. Definitely worth a visit if your in town.
Nice place. So it's a shopping center but it's got vibe  Even for the husband there is enough to do and plenty to see. Just people watching is fun

Cool Afternoon . The V & A Waterfront was a perfect first stop in our time in Cape Town. It was great to walk around and check out the shops, the restaurants and the sights. A must do while in Cape Town.

A shopping mall of the type you will find the world over. The old buildings are beautiful. But otherwise, this is a shopping mall like any other. Inside, all character is lost. Chain stores abound. If you want to go shopping, I am sure this place is great. But it is being touted as the number one attraction in Cape Town when surely that should be Table Mountain or Robben Island? Shopping on holiday is fun - but a shopping mall is not a tourist attraction and ought not to be the number one attraction! Too many tourists are also coming here to eat mediocre food at themed, corporate restaurants. Go visit Chefs Warehouse or The Black Sheep, find something more individual with more heart.

Amazing food and shopping. We had meals here at nighttime and lunchtime- both equally as wonderful. I would recommend taking a coat at night as it can get a little chilly/windy.If you're from the uk, the exchange rate gets you some fantastic food for very little money. My highlight was yellow tail sushi - beautiful!
Fun on the Waterfront. Made a couple of visit so much to do. loads of energy and different things happening all over the place. really fun.

Waterfront Wonder. A stunning place to shop, dine, relax and enjoy fabulous views of Table Mountain, hoping the fog is not obscuring the view. Most of the restaurants even offer blankets to keep you warm on the veranda as the sun sinks on chilly autumn evenings.

Shopping paradise . This is a very well spaced out shopping center .International and local brands.Very good food choices Ample parking The pick and pay supermarket is very well stocked and well priced

Good. This place is good lots of shops etc lots of places to eat I think it's defiantly geared towards tourism especially some of the prices.There are shops that sell African bits and bobs carvings etc I found these to be a bit expensive,tip:if you like African bits and bobs stop at one of the lay-bys between Camps Bay and Llandudno you see locals selling loads of that stuff,other than that the Waterfront has loads of good pubs and that,also you get your activities sellers here,boat tours,helicopter rides etc.

It's a mall. If you find that you need something, there's a good chance that they'll have it. The location is on the waterfront. The building looks like an old train or more likely ferry building or fish market with beautiful architectural elements. What more can you ask for?

Loved this place... This place is busy and lots of activities in the vicinity. It has lot of food variety with wellknown restaurant around. The boat ride to robben island, city sightseeing tours, giant wheel, casino, acquarium. Just a caution, make prior arrangement on return cab if you are leaving late say after 7 from this place as many taxi ask for more and there isnt much option with the bus service in the evening.
A must for shoppers. My wife needless to say spent a lot of time here and the Watershed was where one could find home made African art, clothing, and glass at reasonable prices.

This is a "must" stop when in Cape Town. We enjoyed a multi-hour walk around the waterfront, enjoying the people watching, the number and variety of shops and restaurants. We returned on 2 occasions to enjoy dinner and a wine tasting.
Wonderful Place for a Stroll, Entertainment and Food. Fascinating area with mix of private yachts, tug-boats, restaurants, museums, hotels, and people. Never a dull moment!
tourist attraction. Love seeing the beautiful hand made art in the very unique shops and hearing the many tourists and acsents supporting our country.

Shopping and more shopping. The Victoria and Alfred Waterfront offer a lot to tourists. Not only do they have a world class shopping mall but they also have two markets that offer something for everyone. The food market have a variety of eats and the local market offer handmade RSA goods for the discerning traveller. The restaurants are quite expensive and you must consult the menus before sitting down for dinner because some of the menus are limited. Overall a great place to see the sunset over Table Mountain.

V& A Waterfront. The view is lovely. Meet many tourists, from different countries. Wonderful artists. Lots of things to shop. The people are friendly and all the restaurants do their best with the dishes. My personal restaurants that stands out is San Marco. It serves great food. Perfect location and very clean.

Shopping, sipping, slurping, sunset views.... With the addition of the Food Lover's shed, even the shrewd backpacker now has access to food food, snacks and beverages. Vegan and Paleo options are more plentiful here than on some menus in the mall and may even be prepared in front of you. The flea market is quite pricey even by tourist standards. Take a pic with the Big 4 and meander your way along. The mall itself offers flagship shops and myriad of boutiques. If you are here to shop - rather hop to Canal Walk for a larger selection.

Love the V&A Waterfront. Encore Theatrical Arts Project performed a free show at the amphitheater (WOW - what talent!). So many restaurants and shops! We made several trips to the Waterfront during our recent trip.
When in Rome. Great shopping, often very pricey, great foodie experience, and up and coming. This should be a must on any visit to the area.

If you love shopping and good food...... Shopping heaven and lots of choices eating wonderful classy well presented food - a foodie paradise even for those on a budget. We spent hours here walking shopping browsing and eating and still didn't do it justice!

��Great for cocktails��. This is a cockail bar review only. We stopped here for cocktails twice during our stay. There's a really good choice at around 50 rand each and you can sit on the verandah and watch the world go by .... very relaxing and worth waiting for the sometimes slow service. Check out the Fynbos cocktail - delicious!

A nice place to have dinner or spend an afternoon. Some good restaurants here, but can get crowded during peak times. I went on the Monday after Easter and it was pretty packed. There is plenty of shopping available, but the highlight are the restaurants and on a nice day, al fresco dining. Don't miss the the area where Woodies burgers is; I can't remember the name. In that building there is even more great food as well as an amazing waffle I had at For the Love of Yummyness (as soon in the picture). Woodies is apparently the best burger in Capetown as there was a long line, however I went to a place called Gibson's and ordered some pork ribs. Sooo good! There are street performers here as well, which makes the V&A Waterfront a good place for families to visit together.

Alot to do for everyone. We went on the "big" wheel but what my 6 year old daughter preferred was the kids play area just next to the wheel. She spent over an hour playing with all the other kids there and didn't want to leave. It's free and it's fun so budget some time for the kids to enjoy themselves there.
Pleasant afternoon!. We spent a few hours walking around the waterfront. There were a lot of food merchants and street entertainment. The lunch possibilities are endless!

Touristy but a great central location. We found it a great base from which to see Cape Town but it is what it is. Good shops. A number of attractions. Food is good but can be expensive and there are excellent restaurants outside the V and A

Lovely area with Restaurants and shops. This is a lovely area with great views of Table Mountain, is really a huge shopping mall with restaurants, very safe as patrolled, very European in feel. Always enjoy going and enjoy an outdoor meal, also often has good local buskers.

Plenty to do to amuse old and young - worth a visit. A buzzing vibrant place. Lots of excursions depart from here (Jolly Roger was the children's favourite) and shops. The shops are in a large mall with lots of designer brands represented (Gucci, Louis V, Burberry). Prices higher than UK on the label but a little cheaper with tax back. Some decent restaurants too. Scratch patch was enjoyed by the children too.
Nice place. It is a nice area to walk around, have some coffee or meal, enjoy shopping and taking nice pictures. It is always full of people and it is also safe.

Hustle and bustle with a view. We visited the Victoria & Alfred Waterfront in the late afternoon to find a spot to enjoy food and drink and people watch. We saw a few street performers, locals and tourists alike enjoying the walk along the harbour. You might even spot a seal! Also, it felt very safe - for those who feel nervous walking around.You have views of Table Mountain in the distance and of the harbour. Besides walking and eating there are cool shops to pick up souvenirs, there is a shopping mall nearby and there are a few fun rides - a Ferris Wheel and trampoline bungee.If you're going to eat you are spoiled for options; however, the places do seem to fill up quickly so make a booking or come early. Enjoy!

Lots to see & do at the V&A Waterfront. We just returned from a trip to South Africa with Smartours. We stayed at a central hotel, which provided a free shuttle to/from the V&A Waterfront. We used the shuttle each day of our stay, to go for dinners and to get to the starting point of the Robben island tour. The waterfront area is huge and it's a "happening" place -- lots of shops & restaurants, entertainment. Also has an interesting "swing" bridge (the bridge literally swings out of the way when tall boats need to pass through the area -- much faster than a lift-bridge) There are almost 100 restaurants, of every variety, to choose from. The "Cape Wheel" is a great place to get a view of the surrounding area -- similar to the London Eye and the ferris wheel at Chicago's Navy Pier.

A great place for tourists . There's a lot to do and see at the waterfront! Definitely worth a visit! So many good sight seeing places begin there including the robben island tour, diamond museum, aquarium and many restaurants to choose from.

Lively, vibrant and well-worth a visit. The V&A is the old waterfront docks which, like many similar places around the world, has been given a new lease of life as a place to eat, shop and soak up the atmosphere. There is very good shopping in the mall(s) and a plethora of restaurants at different price points and with many different food types.There is frequent street entertainment - musicians and other acts - which adds to the excellent atmosphere. We always felt safe here and would highly recommend it as a place to visit for tourists and locals alike.
Touristy destination. Lively spot for shoppnig. Whole variety of experiences. However, if you want to get a real feel for Cape town, stick to the streets such as Long street and the city.

Beautiful place to shop and or eat. There are so many shops here and they are all s reasonably priced!You will be spolit for choice when it comes to restaurants! The port is stunning and the vibe is buzzing. People are so nice and it feels very safe. Great spot to buy souvenirs too.

Used to be sterile - much more established now. Two tears ago, this was like any other shopping / entertainments centre on the planet with smacking scenery.It has improved a lot. The food establishments are excellent and good value. The tours are plentiful. The whole place is clean and safe.Worth a day of your trip. Id recommend the helicopter flight. But shop around. There are a few operators and they compete with each other. We had our own chopper for a 20 minute flight for R3500. Prices ranged up to R6000
beautiful at sunset. Nice restaurants and shopping. Good easy place to stay when you start your visit of Cape townLovely market
Great place to stroll around and simply enjoy. Great restaurants, local entertainment and so much more. Great boat trips and great place to spend New Years Eve - out on the water.

Fun Shopping. A good place to shop, get food and people watch. I feel safe here and enjoy the experience .
I like staying near the waterfront and enjoying this scenic location .

Shopping and Entertainment. Walk along the harbor with a huge selection of restaurants. shops and entertainment. Because of the high percentage of tourists the shops may not have the best prices in Cape Town-but great for people watching and browsing.
Beautiful . I really want to go back to capetown! Can't get over the beauty! the marine world in within walkin distance and there is a shopping mall and plenty of restaurants! we had a lovely day

Good for restaurants and a stroll. The V&A waterfront has some nice restaurants. Extremely inexpensive & of course fresh seafood. It's cool to go have dinner & take a stroll. But there isn't any great shopping or much else to see. You don't need to plan a lot of time here.
City Centre. It is a MUST DO when visiting Cape Town. Really nice restaurants, attractions like the Aquarium, Rugby museum, boat trips, whale watching tours, Hop on Hop off bus & shopping places.

Great People-Watching, Love the many boats!. While every waterfront is touristy, V&A maintains a welcoming and safe atmosphere for shopping, dining, and taking a sunset cruise. We did just that, and enjoyed sailing out of the waterfront at day and being greeted with many colored lights as we returned after dusk. Reminiscent of Boston's Faneuil Hall or Chicago's Navy Pier, the V&A Waterfront gives you a great feel for the Dutch influence in this city, as well as an entry-level introduction to Cape Town for Westerners that may be the farthest from home they've ever been.

Excellent Dining and Shopping. Great mall atmosphere with many restaurants and stores. A little touristy and pricey though however nice for a rainy day. Had a wonderful dinner at Quay 4 at a table overlooking the marina and capetown at night. That was spectacular and my first meal in Capetown.

Amazing views. The V &A Waterfront area has everything in one spot for the busy tourist - entertainment, amazing views of Table Mountain and the waterfront, shopping galore and restaurants of all varieties.You can book a boat or helicopter trip and whilst you wait have a great meal or do a bit of shopping.

A Good European setup in South Africa. V&A (Victoria and Alberta) offers a good view of Cape Town port. The place can be easily mistaken for a European square with loads of fine dining restaurants, open pubs, an activity amphitheater and a giant wheel. Victoria Wharf also has a mall estd in 1992. The place buzz with people in evening and offers a good hang out with friends and family. A must visit place is V&A Food market.

Eat,shower,stroll. Lots to do here. Very classy waterfront development that meets all tastes. Make sure you browse the indoor food market and snack on a multitude of local delicacies instead of a more formal restaurant lunch.

Touristy but Fun. The V&A waterfront is the place to be for entertainment in Cape Town. Good shopping, hotels, and restaurants abound. The best spot for interesting local art and crafts is The Water Shed. You'll meet artists and support them, while finding beautiful things, some of which you won't see anywhere else in SA. Not everything is unique, but much is. And it's primarily very high quality.
Great area to wander around. This area had a great atmosphere with lots going on. Lots of little shops and restaurants etc. Lovely views of table mountain in the distance. A very nice area.
Fantastic atmosphere. Lots of happy people, resturants with tasty food / drink, super mall to shop. Almost like peer 39 i San Fransisco.Very recommended!
Disappointing. I was glad i was not in a hotel on the Waterfront, as it is more like a big shopping mall than part of a beautiful city.
Beautiful!. Vibrant, exciting, lots to see and do at the waterfront!The shopping was incredible! Very crowded due to Easter holiday and Marathon.

Endless hours of relaxation . If you are in CT then V&A is the place to visit! A Marina and waterfront that houses a mall, an aquarium, numerous cafes and pubs, restaurants, clothing and fashion stores, antique stores, a specialised market for handicrafts and unique items, entertainment and is also the gateway to Robben Island and other places. The waterfront comes alive in the night as the impromptu African band members dance and play their songs for tourists, the Giant wheel takes you up for an incredible view of the city, the pubs dish out martinis an the fine dining restaurants offer delicious fresh sea-food, while the French cafes offer baguettes, crepes and yummy desserts! The Waterfront Hotel is a beautiful structure. The Aquarium is at a walking distance. The Hop on and off bus station is opposite the aquarium. The waterfront is a huge area and you can spend endless hours just chilling here sipping on some great South African wine. The waterfront is also home to seals during the summer near the Robben Island Ferry area. It's a must visit for CT tourists!

Great Shopping, Great Food & Great Atmosphere. There is something for everyone here as it covers a large area containing the port, shopping malls and open air restaurants. Great for just strolling, relaxing over coffee or browsing. Its a must see when in Cape Town.

Great atmosphere!. We walked through en route to the aquarium and then ambled back again for shopping and lunch. The live music created a great atmosphere. It was busy but not noticably so, as the area is large. The sound of the seagulls and the magnificent views of the mountain and signal hill covered in clouds is always special and never gets old. I also appreciate the obvious security personnel present everywhere.

Shopping, Arts and Nature. Great place to do some shopping although a lot more expensive than the local areas due to it being a tourist attraction.It is the base for many tourist things to do such as visit Robbin Island, Hop on Hop off Bus, Scratch Patch, Habour tours and Sunset cruises and AquariumThere is also a food Shed that has stunning options for the hungry visitors.Be sure to visit the hand crafted shed as well for some genuine South African products.

International Shopping Experience. V & A Waterfront is wonderful shopping destination with both middle income and top of the range designer shops. We had a great shopping experience with my wife from clothing, spa therapy to electronics.
leisure. Great place for teenagers and young children.lots of kids activities as well as boutique outlets for teenagers.

Amazing waterfront views. The V&A is a must when you are in Cape Town simply because it is a beautiful looking harbour. There are loads of eateries in the area with lovely views. If you have loads of money, you can shop around but you will find many of these shops everywhere else. We didn't get a harbour cruise but there are quite a few cruise operators available.
People Watching. Good restaurants, great for people watching. Lovely hotels and boat trips. Have a glass of wine and enjoy all that is going on around you.

Go to the Market. The majority of stuff at the Waterfront is available elsewhere for cheaper. But the craft market is pretty cool and ha quite a lot to offer. Once again it is quite expensive but you might find something that is worth it.

Great Relaxing Venue. Always great to wander around this venue. They always have new and interesting displays . Great for clothes shopping. Very nice choice of restaurants.Well worth visiting several times!

V&A Waterfront. Interesting attraction with lots and lots shops, restaurants and entertainment. There is too much to see and do in one day. You need 2 to 3 days to explore and appreciate the whole waterfont area. It is very clean and safe.

good food and a great atmosphere. Visited thus attraction both during the day and in the evening during a cruise in February 2016. Great food at lunchtime in the Food Shed and the atmosphere in the evening was fantastic with lots of families out and about, folk queuing at the many restaurants, musicians and the big wheel adding to the experience.
Average.. I was expecting more. Slightly let down with the same shopping malls you get all over SA. One or two nice restaurants. Recommend the Cape Town Fish Market and Bascule.
V & A Waterfront. A vibrant and buzzing environment .Full of ancient and modern buildings . loads of restaurants couple of pubs aquarium shopping crafts access to Robben Island. ITS JUST BUZZING
One stop at ocean. What a great place...one stop for shopping in all weather untill 9pm daily...covered parking hundreds of restaurants and shops...

Epic Breefing. Was busy as only the waterfront can get with a big event. The fact that the Epic expo was moved to top parking lot opened up a lot of congestion of previous years. Went on the big wheel and must say was quite worth it after wondering about it for 3 years. Best time is sunset, that is when the city come alive.
The Cape Town's popular place. You need to take time and enjoy walking in Waterfront. You could spend time with shopping, nice dining and just looking at people.

Lovely Stay on a very busy weekend... I will definitely stay again. At the waterfront and with immediate access to all the amenities, we were grateful for the parking as it was a very busy weekend at the waterfront. The porters were fantastic. The rooms were perfect with great views. Room service was quick and professional. Quite a serene experience considering the crowds at our doorstep.

A must do for CapeTown fun in the day or evening . There is so much to do on the waterfront, from shopping for local souvenirs, up market brands, bars, restaurants, live music and plenty of people! This for many is the centre point of many days and evenings out. Whilst there is lots else to see in CapeTown, you could spend days in the waterfront without leaving and have plenty to do. This is also the place where you can start lots of boat tours including the Robben Island tour.

Much to see and do. V&A waterfront offers many delights for shoppers as there are a variety of fashion stores. The centre also offers many options for restaurants and cuisines from take aways to specialities. There are many activities for kids, adults and families. The harbour area overs many cruises or boat rides which is a must see and do during a sunset in the summer time.Some activities can be pricey. But well worth a a full day trip.

Simply beautiful. It's an awesome place, full of music, people, good food ,nice shops and lights. It's the perfect Place to go for shopping, having dinner or just hang out with your friends...especially if you are a tourist
Busy busy busy. A must do when in Cape Town, exciting, vibrant, interesting, plenty to do and see. A great place to shop and support local crafts

Wonderful place. This is a wonderful place if you like all things nautical. It's got lots of attractions, restaurants, cafes, shopping centre, and is very busy and vibrant. At night, entertainers take to the stage in the public areas.

When in Cape Town, a must for a day (or half a day). V & A Waterfront, has a mall that has something for every budget. There are also African markets, the food market, tons of restaurants etc. It does tend to get crowded. I can only assume it is worse peak season. Kids enjoyed taking a break and playing on the playground. Ferris wheel was a nice ride too. Great views of Table mountain from where we were having lunch.
Shopoholics Delight. If you like shopping, this is THE place to visit when next in Cape Town. Plenty of variety and lots of great shops and restaurants. A day spent here is a must for your itinerary.

A fun place to start.. If you like to spend time in a city and you like touristy things to do, this I can recommend. It is fun, good foods, nice gifts. So many things to watch while sipping a gin and tonic.

V and A Waterfront. A nice place to catch a ride to Robben Island however a bit stinky and we battled with Halaal outlets that offer fine dining with no alcohol. Parking fee is ridiculously over priced.

A must visit in Cape Town. We don't visit Cape Town without at least one outing to the V&A Waterfront. The location is superb and we always try and time it for just before sunset with a dinner at one of the many fine restaurants later.Wondering through the various shops and stalls is always fun, and the main mall allows you to do a grocery shop while there.Easy place to spend a few hours and enjoy the fantastic Cape Town ambiance.

It's a mall. I was hoping it'd be more than a mall from I had seen with the nice restaurants by the harbour but no. Lots of shops though, and some dedicated to outdoor activities in case you forgot something before going to the Kruger park !
Not to be missed. Something for everyone here. History trail boat trips music and buskers craft market and umpteen eating outlets. Also a great view of Tabke Mountain
So much to see and do. We went almost daily just because it had everything that we needed and a huge shopping selection and tourist things all wrapped up in one.

disappointing. considering all the hype about this place it is a bit of a let down, and, other than the views of Table Mountain could be anywhere in the world. The shopping centre is huge if that is what you want. There are several restaurants around the area, but because the Waterfront gets busy you will be kept waiting for your meal.

Stroll through the little shops and markets. While we were here there were a couple of live music groups performing which were superb and definitely added to the atmosphere. We went and had a coffee and browsed through the little stalls with lots of hand made crafts which were lovely

Very nice tourist trap :-). This is a tourist trap, but for good reasons. Here you find a mall, a wide variety of different bars and restaurants, a Ferris wheel and, quays and boats other things to do and look at. And a lot of people. What more can a tourist wish for?

Great Shopping and Great Views. Loved the outdoor restaurants with good food and great views. I enjoyed the mall with the nice stores to buy African merchandise. There were also nice stores along the wharf, and the ferry was right there to Robben Island. Our hotel provided shuttle service, so my husband and I went there most evenings.

A real Buzz about the V&A. There is a real holiday feel about the V&A, plenty of restaurants, good choice/value. The shops are generally tourist traps but only what you would expect from such a vibrant location

Lots of things to do for both young and old!. There are lots of nice shops of all price categories, restaurants from fast food joints to elegant restaurants, a big cinema (it is supposed to be 2 different cinemas there, but the small cinema did not have any signs any longer where to find it), There are some rides to take for the children. There is usually one comedian who has an outdoor show. There is a small train which is popular for families with young children, It is also nice just to walk around. There are also quite a few tours one can book.

A great place to wander around and see the various sites. Had a great time just wandering around seeing the various things to see. There were a few different bands playing African music and i bought some CD's of theirs. A great thing to watch was the swinging bridge that opened up when a boat went under it. Nice places to eat as well. They had a walking tour to see various things, but was a bit complex to follow and we had to give that up after a few tries. Lots of fun.

average. don't know what all the fuss is about. it felt a bit boring. the mall is nothing special, the restaurants are average. as a tourist you should probably still go there because you can find and book some trips there that i didn't find elsewhere.

Nice but very commercial. If you are visiting and don't have a car, this is a good place to stay hear too - they are good food options, shopping and tourist jumping off points. There is also a cheesy mall to be avoided and several 'African' shops, but it is Africa after all.

A must to visit . Nice restaurants and shops at the same place, with some design products been sold and a wide range of couisines. Amazing view from the sea and Table Mountain. The Aquarium is awesome. Remind me the Puerto Madero in Buenos Aires although I felt V&A with a more vibrant scene.
Fabulous place to go. We spent quite a bit of time here - had 3 meals here, bit of shopping and helicopter ride - great place with so much choice - felt safe and secure and enjoyed our time here.

The perfect Tourist mall. The mall is extensive and actually worth more than one visit. There is lots to do for the children and a variety of food options from the exclusive to the budget. Get a proper map of the V&A Waterfront to ensure that you experience it all. The Cape Wheel is worth the experience and reasonable in terms of costs. Shops as well cater for exclusive tastes and those on a budget. My kids say that Hamley's Toy Shop is the best that they have seen in South Africa

Active Social Hub. Although a tad touristy it's a must to visit on a trip to Cape Town. 100% safe to wander about, snack drink and shop. Very high standard mall of a decent size and with a food court although the choice of bars and restaurants surrounding is huge. Our favourite stop off point was Quay 4 as a good all rounder. Shall be back.

V&A awesomeness. V&A is exactly what it says on the tin a retail and restaurant haven in the edge of the city. I visited 3 years after it opened and revisited 20 years later to find its expanded with a fab watershed crafts and arts offer, big wheel, cinema etc. Lots of choice for everyone's taste and budget for eating and shopping and hassle free compared to Cape Town city centre. Security is high so it's nice to walk around in normality for visitors, not having to clutch your handbag for fear of crime and safe to walk around in evenings was a revelation after dining all week in the city centre. Lots of great historic sites and information, exhibitions really educational.good programme of busking performers during day and evenings who don't hassle but deserve a good tip, they are all talented and working hard. It's a bit of a walk from some city locations and a free shuttle service would enhance the ease to get there, but there's a good bus service and taxi ranks. Very clean toilets in shopping centre, great harbour and quayside views, fantastic public art exhibitions and sculptures on site add to the atmosphere and photographic setting...a must visit location
Nice atmosphere!. A.Great vibe..Lots of restuarants..friendly people and shopping! A lovely day out... Very clean and well maintained. And good entertainment!

Nice day out when in Cape Town. Cape Town offers a lot of things to do when visiting, but spending a day at the Waterfront is definitely recommended.The shopping centre has multiple floors with a massive choice of shops and brands, as well as some cafés/restaurants. There is also a lot of parking available.The outside area is vibrant and colourful with all sorts of boats in the harbour and traditional, stylish buildings. Here you can check out a lot of other restaurants and shops as well as a market hall. The Ferris wheel offers a pretty good view of the whole complex too and of course, table mountain is visible from the whole Water Front. The aquarium is also a short but interesting experience.On a sunny day especially, this place is a great day out and should be done but not prioritised when visiting Cape Town, as it is just a day of shopping and good food but in a beautiful area.

Through Cape Town. We came to this popular venue as a base to visit Cape Town and Robben Island. If you are sporty consider booking a cycle tour of the city from the info point (awlon) that starts at 10AM and is definitely worth it! Make sure to book your tour of Robben Island in advanced as tickets are limited. If your luggage is stolen or delayed as it happened to us, this is a good place where to buy all you may need.
Shops and restaurants. Shops for all tastes as are the restaurants. Coffee at the Bakery is worth stopping for and try their bread
V & A waterfall ∼ nice. The V & A waterfall is definitely must see place where you can have a nice view of the harbour and a lot of shopping to do

A stroll through the waterfront.. Lots of high end hotel accomodation. Plenty of people wandering through irrespective of day, time or weather. The newly opened crafters shed offers lots on offer for the eye. Its a working harbour, so there is always something happening. Have fun and spend lots of money, thats good for Cape Town. Visit the visitors centre to find out all what can be done in and around the city and surrounds.

Shopping and leisure paradise. There is so much to do at the V&A. It's way more than a mall. In my opinion given the location and scenic views there is nothing like this that I have seen on my international travels.

Must go. Nice area to go for walking, with a lot of shops, restaurants and even beer brewery. There is something for everyone from boat trips, helicopter rides, wide range of restaurants, aquarium, gift shops, museum, local craft shops, jewellery.
Fun area to start your Cape adventure. The waterfront offers a lot of options for shopping and eating. This is also where you will catch ferries to Robben Island. Definitely do a ferriswheel ride.

vibrant must visit area. Loads to do and see.Huge choice of places to eat and drink,shop or simply people watch.One can wander around for hours watching the comings and goings from the quays or listening and watching the live entertainment.

Easy shopping experience. Good quality vendors, excellent food market, and great outdoor seating/cafes. Definitely an upmarket tourist area, but it probably works for most tourists. Safe and comfortable.

Must visit!!. This is a great addition to this city. Lots of shops (mostly expensive) variety. Lots of restaurants and eating places to suit all tastes and pockets. Safe place to go at night and great for people watching. A glass of dry white wine was just over £1 a glass. Bargain!! It has its own 'london eye' for a different view of the city.

Perfect Cape Town Location. We have stayed here several times and intend to return next year. There is just about something for everyone from boat trips, helicopter rides, wide range of restaurants, aquarium, gift shops, museum, local craft shops, jewellery (all prices) and room to just wander around and watch the wild life or people! There are fur seals in the marina and box jellyfish in the water. South Africa has a reputation for being unsafe but here there is a strong security presence. Just don't wander around out of town isolated unlit areas at night. We stay normally for four nights at the V & A.
Great place. Very buzzy, lots to offer for all types. Good shops for all aspects and pockets. Food all cuisines catered for. Buskers offering a stop to relax and go with the mood. Loved it

Visit to the Aquarium and Water Shed at the V&A Waterfront in Cape Town. the Aquarium opens at 9.30 every day and there is a tiered parkade opposite a hundred metre walk to the entrance. The displays of fish, coral, seaweed and penguins are fascinating and children of all ages love it. I took my nine year old grand-daughter yesterday before the Easter weekend. She appreciated watching a microscopic view on screen of a barnacle and how it feeds and grows its shell around it. I had not realized that barnacles are alive before. Penguins are fed at 11.45 am every day and information is given about them and their steady decline around the world while this is done. Enormous sharks and sting rays circle with countless other species of fish in a large tank in a room with seating where parents can sit and watch too. There are also supervised play rooms where smaller children can draw or paint or play in sandpits.We return every school holiday and have learnt so much as well as having fun. Cannot recommend it too highly.
Shopping, shopping, shopping. Great place to find everything all in one location A lot of security, felt very safe. Easy access. Bus, taxi, shuttles
great place to visit. this is a must when in cape town for shopping and spending time by the harbour in one of the many fantastic restaurants.if you are lucky ou may see the seals in the habour

Wonderful and Exciting. Fantastic experience at the V & A.Lots to do. Water activities, tours, shops, bars, restaurants with a vibrancy not experienced in many other places.Street performers add to the atmosphere.Cape Town very well priced.Friendly locals. Safe. Interesting.This place is a haven for locals & tourists alike.
Shopping experience. Great place to shop, enjoy the harbour, and find good restaurants. Wide range of branded stores and well-known restaurant chains, and independent operators.

Something for everyone. Aside from an extraordinary amount of mall options, whether it be eating sushi or shopping eg at newish Harrods or H&M, there really is something to appeal to all. Fabulous markets, upmarket local items, the wheel, boat rides and various exhibitions (recently Titanic) as well as an awesome aquarium, movies and playgrounds for kids including the scratch patch. Locals can do their grocery shopping, there are loads of restaurants to choose from, and almost everywhere outside the huge mall is an appealling view, either of the harbour or the mountain. You could spend an entire day here easily, or just stop-over en-route to exploring in the city centre or going onward to the beach. A well kept and well run destination, and a great place to get or give a gift voucher for!
Varied interest. The cross section of foods available was unbeatable. Bars in every corner and plenty of shopping. Also museums around and the Wheel.

Shopping delight. Very touristy - locals and overseas visitors can be busy at peak times. A very good shopping mall and harbour area with plenty of cafe and restaurants. Highly Recommend The Watershed area with it's large number of small stalls - artisan/local handicrafts and a good coffee shop.
Waterfront: for tourists and locals. It's a large, sprawling area of beauty, shopping but also an area that is a place of work, with boats, yachts, tugboats and other activities happening all around.

FOREIGNERS DELIGHT CAPE TOWN'S NUMBER ONE ATTRACTION.. This working dockside has everything you wish for. ENTERTAINMENT, AFRICANA, FOOD & DRINK,(even UK style pub with "pulled pints"called FERRYMANS) Takeaway shops, (fish&chips, burgers, chicken "ichuku" ) Middle style eating spots and GRAND 5 star restaurants. BOAT RIDES (round the harbour area & across Table Bay to Robben Island. In addition sunset cruises into the Atlantic Ocean. Cruises also go to Hout Bay & SEAL WATCHING. Some cruises will take you round CAPE POINT into FALSE BAY. (on a very calm day)Then not the least SHOP TILL YOU DROP (Zara, H&M, to mention some that have just landed.CHERRY ON TOP (one GBP=R25) not too shabby eh Nige.TRANSPORT to & from is by CAR (plenty of safe parking). MyCiti BUS from City Centre every 15minutes, Better still just stay in the Waterfront (7 hotels from 7xstar to 3xstar) The Victoria & Alfred is right on the docks with "al fresco" dining. You will also find BANKS,cash machines (ATM) & Foreign Exchange, then for SPORTS LOVERS most places have satellite dish TV.LASTLY if you want to WALK its only 2.5 kilos from the centre. ENJOY
Great selection of Restaurants/bars/shops and arts/crafts. A must to visit this area. It is alive all day with people shopping and dining. No shortage of places to go or things to see and do

V&A WATERFRONT. Nothing beats a Sunday afternoon stroll all around the V&A Waterfront.It is a buzz of excitement, with musicians playing their various instruments, children running around, the elderly sitting around and chatting about their weekly activities. You will also see tourists from all over the world mulling around. A place where the whole world comes together.

Lots to do in the Waterfront. Please come early on a weekend get very busy later in the day, lots to do and see but for me the Waterfront is very expensive you can get the same stuff in Cape Town shops look around before you buy.

Myrnas victoria and alfred waterfront experience. This is the best place to see , shop and eat in Capetown. Its an unforgetable place for us as the coastline is beautiful the food choices superb and the shopping is well worth it. We were there sux days of our stay mostly for dinner due to very varied food choices, shopping and going places. Very happy place to be with good for all who have varied interests.
Great day out. A must do. A great waterfront development with excellent restaurants, shops, museums, and working harbour. Easy to get to by taxi, bus or car.

Super apartment on the waterfront.. Had a 2 night stay in the V&A waterfront apartments. First impressions when entering the apartment was Wow! Modern and beautifully furnished. The two bedrooms each had an ensuite and the kitchen was fully fitted with dishwasher, washing machine and tumble dryer. The apartments are in a great location, close to restaurants and shops. The view of the waterfront from the balcony is lovely. Ideal place to stay in the waterfront area.

Only gets better each year. . The ferris wheel is a fun way to see the area. Sops of all sorts from touristy things through highend. Always fun to see a Woolworth; long gone from the USA. The aquarium is great for kids and adults alike
Choices Choices Choices!!. Good food, variety in abundance and an an amazing vibe. There is something for everyone. One of Cape Town's MUST do's. Bring your biggest wallet

Super big mall and waterfront with lots of happening around. Visited V&A waterfront mall and the surrounding area almost everyday that we were in Cape Town. Lots of restaurants and even a food court (with individual kiosks that sells thai food, yogurts, pizza etc). For such a busy and well visited mall, I was disappointed that the floor plan given out by the mall was outdated. We went in search of some restaurant that was already closed. Hence, hope that the management of V&A mall would take some effort to print updated floor plans to be given to visitors or to install digital kiosks that provide updated information of tenants in the mall. The whole area of V&A waterfront was really big and we only managed to cover maybe 1/3. Parking was tough even though V&A waterfront has many carparks, as the carparks are far from the mall and we had to walk quite far from the carpark to the mall. At the area closed to the departure to Robben Island, there are a few Seals in the enclosure. So if you have the time, do take time to walk around the whole V&A waterfront.

Attractions . Lots of good shops not too expensive if you are a visitor. Museums to visit, tourist visits to book and in general a buzzing place to be with some super eating places, great atmosphere and lots to see! Including trip on big wheel to view over surroundings.
great place to shop and eat.. We stayed close to the V&A waterfront, and enjoyed the convenience of the shopping and huge choice of restaurants.

Victoria and Alfred Waterfront is the most popular place to visit.. Restuarants and shops is always the highlight of a day out in the beautiful sun. Food is excellent with waiters and waitrons waiting on your choice of food from their awesome menu's.

Always something to do, to eat, and to shop. Good sit down restaurants with good food and good views; also the V&A Foodmarket offers great food browsing, shopping galore both high end, indiv. stores, and a huge crafts market at the Watershed, as well as a comedy club and boat trips to Robben's Island.

Lots of shops . Okay so the waterfront is what it is, it's loads of shops and restaurants. There's just about every type of shop you can imagine, camping gear, Hugo boss, Billabong, supermarket's, tourists shops with all the usual curios etc if that's what you're after. It's nice to walk around but it's not somewhere I'd visit more than once.

Great place for people watching. We came here nearly every evening for dinner, and if we were around the area during the day then we would as the title says people watch. Plus of course watching the seals lying in tyres on their deck outside the aquarium, or just playing in the harbour.

Vibey, captures the essence of Cape Town and the general impression of the greater South Africa.. Always a good place to take international visitors, so much to see and do "under one roof". It offers a great variety of eateries, catering for varying cultures and tastes. Great variety of department stores and boutiques. Wonderful place to sit and watch the mountain and harbour activity.
Beautiful. Comparable to New York's south st seaport, little smaller than the Sydney harbor. Plenty of Affordable restaurants and places to sit and watch the sunset.

Getting very commercialised . The unique heart and sole of this wonderful centre of Cape Town I think is being steadily eroded through commercialism.Soon it will be like any other (expensive) city mall.A pity!

Always Worth Visiting when in Cape Town. So much going on all the time at the V & A Waterfront. Every time we visit, we find new shops, new restaurants and everything is so clean and tidy. A pleasure to visit,and "no entrance fee!"
Just brilliant. Spent 2 days here and went on wheel and a trip round the bay.. The whole experience was so fresh and exciting. Restaurants brilliant, wonderful shopping and so alive.

Nice. we went to Robbin Iceland, it was a nice Trip, we a had our Lunch one of the Restaurant in waterfront, it was not up to the standard, I suggested some tips to the staff, hopefully they will follow that.
Excellent and sofe. The V and A waterfront is amazing and everyone going to Cape Town has to visit it. It is a hub of foreigners and locals.
Great vibe on the harbour.. Great place to visit. Excellent restaurants with many themes to choose from. Great views, Good shops. Be careful because some of them are really expensive.

A must visit!! . Quick review- DONT MISS THIS PLACE!! Very lovely, relaxing afternoon stroll here at the waterfront. At lunch, it could get very hot. At night its the "place to be", maybe not for a romantic dinner because almost all the restaurants are close to each other plus there is a mall close by, so it could get crowded. But definitely worth a few hours of your trip when coming to cape town.
Shop aholic. LOts of stores and restaurants indoors. Cheap and expensive in a good mixture. Clothes are very cheap.
Lots to do. Great view from the V+A of the Table Mountain and the small harbour.Lots of shops and restaurants with outdoor seating. Large indoor shopping mall with high end stores
Cape Town Must See. Restaurants, shopping, live entertainment! You can find all of it here. A bit pricier than most areas in Cape Town but a must do for all first (and second time) visitors!

An entertaining shopping area.. Fantastic area of mixed shopping and restaurants with local music played in different areas and dance groups entertaining you. You really need quite a few hours here to see it all. Even go on the Eye, which is a little smaller than the London Eye, but still could be worth trying.
