Beautiful. Great place to spend the day. . The waterfront is a really nice area with tons of shopping and dining options to choose from. I'd highly recommend taking an uber because parking can be an absolute nightmare. There are also several activities in the area like sunset cruises and an aquarium. There's also outdoor seating near the mall where you can just hang out and take in the beautiful scenery. I'd recommend spending a couple of hours there at the very least...for sure wouldn't skip it. If you're doing Robben Island then you'll already be in the area, so maybe you can just plan to stick around for lunch or dinner.

Spend hours here at restaurants, shops, and just strolling!. This is a very African-style mall whose stores and eateries sell local product. There is much to see outside as well and it is perfect for just walking and window shopping. Street performers and sculptures add to the festive atmosphere. You can spend hours here soaking up the local culture. For authentic African art, don't miss visiting the "Africa Trading Port" store; it is a virtual museum of African art over three floors.This mall is very safe and clean. Visit it!
Lively!. Well worth a visit for the range of restaurants alone. The night we went the area was packed, with a free outdoors concert and big wheel , not free, we probably did not see half of it!

Nice, but very touristy . The Waterfront is a must visit with a plethora of restaurants and high end hotels. We had drinks at the table bay hotel each evening which was really lovely. The restaurants are nice but, a little too touristy for my taste. Some of the restaurants have happy hours and that's nice. It did remind me of the south street seaport in NY. Not much of an African flare however, a lovely view of table mountain from the 2nd floor restaurant outdoor seating. There is a mall right behind the restaurants but, everything (except the food and drinks) is very overpriced. We ate at a couple of the restaurants. The food was good but, average. Better food choices and more authentic if you venture inland. Nice to walk around though but, I would not make it a focal point of a trip to CapeTown and I did not find it an absolute necessity to stay at a hotel there.
Great harbour development. Probably better than San Francisco or Sydney Harbour developments lots of good restaurants and views of Table Mountain

Everything under one roof. The waterfront is a great place not just for shopping but food as well, Mitchel's is the best pub to visit night or day. My favourite restaurant is the City Grill went there on my first trip to Cape Town in 2000 and ate there a few times on my last visit and still the best. Shopping mall has everything you need but if you are self catering and buying to eat in take the car as you will buy more than you can carry. When going into the car park area it looks as if you are pulling into a loading bay, keep going as the parking area is off to the right, we turned around and were going to leave but seen other cars disappear into the parking area and realized our mistake. Market Shed has all the local artists stuff my wife loved this place and we would have bought more but just didn't have the space in our bags as always packed too much we didn't use. Good place for trips around the harbor and out to Robben Island.
Very cool!. Such a nice place to chill, eat lovely food, shop and watch the world go by! Great food market - easy access to the aquarium and the sightseeing buses too.
Cool place to spend some time, day or night.. I have been to many water fronts in many countries but this has to be the best. Clean, safe, well organised with fantastic shops and restaurants.
Touristic. Its a nice place to eat, shop and get some souvenirs. Went there for one afternoon and for me was enough. Cape Town offers much more than this=

Real hangout place. This sure is a place to spend the evening if not the entire day. There are lots of shops and activities happening. If nothing just walk along and then sit to eat food along with some south african wine and watch the world go past

Mr,. Great place thoughly enjoyed it. Will definitely be back as urs a big area to cover in 2 hours. Eat at cape Town fish. Great food b great service had a excellent ambiance .good food ,quick service n pleasant waiters

Better than expected. Being the tourist hub of the city I expected it to be a wash with tacky buys and fast food.
I was very wrong... Stylish shops, amazing eateries with a real eccletic bunch of people all with the most amazing backdrop of Table Mountain.
Buzzing vibe day and night and Would so loved to have spent more time there.

Touristy but friendly . Worth a visit for the range of attractions. The main tourist bit of Cape Town so u can't can you! ? The v and v hotel is v professional but the cooked breakfast is not always as warm as it should be. #firstworldproblem
This is my local shop . I just go here to my hairdresser, to shop for food and clothes and gifts and it's truly convenient and has an enormous amount to offer everybody!
Buzzing. Went twice to the water front, plethora of activities and restaurants, all very good. Even went on a helicopter ride. The vibe carries on right into the night...electric

European feel. The waterfront is vibrant and has lots of shops and eateries you are spoilt for choice. Boat trips, big wheel, open air stage. Even watch cruise ships come in and leave. In the Victoria mall is a seafood restaurant called willoughbys some of the best sushi and fish, in the mall so very cool temperature. Definite European vibe

Local Love. Although many locals say The Waterfront is only for tourists and too expensive I must disagree. First of all I can do my grocery shopping there at the same prices as the other Pick and Pay and Woolworths stores in Cape Town. But before I shop I can go for a brisk walk in safety and do some people watching - love watching the tourists. and on a hot day sitting at an outdoor cafe and having an ice cream is heaven. there is lots to do and see, fabulous restaurants to go to and parking is easy. Love to take my car for a wash and see a movie while waiting for the car or browse the bookshops. Best spot in Cape Town apart from the stunning natural scenery.

My relaxing day. Afternoon chilling in Cape Town, enjoying the view of boat , sailing boat , ocean smells, seagulls sounds, eating exotic meats, drink excellent house wine and enjoy life , what else you want.

Great setting for a mall.. As far as malls go, and yes, this is just a mall, this is a pretty good one. It has a large outdoor area with a myriad of restaurants facing the water, and a stunning view of table mountain. It's busy and its expensive but worth a visit at least once if you're a tourist.

Great spot day or night. We found ourselves visiting 3 times during a 4 day stay. The waterfront is just a wonderful place to sit or stroll and soak up the atmosphere. There is a fantastic mall with lots of unusual shops as well as big designer names. There are some great fast food outlets such as a noodle bar and a Haagen Daas Cafe and then plenty of posher restaurants with outdoor seating overlooking the harbour. A great place to watch the sun go down and also enjoy street entertainment as someone always seems to be singing or dancing. Restaurants are well priced regardless of their prime location

Very pretty and an essential of CT. You cannot go to CT without doing the waterfront, packed with restaurants and bars. there are quite a few comtemporary piece of art too and a couple of points to take scenic pics with table mountain in the backdrop.

Early morning weekend visits to the V&A Waterfront witih my grandson. Every weekend, regardless of the weather, I take my grandson Max to the V&A Waterfront. He is a special needs child and also being ADHD, means I have to keep him entertained throughout the day - which means the V&A Waterfront is the perfect place to take him. He loves the V&A "Eye" giant Wheel, he loves the kiddies section with the outdoor water park, which he runs around in, right next to the kiddies entertainment area. After playing around there, we stroll around so that he can listen to the music, local musicians, then we either take a boat trip, even a helicopter ride (a special birthday treat) and then off to the Oceanarium for further fun and excitement.There are plenty of places to get some food on the go, we head to McDonalds to get him his fries, and then take walks through the shopping centre and then we head out across the road to the little beach on the far side so that he can watch the ocean and the waves. In fact, nothing is planned, we just go wherever he wants to - there is so much to see and do, it is impossible to mention everything here - no visit to Cape Town is complete without spending a day at the V&A Waterfront. With a fantastic vibe, plenty of indoor and outdoor eating areas and local craft breweries, wine tasting - there is always something happening. Its a must visit on anyone's agenda!

One of the better waterfronts. We enjoy sitting by water and the sound of the sea, I must sat the V&A waterfront is clean and well presented and that is a plus. The selection of bars shops and places to eat were good but at the lower price end not exciting and for the price charged the more expensive placed charged to much for the food quality / presentation on offer and the service provided. However as it was our first visit to SA I would not like to be too hard on anything.

Just a lovely authentic Cape Town outing. so much to do and see and lots for children too. A lovely clean, safe and neat place to enjoy. Enjoyed the big wheel, the aquarium, watch 2 boats at the bridge crossing. Loved the scratch patch. The food market was tantalizing. We hade a great day.

Plenty of shops with authentic local products. Plenty of great eateries and locally produced products available. The waterfront is pleasant. Make sure you travel in an "official" taxi or your hotel shuttle only when departing the area.
Two days or more. Not possible to experience this in one day only. Delicious eateries, rich culture, an absolute must if you are visiting the Fairest Cape Town.

All weathers. Sun, wind, rain, whatever the weather this is a great viby safe place to be. Lots of shops & eateries of all different price ranges & services. Need a hair cut, postcards & stamps, a new cell phone or computer, want to visit the aquarium, enjoy the view from the 'big wheel',mooch around the harbour, take a helicopter trip or the boat to Robben island? It is possible to spend hours here and still not see everything. Very friendly to the disabled with lots of toilet facilities and friendly helpful staff.

Watterfront you can found excellent restaurant and tourist information about Cape Town. In Waterfront you are gonna have good options to have dinner after a long day tourist. Many restaurant are available however are expensive too. If you wanna save money regarding to some options tourist, there are tour agency offices where you can have advice about some places you should go in case you didn't have a road map yet.

Lots of shop restaurants and attractions. You could spend days in and around the Waterfront. As a matter of fact we did. Shop till you drop, choose from a variety of restaurants and visit the attractions

A must see in Cape Town. The waterfront as we call it in South Africa is the best place to stroll, eat and shop when you are in Cape Town. There are a lot of restaurants, clothing shops, book shops etc.It has a lovely vibe and is beautiful with Table mountain in the background.
Shopping and aquarium. There are a lot of opportunities to shop, have lunch or diner and Just walk around. The Aquarium at the harbor is realy good. Not only for children.

A Place of stunning dining choices and entertainment, in one place.. Sterkinekor, international shops, restaurants to please every taste bud.
Fun in all weathers. Victoria and Alfred Waterfront, has something for everyone.

Evening at the waterfront. Being a local, the waterfront is always an awesome visit for us whether it's to do shopping or take in the beauty of it all. Often a combination of both. Love doing the half hour harbor cruise, walking around the outside area and enjoying the beauty of it all with the majesty of Table Mountain framing it and of course what a choice of amazing restaurants to choose from. Always good.

Worth a visit. I have visited the V&A several times but on this occasion I found that it has become more of a tourist attraction . Prices are ridiculous and restaurants over bear minimum service and food! The shed is worth a visit too!
Just another mall. Nothing special to it...just another mall BUT it has amazing views on a nice day; the mountain one side, ocean on the other...
Very Lively place. Loads to see and plenty of quality restaurants. Very inexpensive compared to the UK. Good for both a day time as well as an evening visit
Great place to shop. Contains variety of shops, restaurants, brands, local crafts, souviners, and many more....Must not miss it

V&A Waterfront variety of restaurants. In the 1980's we ate fish & chips at the Harbour Cafe on the docks - it was the only place to eat. Today there is a wonderful variety of restaurants from which to choose, from noisy pubs to elegant upmarket establishments. You could eat at the Waterfront every day for a month and have a different experience each time.

Wonderful Waterfront.. The waterfront is fantastic for food, shopping the bars and restaurants and especially Quay Four which is our favourite place. Den Anker is also nice as it has a great view of Table Mountain.

shop and eat till you drop. this is the biggest shopping and restaurants under one roof where you can shop and eat at the various restaurants which they offer so much choice. this is very clean and safe to shop have fun and take cruise with the boats in different times

Always plenty to do. We always make sure we visit the waterfront whilst in Cape Town. Plenty to do there from shopping, movies, boat trips as well as some really good restaurants. late night opening means you can easily spend the full day there. Aquarium, Robben Island and Sightseeing bus also based there

A bit touristy but a fun place to hang out. With ample parking and some really nice restaurants and bars, a visit to the Waterfront is always a part of a trip to Cape Town. During the the summer you'll hear lots of languages spoken and lots of laughter... during the winter the restaurants have blankets and heaters.

Tourist trap for some, shopping paradise for others. This is truly a one-stop shop venue for everything you could want for shopping, eating, staying and entertainment for your time in Cape Town.
There are plenty of world-class to budget hotels, restaurants from fine-dining to fast-food and shops from the well-to-do to the practical.
It is a tourist trap, but not in a bad way.

Great facility . This area is located by a busy port where fishing boats mingle comfortably with pleasure boats. It is a great tourist area with cruises and helicopter rides available. A plentiful supply of shops, restaurants and bars make it a must-visit if you are in Cape Town

Fine if you're a Mall Person, but some opportunities have been missed.. If you're one of the species which loves Malls, you'll enjoy this one : a wide range of stores, hotels and restaurants, in a pleasant setting and with pleasant to great views. Personally, I find it deeply touristy, more than the more agreeable Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco, for instance. It has developed it's own ambiance, but has kept very little of the original sense of a great harbor. Maybe I'm too old, but I remember the days when, air travel being rare, you traveled to and from Europe by ship and this was one of the most unforgettable harbours on earth. You'd get up before dawn, and wait on deck for Table Mountain to appear over the horizon, and then slowly glide into the harbour, full of shouts, clanking chains, and the smell of salty oil. That feel of arrival at a genuine working harbour, is gone, and Gucci-fied.

Shopping and dining. A wide variety of shops, restaurants and entertainment. If you like fish visit Willoughbys in the mall. You can also find a Bureau de Change if needed. There is plenty of entertainment outside the mall including a big wheel. There is large shed selling local art, jewellery. And others objects.

World class shopping experience . I generally don't like malls, but this is so much more. Variety of shops from low to very high end. Same with food; here you get both a food market with a variety of food and 5 star restaurants. This wasn't my first visit and certainly won't be my last

Unmissable. Very commercial but vibrant interesting place. There is something for everyone,buskers, boat trips, shopping, museums,bars, restaurants for all tastes from burgers to caviar and wonderful people watching.

Bustling. You can take in the view of Table Mountain whilst doing a bit of shopping or whilst having something to eat. Absolutely wonderful atmosphere at the V&A!!! Be aware it is very busy, but that's what makes it worth the visit.

Fantastic tourist facility with great shops restaurants and ambience. Great tourist destination with fantastic views of Table Mountain and the harbour. Good shops and numerous excellent restaurants.Great ambience at night. If you visit Capetown you have to come here. Paul
Fabulous . Great food choices. Harbour cruise is a must for the history of the place, very interesting. Excellent aquarium, very good vibe all round and the shopping mall has great shops

Eclectic mix of attractions. Certainly a well designed complex to appeal to both visitors and locals - upmarket shopping, a vast array of restaurants and cafes, attractions to visit, working harbour to watch, and more artisan areas showcasing local craft talent and food hall. All well worth taking time to explore. Just be choosy on where to eat - most are clearly geared to passing tourist trade.
Wonderful V&A Waterfront. This place has it all!Fab restaurants, entertainment, great fish market, hotels, shops, fabulous shopping malls, I could go on and on and on..........

Has everything . I have visited a few Malls around Cape Town and none match the VA. It caters for all tastes from top brands to affordable stores. I love the food court with a huge variety of restaurants all with amazing views. On most days you can catch local artists displaying or entertaining in and around the VA. You can definitely spend a hole day wondering around or just sitting and enjoying the amazing people of Cape Town.
Busy but a bit dull. Everybody visits Waterfront. It is busy, but lacks charm, could be anywhere. It is a pity they did not create a waterfront with something special and genuin.

Join the crowds.... ...busy, very busy...local and international tourists flock here for the many bars and restaurants - great hub, if a lot touristy, but the food was worth it almost without exception.

Lots of shops and good restaurants. Really good place to visit, and the shopping mall is great. There are many restaurants of all nationalities and prices. You also feel safe due to the security guards at the entrances.

Everything thing you need in one place . Located by the sea and over a large area . It consists of a lot of attraction including a mall , restaurants , pubs , flea market an aquarium neat by plus a lot of other things , suits you especially if you are looking for a long day to spend and you need everything around you because it has all the activity for all the ages .

Mall wit a view. Just at the waterfront...most visited tourist place in cape town...value for money shopping...u can also go for a ride at the cape wheel or boat cruise if u like or just sit and listen to sum street artists perform! !

Nice development..... A pleasing atmosphere full of life and secure.
The infrastructure and a large scope of activities makes the V & A a suitable place to visit with family and friends for a fun day outing...For sightseeing...shopping and find dining..
The ferris wheel is quite fun...
A place to visit for sure when in Cape Town
Always a great place to experience Cape Town.. The V & A waterfront is a beautiful place with lots of shops, restaurants, and night life. The downside is that there are also lots of tourists.
Trip to South Africa. Our hotel was close to the Waterfront, there is lots to see here and plenty of very good restaurants to choose from, this is a very popular area in the evening.

Food. Everything is wonderful at the Waterfront. The food is amazing whether you want a snack or full 3 courses, lunch or dinner time. All the waiter's are pleasant and attentive. There are street artists to entertain you while enjoying a drink or lots of shops with local products to browse. Trips galore if your feeling energetic or just enjoying the view of the mountain or watching the boats sail in and out of the harbour.

Bursting with activities!. I had to say, spending just ONE day at V&A is just not enough! I had to come back the 2nd and 3rd round because it is bursting with activities! From shopping, to dining and entertainment! It's just TOO much to offer! LOL!

Touristy but worth a day. Part of me hates the Waterfront - probably because I'm not really a shopping man....but there is loads more to do than crawl around shops with Mrs W. For a start there are masses of bars and restaurants! A bit of history and historiacal buildings to take in, interesting sculptures, trip to Robben Island, the ferris wheel (I unexpectedly found that rather good), a decent wine shop (Vaughan Johnson) and so on. Mind you - one day is enough.
Tourist must go. Good food. Good shops and tours. Most importantly not overly priced. We took a helicopter tour at one of the counter, spectacular views from above

Boring, artificial, expensive . Clearly a lot of money have spent on doing up this place, but it turned to be a posh but soulless place. Must say the meal I had there was really nice but the bill was really high.

Vibrant area. Very busy and vibrant location with lots of different eateries - well worth a try at least once during your stay in CT. Were underwhelmed by the food we had at the Portuguese restaurant but it was extremely busy and I think they were struggling because of that. The Waterfront overall is a very busy and bustling location and well worth a visit.
Whats not to Love about V&A!!. Great social place, can get abit crowded but soo many restaurants to choose from. The boat rides are awesome and the atmosphere always festive and fun.

Best of both worlds. Working in Greenpoint the position of the waterfront makes it so convenient for me for daily grocery shopping or if there's a black tie event to attend the likes of Zara and Tiger of Sweden is a regular visit. Very pleasant experience on every visit.

lively every day. Sure, if you like your evenings more serene and secluded, the Water Front is not for you.... but if you want the complete treat to African Cusine in full splendor, music and dance, drink and cigar.... this is for you then.It comes without the latent challenges of the neighbourhoods of Long Street while not being boring at all.Yes, it's touristy, but a seasoned traveler will always sniff out the best place for the occasion.

Cape Town's tourist Mecca. The V&A (Victoria and Alfred) Waterfront is one of Cape Town's biggest attractions, if one is to judge by the crowds of people that come here looking for a place to eat, shop and be entertained. Alive and busy, vibrant and touristy, with lots of things to see and do, it's worth visiting even if you don't plan to eat or shop there. Because you can still enjoy the charming setting of the old harbor, the mishmash of old and new buildings, the views of the Table Mountain as a backdrop. The place is especially lovely at sunset. As for what you can find here, the V&A has it all: upscale hotels, small shops that sell local African art and souvenirs, big brands inside the Victoria Wharf shopping center, cafes and restaurants where you can grab something to eat ranging from fast food to upscale dining, street performers, even a Ferris Wheel. The Two Oceans Aquarium is located here and the boats for Robben Island also leave from the V&A. You can book pretty much any type of cruise that you can think of, from sunset cruise to whale watching, from fishing to shark diving trips. The harbor even has 2 small playgrounds which my kids really enjoyed.For a bit of history, the harbor was created in 1860 under the tutelage of Prince Alfred, Queen Victoria's second son. The first basin was named after himself, the second after his mother, hence the name. It fell into decline by mid 20th century and was revamped in the 1990s. V&A still functions as a harbor today.
Tickle your taste buds. All cultural foods under one roof to the latest brands and top end biker jackets. Come see the beautiful mother city and what she has to offer

Pleasant afternoon enjoying the sunshine and browsing. we spent a Sunday afternoon here, parking at the clock tower car park only 10ZAR for 5 hours on a Sunday. Ther are all sorts of shops to browse while you meander around the area enjoying the views and sunshine. Lots of seals lazing around in the docks. Good views of table mountain, lots of places to eat. There is a little Market selling all sorts of food to eat with seats outside for you to relax ant enjoy your food. The craft market which is like an emporium is good for getting an idea of what is available to buy as you continue your travels. There is a large shopping centre too and a large selectin of restaurants available but we did not visit as it's not our thing, but I I gues fine if it is raining. There are plaques and info boards giving the history of the docks too. You can also book variou boat trips here as well as harbour tours. It was fairly quiet on the Sunday when we arrived at 11ish but it was very busy when we visited again after we had visited Robben Island. So go early if your not keen on crowds. You could spend all day here but I think 3-4hours is enough excluding meal time.
CPT Visit. Still the best place to visit in CPT. Shopping, breakfast, lunch, drinks, dinner. Lots to do and see. The Cape Wheel is a must.....nice touch to the whole atmosphere

A Cape Town Jewel.. This place has atmosphere, charm and vibrancy. The shopping was great especially the old Watershed building which houses a market kind of set up. We had lunch and dinner there several times and all were very good. We saw African performers too which added to the fun. I would definitely recommend the V and A Waterfront.

Like any harbor front shopping mall . Have you visited SFrisco fisherman a wharves, Sydney rocks, darling habour, Hamburg fish markt , and many other luxury water front shopping mall. This one is no exception. But it's great for a couple of hours with Scratch Patch near by, and the Aquarium round the corner. It's all pretty nearby to stadium and main road. Very picturesque and great weather it helps to make for a near perfect day if hanging around doing nothing else other than shopping the same branded stuffs avail any where else around the world

A place to hang out all day.... This is where you ought to go when in Cape Town for shopping and eating out. Too many choices of quality restaurants that it too a long time to decide where to eat and for which view to choose.There are 2 Malls for shopping and the fish market is a must. Not for me though as I don't eat fish...:).Was also the place where to board the boat to robben island.I can wander and enjoy this place the whole day. Watching people, shopping, food tripping and enjoying the sights and sounds of Harbor life.Almost forgot to mention, there seems to be seagulls and seals everywhere.Never a dull moment.
Wonderful. Shopping, music, culture, cuisine, people watching, wine, views...not much more to be said. A must visit when in Cape Town.

Best shopping spot. I just love going to the waterfront. Always 'n nice vibe, helpful info desks and a variety of stores to choose from. I always come here when I want up to date fashion trends. Sadly the food court get over crowded at around 12ish. So eat early, shop, have fun and enjoy the view and absolute awesome atmosphere.
Excellent Venue. A tourist to the City should not miss this venue. There is something for everyone, food, wine, entertainment and excellent shopping. Really a world class place to visit.

Lots of places to eat and plenty of sights to see. This was an easy walk from our hotel. Use the American Express office there to change your money -- by far the best rate. Hotels can be 20% lower than official rate. If there is a sporting event, you can get your tickets at the waterfront. Sporting arena does not sell tickets in advance or the day of the event. If you go without a ticket, many people will try to scalp you fake tickets (ones that have already been used to get someone in).

An active area.. After the Robben Island visit we spent some time around the shops and restaurants of the V & A waterfront. Had a great lunch at a Greek restaurant upstairs overlooking the waterfront and the giant wheel- like the London Eye.

Disappointed. I had great expectations of the Waterfront but in reality all I saw was mediocre products being sold at inflated prices e.g. a normal coffee mug with "Cape Town" written on it for U.S. $5. I have spent all of my life in tourist towns in the U.K., Europe and Africa but this was quite sad to see. I really expected the food market to be something special considering the great wines and produce of the region, what a let down. My wife will go again tomorrow to see if she can find any presents for family and friends back home and I will download a newspaper and stay in the apartment. Regrettably, crowds of people and little else have little interest to me.

Great food plus shopping. The V&A is a great mix of mall, shops, restaurants, bars on a marina waterfront - huge yacht berthed whilst we were there- with plenty to do and see. The ferry for Robbens Island leaves from here as do various boat trips for sunset cruises and sightseeing.Most of the shops are the usual high end ones that appear everywhere in the world but there are a few which are quite unique - one of them being a market type stall within the mall - ground floor- which sells beaded animals. The amount of work put into these looks pretty intense and we were happy to buy some of our favourites here. They came with a concierge service!! The Turkish lady who runs this stall is a font of info on Cape Town and is happy to share it all - along with her views on every worldwide situation you can possibly imagine!! We got some great recommendations for restaurants from here - The Harbour House and Baia (both fantastic) - and spent some time swopping views!The Cape wheel is really inexpensive and gives a good all round view, especially nice at night when everything is lit up.Don't miss another, smaller, area just off here, towards the V & A hotel, just past the lifeboat. Great ladieswear shop inside - Lulus? - well worth an hour of browsing and trying on and just outside it there is a good souvenir shop. Further along is a wonderful shop with lifesize animals etc. Even better is a bar where your other half can sit with a beer whilst you are otherwise occupied!At least once during your trip here you will hear singing from groups of men - usually all in the same African dress - very entertaining to listen to but be aware they will want paying for their time and any photos you might take of them. We thought they were worth it. Just past the lifeboat is a large tree where they like to perform during the day and there is a very conveniently placed restaurant here for you to eat and drink whilst this is all going on.We were here every evening during the Cape Town stage of our trip, great food and people watching.

Worth a visit but rather artificial. The waterfront is definitely wroth a visit for shopping - prices way cheaper than UK for quality products - eating - visit the food market hall - and absorbing the general atmosphere. my favourite part was the Watershed full of local craft stalls which were very reasonably priced and although you could barter a bit it saved the hassle of market bartering. The restaurants were numerous but looked rather international and soulless to us. We preferred eating in more local establishments in other parts of the city. Parking was easy and it was a pleasant way to spend a few hours. I would avoid weekends as I would imagine it is heaving.

Vibrant local atmosphere – Shopping and Food paradise. This is another one of those annual attractions for my family. It is good to soak in the atmosphere when the area is so filled with lots of visitors from around the country and abroad. You hear so many different languages in the air, everyone is happy and smiling all around you.It was nice to enjoy some local artists doing their song and dance on the pavements and designated areas, especially at the amphitheatre where there is always a buzz. We enjoyed admiring some of these artists and take in their music and joyful fun. Lots of camera moments.
Great position and safe. Great place to stay. You feel very safe. Lots of restaurants, museums, Red bus tours, hotels and shopping!
What a way to spend a few hours. Lovely place to walk around and people watch. Music/food/bars/shops restaurants has it all. The food market offered so much we struggled to make a decision!

Great vibe!. Although this is a tourist haven (or is it heaven?), the Waterfront is worth visiting for it's excellent restaurants and shops alone.There is also an outstanding aquarium (recently extended) and a Ferris wheel providing good views of central Cape Town. Splendid views of Table Mountain can also be enjoyed from here.The V & A Waterfront always has a wonderful carnival-like atmosphere.Just go!
WE PRACTICALLY LIVED HERE. Everything you need and more is right here. It has every restaurant & shop imaginable as well as numerous pubs and activities. You will not get enough of it.

When in Cape Town this is a must!. Besides Robben Island there is no specific attraction at the V&A, but you have to experience it! Food markets, craft markets, shopping centres, other markers, you can see seals! It's very pretty and stylish and for families it is definitely a place to spend a Sunday in the sun.Beware of traffic and pray for parking spaces though!
Very touristy area. The area is very touristic, shopping is expensive (prices like in Europe, no bargains). Make a visit and a lunch, but I recommend living in Camps Bay or Sea point.

OK if you can park. We love the V&A waterfront and visit whenever in CT. But today , due to the CT Bike tour, parking in the nearby car park was impossible due to vehicles and often trailers taking up multiple spaces. Why stop tourists from shopping when the race could have started elsewhere in CT? On leaving the area we then found many roads closed and we were unable to reach nearby beaches.
Food market. Love the indoor food market great outing for couples and families alike. Lots of activities for tourists and huge toy stores for children.
V&A Waterfront. A vibrant place with lots of bars and restaurants to choose from. Great views of the harbour which is quaint and if course table mountain

African Wedding. My daughter was married in port Elizabeth last week 21st February and I had to go and get my grandsons from cape town were they had flown from the U.K. and bring them back to Port Elizabeth for the wedding we had 3 days in Cape Town and one of the places we visited was the Waterfront its nice and clean there is every thing you could want shops restaurants bars Markets its a must to visit .

Busy but too touristy for me. Very busy areaLots of shops and restaurants to choose from - also lots of activities to book up to do like helicopter rides etc For me though bit too touristy and as always busy think service is not as good as it should be as the restaurants know will have new people coming the next day
A busy tourist area. A busy area with lots of shops, cafes and restaurants. Lots of photo opportunities with the river, sea,seals, street entertainers and views of Table Mountain.

must visit attraction. great to see yet another wonderful re-developement of a dock area..restaurants and attractions are great and this is a must visit for anyone spending time in Cape Town...it buzzes non stop

Loved it.. Loads of restaurants and shops. Also a big wheel, aquarium and when we visited a Titanic exhibition. Street entertainers make for a great atmosphere. Had some of the best food we had in SA.

A world class shopping and experience centre. Whether it is world class shops, world class restaurants or a variety of tourist excursions ... the V&A Waterfront is the place to come. You can buy anything from a toy car to a multi million Rand Aston Martin. Fast food to Gourmet eating. A fantastic aquarium, boat rides, sunset cruises, helicopter flights and other things to numerous to remember. Or you can have a leisurely walk and look at tourists from all over the world.

Lots to see and do. Give yourself plenty of time to enjoy everything there is to see and do at the waterfront - the wide variety of shops, eating places and live entertainment. Colourful and exciting..

Touristy but great. We stayed in a complex within the Waterfront and really enjoyed it - there is always a great bustling atmosphere which is predominantly caused by the number of tourists but that doesn't take away from the charm!

Nice century old touristy attraction in Cape Town.. The V&A is a must for all visitors to CT. Many small businesses, multiple restaurants and shops, but be prepared for crowds and long walks.Many attraction offices are also nearby. A central location to pass the time. Beware of traffic jams during peak times.

Always anew experience. Every year there's something new to enjoy on the V.and A. Waterfront. Always a great atmosphere and an awesome shopping experience. Great music adds to the general party atmosphere here. Shop till you drop then drop into one of the great restaurants for a drink or a meal, better still both!

The V & A visit - a must. Fantastic area to visit, very safe with plenty of shopping for those so inclined, great choice of restaurants for every budget, good for families and easy access most of the areas. Various sights to visit in the entire V & A complex, lots of walking involved so be comfortable, especially during the summer months
lots to do. lots to do here with great restaurants and bars. Good shops and places to book tours . The place seems safe. Reccommended
The place to be. Any number of restaurants and shops, whatever is desired. With beautiful views of the water as well as the mountain.

A vibrant exciting atmosphere that bring out real South Africa. A Modern shopping complex built in the harbour. This is surrounded by hotel and various bars from seafood to traditional ales. There is always tourism activity showing off traditions of South Africa. A wonderful place to spend 2 days soaking up the atmosphere of the waterfront and visit the amazing aquarium. The third day you can take a trip to Robben Island and visit where Nelson Mandela was jailed

wonderful holiday experience. we knew Waterfront from our visits the last years but by the way we had informations of what do to.so we found very good shopping oppurtunities.because waterfront is not only touristic but visited by local people too it is a much better atmosphere.but after all this we had a sushi experience at his best at willoughby restaurant.if possible you should take your break here.very friendly people as everywhere at waterfront.

Outstanding waterfront area. Spent four nights in Cape Town and spent some time at the Waterfront each day. Great restaurants and shopping, and very convenient with the Hop on Hop off bus stopping right in the heart of the precinct.
Buzzing. Whatever time of day we went it was always alive and busy. The evening were really lively with eateries, bars, buskers, street entertainment etc. Cannot be bored.
Awesome . One of the best waterfronts in the world.Great restaurants and awesome experience as always.On a good day there is no better in the world!
Just another shopping mall. It's a great shopping mall if you are from Cape Town, however if you are from the UK or US for example it is just another shopping centre. Nothing special.

The must visit attraction in Cape Town.. For shoppers,foodies, people watchers, a must. Seafood lovers will not be disappointed, nor wine lovers, the prices for an international venue such as this, are extremely reasonable and the service always friendly. Thanks to helpful staff we were able to eat without booking on Valentine's day. There is always interesting seacraft docked there, from ocean going yachts, to luxury yachts, We saw Va Va2 when we were there(Google it).

Classy shopping and entertainment. Always worth a visit or two if you feel like spending some money. The beautiful, modern shopping centre has lots to offer. If you like rugby, visit the Springbok Experience.

Lovely setting, great atmosphere. If you are in Cape Town then this is a must do visit. Lots of nice shops to explore, loads of lovely restaurants/bars/coffee shops to chose from, a beautiful setting with Table Mountain as the backdrop, and a great atmosphere - what's not to like about it?

Good shopping. The V&A waterfront is a nice place to go, but it is rather commercial and hence not really a cultural experince. Feels like you could be anywhere in the world. The shopping is great, seems to have almost every shop you'd want if that's your thing. Great views from some of the restaurants if you want to relax. Check out the foodhall, there are some quirky things to try. What I liked most about this area was the bustle of people. It was still packed when we left at 8.30pm on a Sunday night.

Everything you can think of...... Food, drinks, shopping, music, art, crafts....the area is absolutely loaded with endless possibilities of things to do and see!!!Fun for the whole family, young and old!!I would recommend the area to anyone!
Safe place in Cape Town. Lovely place to work, shop, enjoy day and especially night life, and SAFE - which is the matter ib Cape Town

Lovely. Amazing venue for everything-stunning mountain and sea views-boat trips around Table Bay and Robben Island-loads of restaurants, bars, coffee shops, hotels, takeaways-local entertainment-lots of designer and regular shops-supermarket-cinema-lots of secure parking-Marcel's frozen yoghurt!!

Good place to see. We made the mistake of being at the V&A Waterfront on New Years Day, so there were lots of crowds, but it's really pretty. We walked through the shops and stopped into the mall for a few things as we were flying out the next day. I regret not having time to take a sunset cruise from the water there. Great place to see.
nice place that buzzes at night. lots already been said. its safe lots of eateries. its a long ish walk to town and easy to take a wrong way at night so a taxi is well wort it

The vibrant heart of a vibrant city. Go for a walk across the Waterfront area of Cape Town. Enjoy your coffee in one one of the seaside cafes, listen to the seals next to you, watch the multi-ethnic crowd around you, enjoy the lovely street musicians and buy your souvenirs from the shops. I found the best souvenirs here.

Shop til You Drop. Great area with the mall, restaurants, ferry, marina and more. Higher priced than most areas of Cape Town, but you can find it all here. Picturesque and fun for families, couples and singles.

Beutiful Harbour front. A very attractive centre for restaurants, shops and entertainment. We loved the choices of food (The Fish Market) and African Trading stores. So many boat tours to choose from!

Great restaurants, good ambience. This is where you go to shop or eat in down-town Cape. We did that three times, twice for dinner. All were very good or better. Then there is a good deal of shopping opportunities, latest the second largest H&M in the world. Local handicraft is to be had at a good price that doesn't demand haggling. Taxi prices to here from down-town (Greenmarket) differed between 50 and 100 rand (with or without taxameter).

Europe at South Africa. This Zone is seems like Europe in its streets, spirit,restaurants, cafes and everything.
we visited it almost everyday and spent the dinner there.
also this zone closed at 9 pm, so you have a plenty of time to enjoy everything there indeed
Lovely...just totally overpriced . Breathtaking if you can get there due to the hectic traffic. Restaurants are totally over priced. Most restaurants are not for small kids.

A well design and working tourist area. Well designed centre area with loads of activities and goos shopping. Loads of life and activities. We love the Watershed with Acfrican handicraft. Some good restaurants and cafées. It is a must when visiting Cape Town

Great shopping and dining. Here is a place everyone should be happy. Great dining options and as much shopping as you could want. Side building with mostly African art options. Dock site for many water tours and water dining. Great place to wander. Very safe area with security.
Lovely, but a typical waterfront development. This is meant to be one of the top tourist attractions, but it is just a few shopping malls and hotels on the waterfront.

Very touristy, but worth a visit for sure. A sprawling collection of fascinating shops, delicious restaurants, a huge mall, and interesting old cape architecture. Great place to spend a day exploring & shopping and as a starting off point for a trip to the island. Explore, wander, and be sure to stop and eat. Great people watching with a fun European vibe.

Great tourist attraction. Very good quality here, much better than expected for such a touristy area. Nobu restaurant in the One & Only hotel and some excellent shopping in the craft area. Glad we stayed in Cape Town proper and not here despite great restaurants.
Worth Visiting. Ferris Wheel allows you to see all of Capetown. Many restaurants and lots of shopping. Lots to do here.

What an amazing place!!. We went here on our first day and were pleasantly surprised by all the activities, shops ,eating places and entertainment .There are so many trips you could take and it's impossible to do it all in one visit .

Good place to eat and shop. While staying in Cape Town, the V & A waterfront was close to our hotel and was a great place to explore. There are numerous restaurants and a huge shopping complex. A must see when visiting Cape Town.

A must see destination. A magnificent trip to tourism in Cape Town, FRom the high end hotels tu fast foos eateries this place has them all. Shop in designer stores or rummage through tribal art shops, Tired out ...then choose from a number of excellent pubs near the waters edge. Try an evening visit and be entertained by local musicians or live televised groups. Plenty to occupy the keenest travellor for days.
lovely area to walk around and take in the atmosphere. Full of restaurants and shops, catering for all tastes and types - live street bands help to create a buzz and a great atmosphere.

A real holiday destination.. A transformed harbour area. Redeveloped with 5 star hotels, hundreds of shops, restaurants of all standards, live music,lots of parking, all set against the backdrop of Table Mountain....Magical!

Busy, buzzy and a must for any visitor to Cape Town. One of the highlights of any trip to Cape Town. You have a huge choice of restaurants and bars, many which offer views of Table Mountain. Great shopping mall. Superb choice of hotels. The Cape Wheel is certainly worth doing, and the harbour cruises are a great way to spend a relaxing hour or so.The Waterfront is busy, buzzy and has a unique vibe. Just wonderful really!

Love coming here. Always come to the waterfront when in capetown. Have all the shops you need and the choices of resturants are wonderful. I love going to Willoughby and co there food is delicious, best sushi ever. Staff always friendly and very helpful with what to choose portions are huge so dont think you getting bite size portions. See pics below my daughter and i could not finish. Will always be back when in capetown. Love love love
V and A Waterfront. This is an amazing place with lots do to and see. Plenty of wonderful restaurants and shops. This is a must when coming to Cape Town.

Perfect. Lots of shops restaurants and bars - very clean very safe and an Abundance of choice - ate here in several occasions all good.Tried the Wheel which gave a fab view of the harbour and ship yards -,well worth it and good value All in all the place to visit

A taste of everything. The V&A Waterfront is an easy place to visit as a tourist: Several very good restaurants, exciting shops, historical buildings and excursions. Very touristic, but that is what you are. The design and quality of goods you may purchase is impressive.
Great range of...... Restaurants in particular. None of the restaurants tried were anything less than good. Plentiful taxis in and out ... Do take care with the taxis however!

Superb, the must visit area in Cape Town. A very relaxed, safe area for shopping, eating and just enjoying the Cape Town vibe. There are all sorts of retail outlets, from the elite, exotic craft to the more mundane. You pay a little more to eat and drink here, depending on your choice of culinary cuisine, but it is still very reasonable. An area like this in the heart of any other major city. you could easily expect to pay double. if not triple the prices available here. At 23 Rand to the pound, Cape Town is a veritable paradise for the UK tourist. The back drop of Table Mountain just makes the area almost too perfect!

Regular. Waterfront is a weird place but at the same time so regular. A lot of shopping, a lot of gentrified elements. It is not so nice but nor is it bad or disgusting. It's just there with its middle class attractions.
New Year EVE in Cape Town. Awesome stores and great parking access. If your with the family and have kids a lovely chilled way to spend new years eve.

Another must visit place in Cape town. Beautiful area, very laid back, lots of tourists
Has a mall with lots of shops. Many restaurants, coffee shops, bars all around.
Several 5 star hotels.
Can see view of Table mountain from here. Lots of shops selling local African
arts and crafts.
Could spend 1 or 2 days in this area
Good Shopping Centre. Nice cafes on the waterfront. It is an extensive shopping centre, and good if that is what you are looking for.

Awesome harbour with exquisite flair. A great shopping destination and the perfect place for foodies. Hang out with friends, or have a business meeting. Meeting rooms are available, as well as conference rooms. If you want to impress, then high tea at the Cape Grace is a must. We had fun doing a helicopter flip, best way to get the bird's eye view of the city bowl. You can't get bored at the V&A.

Europe in Africa. This is one of the most beautiful tourist district i have seen in my South Africa trip... Place is full of lovely restaurants serving delicacies from around the world ...I ate the most delicious chicken roll from a Tunisian counter ... Vegetable juice from another counter... Bought some organic spices from a ( French ?) counter ...Cafes are all around you ,where chairs are occupied by mostly European tourists of different age groups...I saw few locals and Asians also...all enjoying coffee or a mug of chilled beer... and most of the evenings you will witness most amazing tribal dance and music performance near Cafe Alfredo... Near the Cape wheel there is an open performance area where you can enjoy music sessions by new and old bands ,every evening... and off course area has 2-3 shopping malls near the harbour ... Place is safe and very well managed ... This place is must for kids of 5 year old to 95 year old... So Enjoy !!!
A must see in Cape Town. Visited the place around 4 pm and the place was moderately crowded with live musicGood place to stroll and to do some shopping as well.
What a beautiful place to be!. So many beautiful places to sit and enjoy the view. Views of the Table Mountain, the boats going by. Shopping opportunities everywhere.

Food and shopping. Must do part of a trip to Cape Town. Lots of great restaurants and lots of shopping. Oh and a decent view of Cape Town.The really big part, at the time of writing this, is the UK-SA exchange rate. There are many bargains to be had. Oh and make sure, to add to this, you claim back the VAT at the airport too.
On my doorstep. Always a pleasure visiting V & A Waterfront. Stylish. Often a bit crowded, but still worth every bit.

Lovely place. I was at the Waterfront a couple of times and have to say its a lovely place even though very touristy. You have lots of shops, loads of restaurants and souvenir shops.
It's nice to go there now and then but glad I had my accommodation somewhere else more quiet.

Great place to wander. Beautiful attraction, full of numerous cafes, restaurants and individual shops. Boat trips available, we did harbour 30 mins just enough. Fantastic selection African souvenirs in huge converted warehouses, shoppers paradise!

Massively changed in the last 10 years. Hardly surprising i know, but we were surprised at just how much bigger it had got. Still full of excellent restaurants and a main location in Cape Town for both day and evening life.Shops are a little pricier than in the large shopping centres outside town but it is all very convenient. Still good for getting the trip to Robben Island, harbour trips, helicopter rides and some wilder boat trips.

Great for shopping and dining . Lots of shops in the mall for souvenirs and clothing on the Waterfront. Of course many jewellery shops too. Open daily from 09.00 until 21.00. local artists and performers to watch as well as the many boats on the piers as well as the sea lions too! Lovely in the evening to eat outside in one of the many restaurants, all of which are highly frequented by locals and tourists. The exchange rate makes both shopping and dining really cheap, the latter being of high quality in most of the locations. Security is high, with a lot of staff monitoring. Never felt at risk but always wise to be careful and not foolish.

Mr. Nice place , having lunch and dinner at the water front facing the sea, staff where very kind and helpful, although the conference room across the hotel was up to my expectations but big up for the iron box in room ... it's one of those things that gives me a lot of headache when I travel

vibrant waterfront. My first visit to Cape Town exceeded my expectations and the victoria & Alfred waterfront was just amazing. Beautiful buildings, gorgeous shops, a huge mall which also houses lots of lovely restaurants as well as fast food, a quirky place called the watershed which housed local crafts, a big wheel with pods like the London Eye giving amazing views of the area. There was an open air stage with a band performing and the area was just buzzing with everyone enjoying themselves. There was a play area for children and a vibrant pub with entertainment as well as showing sports. Nearby, you can catch the red open top hop on hop off bus to tour the area. The whole waterfront area is just beautiful to walk around and is well laid out. Lots of safety officers about too and very friendly. Just loved the vibe!!

Such a great place to visit. What a great development, superb shops, both African trinkets, and mainstream clothing. Fabulous restaurants and bars, the majority with a view of Table Mountain. Definitely worth a visit.

Busy, bustling with great location. This is the epicentre of Cape Town tourism and, as such, is a must to visit and a convenient place to meet others.It is a really bustling commercial hotspot which should visit once and probably only once but its location on the waterfront with Table Mountain and the Football stadium as backdrops.It is chock full of restaurants, shops and other entertainment - bands, super yachts, clock tower, the wheel, sea front, boat trips to Robben Island and elsewhere.It is the perfect introduction on your first visit to Cape Town before you explore the real city

Good place to go shopping, dining, for a morning/afternoon.. We went there on our last day of the holiday trip in Cape Town. It is a good place to casually walk around, do a bit of shopping, enjoy the music playing outdoors, and the view of Table Mountain. I would say half of a day is more than enough if you're not particularly into shopping.

Fun and lovely. The V & A Waterfront is in a lovely setting on the water with many restaurants and shops, as well as a ferris wheel.We strolled the grounds and had lunch on a sunny day with deep blue skies overhead.There is also an inside mall at the Waterfront, but we didn't go in.
Shop until you drop. A fantastic selection of shops and restaurants to choose from definitely a must to visit when heading to Cape Town!

Worthwhile for shopping Nd tourist activities. A nice shopping precinct with an interesting series of shops and tourist activities and sculptures. The area Is popular with locals as well as tourists. There are things you can buy but may. Or be able to take home, like a touch and taser combo device.

Very busy but Fun place. We enjoyed this entire area. There are street entertainers, a great ferris wheel, excellent restaurants, pubs, shops, a huge mall, sailing cruises etc. Spend at least a half a day here!

A place for all. Ranging from perfect hangouts with friends and family, pubs serve you with both entertainment as well as good food and drinks. If you not into that..you can shop till you drop at stores and stalls catering for all budgets.. with a variety of both local and international brandsYou can even catch yourself a little boat trip around V&A or to robben island or another way to see V&A in a different way..go get yourself a ticket/s for the Big Wheel...Gorgeous hotels within walking distance...For the kids..and perhaps yourself too...the Aquarium hosts a variety of under water world fella's..go and say Hello!It is really a place that caters for all!!

Perfect dinner with waterfront view. Just an awesome place for seafood and excellent wine. Although it is quite a busy place, the service was very good too. Wine recommendation was on the spot and the food was fresh. Would go back any time.

Great choice of restaurants. We visited here in 2003 and loved it then, now it's even better as there are more restaurants and attractions, two good reasonably priced are, City Grill and Fish Market Café.

Beautiful . After taking the helicopter tour, we went to sit on the waterfront in a lovely bar. Table service was very good and we had a lovely table right by the water. Not a huge selection of beers but we were perfectly happy drinking ice cold Savannah cider. Lovely way to end the day.
One of the most picturesque places in Africa. Awesome place to spend your morning or evenings. Great vies of the ocean and mountain. perfect for a run or jog

Great shopping but disappointing too. I frequently am required to work at the Waterfront and don't entirely dislike it. When I get a chance to shop I find it is a great mall and offers something for everyone including fabulous eateries. The one thing lacking, which should be top of the list considering the 1000's of tourists visiting the mall daily, is free WiFi. For a top tourist destination with people visiting from 1st world countries, this is crazy. Be prepared to buy data if you plan to use your laptop or smartphone at this mall.

Nice atmosphere...and crazy busy. Loved the variety of shops and things to do. My favourite part was this large separate building that only had local artisans and craftsmen...including a guy selling guitars made from metal oil containers. This was the terminus of the Robben Island ferry so just strolled around when we came back. Great shopping but bring money. Lots of it...

Very developed. It has been a while since I've been to the V & A Waterfront so it was good seeing all the developments in the mall. I was at the amphitheatre and liked the fact that they've placed a covering over it to protect the public from bad sun burn and partially warding off the train. The mall is certainly set up for tourists to enjoy the variety of stores and restaurants to eat from. Its great that additional parking has been built across the mall. It is however sad that there are no more live jazz restaurants around like Manenberg's that was at the Clock Tower and the Green Dolphin. Cape Town produces some of the best jazz musicians and sadly there's no platform for them to be showcased regularly at a restaurant at the Waterfront

Great place to stroll at the end of the day!. We went to visit the Robben Island and on the way back we walked around the waterfront and saw pink colored clouds behind the quay! What a nice viewHad a lovely dinner at the mall and did some shopping! The stores are great and this is a good place to go anytime!
lovely. spent an afternoon here lovely place to wander around with lots of restaurants,shops,museums,boat trips,bars even seals sunbathing on the pontoons.

something for everyone. A great waterfront catering for all tastes in shopping, entertainment and a fab marina. The whole place is very similar to the waterfront of san fransisco. Something for everyone indeed.
We LOVE the Waterfront. I've never seen such a beautiful place to hang out, to go shopping and eating. Its so nice to just walk around, sit and relax somewhere next to the water and enjoy.
This is the hot spot in town. With a multitude of restaurants to choose from, and fantastic shops as well as fantastic people watching definitely go here early on when you are in Capetown

What a Buzz!. So much to do and see in this very colourful and cosmopolitan area. Great choice of eateries for all tastes and appetites. International brands and ethnic shopping galore. Marina/Port/Funfare/Museums/Entertainment - they're all at The Waterfront

Great Harbour development. A full scale shopping experience combines with bars,restaurants,food hall and museums. Easy to walkabout and perfectly safe.Visited the diamond museum and Titanic exhibition A good day and night out
Great place for shopping and eating.. So many shops from well known designer to excellent local craft shops. Umpteen places to eat, boat trips, trips to Robben Island.

Lovely place for everyone!!. Lovely place to spend the afternoon or evening, great food market and many incredible restaurants, Belthazaar steak restaurant was the best steak I've tried! Food market stalls are a must! The Aquarium was well worth a visit and a highlight!! Also loved going to see the Cape Fur Seals that swim and bask around here!

Great place to spend hours or days, plenty to do. You can eat, drink, shop and entertain yourself in this huge area of Cape Town.
The Robben Island tour departs from here.
The aquarium is really nice and worth the visit
On the weekends theres the Oranje market in one of their parkings (really nice for local produce).
VA Waterfront. Spent a couple of hours at the waterfront. Well worth the visit even though I have been there often. Catch the vibe and mingle with the tourists having fun.

Beauty at its best. From shopping to having a meal while enjoying the beauty of the ships and boats. The Nobel Square is a must see. Why not take a ferry to have a much better view of this beauty that Cape Town has to give. Robben Island gateway and museum is also another must see fro those fascinated by our history and earlier politics. Two Oceans aquarium is also another must see. Its friendly for both sigles, couples and families alike. Beauty at its best.

Fresh breeze and lots to do!. It's a place packed with luxurious yachts and lots of activities; from dining, to cruising, from shopping to live performance - one will find something to his taste. We went for an hour cruise and saw some dolphins and seals on the way! A great place to hang out for a few hours.

Great buzz. Enjoyed meandering around here for 3 days with a great choice of shops and restaurants. Great to stop and admire the harbour on one side and the backdrop of Table Mountain on the other.Has everything you need in one place for an enjoyable stay.

Great day out . An excellent place to spend the day. Just be warned that there may be many many people and mostly foreigners. I really enjoyed watching all the tourists and walking through the many shops and entertainment places.

Entertaining and Great Food. Looking for something to do? Somewhere to eat? I recommend V&A Waterfront. We ate here several times in the 3 days were in Cape Town. I have nothing bad to say about the waterfront. Lots to do and see. Very Clean!

Great place ot spend an afternoon. Not to be missed during your visit to Capetown. Very picturesque location with shopping, great waterside restaurants and some free entertainment. Access and parking is easy and you can use this for a jump off spot for some excellent tours as well. Go when the weather is nice so you can spend a few hours here.

Only shops we were in all holiday!. Lovely area for a lunchtime drink -bit like N>O> with some jazz musicians playing in the square. Great craft market and waterfront with lots of bars and restaurants. Plenty shops -if you want to do that.
Fun for shopping and great food. Not to be missed. The aquarium is great, there is very good shopping for arts and crafts, and an excellent covered food market.

Fabulous shopping and food. The V & A Waterfront has everything you could want in terms of shopping and food. From the mall, which has tons of name brand stores and restaurants to the ferris wheel, there is tons to do here if you are by yourself, with friends, or with family. Be sure to check out the food market and crafts market (two warehouses next to each other) which have great bites to each and cool crafts from all over Africa.

Wow... . The views are unbelievable, especially at sunset . The cruise was alot of fun on a lovely yacht... there's something for everyone at the waterfront. The V&A market is a must! Fabulous atmosphere and variety of foods.
A full day out. Lots of shops, bars, restaurants, attractions. You could easily spend a full day here and not do half of it. The craft area is excellent - next to the aquarium.

A main attraction in Cape Town. A very busy multi shopping complex, many different Malls. Including a whole area for local and ethnic crafts,something for everyone. Various areas for live music,and numerous restaurants and cafes. We were conscious of how safe the area compared with our visit in 1997, there was a security presence .

My favorite location to just hang out. There is always something going on on the waterfront. Live music, dancing and people watching. The Mall itself has something for everyone including a 'Rodeo' drive wing of very high end shops. Lots of great places to eat with a water view.
A highlight of Cape Town. A fantastic location and a great mix of shopping, restaurants and activities. Something for the whole family. A "must do" if in Cape Town.

V & A; Varied & Amazing. Every visit here is different thanks to the diverse live music performed, the turnover of people and the general 'buzz'. Great views on a clear day of Table Mountain. Nobel Square adds a dash of history and some photo opportunities. The Trading Post offers some good deals on tourist goodies considering the other options available from high end (rip off) outlets. The Big Wheel is not as big as clever lenses suggest and you'll get better views from Lion's Head or Signal Hill. Access to Robben Island from here; multiple benches to sit and watch the boats, the people and the seals and when you're done outside, you can always venture indoors. The Watershed now houses a craft market which is tourist nirvana I imagine, but the main building includes restaurants, cinema, high end outlets plus more pedestrian establishments and good, clean loos.

Interesting place in Cape Town. Though I did not live in the central of the town, I was very happy when I reached there. The crowd made me happy. There were a lot of entertainment, you can see magician, artist, orchestra, painter and so many many things. Since I arrived Cape Town, I was craving for rice and finally, I found it in one of the restaurants of waterfront. Thanks god!

What an array of shops and restaurants . I know my wife would spend her holiday just at the V&A, it has that many upmarket shops and restaurants! The food on offer is first class and at very reasonable prices....If you are intending to visit Cape Town, you would go to far wrong in choosing a hotel within the V&A as everything starts and ends here.
Shopping and Food!. Also took the time during our this years stay to walk through the mall. Good shops, lot of variety. Food at Melissa is delicious. They even have a cinema there!

V n A. This is our 5th visit to Cape Town Victoria and Albert waterside. Theres always so much going on. You can waste hours watching the boats coming and going. The different restaurants are too many to choose between. All so cheap with the exchange rate at the minute. So many great shops too.

Really cool place to go!. Came here with friends for evening meal, which was very good. We then had a good wonder around afterwards, and finished the evening off with an amazing Hagen Daas ice-cream, divine!
Busy, cosmopolitan area. Great shopping & choice of places to eat. Well worth a visit, especially in the heat of the day as it is all air conditioned

Lovely area, very lively and active. Great to walk along the harbourside. Cape town is one of the nicest cities in the world, and the Waterfront is an exciting area, full of sights, shopping, restaurants and amazing value.
In spite of South Africa's variable reputation, we felt no discomfort or anxiety at all walking around this area even at night
see separate restaurant reviews

Shop Til You Drop. A great place to shop with every shop imagineable in this stunning dockside development. A plethora of eating places where you can sit and people watch.. Take a boat trip to Robben Island or just go on a nail biting fast boat beyond the harbour. Masses to do.

Busy waterfront mall plus more. Although the mall portion of the v and a is touristy the African artisanal shops have lovely handcrarfted articles at very reasonably prices. The quality of my purchases was exceptional.

Great place great buzz. Has to be visited...lots of tourists of course . But fantastic bars, restaurants, shops and views.
We stayed in an apartment for three nights on the V and A . Great central place from which to visit Cape Town.
Stayed at V & A hotel. Lots to do on the Waterfront with restaurants and shopping. Rode the ferris wheel at dusk and saw a great sunset.

Touristy but fun!. Lots of action here -- besides upscale hotels, tons of restaurants (fast food, casual, and upscale), world famous retail shops, department stores, live entertainment and a playground there is also a great food hall with great sandwiches, smoothies, dried fruits, etc. and another large hall showcasing small local retailers selling everything from Christmas ornaments to one of a kind textiles and apparel to artwork. Or just enjoy walking around viewing the harbor and people watching. The trips to Robben Island leave from here, and the Aquarium and the Springbok Experience are also here, so you can easily spend a day or two here.
Good shops and restaurants . Visited a couple of times, good access to shops and restaurants. The live bands were great and easy access to taxis if not returning by bus

Fantastic harbour, lots of things to see and do. Great harbour to walk around, beautiful sunset pictures. Lots of great high-end shopping if that's your thing. Also Cape Union Mart, a shop selling the best equipment for hiking/camping/general adventuring is here if women want somewhere to deposit their husbands. Buskers playing music lend the place a great atmosphere. Food is great - from nice harbourside restaurants to a collection of fast food chains (McDonalds etc). Also traditional craft/art shops selling handmade goods (beware quarantine). Easy to pick up a taxi from here. Lots to do and see here.

Fancy tourist attraction. It is with togo there, because you'll have a great view to table mountain, lots of shopping possibilities, good restaurants, and the chance to go by boot to robben island or do shark diving, as well.

Busy and vibrant!. The V&A Waterfront is quite the tourist mecca. It offers shopping, activities, tours, dining and many flights of fancy for the local or tourist.The Food Market is a favourite of mine in particular - so many tasty things to enjoy if you dont fancy sitting down for a meal. The Red Shed is popular with tourists although quite pricey for souvenirs in my opinion.

I am a big fan of the V & A Waterfront, I visit it at least once or twice a month. There is plenty of parking.. There are many lovely shops and so many Restaurants to choose from.My favourite Restaurant is Den Anker, Belgian Restaurant. There food is alway good. Balducci is also another favourite.

Shopping & Food !!! 🍤🍝💳💲🎡 . Love love this place!!! Could spend hours here and you never get bored! Dine and have a spectacular view of beautiful yachts! All restaurants are pretty good but if you love indian cuisine Bukhara is THE BEST!! A bit pricey but soo worth it. Don't waste your time in Canal walk rather shop here

Shop till you drop. When it comes to dining or shopping, there's something for everyone at the waterfront. From takeaway burgers to fine dining. And from high street fashion to chic. Don't miss the crafts in the Water Shed.It's easy to dismiss the complex as a tourist trap, but tourism boosts the economy and provides badly needed jobs.The waterfront is also just a pleasant place to stroll around, with no litter and good signposting and security.I was less impressed with the parking. We drove past several entrances to underground car parks, all without any visible info on tariffs. Do they seriously expect people to park without any knowledge of what it might cost? In the end, we found free on-street parking just a 10-minute walk away.

Nice shopping mall; take time and oversee. Went here couple of times, since we dont get to shop much in our country. Was very nice to have so much stuff together. Parking is easy and there is always space. The back part of the mall is pretty poshy, for the rest it is a nice combination of shops.

The whole is more than the sum of its parts. What to do, where to go, what to see, where to eat? At V&A Waterfront that is a luxury problem. Way too much choice.Eating: the first time we had good fish & chips at the Fish Market near the Clock tower. The second time we ventured further into the Waterfront and had a pleasant lunch at Sevruga. And don't miss the Food market!What to see? The seals are lovely, Nobel Square is worth a visit, the Wheel is nice, the swing bridge swings. Just walk around, take in the sights and shop till you drop, if that is your thing!

Amazing. This place is very special it has all ur designer shops inside and top restaurants outside but with a twist. for uk citizens eating and drinking is peanuts £1 pints of peroni and cocktails of your choice @£1-50-2-50 if u go to cape town and miss this place u will be making a very big mistake it is a top drawer tourist destination V&A awesone.

Just LOVE the vibe of the V&A waterfront!!. From excellent restaurants to great shopping and lively street entertainment, this is definitely not to be missed. The buzz of the place makes you want to keep coming back again and again.

No Parking and Overpriced. Granted, the location of the place is beautiful and it has a very extensive selection of restaurants and shops, but as a Cape Town resident I tend to avoid it because parking is often very difficult to find and everything there tends to be overpriced.
This is where it all happens. Shopping, Dining, Entertainment, Cape Town Wheel, and so many activities on the waterfront... its all there !!

Great location and something for all the family. We were in CaeTown for three days and went to the V&A Waterfront a couple of times for lunch. Not to be missed is a trip round the harbour and look out for seals playing right by the quay. There is a great atmosphere and the wonderful backdrop of Table Mountain and there really is something for everyone - big wheel, live bands, cruises, eating and drinking and shopping till you drop!

Definitely worth a Visit -- even if you don't want to shop. We were surprised when we heard that this was the most visited location in South Africa...and I guess we made the mistake of thinking it was just another waterside tourist trap. Which was a shame because the V&A is much more than that....and we could have spent a lot more time here. Don't get me wrong -- there are shops here, really good ones too. Department stores. Fashion labels and much more. There are also amazing eateries, wonderful craft and local arts/fashion designers, tremendous local foodhalls/markets and much much more. Here we hopped on a small boat for a great rise around the harbour, got a hair cut and colour, bought linen and a dress from local designers (at great prices I might add), bought suit coats and pants for my husband and much more....all in less than four hours. We found a fantastic wood-fired bakery and learned more of the local history. We ran into lots of really helpful people and the place was buzzing -- even on a weekday. We could easily have spent much more time here -- and will definitely aim to do so if we get back to Cape Town.

Always a winning destination!. At the V&A there is always something fun to do for every member of the family. As a Capetonian that lives just up the road it is our local go-to, come rain or shine. From affordable boat rides to movies, play areas to the aquarium, fish n chips to a Primi salad, we are spoilt for choice at the waterfront. It really is a world class destination and fun for all!

World Class . The Victoria and Alfred waterfront is one of the best Waterfronts in the World...if not the best. With magnificent views of Table mountain.The waterfront allows you to shop till you content. The restaurant's are amazing. You can have, Italian, Chinese, Mediterranean, continental ....pretty much anything you desire. The area is also filled with entertainment. The aquarium is a must see.I can highly recommend this venue.

Something for Everyone . You can spend days exploring the V & A Waterfront. Mall shopping, groceries, restaurants, Historic sites, cruises, ferry, Aquarium, and the list goes on. This is a major tourist center, with the crowds and prices to match. It is also frequented by locals and is definitely worth experiencing.

It's my go to place for shopping. Being a local I love shopping here even though designer outfits can be pricey. This is the place to visit with friends and family as there are plenty of great restaurants to eat or if takeaway is your thing then do that. Eat your lunch at the ampitheatre as usually their is a band playing or magicians act. It's a fun safe place and consider doing to sunset cruise, it's beautiful

A buzzing location. The V&A waterfront provided a hub for our few days in Cape Town. The atmosphere in the restaurants and bars at night is fun and during the day the gift shops and trips are essential. You wont find bad food in the eateries here. Look out for the seals in the harbour water they are keen on playing and sunbathing.
