The most spectacular Waterfront. This Waterfront has the most unbelievable atmosphere and scenery. It has everything one could wish for to entertain the whole family. A variety of restaurants from the most expensive and sophisticated to the most affordable. The shops are great and there is so much to keep tourists busy for a few days.

Great Souvenir Shopping and Great Restaurants . Over our couple of days in Cape Town we went to the V&A Waterfront a couple of times. We did a bunch of shopping for family and friends and also had a meal there which was also very good.

Stunning, fantastic shops and restaurants running along the waterfront.. Vibrant area and so clean and beautiful. Lots to do with many eateries to choose from, with great food and so cheap. You cannot miss this area.

Great place to meet. Great place to meet, eat and shop; and if you want the best shave ever go to J C Cobb on level two of the precinct. Enjoy a truly decadent cream or high tea at Cape Grace, rub shoulders with Hollywood actors and KNOW you are every bit their equal!

Easy and relaxing way to stroll along the marina!. We enjoyed strolling around shops, restaurants, cafes while watching diverted activities taking place around the area. There is a lot to see and do in this appealing area. We would visit one brewery for a drink, then moved to a cafe, and just tried different spots. Nice restaurants to choose from, interesting shops of all kinds, entertainment of diverse kinds or one can take a cruise along the area.
Good shopping and eating. A wonderful place for food, drink, street performances and shopping. Hub of all things tourist in Cape Town

Fun way to spend an afternoon!. We went to the V&A waterfront for an afternoon, which was plenty of time to spend there. It was a good spot to sign up for helicopter rides, shark diving, or boat trips if you are interested- but you can get better deals by calling the companies directly. Lots of cute shops and restaurants, especially the food market. Also- you must walk along the ocean front for the views of the sail boats- so beautiful!

A lovely city waterfront . Enjoyed wandering the V&A waterfront while staying at the Cape Grace Hotel. Tried many bars and restaurants... And loved the extensive shopping mall too... The exchange rate was very favourable against Sterling so we got some good bargains...
Tremendous choices.. This is a huge mall down by the seafront with numerous shops and wide range of goods.Also has several restaurants outside overlooking the harbour offering different cuisines.
Great area of the city. Very large area of the waterfront which has been redeveloped over the years into a great shopping and restaurant area. Many things to do and see.

Amazing surroundings...VERY RUDE STAFF. The waterfront is stunning! There is a great vibrancy about the area but sadly your good opinion of the area may be tarnished! The staff in ocean basket restaurant, pick n pay supermarket and ferrymans bar have amongst them, the rudest staff members and worst customer service I have seen in a while! Being black myself, I would have expected the black South Africans to treat me with atleast basic human dignity but instead, I was given dirty looks, disrespectful service (no greeting, no help packing the bags and they didn't even tell me my total price!!!!)!from the checkout assistants at pick n pay supermarket in the Victoria mall. The staff in ocean basket restaurant in Victoria mall ignored me and I only wanted a takeaway! Instead of being helpful, I had to approach them so my order could be taken. I waited about 20mins on top of the 20mins they told me I would wait and when my food was ready to come to me, they left it on the side for about 15 mins so when my food arrived it was cold!!!! The ferrymans bar ignored my existence too. I don't know if it's a jealous thing as we are both black but they are serving me so they much treat me in nasty manner but management should change this quickly as the popularity is likely to decrease if this continues. It's like a form of xenophobia on the black South Africans part because white afrikanas were treated properly!! They staff must think my money isn't as good as theirs so they treat me like a second hand citizen

Excellent !!. Absolutely love the Waterfront , the range of shops , restaurants , street entertainment ,the Watershed. We enjoyed it all and felt safe as a family day and night. Wonderful restaurants that catered well for us a family of 12!! Alfredo's and the Karuba and Quay 4 being our favourites!

Something for everyone. Great restaurants and a ferris wheel; the gateway to Robben Island Museum; lots of shops; live music. It's touristy and shouldn't be a place you spend too much time, but it's good for an afternoon or evening. Have dinner at Ocean Basket. Affordable and generous seafood restaurant.

An absolute must when visiting Cape Town!. We love the waterfront! Whatever your preference, be it shopping, watching a busy harbor, taking a cruise, visiting the aquarium, taking in the currently staged Titanic exhibition, taking in a movie or having an excellent meal...the waterfront offers it all!

Attending my daughter's showing at CpT International Design Indaba's Emerging creatives 2016 Expo. So refreshing and inspiring to see the talent and confidence that exists among SAs youth - proudly South African!
blows Sidney Harbour away. I was told that this was like Sidney Harbour butt I had found that disappointing. this is ten times better and well developed with good oper
Very trendy and pretty site (also very Touristy). Nice boutiques/shops, great for people watching and a departure site for a speed boat tour of Cape Town bay.

Fastastic location to enjoy the ocean view as you enjoy a meal. V&A Waterfront offers you an ocean view opportunity as you enjoy a meal or a drink in one of the many restaurants available in this location. There is good security and plenty of boutique shops if you like shopping

Great regeneration project. Visited here several times and eat and drank in a couple of places. This is a good example of how tourism can help to regenerate areas of the city. Plenty of good places to eat and drink and great for people watching.

Very unique experience!. I have been to the V&A Waterfront a few times now and every-time I go there I enjoy it so much! Its truly one of the most unique places to go to in the world. Its got so much to offer, from the best restaurants to flying around in a helicopter. Fantastic shopping experience plus beautiful pubs on the waterfront. I can highly recommend this to anyone young and old!
Excellent for those you love shopping.... the Waterfront is worth visiting especially for those you love shopping! I love the foodcourt where you have for every taste.
Window Shopper. great places to eat,window shop or shopping if you dont mind spending and also fun walk on harbor and boat rides
Lively experience. Great place to eat and shop. Certainly should not be missed. Can be a little crowded during holiday periods and weekends.

A touch of world class shopping experience.. Being a local I sometimes find myself in amongst hundreds of tourists bustling through the waterfront. They are all buying the expensive stuff whilst I do the menial task of popping into the chemist. And I'm not complaining .... I'm thrilled with the versatility this centre caters for. This way it will never fade as there is something for every occasion and every budget.
Big. This mall is located right at the pier where the Cruise ships come in. It is very big and the prices are quite reasonable.
Great restaurants and shops.. Great way to spend the evening. Wonderful assortment of outstanding restaurants. The waterfront is beautiful day or night.

The cool place to be!. Tons of restaurants and live entertainment. There is everything from seafood to Portugese to a craft brewery. If you are from the U.S., be prepared to wait much longer than usual for service-it is just the norm over there in S Africa. Prices are super cheap with the current exchange rate. It was typical to get an appetizer, a few alcoholic drinks, meal, and dessert for around $20 total.

Fun and busy. We spent several hours at the Victoria & Alfred waterfront. Just before we left we discovered a large warehouse-type building that contained many, many vendors selling mostly handmade crafts. I think it is called the Watershed. Wish I had gone their first for my souvenir shopping. It was delightful!
WORTH A LOOK. Walked along the Victoria and Albert waterfront many stalls restaurants and the ferris wheel enjoyed but tiring

Same old same old. Bars,cafe's,shops, souvenirs. It's a tarted up harbour just the same as a thousand places in the world. To be fair, it's very well done, and many of the historic buildings have been preserved, but tourist traps like this are just not for me,

Busy as hell. A good mall but can see clear bolt ons with little planning of stores on bottom level. Top level a bit more organised. Great entertainment areas and can do with a little high level clean up. While a great location it is city locked with traffic at all times due to poor enterance planning.
Great buzz . I love walking around here on our visits to Cape Town. There is always lovely places to eat and wonderful music playing. It is an absolute must if your visiting Cape Town

Cannot better the vibe. All round great experience for any tourist. Excellent scenery and an array of restaurants to choose from. The adjacent shopping mall also caters for all interests and price ranges. Live bands and street performers enhance the overall mood in peak times. Restaurants could sometimes be a bit touristy and pricey and hence I prefer dining somewhere outside the Waterfront. Still good experience though. A harbour cruise is well worth it.

Kevin & Rita Taylor. What an amazing experience we had at the V&A Waterfront. So much to see and do. Shopping is fantastic, so many restaurants to chose from and amazing coffee shops to take a well earned rest. Went to the Titanic exhibition which we thoroughly enjoyed and saw some awesome artifacts. Beautiful waterfront area where nothing is overpriced. Listened to some young men singing. They were brilliant and enjoyed by many. There are many boat trips you can take throughout the day at very reasonable prices. Definitely worth a visit.

V&A Waterfront. Brilliant, vibrant place. Can get quite busy in the fast food restaurants in the centre, but there are absolutely plenty of restaurants around the area, cuisines ranging from noodle bars right up the way to fine dining! A good assortment of shops in the shopping centre (international shops such as Jo Malone, Burberry, Levi's), even an M&S! there's also a lot of craft shops with locals making souvenirs. Just fantastic!

Amazing Place. This must be one of the most beautifully restored harbours in the world. The whole old harbour has been turned into an historic area with extensive shopping, many restaurants, museums, a marine land, condos and many arts and crafts venues. This is an absolute not too miss in Cape Town.
all you need. all you need for your stay in cape town, food clothing electronics souvenirs - and good food! excellent variety of restaurants.
Odd place. There are several old buildings which make this place great but on the whole it is just a massive shopping and eating place.

A must visit whenever you are in the mother City . This is where 99% of all tourists and spend their time and money, simply because it offers you almost everything you need, from sport pub, hotel, good restaurant, boat trip, gate way to famous Roben island, to and Great Shopping Centre and more. Can be over crowded at times perhaps time to upgrade.
Nice place but very touristic. Nice place to see in Cape Town.A lot of tourists.Nice hand-made market. These people are really talented.

Something for everyone. This place has it all! Tons of restaurants, lots of shopping in the mall, and loads of attractions. In the evenings you'll find street performers and music groups. In the mall there are brand name shops, but among the restaurants, you'll find gift shops that sell souvenirs. They have an aquarium and you can book a little harbor cruise, too. If you do not like big crowds, this is not your place. I went in December/January during peek tourist season and it was very crowded. Parking is somewhat of a nightmare.

Great design for shopping and leisure. It is easy to get lost in the V&A shopping mall, but after snapping up some great bargains there are several great restaurants where you can while away the afternoon listening to music or whatever else is going on. Such a cosmopolitan atmosphere and a real buzz. Loved it.

Great shopping are with a few good restaurants.. Watershed: Great for shopping African Gifts. Nice bars and restaurants (Willoughby & Co. in the Victoria Wharf - best and cheapest sushi ever in my life!). Some nice views, bars, shops, restaurants and music.

Visit is a must. The waterfront is where it is art - wonderful fish restaurants and cafes and not expensive and the place to book your trips direct and cheaper with the tour operators. Lots going on and if you are a shopper, you are spoilt for choice by the surrounding malls. Great day or night but noisy and full of energy.

Fantastic place to visit . A perfect relaxing spot for eating, drinking and shopping!!A great selection of designer shops, pleased my wife immensely !!Restaurants are of great quality, good selection and well priced!There is a good mix of local shops, ideal for souvenir hunters!There is various street entertainers which are very good,and many options for tours, boat/helicopter and shark cage diving!All in all a great and safe place to visit and we WILL be back!!

Nice African Stores in this "Regular" Mall. The mall was nice, clean and obviously a "destination" for lots of people. There were some shops with local African flavor, but most were chain stores that are in most malls around the world. We ate in two places while in the mall... I can't remember the names. One was good, the other, not so much. The prices were mid range for the food, but we could have done better. If you're going there, seek out the two local African themed stores that are next to each other. Their prices were good. There are also a number of kiosks with African made items. Skip the chain stores. You can find them everywhere. (One thing that was concerning was the heavy level of security there. We kept wondering why!)

Shop, eat, play and more. The shopping centre is fabulous. Designer shops for men and women as well as some of the locals' old favourites like Woolworths, Edgars, Foshini's and Truworths. Lots of restaurants for any kind of dining - from cheap fast foods round the amphitheater, to fine dining in some of Cape Town's best restaurants. I love Ferrymans ( with craft beer, awesome pub grub and live music) and Quay Four (great bar, great food and great view), Sevruga for sushi, Ocean Basket for a great fish menu, and so many more. Lots of excursions are available from here - sunset cruises, harbour cruises, kayaking for the brave, hellicopter rides, a ride on the Cape Town Wheel ( SA's answer to the London Eye), a trip down rugby's memory lane at the Rugby Museum, a glimpse of life under the sea at the Aquarium ( one of THE best outings for kids), free entertainment most weekends in the amphitheater, a stunning jungle gym with water play next to it for the kiddos, so much I can't think of everything right now. The craft market is worth a visit, so is the scratch patch (collect semi precious stones to take home) and cave golf is fun. All in all you won't regret a visit to the Waterfront. As a local, I go often and have never been disappointed. Parking is plentiful. The MyCiti bus stops right outside the main shopping centre and runs regularly until late at night. Lots of taxis service the Waterfront and its a stop on the City sightseeing hop on hop off bus tour.

Hustling and bustling. Cape Town’s Waterfront is no different from other similar places in the world. Lovely lure for tourists, trying to squeeze everything out of them. If going shopping, you will find lots of lovely items, but forget about bargain prices. Same with food. But still it is very worth visiting – in the end, there is no need really to buy anything, but to wander around, to look for various lovely details, to drink in atmosphere – it is all free of charge. Mind only – if you are taking taxi to return to your hotel, the rip off is ripe.
Fantastic Place to Visit. A must do in Cape Town. You could spend weeks here. Great dining, shopping, museums, boats, attractions. It has the lot.

Its a wonderful vibey place. Everyone visits the waterfront and with good reason. There is a lot to do if you like eating, shopping, movies, good views of the harbour, and generally watching the world go by. Its often teeming with people so some days more congested trafficwize than others but overall a lot of fun for everyone in the family.

A Must. If in Cape Town you have to visit the Waterfront every day you are there. So much to see and do, either shopping or eating at the many seafood restaurants you will be consumed by the atmosphere it grabs you by the arm and leads you from one interesting craft shop or eatery to another place of enjoyment.

So much to do!. Shopping, eating, sight-seeing, tourist attractions - the place has it all. My favourite food as at the Food Market. There is a beautiful craft market (albeit a bit pricey). A harbour cruise is well worth the time.

Just perfect place in capetown. You are right in the sea, you she the cheap and the expensive in the very same place, you can go to harbor house or to kfc, you have the best stores and the beat restaurants in the are. I recommend

Absolutely love the Waterfront!!. Super place to spend many hours.Fantastic array of restaurant catering for everybody. Shops and stores galore, craft warehouses food halls excursions can be booked here and boat trips,see the seels in the harbour. Just oozes good times!!

A MUST TO SEE AND MANY THINGS TO DO. If you are press for time when visiting Cape Town, this is the place to go! It is difficult to pin point a specific location as there is something for everyone...adults, teens and younger children. During my visits there ( 2 days) I had a wonderful seafood dinner at a local restaurant on the main strip and across from the ocean. I was fascinated with the large Ferris-wheel and due to the long lines I decided not to venture there. In stead I visited the Water Shed that had many various stores and vendors selling their specific creative wares. This included hats, costume jewelry, flowers, clothing, house-hold wares and much more. After making several purchases I continued to the mall. Here there are also many stores at this location, including restaurants (some USA chains) a hotel, easy to reach rest rooms and much more. If you are in the market for diamond jewelry, visit Shimansky, located in the Clock Tower, and take a tour of their diamond factory. You will come away with a much improved knowledge of how diamonds are crafted and will likely be able to select your diamond choice be it large or small with confidence. in addition the staff is professional, helpful but not pushy. If you want to try different ethnic foods, tour the area that has anything that you have a taste for. At most stops the food is cooked while you wait guaranteeing freshness. You and your family are in for a fun filled day. Enjoy!

Three days in Cape Town. A must visit! We were not there to shop but you could if you wanted to. Great place with lots of restaurants and interesting historic buildings. Take the hop on hop off bus to the V&A and then do their mini cruise of the harbour for peanuts (free if you buy a two day ticket)! Will help you get your bearings!
Fun Place. Enjoyed it tremendously.Highly recommend it if you visit this area and have time. Music and good food. Shops with interesting local art, etc.

Always worth a visit !. A great spot ! Has a wonderful vibe ; shops , activities , concerts and restaurants to suit any pocket . The hub of Cape Town !If in Cape Town , never miss a visit to the V&A !!

A really great place to spend your time. We have visited Cape Town several times over the years, and we always make a point of spending time here in this fabulous public space. The shops are wonderful, and this time I did purchase a lot of stuff!! The bars and restaurants are world class, but our favourite place for a drink or a light meal is Alfredo's as it is right opposite all the street performers. Musicians, choirs, dancers.........all performing whilst you relax and take it all in.The views to Table Mountain too are really lovely and there are lots of activities that start from the V&A.In truth, I could spend whole days just here, down by the waterfront!
Nice place . Nice place in Cape town with good restaurants and shops. Have a glass of wine at one of the cocktaillounges and enjoy the atmosphere, it's fantastic.

restaurants. lots of good restaurants but some overpriced and overated, especially Dash Restaurant which is situated and vic and albert hotel. Foi Gras on the menu, shocking, should not be allowed, so many restaurants discontinued this yet Dash has to keep it on the menu

Só much to do here!. There are so many attractions here that one can easily spend more than one full day here. Take a ride on the panoramic Wheel for a breath taking view of Cape Town and Table Mountain. There are many excellent restaurants and hotels in this area supplemented by museums, cinemas and shops with the lastest fashion. And it is safe! Stay in a hotel in the Waterfront to fully experience the world class site!

Truly impossible to exhaust the many positive features. Absolutely 100 % a great blessing I visit every week and continue to enjoy serendipitous discoveries Dynamic Survival of the fittest Shape up or ship outSecurity excellent park and have the privilege of massive choice of restaurants etcDynamic and inventive !!! Full marks to management

Waterfront variety. It's FREE! There are loads of eating places, a museum and a huge building filled with boutiques selling local arts and crafts. A great place to stroll around in the sunshine,dozens of boats to look at; a South Africa Golf Hall of Fame and a swing bridge to watch sailing boats pass through.

Superb destination for everything in Cape Town. The Waterfront is quite incredible with amazing shopping, restaurants and attractions and magnificent hotels. Indoor & outdoor animations and a place to meet and buy everything you could possibly want. The underground parking is so convenient and it is totally secure. A must see.
An interesting place to go.. Typical tourist scene bit vibrant with good shops, great restaurants, and I trick place to visit. Well worth a visit, wouldn't miss it!

LIKE ALL THE REST . Just another shopping centre with all the usual outlets plus a few local vendors. Good views of Table Moutain from some outside areas. Hectic and crushed in season. Better shopping experiences to be had in Cape Town. Nicely designed though, great staff everywhere, plenty ifw parking and of course it's the gateway to Robben Island and the currently being built Modern Art Gallery.
Surprisingly pleasant. The waterfront has everything going for it. Many very good restaurants, interesting market stalls, boats in the harbour to see and a first rate shopping centre

Lots to do and see. Cape Town's Waterfront has plenty going on. Lots of great shops, a huge range of restaurants and coffee bars, outside entertainment, cruises, hotels, children's entertainment. A fantastic place to spend the day with great views of Table Mountain and out to sea.

Amazing place!!!. The Waterfront is a fantastic place. The most amazing shopping under one roof in the big shed that I have ever seen. Not exactly the cheapest but you need a treasure or two to take home. The Trading Post shop is another amazing place and reasonably priced. This is where I did quite a bit of my shopping. Just an amazing place!! Nice reasonable food places as well.

So much to see and do. If one is looking to shop (there's shops with some really nice, unique, quality items), eat at fancy restaurants, go for boat rides, take a walk and take in some beautiful sights, this is a really nice place with everything.
Parking is a rip-off. The V&A is one of my favorite venues to visit in Cape Town. Pity it has become one of the most expensive places to park your vehicle.

Great to wander around - but bring your wallet!. Its a bit expensive, but you have to expect it for the area. Really nice to just wander around and explore. I spent over 4 hours just walking! Great for a day.
Relaxing & Safe. Lots of interesting sights - a diamond museum ; tour to Roblin Island ; water tours ; decent restaurants ; great shopping ; etc. , etc. Something for everyone to see & do .
V & A Waterfront Fun For All. Awesome shops and restaurants plus little markets and great entertainers. Worth a visit when your in Cape Town .

The happening place at nighttime.... The Waterfront is busy and very popular at nighttime, with live music and residents and tourists everywhere.. even noisy wheeling and diving sea birds joining in the fun...lots of restaurants and shopping choices...
Everybody goes there. A great shopping mall. Must go there to take a trip to Robben Island. It is also the first stop for the excellent Tourist buses.

Love the shopping. The mall is just wow, so many shops and love the ambience.
There's everything shops, restaurants, cafes.
The place to be!

When you cannot find it else where, go to V & A. A visit to the V & A almost always make me feel that I am in an overseas country. It is really a buzz of all sort of languages, food, people,shops etc etci am a Capetonion, but this is a must visit. Even if just once of twice a year to make me realise what a wonderful city we are living in.

V & A waterfront in Cape Town. To me the Victoria & Alfred waterfront is the best I have come across in my travels. It made use of the old warehouses and turned them into pubs,hotels and shops. To sit outside the restaurant and overlook the harbour with yachts coming in, see sea lions frolicking in the bay and people watching is very relaxing. Overlooking this is the beautiful Table mountain. This was followed by shopping and the day ended by having excellent sea food. There is much to see and do .

Love. I feel an instant warmth when I come here.It's set up for tourists for sure - but the views are to die for, the range of food wide and the loungers to sip a cocktail on and just people watch keep us coming back.There's a huge mall plus tourist ware shops.Local musicians provide entertainment.You can hire bicycles, go on a boat trip or sit and watch the seals down on the observation deck near the aquarium (no charge). We saw a baby seal yesterday which was a treat!Highly recommend Harbour House for lunch.

Gorgeous setting for a spot of shopping and dining. We visited the Waterfront a couple of times and it is a great place to while away a few hours. Even if you don't want to shop there are numerous cafes, restaurants and bars with views out over the water and Table Mountain.
Fun place to visit.. Interesting shops including African crafts and great for souvenir hunting. Outstanding restaurants. great people watching and good vibes.Plan to spend most of the day.
Great venue. The waterfront has so many different places to eat great food along with tours & shopping. The Watershed has a lot of vendors with their local crafts.

Lovely but busy!. We visited the Waterfront because we were taking a trip to Robben Island (which is incredible!). The Waterfront is full of cafes, restaurants and shops, but on the Saturday afternoon we were there it was super busy and full of tourists. We grabbed a quick bite to eat and then left!

Lots of shops. If you want to do some shopping this is the place. Unfortunately most of them you could find in every country in the world. Restaurants of all types some good some not so good. Parking is easy and if you want to book a boat ride or a helicopter ride that can be booked at the V & A waterfront. There are the occasional crafts and non global brands. It also contain a couple of hotels. Worth a visit but don't think you are missing anything if you don't get there
Overpriced shopping. Okay if you want overpriced multinational shops you get anywhere in the world. There are a few African tourist shops and plenty of eating places. It's clean and cool.
Our go to place. A wonderfully vibrant place - lots of different restaurants, places to visit. Excellent for just sitting and people watching.

Shopping and Eating Mecca. The V&A Waterfront is like the Spanish Steps of Rome, Oxford Street of London and Rodeo Drive of LA. Also many accommodation choices around this precinct which still has a working harbour. From bargain hunting handmade items from rural villages and other African countries to Louis Vuitton and Chanel from France. All is available. Staff in the shops are helpful and friendly. Great variety of food from food stalls to 5 star dining experiences. Walking around this area you will find boat trips to various locations, shark diving operators, or air trips, streets buskers and athletic displays. Anything your heart desires. The V&A Waterfront is a destination that a visitor should not miss out on.

Remains a favourite . I am convinced this is my favourite mall in South Africa.I spent most of Saturday there again with my 6 year old playing mini golf in the cave, having face painting done and eating the best sushi in South Africa (Willoughby's). We usually do a boat trip or oceanarium visit as well when we have time. Awesome shops with everything you need, and want and don't need, and absolutely everything in between

Vibrant and plent of good eats. From street buskers to attractions, lots of eat places, shopping and generally watching the world go by this is a great exciting fun safe place to just stroll around, have a meal or sip a drink. markets, high end shopping, helicopter rides, bay sailing, it has the lot.
Always busy. Been there so many times already and the shops are nice, however overprices most of the times and it is always too busy. You cant have some nice relaxing shopping going on here.
Lovely location!. Everything a traveler could want,lots of places to eat,get drinks,shop,find African handicrafts.Plus there's frequently live music to add to the African flavor!

Fun place to mill around with several interesting museums!. Plan on spending a day exploring the waterfront area.... several museums (Battery, Diamond, Mandela Gateway, etc.). Plus lots of good food, the swing bridge, musicians, etc.

Area with great atmosphere. The waterfront gave me the impression of a big shopping mall with a lot of restaurants. However, the atmosphere in the area is great. There is lots of people outside, performances, many nice places to eat and some nice views over the water and on table mountain.If you don't have plans doing some shopping, then it's enough to just walk around here for some hours, enjoy a coffee or lunch/dinner in the sun and just watch the people walking around in this area.

Cant get enough of this place. I've been living at joburg for almost half a year now and it was a good decision to take a break and tag along with couple of my friends!! Place is just beautiful, if u are in Capetown business or pleasure ..this is a must visit place.. There is always more to see,..

Worth going to. Good shopping and some great restaurants. While some might consider it to be a tourist trap it was worth going here for the food and for the lively atmosphere. It was one of the few places open during Christmas day.

Overrated, just another tourist centre. Not my kind of place, mostly restaurants, which tend to be overpriced and a couple of shopping centres.Very busy and crowded, if that's what you like.The water trips in the harbour and the bay are actually well worth doing and they all leave from the waterfront.

Walk Along the Waterfront. The Victoria and Alfred Waterfront is filled with all kinds of interesting shops, boutiques and food stands. also, a variety of entertainers are performing outside for tips. This is a great place to spend a day or two or three!
A lovely vibrant harbor. Beautiful harbor, fun to visit, waters, ships, fishermen, big shopping mall and many restaurants. Fun and pleasure

Decent shopping and a people watching paradise. Range of fast food, cafes, clothes shops and most major brands. A delightful spot to wander about for a couple of hours. Quality shopping centre, safely controlled. Take in the views and watch the people!

Good safe place to visit. Lots of restaurants and good food options both day and night. there are metered regulated taxis available too. We dined here on a Sunday evening and enjoyed a great meal and a safe drive back to our Cape Town city hotel.

cape town visit. This is a nice place day or nighttime. You have a lot of shops for about anything, plenty of restaurants for any kind of food. there is a lot of entertainment for young and old.
And I am sorry to say, this is one of the safest places for tourists and everybody

Amazing Place.. We heard this was the current most visited attraction in South Africa and we know why. So much to do and fabulous places to eat. Visitor attraction are around every corner and the starting place to visit Robben Island. Did not expect to spend so much time there but was so much to do and see..

Perfect attraction for the tourist. Locally know as the V and A, the waterfront complex contains everything the tourist could wish for during a visit to Cape Town. Restaurants, shops, souvenirs, direct access to Robben Island, a giant wheel and local bands compliment the area: and it is only a short walk from the city centre. Just one word of warning - at the time of our visit the clock tower clock was one hour behind actual time so should you rely on that while waiting for the adjacent Robben Island ferry the result could be disappointing. It is worth checking..!
Well worth a visit. A very plesant development around the harbour. Shops, restaurants and always plenty to see. Very easy to spend time here.

Great place! Must visit!. There are plenty of restaurants and shops around.This place is great for shopping- cheaper than the UK and well worth a visit!You could easily spend a day here relaxing, eating and shopping.
A must go. We loved popping down to the Waterfront . Very buzzy ,a great atmosphere, lots of shops and restaurants..
Family Weekend at CapeTown. Very very good place for a walk, a good meal, shopping... Lots of relaxed people, plenty of street entertainement, and all the services you need (banks, atm's, taxis, etc)
Always a must when in Cpt. Beautiful surrounding with qamazing views. Lovely shops to get lost in for a few hours. Lovely morning spent taking in the vibey atmosphere
Vibrant. Stayed at the V & A here. Loved the atmosphere. Fll of attractions, shops, restaurants and bars. Very friendly and safe
First Class. The waterfront has a lot of good restuarants and also a shopping mall. It also has a big wheel which is good value for money

Great shopping. We were blown away by the V& A Waterfront - loads of shops, and at the present time (Feb.2016) 11 to the Australian dollar - so many bargains to be had.We enjoyed an excellent meal at Balthazar (inside is better than the terrace) at half the price we would pay in Australia.The Pick N Pay supermarket in the basement has a huge range of goods at great prices and the liquor shop the same (where else can you get a great bottle of local red wine for $A6.)We stayed at the Portswood which is about 2 minutes walk away - great hotel.

Busy Busy. Fun to walk around but seething with people. Good to walk around the old restored buildings but very very commercial with lots of pleasant but touristy restaurants and cafes with average food and drink. Huge shopping mall similar to anywhere in world and very few interesting shops. smaller buildings with bric-a-brac. One of those places that "you need to visit" but don't stay too long!
Commercial. Very commericial and not a typical Mall. It's designed for tourist and very expensive compared to other location.

Magical Venue . Our first trip to Cape Town started with a stay on the V&A.Its got everything for everyone- great restaurants, fantastic local art, terrific array of shops, good hotels & a pleasant night life

Shopping Dining and Sights. January in Cape Town proved to be a memorable time, with near bi-weekly visits to the mall and waterfront venues for sightseeing, departures and shopping for groceries at Woolworths and Pick and Pay proved to be convenient either by bus or Uber Taxi.Lots of visible security and shop friendly stores confirm that the V and A Waterfront is Africa's number one Tourist destination!

Good place to walk around after dinner.. The waterfront is full of shops, restaurants and bars and even boasts a Ferris wheel. It is a nice place to wander after dinner. ATMs are readily available for those who need them. Lots of sea lions frolic in the harbor and you can usually find one or two laying on the dock by the Table Bay Hotel.

Something for Everyone. Really good shopping centre.All kinds of shops from designer to cheaper types. Prices much cheaper than the U.K .Restaurants plentiful, varied and good value for money. Generally good service.

Special vibs.. No visit to South Africa is complete without visiting the Victoria & Alfred Waterfront the vibs begin when walking through the shopping arcade from the car park & burst like a firework display with the iconic view of Table Mountain with or without the Table Cloth,a view presently changing as the construction of a skyscraper appears to be about the obliterate the Cape Grace Hotel which has been twined in my mind as the foreground to Table Mountain.
Fun . It was good to walk around and so much to see and learn, the kids loved the V & A Waterfront. Interesting history and stores to see, and the big wheel was fun to use and see the whole of V & A
Something for everyone. The V&A has something for everyone - trendy shopping, harbour cruises, historical and artistic experiences. A single visit would never suffice.

Don't miss this attraction. You can see yachts, sail boats, shops, restaurants, art crafts, hotels, etc. Plenty to choose from, and also the big Wheel, excellent ride, and views. Beside the shopping mall, there is a nice place for beautiful art crafts, don't miss it.
Well Wotrh A Visit. Shops, restaurants, cafes and entertainmnet. Add to that hotels, bars and good scenery - and you have the V&A Waterfont. It's a must for any vistior to Cape Town.

Excellent by day and by night. There are many excellent restaurants to be found at the V and A with a great variety of prices. There are plenty of shops to look at. The V and A is safe to wander around at all times as there is plenty of security.

Everything you need. Restaurants, miles of shops, live entertainment , kids rides and activities. Security and hotels.
A very large area on the waterfront. Boating, museums. Really something gif everyone.

So much to see. This is tourist central but also very relaxed with lots of locals having a drink or dinner. Don't miss this location on your trip to Cape Town. Plenty of options to eat, shop or dine- casual or up market - the choice is yours!

Relaxing, Exciting, Busy, Interesting .. It's all of that and more!. I loved wandering around the waterfront. Our first visit was in the morning and it was quiet, we wandered around the shops and I managed not to immediately buy a fluffy baboon in the gift shop although I succumbed during our next visit. The shops are varied and goods are reasonably priced which is often not the case at tourist attractions.There is a wide choice of excursions you can arrange, boat trips around the harbour, visit to the island where Nelson Mendala was imprisoned, trips around Cape Town. It's a good location to choose and book trips.There are loads of different cafes and restaurants to choose from and prices are very reasonable.There's a huge wheel on which you can ride and see all over the harbour when you're at the top. At first. I wasn't sure if it was a bit incongruent but it sort of fitted in and at night when it's all lit up, it looks lovely.There is outside entertainment and it's especially good at night when groups of people are standing around watching and, on occasions, joining in. There's a brilliant magician and the bands are great and change frequently so it's not the same thing all the time.At night it's really exciting but feels very safe. During the day it's more relaxing and you can sit and watch the seals swimming in the harbour or lounging on a small concrete space which has been reserved for them.I really enjoyed the Waterfront ... It's a great place to wander around during the day or at night and it feels very safe.
Bustling Waterfront. The V&A waterfront is a bustling area of shops and restaurants - it was well designed and built and it a nice place to spend part of the day.

Awesome half day actuvity. The waterfront is a must do when in Cape Town. There is a variety of shopping available and some nice restaurants. We ate at the Cape Town Fish Market and thoroughly enjoyed it.
full of life. very nice area, so many people around, but also child friendly, with a very nice playground, lots of things to do, enjoyed a lot to walk by

Shopping and much more.. There's a craft hall I believe is called Watershed next to the mall that is a must if you want to buy quality souvenirs! The V&A mall is nice but like most other malls. The whole place with the surrounding harbor is touristy but chill.

Too crowded. Hi. Too crowded. Expensive shops. Visited only Hamleys and Toys Kingdom. had a quick walk around. for food, we would recommend the food court next to the aquarium where you can get typical home made south african food and not the post restaurants of the waterfront.

Beautiful but touristy. Think the Inner Harbor in Baltimore V&A was a an industrial dock area -- a working seaport -- now converted into a huge shopping mall on the water. It's lovely. Walk around. Catch the boat to Robben Island.The restaurants are formulaic. The stores are the same upscale stores you'd find in any upscale mall anywhere. There are fun-ish activities for tourist: helicopter rides. Harbor tours. Seals. What you won't see are Capetonians. My friends told me they around the waterfront, let the tourists have the run of it.You have to go, at least once. It's fine for a beer and lunch on a sunny day. But don't forget to leave the water front and actually see Cape Town.

Such a lively place!. I travelled to SA with family and stayed for 4 nights at The Table Bay Hotel, the V & A Waterfront was a 5 min walk from our hotel. Every evening I would go for a walk down the waterfront with my music and fell in love with how lively the place was! The 1st thing which caught my eye was the cute amphitheatre where many locals and tourists gathered up and were performing in the evening and people grabbing a bite at one of the numerous waterfront restaurants serving all types of cuisines. Would definitely visit this place if in CapeTown.

Awesome . Awesome shopping - amazing places to eat with fresh seafood and great views of the harbor and Table mountain ! It is highly recommended that you spend a few hours exploring the V&A waterfront and maybe do a harbor boat tour.

Vibrant regenerated area with shops, attractions and restaurants. We had five nights in Cape Town and chose to eat at the Waterfront for four of the evenings. There is a wonderful atmosphere with a range of eateries, boat trips, entertainment from local African bands/artists and great shopping. There are a variety of shops selling local crafts, particularly the Watershed which houses a wide variety of goods produced by those in Cape Town townships. We also used this as a base to visit Robben Island and take a ride on the Cape Town big wheel, giving stunning views over the area.A vibrant setting to while away a few hours.

excellent. quite a long way to go but here I found the best ever Iced Coffee, for the great price of 50pence! but then you have to add on the air fare shame, if you like waterfront shopping and dining there is no better place to go.
Lively Lovely Place. Its crowded and happening place. A lot of choices for food and drinks and various activities. Helicopter ride, ferry ride and many other options to explore.

Titanic Exhibition . The waterfront has this way to make you feel like a tourist in your own country. We visit the exhibition and it was really interesting with some good artifacts. Slightly pricey, but worth if. Great history on this tragic event. Plenty of parking available and you feel like a tourist. What more do you want?

Lots of fun but a but overwhelmed by shops. This should be the perfect place to spend a few hours, with views, places to eat and entertainment. However, I was a little overwhelmed by the large shopping mall plunked in the centre. Still, ignore that and have a lively time anyway, whether taking a helicopter or big wheel ride or just enjoying the non-shopping ambience.

Fun Area. Great, fun area with an assortment of restaurants, shops and amusements. There is a Comedy Club in the evening which is a great way to spend a very inexpensive evening. Equally the shopping mall offers lots of good shopping opportunities. Helicopter flights, shark trips etc are all well serviced in this area.
Great atmosphere. This area is highly popular and rightly so as there is a great atmosphere both during the day and in the evening. Lovely restaurants, bars and excellent selection of shops.

Awesome vibes but expensive . Come to the waterfront on a Friday night for live music and and awesome Cape Town vibe. Beware that everything is extremely overpriced in the waterfront. Rather find some other place for food.

Something for everyone . Love coming to the V&A. Lots to do and to see. Fun for all ages. Love the new 4D movie cinema.
Safe for kids. Nice live shows and music. Amazing boat rides all around.

Excellent place. This place has many options of restaurants, bars, stores, local attractions, a great handicraft gallery, beautiful views from Table Mountain and Pier. You can see seals and boats along the pier.

Fantastic choice of restaurants , shopping and entertainment.. very safe too. I love this area of Capetown. Lovely place for shopping ( even local gifts are not overpriced and cheaper than market prices), gorgeous restaurants , cinema , local entertainment and more. Where is other places could be unsafe at night this place feels very safe and comfortable . The views of the table mountain and waterfront are stunning too . Not to be missed

central point. The main shopping plae in cape town. We were on holiday so werent bothered about shopping, but it is such a nice area to walk around. Quieter in the mornings, gets very busy in the afternoons. Lots of nice restaurants and shops. Go to the clock tower and watch the boats come in, the bridge opens up for tall boats. You can easily pass an afternoon here. Go to the tourist information centre and get the cape town tourism brochure, its got lots of information and discount vouchers. Lots of taxis here to take you back to your hotel, they do try and charge you more than they should, always ask how much it is before they take you, they will barter with you. 10 rand per km is what i was told they should charge. One we got late at night tried to charge us 50 rand to go less than a km (we were told not to walk after dark), so we just walked away.

Bustling . Great place to wander around and take in the history, museums the various shopping areas and the restaurants. Or just sit and watch the world go by. Several street entertainers in addition to the amphitheatre. Feels safe day and night. Excellent choice of some very good restaurants.

Food, ferries and Fendi. There are a great restaurants on the waterfront (we loved Harbor House) and the dinner in the Table Bay Hotel. You can also catch the ferry to Robben Island there. There are not enough good words to say about the mall. I bought a Gucci bag that was a third of the cost than in the US!!

Very nice boardwalk. Been there an night. Very nice boardwalk, clean, luxury yachts.There is a big shopping mall which closes about 9pm.We had a dinner at San Marco - Italian restaurant, which was great!

Great all in one spot!!. Good location to do a little of everything - food, shop, tourist items and general walk about.
A must visit to experience the cosmopolitan life of Cape Town.

Visiting Cape Town- start here. . If you don't like bustle and people then avoid this place, but you would be missing a treat. The Waterfront is full of tourist tours, boutique shops, restaurants, cafes, a very large shopping mall full of modern shops for the shopper in everyone. There is a food hall with ethnic and organic foods and another warehouse full of di usual stalks selling native African arts, crafts and clothes etc. We can easily spend a day or two just wandering around enjoying the atmosphere and purchasing souvenirs etc. If you want to be at the centre of things in Cape Town, then head for here. Did I mention the restaurants? Just head here in the evening and you'll find restaurants of all types buzzing with customers and with great food to tempt you.
Great area. We loved this area. Lots of places to eat. Very lively and entertainment was provided at several places. Great just to wander through or shop in the mall.

Well worth a visit. At the V&A Waterfront you have a whole host of activities to keep the whole family occupied. Shopping, eating, drinking, etc. You can also just chill out with an amazing view of Table Mountain and the harbour. Sundowners here is a must.

More, more, more!. Walking around the V&A and sampling all it has to offer is a day's worth of bliss. Eating, drinking, shopping, looking, listening, smelling - it taunts all your senses in the best way.

Nice place to spend an afternoon. As other people have already said, this area is very touristy. If you want something off the beaten path then this place is not for you. However, if you want to shop and eat, this place has lots of options. I especially enjoyed the V&A Food Market which was filled with smaller food vendors and gave you the opportunity to try different types of food for a small price (the ice cream and jerky we got from here was amazing!). We also enjoyed the Watershed, which was a separate building and had smaller stores that seemed geared towards artisans and carftsmen. Was able to get several souvenirs at a store called Original T Bag Design which recycles old tea bags and makes coasters, fridge magets, bags, etc. out of the tea bags. Beautiful products and the company provides jobs for women in Hout Bay.

Vibrant atmosphere. The VA Waterfront have it all. Shops, boutiques, restaurants for each taste, views over the ocean, Table Mountain and the harbour, romantic dining at night, art scape movies to choose from daily, and when you are tired of shopping indoors a boat trip or helicopter ride or just sitting at a restaurant overlooking the water or on a bench waiting or doing people watching. You have the best of both worlds. Shops and nature at your feet and combine this with the vibrant atmosphere and you have a win destination to enjoy as often as you choose to visit

beautiful place. We visit the Waterfront late afternoon to eat and take in the atmosphere. It surpassed my expectations with loads of shops, cafe's, bar's and restaurant's that were full of family's and couples eating chatting and taking in the early evening sun. We ate dinner on the upper deck and returned later in the evening to visit a couple of bars for a couple of night caps.I will definitely visit again when we return to South Africa.

Shopping and Food. The shopping is good. One building full of hand made crafts of all shapes and sizes. The two restaurants we went to the food was great and wine reasonably priced. The shopping mall is large enough to find something for everyone. Great pub to sit outside have a beer and burger and people watch.

Defintley worth seeing if you come to Cape Town. Designed for tourists - with all the usual tourist activity sales kiosks pushing wine, helicopter, boat, ski diving, safari tours etc. Lots of restaurant choices from fine dining to fast good - most of which are your bulk standard fast turnover tourist food but with some research including Trip Advisor one can find a couple of well worth it meals. Catch a boat for a 20 to 40 minutes harbour cruise. Check out the indoor malls for souvenirs when outside is too hot.

A great vibe with great shops and lots of restaurants . It's really happening at the waterfront. One of the nicest times spent here. Lots of people having the times of life. Lots of restaurants on the water of every pallet. A lovely array of international and local stores. It also has a host of hotels. A visit to Cape Town is not complete without visiting the V&A.
A very good development. Well worth a visit for the whole day. It's South Africa's "Pier 39 San Fransisco USA" but with less seals.

Every tourist should go here. There is everything you could want at the V&A waterfront, but it is pricey compared to other outlets as it appears to be geared for the tourist market, similar products can be purchased elsewhere at better prices! Having said that, the watershed in particular is fascinating, and there are trips around the harbour available too. I would say any visit to Cape Town should start here.
Great venue. This is an excellent spot to shop, eat, or just soak up the vibe. We kept going back and found new things each time. The swing bridge was a nice treasure to find.

The best place to stay. We stayed in a hotel on the water front and for us it was perfect. Many great shops restaurants . Music and entertainment just yards from our hotel. The area felt very safe with many guards on hand

Every Tourist City Needs its Tourist Trap. This place is truly remarkable but in an undistinguished way. Lots of restaurants that are (from the reviews of our group) not memorable. They aren't bad, they just aren't good - but they are about the only places open on a Sunday. Lots of shopping, lots of tourists to watch. But you could be in any city anywhere with a waterfront attraction designed to take money from tourists without enough imagination to do something truly special.

A place for everything. This is the place to be from helicopter rides, tanzanite and diamonds to just a place for food and drinks. Always a busy place with lots of shopping. The retail bit pales in comparison to other cities but a good place if you are needing some 'emergency' shopping. There are plenty of restaurants, bars and souvenir shops. Yummy springbok steak, farm butter and ice cream!

A unique and excellent place to visit. Spent the day here and was very impressed with the shopping and scenery. The food choices were good and something for everyone. A beautiful place to spend the day or afternoon. Will definitely visit here again. Great souvenir shops.

If a Mall can be fun, this is. I cannot believe that there are people who think that shopping is a form of entertainment, so my only reason for going to a mall is to get the shopping done as quickly as possible because there are so many shops under the same roof.As malls go, this one is more fun the most, a plethora of restaurants and cafes, lots of outside space and the Waterfront itself. In short, this is a mall where you can find something more pleasant to do than shop.

shopping galore. The shops in the centre are endless and all vary in prices. They seem endless and you can wander to your hearts content. The outside restaurants cover all tastes and prices. Well worth a visit to any of them. Outside also offers entertainment and more shops!

The V & A the total experience.. The Victoria and Alfred Waterfront is the complete day out destination, wither its the various international and local shops and restaurants, The setting is magnificent and the views of Table Mountain are beautiful. The Aquarium is a great attraction and boat trips can be taken into the working harbour and out to sea and Robben Island. It was quiet exciting to see the Tower clock and seeing the bridge move completely out as to get other boats with tall sails to pass by, and there after when the boats passed, the bridge comes together again so pedestrians can cross the other side.Why with one mall then you three yes V&A, Victoria Wharf and the Alfred mall and pier head plus the clock tower district renovated Shopping Mall in Victorian Style. just where to you begin?? Enjoy............

Such a nice place to visit . Very similar in feel to Darling Harbour in Sydney, the V&A Waterfront is such a great place for tourists to enjoy the amazing harbour, fantastic food and great shopping. Not the cheapest place in Cape Town but well worth a visit for a great meal at many restaurants, great nightlife and a very safe area.A must visit when in South Africa!

Beautiful!!!!!. One of the most beautiful parts of a wonderful city. Shopping, site seeing and wonderful dining. Lots of hotels in the area. There are also boats for tours of the coast. Cape Town is a bucket list place. The views of the sea surrounded by mountains is unbelievable especially as the sun sets. I look forward to going again
a hapening place. a mass of people scenic waterway easy to get a cab, many shops a huge mall street buskers a wonderful ferris wheel and some scenic ships, lots of good places to eat
Lovely just to stroll.. Great choice of restaurants and bars ,plenty of live music . Lots of boat tours available and a good size shopping mall.

Great mall and restaurants at V&A. My cruise included a 3 day stay in Cape Town and my hotel offered a shuttle to V&A so I wandered around on my own, taking in the sights and having dinner at a South African fare restaurant. (Good food!). The next day I returned with 2 friends for a seafood dinner at the Cape Town Mart where my cane was knocked over and landed in the harbor. The restaurant manager tried to locate it, but it sank like a stone. Next thing I know he is at the table saying he found a cane that he could purchase for me. Now that is service! Lots to see and do at the V&A!
Where the tourists go. Nice walk with loads of souvenir shops, boutiques, restaurants and art shops. A lot of tourists go there and it can be convenient for last minute souvenir shopping.
Too many shops that you can visit anywhere.. All the chain stores from back home are here in abundance. Onecomplex has more local stalls but all in all not a great experience.

It's a must. You will enjoy it if you like shopping. Enormous huge shopping center with all shops and makes you may think of. In adition you get the harbour which is a pleasure too. High quality restaurants etc.

Mother and daughter time. Had a lovely half day here with miss 11 would have spent the whole day but for another engagement.Walked around the V and A shops for a while, caught the Ferris wheel, wandered around outside then spent a good hour at the watershed shopping area which is full of superb and different arts, crafts and souvenirs. My daughter had her hair braided there.Fabulous smoothly and juices in the food hall.A great place to explore!

Leisurely stroll. There is so much to do here....You may go for a sunset cruise into the ocean,take a sip in the innumerable bars around here,grab a bite at one of the cafes,go for shopping in the malls or just stroll around listening to live music played by bands.You may also enjoy dinner with your family at the many restaurants here.

Super Fun. Lots of great shops, great energy, cool souvenirs. A wonderful place to either shop it up or sit, relax and people watch with a good cup of coffee. Don't miss the WaterShed with all the artists with handmade goods, lots of really cool hand made arts and crafts. I especially loved Fay's Miniature World with the most gorgeous handmade miniatures.

V&A Everything!. The Waterfront remains a firm favourite for shopping, accommodation, movies, dining, meeting friends, being a local tourist or simply killing time by watching the world go by. It's easily accessible with many parking options. If you're a tourist, one day is simply not enough. It also remains a working harbour which adds to the appeal.
Excellent pedestrian area.. Large area by the docks with shopping malls, plenty of bars and restaurants and pleasant walking. Safe environment with plenty to do and see.

Worth a visit. We visited Cape Town on holiday for a week and were based at the waterfront village in the marina area. A week isnt long enough to see everyyhing round here theres so much to see and do.

A hive of activity. Really .....the atmosphere is always great ,the views are limitless,photographic opportunities abound ,shopping is fun and lively ,quiet restaurants there are not ,the restaurants give good food ,great service at an affordable price but you don't go here to eat that is an add on , enjoy the ,V&A it really is a great outing

WOW ! Must go, see, feel !!!. This place is amazing much larger in scale from Baltimore Inter Harbor. There is so much to do here that it took us two days and that was not enough. First there are the restaurants, many many really class places to eat and price points all over the place. The shopping mail goes on forever and I mean forever ! There is a shop for anyone who wants shop! There is also a small venue for local small restaurant venders, try the crapes ! Really good. And lastly people watching is very good! People from all nations.
Worth a visit. The V&A is worth a visit with plenty of shops and different types of food outlets.There are lovely views of table mountain and is a nice place to spend an afternoon

Shops, cinemas, restaurants and cafes. V&A Waterfront is an easy destination if you want to do ordinary shopping, eat, drink and feel safe. HOWEVER, do not think this is "South Africa". Coming here is like going to any large mall in any country for some days, return home and claim you visited a country. It is indeed nice and functional, safe, clean and so on, but go up to St.Georges Mall (pedestrian street) if you want to get to know Cape Town.
Ok...just a bunch of shops on the waterfront. If you like shopping and would like to dine while you are at it, then this is the place for you. It is just a shopping centre with the sea view.

Nicely Done. Shops, a mall, restaurants and bars. The waterfront offers a lot for the traveler. Impromptu shows, stores, scenery and good restaurants. Walk around, take your time and find the hidden shop that has the treasure you are looking for.

Wonderful start to a holiday. Arriving at the water front it's difficult to decide where to go first We went on the big wheel so we could look across the city & watched Dolffins in the Harbour. Enjoyed a good meal & spent a few hours listening to a band playing 70's music. Good time was had by

Wonderful. What's not to like - lots of shops, lots of restaurants, lots to see and hear and 23 rand to the pound to spend, spend, spend. The views are especially great, Table Mountain, Signal Hill and the Twelve Apostles mountains on three sides, and the sea on the fourth.Easy parking and expensive - not. It's about £2 for a full day.

What a stunning City Frontage. Wow,Love this place what a great place to spend a few days. If you love good food, fabulous wines and a stunning back drop then this is for you. Not only eating very diverse shopping and points of interest dotted all over.This part of Cape Town has trilled and amazed us, and at night time it is in creditably vibrant and NOT to be missed.Cape Town is quite a remarkable place to spend some time and I for one will be back.

Great for a day or night visit, a must do in Cape Town. Well deserves a visit. Whilst it is a touristy place it is interesting and is far more than just shops and restaurants, although these are also excellent.We visited on a Sunday and as most of the shops in town are closed that day it was busy but with a great atmosphere and vibe. The Watershed was really interesting for artisan South African shops and we bought some interesting Wall art.We also returned to eat one evening and once again enjoyed the party atmosphere.

Best habour development. We always visit when in Cape Town. Such a well planned and beautiful development. Pity the shops have become so focussed on the upper end of the market. Good food everywhere and more than enough to see.

A must see!. We took the red double decker bus to town from our hotel and got off at the waterfront area. This was a bustling area with LOTS of shopping and dining options. We ate the Harborside Restaurant; another must! The watershed area is full of all local handmade items and you will be sure to find something for anyone and everyone on your souvenir shopping list! :)
Modernized waterfront of the old harbor.. Lots of interesting shops and restaurants overlooking the quay! Close to the best hotels in Cape Town.

Food and shopping! . What more can a girl want? The variety of shops, designer and local - just caters for all locals and tourists - live band and street performers, restaurants that have an amazing view of the Table Mountain and the harbor - busy with fishing trawlers and small boats - just take a seat, absorb the atmosphere and enjoy!

life and movement. this is one of the fun places in the world, you can walk around and look ate the interesting shops and people for hours the security is perfect and it is like a pary atmosphere all day and night.Huge selection of bars restaurants and shops.the is a food hall where you can eat home made foor and fresh Juices and the best cheesecake I have ever had.All in all great for all the family for 2/3 daysRichard

Prefect location and best bed I ever slept on!. Totally loved the hotel! We spent our last 3 nights in South Africa in this hotel and it was fabulous!Breakfast is very tasty and has options for everybody and if you want something different they can make it for you! The rooms are really comfortable and the bed was like a cloud!The location is also good for walking around, for shopping and for taking the hop on hop off bus, for high class dining or for budget dining ... All you want can be found close to V &A Hotel!

Relaxed place to spend a day. Nice place to spend a day in Cape Town. Some people might complain that it is too touristy, but I am here as a tourist! Went for a boat ride around the harbour had a good lunch at one of the pubs and a VIP ride on the Cape Town Wheel. By the time we had wandered around some of the shops it was late afternoon and another pleasant day had passed in Cape Town.Easy to get too and with plenty of secure parking.

Lots to do and see. At the waterfront it is full of things to do and see. There is the big mall which has many popular shops and restaurants inside. The waterfront itself has many traditional African souvenir shops. A beautiful harbour to look out at, as I sat on a bench I had the luck of seeing a family of sea otters swimming and playing in the harbour. There are plenty of chances to buy a ride on the different types of boats, tommy the tugboat for the children or a fast riptide one for the adults and everything inbetween. You can also buy a tour on a helicopter at the port for views of Cape Town and the waterfront. There is a feris wheel and street performers at waterfront as well as many bars and places to eat to enjoy the sun or watch the sunset. At The V&A Waterfront all of the locals are very friendly and welcoming, its gives the whole place a warm and bustling atmosphere for everyone.

Lovely walk. There is so much to see as you have access to both harbours and all the shops and cafes. Lovely place to sit and relax. We were there on New Years eve and it was packed with thousands of people and the firework display was amazing

Relaxed and friendly shopping and sightseeing experience.. Spent a few hours around the waterfront, shopping, eating and just watching locals entertaining passers by. A vibrant atmosphere, very safe feeling, and some very friendly locals to help along the way. On our next visit to Cape Town, I will be going back.

You could be anywhere. The waterfront is pleasant, upmarket, expensive. If you like plush restaurants and overpriced souvenirs with an attractive outlook then you'll love it but for me it didn't have much heart. It is attractive and worth a look but I personally wouldn't spend much time there.

Just too touristy. You have to be picky about which sights to stop for at the Waterfront, unless you're just there for the shopping! Nobel Square and the historic bits worth a look but felt like one big commercial enterprise and was most expensive lunch place we ate all week. Get out and see the real Cape Town!
V&A Waterfront. Very beautiful setting, buzzing and vibey area of Cape Town. Night life is happening in this part of Cape Town. The place is luxurious and for the classy.
Late hours could be extended . Great centre and where everyone heads to. Might be an idea to have much later shopping hours than they run currently.
A must see in Cape Town for shopoholics!. There are many restaurants and bars, shops and gifts to be had here. Fantastic night life and buzzing 24/7
New Year 2015. Wide variety of shops in the various malls, very clean environment on two floors.Outside perimeter mainly bars and restaurants, some with view of harbour.
Great Location. Really impressed with the V&A Waterfront loads for everyone, restaurants, bars, pubs, lots of shops & Arcades. Buzzing day & night, several live entertainers also day & night.
tourist friendly. a the centre a very busy area and lot of restaurant shops near the place and music band at night a lively place

Great place to spend a few dats. Love the waterfront, always a good atmosphere and we always feel very safe. Good shopping, if that's what you are looking for but better still, great restaurants bars and cafes.
Nice place to be. Tourists and locals visiting this nice place. Very different shops and a nice view of Table Mountain and the sea.

Nice Half Day Trip. The V&A Waterfront is a little touristy but worth a half day visit. Best in the afternoon so you can stay for a bite to eat at one of the many restaurants. We shopped a little and went on the Wheel of Excellence for some great views. There are plenty of shops selling African arts, crafts and curios. The shopping centre itself is nothing special, you can see most of the shops in other centres and prices were not that different.
everything you could possibly want, including pick and pay, lol :). loads of shops, mid-high end, fab' restaurants, love the place, safe, beautiful, table-mountain view x

Your Tschoke shopping heaven. The harbors been re-done for shoppers and apartment dwellers but there are excellent restaurants embedded plus some upscale shopping is starting to arrive. The rest is low-end retail of souvenirs. Fun parts: the Ferris wheel and the tour to Robben Island from here.

Where do I start. The waterfront in Capetown is brilliant, there are so many eateries all of which are good. We particularly liked the Mondiall its always busy but the cocktails are good while you wait. The food was excellent we had steaks. Opposite this is the Hildeband this is good for a long lunch time on the patio on the harbour side. We also went to Quay Four the seafood platter is amazing and so cheap as is everywhere at the moment.For drinks the Ferrymans bar is good with regular live music and decent bar food through the day.There are also several eateries attached to the shopping mall we didn't try them as there are so many but some others on our trip said the steak grill was one to try.The shopping mall is also pretty good with lots of designer shops if that floats your boat.The jewel in the crown was Shimmys Beach club its a little walk to the clock tower and then a free shuttle bus (only two minutes) but it is a place you can pend all day there is a few bars and a pool with sun loungers and the restaurant is very good, they do sushi and fish as well as all the usuals. You can sit and watch the boats going in and out of the harbour as you eat drink or relax.I could say so much more about this area the boat trips are good the live impromptu music and dancing around the area by the locals is great for a watch.You will enjoy !!!!!

Shopping!. Great place for a day of shopping, eating and viewing the scenery of the wharf. Wonderful stores - make sure to visit the Watershed for local art, design and crafts. And don't miss Avoova (in the mall) for stunning Ostrich egg creations.

Most popular attraction in Africa. a little retail therapy at well below European prices for skin care products. Eating reasonable too. Harbour tour free with 2 day Hop On Hop Off bus ticket worth it for the seals sunbathing in the car tyres around the harbour walls.

Cape town most favourite drop in. The place is a great place where everything you need is available in one place, great music,entertainment,malls a,food and clothes market,boat rides and chill spots.It is a plce to bring kids,freinds and family or couples.I like the entertainment there where local snd international artists come and showcase their talents,different food courts to eat,shops to shop and children entertainement also.It is always full and bring some camera and cornfortable shoes to take a ride to robben island and see some local museums and also take a ses walk in the aftrnoon
such a amazing place. very busy and beautiful place lot of food places all tour operator are available you will definitely enjoy

Chill out and shop venue.. Wonderful place to shop, everything from ice creams to any high fashion products you can think off. There is the hop on/off bus depot, quality information centre, banks where you can safely use ATM's, Aquarium, boat trips, and being a photographer, enjoyed the Buskers which seem to change on a regular basis. Eating here is an experience, with everything from 1st class restaurants to your fast food outlets. Just a nice way to chill out, shop, eat well, and the atmosphere is terrific. If anyone has worries about safety, don't, just take the same precautions you would at home, the security here is 100%, there was hardly a time anywhere on the waterfront when you could not see at least 2-3 very attentive Security Officers.
utter bliss. The vibe is ever UP, people across the board mix and mingle goodwill and cheerfulness prevail, What more?

Great place to eat,shop, chill, whatever. Lovely waterfront area with wide range of shops and restaurants. Nice walks with historical photos and inforamtion. Check out the food maket for casual cheap choices

Too touristy. Everyone goes to the V&A once. I am sure there are some lovely eateries but we preferred finding places off the beaten track. We did enjoy the food market and souvenir market near the aquarium though. Just in general the V&A was too commercial - a big shopping mall, perfect if you want some cheap flip flops.

Time spending shopping. At this venue a lot of locals and tourist alike.Lots of eateries and shops to buy anything from shoes and hats,clothes and toys.Very very busy and i suggest you visit early in the day than late in afternoon,especial during weekend,Lots of parking available but have to search for a parking bay or drive from parking area to another otherwise splendid to visit.

Unique harbour site. Cape Town's Waterfront is a unique place to enjoy the pleasures of this wonderful town and its joyful people. Although overcrowed during holiday time, we enjoyed our stay and the extraordinary views you get on the town, Table Mountain and the Waterfront area. Specially interesting the groups of south african musicians performing, a Katamaran excursion around the bay and the aquarium. A place among the 100 you must have seen and felt in your life.

Just another mall. Although the location is marvellous, in the old docks, this mall offers the same selection of retailers as all the others. A great choice of restaurants, though it may be hard to get a table.

One stop shop and entertainment venue!. This is an excellent venue for shopping with lots of entertainment elements to keep you satisfied. The shops are trendy and range from groceries to high class items, with plenty of shopping variety to choose from. The re are movie houses and lots of places to eat at from fast food to sophisticated seafood. the harbour cruises, aquarium open air theater and other fantastic items to see give you plenty to keep you amused and entertained.I would recommend a visit if you are in cape Town.
worth a vist. plenty to do plenty of cover if wet also cool when sun is to hot god boat trip around harbour plenty of food out lets all the shop u need

You have to visit if you're in Cape Town. Lots of shops, restaurants, great views of the water front - a wonderful place to people watch or spend your rand. It really does have it all, and offers a slice of the "good life" that South Africa has to offer.

World Class. The V & A Waterfront is, without doubt, world class. There is a huge variety of shops and restaurants and top class hotels housed in lovely modern and historical buildings. The setting is magnificent and the views of Table Mountain are beautiful. The Aquarium is a great attraction and boat trips can be taken into the working harbour and out to sea.

good shopping and eating venue.. We did some shopping and then had lunch at the Quay Four restaurant. Wife and I both had kingklip fish and chips which was outstanding followed by desert - cheese cake . We were more than satisfied. Food a bit expensive but good value for money.

Beautiful. Great fun for seeing Cape Town from the waterfront! So many amazing restaurants and little shops to buy things, plus a huge indoor mall! Loved the Ferris wheel for amazing views of the city!
Fell In Love With This Place. So much to do, so much to see, this is one place you cannot miss. Food Markets are amazing - Craft markets :) everything about the V&A is amazeballs
The V & A Waterfont. Lots to see and do. And do forget all the exciting food stalls. Take a ride on the Wheel and you can see forever on a clear day.

Potpourri . This is the spot where I go soon after landing at CT airport. It's vibrant, colourful with lots to see, taste, drink and do. Some of the best coffees in town. From here you can take excursion into the harbour and Robben Island. The live bands and shows send out energy that is intoxicating. Love it.

Good food but may have to wait. We found eating at the V&A waterfront the standard of food was good but the service is often slow and they are more expensive than restaurants out of the location. However everything is so cheap in south Africa so it is still good value.
Good for shopping. The V&A waterfront has lots of charm. It also offer many restaurants and bars and lots of shops for those with plenty of stamina
Nice Shopping Mall in Victorian Style. This renovated Shopping Mall in Victorian Style is a real nice place for dinner, entertainment or a day shopping before your flight.

a time to have fun. The V&A waterfront is always a fun place to visit. Lots of things happening and on offer for the tourist from very expensive to totally free. There are usually musicians around that perform free of charge, many restaurants to choose from and lots of entertainment for young and old alike
