Cape Town's buzz. An absolute must for any visitor. You'll experience Cape Town in all facets. Great shops for buying or browsing. Watch a movie, visit the aquarium, shop or just relax and listen to local music. Plenty of restaurants and pubs.

Nothing to write home about. I toured this area whilst waiting for my booked ferry service to Robben Island. It seemed to be a mere collection of overpriced shops and restaurants. I had the consolation of not having wasted time making a special journey to it. The nearest which it came to salvation was the Watershed which championed local craftsmen (although none produce goods in my specific areas of interest).

Great for Food and Shopping. A very modern waterfront, full of upscale restuarants and shops. There is also a ferris wheel that you can go on. Very beautiful setting. Great place to relax in the evening.

A Great Day Shopping. We had visited the V+A Waterfront a few times during our time in Cape Town. It is a great venue for any shopping and complimented by dozens of sit down restaurants and take aways all overlooking the beautiful harbour and Table Mountain. There is something for everyones taste from luxury fashion to athletic and furniture stores.Access is easy and with cheap secure parking its super convenient. We look forward to returning!

Fun at the Waterfront. Great place to shop and late trade always makes it a destination of choice. Restaurants galore for each pocket size and a variety of activities for every age group - always on my list when I am in Cape Town
Shopping. Nice view, dinner opportunities , shops and leisure. Safe place to walk even alone.Lot of international trademark to shop starting witj Louis Vuitton and ending with H&M.

Easy place to shop. Great place to shop for all! One can find all essentials, South African curios, and more. Good place to find souvenirs! The entire shopping area is clean, good restaurants and food as well. If you are planning a "shopping day" in your time in Cape Town, this is the place to go!

Lovely area. A little bit tourisy but lots to do here with aquarium, great food market, craft market, shopping and activities. Lovely views up to Table Mountain and of the dock area. Loads of restaurants to chose from and street side entertainment...lots happening and a must see in Cape Town.
Lively fun venue. We always make a trip down to the waterfront when in Cape Town lots of shops and always lots of entertainment and food options a must see.
Good. This is a great place to amble about, great shops, bars and restaurants, take your time and enjoy all that's here you will also be able to get great photos of table mountain.

Simply love the place . The beautiful setting simply makes one relaxed and happy. The various small restaurants lined on the waterfront are a treat for any visitor. Both the malls are also a great pass time . Plenty to do for children as well. One of my favorite places in cape town.

Not particularly interesting and too touristy. There isn't much on this waterfront that makes for an interesting trip. It's just a very touristy place with a lot of tourist traps. But there are certainly lots of shops, places, and the possibility to book tours.
Part of the Cape Town to do list. Its rather not difficult to do Jump in a taxi, get out wander round the harbour, have a drink, have a meal do some quality shopping
Big place. We went here a few times really big shopping center,good places to eat and nice bars to refresh your self after a busy day ,night life is good.

Cute Shops; Nobel Plaza. Its worth going because this is where you go to get the Robben island Ferry. And Mandela's statue with his Nobel mates is cool. Otherwise its a mini mall (but a better than average one)
Worth spending time here. Great place to walk around with entertainers and food and shopping. The entertainers were unusual --we saw a man levitating.

best Capetown attraction with table mountain. A complete package for all age groups and tastes...... Aquarium, shopping, history, nature, eating, cruise, fresh food market, activities, ample parking etc .... Spend almost 2 days there and could have spent more time. Prices are obviously upmarket being a tourist venue. New year party was a bit over hyped though

Must See Typical tourist waterfront. Very nice area in Cape Town that would be considered a must-see unless you are trying avoid the typical tourist experience. Plenty of shopping, restaurants and entertainment pieces.

Great venue for shopping, dining and tourist attractions.. Simply the best place in Cape Town for tourists to enjoy shopping and dining with a fantastic choice. There's even some great tourist attractions to enjoy. Best view of Table Mountain in the background. It's safe and plenty of car parking.

Nice relaxing place for food and shopping. This is a nice place to visit for shopping and dinner. There are plenty of shows and live music to add to atmoshere. The local art shopping is well worth a visit.
Vibrant and varied waterfront with plenty of places to eat and shop.. Vibrant and varied waterfront with plenty of places to eat and shop. Trips to Robben Island depart from here too

Lovely attraction in heart of Cape Town. Great place to spend the day with lots of choices in terms of shopping, restaurants, activities for all. It is a tourist venue so prices high be a bit higher, but if you are exchanging euro, USD or GBP you will be getting a steal.We visited the aquarium and went on the Ferris Wheel among other things.Highly recommended to visit
posh shops. lots of shopping ......must go to the watershed.......locally made items.We went last time came and it has gone a little more upmarket which i thought a shame.

sightseeing on tour. It was quiet exciting to see the Tower clock and seeing the bridge move completely out as to get other boats with tall sails to pass by, and there after when the boats passed, the bridge comes to gether again so pedistrians can cross the other side, beautiful place to see locals playing music , dancing etc on the side

1st Class all the way. First trip to SA, and may I immediately say not the last.Stayed in an apartment on the marina, Altmore Building, excellent accommodation.The waterfront itself is vibrant with plenty of restaurants' to suit all tastes, seafood's, meats, pasta etc etc all delightful. All at reasonable costs for travellers.Plenty do in and around, trips to Robben Island, Table Mountian and the wine district'scan all be organised easily.When I have more time will actually review some of the trips and restaurant in detail.To close for now, just go and enjoy I know we will be back soon.

Oversized Mall. Set aside a half day at least for this shopping mall. It's not only a mall, there are piers that lead off to boat trips. Loads of restaurants, craft shops, markets, high end retail stores, and not forgetting the hop on hop off buses and aquarium. There is so much to do here, and plenty of secured parking, just take note of which car park you choose and the level of you'll find yourself walking around for hours looking for your car.
great area to walk around. It is safe, endless restaurants, food court and everything else.There is a bit of a buzz there. We loved being there. Recommended to visit.

A fun place with or without shopping. During the Christmas period this was heaving with visitors but I feel they were attracted by the shops, bars, restaurants and other attractions, as much as the reputation. Cape Town has a lot to offer but in the evening, this seems to be the place to be, Take a trip on the big wheel for an extra dose of enjoyment, as we did.

Vibey, cosmopolitan and worth a visit for locals and travelers alike. The multitude of shops and the convenience of restaurants packed side by side gives you a lot of choice. And then you get to take in the spectacular view of the harbour and look up at Table Mountain in the background. With lots of parking or convenient public transport it is easy enough to get there and spend the day wandering around. You might be lucky enough to take in one of the performances staged in the central arena while you're there.
happening place. This place is very crowded on weekends as locals along with tourist come here to have food, drink, spend time and enjoy the nice view.
The Flagship of Cape Town. Stunning vibe, beautiful views. everyone i happy. The jazz musicians are playing. shops galore. seagulls above. such a awesome spot
Great Place. A hub of entertainment with great shopping and eateries at excellent value especially as the pound is so strong to the rand.

A World Awaits. A lovely shopping, dinning experience with loads of entertainment. Parking is never a problem and public transport to and from is also hassle free. Put your walking shoes on and make a day of it.

What a vibe!. At a loss where to start showing off the Mother City to tourist friends? Whether your friends are shopaholics, wine connoisseurs, food lovers, art & craft fanatics, adventurous in nature or just love soaking up the atmosphere whilst people-watching, the V&A Waterfront has something for everyone! Mind you, we just love coming here as a family during school holidays & weekends to chill, go to the aquarium, an exhibition, whatever! From stunning mountain & ocean views to fabulous restaurants, boat trips & enough shops to literally make you drop, you won't be at a loss for something to do, unless you're one of those people who struggles to decide what to do first :)

great place to visist for a few hours. Busy place with lots of interesting restaurants although more expensive as would be expected for such an attractive waterfront. Shops not too expensive but spend more time doing other things if y ou only have a few days in this wonderful city.
Family entertainment at the amphitheatre . An acrobatics show entertained and amused the young ones with lots of shopping available for the rest of the family.
Beautiful views. Walking along the boardwalk was pleasant and the views from all sides were beautiful for viewing and photography.

A world class location. The v&a waterfront is amazing. There are so many things to do see,buy and taste. It's a very classy and trendy place. It's a woman's shopping paradise. And you can go on a harbour cruise which we did. And for me the most prolific where the 4 Nobel price winners statues that l loved having pictures with.
Grand Central. The engine room of Cape Town. Everything happens here....great shopping, good restaurants, live entertainment etc
Waterfront. So many things to do, so many shops to visit. One must take a boat cruise around the harbour to view it from a different perspective.

Great Atmosphere. Street Entertainment, shopping wonderful bars and restaurants in a stunning setting. This area is very touristy but quite magical on a sunny day. Definitely worth an afternoon even if only to listen to the music and watch the crowds. A must for both people watchers and shopping addicts.

NYE 2015. Hi PeopleMe again,and what an NYE experience that the V&A Waterfront Cape Town have us.From breathtaking views especially for the selfie mad,picture craze junkies you can not get enough ,to the various local artist performing live at various stages of the Waterfront. This was my first New Year's Eve at the Waterfront and it didn't disappoint ,the artist,food stalls,and especially the fireworks at the count down was all on par.The was some congestion going to certain areas of the waterfront and my suggestion to people planning to there on a NYE is to pre book a restaurant of your choice as all the restaurants was fully book with some sort of live entertainment and various themed parties happening,this is just to prevent any running around if you are keen on not scouting the place.There is so many fast food places available ,the wait was somewhat long but that's a NYE at the waterfront for you.Everything else went down amazing,the weather as always was perfect and it was an amazing way to stry off 2016.For your next trip to Cape Town try an NYE party at the Waterfront.

Awesome, chill & have fun!. I love the Waterfront, a little city, in a city. Here you can do all kinds of shopping, enjoy a movie at a theatre, a choice of restaurants to enjoy a good meal or find a pub to enjoy your favorite drink. There's lots to do here, too much to mention

not good just avarage. the only thing makes it unique is the harbour (not included iyyk smell , weird animals around , ship workers etc,,) , perfect view to the table mountain , shops are shops meaning you get them everywhere you go ! restaurants are OK and again expensive , too busy and not well orginised !! everything is everywhere , they dont know what else they are going to put where !!! just come and have a coffee when it is quite in the morning infront of the TABLE ! peace ,,,

Great atmosphere. We parked in a parking station on one side ,very inexpensive,and walked around,had lunch and did some shopping.Loved the out of africa shop for african things and bought some clothes in woolworths

beautiful place. the water front is lovely place to hang around especially in the evenings.there is always some activity taking place like singing, bands playing musics. small group dancing to famous numbers make to realise the culture of the place.many restuarants line the waterfront giving one a multicuisine option for dining. a ferris wheel is located at the waterfront.ferries going towards the robbin island can be taken from here too.The mall at the waterfront has almost all the brand stores within.could spend days at this place.

Amazingly Enjoyable. The Victoria and Alfred Waterfront is surprisingly pleasant and beautiful. The Food Market is filled with very fresh and "foodie" approved individual food stands that will delight all members of your party, from veggie smoothies to burgers to kudu jerky to gelato - all of top quality. The craft market is also worth your time, to find high quality artisans showing their work - there are clothes, fabrics, jewelry and ceramics - some "traditional" and some "modern". Very interesting. Some have characterized it as too touristy, but we found it a worthy stop for an hour or two. Not tacky at all, and as mentioned, a great place to pick up some fresh food, or a craft or piece of art. Build this in before or after a boat ride or trip to Robben Island.

Interesting Place to Visit/Hang Out. We first visited V&A to join our Robben Island tour. However, due to bad weather, that tour was cancelled, so we decided just to walk around V&A for a bit. Aside from having a rather generic mall, it does possess some really interesting shops - jewelry, African souvenirs especially cool art - and it has some good restaurants as well. On a nice day, it's nice to walk around outside, but when the weather is bleak, there are plenty of shops that can keep you occupied!
Balducci restaurant. Fair place - quick and friendly service. Food was appreciated by all 6 of us who had pizza, salads and steaks. Very loud with bad acoustics.

Vibrant area for dining and loads of shops set against the backdrop of Table Mountain . Always an enjoyable area to be in Cape Town. Loads of things to do from high end to craft shopping and lots of dining choices. Also the jumping off point for Robben island and the city sightseeing bus tours. Look out for the seals!

Super atmosphere. Apart from a typical huge mall which you do not have to visit, the V&A Waterfront is a happy bustling place with lots going on. Outdoor performers, music, you name it. Massive car parks at the mall so no problem there. Ferris wheel, not that big, but gives a view and almost no queuing. Food outlets are not all fast junk. Try Vovo Telo café near the Ferris wheel. Stroll in the sunshine. Enjoy!

Must do in Capetown . When in CP you must visit this area, many things going on and huge choice in restaurants & pubs. Boat & helicopter tours are easily made from here and the shopping mall is bigger than you would expect.
Brilliant. Cheap shopping due to the Sterling conversion rate at the moment. Clean, tidy and superb eating. The only negative is the information boards dont put the location of the shops on it!

What More Could You Want?!. Shopping, restaurants, an Aquarium, museums, Hop Off Hop On Bus Tour, hotels, and views - the V&A Waterfront has it all!! We stayed at The One&Only hotel at the Waterfront. It was easy to walk to restaurants, the aquarium, catch the tour bus, and shop. And, several locals told us how safe it was!! We especially enjoyed the food market. We ate there at least twice. And, the craft market at the Water Shed was another favorite.
Cool but tourist trap. Really neat waterfront but totally geared towards the tourist. The food market is good and sample some STOKKIESDRAAI BILTONG as we found it to be very good.

Cute area, good People watching.. Pricier shopping, but all kinds of shopping, and good restaurants, cute area to walk around. We ate at some pub on a patio, can't recall the name of it, but we both ordered what we thought was a glass of sangria and a cocktail, and the brought out an entire pitcher and a fishbowl cocktail! haha. It was hilarious, and also ok because it wasn't expensive at all.
too busy. this was too busy for me, but its great looking at all the boats and looking round the shops. plenty of eating places to visit

Busy and diverse. Great vibe, can get very busy and parking is a bit of a mission. Great location with brilliant views of Table Mountain and the harbour. Enjoyable watching the boats come and go. Good restaurants, bars and coffee shops and a wide variety to choose from.
Great shopping and food options. Despite the crowding over the pick holiday season, the V&A is a great place to be. Lots of souvenir shops around and restaurants.

Great attraction. Fun place to wander around, shop, and eat. We stayed at a hotel nearby and found plenty of great restaurants for dinner on several evenings. The shops offer anything one could want, and the ferris wheel was fun. The most interesting shops were the craftsmen and boutique shops at the Watershed.

Wowsome!. You can spend entire day over here. Beautiful restaurants on the harbour and boutique shops sorrow do the area. The location is buzzing with so many activities, would highly recommend an evening dedicated to this place

Great tourist destination. Cameras are a must.The waterfront is also a working dock with the beautiful tabletop mountain in the background.The shopping centre is very high end with all the designer shops you could ever want if your wallet allows. There is a good selection of food with a food hall and lots of restaurants with sea views, just check the prices as some can be expensive.Perfec place to buy your souvenir.

Spend all day. From market stalls to designer shops, a ferris wheel to sea life centre. With a marina and places to eat and drink from mcD to high class restaurants. This is a great day out for all the family which is open 'til 10 at night. Don't foget to bring your camera too as there is a wonderful view of Table Mountain with a huge metal frame for you to stand in and a cross on the floor showing where to stand to get the best picture.

Not your typical Shopping Mall. Think about all the best restaurants in the city in one place, with amazing view and service. There are top attractions and points of interest within, like the gateway to Robben Island and the Two Oceans Aquarium, among many other things. We went all over the city, and ended up at night here for a superb dinner in different restaurants. Consider that the food is well priced, and accessible. Other items, like cloths and memorabilia, may not have the better price available. We will definitely return, and with more friends!

Something for everyone. The Waterfront was one of the recommendations I'd been given by a friend in Johannesburg to visit while in Cape Town. It's amazing. There is something for everyone here. Shopping, friendly vendors, city bus sightseeing tour, restaurants, harbour cruises, helicopter excursions. You name it, the Waterfront has it. Went several times over the stay.
Fun place to walk and eat. We had multiple meals there during our stay. Great food even though it appeared to be touristy. Fun place to walk around too.

Exciting and full of entertaining options . From great restaurants to luxury shopping and entertainment, the V&A Waterfront is an absolute must visit.The space is light and airy with double volume ceilings in most areas and broad walkways. The space is necessary as during peak season, the mall can be very crowded.Try and avoid long queues by booking space or tickets for attractions or restaurants.Whatever you need, find it here- great International brands, top class restaurants and plenty of outdoor space to enjoy Cape Town at its best.

A must-visit. The waterfront is as iconic as Cape Town itself. You must visit to - as we did - walk around the waterside, eat at one of the restaurants (not as expensive as some say), visit the excellent market, have a drink at one of the bars, go on a harbour cruise (we went on the City Sightseeing one), and view the seals on the platforms in front of where the City Sightseeing harbour cruise departs. New Years Eve was great too as you could get a beer and a seat and watch the fireworks...unlike other capital cities (Sydney for example)...

Vibrant and interesting. Great mix of shopping, entertainment and eating. Always a good vibe and a wide range of activities. We enjoyed walking through the area in the early evening soaking up the atmosphere.
Wonderful. We went there several times over the four day visit. We had good food, the shopping is interesting and it's great to just people watch.

Great package of entertainment for home from home for tourists. Lovely regeneration of the waterfront with shops and eateries, but a little identikit to many such places from other holiday destinations around the world.

Exciting attraction. This large, waterfront attraction is on reclaimed land and includes an incredible variety of attractions; shops, museums, marinas, hotels, shopping mall, stores, beauty salons, amusement rides, restaurants -- even a post office. One of its best features is that it includes many historical venues that existed here before its development. A great place to spend the day
A great spot to visit. Pretty to see the shops, the scenery, some harbor seals, plus the aquarium, good food and more. Been on two different visits to SA, it's nice. Parking is not fun, but worth it.

Very very busy. Yes it's a tourist hot spot but at new year time it's really really crowded- don't think about eating here unless you've pre booked way in advance. Boot trips from V&A are really good value

Better than San Francisco. Well organized, new and still growing. Great selection of attractions. Well maintained. No issues of safety. Friendly vendors, no pan handlers, good for families and mobility impaired persons.

Busy, tourist driven but a great place to visit.. I have never been here in the winter so my comments are refined to the summer time when I visit Cape Town from Europe. Busy, tourist driven and very lively. Loads of activities to fill your day (including that shopping thrill deep inside of you...LOL). A focal point tourist venue, this place is in a league of its own. Eat, drink and be merry....after your shopping spree.
It's a Must!. It's a fabulous place to visit in Cape Town. Everything you need or would want from designer shops, bars, restaurants to seals swimming in the harbours.

There's only one V&A - that's Alfred!. A masterpiece of resurrection the V&A is designed around the historic dockyard in stylish Cape Town.Ever changing and brilliantly arranged, the V&A is mix of hotels, bars, shops, restaurants, music, outdoor entertainment and an oceanarium.Trips to suit ever taste leave from Quay Four and the high speed ferry to Robben Island departs from near the Clock Tower (book in advance as the weather plays hell with the schedules!)The V&A is a foodies paradise with indoor and outdoor places offering just about every type of national cuisine.The old dockyard sheds contain enough variety for the ardent shopper from the department stores to big brand names.There are also cinemas, a big wheel, central concert area and enough parking for thousands of cars - just remember where you left yours!At Christmas the decorations, swing bridge and seals are an added attraction.

Excellent restaurants. This is a busy, tourist area but ,even on New Years Eve, it seemed to absorb everyone without a crush. There is an excellent selection of restaurants but do make sure you book in advance at busy periods.

Loved it!!. Vibrant and inspiring - the shopping, the food and the proximity to everything. We loved it! And what a view when you turn back to look at Table Mountain!!A must see/do for your time in Cape Town
A nice place to be for a stroll. Must do once at least. Very nice setting. Loads of attractions and food places. Can be very busy. Pick any parking but make sure you remember the entrance.

Shopping Galore!. Whether you want luxury brands or African handcrafts, everything can be found in the Waterfront. If you want to enjoy sushi with a spectacular view, go to Servuga or have afternoon cocktails at Alba Lounge. Remember that if you are going to Robben Island, the ferry departs from here as well. Give yourself atleast 30mins to find the Clock Tower where the Robben Island Gateway is.

The place to visit.. Quite outstanding location in central Cape Town.Several great restaurants (especially Den Anker and Quay 4), as well as a number of attractions nearby (such as Aquarium, SA Rugby museums, Titanic exhibition). There are many bars as well. THE place to visit in Cape Town

Beautiful Setting. Great harbour area with lots restaurants and shops. If you fancy a snack the food market serves all sorts of cuisine from little kiosks. Grab a boat to Robben Island or catch the hop on off buses it's all there.

Tourist entaintment capital & shoppers paradise. This is the one stop shop to experience the local food, drink, entertainment , diverse people , culture, all shopping categories, fun , arts , craft , banking, accommodation & much more with a splendid back drop view of Table Mountain, Signal Hill ,Lions Head & CBD on the one end and the Atlantic ocean on the other . Visitors are really sploit for choice when it comes to this venue.It really accommodates every need of the visitor. Very safe and secure venue , but personal safety rules to be applied. Muslim prayer room is also available. And being Cape Town, halaal is not an issue at most outlets. Just ask the locals and outlets are certified by resident religious autolhorities ( e.g MJC, SANHA & ICSA)This highlights the freedom of religious practice that exists in SA under its democratic constitution. Perfect for a day visit and open all year round. Always buzzing with locals and tourist daily. A true rainbow nation culture . Shopping business hours apply,but fast food outlets and restaurants stays open till late. Water/sea only accessible by boat cruise in harbour. You may even spot seals lazing around in the harbour by taking a walk around. Be sure to visit the 2 Oceans Aquarium. Perfect visit for kids all ages & family with endless actives in store. Entry fees apply. And personal must is to take a ferry across to Robin Island. Excellent tour installed with a great history lesson awaiting. The V& A is accessible by all modes of transport for all people. Definately disability friendly . Each visit promises to be different.

Plenty of shopping and eating, little else. We spent 7 hours on a warm sunny day walking around the waterfront. We did the Ferris wheel which was a nice way to get some unique views. We tried a lot of food, shopped in the mall and in the shops along the water, the museum and outdoor cafes. There is a small playground for kids, and other kid-friendly activities. Overall, lots of tourists, shopping and eating.

Where it's happening. We really enjoyed the area because almost everything is there. All kinds of shopping from a mall with all the usual suspects, to arcade buildings with all kinds of art and handicrafts. Excellent hotels and restaurants. With all this in one place, once the shopping is done, there is a vibrant night life.
Buzzing with good food and drink. We stayed at the waterfront for 2 nights on a recent visit. I loved all the african arts and crafts and the food market was great.

As far as tourist zones worldwide, the V&A is well worth a visit. Whilst nobody can deny this is a touristy place, in comparison with other tourist zones around the world it has been done in a lovely way. In general the restaurants here are very hit and miss, it's well worth venturing away from the V&A to eat, but the shopping and markets are amazing. The scenery is beautiful and it's lit up beautifully at night. It feels very safe at any time of day due to the high security presence which you don't get in most other parts of the city, let alone the rest of SA. There are very expensive hotels here, but there are also apartments and smaller hotels in-between so it's a varied area, with street performances, mixed shopping and souvenirs and beautiful views of table mountain. Even if you aren't staying here or like to get "off the beaten path" I think its well worth the jaunt to the waterfront to check it out one morning or afternoon.
Spectacular place. It was a great experience enjoyed the walking lovely restaurants and lots of shops, cruises, pubs with great cocktails in jars...had an amazing time. Must see place indeed.

Tourist mecca. As per my title, it is a bit of a tourist trap, but that is not necessarily a bad thing. There are lots of shops to wander around and the comings and goings of the various tour boats and other private boats to watch. Also is the departure point to Robin Island and helicopter tours over the city. Plenty of restaurants and bars to choose from. The shopping mall itself is modern, but ultimately just that.
Great place to spend time. There's plenty to do here. A great place to spend time eating and shopping. There are a wide variety of restaurants to chose from.

Not to be missed. On any visit to Cape Town this is one of those "not to be missed" areas. There is enough to do here for the most fussy of visitors: restaurants, shopping, history, boat trips, photo opportunities - all are catered for. I love the area and keep returning to it on our visits to Cape Town.

Best Shopping Centre/Tourist Venue in the world. This place is amazing.. it attracts locals and tourists.. it's got a huge selection of shops.. and at the same time's a great tourist destination.. for locals and visitors alike
Crowded. I found the Waterfront extremely overcrowded. It's nice and beautiful, but super expensive. Wouldn't go again. Overall not a place I would recommend

A centre but not a mall. V & A waterfront is for most part a mall with many great shops. The selection of stores and the variety within each category makes you spoiled for choice. I love that there are some excellent high end designer stores, as well as more local stores. The restaurants are all fabulous. Then there is the harbour which offers a variety of activities for young and old. There is seal watching boat tours, sunset cruises, helicopter rides and more.

A nice, clean, safe place to walk around. We stayed at Camp Bay so only walked around this area for some short amount of time. Found the place is comfortable, no peddler. It feels clean, comfortable, and safe here more than many other touristic places in Europe.

Always enjoyable. We normally drop by the waterfront when in Cape Town. Excellent shops and restaurants. Love walking through watershed craft stores. This year the Christmas decorations were excellent.
A must see in CT. V & A has so much to offer..shopping..leisure..entertainment. ..dining...activities...cruises...cape wheel...markets...holistic health...aquarium. ..bus tours...and so.much more...

Vibrant place with great eating options...and an amazing view of the table cloth on table mountain on some days!. Its a hugee place with tons of restaurants n people milling around! We went fr new years...so ofcourse the place was amazing fr celebrating new years eve with multiple entertainment areas and performers...great vibes..ending with the fireworks..while the fireworks were great but not spectacular...Im sure Sydney is better :PThere are great exhibitions n museums around and a great shopping mall.What i loved was the Food Market @ V&A...its got fantastic yumilicious food...it ws the best...yum desserts, kebab rolls, brazil nuts...could go there multiple times n still not sample all they have to offer!N on days when the table mountain was covered in white (the table cloth effect!), it was a great vantage point to see that!All in all - good place to chilll!

What apple for a wander ...... We had a thoroughly enjoyable two days wandering the waterfront, eating, listening to the live music, perusing the wonderful shops and craft markets. A definite Mst-do when in Cape Town

Nice place but busy during peak times. We stayed close to the Waterfront so we were in the area for 3 days. It's a lovely spot with restaurants, shops and some street entertainment. As we were there in January it was extremely busy as it was peak season. If you're not keen on crowds then stay away otherwise the atmosphere is wonderful. Most importantly make sure you book lunch and dinner as there is a long wait with all the restaurants without a booking

V& A waterfront really chilled place to visit with lots to do. we stayed at the V&A right on the waterfront and this was perfect base we had the luxury of the christmas entertainment but even so the waterfront has a great vibe and some fantastic restaurants and attractions to visit

Shopping Galore!. The amount of shops at the Waterfront is unbelievable! It was nice to be able to browse and be so close to the ocean. Tons of delicious restaurants there as well, Could easily spend 3-6 hours there. We went back twice. :)
Shoppers heaven. If you looking for the perfect mix of shopping and nature then the V&A Waterfront is the place to be. Nightlife or day visitors will have plenty to keep themselves entertained.

December 2015. Typical tourist trap and absolutely a must visit.great views. Lots of free entertainment. Train rides for the kids, Ferris wheel, great food. Convenient parking and appeared relatively safe and secure.
Day and Night. This place is the centre of the waterfront social scene day and night. It has great restaurant and bars and is always buzzing with activity.

A shopper's delight. Very large enclosed mall on the waterfront. Many different types of shops mostly moderat to up scale. Some good bargins if you know your prices. The perfumery had some nice women's purses

The best shopping centre ever!. It's enormous! It's full of wonderful shops, very diverse product ranges and I have never experienced so many kind and helpful staff. They have a huge Woolworths over two levels, nothing like the old Woolies we had in the UK. The food hall is M&S, they have David Jobes clothing, a fantastic beauty area full of the leading brands and very affordable freshwater pearls -the equivalent of ten pounds for a beautiful three strand necklace!It also has about thirty five restaurants selling well cooked and presented food.A glass of red wine and a Belgian beer works out at approx £1.70p. A really good meal will set you back about £10.00 for three courses. Check out the prices in H&M, Zara and Ralph Lauren - less than half the price we pay in the UK!

Great Hangouts!!. The Victoria and Alfred Waterfront has superb restaurants, shopping and activities for young and old. During the Christmas holidays there were free concerts and non-stop action for everyone. My family particularly liked the Grand Beach and Tasha's restaurants.

Great vib lots going on. The waterfront is a great place to go. It has everything there are shops restaurants bars .there is often live music playing. It is always full of life with a real buzz . It is very touristy and some of the restaurants are less value for money than if you went into Cape Town.
Live this place. Such a vibrant fun place to visit. Great good market which you must explore. Lots of places to eat and drink and shop away

So much to do!. We spent almost a whole day at the V&A Waterfront. There is so much to do for families with kids. From the boat rides, big wheel, Hamleys train, shopping, eating. We walked around for hours through the different areas and enjoyed the atmosphere of live music. Really a MUST DO!
great place. Great place, lots of activities, food and shopping to be done. enjoy fresh catch of the day, with live shows and great wines and cigars.

Shopping, food, information, activites - it's all here!. Arguably the hub of Cape Town, especially for visitors to the city. Find a wide variety of shops here, both expensive and affordable, offering anything you could wish for. Cinemas, restaurants, coffee shops, fast food spots are all here.Try a few of the more special experiences like a boat cruise, a trip to Robben Island, the big wheel, the Aquarium, the Red Bus Tours - all these activities happen from the Waterfront.
Great place to chill. shopping, eating, drinking, waterfront viewing, activities - this place has it all.. great place to chill

Where the action is in Cape Town. The waterfront area has everything you could want. There is shopping, restaurants, entertainment, people watching, boats, yachts etc. It seems to be the center of all that is happening. It is easy and very cheap to get around by taxi.

Great attraction with a Cape Town vibe. You can spend a day wandering around the shops, craft markets, first class hotels and eating places from take away to 5 star restaurants and the aquarium - also take a boat cruise around the harbour or into Table Bay for a sunset cruise with Table Mountain in the background - suits all ages

Total experience. The Victoria and Alfred Waterfront is the complete day out destination offering exhibitions, shopping, eating, browsing, entertainment etc.From visiting the Two Oceans aquarium, Titanic travelling exhibition, Red Shed craft area, various international and local shops, there is something to do for everyone. This combined with eateries of every kind, makes it a one stop destination for a day and/or night out.

Where* almost* everything is at. The restaurants, the activities, the shopping.... Everything is readily available for the entire family to enjoy.We are a young family of 4 and for the four different tastes and ages, there was an activity, a restaurant, anything. It was even awesome to be able to leave the hubby and sons at one place while they enjoyed their touring and paintings and toys, while I went shopping.
Too busy. Overcrowded, impossible traffic, restaurants overbooked, but at this time of year it is to be expected. Much better out of season.

Expensive, but a feast for the eyes. Yes, it's touristy, but I love the V&A! We spent so much time here on this trip, and really loved it. We went to the aquarium, Robben Island tour, and the Titanic Artifact exhibit. There are so many shops with expensive goods, but it's still fun to look around. The crafters market is great, and nowdays, is a better place to buy your SA souvenirs than Greenmarket Square. We were thrilled with the food market, as there were so many beautiful, healthy options to try. They even had a Raw food station!! Grab a drink or a bite to eat and just walk around taking it all in. You will see people from all over the world, and hear all kinds of languages. I love it!

A Real Buzz. We went there on New Year's Eve when it was heaving with revellers and street entertainers of all sorts - a really exciting and fun place to be but it is fun at any time as we visited there for 3 days! Wonderful restaurants where you can sit inside or out and although it is very busy, they always seem able to find a table with a happy, smiling waitereven though they are run off their feet. Lots of boat trips to choose from, from the pirate ship to a traditional sailing yacht, best to book in advance but we managed to get on a Sunset Cruise shortly before it sailed - and we saw 2 whales playing in the sunset. Sit back and watch the world go by or join in and enjoy living!
Busy spot, lots to see. Perfect place on a hot sunny day. Relax with wine and simply people watch. Your £ is bound to go along way in SA at the moment.
Lovely. Lovely place to wander around and spend all your money. Amazing, world class hotels. The best seafood you can imagine. And of course, some of the best shopping in Africa!

This is the happening place in Cape Town!. Really, this is just one big shopping mall. The difference is the location and the mixture of harbor facilities an aquarium, hotels and lots of first class eating establishments.

Great place to eat, drink & shop. Fantastic starting point in Cape Town, great for shopping, eating and drinking as Well especially the craft beer. Fantastic entertainment around the V&A and the vibrant atmosphere is fantastic.

Great place with something for everything to do!. Great views of table mountain, cabs available at every point and a variety of eateries on offer. The parking seemed to be slightly problematic but if you catch a cab then you should be fine.
So much to see and do. You could spend a whole day here and still not see or do everything!! Great variety and loads of options! Be prepared to spend!

Lots to look at!. We had heard the V & A Waterfront is a tourist trap, but honestly it is a pretty cool site with lots to do - lots of dining options and shopping if that's what you're looking for. We lunched, walked around, looked at the curio shops, and got some ice cream. It was pretty crowded and hot when we were there, so it wasn't a long trip, but good afternoon activity for families and couples

Great Trip. Spectacular! Just love this area of Cape Town. Will definitely return at some point! It has everything. Superb climate. Superb Restaurants and Bars. Stunning views of Table Mountain. Will definitely be back here!

Excellent place. The waterfront is a melting pot of cultures. We had been there on New Years Eve. There was a musical concert, live dance performances, and a cultural parade. It was completely packed.There is ample parking available out there; to name a few parking lots, there were portswood, ulundi, breakwater... Parking charges differ in each of these parking lots, depending on its proximity to the waterfront. Make sure you visit this place when you have at least 3 hours.

Day out vs New years' eve . The V&A is generally a cool place to shop, especially because the stores are bigger and offer a much wider variety on their items. Despite this, the mall tends to get very crowded (and personally I don't like crowded areas). The mall also has some nice eateries and boasts various types of cuisine to suit desires of most.If you are looking for seclusion in the festive season, try bigger malls like Canal Walk which MAY have fewer people (probably because everyone is at V&A, i dont know) - when i went to Canal, there were no crowds although it was before lunch time.The worst of V&A was the 31st December - i went there to see the display of fireworks as we ushered in 2016 but geeez the place was sooo packed there was hardly space to move around. If you want space to just sit and watch the fireworks, I suggest making a reservation at one of the restaurants on the waterfront, their prices ranges between R1 400 - R1 750 per person for between five to eight course meals. Other than that, other fat food places closed at 10pm and many were turned away. The display of fireworks was absolutely amazing and the vibe just awesome as everyone counted down together into 2016. On other days, musicians can be seen performing local hits and sharing local tunes with all who are present. There are lots of souvenit shops which sell mostly African or uniquely South African items. There's the Cape Wheel which you can go on to see views of the Cape from above and there is also a kiddies area at the waterfront.The hop on hop off bus departs from here first daily and several other tour operators have boat rides from here throughout the day. The ferry to Robben Island also leaves from here.

Interesting but expensive. Nice day trip to the waterfront where you can shop, sail on a boat, visit the aquarium, eat at a nice restaurant, listen to musicians performing or take a ride on the big wheel.

Great area for tourists. Good shops, bars, and restaurants in this area. The indoor Watershed market and Food hall are really good for shopping then a bite to eat / refreshments. Sometimes there are outdoor performances by various artists that draw big crowds. There are loads of different restaurants and shops in and close to this area.

Hard to Beat. Yes it has it all, but don't forget this is not Cape Town, i know it's hard to leave all of these fantastic shops and so many places to eat, explore town too, parks museums night life, At the V & A we felt relaxed and safe with so much going on endless dances and African singers talent on every corner.

The water front a must when in cape town. My first experience at the V and A water front was amazing . I really enjoyed all the shopping outlets that were offered. My highlight was going on the cape wheel. The view from the cape wheel was magnificent and merely breathtakinh.

Check out the seals after your shopping and you can also visit Robben Island from the docks. This is such a great shopping experience but also a great way to get a sense of Cape Towns people and history. You can walk around the docks and view seals swimming in the harbour and also get a boat out to visit Robben Island where Nelson Mandela was imprisoned for some culture too. Some fantastic restaurants too!

Average. We weren't too impressed by the V&A Waterfront. It is extremely difficult to get to other than by car (which we would therefore recommend). It is also not what you would call "pittoresque" as it is quite an artificial construction in the docks. Not like the other waterfronts you will find in the smaller Garden Route cities. Maybe worth a visit if you are in Cape Town for quite a while and are looking for a place to have a drink. Wouldn't recommend going there for dinner though.
Lovely evening of entertainment . Had a lovely time here walking around then shops and listening to the bands playing great night out, such a holiday buzz with great excitement
great way to spend your day. Plenty of shopping and places to eat. the aquarium is really nice. we enjoyed that. The food market was amazing and the watershed has some really nice things to buy

Love this trendy location. What a wonderful place to visit. The waterfront is so trendy and truly has something for everyone from McDonalds/Steers for a burger to City Grill/Karibu for a zebra or ostrich steak. There are cocktail bars and pubs such as Ferrimans, sushi and noodle bars and hundreds of shops. The great thing about all of Cape Town is the price of beers - on the Waterfront you can expect to pay the equivalent of just over £1 for a beer and around £3-3.50 for a cocktail (including champagne cocktails). Food is also extremely reasonable. The shopping at the Waterfront is highstreet/designer and is about the same price as shopping in the UK, I have yet to discover any real bargains on the clothes front in Cape Town. I would avoid Quay Four at all costs. It appears to be good, due to often having queues outside, but I can only imagine these people queuing don't know its reputation. The view from the restaurant is fantastic, but that is where it ends, the food is awful. Every other restaurant we have tried on the Waterfront has been fantastic, you are spoilt for choice. No need to waste time or money at a less than average restaurant. All in all, the Waterfront has something for everyone. There is also a man there selling safaris to Aquila big 5 safari - I would recommend doing the overnight one if you have time on your trip - we did and it was wonderful! only £90 each for self drive to Aquila which is a lovely and easy <2hr drive from Cape Town!

Tourist Paradise. If you only have limited time in Cape Town, this is a must visit! You have the mall with the trendy boutiques, the craft market for all your souvenirs and African street entertainers around the Waterfront. If you don't like crowded places or walking a lot, this is not the place to go, there are many other attractions.I would suggest to go early in the morning, try to be there by at least 9am, parking will still be easily available and the restaurants and shops not too crowded.

Happening part of town. The waterfront is a great place to base your stay if you are visiting. The area is lively both during the day and also at night. There are street performers in the day which light up the mood and add a pleasant sound to the area. Restaurants are scattered around so dining options are also excellent!

Great Place to walk around, food is excellent. Check out the art section (covered area with maybe 100 artists) for funky art/gifts to take home.Food was great at the restaurant we stopped at.There is a free circus show (acrobats).When you leave be sure to get a legal taxi at the stand. The illegal ones might be cheaper but don't always have working seat belts, AC, etc.
Lively and full of history. A great place and a must see if you in cape town enjoy the architecture and livelyness of the place plenty to do and lots of food places to choose from
Gorgeous spot!. Nice spot for a meal and its got great views!Fantastic vibe too. There are also lots of shops nearby.

Watershed is the best SA shopping experience at the V&A. When visiting the Waterfront in Cape Town, do not miss a very interesting shopping experience at The Watershed (near the Aquarium) For us this started with a visit to COOKED, which is a coffee shop selling not only tasty coffee, but also scrumptious savouries and cakes baked on the premises. Then we started on a round of small, interesting boutique shops selling a range of SA- made products: clothes, pictures, curios and ornaments. We found that it took two hours to cover the lot, and we could not resist spending money: but supporting local entrepreneurs seemed a worthwhile thing to do.
Excellent. Good variety of shops, craft markets and restaurants. Buzzing centre of Cape Town. Easy to park and walk around
A great mall but very busy. The epitemy of the global village syndrome- H & M, Hamleys, Top Shop, LVMH all there. A nice mall but it's like all good malls everywhere.
Wrong time of year. We may have had a better experience if we had visited another time of year. It was crowded, noisy, confusing, and none of the shops seemed to be interesting.

Insanely busy and not that cool. This is the least interesting place in Cape Town and apart from some nice views, it's like being in a shopping mall in the US or anywhere else with chain stores etc. I feel sorry for all the tourists who spend time here and think they've seen Cape Town properly. I come when I need to but try to spend as little time there as possible
Shopping Paradise!. Huge selection of shops of everything imaginable. Both indoor and outdoor shops and large variety of restaurants. A place not to miss.
Shopping heaven. If you are looking for a specific shop, you will find it here no matter from which part of the world you are from.

A day wandering..... The V&A as it is known is a magnet for visitors from all over the world and is always busy, especially at this time of year. It offers any restaurants and shops and is the place where trips to Robben Island and other excursions begin. A lively and buzzing place with always something to see and do.

Great shopping experience . Visiting during peak season we expected the hustle and bustle of people from all over the world, but we didn't expect such a crowd.The stores were well prepared and the centre was well set up with visible security all over the place.Well done to the centre and store owners/managers.

Clean, bright, large variety. If you're looking for a big mall, this is it. Good access and parking, massive range of shops; interesting activities to do like visiting the harbour or the aquarium. Certainly a shopping Mecca if that's what you're after.

A must do visit!. The Waterfront is part of the old Cape Town harbour which has been renovated and is now a major shopping and restaurant area.
It has spectacular views of Table mountain and is the point to board the Robben Island ferry (a must do visit). A great place to chill, have a cold beer and lunch with the family.
always a nice pace. this place we will always recommend once you will arrive in Capetown, close to the city and nice atmosphere

Great but EXPENSIVE. If you thought this place was a place to visit, you are right
Stunning position and great to be here for the new year's festivities
Lots of great restaurants but one you
Can skip is quay 4 upstairs
The rest is very very expensive(as a south african)

Excellent. Perfect location, beautiful view of the ocean and mountains. Very nice restuarants and shops. I love the the little shops with all the handmade stuff made by local artists. A must visit if you travel to Cape Town.
Bustling with activity. We had a great time at the V&A waterfront. The number of things to do and experience seems infinite. So many food options. Take a sea charter tour. Visit Robin Island or shop.

1st time at V & A was a bliss. The ambience of the place is magical, the infrastructure tops & beautiful and everything else terrific. We hopped onto the harbour cruise and got to learn about all the forms of the surrounding. It was very packed but we enjoyed being there. I will surely visit it everytime I come to the mother city. It's a placed to be if you need a top class experience...
Great eating and shopping. Great shopping centre and loads of restaurants ,a must do visit .Lots of great familiar name shops from every nationality .

This was our second visit to V&A Waterfront. Changes have taken place, but not for the better. There was also construc. This was our second visit to V&A Waterfront. Very impressed the first time, but not so much this time. There was some construction going on which may have slanted our views. Seems there were more "junk stores" where the restaurants used to be. However, if you are only in Cape Town for a short time, it is well worth a visit.

Holiday visit to a Cape Town institution . We were meeting people at the V&A Waterfront, and we explored it after our meeting. If possible, try avoiding it during peak tourist season (December), as it gets very busy. There are loads of shops and restaurants, as well as tourist attractions like helicopter flips and charter boat trips.

Shopping and walking. Great place to go if you'd like to shop, walk, see the views and eat at many varied restaurants. Also often live music and entertainers too. Good varied places to eat so take your pick.

Outstanding . Visited on multiple occasions including New Year's Eve. Security is visible and very helpful. A great selection of stores and eateries are present (various halaal options available). The NYE atmosphere was amazing with a parade and fireworks display, and multiple bands and buskers playing throughout the evening.
My Mum was so impressed. My Mum had been wanting to visit South Africa all her life to see the game and visit Cape Town, she was not disappointed. Loved the city and especially loved the waterfront.

Typical tourist place. A few upmarket hotels, overpriced restaurants in abundance and hundreds of shops and stalls overlooking the harbour. Nice food market with a lovely variety of snacks and cuisines.
Harbour boat tours leave from here which you get nice views looking back to the waterfront with table mountain in the backdrop.
Beautiful but very touristy.. What you can enjoy is the restaurants and the ambiance but there is also the downside of too many tourists, and over priced gifts.

Rip off city.. The shops and restaurants are out to rip you for as much as possible.
Sloppy service generally and the prices definitely cater for forex. Locals stay away.

Crowded and overrated. I had very high expectations when going to the Victoria and Alfred Waterfront. I was, however, very disappointed. Very, very crowded, more like an amusement park. Not what I had expected.

Lively and full of Excitement. No visit to Cape Town is complete without a trip to the Waterfront. There is plenty to do. All major chain shops are under one roof. You can take boat trips to Rubben Island or just around the coast or you may want to view the coast by helicopter. Almost every type of cuisine is served both indoor and outdoor. Most bars have music and there is always live entertainment in the open. It is best to go late afternoon and stay for dinner unless you are gpoing for shopping only, in which case you may want to be there mid morning as there are a lot of shops and there are plenty of eating places.One does not have to worry about it being a rainy day as there is a lot to do indoor.
Lots to see and do. Love spending time at the waterfront. . So many different things to experience .. a must do while in cpt
V&A Waterfront. the best place to be at this time of the year, the variety of shops and the trading hours make shopping very exciting the view is spectacular I visit over and over again.

Loved it!. We spend some time here after our Robben Islandt our. Loved the buildings. Great shopping, good fun places,to,eat.Spend some time wandering around.One thing, I was taking a picture of the statues of the four Nobel Peace Laureates, as I was doing this a guy tried to pickpocket my partners wallet. Be a little careful.
Beauty. Beautiful. Easy to get to. Extremely busy over high season. Good food. Start of hop on hop off bus route. Leka vibe.
Best waterfront on the planet. Been to most waterfronts the world has to offer but nothing beats the V&A. Some nice restaurants, great vibe, good shops, beautiful views.

Large Mall on the Waterfront. Most hotels have a free shuttle to the Waterfront Fall. There were several local bus lines that past by the mall. The mall has a lower level for parking and there is a large super market. The other two levels have several department stores, shops and restaurants. There is a movie theater in the mall. The mall has two or three barber shops. The mall is very large walking from one end to the other end. There is an information desk in the center of the mall. The desk provides map and give directions to different shops. The staff was very helpful.

V&A Waterfront - Great Place to be - 'PLENTY OF EXCITING THINGS TO DO!!'. The place to be. You have great designer style shops, boutiques, beautiful restaurants, cafes, souvenir shops, museums. There is so much to do. There is live entertainment, live jazz, exhibitions. You can go to Robben Island from the V&A from Nelson Mandela Gateway. You can take a sightseeing Harbour Cruise, Champayne Cruise Catamaran on Table Bay for R200, Sunset Cruise, Helicopter Trips, get on the Ferris wheel. There is so much to see and do. You will love it!!! Go and check it out:)

Shopping, food and drink on the water. This is a large mall with lots of shops, a food court and restaurants set on the harbour. It is a bit touristy but worth a visit and if the weather isn't great a lot is indoors. In the evening there is music at some of the bars and restaurants and it can be lively with performances in the public areas by traditional dancers ad singers.

Beautiful items on sale! Fantastic vibe!. We took the Blue Bus for a tour around the city, passing Kirstenbosch Gardens, and disembarking at Hout Bay, where we had a wonderful lunch. We took the bus back to town doing a lovely detour of many of the beaches, and then stopped at the V&A to look at what was on offer. So many beautiful items, difficult to decide, and some very unique items! I would have loved more time there!I also enjoyed the big wheel ride!

Very crowded. We came here over Christmas and New Year. It was our first time in South Africa! We were nor expecting so many people with the restaurants full. However, if you go to the top level the restaurants have space. Perhaps it will be less busy in Jan! We did like the variety of food. The wives will love it. Plenty of shops in the Mall behind!

ALL YOU NEED. V&A Waterfront caters for everyone, Ages 1 to 100, hundreds of shops and the most gorgeous and different shops all under one roof. When you are tired of shopping there are a myriad of restaurants, sunset cruises, show in the amphi theatre or big wheel to end of a perfect day.

Fantastic! . The V&A is so diverse that it is one not to miss when in Cape Town. Fabulous shopping before a visit to the live band and for dinner at one of the many fine dining restaurants.A fabulous day or night out with great views of Table Mountain too!

take your time to choose the right restaurant. there are a great deal of restaurants.I would suggest time is taken to peruse the menus on display.The price range is incredible.Also allow time to view the street performers and musicians.A great family day out !

Visiting at Christmas always a pain. Nothing has changed great place to shop in the off season avoid during Christmas
Parking took 20 min. Restaurants have large queues. Very busy as like most places but the parking is the worst.

Nice, nice, nice!!. Shop, shop, shop!! A shopping paradise!
Loads of parking with easy access. Clear indications to main stores. Friendly security guards to help you in the right direction.
Clean bathrooms!

Excellent vibe in an awesome location. We spent many nights at the Waterfront. The atmosphere is always great with the best retaurants and nice live music all around. Thee is so much to do and enjoy at the Waterfront.

Great Food Market at the Waterfront - specially Vagabond Kitchens (Awe Afrika and Mash). At the V&A Waterfront there is a great Food Market where we found a gem - Vagabond Kitchens (trading as "And Mash" and "Awe Afrika"). This young team of chefs produce excellent beef, malay chicken and vegetarian wraps together with amazing Pork Belly or Rib Eye Steak plates of food. Quality people producing quality food for a very affordable price of about R50.00 per wrap or plate of food. Excellent value for money.

Endless fun! Great food market and shops- all around fun. THere is ALWAYS something new and something fun to do here. I love the waterfront and highly suggest people go several time during their Capetown stay. We only explored one area but definitely look forward to returning and staying right in the waterfront and checking out something new every day. There was a small train for kids, a fun kiddie play area, live music, African dancers, beautiful views.... you name it!

Perfect!. One of my favourite places. We've been there every day,while visit Cape town. Everything starts from there,as boat trips,hotel shuttles for your convenience....so many different restaurants with the tastiest and cheapest food i have ever eat since. Bill for less than 50$ for 5 with a bottle of wine?!?!I can't believe it!We try different restaurants and all are good. Shops....countless,couldn't manage to check all of them. With all world famous brands,as LV,Versace,Gucci,etc.The only minus I can say,its the early closing time for shops-9pm. As targeting tourist,who are mainly going out late evening, 9pm is a very early closing time,but the restaurants are working a bit late.
Touristic. Fun in a tourist way. Very crowded so dining is a struggle to find if u don't book once u arrive. Great to find gifts, hit he mall and walk around and see entertainers

A Fun Activity on a Nice Day!. The waterfront has a great variety of foods, attractions, beer, and shops! We went during the most perfect summer day which just made everything complete. It was such a vivacious scene! We took a very touristy walk around the waterfront and was able to capture some pictures of a seal doing tricks for the public. We grabbed lunch right off the pier and it was perfect. Afterwards, we wandered to the Mandela museum which was very informative and entertaining. Overall, a beautiful Cape Town attraction!
Great . Great place for families with young children. Nice play area for kids. Lots of places to eat. The kids loved the aquarium. You can spend all day there!
Nice lively place to go. Decent mall, places to shop and take pic of the view of table mountain, a must see two ocean acquarium and lot of places to eat and enjoy.

You can spend the whole day here . Apart from all the shopping possibilities and variety of restaurants, the Waterfront offers you a 'holiday destination' where you can just walk around and enjoy the vibe. Many things to do, including boat rides, beer tastings, amusement Park etc.

Great experience. I have been to the V & A Waterfront many times, and am constantly amazed at what a great place it is every time I go. There is so much positive energy there, so much to do and so many restaurants and shops to choose from. The entertainment in the arena outside was excellent the last time I was there, with young local guys doing acrobatic tricks, it was very entertaining and amusing. I highly recommend the place.

Nice, lively mall. Very decent mall, with high street stores and more high-end shops, 2 cinemas, and *so* many restaurants. I say 'decent', as the wares in shops tends to sell for much higher prices than they do anywhere else (high mark-up on those souvenirs!) and the food is good and cheap, but never great. If it's raining, or you have a few hours to kill, or you are stumped for ideas for food though, it's not a bad place to be.
Amazing place . Our second visit here and still so much to see , buzzing and so much to do and see for everyone. It's one place to visit on everyone's bucket list !
Family Holiday. Congested, shops are good- long hours , entertainment always good . Generally service is mediocre. Has a lot of traffic as in movement of people.
A days visit. Roamed around the Waterfront in and around everything. Went on the big wheel, good views, safe ride. Had lunch at The Grill, bit pricey for what we had but nice.

World class venue that is also a working habour. Visited to waterfront to attend the Titanic Expo. This provided myself and a friend to make a day of it by visiting various sites and enjoying a quick lunch at one of the many eateries. Parking is plentiful and fairly cheap. The waterfront has high end shops to fast food outlets. There is something for everyone. There is a lot to see and do. You can spend endless hours browsing the various shops and stalls for that special gift or you can visit the various interesting buildings, dry docks, Clock Tower, art exhibitions, monuments, aquarium, ferrous wheel or watch buskers performing on the quay sides. Can be very busy during the peak summer tourist season.

Lots to do - very touristy!. This is a mash up of Boston's Quincy Market, San Francisco's Pier 39 area and maybe a bit of downtown Disney thrown in. It's huge - tons of shops, a couple malls, lots of restaurants, lots of places to walk along the wharf area. Very busy. Very touristy -- after about 30 minutes we had seen enough. There are other more charming and authentic neighborhoods in Cape Town to visit. This is Cape Town for the masses.

Huge shopping restaurant area. The hotel shuttle buses took us to and from this area. It was so much fun. Live music being performed. Assorted foods, wine and restaurants. Shopping. Souvenir offerings. Clothing and toys. Decorated for upcoming holidays made it a photographic must-have.Many choices of what and where to eat. Seafood, steaks, sushi, or pizza can be found in one restaurant.

The Waterfront is a must go in Cape Town.. Visited The Waterfront every day while in Cape Town.Always something else to see.Nice to visit early or late.Good shopping and nice selection of restaurants.Restaurants are good and mostly reasonably priced.
Amazing, bubbling with life. A complete package-food, shopping, play area, tourist attractions. Enjoyed live, dance, music and amazing views. Must visit in Cape Town.

One of the best tourist/shopping/dining spots in South Africa!. The Waterfront is a major benchmark for other tourist attractions, malls and restaurants. It has maintained its high standard for many years, and I hope that this will continue for years to come.

What a vibe! Cant wait to visit again!!. breakfast, mid day wander or dinner its great! the watershed was also a great place to find souvenirs.Eateries for all budgets and tastes - the market is specially fun!

Lovely Place with many opportunities. Here you can have breakfast, do some shopping, make a boat trip to Robben Island, enjoy the view, eat something delicious in the food court like a south african wrap and you MUST drink a pear cider.At the amphitheatre at the back of the V&A Mall you can enjoy the various shows, street artists and music. It is really lovely there.

Miss Green. Besides the fact that most shops are a bit bigger in this mall it's not really fun to walk around it.I prefer Canal Walk 100% more than this mall. It's hard to find a toilet, so when u do its usually packed and u stuck in a queue!Most restaurants uses a lot of walking space. Besides the little park and boat area thre is no entertainment in that place. And no free WiFi

Something for everyone here. This place is really nice - it is a little bit like fisherman's wharf but seems less messy than that. There is a really huge port area for all to see and then there are low-lying shops. There seems to be a lot of work in the background as there were many cranes. There is also the view of Table Mountain and the cloud that hovers just above it. According to our guide, all the South Africans also come here for all their recreational activities after work. So this place is really bustling with life. It is also genuinely very crowded For children, there is the aquarium, a large chess set out in the open, an overcrowded playground (even at 10.30pm), face-painting and train my Hamleys that goes round and round. It is really nice to come here for an evening stroll Etc. There are sunset rises, helicopter rides, ferris wheel... the attractions just go on and on. There are many restaurants to choose from and a lot of them overlook the harbour so it is also very nice. During weekends, there are also free concerts but the seating area is all jammed up and over-flowing, loads of buskers etc. Even until 10.30pm on a Sunday night, the live band in one of the bars was still going strong.

An excellent place to spend a few hours.. We have been to Waterfront a few times in 9 days and had dinner in different restaurants. This place also good for shopping,havind a stroll along the waterfront and see street dancers etc. When you are in Cape Town you should visit Waterfront.

Working harbour . Although so busy during the Xmas season the shops were just so busy. Being a music fanatic the bands at the pubs and the show at the waterfront was great to keep adults and kids busy. Watching the tugs coming and going was a great part of the day.
So special,a Great variety. This must be the best place to shop and groove in the World,Cape Town you beauty.This is a great time and must visit if you go there.

A Kaleidescape of happy visitors!. You can experience a beautiful setting, amazing seaside restaurants, musicians, whimsical art(a Christmas tree made from recycled water bottles, for example), fabulous shopping (don't miss the Watershed for gorgeous African art, clothing, house wares, jewelry, etc.), and the Two Seas aquarium is such fun and so lnformative. The food hall next to the Watershed is out of this world!
V&A Waterfront. Top shopping and activity centre that certainly gives a family any options to stay occupied especially on a rainy day!

A huge area with something for everyone - can be crowded in parts. It's 3 years since we were last at the V&A waterfront and it has continued to expand and develop. Lots of bars, restaurants and boutique shops - and now a huge full-on shopping mall. (Although frankly many of the shops are the same ones you'd get in a dozen cities around the world). Lovely atmosphere with a few museums and attractions such as the Aquarium (which is great), a big wheel, boat and helicopter rides around the bay and now a Titanic exhibition.Can be crowded in places but, equally, there are quieter places to wander. This is one of the "must see" parts of Cape Town".
Good restaurants, shopping. A very nice shopping center on the waterfront, some great restaurants. Lots of options for on the water activities such as harbor cruises.

Our visit to the V&A Waterfront. We had fun shopping around the Mall, we also toured around the city with the sightseeing red bus. We also had the harbour cruise, lunch at Quay 4 restaurant, the Cape wheel and an experience to the Two Oceans Aquarium which my little daughter also enjoyed so much!!

Attraction to definitely visit in Cape Town. Huge area with a classy shopping mall, lots of restaurants, cinemas, ferris wheel, rugby museum, aquarium, beer house, hotels and a great view of the harbour. Walk around in the mall or outside around the harbour. Take a boat trip and experience Table mountain from the sea. You will love it

Nice shopping , dining and crafts area . Good mall with well organized parking . Can be a bit to busy and overwhelming during holidays time . Gods selection of restaurants and the craft mall nearby is a treasure

A Very "Happening" Place. There's a lot going on here, hotels, shops, restaurants, street performers, boats, seagulls. Yes, it's touristy, but we were tourists and found it offered everything we needed. No need for a car or taxi because we could walk everywhere in safety or catch the Hop-On Hop-Off bus to Table Mountain, Kirstenbosch, etc. Would not consider staying anywhere else in Cape Town.
a fine shopping eating location. The location on the waterfront makes this collection of modern shops and restaurants special. The large amount of parking helps.

If you love shopping this is your paradise. This Waterfront is a great place to be and is also excellent when it is raining.More than enough top class shops where you can shop until you drop. A number of local chains ie Woolworths & Pick n Pay are well represented. The restaurants are very good and there are a number of bookshops. Movie houses as well as Take out shops are well patronized and easy parking available. Reservations for many activities such as helicopter or boat outings can be arranged as well

Great fun, lots to see. The V&A waterfront has activities for everyone. There are fine dining restaurants, cultural/historical options and museums, shopping, fast food, and much much more. My favorite part was the indoor crafts market which had many unique gifts. Be sure to walk around to take in the historical buildings with their stunning architecture!

An unexpected find.. Our hotel offered a free shuttle to the waterfront and we accepted. What a surprising delight when we arrived. Absolutely gorgeous shopping mall with lots of restaurants.0, a magnificent Ferris wheel and lots of wonderful stores, plus, a magnificent view of the harbor. Lovely way to spend an afternoon and evening in Cape a town!
What a wonderful place filled with life. It is such a great place to visit and the ambience is great. Everyone going to Cape Town must visit. The food is great and the shopping exceptional

World class shopping. This is one of the best shopping centres, pricy but caters for all types of shopping. La Parfumerie - the best find with the excentric Gerhard Cohen. Could order my much loved Mystere from De Rochas.
Touristy. Not authentic Cape Town, just a tourist location really. But I guess that's what tourists like. Safer than other areas so that is a bonus
Choice choice choice. I love the waterfront. It just gets better and better. The new wing is very pretty with properly smart stores. Excellent dining facilities as well.

Wonderful. Victoria and Alfred Waterfront is a place te be whenever you go to Cape Town. With a diversity of activities to do there, you will easily spend a long and nice time there, with family, friends, in couple or alone. Must see !

Shopping. World class. Something for young and old. Great eating venues. Also boat trips and helicopter trips. Live entertainment adds to the visit. Loads of parking for cars and also public transport to the city and back available. Lots to keep kids busy things to do and see!

Shopping and food. Waterfront is a hive of activity. Something for everyone to do. From shopping to eating, the aquarium is a must do activity. Wear comfortable shoes, lots of walking. If you love the ocean, take a boat trip. Find a cosy spot and take in the enchanting views.

Nice to walk around when visiting Cape Town. The V&A is always a nice place to visit when in Cape Town, and the atmosphere is always great! You get to walk all around the harbour and see all the ships coming and going. You can also go on a boat trip if you'd like.Keep an eye out for the seals in the water! They are quite used to people and will come close.Stop at at least one of the local artists standing around the V&A and enjoy their talents, whether it is singing, drawing, acting or whatever. They can be real gems!Find a restaurant that fits your budget. Most of the restaurants next to the water are quite expensive, so look for one behind them, or go into the mall to find some cheaper restaurants.

Great vibe. .lots to see and do!. Visited the VA waterfront during one of the busiest time of the year. ..just before Xmas!The mall was beautifully decorated in a xmas theme..shops galore...musicians and magicians entertained the crowd outside the mall. The waterfront plays host to many activities from romantic sunset cruises to helicopter rides. We went to the Titanic expo, pirate ship, craft market, food market amd aquarium all within walking distance. The are many restaurants to choose from offering a range of cuisines. The ferris wheel was very popular with a constant queue of people waiting for their turn.There's enough do to at the waterfront to fill a whole day!

In Cape Town this is a place to visit for strolling and dinng. Easy to get to place for strolling and dining. Located in a working harbor, there is lots of water activity. Restaurants ( with seafood a specialty ) abound. If you are American, the dollar is strong right now (12/15) and dinners are relatively very inexpensive. Its very active at nigh. There is shopping and tourists activity galore.
Nice shopping & eating. Great day out so many shops and restaurants . Check out the new H&M store what a flagship. Walk around the port and take trips on boats. A great family day.
Beautiful at anytime. A lovely ambience, clean and tourist friendly. Be sure to visit the lovely stores, the Cape Wheel and some of the fine restaurants.

Hive of Activity. The Waterfront is delightful and buzzing with activity. Restaurants, bars, shops - no shortage of things to do. There is also a wonderful hall of shopping with genuine and beautiful objects from the artisans all round Africa. Not your usual cheapie, but if you're looking for some fine stuff, don't hesitate.

My best treat... All I can say is .. Wow !! What a dream place to have visited. Enjoyed the boat ride...great place to do your shopping and relax at your favourite restaurant.. Everything at one place..Amazing!

Shopping and The Mug and Bean!.
