The all singing all dancing shopping experience in Capetown.Malls of beautiful designer shops kids stuff incredible African artifacts and an ececletic selection of eateries inside and out overlooking the docks with Table mountain as a backdrop!Year on year it gets better herethere is more diversity more outlets a great big new fish restaurant near the Clock Towera brand new Hotel The Grace on the other side and many more new buildings going up offering high end accomodation.The eye is definately worth a visit as on a good day you can see Robbin Island as well as The Drakensberg Moutains... not expensive and all the pods are aircondtioned!One of the main attractions for me are the musicians who play outside near the eye. You will hear pure African marimba sounds singing unaccompanied male voices as well as small groups of jazz musicians in the shade revisiting the Ella Fitzgerald greats ..its always a pleasure to linger and listen between shopping and eating!
Touristy but worth the visit. Nice shops and even better restaurants. Closeby to other attractions like the aquarium and also where ferry to Robben island is so perfect to combine the activities.

Worth visiting. A great place to eat and shop. Take a harbour boat tour and learn some history and see great views.The weekends are very busy with tourists and locals and expect to queue for restaurants.It's a great place all round with a modern shopping mall.
Great atmosphere. Loved being back in this part of CT - it's been too long since our last visit - so much to see and do, whatever the weather and the age / makeup of your party

Heart of Cape Town:. Almost all hotels from sea point or campers bay have free shuttle buses running to waterfront every 60 mins. One can start day here and end here starting from touristic tours ending with an amazing dinner. Shopping (national or international) is also here.

So much vibe!. You can go here and choose to do a lot of stuff or just sit there and do nothing! Its that kind of place. Perfect for that lazy brunch or a wonderful romantic dinner. You cannot not go to V&A when you are in capetown!

Brave visit in season. Went to Waterfront to show a visitor and was not a crowded as I feared.A great place to visit but as might be expected most thing a bit more expensive than elsewhere.The live bands are always a nice attraction and there is a lot of people watching to do.The parking payment machine was a problem - hence the 4 stars.
Nice place. Nice cool place to chill out. We took a boating trip to experience the surroundings & enjoyed every minutes of it.
Exciting . Something for everyone, lots of action with the harbor, shops, restaurants. Good idea to take uber and skip the parking.

There is so much to do!. We spent two full days here.. There is always something going on..performances, shopping, live bands, magic shows..you can go on the huge faris wheel, go minture golfing or go on a cruise tour of the harbour...it also has an amazing view of Table Mountain.

Pleasant tourist spot. The V & A Waterfront is a great place to visit when in Cape Town. It is fronted by a working harbour and there are a wide variety of tourist activities to take part in. There really is something for everybody and I enjoy going there each time I am in Cape Town as there is a variety of eateries and the friendly vibrant atmosphere is enjoyable.

Fun spot to hang out in Cape Town. The waterfront is very lively and always happening no matter the day. Full of tourists and locals too. Nice restaurants and shopping...a must see for people going to Cape Town for the first time!
"A must go see". Lots to do and see for the avid shopper there is enough for more take a boat trip out on see !! You might be pleasantly surprised seeing dolphins or sea otter's.

Loads of shopping and dining. Plenty of shopping from crafts and small boutique shops to larger chain stores. A host of restaurants from fast-food outlets to fine-dining restaurants serving both local and international cuisine. Huge range in prices, but quality generally good throughout. Very geared towards tourists and can be a bit busy at times. Harbour tours and trips to Robben Island depart from here. Also a range of hotel accommodations in the area or within walking distance. Good public transport access.

Great convenient location . Everything you could want in a great location- except a beach- though there are gorgeous beaches just minutes away. Great for shopping, great restaurants and great people! All staff of the waterfront are so helpful and can't help you enough. There are security teams all over the area so is very safe. We stayed at the table bay hotel which is conveniently located in the waterfront- with access to the Victoria wharf shopping mall. Would 100% stay here again!

Cheerful crowds. This huge shopping, eating and relaxation experience is wholely charming with good-natured crowds and punters all in the best of moods. In the last few days before Xmas it's very busy but even we, as allergic to crowds as we are, could only sit back and enjoy the atmosphere of bonhomie and pleasure. Entertainment for all the family and more than enough to eat, from fast to slow and everything in between! Great!
Lovely place. Great places to eat. Lots going on at all times of the day. Staff at the restaurants are brilliant. High quality service. Lots of shops.

Parking was a schlep . VSA Waterfront was a good outing. They were, however, working the roads or something so many were closed and no clear indication of where parking is allocated. We parked at the Nedbank parking and walked the other part.

Beautiful views and wonderful restaurants and shops. The V&A is a safe and interesting place to explore. The restaurants and stores are world class and the easy access to Robbin Island was convenient. The added bonus of street musicians and ferris wheel gives this a festive atmosphere.
Shopping, dinning, and so on.. great for shopping, liked the Nautical Atmosphere,nice restaurants great walk, all kind of activities for anyone's liking.

Tourist trap, but great!. We used the waterfront quite a lot. Loads of great places to eat. A huge shopping mall.Boat and helicopter tours. Acrobats, African drummers. A huge Ferris Wheel.It get very busy on the evenings so best to book one of the restaurants.There is also a food market selling prepared snacks and lunches.Lenny of taxis, but allways agree on a fare before getting in, they never use the meters!Only thing that would make it better would be a few bars for just getting a drink. They all seem to serve mainly food. We walked into a restaurant and asked if we could have just a drink, no problem! This is a very cosmopolitan area with lots of tourists. Good fun.

Something for most everybody. We encountered a helpful employee of the posh hotel at the waterfront, who directed us to the restaurant area. We enjoyed people watching and then making the most of the foodie events being held there. Lots to see and do.

Pricy but worthwhile. Definitely worth a visit. Lots of shopping eating and drinking. Beautiful setting and scenery. I found the shops and restaurants a bit pricy and obviously geared for the tourist trade.
Great fun!. Lots of shops and restaurants, along with live music in the street. This is a great place for strolling, shopping, eating and people-watching.
Great Entertainment. Great place to visit, great shopping and street entertainment - lovely food - a fab place to people watch.
touristy but still interesting. lots of action, from live music to caroussels and boat trips. It is worth it also being a little touristy. Still you get some nice views and entertainment.

Shopping, eating, drinking by the seafront. Whether you're thinking of shopping, having a drink or a meal by the sea, the V&A Waterfront has it all. It can get crowded during the summer, but it's highly recommended, particularly the V&A market, which offers great tasting food at a very cheap price.
beautiful. We enjoyed a little shopping. Visit the Watershed for authentic African treasures and crafts. Great people watching.

The best place to be for all the activities!. A vibrant place to go to. You park once and walk everywhere. The variety of shops and restaurants are amazing - for all age groups.It is a valuable asset to our beautiful city. It has the Hop-on-hop-off bus station at the aquarium and you start your trip from there.The fact that the harbour is a working harbour is a big plus. We are very fortunate to have such a world class facility in Cape Town!

Excellcent . Lots to do!Good shopping lots or bars and restaurants (but would suggest pre booking Restaurants) as can get very busy in the summer! Lively atmosphere live bands and on going entertainment Makes a good day or night out! Would highly recommend a visit to the water front!

thanks to Sol for that beautiful hotel , with so much on the doors step. the hotel is first class the views from the rooms the view from the surrounding apartments overlooking the entire area , just make you wnat to stay a little longer ...or even better buy one ...I can see why they are so attractive to overseas buyer for what you pay and what you get NO WHERE else in the world will you get this value for money well maybe if Sol allows you to buy at Maldives .....that comes close ...

Fun Galore. I am not sure i have the right words to describe the excitement here. Do I start to talk about the soweto music groups or the XMAS carol music group. Is it the funny spectacle of groups of friends making hilarious gestures, It really is a beautiful place to visit!

Worth a visit. We had an evening to spare in Cape Town and decided to do a visit here. It is a long stretch by the ocean with a series of restaurants, a vast shopping mall, and a smaller version of the London eye for those who love rides. It was a fine walk along the walkway watching seagulls and seals. The majestic table mountain overlooks the city and complements the surrounding environment perfectly. A good way to spend a relaxing evening sitting in one of the restaurants overlooking the ocean.

Excellent shopping, eating and cultural experience.. We were staying at the Radisson Blu waterfront hotel so access to the V and A was easy using their shuttle bus. Once there we found lots of shops, restaurants and the ideal place to book and depart on your Cape Town experiences.

Shop, walk, eat till you drop!. There are so many shops and restaurants here! Cater more time in this location if you love to shop and eat. Other than that, there are things to do here, for example the red city tour bus has a stop here, robben island tour starts here as well.You can also do a V&A Waterfront historic guided tour too if there is time. Get to learn a bit more about the history of the waterfront area, but do not expect too much though.

Visit the waterfront and do not forget to take the trip to Robbeneiland. Very nice spot to drink and eat and for the trip to Robbeneiland.
Walk around look at the table mountain and just relax

great atmosphere. there is something for everyone here. great views of the harbor, amazing restaurants, great shopping
there seems to always be some amazing musical performances outside as well. I hate shopping but loved my time here

Congestion: Poor Access to the park area of the Highway...traffic congested for kiometres...a poor start to our tour.... We were queueing into the V & A Waterfront for the best part of 15-20 minutes with no advancement of the traffic...it was a really bad expereince and will not be going back there...if I can help it!
Lots of food and shopping. Nice area by te water, good for strolling, eating, and shopping. Views of Table Mountain. A bit tourist, but plenty of local people to make it feel like a homey place.

South African roadtrip . The V&A is quite simply how shopping eating entertainment should be. Very modern but feels like it's been there for ages. Walkable and yet vast. Two distinct sides. Inside you have the mall with all the fashion outlets plus checkers and Mr price! Outside you have bars and restaurants and the harbour. We fell in love with the place.The robbin island jetty is also here.Parking is in huge lots right opposite and is very reasonable. We both felt very safe here day and night.
Vibrant!. If in Cape Town this is a must. Shops, bars restaurants, boat trips to Robben Island, helicopter trips, this place has it all.

V&A Hotel is a good place to call home base while in CapeTown. We stayed here and found it to be accessible by foot to all the charms of the V&A waterfront. The hotel itself was very nice. Very well-priced and beautiful rooms.

A must visit for shoppers. Victoria and Alfred Waterfront offers quality shopping and wonderful restaurants. If you are looking for local had made items go to the Water Shed that is a separate building and you will find a great selection of hand made African goods. These are not cheap souveniers, but quality items you can display in your home. There is often entertainment and a lively crowd to enjoy it. There is a building located that is somewhat of a food court and offers a versatile menu. We loved eating lunch there every day for a week. When we were there in August they closed around 6 so be sure to go early enough to be able to enjoy their offerings. Upstairs they sell spices by the ounce and you will want to take some of these home with you. There is a reason the Victoria and Alfred Waterfront is the most visited tourist attraction in South Africa.

Vibrant . Apparently it's the biggest tourist attraction in Africa - raking in more tourists than Victoria Falls, Table Mountain and the Pyramids of Giza. At the end of the day it's just a shopping complex set against the backdrop of the ocean and Table Mountain, but the vibe is great and the restaurants and shops are first rate. It's definitely worth a visit when you're in the city.
Good shopping area. Good shopping area. You can get alot of tour activities package from here and you can bargain the price too!

Great area with so much to do!!!. We loved the Victoria & Alfred Waterfront! It was five mintues from our hotel and we spent a good deal of time wandering through the many stores and attractions. We had some good meals that ranged from Sushi to Italian and found the area very friendly and safe.

Shopping, Eating and sunset sailing. The place is so bustling with activity, plenty of clothing shops at the Victoria mall. Choice of places to eat, or drink. There is some street performers, and of course you can sail on a boat for a hour or so.

Unbelievable array of top shops and restaurants. We visited here a good 10 days of our holiday and I'm sure we still didn't see it all. It is without question the best shopping mall we have ever been to, and all open until 9 o clock. It also has the best selection of restaurants in one place we have ever seen with menus to suit everyone. Top this with a great exchange rate at the moment.

Shopping, Restaurants and Entertainment. From souvenirs, curios, Name Brands, clothing and even groceries you can find it all at the V&A waterfront. There are also many restaurants to choose from. Well worth the visit.

You could spend two days here, and we did part of two. We spent several hours the first day before boarding the ferry to Robben Island. Lots to see and do and multiple options for food and shopping. We've done the usual: Rio, Sydney, SFO, Singapore, Hong Kong etc., but this waterfront is the best of all.

Yay, tourist trap!. If you cannot find anywhere else to go, the V&A is probably a good option. Although there are some exceptions and spots worth a visit it generally ticks most of the "tourist trap" boxes.

You shop, dine, leisure and all. This destiny is all inclusive a few hundred shops, boats to Roben Island, busses to tour the whole city. Beautiful hotels massage areas, enough parking.Kids play areas, There are just all restaurants you can think of from economic ones to nice and very pricy ones.  A destiny for all interestSome nice coffee shops and clothing shops, fragrance shops, and super exclusive onesI guess there is enough destinies for all interest
Lakeside/Blue Water/Westfield in Cape Town. Great variety of shops and restaurants. Ideal if you also want to make a boat tour or helicopter ride around/over Cape Town.

Nice tourist area to relax. Beautiful area on the docks with so many restaurants to choose from. The seafood is to die for. There are a number of shops too but some are quite pricey.There are a number of bars but these close approx 11pm, so if looking for a later option of night life then you will need to go further afield. The Nelson Mandela museum is a must visit & you also get the boat from here to Robben Island

Lots to do and see. Plenty to do and see - shopping, food, boat rides, hop on hop off location for extended tours of Cape Town. Shop around for African curios - cheaper in the shed area (as at December 2015). Very busy and given the crowds - not recommended for babies and toddlers. In most photos, you can have the ocean or Table mountain featured in the photo. Also not far to walk to Sea Point or the Stadium - location is quite central.

Very modern, contrived. Not my bag, but well worth a visit. Ultra modern and clean, with outstanding shopping and views, this location is the class of tourist based urban development...think of it as a better version of Fishermans Wharf.

Eat, Shop, Wine & Dine. Shopping with Style, Curious Shops, Luxury Shops, Shops for you & me, Food no matter if you wanna go for a Pizza. a Burger or some Wine & Dine ( $ up to $$) Here is where you can do all that and much more.

A Super Cool Place. I had no expectation of V & A Waterfront, but I could have spent a week here instead of the two days that we had. Perfect views of the mountain, great shopping, amazing atmosphere with continual busking and music and no people hassling us. Felt totally safe and happy.
Awesome. This place is beautiful actually mind blowing. Everything about is just awesome any shop you can think of is there

Always worth a visit. Always enjoy the V&A. Restaurants are brilliant and cater for all tastes and budgets. Not much variety when it comes to other shopping though, mostly clothes.
Views are amazing. The sunset champagne cruises on the catamaran are a must!

Nostalgic feeling, interesting waterfront. Love this place, it's full of life like a carnival! Well decorated shops, great food, talented street performers/artists, big shopping mall, nice stroll along the waterfront admiring the boats.

It's heaven for Shopaholics who want Quality handcrafted products! . Shopping is always one of my favorite parts of travel. I collect local art, home goods, jewelry and clothing as memories of my trips. I'm not looking for chain stores that pop up all over the world! Many times the local handicrafts I'm faced with are an assortment of junky, cheap mass produced CRAP! That's not the case at the Waterfront Shed . A huge barn like building with artisans in "stalls" featuring their creations. It's mostly home goods and some clothing with fair prices.....really fair.....! In additional adjacent to the watershed is a "food court" for lack of a better description with the most amazing fresh, versatile food offerings...from fresh smoothies to Indian pocket squares to Mexican burritos. Its Orgasmic,! If you don't want quick food there are plenty of sit down service restaurants along the waterfront too to choose from. This is the BEST waterfront shopping area I've ever seen ...don't miss it if you LOVE to shop and appreciate high quality Value !
Beautiful water front & lots of things to do. This place is amazing. Lots of people meeting and eating. Few activities to do as well. Lots of activities like sunset boat ride etc., start from here.

A Shopping Mall - Not A Tourist Attraction. We added V&A Waterfront to our itinerary thinking it was a place unique to Cape Town. Although the waterfront is nice, it is a shopping mall. It has all the same shops as back home (though with the exchange rate, your money will go a long way) and several restaurants. Looking back, if I had known what it this place was, I wouldn't have gone. It was still a pleasant time, but I would have rather gone elsewhere.
So much to see!!!. Here there a vast variety of stores and independent traders.Make sure you leave room in your case!!!!

Cape Town Waterfront historical walking tour. Waterfront Cape Town is not just shopping and restaurants but it also offers a very interesting historical walking tour (about 2 hours) which includes the Chavonnes battery Museum. Many thanks to my guide Thandikhaya who introduced me to the history of the Cape Town harbour and its various buildings. He is very knowledgeable and passionate about his job. I do recommend the tour to see the Waterfront from a different perspective.

A Great Way to Spend the Day. I visited this area a number of times and each time made new discoveries.I particularly loved the Water Shed a large warehouse with many stalls set up by individual artists and craftsmen to present some very creative products. It is the gateway to Robben Island and several museums and restaurants and is a central transport hub. There is a holiday vibe with buskers and tourists and it is easy to spend many hours there shopping, eating, drinking or just strolling around.
Wow. This is huge - we had no idea it was so big and busy but give yourself time to explore as you prob need a day. It's huge. Loads of restaurants and shops.
Shopping and relaxation . Yes, lots of nice and interesting shops there. A good mix between luxury, high end, touristy.Lots of nice options for food and relaxation.Spacious, by the water and nice!!!!

V&A Waterfront. The highlight of our visit to the Waterfront was, besides the quaint structures, the sighting of a large school of dolphins playfully jumping about in the Atlantic Ocean. They were so close to the shore that one wanted to just jump in and touch them if one could. There is ample scope of shopping too, but I would prefer to spend more time with the dolphins than shops!

What Every Major Waterfront Should Be Like. The V&A Waterfront in Cape Town is a bustling hive of activity most days. The dining, shopping and tourist opportunities are abundant. One could easily spend several days there and still be entertained at every turn. There is always live music/performers to enjoy, excellent restaurants, and activities for adults and children alike. Many of the shopping malls are full of high-end retailers, but there are also niche retailers for over-priced gift ideas for family (the same the world over). Many cruise liners take port there and are a real spectacle as they enter the harbour. There are plenty of high-end hotel options at the Waterfront, as you would expect, but also apartment rentals available. We stayed in Cape Town for 10 days and visited the Waterfront 4-5 times. Extremely safe and a relaxed, happy vibe.

The best place to be in Cape Town. You can spend the whole day at Victoria & Alfred Waterfront there is loads of fun and activities to do .From boat rides,helicopter rides,watching movies live Marimba bands.Going to the cinema.Just doing sight seeing taking photos as you go.Or you can hop on the bus at the waterfront to Table Mountain to see one of the seven wonders of the world or a tour to the Winelands dine in style.There is so much to do a day is not enough.

Too touristic and busy. We really do not like this area as it is very crowded and very touristic. This is more like Fishermen's Warf in San Francisco. The restaurants are too crowded and busy and in Capetown there are so much better ones to find. Explore Capetown and not this area!
Worth a visit. An upscale mall with much to see and do, and just across from another mall. Some outdoor activities and restaurants.

Fun Spot !. I was expecting just some shops but this is so much more. Lovely shopping center and huge, but lively outdoor entertainment at different time of the day, Great Aquarium, nice boat tour of the harbor, many great restaurants and things for children to do also !

Great place to spend time and money. The waterfront is beautiful and has great places to eat and shop. The mall and surrounding attractions are top notch, it is like the Beverly Center on a waterfront but more to offer. There is something for all ages and taste buds, an aquarium, Ferris wheel, shopping, restaurants, photo opportunities, views of the water, this place has it all. With the current rate of exchange the dollar goes a long way.

A nice and modern area containing shopping mall, with a lot of well known shops, restaurants.. Here you will find a modern shopping mall with a lot of well known brands. A lot of restaurants, pubs and a scene where it is free to sit down and watch different shows. At least when we were there. We saw a performance by students from a Hip hop school and a beauty contest - of course :o) There is also a market and several stores where you find local crafts.

Amazing quality of shopping and dining a must on every trip. Love to come and wander around this venue - it's feels so relaxed ,busy but loads to do and see . If you like to shop then every major Brand is here. I know it's the tourist hangout for Cape Town but believe it holds it quality and appeal - take a coffee listen to the local music bands - sit in the sun and enjoy !

It's a must when you are in Cape Town. There is everything and anything you can do at the V&A. From shopping, to eating, to sailing... I love the upgrades which have given me reason to keep coming back year after year as there is always a new activity, shop or restaurant to try out. As probably the premier tourist shopping destination in CT, most items are quite pricy so keep your eye out for specials. Very convenient and close to CBD. For those with young kids try out the Hamleys train ride which departs from near the Ferris wheel. At R20/ride (for any age) it's really worth it.

One of the Highlights of Cape Town. I loved visiting the V&A waterfront! I was there at least 4 times during my 5 night stay in Cape Town. There are wonderful cafes and restaurants where you can sit outdoors and sip a glass of excellent South African sparkling wine, enjoy fabulous seafood meals, visit amazing galleries, take a tour of a diamond museum, enjoy outdoor concerts, shop for local crafts and animal skins, shop at high end retail stores.

Shops, restaurants + hotels - a relaxing afternoon, local artisans at the Water Shed. Yes, it's a "tourist trap", but we enjoyed an afternoon here, doing some browsing and shopping - and relaxing, topped off with Happy Hour drinks/food with a clear view of Table Mountain. Especially liked the Water Shed, featuring local artists...you should check it out if you're into local crafts!
Lively place. For a vast variety for shopping, dining and entertainment next to the water. You fill how lively is Cape Town

Great!. Perfect spot for shopping and lunch on the water. Great views of table mountain, and a good transportation hub as well (MyCiti busses and taxis). Definitely pricier than other restaurants in the city, but worth a splurge for people watching and waterfront dining.
Touristy but Terrific. Lots of restaurants and bars with views of Table Mountain or the waterfront, including the now-mandatory ferris wheel at all touristy attractions. Gateway to Robbens Island.
Fantastic for shops, bars and restaurants. What a place one big shopping,eating and drinking eporium. Easy to navigate around and loads of hotels nearby and loads of helpful security people.
Easy access to boats and helicopter rides. Not interested in shopping. Several good choices for food and drink. Great people watching. Boat rides and helicopter access.

Wander for hours. The waterfront is a definitely must see place while in Cape Town. Since our hotel was located on the waterfront we spent a lot of time here just wandering around. There is a guided historical tour of the waterfront but the times didn't work for us because of other activities we had booked so we did a self guided walking tour. There are signs posted all through the area with pictures and text describing various points of interest. It was a wonderful way to spend the afternoon. Along we way we would stop in to various restaurants for a drink and snack before continuing on. You could literally spend days just wandering around this area. Extremely safe day or night!

Loads of entertaining people, but eat somewhere else. A walk along the waterfront dock area is entertaining with street performers, interesting people, and lots of shops and restaurants. So if you have a evening with nothing special to do, this is the place to go. But, the food here is priced for tourists and is not the best quality, eat somewhere else and then come walk and sit with ice cream or a beer would be my recommendation.

For who?. As I lived in CPT and understand both sides, I have to ask myself for who is that shopping Mall? 70% overseas tourists and 30% rich locals?Do the shops make enough turnover and profit? Surely not, by the way the shops come and go, it is not easy, and rent must be high.You might say, “It is not your business”! But when you buy something from that nice shop and you go back the next year to buy that other missing piece of the set you bought, and the shop has disappeared, it becomes my business.All in all it is a nice and clean shopping mall and as anywhere else, you have to find your way between fake and real and value/quality and tourist trap/cheap.

Plenty of places to eat and shop. Mitchells Brewery and Belthazar are just two of the attractions at this brilliant attraction. Whatever your taste or budget, you will find something of interest here.

Day & Night at Waterfront. As a local, I'm often at the Waterfront, besides being a fun entertaining place to shop or meet up with friends it's actually also a fully functional harbour so the 'landscape' changes constantly. It's Always 'abuzz' with tourists and locals. There's something for everyone available here... A huge variety of eating establishments to suit everyone's palette from Mac Donalds & other 'take out' type eateries to pubs with evening live music to fine dining restaurants. Retail therapy abounds in the form of craft markets, food markets, general retail, jewellery, book, electronic stores & very exclusive branded shops. Many excursions operate from here like sunset or day trip boat cruises, Robben Island boat trips, helicopter rides, and the main departure point for the Hop on Hop off bus, Two Oceans Aquarium, Springbok Rugby experience museum and current exhibitions... The TITANIC Artifact Exhibition displaying authentic artifacts recovered from the famous shipwreck is at the Waterfront until March '16. .... And that's just a taster.... Too many to mention!
Excellent place to spend an afternoon and evening. Beautiful area full of lovely seafood restaurants and shopping, safe and easy to get around. Try the Baia Restaurant for the best snails in town.

Water shed. The waterfront is like any waterfront anywhere -- overpriced. But check out the Water Shed, a building filled with top-quality, South African-made goods from clothing to jewelry to crafts. Best place to shop in all of Cape Town!

Gets better with time . V&A certainly keeps up with the times , it has the Classic vintage look yet modern. It offers the ultimate shopping experience and a wide variety of eateries. The place comes alive at night with performances everywhere, also very secure with guards all around the establishment. Still remains the number one must visit tourists attraction venue in Cape Town

Good atmosphere but very busy. The newer part of the V&A is very disappointing as it is just another shopping centre with designer shops you find all over the world. The old part is much more attractive and so is the market. It's very nice however to sit on the terrace of one of the restaurants and see the world go by. Great variety of boat trips on offer from here.
Pretty tourist spot. Clean and relaxed a nice walk around the restaurants and bars cool shops and market you can get the cheap red open topped bis from here around the town
Ok. Suppose this is one of the must see when visiting Cape Town. It's very touristy and had good quality (if expensive) shops and attractions.

A MUST visit. This waterfront is one of the best in the world in my opinion.The restaurants are fantastic. The ambiance is fantastic. You can walk around all day, visit attractions (aquarium, helicopter rides, big wheel, markets....). Equally you can sit and relax - and there is plenty for adults and children. The markets offer great food, it really is a must visit place.

Good vibe at the VnA. The VnA waterfront is a safe and lovely place to visit the various attractions as well as serve as a central meeting place. Area has a good vibe especially during the festive period.
The safest point in the city and also the most spectacular. Shops,restaurants,market ,music,marina,sightseeing bus ,aquarium,all and much more is a whole day programm
Great vibe. What is there not to like about the V&A Waterfront ? Lots of shopping, great views of Table Mountain and plenty of boats to see in the harbour.

Great place to walk, shop, then dine. Everything in one place. From shops, to artisans to great restaurants. So much to see and spend. Make sure to ask your concierge where to eat. Some are better then others.

VERY TOURISTY and Restaurants are overpriced!. This is a typical tourist hotspot with overpriced restaurants. 2 places I recommend there: the food market that had individual vendor booths selling juices, lunches, chocolates, etc.. all ready-to-eat or made fresh to order! Also, the big craft building that had all the vendor booths (and the public bathrooms). The vendors were all local artists: clothing, pottery, painting, jewlery, paperworks, etc!

Interesting shops & restaurants. Fun and scenic to wander around and window shop - plus some real shopping. Found some interesting craft items made in South Africa for remembrance gifts for family and friends at home.

Just another shopping centre . This might be a premium shopping centre but a shopping centre none the less. Nice entertainment and a decent selection of shops, but it doesn't feel like you are getting anything special

Centrally located-lots of options. Shopping, funky galleries, a great variety of dining options, and entertainment galore. This collection of establishments is really fun to stroll and accessible by public transport. It is clean and safe. Perfectr place to spend a few hours.

Lots of waterfront restaurants. Great safe place to wander around with lots of restaurant choices. It is touristy, so the shops have higher prices than out lying areas. Get your souvenirs out in the country from local artists.

AMAZING DINING, SHOPS...SIGHTS! THANKS GO TOUCHDOWN TOURS!. Incredible place to shop and dine and also take the ferrys out for various excursions. Of course we took a ferry out to Robben Island only 5 miles away to the place where Nelson Mandels was incarcerated during Apartheid...Guess who our tour guide was?? An EX-Prisoner who served on the island also...talk about the personal touch all the way-That's how Go TouchDown rolls!!
Great Variety. A great variety of things to see and do, places to shop and eat. And all the time, just across the water, the ever changing scene of Table Mountain.

Perfect♡ . One of my favourite places to be any day in CT (but especially when the weather is nice). Lots to do, inside and outside (activities like boat rides, restaurants, performers outside, ferris wheel, my favourite is the Welness Centre and the Food Market!!! Wow) ....

Tourism at its worst. Unless you need emergency supplies (pharmacy, travel gear) upon arrival in Capetown, don't bother making the trek to this "Disneyland" of bad tourism. The shops are the same as any other in a major city and therefore offers little in the way of character.The pubs are uninteresting, and the restaurants are average food at best. The only highlight is the "farmers market" in the large shed which has local foods available so if you do have to be in this area, at least there is one place to buy local.Instead, make your way to downtown, or any of the local beachside places for a local flavour (and to spend your tourism dollars with the locals instead of the conglomerates).
great busy place. on Sunday, the place was packed. lots of entertainment though, shows, artists, groups. very hype. great sea view, as well as many bar and restaurant options to select from.

A must to visitors. Great place has a little or a lot of everything, shops, restaurants, entertainment, cafés, something for all ages it really comes to life in the evenings with street entertainers suitable for children and adults shops remain open till late the Mall is huge, the Food Mart is a great interesting place to visit during lunchtime also the Water Shed which houses the indoor market
Excellent place to chill. Nice place for relaxing evening. Great eating and drinking places. You can find budget as well as upmarket restaurants.

Holiday. What a great place to eat, shop and enjoy. We have just returned from a week in Cape town and were fortunate to be able to walk to the V&A most evening for our meals.This place was buzzing and energetic. we felt relaxed and safe all the time we were here.Ate at Karibu, City Grill Steakhouse, Ferryman's and Cape Town Fish Market. Also had drinks at Quay Four.

Wonderful area.. The waterfront has so much choice of places to eat it is hard to make a decision!! The shops are amazing (and there are so many). It is easy to get lost inside the shopping centres as they are so vast but there are also smaller shops on the outside with locally made goods. There is even a play area for the kids. A fab place to spend a few hours.
A must visit in Cape Town. As stated in title this is a must visit when in the Cape Town area. Great views, shopping and dining. Just a fun place to visit. we went three times during our short stay.

Good variety. Shopping mall, indoor flea markets, indoor food market, titanic expo, boat rides, big wheel, pubs, restaurants, harbor view, mountain view. Perfect if you want lots to do in one place. Probably a must see at least one

Where to go and be seen!. Great shopping centre with some fab restaurants, by UK standards very cheap, we particularly liked the Bais Restaurant - 3 course meal for 3 with aperitifs, and bottle of quality wine less than £65 - fantastic view of the mountain. For a quick lunch try the food in the Watershed small little vendors great quality
All in one location. If the weather is not great, then the V&A Waterfront is the perfect place. There is also the market on Saturdays. I love the art movies and sushi at Willoughby's.

My Favorite Cape Town Mall. I've lived in Cape Town for 20 years now & the V&A Waterfront was & still is my all time favorite mall in Cape Town - it is a true destination mall offering everything from high end shopping at Louis Vutton & similar to mundane grocery store shopping at Puck n Pay; restaurants which are open from breakfast through dinner; cinemas; children's play areas; the Cape Town Wheel etc......yes indeed, there is only 1 V&A Waterfront

Recommended for dinner and walking around. Beautiful area and very pleasant to walk around. Lots of shops and restaurants. We enjoyed this area on a sunny afternoon just sitting outside and enjoying a cold drink.

Perfect location!. We spent 4 nights and wished we could have extended our stay for a couple days more, just to enjoy the surroundings without rushing around with full days of sightseeing. We had two well equipped, comfortable apartments. I would stay here again for sure.

Lovely place for a stroll. The waterfront is a great place for a nice stroll, good dining, shopping etc. Everything one looks for at a harbour area is there. Also, it is a very safe area in the evenings.
Shopping at the V&A. Great shopping and terrific restaurants. On the water where you can have a snack or lunch and watch the seals frolic in the bay. Wonderful place to walk, shop, eat or just relax.

A place for your whole day fun, dining and shopping experience.. Had a great time shopping there.
So many shops!
Live African music playing on the streets kept us entertained for few hours.
Easily assessable and safe.

This area has it all!. Great shopping, Great restaurants, access to fun Cape Town Attractions, lots of people watching, authentic African Craft Market, Aquarium, ferris wheel.....what more could you want!

Nice place to hang out and people watch. Lots of trendy shops, restaurant choices, street entertainers and a fun and safe feeling place to stroll about. There was a central stage where some break dancers were performing and seemingly it is used to entertain visitors regularly.

Waterfront good place to start.. Visited the waterfront as we were waiting to go to Robben Island. Interesting clock tower, harbor master house, dry dock and water craft. Places to sit and have drinks, snacks or dinner. Spent more time and had dinner after we came back from the Robben Island tour and walked through shops. Most shops were not unique to Cape Town or African and had national or international branding. Could shop them on the internet or in home country if a visitor. The history and crowds make it a fun stop and things to see while waiting for the ferry.
Lunch venue. Great place to view Table Mountain and some excellently prices restaurants. Easy walk from Central Cape Town

A US type Waterfront. An excellent place to spend time. In addition to the Ronne Island Museum & Ferry location, there are many restaurants, fast food gallery, arts & crafts mall, typical USA mall with the same stores as any US Mall. I do recommend you spend some time here.
everything you need. Wonderful shops and restaurant that cater to all tastes. enough things to see and do for a full day.
Holiday vibe. Love going to the Waterfront. So much to do and see. I always leave in a great mood. Fantastic part of Cape Town.
Bustling!. So much to see and do. The Waterfront has really great vibe with lots of restaurants but it tends to be a bit pricy.

Touristy yet with some cultural flare. If you are not from South Africa, I think this is a great spot to ease yourself into Cape Town culture. This is a really touristy spot. The mall is great if you need to make any purchases and the restaurants also provide a safe bet for dining. I never had any bad dining experiences on the waterfront. There is usually music and in general, its a nice spot if you are with your family or you need to kill some time.

A whole place in itself. It was wintertime and this place was very near to our hostel. So we gave it a shot first thing. And we gave it a shot the rest of our days too. The waterfront has everything you can possibly imagine. Cafes,restaurants, yachts at the quay, music, mall, calm riverside seating places where you can enjoy the view and a cup of coffee, and it even has a giant wheel to finish the list. Maybe it was all.in my head but I felt very strongly for this place coz it is buzzing with activity yet there is a beautiful serenity..and at sundown this place just transforms into a lively arena with all bars playing music and broadcasting football. My best memory is sitting in a cafe with hot white chocolate in hand taking in the wintry rain and the chilly wind outside . I still miss this place and wish i could just go back and spend a few quiet minutes in the river breeze...my word all you folks will definitely secind my opinion. ☺☺

Over Rated. Although the V & A have beautuful views of Table Mountain it is rather over rated and mostly expensive. You can find much better things to see and do in Cape Town than to spend it walking around the V & A Waterfront.

Everything you need for a nice day. You can spend a whole day at the Waterfront. It is really nice! There are plenty of restaurants, shops and things to see here. A must see if you are visiting Cape Town.
Walk this Boulevard!. Good restaurant, high quality shops, maybe a trip to Robben Isle, good place for lunch and dinner or to ship in on one of thse yachts

A very bussy and buzzy place. Here you can meet and greet to your hearts content the gathering of locals and visitors in their hundreds. You like crowds and people don't miss out or the stroll with all the shops and restaurants a real buzz. Do go on the Ferris wheel we did it at night the harbor comes alive.

Wow - what a place!. Forget all the warnings you may have heard about South Africa from people who probably haven't been within 1,000 miles of the place. Cape Town, for instance, is a wonderful place that's as safe as houses - and the waterfront is magical. The views are awesome, eating and drinking out is more than half the price it is in the UK, and the locals are so warm and friendly. We stayed at the West Quay apartments for five days in sheer luxury, ate out in similar style for next to nothing. Give Cape Town a go. Honest, you won't regretb it.
ADD TO ROBBEN ISLAND TOUR DAY. Stores, restaurants and more. Great shopping, great choice. History, great food, but very busy. Parking can be an issue

Shop and eat till you drop!. They had a huge mall with all of your commercial stores, a place called the watershed that had small boutiques shops, and along the waterfront there were small buildings with different stores and boutiques that was selling a lot of touristy african goods as well. Along the waterfront there were nice views of boats and restaurants lined up along the water.

Beautiful Waterfront, Great Shopping. Tons of Shops, restaurants, a mall and things to do including a comedy club, the Robbens Island Museum, street performers and more! Prices are great at the African Market.

Sites, Shopping, & Food Galore! . Great place to beat the heat and grab a bite to eat... oh, and pick up that new outfit I wanted. Lots of history here as well, plenty to see and do for an afternoon. If you're close it's not a bad walk, and if you forgot anything on your trip in sure you'll find it here.

Fish in and out of Water. Fresh fish abound here as do live ones in the Aquarium. Many shops, restaurants and pubs to choose from. Some areas smell like, uh, dead fish but hey, that's part of the charm. The old prison turned hotel, the pump house now shops and such, ships in dry dock being refurbished, yachts and tour boats are all there to see.
Shopping heaven!. This place is where everything happens, where all the shopping, where all the mix of cultures, and where you will have an amazing time!

Great find for food and shopping. Pleasant surprise and the quality and number of retailers and restaurants. Food was great. The shopping was easy and we even took a spin on the ferris wheel. Cool spot.

Very touristy. Most visitors to Cape Town come here one way or another. It is a big shopping mall on the water front and really does not reflect Cape Town itself. Good for the start & finish of the hop on/hop off bus which I would highly recommend.

Bustling shopping and sightseeing area. This is the epicenter of tourism in central Cape Town. Lots of restaurants and shops along the water, including water excursions and the ferry to Robben Island. Many bus tours originate here as well. Fun for people-watching, too.

One has to have been there. Some nice shopping there. Everything made in Africa can be found in a large three storey shop at the waterfront. Less expensive shopping for handicraft and other things can be done in the Water Shed

Awesome Views, But Otherwise.... The waterfront is a good launching point for sightseeing tours and a first visit to Cape Town; it also offers beautiful views of the ocean, city skyline and mountains. But unless you're into touristy schtick and malls, there isn't much else to do here beyond grab a bite to eat.

A quality etensive shopping and entertainment center. You will be pleasantly surprised at the extensive number of quality stores and good available and tempted over and over by the number of fun and interesting restaurants and public facilities. The three story building is nicely designed with now beautiful Holiday decorations Best of all, with the value of the dollar at 14 Rand,, prices are very reasonable. The Vitoria & Alfred Waterfront is worth a visit, even if you don't need to purchase anything and a must visit if you do.

Safe Place to Start; Don't Get Trapped Here. Without a doubt the V&A Waterfront is a great location with ample shopping, dining, and entertainment. It's a family friendly venue to boot (well attended, ample security, etc.).That being said, there are a number of worthwhile venues around the city for dining, shopping, and entertainment (many within walking distance of the V&A). Cape Quarter is a great example. It's small but much less congested. You can sit for a coffee or eat and it houses a well stocked Spar market for all your needs.There are thousands of reviews for the Waterfront many with helpful tips or advice. My recommendation is enjoy the Waterfront but don't trap yourself there. It's easy to do.

Mixture of Activity. This area has nightlife, restaurants, shopping, museums. There is quite a lot to do here. An abundant amount of choices for dining. Many water activitities. Small independent shops as well as a large indoor mall. There are museums, an aquarium and the Robben Island museum. This is where you board the ferry to Robben island. There is a Ferris Wheel as well. There are street performers. Very busy place. Most places open until 9 pm everyday. Never felt unsafe, even walking away from the waterfront.

Interesting place. There is a lot to see on and around the waterfront. A massive shopping mall but also a number of historic buildings. Plenty of restaurants to suit all tastes. A variety of small traders and craft stalls in Shed 17.

The best cosmopolitan place in South Africa. What ever you are looking for or you have to do: everything is possible at the Waterfront. Shopping, eating, sun downing (with a nice sip....), banking, hairdressing, posting, just relaxing, meeting friends and other people etc. Short walks, immense parking areas, bus stops, taxis always available and nice people everywhere. Attractive boat trips are always possible. Helpful security officers. Of course there are tourist around the whole year. Between the seasons it's more quiet but as locals we like this time always. We are there every week.
nice area for restaurants and cafes. you can always find a restaurant or a cafe to spend some time there while in cape town. A nice place.

Great place to shop, eat & spend the day. This is so much to do here. You can shop, eat, watch various artists perform, book a boat cruise, go to the Aquarium and ride the Eye. It's simply the place to visit while in Cape Town!
Fun shopping district. Lots of nice shops and a variety of restaurants. Very pleasant area to walk around, see the harbor, and views of the mountains.
A great buzz. Lots of shopping outlets, restaurants and bars in a lovely old dock setting, and easy to get to. Stays open well into the evening.
Fun for all!. Great food, activities, attractions, banks, artist, sidewalk entertainers, shopping and general entertainment.
Very touristic but nice to visit for a day. Very crowded but nice to visit for a day! I love the live music, street artists. Also nice place to a lot of souvernirs.

Perfect for everyone . What more can be said about the Waterfront - a selection of restaurants, views and shopping that rivals and beats many venues across the globe. It caters for families, couples, business people, people who just want to have fun ( sorry Cyndi Lauper) - well everyone. I am here now, done my shopping and having a bite at a new restaurant ( Dalliance ) with the perfect view over the sea towards Blouberg Strand, clear blue skies .... Spend a day or two .... Or three

Eat, drink and cruise! The real centre of Cape Town.. Make sure you have lunch, dinner and cruise around the V&A Waterfront, oh and shop too! There is heaps to do there and its a pretty place, so don't miss it!
Good spot for tourism. Lots of food, shopping and tourism. Upload find local goods and trendy stores. After walking the local streets and attempted pickpockets, we felt safer here.

Nice place to hangout. This place gives options of shopping at Malls, do boat riding, helicopter riding, buy souvenirs or just walk at Waterfront. They have a giant wheel too (which is very different and smaller than London eye or Singapore flyer)! This place offers something or the other to everyone, people of all ages can enjoy here.

Great Tourist Place. Lots to do and see. Shopping malls, outside strolling past street entertainment, lots of restaurants of all venues, (don't forget the great South African Wines), great views of the harbour, table mountain and the sea. People watching, Great for lunch or dinner. We went over two evenings for dinner. The outdoor patios were great and they had animal print blankets for the customers and electric heaters if the evenings got too cool if one wanted to sit outside. There was even a old war museum there that we had to seek out that had been excavated. It was near the 'clock'. Could also rent boat rides. A pleasant waterfront experience. It was not far from the Big Bus (Hop on Hop off) and also the point where one got the ferry boat to Robben Island. A must visit while in Capetown.
If crowds are your thing?. Soo many people, shoulder to shoulder at times. A wide variety of shops all competing for your money.

A hive of activity - day or night. We were staying at Table Top Hotel which has direct access to one of the Waterfront area's excellent malls and to all the attractions the area has to offer including some great restaurants. The whole area is buzzing day and night and there is something for everyone. A mecca for locals and tourists alike. Highly recommended for several hours' visit.

Great place to hang out and shop. This is the place that people come to to hang out in Cape Town. There are all sorts of interesting restaurants, a high end mall and a great craft building on the site. As well there are street performers in the area. When we were in Cape Town we went down to the Waterfront each night.

Loved the street musicians!. Even though we were jet-lagged, the walk to the V&A Waterfront was made more enjoyable by the numerous street musicians, dancers and singers. Many choices of restaurants, shops, and just people watching. There is a huge mall, of course, but the separate market with its many stalls, etc. was much more interesting.
Honeymoon trip. Great area to explore and shop. Tons of great restaurants and lots to see and do. Access to Robben Island.
Safe en relaxing. A few big shopping malls and a lot of restaurants. You can book manny excursions from the Waterfront. We did a helicopter tour and we also went to Robben Island.

Expected more. The setting is amazing. The views gorgeous but the prices of goods on offer are ridiculous. They are geared towards those travelling on the GBP or USD or EUR, def not on the ZAR! The Shed at the Waterfront is touted to be a craft market. What a joke. It is more like boutique shopping with the prices to match. There are much better goods and a far larger variety of items available at some of the local craft markets. I will definately not be shopping here again in a hurry.

LIVELY, COLORFUL, FUN!. It is almost impossible to imagine NOT having a good time at this lively waterfront
complex! There is so much to see and do: boat rentals of many kinds, lots of restaurants, a beautiful mall, roaming musicians, even a ferris wheel!
shops shops and more shops. With the exchange rate favorable to the British Pound it means you can buy some things cheaper than in the UK

Lovely and very interesting . This was a lovely experience and we spent 4 hours discovering this diverse area full of shops restaurants and the many interesting attractions. Although it rained a bit we managed to see quite a bit indoors or under covers. If we had more time we could have seen a lot more.

Vibrant Waterfront Culture. Lots of shops, restaurants etc in modern surroundings around the harbour and all overlooked by Table Mountain. We ate in an Italian and watched the sun go down over the mountain. You get boats to Robben Island from here.

Lots of things gloing on here.. You could easily do 2 days wandering around the V & A. There are lots of little craft places, all very unique and not expensive. The food is good too, interesting food and extremely varied. The restaurants in the evening are all excellent. We never had a bad meal in Cape Town. If you are a shopper there is also a mall here with all your usual fast food places to eat. Usual shopping like H & M etc. in the mall. Lovely at night all illuminated .We never drove at night as you are advised not to. But taxis are dirt cheap and all the taxi drivers were lovely. The restaurants are very accommodating and will phone a taxi for you. . .

A Vibrant Tourist Area. Apparently, this is the most visited site in Africa and I can believe it because on the 3 occasions we visited the place was packed.There's plenty to do here. Large shopping mall, numerous boutique shops, accommodation, bars, restaurants, the obligatory ferris-wheel, harbour cruises, aquarium, Watershed market and Merimba bands.Easy to fill in a day if you so wish.

Massive shopping malls in middle of greatness. I was really disappointed with the waterfront. I was expecting a laid back, art scene instead found it to be just building after building of shops. There are some local ones mixed in (mainly near aquarium) but it felt so commercialized. If you don't have a lot of time, I would give it a miss! There are much better restaurants and small shops in the water kant!

Commercial but fun. V&A Waterfront is full of restaurants of all types, main high street stores and boutiques (yet commercial). It's full of tourists (like me), and locals is very safe and has a fair amount of attractions. It's pretty when lit up at night and in many locations has "touristy" entertainment, think Covent Garden entertainers. You can access it either via a shuttle from your hotel, taxi or your own car (there is lots of parking). I have nothing bad to say about V&A, it a commercial retail and eating hub (H&M, Zara, etc). Well worth at least one visit. But not authentic SA.
A must do while in Cape Town!. Beautiful old port in Cape Town. It is a mix of a shopping mall, a food court and just a calming place to walk around and look at yachts .
Heart of Cape Town. The hub for entertainment, food, fashion, culture, the works. Definitely a must to visit when you in Cape Town

Atmospheric. There is always something happening.. We stayed a short walk from the V&A. It is full of restaurants, trips, shops, markets, street artists and other things to do. It's lovely just to meander around and soak up the local characters, smells, noises and vibrant atmosphere. It is very safe, at no time did we feel anything but friendliness, happiness and good humour.

Nothing to special. Nothing more than a big shopping centre at a cool location. Loads if big name brand store all eager to take your money and all the normal fast food take out joints. Out of the shopping centre lots to see of local hapeenings and more shop. Bring comfortable shoes and walk about is the easiest way to get in and around the area.

Neat, but.... It was a nice place, very clean, etc, etc, but honestly it's just another mall. You should check it out if your there, but I personally didn't find it to be anything special. The views outside were great though! It's probably one of the better spots to view Table Mountain as a whole.

Novelty mall in an undeniably beautiful location. To some extent a mall is a mall is a mall, but the V & A is special because of its setting. It's nice to be able to walk outside between sections, and it the mall itself is a cut above any others I know of, aesthetically. Plenty of stores, restaurants, bars etc. Many of them seem to survive on the good reputation of the mall rather than their own quality, but if you know where to go you can shop and eat well.

Beautiful Tourist Attraction! Not to be missed!. This wonderful waterfront is a must to see while in Cape Town. Yes, it is very touristy but it is wonderful! There are many many restaurants and food places to try and many many shopping areas to venture off to! It is a great place to spend the entire day for solo travelers, families and even couples. Take your time and explore this wonderful area and eat!!!
Great atmosphere. Loved it! Loved the atmosphere and the vibe... Enjoyed the evening strolls from our hotel to the waterfront.

Worth a walk around. Shops, restaurants, cafes and attractions all in one place. We hopped off the tour bus here for an hour or so walking around. There's a really nice atmosphere here with street performers and a buzz of tourists and locals all enjoying the harbour, shops and views. The shopping is both touristy and a proper mall with a hamleys and Hennes. Well worth a visit

Amazing position.Buzy vibe.... The V&A Waterfront is a must visit. However I missed Bertie's landing [From 20 years ago] and his style of Fish and Chips. The restaurants were mostly chains or expensive. I would have liked more individual style eating places. Loved the food Hall

Tourist trap but well done. This is simply one of the things in Cape Town that you simply cannot afford not to do. This is a very good example about an old industrial site that was renovated for present day's taste. One of these places that cheer you up.

Visited by locals and tourists alike - for a very good reason. The Waterfront has developed into a major tourist attraction with a endless variety of shops. However not only the tourists come to shop here but many locals as well because they like the atmosphere and hubbub of the area. The harbour is dotted with boats of every description and the screams of seagulls gives it that 'fisherman's wharf' feeling.Allow yourself at least half a day to do the waterfront justice. Parking is plentiful and cheap.There are many places to eat but be aware that some of the restaurants charge more than they should being in a tourist area. Be selective.

So many options . It wasn't the marvel I have been told but still one of the best places in Africa. A huge place by the sea with everything you can ask for. Great view, safe, many many options for recreation and shopping.

Obviously aimed at tourists!. This area of Cape Town has been renovated and even though the docks are still in use it has a touristy, up-market feel. Many of the restaurants are good, especially the Harbour House and the food market sells locally made food and drink. They have local dance and music acts playing during the day and there are all the shops you could possible want. I didn't feel it was such a 'local' experience as eating in the town it's self but it obviously caters for what tourists want.

Lovely spot to explore, hang out, etc.. So much to do here- a real hub of activity with shops, restaurants, the launching point for tours to Robben Island. I felt very safe here and enjoyed simply walking around, absorbing the views and people-watching. A great way to pass a few hours.

Great place to spend a few hours. This is a great place to spend a few hours, even if you don't like shopping! Some great places to eat, ranging from food stalls to restaurants. Fantastic range of shops with something for everyone from budget to top end. Boat trips around the harbour availble. Very pleasant environment.

Worth a visit. Nothing really spectacular about it with the exception of the views of Table Mountain in the background.Simply another waterfront that as been nicely fixed up.Yes it is a nice place to go do some shopping and have a few drinks, however there are many places that are better in Cape Town.

tourist hotspot. caught cab as it was late afternoon into night and was recommended. Once there it was quite packed but not overcrowded. We had a good meal while overlooking the harbour and watching people go about there business. A nice experience overall.

A must-see for first-time visitors. This is a great area for an initial visit to Cape Town, you can see Table Mountain and there is a lot to see and do-especially shopping and lots of restaurants. After we have come back to Cape Town, we have realized that there are many other places to eat and shop that aren't so crowded and touristy, so keep that in mind if you have time to explore.

The Hot Spot in Cape Town!!. The V&A Waterfront area of Cape Town is the perfect place to relax with a cold beverage and people watch or "shop till you drop". There is a large mall with everything from groceries and shoes to hikeing shorts and gutairs...There are resturants, food barns , and the Water Shed where local artisans show their wares. And in the center of it there all, is a magnificent Ferris Wheel, an amphitheater where bands play African music, and a large kids play area.There also is an area to sign up for any tour you might to take in. Helicopter rides, sand boarding, shark dives, zip lines, mountain tops, wineries and more ...Recommend a visit to this wonderful spot.

Great shops, vibrant atmosphere, variety of restaurants. There's a great selection of shops here with some individual shops selling original items instead of chain stores that you can find any day in the UK. Great selection of restaurants and cafes, and there's always great live music playing. The huge Christmas tree was amazing.

A Mecca in its own way. I really did not know what I would get at the V&A Waterfront until I got there. The view of the port as you eat your pizza at the Meloncino Restaurant is something you rarely get anywhere else in the world. The replica of the London Eye and the shopping mall make this place an ideal place to visit

Very Big Shopping Centre. THis is a very large shopping mall spread over 3 floors hundreds of shops, .bars ,restaurants, very busy. Here you can get a boat trip round the harbour and see the seals which laze about in the bay. Some of the shops are very expensive the main tip is if they dont show the price in the window be prepared for high prices when you go in but over all its a day out and like most other malls in the world you can easily spend the whole day there.

Quaint charming & full of character. Vibrant and busy location surrounded by some fabulous hotels with a stunning view of Table Mountain. There are so many touristy things to do around the bay from shopping in the souvenir shops cape Union mart has some great items & there are a number of well placed stalls selling their wares. There are enough restaurants to suit all tastes and you can't get away without buying a few excursions offered by very creative marketing from 90 mins tours around the bay on boats ranging from speed yatches & of course adventures on the Jolly Roger- u need to take the sunset cruise also on offer are helicopter flights around Cape Town starting from R800-1000 (£40) a personThere is a amphitheater that has all sorts of performances from marimba players dancers etc
They got it right. An engaging high end shopping experience in excellent facilities.The Fish Market Restaurant was a highlight for lunch
Quite bland. Fairly bland, corporate development. Lots of sterile restaurants and a shopping centre. Not too appealing for us
Love the place. Probably the most cosmopolitan area in South Africa, always busy, lost of food and shopping choices, can be colder than you expect!.
Lots of shopping and dining. Pretty cool area with different types of shopping and dinning. Bigger than we were expected so leave lots of time to see everything if you are shopping.

Everrything's here. You can do everything here. There is a huge shopping center where you can find loads of shops and restaurants, and you can also have a nice walk around the wharf. The ferris wheel here is smaller than those in other places, but it goes around 4~5 times and faster than others.

A Must do in Cape Town !. The V & A Waterfront is a Must Do when visiting Cape Town. Situated in the heart of Cape Town's working harbour with the dramatic backdrop of Table Mountain & the Harbour. Its a striking & interesting place to visit. Heaps of tours operate from the Waterfront so its the place to go if wanting to explore Cape Town. The V&A Waterfront is also home to some of Cape Town's best cafes & restaurants. Its a difficult decision to decide on which one to eat at ! There are also an array of over 450 very interesting shops from the normal tourist shops to Art Galleries & original South African designer boutique & international brands. A large supermarket & ATM's are also available. We enjoyed strolling through The Watershed with over 300 brands from ceramics and furniture to textiles, fashion and jewellery.
Busy, busy,busy.. Lots going on down here with entertainment loads of varied places to eat and shop till you drop. It can get very busy so be prepared

Too hipster/hickster for the craft area. Bring back the Red Shed. I was so disappointed that the Red Shed is no longer. The new craft place has a lot of the same stalls, but I feel the food "shed" is a bit hipsterfied which is a huge turn-off for me. Better directions in the mall would be great as I spent ages going round and round looking for specific shops. A paper map would help to avoid this.

Lovely, plenty to do, and very safe. Lots of shops and plenty of places to eat. I particularly liked Karibu - a South African restaurant with delicious food at a very reasonable price.
The harbour is beautiful at night, and it's also completely safe to walk around after dark (something I was very conscious of as I was traveling alone).
Meh! good view, but who wants to shop on vacation????. Beautiful views...that's the best thing I can say. Tourist trap with lots of animal skins in shops:( very sad ):.

shop, eat, repeat!. I was here 3 days of the five we were staying in cape town. Lively and chilled vibe. It is one of the must see attractions of cape town with all the top brands making their presence felt here.

Fun. A great place to go for fun and school outings. There are boat rides, shops, restraints. If you go there you should go to the aquarium,the boat ride and go for high tea at the cape grace hotel. It is a really good place to have fun and a really great time for adults and children. You should not go around Christmas though. In Christmastime it is really full all over

Open air shopping center. Once in Cape Town you probably won't escape from one (or several) visits to the Waterfront. There you will find restaurants, shops. the Two Oceans Aquarium, supermarkets, food market and shops of souvenirs and a mall as others around the world. Nice place, filled with tourists on a renovated harbour. You can book boat trips, helicopter and all tourist attractions over the city. Great for food eating.
Ok but a bit over rated. went a couple of times but very busy and very over the top, its not the Real Cape Town but if thats your bag its well worth a visit

An interesting area. We spent a morning walking around the waterfront which has a great variety of shops including some excellent ones featuring ethnic African products, all in an attractive setting. A variety of food and drink outlets to suit all tastes.

Shop, eat and relax in style. The Waterfront is one of the "must-see" attractions of the Cape. If you like to relax and enjoy attractions, there are numerous areas to sit and sip a drink, people-watch or take in views of the Mother City from the Wheel. If you like shopping, the mall gives you high-end options with department stores (Woolworths), clothes and shoes (H&M, Zara, Aldo), and cosmetics (MAC, Crabtree & Evelyn) while more affordably priced craft is available at the Watershed. If you're a foodie, get ready for the widest variety of cuisine. From Tunisian, to South African, to Asian, Italian, whatever you're craving you'll find it there. I recommend the Food Market which has many mini restaurants serving dishes as diverse as empanadas, specialty cheeses, dim sum, baclava, Cape malay chicken wraps and German pastries. All of this at an affordable price, mind you. Another great choice is the Fishmarket Restaurant for seafood.Or you could just take a walk through and enjoy the ambience, enjoy the Cape sunsets!

Tourism, Shopping and Eats. When booking accommodation, make sure it is close to the V&A because you'll find that you're there every day, anyway. From unique shopping experiences and food markets to live music and a Ferris wheel, this is the place to be.

Great walking, shopping, eating and drinking. We came to the waterfront two out of the three days we were here jus because there was a lot to do. Make sure you go through the market because it's like a farmer's market under roof. SO many different kinds of food from SO many different countries and tastes. The chocolatier was awesome. There is also a spot where a marimba band plays all day. We sat at a sidewalk cafe and had a martini while we watched an entire set. We were lucky to see the clippers of the clipper round the world race but I wouldn't be surprised if there isn't always something going on there. you can also book private charters for fishing, exploring, whale watching, etc right there. This is a definite place to go to walk around and grab something small or a full meal to eat.
Fabulous for night and day. A bustling experience for night and day. Safe feeling as well and so tidy and clean with great little shops and restaurants.

Very Relaxing. There is so much to do here. You could spend the whole day here if you wanted. It is also a launch pad for excursions too
.

Everything under one roof!. On our first day in Cape Town we visited the V&A Waterfront. We were pleasantly surprised at how much there was to do there - some great shops and restaurants, museums, buskers, bands, views of Table Mountain and a visit to the Springbok rugby museum. You could easily spend a day or an evening there without getting bored.

A mall to enjoy. Cape Town's renovated harbour area which contains huge mall space. The imported brands appear to be at least as expensive as anywhere else in the world, but the local things are an amazing bargain.

Great Place. This is a safe area to walk around day or night, it is a tourist place yest, but there is always something going on. There are plenty of shops and restaurants and the ferry leaves from the waterfront to Robben Island. If you look carefully there are two resident seals that love to entertain. There is also South Africa's version of the London Eye a good view of the area.

V & A in Capetown. This is a great shopping area with lots to see and do. Good restaurants nearby and interesting sights in the adjacent harbor. Can get some more authentic keepsakes in outlying areas rather than this upscale area.

Like San Francisco's Pier 39 on steroids... but more more affordable. You're on a trip halfway around the world, do you really want to spend time someplace that isn't that much removed from a fancy waterfront development back home? Truth is, this is a very friendly place, many, many restaurants with excellent food and reasonable prices, places you can get souvenirs, and very, very safe. I felt guilty spending much time here at first, but it grows on you, quickly.Also, there is a large (actually huge) Pick N Pay grocery store on the lower level of the mall-type building. Anything you might need, you can probably get there. Website says it's open 8am-10pm.

Great place! It offers a good walk, a variety of restaurants and shops, much music and wonderful location.l. We had the opportunity to spend three hours here and wish we'd had longer. Of course the weather was terrific so being outside listening to a variety of local singing groups as we walked by, was perfect and we felt very comfortable and safe.There is a tremendous variety of stores, both chain stores and local boutiques with goods at every price point. Enjoy!

World Class!. Shopping, Restaurants, Excursions, whatever you are looking for, the V&A Waterfront has it. A historical centre which is build around the dry docks, the energy in this vibrant site in infectious...

Whatever the weather, whatever your needs!!!. If you want to do this properly allow a total of two days over a period that you are on Cape Town. Whatever your needs, it is here and yes the £ vs SA Rand is very advantageous at he moment so plenty of opportunities to spend on clothes, jewellery, watches, gifts etc. Food, whatever you fancy, from local to international and exhibitions, aquarium, Springboks and a very useful Information Centre near Mitchell's Brewery / bar. Research all the harbour trips etc before you leave and definitely use the hop on bus which is based near the aquarium. Best bet, get the two day tour which will include a harbour trip and a evening trip to sunset at Signal Hill.

Nice place not the best of sights in capetown! . This place is overestimated!
Apart from the fact that there is a shopping mall and many restaurants there is nothing else to do
High priced shops and medium food since what the restaurants shel is the view and not the quality in general terms.

Fun, fun, fun at Victoria and Albert. This was only a ten minute walk from our hotel, but it was a great place to come for meals and SA wine. There were pockets of live music, artisans stalls and restaurants. There's plenty of shopping outlets in the V and A mall as well as a supermarket underground. The supermarket was perfect as we were staying in a self contained apartment. From V and A, you can take the hop on hop off sightseeing bus, ride on a boat cruise or take a short helicopter ride.

Everything you need to refresh before or after gritty Africa.. You can't knock the Waterfront. All the shopping you want, all the food and cuisines you want, plus magnificent views of Tabl Pe Mountain and the sea. The harbour of course provides all those other activities that people, might want: diving, fishing, water tours, helicopter rides, trips to Robben Island. One thing I would say - this is not Africa, though it has the flavour, with buskers in the form of singers and performers. But then Cape Town is more European/Mediterranean in her outlook, a great place to refresh after nitty gritty Africa, or prepare before. Bit I still love old Cape Dutch Cape Town on Long Street. Don't neglect to visit the real thing.

Great Hub Area with Restaurants and Shopping. While in Cape Town-a must see area. Very alive with international travelers, shops, and restaurants. There is even a grocery store very well stocked especially with SA wines and a person dedicated to that area to assist with purchases. Local musicians added quite a beat to your step.Highly recommend.

Lively & fun. This was much better than I was expecting. Not a tourist rip off at all. Lots of good restaurants with very good food and prices.And for buying souvenirs - this was better prices, and much less hassle than the market stalls at Green Square.Lots of activity, lovely water views, friendly people, felt safe

It's a big, waterfront shopping center. Just like a shopping mall anywhere, but with table mountain as a backdrop! A series of buildings, nicely done crammed with all the normal stores.quite a few restaurants and bistros, you also have the Robben Island museum which to be honest is free but not much to see, plenty of parking available.
