See the seal sitting in the huge tire. We took a harbour tour & saw seals sitting in these huge tires hanging on the side to protect the dock walls from boats. There's good shopping & it's just a nice place to walk around in.

Tourist Hotspot. The V & A waterfront is a wonderful spot with lots to do. From shopping to boat cruises to helicopter rides, there really is something for everyone. My favourite part had to be the food market with its range of diverse cuisines in a very hipster setting. The mall itself is much like the other big malls in South Africa with a range of stores, both chain and individual. The V & A waterfront is also home to the ferry Port from where ferrys take visitors to Robben Island.
Perfect for an eveing. Great and very safe bit of town to stroll around in, do some shopping or enjoy a meal down by the water. Plenty of security guys and the taxi ranks are also managed.
Great Fun. The waterfront contains lots of restaurants and shops, as well as an aquarium. We just love it. Shopping for art and souvenirs is just fun and the prices are very reasonable.

Tourist Attraction. The V&A is set up to cater for tourists. Elaborate and overly expensive restaurants and stores for the most part. One is spoilt for choice when it comes to designer labels and exquisite food. See the waterfront from the air when you go on a ride on the Wheel of experience; go on a boat cruise or maybe a helicopter flip around the peninsula. There are lots of other attractions within walking distance. The waterfront is normally abuzz with talented locals singing, dancing and entertaining

Where it all happens. Although not yet complete this is a great regeneration of an old port area. Bars, cafes and restaurants abound and there are more shops of all varieties than most major cities. And a few museums thrown in
Always something new. The V&A is constantly changing. Every time I go there is something new to see. There are now international shops such as Hamleys.

Wonderful mix of the old & new at the famous Cape Town Waterfront. We had such a good day shopping eating exploring and buying gifts. So much choice. The V&A Waterfront knocked our own Darling Harbour into a cocked hat but don't tell anybody I said so as being a Sydney-sider this is treason!!! Marvellous memories.

Pretty touristy but fun. Like most waterfront areas worldwide, V & A has been developed to within an inch of its life. Hotels, restaurants, cafes, bars, shops and more crowd this area but it's a fun place to wander and people-watch. There is a fun market/eating area where you can purchase an assortment of foods and eat either on the premises or outside on a picnic bench.

Mrs. We had a great time here in Cape Town. The hotel is excellently situated close to everything we wanted to do during our stay. My mum & her husband came with us and loved it.Couldn't believe this was rated as a three star hotel. It deserved more than that. The staff were all friendly and polite. They all looked smartly dressed & had smiles on their faces. It was a relief to me to find there was a lift as stairs would have been a problem on this occasion because my knees & ankles had become very swollen because of rheumatoid arthritis.
Great shopping experience.. This is a good shopping experience. Fantastic restaurants and a great vibe with lots of buskers and great views of Table Mountain.

Something for everyone . I always love coming to the V&A. There are shops for every taste and pocket. Foreigners can feast on the newly opened H&M to Zara to Cucci and LV with the weaker exchange rate. For an alfresco lunch I went to Sevruga and enjoyed some fresh sushi overlooking the working harbour.
A shopper's delight. Wide variety of shops offering most anything one would like from jewelry to clothing and whatever in between. From luxury items to stunning bargains.
The Jewell of Cape Town. Restaurants, markets, music and shops abound. Take a harbor boat tour ( comes with your red bus pass ) and you'll see Cape Seals too.

A full day adventure. This is probably the best spot to entertain the whole family . Whether you are shopping, sightseeing or dining you will not be disappointed . The shopping caters from very affordable to exclusive designer labels . If you are hungry you can go McDonalds or dine in style at Servuga. As for entertainment , you can watch a movie; take a trip to Robben Islamd; take a sunset cruise; drop in at the aquarium; take a walk ; watch the free live entertainment. The options are endless .

Shopping is excellent, and views are amazing!. The shopping area at Victoria & Alfred Waterfront is excellent! I found a gold coin with a beautiful gazelle on it here. In the distance, you can see Lion's head and Table mountain.

V&A Waterfront ....... beautiful. It's a very nice place to walk, go to restaurants and shopping center. It's a clean and safe place, with thousands os tourists. One of the best places of Cape Town to visit.
Lovely safe place. This is a lovely area especially if the weather is good, there is the ampitheatre and lots of shops and restaurants

Not our favorite.. After hearing all the hype about the V & A Waterfront, we were disappointed. Partly because there is ongoing construction, the views were not that great. It is very congested and, unless you are a devoted shopper, it isn't the best place to hang in Capetown.

Must-do on your holiday!. The waterfront is a fantastic day out for young and old! There are so many activities to keep you busy that one day could not possibly be enough to get the full picture. Choices of restaurants are to everyone's liking and the shopping is really good. It is pretty expensive all around but spending money is a choice and you can have fun without forking out too much. Highly recommended!

Stayed at V & A Hotel. The waterfront was nice because the mall has pick and pay- a grocery store that has EVERYTHING. We were in C town 7 days - the area made it easy with food variety - the food hall was great !

Must visit!. To have the whole Cape Town experience, visiting the waterfront is a must. Lively with street performers, tempting restaurants and great shopping. Skip Long Street which is tacky, and wander about the waterfront. Gift prices are a bit high, but we didn't find anywhere else with the same selection and quality.

Second visit. Last visited 6 years ago at the time of the World Cup and notice the difference in the Waterfront area with the addition of designer shopping and a better choice of restaurants. We ate at Bahia which was excellent.

Brilliant place for day or evening...... We spent about 4 nights of our 5 nights at the restaurants in the V&A. There is so much choice. The area is very clean, plenty of high end and mid range shops, some lovely gift shops and everything seems so cheap. Please go and see when in Cape Town.

Great Atmosphere. Wonderful shops and restaurants. Lots going on. Big marina and dock area. There is also trips to Robben Island. You can hire a helicopter trip flying over the cape with whale watching if you are lucky

awesome vibe, great place to chill!. Abundance of designer stores, amazing restaurants - from fine dining to great quayside cafes, and fun activities to enjoy!!great place to chill, enjoy ice creams and walks, there is also a large Ferris wheel. Robben island cruises and harbour cruises also depart from here. Amazing views of table mountain even with bad cloud cover. Must do for anyone visiting Cape Town!!!

Crowd lovers paradise of noise and activity!. Our visit was made special by the Clipper Ships Race Around the World ships docked in the harbor! We also stayed in the same guest house as one of the crewmen! The Oceans Festival was also going on so there was even more excitement. Upscale shopping, dining, and boats galore!
Family Fun. Excellent place to find something for everyone. Harbor tour was a favorite. The big wheel is also an excellent choice any time.

A local acting like a tourist. We were in Cape Town from the Northern Cape for a few days and decided to be tourists for a day. What a great time we had here. We had bubbly overlooking the boats, went on the wheel and ate at the food market. Good time had by all.

Excellent place. I love the Waterfront. Parking is not a problem and you can do everything here. Shopping, eating, relaxing by looking at the boats in the harbor. We had dinner at Mugg & Bean and even tho there was an event and the place was packed we had no problem ordering food. Service was excellent. Also great that the shops stay open until late so you can have dinner and still shop afterwards.

Shops & Eateries Open Late; Buzzing Atmosphere. There are loads of high end shops as well as Woolies and Pick & Pay and a cinema. Lots of restaurants suiting different budgets and just about your only dining option on a Sunday evening after 9 PM. One a nice day it´s great to walk outside and see the boats, visit Robben Island. The Aquarium is good too.
A must see. Touristy, but pristine. We felt completely at ease strolling from shop to shop to restaurant. It is worth spending half a day here.

A lot of people watching.. There was a lot of fun people watching. This also seems to be one of the main shopping areas in Cape Town and there are many restaurants. I also recommend the Watershed and the building next to it which was small pop-up shops and restaurants to try.

Europes "Villa Moura" Experience. Where do I start? All foods, shop till you drop, and awesome views. Take a ride on one of the catamarans/boats of your choice. Have a blast on an ancient pirate Ship---party galore. Awesome entertainment at almost every corner-- Another MUST for Cape Town

Great place to hangout and do some shopping. There are some great places to eat here. All reasonably priced if you are from Europe or North America. Lots of shopping and there are always people around singing and dancing. You can easily spend a day in this area if you wanted.

Shopping, food, scenery, people watching all in one place. Very much the center of activity in Cape Town for any visitor. There is an actual indoor shopping mall which includes many of the upscale brands you are familiar with along with brands specific to South Africa. Very clean and inviting. Lots of restaurants. Almost any kind of food you can imagine from fast food to fine dining and almost any cuisine. The harbor itself is very beautiful on one side and the majestic vista of Table Mountain in just behind. The Watershed market is right next door which contains authentic, handcrafted local wares too numerous to mention. Do not miss the Waterfront. Maybe more than once to get the full experience.

It's a mall. Everybody seems to love the V & A waterfront which although a genuine working harbour area with many interesting things to see and do - it is also a great big shopping mall. Great buzz and plenty if restaurants.
Nice place to relax.... Nice and safe place to eat, walk, sea tours and shopping.For shopping the prices are a litle higher, but the security and view as a price too...

a great place to eat, stay and people watch. V&A Waterfront is a great place to stay while in South Africa. Cape town is a very cosmopolitan city with much to do and see in the safe areas around the waterfront. Want to shop for fun african gifts? The marketplace is a great place to eat and stuff your bags with goodies for those you left at home.

Must see part of Cape Town. It's gradually expanded over the years and the shops and restaurants have improved in quality. It is a must see part of your visit and the jumping off point for tours of Robben Island, helicopter tours etc. Don't miss the arts and crafts warehouse not far from the clock tower for interesting gifts.
OK. Great place to book your trips, enjoy table's mountain view and look around. Next to the market and waterfront. You will pass trough it... so don't mind to set a date to check in.

A lively and attractive development. There are plenty of good pubs and eating places, with interesting market stalls and a large shopping centre, and street entertainment. A visit to the Waterfront should not be missed.
An absolute must if in Cape Town. Great food, great shopping, great harbour tours, aquarim and special attractions. Something for everyone.

The best in Cape Town!. The V and A Waterfront offers the perfect balance between acccomodation, retail therapy, choice of dining and activities, from boat rides to helicopter rides. You can see why this is the No. 1 tourist destination in South Africa!

Great time at the V&A Waterfront. A modern, safe shopping and dining area centred around the Victoria Basin. Easy and cheap parking. Great range of restaurants. We ate at the Belgian Restaurant, Den Anker. It was superb- both our mains and desserts.Plenty of street entertainment as well.
Great views of Table Mountain and Signal Hill.
Definitely recommend a visit when in Cape Town.

Great holiday hang out. We always stay on the waterfront. Mainly for the great fun friendly vibe. But also it has great shops and Restos. Plus all the touristy stuff like the Wheel. Pirate ship tours. Harbour tours. Sailing. Live music. The whole touristy thing is available. But you can also just eat and shop and chill

Waterfront=funtime. We've been going to the waterfront for years and we always have a good time. So much to do and great entertainment and play areas for the kids. It has a wide variety of restaurants and shops.

A classic tourist place to visit. It's one of those places that are easy to identify as being 'touristy' - Big mall with many shops, many restaurants at different price ranges, well maintained streets, several activities to do, security presence, by the ocean...it has a great views for pictures - towards the ocean & buildings. The view is what attracts me to the waterfront, the other activities don't really.

A MUST do in Cape Town!!!. This world class facility is absolutely awesom!!! Top shops to choose from, FANTASTIC restaurants to choose from, as well as the open air amphitheatre!!! Great all round atmosphere with a brilliant vibe. A MUST do in the Cape Town Wheel, also situated at the Waterfront!!!
Beautiful Afternoon Stroll. It was nice to visit the hustle and bustle of the V&A Waterfront on our visit to Cape Town. There are all sorts shops as well as wonderful restaurants!

Wonderful evening. My wife and i were lucky enough to have an overnight stay in Cape town whilst holidaying in South Africa. We spent a wonderful evening down at the V&A Waterfornt enjoying a superb meal in one of the many Quality Restaurants. The Shopping, Entertainment is excellent and all in a safe and vibrant environment. We will definetly return and stay longer.

No that interesting. We spent a few hours there, but the area is a bit disappointing. Sure, you'll find many shops and boutiques, but nothing really I found really interesting. Very "touristy". The harbor/waterfront is nice, but I wouldn't spend too much time there knowing that there are many other amazing things to do in Cape Town and the surroundings.If you go to Robben Island, you'll have to come there anyway. One or two hours at the Victoria Waterfront was enough for us.

A lively and fun place to be. The atmosphere on the Waterfront is really buzzing. This vibrant area is great, and also safe, to visit both day and night. The shopping malls are enough to satisfy even the most committed shopper, and given the numerous restaurants, there is surely something for everyone. There are lots of beautifully located bars to pass a hour and do some people watching. Boat or helicopter tours are on offer, as well as tours to other attractions around the area. We really enjoyed our time at the Waterfront -there is so much to see and do, it is a destination that needs plenty of time to explore. The huge ferris wheel offers amazing views of Cape Town and the surrounding area.

A smaller (and moire intimate) version of Sydney harbour.. Second time visiting as we enjoyed so much the first time. Geared for the tourist. Extra African touch is local singers and dancers performing and selling their wares. Fantastic. I loved the Fresh Food Market. Everything you could ever want. The local designers market is also wonderful, although not cheap. Huge!! shopping centre to get lost in. More restaurants you can poke a stick at. You'll love it too!!

Always the best. You are not in Capetown if you do not visit V & A. But the parking rates are quite high. If you buy from more that R200 at pick and Pay at least they give you 90 minutes parking for free
Evening Time. Very beautiful place to walk and hang around. The mall has very good shopping options and food outlets.
Plenty of options. Shopping, market, bars restaurants, excursions and hotels. It has everything here. It's a social hub in a harbour setting, and security is very good.

Huge variety of Shopping and Eating. V&A is a little like Disney land for shops and restaurants, Very touristy but quite lovely at the same time. Bustling with people, street entertainers and a lovely marina to sit and watch the world go by. The shopping centre caters for everyone from fashion at low end and designer as well as African Arts and crafts. Worth a visit to the craft market contemporary designs from local artists.

Top quality shopping centre. The V & A Waterfront has everything you could need in a shopping centre. High end shops, supermarkets, department stores, many restaurants, harbour tours, medium range shops etc.
Fun location. Good outlets and shopping, good for people watching and everyone was very welcoming to us vacationers

So Much Choice. So many Coffe Shops, Bars, Restaurants, everybody catered for, and all very reasonably priced. Also, a good Food Court in the main Shopping Centre. You can eat and drink, from Breakfast till way past Party time. Loved the vibe from Mitchells Pub, food good too. Lots, and Lots of shops, and a good market, were you can get bargains, and some of the stall holders will barter with you. FYI - Worth going on the 'Big Wheel' to give you the overall sense of the V & A, Stadium and surrounding areas. Also, take a trip on the Canal for a different view point. I got a Free One Way ticket with my Two Day HOHO Bus Pass
A lot to see. Dont go there if its for a flying visit. There is so much to see, do and eat. You are spoiled for choice.
Loads of variety. We spend nearly a full day at the V&A and had loads of fun, from eating, drinking to visiting the various onsite attractions, good for the family.

GOOD. We were in this hotel during our honeymoon per 4 night. Excellent position, near waterfront (turistic area near the harbor, with pubs and caracteristic shop). room was big , and always clean. Goog restaurant and nice atmosfere. friendly staff.

A pleasant evening stroll. Nice place to walk around in the evening. Interesting shops and displays and the place is buzzing on a Friday evening. The views of the mountain is lovely.
Everything is overpriced however.

A Cape Town must do. An example to the world as to what to do with older wharf areas. Better than Sydney or San Francisco. Restaurants are so reasonably priced by world standards and great quality. Shops of all standards. Must not miss this
never gets old. lots to do. always buzzing wether it be a weekend or weekday, theres always something for everyone. indoor as well as outdoor activities

Great way to spend an afternoon. The waterfront is a variety of experiences. There is the mall shopping centre, that has the usual mall stores. There are little shops that carry manufactured African souvenirs, and there is the watershed that sells home made crafts.There are many eating establishments from high tea, served at the Table Hotel, many mid priced restaurants outside, the food court with fast food chains in the mall and ethnic food kiosks down by the watershed.This is the place where you can arrange and start your tour to Robben Island, take a fishing tour, sunset cruise or helicopter ride.Or you can ride on the Ferris wheel or the small train with your little ones.We were also fortunate enough to be down at the waterfront when the world yacht races were leaving S Africa on their journey to Australia, super interesting.I definitely recommend at least a half day here.
Lots of Activities and Fun. This is the excitement of Capetown. Shops, a Craft Market, great restaurants, giant ferris wheel, music, entertainment and a harbor altogether.

Everything you need and want can be found here. The waterfront is buzzing with people and there is an abundance of shops and restaurants that one can visit and shop from. I would recommend visiting the food market as it gives a nice variety of food to choose from for less then you will have to pay at the restaurants at the water front.

Beautiful waterfront shopping area. This is mostly shopping and restaurants but done in style. There is something for everyone -- high end shopping, trinket shopping, items of all kinds. Good restaurants with a view or just for people watching. The Watershed is full of local crafts. A definite must-go.

Clean and safe. Nice place to go for food and taking the family where you can wander unhindered in a safe environment. I found it a bit touristy personally but not in a tacky way but I guess that's what its geared towards. There are some good craft markets here and food options, a nice place to wander around.
A must see in cape town. Very nice walk and pubs around. Perfect spot to meet. Shopping no so cheap but with good value. I suggest elicop tour
Cape Town shopping mecca. Tremendous shopping inrepurposed warehouse Grocery in basement has everything in Ludington huge wine a d liquor departments. Fine dining at Baia, etc.
Excellent. Much to see and experience, even to just to sit and people watch. Restaurants and many delightful shops.

Large choice of shops, restaurants and bars. Very safe area with plenty of choice! We watched the Rugby World Cup in Quay 4, they had plenty of screens so visibility totally assured, a good atmosphere and good beers. Good choice to watch sport!
great. great fun place with a lot f places to eat and shop and lots to do and see. you can get on the tour buses here as well. many hotels and great harbor her as well...great night life as well

Light lunch . This facility remains the premium shopping centre in SA.
Location is absolutely fabulous.
Backdrop of the mountain. ..priceless.
Parking. ..safe and secure.
Facilities. ..modern and clean.
This facility is the epitome of world class facilities and ranks as one of the top shopping centres in the world. No doubt about that.
An absolute recommendation.
A meeting of remembrance. Hours of tranquil shopping; exploring and savoring life before taking a moment to catch a breath over a spectacular lunch.

O.K. if you like Malls. It's on a waterfront, there are lots of (good) shops, some bars and, erm, that's it I'm afraid. Overlooked by Table Mountain it's a pleasant place to be, but South Africa has lots, lots more.

Wine & Dine & shop till you drop. Good shops
Good Food
But most of all the best atmosphere!
Big wheel gives great views.
For kids the cruise out of harbor on Pirate ship a must do.
Okay I suppose.. A busy place that looks like so many other waterfronts though the food choice is pretty good and you can find decent beer.

Perfect place for a post-flight stroll....... Very clean and well maintained, as you would expect from the #1 tourist spot in South Africa, based on traffic volumes. Wonderful shops of all sizes with lots of selection in restaurants and cafes.

Always a lot of fun. The waterfront is always a great outing for Cape Town. They have many yummy restaurants, shopping (from cheap to boutique) and entertainment going on. The movies are well looked after and the views over the harbour are breath taking. The parking is very expensive so try to park at one of the parking lots adjacent to the waterfront. We parked at the Table Bay and it was alot cheaper than at the waterfront.

Magnetic,pleasant,cinematic(vibrant) safe. first stop on our first day,very exciting lots to do and see, all around you from food,shops, coffee,bar's,the view's table mountain ,the ocean, aquatic centre,harbour, boatsbig wheel,singing and yes dancing in the street . a lot to do cinema , i could go on,best seen by yourselves,very clean, maintenance real up to scratch loads of foodoutlets from fish and chip's(yum yum)to Thai, mickie dees ,steak dinner's etcone word QUALITY..... suit everybody not just one group.
For shopping and dining. Nice views. Plenty of restaurants to choose from: from budget (fast food) to nice dining. Ideal place to do some souvenir shopping.

Dining and Shopping Paradise. Touristy, but a must do!. You won't go hungry. So many restaurants! African, Italian, Asian, the list goes on. Try a different venue each day you are there. We never had a bad meal. There is also a food shed to select lighter fare. Don't miss The Creamery for fantastic ice cream. There are two other Creamery locations in Cape Town as well. So many shops! You will have fun and experience unique shopping opportunities in any of the shopping malls. There is also a craft shed which features unique arts, crafts, etc. Beautiful works including ceramics, jewelry, textiles, paintings, batiks, etc. You cannot go wrong bringing gifts back from this shed. If you like the South African decorated Ostrich Eggs, there are many opportunities to find the perfect egg in several of the shops.

Big and varied tourist area. You can easily spend several hours here. There is so much going on - it is a working port as well. The shopping is high quality with high prices to match. Still you should visit any way. You might see some seals in the bay.

Picturesque but over rated. This is predominantly a series of shopping arcades (expensive on South African standards) set around a harbour with lots of restaurants. It is also the place for the ferry to Robben Island.
Excellent Location, lots to do. Stayed at The Table Bay hotel here. Excellent restaurants, shops, food market. Lots to see and do to please everyone.
Wow Wow. Great place I felt very safe even at night so much going on all the time a Must the shopping is great too

Fabulous Place to Stay. We stayed at the V & A for our final 3 nights in South Africa and feel like we ended our trip in style. We had a view of the water and Table Mountain. The breakfast was sumptuous, the service impeccable, and the room comfortably luxurious. We saw seals swimming in the water outside our room on our last morning! What a wonderful way to end our vacation.
Great for daytime or evening eating, shopping and people watching. Beautiful location for eating, drinking, shopping and watching the world go by. Try going at sunset for dinner it's a must

Place to visit. Waterfront situated at the foot of Table Mountain which has the status as one of the 7 wonders of the world.Beauty all round.Lots of really nice food restaurants with many different foods available.Also lots of coffee shops.Also a very smart Pick n Pay supermarket where you can purchase your groceries and other food stuff.There are few movies in the area all showing the latest films.There are many clothing stores selling the latest clothing lines and you could spend hours shopping.Also many boat cruises available - you could take a trip to Robin Island, a sunset or day cruise along the coast line or a trip around the harbour.Most weekends and holidays there is live music which one can enjoy at low cost.The SA rugby museum is also well worth a visit.

Beautiful. The harbour, the mall, the food market ... The place itself. Just beautiful.
One if my favourite areas in CT.
V&A Mall is nice. A lot of good stores ... Food market is vibrant ... Music, nice food for all tastes. Love the place

Great Shopping Outlet. On a recent visit to CapeTown and staying close to the Waterfront, we paid many visits. Ideal not only for shopping but also for the vast amount of eateries to suit all tastes. Also close to the various sightseeing and tour operators. Well recommended.

Shopping Paradise. There are so many shops and restaurants in this area. We walked around this area day and night, felt very safe. The shops are of high quality and some are artisans. Well worth the visit.

Touristy .....not to be missed. It's an area not be missed. It adds to the flavour of Cape Town!
There are plenty of places to eat and shop.
Views of the harbour and table mountain.

A lot like home.... This area is really beautiful and if you're looking to shop, it's perfect. The local crafts area is the best spot, but you can also find items that you'd find at a mall in the states. We ate at a couple different locations and each time the food was mediocre. Feels a bit like Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco. Worth visiting, but too much like a mall vibe if you're trying to escape home.
Beautiful area. It is a nice place to walk around. Lots of shops and restaurants. Quite touristic, but still a great morning activity.

Excellent anytime of the day. This is a popular tourist area. Filled with plenty of restaurants. The area also has a large mall with a large grocery shop, plenty of clothes shopping and food market. It's a nice area to walk around anytime of the day. There is an aquarium and miniature copy cat London eye wheel. This area also has live entertainment most weekends when it's very busy. There is plenty of car parking at reasonable prices.

My home from home. Ever since the V&A Waterfront in Cape Town opened years ago, it has been my local place to buy food, jewelry and all other provisions.The easy layout, safety and general quality is world class. I've been to many places and this really beats it all because it's is truly an authentic harbour and there's always lots to do and enjoy.Somehow it's managed to not to be touristy and has a great mix of locals and visitors.

Victorian harbour with all mod cons!. This is a lively complex of shops and restaurants with outdoor seating and often views across the harbour to Table Mountain, as well as being a working harbour from where you catch the ferry to Robben Island. The whole area has a real buzz from the Ferris wheel to the buskers. something for everyone.

Sights, Restaurants, Bars and Shops - Vibrant Waterfront. The Victoria and Alfred Waterfront is a pleasant place to spend an afternoon exploring the different options. There is plenty of variety of food and drinks on offer. Some of the cultural experiences are worth seeking out including the Robben Island Ferry terminal, the clock tower and Nobel Square. If you need to find an African souvenir, there are plenty of options in the craft markets. The other option is to find a comfortable seat and watch the world go by and enjoy the vista of Table Mountain. What's not to like!Thanks for your vote if you found this review helpful.

Victoria & Alfred Waterfront ... the quintessential hub of entertainment!. During our two week stay in Cape Town, we managed to visit the V & A Waterfront on three separate occasions. Each visit, revealed the many attractions on offer in this delightful cultural and historical hub. The V & A complex is situated in one of the most beautiful areas of Cape Town, surrounded by the ocean on one side while the majestic Table Mountain stands guard on the other. It is easily accessible via public transport or if you prefer driving there, parking fees are quite affordable. Whether you're a foodie, a shop-a-holic, a cult-vult or just simply enjoy eclectic sights and sounds, then this is the go-to place! At the V & A Waterfront, you'll never be bored as there is always entertainment, shops, restaurants and activities to attract every member of the family. Oh, and did I mention that facilities for the disabled (I have a spinal cord injury and mobilise with a manual wheelchair) is world class! Our visits to the V & A Waterfront were truly sublime on every level.

Quick visit. Beautiful harbor area which feels very safe there were guards everywhere. Only visiten during the day and did not eat but see med quite expensive. Would live to stay in a hotel here but we could not afford that, maybe next time....
Fantastic place to shop and eat. An excellent redevelopment in Cape Town. Great shopping here. Loads of tourist shops and the covered food market is excellent for cheap eats and interesting food.

Huge mall on the waterfront.. All shops you could want in one place. From the African-souvenir shops outside the mall to the standards like the new H&M and Super Dry inside, there is pretty much what you would expect from any major Western mall. The food court wasn't great, but it is what it is.

Nice Cosmopolitan Atmosphere. Two of the main advantages of the V& A is it's location & cosmopolitan atmosphere.The shopping centre hasn't changed much over the years despite for the addition of a few more boutique shops.It's a fantastic site to spend the evening after a meal. However, having said that we found it a little dead this September.The exterior is in need of some maintenance as it's showing signs of fatigue. For example, the wooden benches could do with sandpapering & varnishing etc.

V & A Waterfont Cape Town. Excellent shopping mall featuring International and local shopping brands. Movie houses and a big variety of coffee shops and restaurants situated throughout. Children are also catered for and have great fun painting at ARTJAMMING while parents are free to shop or have a quick bite in one of the many restaurants. There is plenty to see and do at the Waterfront. Underground parking as well as outdoor parking is available if needed and you pay per hour.

Great Shopping, views, dining in a safe environment. Love spending time at the Waterfront. There are loads of shops and places to eat and drink as well as the beautiful water views. I always feel safe at the Waterfront, there is good security and police on site. Shopping ranges from Woolies to designer stores so there is something for everyone. Really love the food market as well as the great range of artisan shops in The Greenpoint market. Great for souvenir shopping for more upmarket gifts.

Out of Africa. It's a place that has everything you could want in one place. It's hard to believe you are in Africa and is one of the safest places in Cape Town. Great for families but can also be romantic. It's the first place I show to my foreign language students and then they can return to investigate more closely. It is really big! I've had new students who are on return visits and I've shown them parts of it that they never saw on their first visit

Shopping haven, great eateries & stunning views. I love the Waterfront for many reasons - the vibe is electric both day and night. There is a great choice of restaurants, and lots of different shopping opportunities to suit all budgets. The markets are amazing and offer a huge selection of locally made products. A must do if you're in Cape Town.

For a modern mall this was pleasant. For a modern mall this was pleasant, particularly sited near the waterfront. Some views from cafes -such as the one in Woolworths, which was particularly good.Good range of shops and plenty of parking ( 45 r for 7-8 hours).

Buzzy with plenty to do. The waterfront has plenty to do with lots of bars , restaurants , and shops.
Prices are a little higher than elsewhere but it is well worth it. We also took one of the harbour sail boat trips which was good fun and value.
Busy and safe. We spent a short time her, prior to travelling to Robben island. I wished that we had had more time. Lots of restaurants and cafes, felt very safe.

Plenty to do on any day. Enjoy the harbour, the water and the boats. Plenty of shopping and loads of food. Very busy on weekends. Park as soon as you can and then walk.
Watershed is worth a visit - a really well laid out local arts and crafts market.
Life music often or at the Ferrymans

Checking out the local attractions. This is a must do! You can spend the whole day at the waterfront visiting shops, restaurants, museums, etc. We spent the day walking around the area ending the day with a bit to eat and coffee.
Interesting. Interesting with lots of history and very different from 10 years ago. Lovely restaurants , cafes etc. entertainment on wharf by local singers and music.

Waterfront wharf offers centralized access. The wharf is the place to go. It compliments a visit to the city, or just come stay and watch people and boats around the Barbour. Several interesting restaurants and shopping. Nice boardwalk for jogging or a stroll. Great view of Table Mountain.

A nice place To be. The waterfront is a very nice place To be,we had nice weather, and a great variety of shops. Lots of entertainment and we loved To sit and drink and eat something while listening To the artist.
A nice place. picturesque, i went there in a taxi, there's a harbor, a market place, restaurants, arts and crafts. A must place to visit in Capetown

Nice area. The V&A has a number of good restaurants, accommodation, shopping and entertainment. A nice area of Cape Town reminiscent of a number of other world class harbours (Sydney, Auckland etc) with the bonus views of Table Mountain in the back.

A shop for everyone. All under one roof and if you explore you would find places like Grand cafe and Shimmies - the two are in opposite directions but worth a visit. From Grand Cafe a walk to our international stadium make interesting site visit

Shop, shop and shop. A large amount of big and small stores and dozens of restaurants of good quality.
I recommend a helicopter ride which gives a magnificent view of Cape Town and the surrounding area.

The Diamond in the Jewel of Cape Town. I live in Los Angeles and this is what the city should turn their disused waterfront into. WOW, money well spent. A great example of the Rainbow Nation. Everybody meeting and having fun. Whether to watch the Rugby World Cup, or enjoy the local music, food, or atmosphere, you cannot go wrong. So much to do, not enough time.
Very touristic. Nice but very touristic , lots of restaurants, and shops also the start of the robber island ferry to robbed island.

Touristy but very well done and fun. Fanueil Market on steroids and very very well done. We saw boat races, Save the Rhino School children competition a la the cows in Chicago etc, shops, buskers, harbor activities and tons of construction.

Great 1st day in Cape Town-Great way to walk off the plane fatigue!. After a 11 hour flight and ride from the airport to the hostel, walking the V&A Waterfront was just what the doctor ordered! Beautiful day, lots to see, this is where they have the boat rides, trips to Signal Hill , Lions Head, Table Mountain and Robben Island. There are street performers, shopping, restaurants, everything is there. The views are fantastic, this is not to be missed!
Good day out. Excellant place to visit plenty to do and see, loads of shops for the ladies. Boat trips round the harbour,and to Robbin Island. Eatries plentyfull and cheap.

Must visit the waterfront area!. If you do nothing else in Capetown please take in the waterfront area and dine out on one of the many great restaurants with patios overlooking the harbour... You will be glad you did!

Good food and unique shopping experience. Victoria & Alice Waterfront has something for everyone. Before we started exploring the waterfront, we enjoyed a fantastic lunch at Vovo Telo.. The mix of outside entertainment, fantastic restaurants, specialty shops, craft shopping and designer stores provided us with hours of fun. We caught the hop on bus outside of our hotel and was dropped right at the entrance of the waterfront. Very convenient.

Nice area. Great area to walk around on a nice day or hide in the giant and mall on a bad one. There are some great shops/restaurants both inside and out. When were were there they had the promenade set up to watch the rugby game which was fun as well.
Lots to do & see. Fantastic area to enjoy, lovely food. shopping and pubs and street entertainment. not to be missed a lovely experience.
Everything you want in one place. The V&A waterfront offers a great selection of restaurants, shopping & entertainment options. Everything you need n one place.

Touristy but everything under the sun. We spent quite a bit of time here during our visit. Lots of outdoor performances, good restaurants, great shopping. Particularly enjoyed the water shed which featured lots of artisanal works and the food market which had amazing food in various booths.

WHAT A BUZZ!. Amazing exciting place - had no idea it was so good. The most beautiful craft shops in the huge 'shed' next to the bus station. fab shopping centre and a huge variety of classy restaurants.

It's the tourist trap I can't get enough of. What's not to like about the V&A Waterfront? Sure, the restaurants are a tad more expensive, and yes, lots of the shops are aimed directly at the tourist. But where else can you drink a glass of wine with the picture postcard view of Table Mountain right in front of you? Where else can you shop for anything, and then take a few steps and look at the mountain some more? Drink craft beer. Ride the Cape Town Eye. Just chill.

Nice day out. great spot for high end shopping and relaxing at one of the many gorgeous restaurants, the craft market was amazing full of very talented entrepreneurs, and the food market... delicious, something for everyone.
Must visit in Cape Town. Lots to do for the whole family; shopping, variety of restaurants and cuisine, outdoor activities and walk about areas.

Some Place!. We visited the V & A Waterfront development several times during our visit to Cape Town and each time found something new to interest us. The shops are varied, the activities happening on the streets are very entertaining and the food is spectacularly good. There is a lot of activity on the water with boats coming and going and we made the trip to Robben Island from there. We parked in the underground car park on the edge of the complex which has a system of red and green lights to show where there are spaces which makes life easier. Everybody we saw looked happy and pleased to be there.

Sundowners, lunch, dinner, shops - all good. You have to go to the V&A Waterfront. Restaurants are brilliant and staff everywhere are incredibly friendly. As you walk round, you have local bands playing and singing which adds to the atmosphere. There's a great buzz around the place for drinks and sundowners with live music in a couple of venues. Great for shopping - high-street brands and quaint African souvenir shops.

A World of Ideas and Experiences. The Waterfront has every experience you could reasonably hope for. Restaurants for every budget. Pnp supermarket with the best to offer for the medium sized to extreme budgets. You have a beautiful view of the harbour and there are many boat experiences for your apetite. The Waterfront is really like a small town. People mostly keep to themselves, but if you woulkd like to meet people, you can. There are quaint little Irish Pubs for that. The information Centre will be able to help you with literally any request or query. There are meter taxis everywhere and the Waterfront boasts more than just one hotel for your overnight stay. Close your eyes, dream your dream and when you open your eyes, it will be there.

I´m in love with Cape Town and it´s my favourite place!. I love coming to Cape Town and spending a day in V&A Waterfront Bay.. There is a lots of restaurant with cheap an excelent sea food... and great south-african wine...
Always busy, always good atmoshpere. Been there many times and it has never been the same.... As in dull. Always something going on, always people, always a good atmosphere.
Mandatory tourist attraction. Your Cape town visit should include the waterfront, nice to walk around for a bit. Next time I'll avoid eating there, found much better value for money elsewhere.
Great place. A great place for all ages. Good shopping, dining and entertainment. A must when in Cape Town especially now with summer coming up.
Safe and clean. First thing is safety and that's wat V&A have, they are lost of restaurant and clothing shops etc . . . I always go there for my end of month shopping, best mall and places ever

Wonderful location, shops & restaurants. We were very lucky to go to The Waterfront on a beautiful, warm, sunny day. The atmosphere is really great and the views of Table Mountain are stunning. Lots of top notch shops and excellent restaurants plus lots of attractions. Don't miss this one !!!

good catch at V & A waterfront.. Good shopping, there is also a great farmers market each Saturday in some large marquees in the car park. Also some interesting things going on including rowing races and museums. There are some resident seals. On the day we went the boat trip to Robben Island was full, so we went on a rival tour out on the sea. If the man says it's pretty choppy out there, step off the boat of you are travel sick like me, I covered his boat in the things I bought from the farmers market!

Shopping expedition!. This is a beautiful place to spend the day with the many activities that it has to offer, can shop and have lunch and then shop some more! There is a wide variety of shops for all budgets and ages and very close to other attractions in Cape Town such as the Two Oceans aquarium.

Tourist city. This is not true Cape Town. There are alot of activities but the atmosphere was a little 'up-tight' for me. If you want to not worry about safety in Cape Town I would recommend staying in this part or for a family. There are shopping malls, activities (shark diving, restaurants, boating etc) and where you can book tours.
The best shopping in Africa?. The V&A has everything you could need with a high quality atmosphere and top notch food. Only disappointment is the big wheel not operating on a Monday...
Luncheon . To wonder around the waterfront with its large collection of shops is a pleasure for the visitor. Also the eating places are clean and reasonably priced. The food is grear.

Best shopping area around.. We went all over Capetown and shopped. This is the best area for variety and quality. There is a craft mall with all locally made products. Restaurants are generally very good and there is an indoor mall with some great and familiar stores.

So much to see and do!. Whilst this is not "real" South Africa; it is beautifully done with wonderful views and lots to enjoy. Before arriving I expected this to be one of my least favourite places in Cape Town but it turned out to be the place we spent most our time enjoying walks, meals, street music and performances, the Cape Wheel, some museums, aquarium and drinks. It's a great base to organise any trips or tours too (we'd self driven for 10 days prior to arriving in Cape Town so did not use any of the companies).
Victoria and Albert Warterfront. One of the world's best waterfronts full of variation, lovely shops and great stores and a marvelous atmosphere. Better that Fisherman's Wharf in my view.
Graet Scene and Shops. Worth a few hours just to stroll around even if you do not like shopping. Easily accessible by taxi. Nice views of Table Mountain.

Great place full of life and options from £-£££. Wonderfully packed with restaurants, eateries, amusements, shops and pubs not to mention ferry starts and the Ferris wheel and street artists. Great centre really well planned and one of the best tourist centres I have ever visited.
beautiful and nice shopping around!. good stores and great food! there are other bigger shopping centres in Capetown but this place is nice, with a great view and great restaurant options!

It's a big mall. I don't see the appeal of visiting a waterfront mall. It's a nice mall, mind you. But it's a mall. We were hoping for more local shops. But it was mainly chains/stores that you can visit anywhere. The best part (for us) was the food court. There were a lot of local products/foods there. It's a nice rainy day activity, though. Cape Town doesn't seem to have a lot to do when it rains. It was raining during our stay, and the only things the concierge could come up with for us to do when it rains were dining at a fireplace restaurant (still not sure what that means), V&A waterfront, and District Six museum.

Fun place to walk, shop & eat. Along with Green Market Square and Kirstenbosch Botanical Garden, this is the place to go in Cape Town. The ferry to Robben Island is there, along with the Mandella Museum and the SA Springbok Rugby Museum, and the place abounds with great restaurants and shopping.

One of my favourite places to hang out!. We've visited a few times and I never tire of the view, the lovely relaxed but vibrant atmosphere and great people watching. Our dav place to do this: Den Anker

So many attractions. If you are coming to Cape Town, this is the area your hotel should be in. Its a lovely place to go at the end of the day, have a nice dinner, browse some shops or just take in the sights.

Outstanding and great atmosphere day and night. The Waterfront is a great place to stay and to visit. Great sights, restaurants, shops, hotels and bars everywhere and all within a short walk of each other. Don't miss it!
Shopping and History. Busy busy place, you can shop, eat, drink, hop on the Cape Wheel, visit Robben Island and even have a helicopter tour of the city!
Great Venue. Lots of great restaurants and a big mall for shopping. Very upbeat and fun atmosphere. Outdoor concerts and a big ferris wheel. A can't-miss stop in Cape Town!

A have to place to go for Visitors to Cape Town. There is so much to do lots of entertainment. boat trips, Shops. shops and more shops, If you can't find at the v & A you ain't going to find it elsewhere. Restaurant's, well I think every taste is catered for from KFC to Sushi to Steak and Fish. From Greek to Irish . Spa facilities and the many hotels and their facilities right there, Take Hop On Hop off Bus and tour the cape ,.My Citi to get around or taxi's not that pricy on short distances .Parking expensive and often difficult to find. It is not my favorite place in Peak season and weekend. But then I live here I can avoid the crowds. Even if you have to fight the crowds it is still worth and these busy periods have more street entertainment

Authentic Waterfront. It is authentic in every way. It is a working harbour with fishing trawlers, tourist charters and private moorings. It boasts first class hotels and restaurants to delight both the connoisseur and the 'common man', The mall offers shopping to delight any fashionista and kiddies activities that will leave any parent heaving a sigh of relief. There is plenty of outdoor seating, markets and (in season) free entertainment. The views are stupendous, unique and often awe-inspiring. The people are hospitable and security of the highest order. This is not just a tourist attraction it is an ingrained feature of Cape Town's identity.

Shops for dayz. Great shops and restaurants but parking is expensive so use the MyCiti bus to get there. Step away from the shops for an hour or two and take a walk along the harbour where you get to see how the other half lives with their yachts and lavish holiday homes. Grab a ride on one of the harbour cruises to see the other side of the Waterfront and watch seals play in the bay.
A true tourist trap, fun for all visitors. Our group of 7 nationalities had 4 days of fun shopping and eating their way around the V&A.Getting better every visit

Place to visit several times. This is a very friendly, safe and extremely clean area, excellent restaurants at affordable prices, no hassle from anyone, good wines to taste and on our list to return to again, as is Cape Town itself. Direct flight next time though.
Scenic. The area is very safe and the views are great. The mall has a wide variety of shops for shopping maniacs.

awesome venue. This gain is a must see venue, with lots of great restaurants and bars, best at night. Right on the marina waterfront, you can walk to so many outlets, and see local crafts and attractions. Two areas, Victoria, and Alfred, wander round this stunning marina with Table Mountain behind, and a big wheel to take these super snaps.

SO MUCH TO SEE SO MUCH TO DO AND SO MUCH ON OFFER. Having lived in Capetown for 20 years have been to the waterfront for various events, movies, eating shopping malling. This time we decided for the first time to take a little boat trip round the Harbour on a perfect day. The Queen Elizabeth was docked in the harbour so we had an added bonus. The morning started at Marco's for breakfast, the boat trip and then finished off with lunch at Quay 4 . Another great day had in Capetown and well worth visiting!!

A myriad of Cape Town. The main thing I enjoy about the V & A Waterfront is the fact that you can find a wide variety of nationalities, languages and cultures. Upon entering the Waterfront you almost get that feeling of going back in time. At the Watershed/Aquarium entrance all the way to Ferrymans Tavern there is a cobbled stone walkway to guide you. You can walk all the way from The Table Bay Hotel, all along the quay past boats of all shapes and sizes and restaurants catering to almost every cuisine. Following the cobble stones you can walk past the Wheel of Excellence (which offers an entirely different view of False Bay and Cape Town). Continue walking until you find the Belgian restaurant where you can take an iconic picture of Table Mountain.If you continue even further you will cross a bridge and there you can visit the famous Clock Tower or take the ferry to visit Robben Island, where Nelson Mandela was imprisoned for 27 years. It is a grave experience, but one that I would recommend. I think it is necessary for people to know the good and the bad parts of history.Visiting the Victoria and Alfred Waterfront is quite an exciting experience - for locals and tourists. Enjoy!

Good Vibe. A very popular and busy place to visit. Everything you could need, souvenirs, arts and crafts, restaurants, activities, boat trips, aquarium, hop on, hop off busses, all there. If you're local the prices can be over the top but still an enjoyable day out can be had. We felt safe and the vibe was upbeat. A good variety of value for money restaurants.

Absolutely a great place yo visit while in CapeTown , SA. Very beautiful and There is so much to see & do at Victory&Alfred Waterfront. There is a shopping Mall with lots of designer shops & a movie theatre. There are always musicans playing & singing African music in the Square, you can just sit & listen for hours. There are Several indoor & outdoor restaurants with great food all along the dock You can sit outside to eat & watch all the boats coming & going. you can take a boat ride tour Robin Island from there which I would highly recommend. Also there is a huge locally handcrafted market which offers a vast variety of beautiful work. Definitely a must to spend a day there.

Worldclass shoping and dining. Unbelievable choices. Every restaurant level and shopping choice you can imagine. Easy to get to by walking/hotel shuttle/public transporation/hop-on-hop-off bus. Very sophisticated - something for everyone.

Great place to stroll around and take in a sunny day. The whole waterfront area is great to walk around and enjoy the water views, the mountain, the entertainers and the general vibe. It is a fun place day or night, but I enjoy walking during the day, watching the seals play in the water, seeing what kinds of boats are in the dry-dock for repairs, looking at the crafts and just enjoying a great view. There are many great restaurants at all price levels. One of my favorites is the inexpensive but quite tasty seafood at Ocean Basket, sitting outside near the big wheel. I also enjoy having lunch at one of the restaurants on the upper level of the mall on the backside facing the open water. The new Water Shed craft building is quite nice as well. It replaced the blue and red shed craft areas with a clean new well lit area that makes shopping easy.

Tourist hotspot. The waterfront is a one-stop must see. I love the Aquarium (have done a dive in the shark tank). Great market with local food, beer and such a vibe. Don't forget souvenir (pricey but classy) shopping and a sunset cruise. Did I mention the view of the whole of Table Mountain? Very touristy type of place, but we'll worth a visit

Fantastic experience. The V&A has something for everyone. A good shopping centre, dentists, doctors, many restaurants, arts and crafts in the Shed, the mariner, street entertainers and local hotels and serviced apartments.Great views of table mountain and the tour bus of Cape Town can be boarded here.Safe to walk around in the evening here.

The best waterfront development I have seen anywhere. There is something for everyone - those who love to shop will love it. Those who love food and wine will love it. Kids will have a ball. Lots of options for tourists to enjoy a wonderful harbour-side development. Remember to visit the food market and the Watershed!

Shopping with a view. The V&A Waterfront is a real buzz. Several great retail stores from local to international brands. Then there is the Watershed for those shoppers who enjoy the market style browsing and shopping. Restaurants for all everybody - the fancy sit down restaurants to the food court. Savruga is one of our favourite restaurants for sushi - perfect seating outside for sundowners. The views from the harbour of Table Mountain are amazing. There is lots of parking and if you want to take the public transport the MyCiti Bus take you into right into the waterfront. There is just so much to do - you can take the boat trips out to sea and in the summer the dolphins swim and play alongside the boats. A great time in good or bad weather.
Stylish and Breathtaking . The V&A waterfront is a must do in CT. There is always entertainment with Seaworld close by. It is a bit expensive for locals though.
Amazing place to visit. Everything you need at the waterfront, shops, restaurants, activities, what's not to like, day or night it is an exciting place to visit.
Good food and lots of people. A place to go if you like people and outdoors dining. Safe area and lots of activities, shops and souvenirs, maybe even some original works...

Breathtaking!. Walking along the boulevard at sunset is absolutely breathtaking, the ocean views with the shorelines is very picturesque. However, make sure you're dressed for the strong winds that seem prevalent.
Beautiful . Stunning place overall. Worth spending ur time there. Lots of shopping to do. Restaurants definately served great standards of food

The best of Cape Town. Here you can find the best Cape Town has to offer, excellent restaurants, coffee shops, the big wheel and the Aquarium. The locals will provide traditional music and dances to entertain you while you are here.

Mrs. V&A Waterfront is one of my favourite places to visit whenever I am in CT.I love the shops and the many things to do. Not forgetting the entertainment and the many restaurants that off the most delicious meals.

wonderful experience. The sea front is best visited at the night time.A huge fly wheel ,people doing acrobatic,colorful restaurants, boats of different shapes and colors floating in the sea water......!

Touristy but worth sometime. A mix of everything, shops, restaurants and market. We started hop off and hop off bus tour here and did some shopping and eating. Great local shopping and so may restaurants.
The Heart of Cape Town. Was an interesting place for walking, shopping and eating. Found some good souvenirs and a couple good places to eat.

Touristy and Fun. This is what rejuvenated Cape Town. There is plenty do to here including shopping (huge indoor mall), ferris wheel, tours of every type, bars, restaurants and perhaps the most unique thing to do is visit the Watershed. The Watershed features local artisans in a very unique enclosed environment. Here you can scope out local crafts, jewelry, clothes and other stuff. For runners the waterfront starts the running trail in which you can run non-stop for miles along the Atlantic. A must do while in Cape Town.

An amazing place. I must say,this is one place you never get tired of staying.With so many things to do.You can shop till you run your card empty,beautiful restaurants,shops,side attraction,the local musical bands singing to entertain folks.You just don't have any reason not to love this place.

Day out with family . There's lots to do here . Shopping galore and restaurants too. They have the big wheel there now also which is amazing on a clear day . You can go to robbed island and enjoy the sunset from the harbour.

Great Prices. With the strength of the GBP against the Rand at the moment we found the shopping to be relatively cheap and the quality of goods to be much better than the usual tourist rubbishy.Was also a novelty that we didn't any Starbucks or Costa coffee shops but coffee was just as good but much cheaper.

Pleasant stay. This hotel was very conveniently located. It is getting a bit old and could do with a "tart up". They were re furbishing the eating area when we were there. However, the room facing the mountain on a corner was very good and the view was great.Breakfast was fantastic and included everything that you could possibly desire.The staff were very friendly and efficient.

Interesting! Shopping and restaurants, go if you have lots of time!. A nice place to go shopping, a lots of good and expensive restaurants, and a beautiful waterfront! Exploring the V&A Waterfront is one of the classic tourist experiences of Cape Town, though it really is quite average compared to some of Cape Town's more spectacular experiences!

Artificial Area for Restaurants and Shops. This place is the best place to walk around safe at night in Cape Town city. There are many restaurants where you can have cheap to fine dining. You can also make shopping. T
A truly vibrant waterfront with fabulous restaurants. With a huge range if huge quality restaurants, cafes, shops and activities this is a real jewel for all ages.

Skip the mall, but check out the food market, new design hall and Mitchells brewery. The mall is a mall... ignore it. But the new design hall if interesting to see and the food market is a culinary delight. Worth checking out if you're in the area.

Great Place to Soak in Cape Town. This is a great place to find delicious (though expensive) restaurants, soak in the views of beautiful Cape Town, or get some shopping done. It is really touristy though, so if you're looking for a more "South African" atmosphere I'd go more downtown. It's a lovely place to spend an afternoon or evening though!
Everything is here. The V & A Waterfront is a very safe environment, with lots of restaurants to choose from, entertainment and shopping.

Fun, but very touristy. We ended up having a good time here, but it was a bit like the disney version of Cape Town. A little too sanitized, and with ways to spend money that were impressive! Still, we liked the ferris wheel, and even though it was a covert attempt to interest us in buying the merchandise, the "South African Diamond Museum" was an interesting and enjoyable visit.

Great location next to the Victoria & Alfred Hotel. Fab views of Table Mountain & the waterfront. Lots of great places to eat & drink at very reasonable prices. Shopping excellent. Lots of things to do on the attraction side as well as Table Mountain. Boats to Robben Island. Helecoptor trips and so much more. Lots of great street entertainment. Great atmosphere. Lovely place to visit and worth staying a couple of nights before going onto the garden route, or a safari or visiting a fab place which is 45 minutes drive away called Franschhoech. Great wines and foodie heaven. The watershed on the waterfront is worth a visit. Lovely merchandise, arts & crafts from the local community.

Amazing restaurants. Beautiful area full of amazing restaurants! We loved harbour house, the food was excellent. We didn't go shopping but there was plenty on offer. The aquarium was good for a rainy day activity. There was also an excellent food market building with lots of different types of tasty food on offer.
Shopping, eating and strolling. Nice and lively area, where you can easily spend a day, shopping, strolling and enjoying great food.

Attractive location and lots to do!. The Waterfront area is a very secure area that is made up of the harbour and lots of shops bars and restaurants. The shopping centre is large with a full range of shops and eateries to match all budgets. The top end has Gucci, Louis Vuitton, Tag etc. There is a supermarket at basement level. The area also has a craft market at shocases the work of local artists and craft persons, there is also a food hall that has small outlets that have specialist providers for snacks and lunches etc both worth a visit to take in the skills etc of local talent. The view and atmosphere is very relaxed, there are often street musicians around.

Great location. We stayed at a hotel near the waterfront and really enjoyed the great location. Has a variety of shopping, eating places and tourist attractions, including the main stop for the hop on-hop off sightseeing bus. We found the people in this area to be very friendly and helpful. Also within easy walking distance of the city centre.

Ok Market (built up). I was shocked to find out that this is the number one tourist location in Africa. We enjoyed looking around the craft vendor stalls and the food market which had delicious food from various countries. Food stall variety included but was not limited to: German, Asian, African, cafe, fresh juice, fudge, mixed nuts, etc.  We loved that there was a traditional African food stall that served African fare of samp and beans, beef or chicken stew with pap, etc. we found it harder to find traditional food and easier for international fare. Overall, V&A Market was nice but definitely not number one or even one hundred.

Lots to Do and See.. Great shops, market stalls and places to eat. Feels safe, and car parks abound. Try the Diamond Museum, the Aquariums and food at Willoughby & Co, as a couple of ideas. The Market has a wealth of talented artistic people, although some are very pricey.
An amazing feeling. V & A waterfront is an experience you will never forget. It has lots to offer beautiful view, eateries, music,shopping etc

Big shopping mall, craft centre & colourful waterfront. The shopping mall is big and has lots of international brands. There's a large supermarket in the basement, and at V&A you'll probably find what you need if you're after luggage, groceries, or souvenirs. Beyond the mall, there's a colourful waterfront, a large, upmarket (and good!) craft market selling South African carvings, paintings, etc. There's the hub for the Open Top Red Bus tours, and also boats that go out in the bay.

Sanitized but fun. Very touristy area but clean and safe at any hour. Very much a packaged and sanitized version of Cape Town but definitely a relaxing stroll with lots of little shops for gifts and very reasonable prices.
Wonderful views of table mountain and the harbour. A lively buzzy place ,lots of entertainers,shops and lovely restaurants, great views all around.a lovely place to wander around day or night.

Vibrant place. You will need more than one day to explore all that this place has to offer both day and night. Shops and more shops, lots of restaurants to cater for all tastes and some street performers to entertain. It is also the main place to pick up boat trips and the city sightseeing buses. There is also a lot of security so it always felt very safe.

Great way to spend two hours or all day.. Wonderful shops, restaurants and entertainment in a very scenic location. Food ranges from fine dining to very inexpensive. Excellent range of souveniers for every price point. First world shopping, dining and strolling.
V&A is for shopping and good food. Make sure you visit this huge mall and shop from kiddies toys, household, brand clothes and good food. The shops close very late so you can shop at night too.

You'll go many times during your visit to Cape town. This a must do while in Cape Town. Lots of great restaurants, it's right by the water with easy access to Robbin island. Every time I go there is always lots of live African music groups which add amazing animation.

Great photo area. Spent an afternoon at the waterfront. Went there for some great photos of the harbor. If you are not a shopper you can skip going inside the mall. Had an early dinner at Hildebrand's overlooking the harbor. The food was great and the service too. Prices are pretty reasonable. You can get a 3 course dinner for 170 rand.
Fun place for shopping and people-watching. We stopped here for a quick lunch and had a wonderful time. Sample cheeses and wine inside the V&A Marketplace. Don't miss the restaurants.

I love it! Live music, lots of shops an fantastic food. Perfect place to spend the afternoon, specially in not sunny days when there is not much to so. For the shopping lovers this is kind of a paradise, every kind of shop all together. And for the food lover the same. From fastfood to the finest restaurant. And music on the street, that i like very much. From time to time you also can see some boats, it is fantastic

Wonderful waterfront. Walk, shop, eat, have a drink and watch the local entertainment, ride the ferris wheel or catch a boat and do some water activities around the coast. Sooo much to see and do. A, dont miss in Capetown.

Young and vibrant. This seems to be the place to be after dark. There is shopping, great restaurants, and good street entertainment. Security is non-intrusive and done well. Both my favorite dinner and breakfast places are here. Although I enjoy shopping at the local market downtown, souvenirs are found cheaper with better selections here.

Elegant. The waterfront is a beautiful attraction and you can enjoy shopping and good evening.Plenty of nice pubs where you can wind down after a long day touring capetown. The mall has both high end shops and affordable shops.It is a gateway to many other attractions like robben island,aquarium,city tour buses etc

V& A waterfront provides lots of activities and a fantastic view of the Atlantic Ocean. the V&A waterfront provides alot of activities for all types of visitors. the ferris wheel is a favourite providing an astounding view of the city as it turns.There are several malls for one to lose themselves in shopping and great eating places.

So much to do and see and eat will keep you busy for days!. SOO much to see and do you will be spoiled for choice! we always go to the food market the food is great and so much to chose from- you can shop till you drop at local and international stores and so many choice of amazing restaurants- there is always some form of entertainment going on. you can hop on many excursions from boat trips out to seal island or robin island or helicopter trips the choices are endless ad you can spend 3 or 4 days here and not see and do all it has on offer

place to stay nearby. this is the best place to stay and visit at Cap Town. Everything happens there. the best restaurants, the boat trips to everywhere, helicopter ride, hop on hop off, and the best view of the bay. If you can stay at hotels neraby, it is going to be real good
Stretch your legs and explore this buzzing place. So much to see and do. Indoor shopping and outdoor eateries, take your pick there is sure to be something to entertain you.
also for bad weather. It was not the best weather to visit Cape Town but at the waterfront this is no problem. We enjoyed very much the food corner and the Whater shed

Great place to sit and enjoy the view.. Nice little waterfront with many good restaurants all around. The lovely view is perfect while dining. Took one of the boats from here for a sunset cruise and it was very easy and convenient. Went straight to dinner at the Greek Seafood restaurant after.
Chain stores and average restaurants. This is effectively a waterfront shopping centre with mediocre restaurants. Has plenty of shops mainly chain stores.

Adorable place to spend the evening. Walk around the V & A Waterfront, coffee in hand, and enjoy the crisp sunny air, palm tree-lined boardwalk overlooking the crashing waves, colorfully painted fishing boats pulling in and out of the classic and character-filled harbor. The expansive mall is never-ending and gives way to hundreds of shops and eateries, some with balconies overlooking the action outside. Live music and street performers accompanied our private sunset with wine in hand, overlooking the gorgeous Table Mountain and beautiful water. A little touristy? Yes - but a place to visit when in Cape Town for sure!

Terrific array of options on offer. The V&A Waterfront is a large, semi-enclosed shopping complex that has tons of shopping, dining, and lodging options available. If you need something to go camping in the bush, you can find it here. You can also find fashionable things for the nightclub, or gifts to buy for your friends back home. There is also a good range of eateries, from fast food takeaways to nice, sit down dining experiences. This area is also a good option for a rainy day when going up the mountain or hanging out on the beach is simply not an option.

Great place to stay and visit. Marvellous place to shop and eat, lots to do for all ages and plenty of hotels.Boat trips, helicopter rides etc big wheel children's activities, museums. Busy almost all the time even in bad weather. parking plentiful and cheap, between 90mins and 3 hours just 20 rand, £1. Incredible variety of resturant to suit all tastes and pockets

Fabulous place to eat, drink and shop. Fabulous place to eat, drink and shop. My favourite pub is Quay 4 however the others are also good. Great little Thai Takeaway in the food court, also ate at Bukara Indian which was very good. PicknPay on lower level is a large supermarket that also stocks well priced wines.
It's a huge shopping mall. Lots and lots of stores right at the waterfront. Many restaurants where you can fit outside right at the water.
CHECK OUT THE FOOD HALL. Great shops and food at the waterfront. Good place to take the family for the day and just stroll the waterfront.
Spectacular Views. The Victoria and Alfred waterfront area is safe with many good restaurants and shops. The views of table mountain are spectacular.

Lots to see and do. Great fun, shops and restaurants. Street entertainment and big shopping centre with all the name brand stores. Good place to hang out, enjoy a drink overlooking the harbour at sunset.

Gibsons V &a Waterfront Best burgers in Town. Gibson's & V & A have excellent Steaks, Ribs and Gourmet Burgers and is value for money. Good wine list and a very friendly and relaxed atmosphere I loved the place and go there every month when I am in Cape Town.
lots of fun. Great place to wander about in the evenings. There are lots of restaurants and shopping areas, as well as a market and lively entertainment. Don't miss it. The view is beautiful.
Great Shopping!. Great shopping area. I found the most special straw hat woven in the shape of the original safari hats. Lots of wonderful African shops, as well.

Shopping/eating /. full of shops which are pretty high end prices.lots of food places,entertainment going on.lots to see and plenty to do such has boat rides,helicopter rides walking along the beach front and people watching.very safe with lots of security. we spent 5 nights here which is plenty enough

Great Shops and Restaurants. This is really worth a full morning or afternoon when in Cape Town, there are great shops and restaurants to see and eat at. If you er planning on going to Robben Island plan to spend time eater before after the tour. There s a great choice here.
Beautiful. Lots of amenities, lovely restaurants, great place to pass time in Cape Town. Great place to buy souvenirs in Cape Town

Collection of shops and restaurants. If you like places like Fisherman's Wharf in SFO or the Fanueil Hall marketplace in Boston, you will like this waterfront area of shops, restaurants, outdoor "entertainment," and harbor cruises. We didn't find V&A waterfront very unusual.

Nice but I did expect there to be more to it . This is a shoppers paradise. So many shops available and not too bad for prices. Speak to the staff for deals on the day as they can be big savings. I did expect there to be more to it but there was still plenty here to do and see.

Busy bustling tourist centre of Cape Town. Most locals would not come here to shop but its a great place to wonder around, grab a bite to eat or just watch the boats and the seals.
It is touristy but has great restaurants and the Brass Bell is a must for a few pints and some live music

Shopping . What a fantastic place. From shop till you drop to great restaurants . We went there every night to eat and have a drink in the two pubs there. The shops range from high end to small craft stalls all of which are lovely. You feel very safe here even late at night. You can book all sorts of trips from here as well.

Seals, sights, cocktails and foodie paradise. Just wander and enjoy and if you go anywhere to eat - if you like good food, with a French twist, go to De Anker. The highlight of our food fest in Caoe Town ( there were many - you will be spoilt for choice) Go see the seals and the beautiful clock tower. Turn round bad look at the majestic mountain. Find a roof top or terrace bar and have a cocktail and just soak up the sights and atmosphere of this beautiful city
Fabulous world class venue. This is an active,busy,exhilarating venue to have fun ,shop,read,eat,entertain ,chat.Very upmarket,secure and inviting place to spend the time.
Attractive venue with a real buzz.. Just a lovely area with lots of old and new things to see and experience. Restaurants, cafes, buskers, shops and safe due to lots of security and police.

Something for everyone at the Waterfront. As tourist destinations go this has to be a world-class venue. Built around the working harbour there is something for everyone whether you want shopping, movies, entertainment, eating, drinking and anything else you can think of.

Hoping place. If you don't know what to do, the waterfront is a big mall with plenty of outdoor cafes and shops of all kinds. Wonderful upscale restaurants as well a great place to people watch and shop.
Great place to be. I love the Victoria & Alfred Waterfront for its ambience, the beautiful view on Table Mountain, the port, the nice shops, the watershed, the life music...everything is great there.
Beautiful , relaxed area with lovely facilities. Beautiful location, lovely restaurants and gift shops. It's the gateway to Robben Island. Loved the atmosphere.

Just another mall. Not sure what all the fuss is about. Had breakfast at the Mug and Bean - I think every town in South Africa has one. Very commercial. There were some nice shops but they were pricey. Meh!

Everyone will find something to do here.... Some will eat and drink and some will do some shopping.
the only question is how much time you will spend there...
There are also some things for kids. All together a well rounded place to spend time...

Nice area to buy some food and check out the local shops. Plenty of places to chill out with a beer and get some decent food. The food market is excellent with plenty of options for the discerning foodie.If you are looking for some souvenirs that are decent quality go to the big market type building by the hop on hop off bus terminal.
