Many places to buy from around here so take your time and enjoy.
A greta place to meet others for a drink.. Sat outside and had drink in bar. Great spot to meet others and watch world go by. Also get street artists and singers to watch ...
Not much to offer. Not much to see here but loads of shops and some mediocre restaurants. Unless you're in a dire need of some new clothes, go somewhere else.

Worth a visit!. There's literally something for everybody, loads of activities, shops, shows, theatres, superb restaurants, beach look out spots to chill, breathtaking views.. its just too much to mention! good vibes and awesome people

Clean, safe place to shop, dine while in Cape Town. The shopping and pedestrian areas were popular and crowded. At the same time the area was clean and there were many guards around. There was a large number of diverse and high quality shops, including restaurants and international chains. I liked the new foodie section (with the green roof).
A bit touristy. The place to go for the big brands and top shops, same as anywhere... Nothing to write home about but the nice views

Lots To Do. Something for everybody. A wonderful shopping mall with all the usual shops plus more unusual ones. Restaurants and cafes to suit all tastes! Boat tours, including to Robben Island. Street entertainers!!!

A beauty to adore. A must visit when you are in Cape Town. Waterfront boasts hundred's of shops and eateries including fine dining, and wine. It is also home to Fur seal, the only found in the world and a Gateway to the Robben Island.

Superior shopping and dining. Even as a "local" I love the V&A - I just wish I remembered to go here more often. It's vibey, safe, has amazing shopping in a stylish, well lit, well managed centre. Fab restaurants and coffee shops, and of course - Willoughbys! What more can a girl want, right?

Fun Area. We stayed at the V & A hotel on the waterfront for 5 days. It was so convenient being on the waterfront. There was so much to do, so many shops to browse, and so many bars/ restaurants to enjoy. We really enjoyed our 5-day stay on the waterfront.

Great place to wander. The V&A waterfront is a showpiece attraction in Cape Town. It is a blend of museums, small shopping malls, craft shops and restaurants, coffee shops and bars. It is all centred around a Marina with boat trips, helicopter rides and street entertainers. It is very safe to wander around and you keep coming back and finding something new each time. You must visit the Watershed which houses a selection of craft stalls most of which are supporting local initiatives, co-operatives etc. there are several really good restaurants, Baia and Cape Grace Hotel are just two. There is a food market which is really interesting to browse and sample local delicacies -caterpillar anyone? Fab place which we visited several times during our stay.
Fun place. Great shops, great market, , great food, great environment. Lots to see and do for everyone . We hung out here many nights .

Good for a sundowner and stroll. Nice area to walk around, grab a drink and dinner. Lovely sunset views to the west and Table Mountain to the east. Good pharmacy and grocery store inside the mall to the south.
You could be without. If you like crowded areas, souvenir shops and bad restaurants this is the place to visit. A little bit of a tourist trap.
Great food options!. A fantastic place to walk around, have a drink and eat some great food. There are some great craft stalls and local food stalls in the market too.
What a fun place to be!!!. Always something to do...music was great..tons of good eating and the best shopping...loved watching the boats come into the harbor.
Good Shopping...it's worth a visit. Very good assortment of stores. Stores ranged from very high end to low end. Easy to navigate. Pandora charms with Africa themes was a pleasant surprise.

Choices unlimited :-). Very wide variety of shops with multinational brands & very nice set up along with Harbor for multiple activities like Two Oceans Aquarium, Tigris boat cruise to Robin Island, etc.

relaxing shopping area. Brilliant place to shop till you drop. Lots of place to eat and drink. Great places to relax and take in the wonderful scenery. Take a trip on the V&A Waterfront wheel for great views of the waterfront

The best Waterfront in South Africa - by far.. The Waterfront in Cape Town is a must to visit. There are dozens of good restaurants, shops, boat trips and numerous novelty shops with food and crafts and the Aquarium. A very good vibe especially at weekends with lots of "buskers" doing various acts all at no cost. It is a great place to see the amazing variety of tourists enjoying the sights.

A great place for shopping, eating and relaxation. The waterfront is a great place to explore and Table Mountain makes a fantastic backdrop. The shopping arcade is well worth a wander and, when you've had enough, there are hundreds of different restaurants to choose from. You can sit out and watch the boats in the marina or take in one of the local street performers. Food comes form all over the world so you are sure to please everyone. It's hear that you can also book fishing and boat trips, or a flight on a helicopter. It's very friendly and there are lots of security staff about to guide you. The large warehouse where there are hundreds of stalls of local crafts is definitely worth a visit, as is the food market and if you're a rugby fan, you can't miss the Springbok museum.

Wide range of stalls. We visited the V & A waterfront twice in a week. There are plenty of stalls in covered halls selling a wide range of gifts and food. There is also the aquarium, although we didn't have time to visit. The open top bus tours stop at the waterfront too.

Waterfront Entertainment. The waterfront has a various shops with all kinds of things for the consumer to purchase, form clothing to curios. There are some great pubs with live entertainment! Some lovely restaurants and cafes just for that well needed coffee break after all the bus tours and walking!It was a very shot walk from the Commodore and Ports Wood Hotels, straight across the road to be exact!The views of the waterfront are lovely too!

Nice spot. This is a fantastic base to re-stock for tourists and do some high-end shopping. Not as good for local shopping though. Several nice restaurants and a great view of Table Mountain if it isn't hidden under the tablecloth.

No.1 Shopping Centre. This buzzing harbour-front is FANTASTIC!
Great shops; great Restaurants;5 Star Hotels..(THE GRACE and Tableview Hotels are superb)
Get the boat to Robben Island.(President Mandela spent 20 years of his life here!)

Gorgeous views. We spent the day at the waterfront. The highlights was definitely the catamaran sunset champagne cruise. We loved it and it was a great blast. The mall was quite upmarket and standard like any other mall so somewhat of a waste of time. Lots of shops great places to sit and eat and look at the boats.

Capetown Waterfront. A fun place to go for shopping and dining. The mall is massive and has every store you can imagine. There are lots of nice souvenir shops as well with pretty reasonable prices. Definitely worth checking out!

Like Holiday at Home!!!. If I want to have a HOLIDAY feeling I just visit Victoria & Alfred Waterfront!!!!! By just walking around there and hear all the different foreign languages .....French, German mixed with some local Xhosa and Afrikaans. There is a variety of restaurants for different price class. A lot to do: Boat trips, Beer tasting, Big "Eye" Wheel rides, and the locals with their music and acting. Place to see & enjoy!!!!

Very Pretty. We stayed at a hotel right on the waterfront so we were able to walk around this area quite easily. There are great views here and it was fun to watch the seals in the water. There are numerous shops and restaurants around the waterfront as well as a promenade that you can walk/run along the water.

All you need at the warefront. We stayed at the waterfront and the area felt safe to walkabout on your own with security guards dotted all over the place either watching boats or residences in the area.The waterfront is fantastic place to find food with plentiful supply of restaurants and a huge pick and pay supermarket. It is a very pleasant area to spend an evening relaxing.there are pubs for cheap dining and there are fine dining restarants available,fare to suit every pocket.In the day there are numerous boat rides into the bay available and cafes to spend time looking out onto the sea,one of the trips available was Robben Island to visit the cell where Nelson Mandella spent most of his time while in prison.There is a huge Ferris wheel which is a good landmark for the area and a cool ride.Something for everyone including the ardent shopper, plenty of shops available for you to spend your Rand.
The best place to buy souveniers. If you need something in Cape Town just come here and you'll find it. The mall has all kinds of stores, types of food and general services you might need.

Ideal base to explore. Great views, great shopping and fantastic restaurants. We spent a week in the waterfront and never got bored. We even saw Dolphins in the harbour. We used it as a base and would go out exploring during the day using the hop on hop off buses or our car.

Best venu in Cape Town for dining and shopping . During my short stay I went daily to the Waterfront whether I needed to shop, dine or just stroll around the harbor. I also took Cape Town tours from there. The mall is wonderfull with high end brands like Burberry and Louis Voitton and retail shops like Mango and Zara. The dining choices are numerous and you are bound to meet your craving. There are even some Halal restaurants. The mall is very clean and well served. There is a giant wheel infornt of the mall and bistros around it. It is very safe there with an army of security personnel to insure your peace of mind. The mall has everything you might need from diamonds to groceries. The mall is smoking free but there are places designated for smokers. The aquarium is adjacent to the Waterfront and besides it great handcarts shop with nice cafes.

Everything for everyone. So much to see do and experience here. Shop till you drop or chill and world watch. Boat trips great choice of restaurants and cafes. Birds galore and lots of seals to watch while you enjoy a well cooked meal. Entertainment aplenty too of you need more

It has everything and more! . This place is wonderful. We spent two full days here. The aquarium is beautiful, the Jolly Roger cruise was fun, the mall had good restaurants and great stores and the location is beautiful. We watched a film at the nu-metro cinema and it was a pleasant experience. I would highly recommend the Food Market. The Mexican wraps, Hungarian flatbread with salmon, smoothies and vegan stores offered wonderful food. The samoosa place was overpriced (5 samoosas for R45) - so avoid that unless you really really want samoosas. Having visited the Cape Union Mart there twice, I can recommend using the store. Apart from the large variety of items, the staff are friendly and very knowledgeable.I bought a groupon for a ride on the Cape Wheel where I got 2 tickets for R100 but I wouldn't do it at full price (R100 per person for 15 minutes).

The Waterfront Cape town. Nice environment for tourists. Lost of shops and restaurants. Often live music from African groups. When you are in Cape town, it is worth to pay a visit.remark: Go also the the Water Shed. New hall with all original African shops and products (art, dresses, souvenirs etc etc) Very fair prices, compare to other shops.

Central attraction in Cape town. No visit to CT complete without a visit to thev&a. Restauramts, a working harbour, live music, screening of major sports events, shopping and thegateway to Robben Island

Out and About in Cape Town. Beautiful setting, nice view of Table Mountain and bustling with activity. That in a nutshell summarizes my Waterfront experience. I found the restaurants really overpriced, and not that special at all. One can get much better culinary experiences in the city centre. There are interesting shops, apart from the chains spread all over the area. The flea market next to the Two Oceans Aquarium is well laid out and very "airy"Parking is never a problem. The Waterfront is a must see when in Cape Town.
wonderful shopping experience and sight seeing. i enjoyed being here, everything was superb and beyond expectation. good restaurants.i enjoyed the cleanliness of the environment

Brilliant!. V&A Waterfront is one of the most beautifull places to be in the world!A lot of excellent restaurants with life music and in the evening you can see the whale-watching boat is coming in the harbour!The Table mountain, you can see it from V&A Waterfront!!! The prices are there so low now, you can have a very good dinner with all the drinks for about 10 Euro!And you can drink clean water out of the krane..... it's amazing to stay a copple of days in Capetown! And no time-difference now,and only 1 our from October till March!

What a package. It’s a hive of activity. Which other place in a capital city offers you a perfect view of an amazing mountain, ocean views, and seal pups playing in the harbour whilst sipping great wine?

Tourist trap and expensive. There is many restaurants at the waterfront, but it is a tourist trap and the prices are just out of this world. If you want to eat good food, go to ocean basket or Quey 4 as they the only fish place that is good value for your money. The shops also increase their prices due to the tourist. There are many malls in Cape town that do not increase their price like canal walk for instance.

A place to chill. There are a good selection of restaurants, shops, boat & helicopter rides as well as street performers. It is a busy place but the mood is relaxing. Carry jackets along if you choose to go on a boat ride. The parking is expensive. We had the pleasure of touring a British war ship ... awesome!!
Cape holiday shopping paradise!. Holiday shopping at its best! Very nice shops and restaurants with stunning views, dont forget the Jolly Roger!!!

Beautiful. Errr despite the beauty that draws you to this area and the vibe, this is really on of the most expensive places in Cape Town. If you are looking to do a bit of shopping rather go to the Canal Walk Mall as prices are actually a bit lower than at the V & A. Amazing place still and views
Victoria and Alfred Waterfront. Great place to hang and really gives you a sense of Cape Town and what to expect from the people around you.

World class development. The V&A, as it's called, is an extensive mall area on the Cape Town waterfront containing many restaurants, attractions (e.g., the aquarium), two buildings selling high quality African arts and crafts that you will want to take home and a gourmet food building that would be wonderful if you are self-catering.Although it is a major tourist attraction for non-South Africans, we were there on a Sunday and it was crowded with locals as well. This is not just any old mall. It is a very high quality development, the likes of which I have not seen anywhere else. There is also lots of activity on the waterways that thread through the area.We went back several times to eat at world class restaurants.
A lot of fun restaurants and shops. A great variety of restaurants. Great views. Fun shopping and street entertainment. Well located downtown.
Amazing international shops.. Great restaurants. Interesting to see a working harbour. Historical and modern at same time. Beautiful scenery. Stunning views

Even beautiful in winter. It was such a blustery day I took my mom on a hop on hop off bus tour but we were blown around V&A first and the wind still didn't put a damper on my mom's spirits enjoying all the beautiful viewpoints and great food market where we stopped for coffee and a pastry before our bus tour.

Views, Food, Shopping & HIstory. The Victoria & Alfred waterfront is a must for visitors to Cape town. A perfect spot for shopping (international or ethnic South African goods). V& A offers a wide variety of restaurants offering a selection of cuisines and cafes for all budgets, and then there is the history of the harbor and the stunning views. A great way to spend time; meandering through the mall and harbor, stopping to watch the boats or a bite to eat, or just seeing a bit of history; taking a trip a pre-booked ferry trip to Robben Island from the Clock Tower on V&A.

Interesting mix - restaurants and harbour view galore!. Good mix of restaurants and interesting activities like the Aquarium and swimming with the sharks! Importantly, it is where you start from, for the Hop On Hop Off Bus Tour - with the ticketing office present right next to the Bus Stop. Abundant food options and all in all, a chilled out place!

Great place for a bite. It's just a lovely place to take a stroll in during the day when the sun is out. The mall is very good with heaps of international stores. There are many restaurants to choose from in the area and it's very good for both lunches and dinners. During the evening there is also different street entertainment around the area and a place for kids to play.
Lively scenario.. Interesting mix of food, entertainment and shopping. Good place to visit on a dull day, and probably better on a good day!

.. So much to do and so many shops and also the nice spot to view table mountain . u can take a boat trip around the harbour and ride on the wheel to see the whole of cape Town while taking my city bus which is so convenient

Touristy, but a Great Place. Our 2nd visit to the V&A, perfect for shopping, eating, drinking and sight-seeing, the big yachts are moored in the harbour, there are vendors selling cruises and a big wheel. Plenty of parking but there is a charge for the parking, and plenty of taxis outside if you dont have a car. We went to the cinema while we where there, reasonably priced. Some great places to eat and drink, Tasha's Bar Restaurant was very good.
Good eating and shopping. Brilliant for shopping and eating. Tried 3 restaurants and we're pleased with all of them. Eating in South Africa is quite inexpensive

Perfect for a day of rest. The V&A Waterfront is perfect to visit at the end of your South Africa journey. Shops, restaurants, sightseeing and a great view of Table Mountain in the back. It's fun to watch the boats and ships moving in and out of the harbour while strolling along the harbour. Forgot to buy a item to bring home with you, here's the place to find it. Nice layout and several hotels are closeby. Paid parking at decent rates.
Waterfront. A lovely Mall with plenty of shops with superb views of Table Mountain.Plenty of restaurants to choose from

A 'must' when in Cape Town. Very busy but interesting place to visit whilst in Cape Town. Lots of shops, restaurants etc. and the place from which to visit Robben Island and join the Hop-on, Hop-off bus.

Shopping and a meal with a great view.. A great place to go shopping and have lunch or dinner. Would recommend spending some time down here. Cape Town Fish Market a great place to grab a bite and enjoy the view.

done once but not keen to revisit. Nice but very very commercial ... not a highlight once you have viewed it once .catering for the toursist with whale tours , boats tours shark diving activities and lots of places to eat and drink and then of course there is the shopping.

Port and Bayside Area with Shops and Restaurants. V & A Water Front area is a great place to spend leisure time. There is a lot that one can do here. Just stroll on the Water front, Window Shop or pick-up some Curios and Gifts from the Shops, enjoy your Beer or other Drinks and fill your pallet with what you want to eat. In parallel you can look at and appreciate different kinds of Boats and Ships parked around or larger Ships berthed further down in the harbor. You also get a very clear view of Table Mountain from here. In fact we were at V&A Front when we saw the clouds clearing on Table Mountain and rushed towards that. We had visited this place in Dec 1995.
Still simply stunning. Great shopping, great ambience and good security. Easy access by taxi bus or hotel shuttle. Well worth spending a few days even if just to take photos of the activities.

Buskers, restaurants , shops and bars. Short walk from the city to the waterfront. The Victoria and Albert Waterfront so named after Queen Victoria and her nephew Albert is a must see if spending any time in Cape Town. It's mixture of buskers playing jazz set against the backdrop of the marina sets an eclectic vibe thats difficult to replicate. A collection of differing gift shops and restaurants is sure to please every visitor to this area which is regarded as the most visited sight in South Africa. It is also the departure point for the ferry to Robben Island which was the prison that housed Nelson Mandela for 18 years of his life. Well worthy visit

Great place to stroll around. We went to the waterfront daily when we were staying in Cape Town. There are a bunch of different restaurants to try and shopping mall to explore. The first night we tried a restaurant with local african foods, another night we had fresh seafood.  There is a cool craft expo open till 6pm you should check out! It's full of goodies made by local companies that are good quality and not cheap looking like the most craft places i'm used to seeing. Also next store to that is a food market which was a whole bunch of different vendors opened to 6pm as well. HINT - there is a bar uptop and a cool vendor downstairs that sells amazing beers from a cooler. My family and i had a fun time eating different things, checking out the crafts and buying touristy things to take back home.  The waterfront area is guarded by police and cameras and is very safe to be. You must check it out! There was a shuttle from our hotel that took us directly here. There are alot of hotels around within walking distance as well.
quay four. Vibrant area, lots to do and see. We went on the by wheel, great views. Try the prawns at quay four, they were amazing.

Shoppers paradise. What an amazing place. Great for retail therapy. Loved the Watershed - local crafts. Huge selection of restaurants. Lots of things for kids at the waterfront. Big screen set up to watch the rugby world cup. Only criticism is the shopping mall is so big we kept getting lost.
Quay Four. Great shopping venue though bit pricey for the local South African.Lovely waterfront to stroll around.
A great view of table mountain. Very commercialised - same old same old upmarket shopping center. All the big brand shops are here, but don't expect any bargain specials

Where you go!. Do you want great shops? Do you want great restaurants? Do you want great atmosphere? This is a fabulous place to go where you will relax, feel safe, sing along to the music outside, see fantastic shops, sit in the sun at the waterfront pubs and check out Table Mountain.

Very much improved. I first visited the V & A in 2000. Then it was extremely quiet and many shops were not open. This is not the case now. The mall is bustling with an excellent range of shops and restaurants. Great way to spent a wet day in CT!
Lots of free performances and great shopping. Lots to do, great restaurants and shopping, there's often free performances near the wheel and of course free wifi for the travellers!

Nice place with great view. It is very nice place to go and sit or dine. It has a wonderful view over the marina. There are many different restaurants and cafes. There are also many shopping brands and souvenir ones.
We enjoyed going there for two days where we got lunch and dinner too.

Best place in CT. Spend always a lot of time her when in CT and it never disapoints..getteing better each time..old classics and new places..safe and clean and a lot to see and easy to find goid food and drinks...a must do...recomended

Good complex and views. The V&A waterfront has lots of restaurants and shops and is definitely worth visiting at all times of the day - for breakfast, brunch, lunch or dinner.
There are some beautiful views of Table Mountain from here too.

Excellent. I walked all around this lovely waterfront and found it very interesting. Plenty of shops for all your needs, supplies, clothes and there is a wonderful shopping mall.The waterfront is also a great place to eat as there are plenty of restaurants and bars. There is also a very good craft market .The waterfront was clean and very well kept.

Something for Everyone!. Something for everyone! A decent mall with many different retail shops and restaurants. Stunning views of the harbour and Table Mountain. There are often excellent street performers of all sorts busking in the communal area outside the mall. The perfect place for tourists to pick up a souvenir of their trip to Africa. The Robin Island Ferry leaves from here, and there are many other types of boating trips on offer in the harbour.

A "Mall" worth visiting. This is more than just a 'mall'. V & A is a complete one stop destination suitable for all age groups. You can just browse outside or enjoy the shopping experience inside. The "food market" is absolutely interesting with great options for all dietary requirements.Well worth a visit.

So much choice. Lots to see and do in the V&A Waterfront. Lots of choices of restaurants. The service levels are high and, at some places, so are the prices. However, most places are reasonable and serve good fare. We love it and often go to the Waterfront as a treat.
Nice place to while away time.. Great atmosphere. Restaurants. Pier for boa tride to Robbens Island. Some rides. A pictures stand to take pictures with Table Mountain as backdrop. Souvenir shops.

THE place to be!. The best mall in the whole of South Africa as well as a working harbour and playground for young and old. With high end boutiques to expensive jewellery to over-priced (for the locals!) curios as well as more budget friendly options. Fantastic restaurants and take out joints. Night clubs and pubs and family friendly steak houses. Art, culture,music, sport..you name it, the V & A has got it. Everyone has to go there at least once in their lives.
So much to see - recommended. Great waterfront. History, views, food, bars, shops and entertainment. Ideal spot to chill after a long flight.
safe area!. Spent a few fun evenings here. This place is always full of people! but still great fun. and one also feels very very safe here.. even past midnight!
Awesome Waterfront. Great waterfront area with lots of things to explore. Really safe and lots of shops and attractions to keep you busy. The boat to Robben Island leaves from here as well.
Nice Shopping and Dining. Victoria and Alfred Waterfornt is a nice shopping and entertainment area with excellent restaurants and a nice atmosphere. Plenty of (paid) parking facilities available

Part of the Cape Town experience.. Lot to see at the V & A.
Great shopping, restaurants and entertainment.
We returned many times during our stay.

Day trip. Excellent location! Lots of activities and very family friendly! Visit the Two Oceans Aquarium to see beautiful sharks up close and personal as well as the cutest penguins you will ever find. Take a sun set cruise out the harbor and appreciate the stunning view of Table Mountain. Lastly, do lots of shopping!

Terrific Historical Area. Terrific area to visit. It has been very well restored and is totally accessible for whatever you want to do. So many types of restaurants I lost count and the ones I used were very good and great value. This is also where you get boat trips and get to Robben island. A great area to shop, eat or drink. A must do on a Cape Town Visit. I loved it.
shopping. modern shopping center and niece place to stroll along, listening to music playing by street performers and have some food.

Touristy Treat. Yes it is touristy, but it is also an fascinating place to visit, overlooked by the majestic Table Mountain. The first time I went to check out what was happening there and started off my following the advertised trail around all the historical sights on the waterfront. There is a guided walk but I elected to make my own way round, following the signboards which give detailed information of all the stops on the walk. I went to the V&A every day of my holiday for one reason or another: to book my tour to Cape Point, to start the tour to Robben Island, to catch the boat for the sunset harbour cruise, to watch the street entertainers, to see the sea lions, to buy some lovely Cape Town books but mainly to eat and drink. There are any number of restaurants and bars to suit all tastes and price ranges, although nothing is expensive – most evenings I had delicious seafood and two or three glasses of Cape wine for less than 200 Rand (£10). It is also a shoppers’ paradise for those who like shopping.

Nice, but overrated!. Like most of our attractions in SA, this place is so expensive and over the top kitch. Only overseas visitors still fall for this tourist trap. You can go to numerous other places, which is much cheaper with the same amenities, minus the boat trips!
Snobby but relaxing and beautiful . Very nice place at the water with lots of shops and restaurants. The high society stays here it seems but very nice to visit and walk around.

Great place to shop and dine. What a great location for shopping and dining. Also home to the Aquarium. Shops range from souvenir to high end. The variety of restaurants will keep you from ever going hungry.

Our favourite spot in Capetown!. Our hotel was about 10 min walk to V&A Waterfront so we frequented this spot a lot as it offers many cheap but delicious restaurants/ eateries/ food court. Also many shops and attractions too! This is also the ferry terminal to Robben Island, but you must prebook as it gets sold out fast.
Sightseeing. Excellent place to spend a day or more. plenty of shops, restaurants and bars.A trip to Robben Island can be arranged from here.

V & A Waterfront. Just the most complete Cape Town experience from the range of shops, amenities and services to the environment and spectacular vistas.
If you have only one day to spare in Cape Town, the V & A Waterfront must be on your list..!

Most beautiful setting. This must surely be one of the best waterfronts in the world. The atmosphere is great, so much to see, from craft markets to fashionable boutiques, every type of restaurant, music from buskers, seals frolicking in the harbour.

Morning and Evening Strolls. Excellent hub for foodies and shopaholics alike with a consortium of options to reduce your ZAR.
Very pleasant region with a friendly, safe feel while walking after dark.

Vibrant waterfront shops and restaurants. The waterfront is a great place to spend an afternoon- it has everything for the young and old. The two young ones with us enjoyed the aquarium. The mall has the usual major chains. Excellent restaurants around, including Harbour House. Great African markets, best and most reasonably priced being the African Trading Post.

Excellent Shopping. Very nice shopping mall. Has most of the normal mall stores as well as a few unique stores not found elsewhere. We specially went to the center for one item and we found it so we were pleasantly surprised.

Great Restaurant Variety. There is something for everyone here but the best thing is all the restaurants. You can sit outside and watch the hustle and bustle around the water or sit inside. A great variety of cuisine and all very yummy. Presentation is everything in Cape Town.
Cosmopolitan. A very cosmopolitan feel to the Waterfront. Some excellent restaurants, bars and shops. Also the departure point to Robben Island.

Tourists Place, however, dont miss it. There you will find many stores, from big international franchises to small handcraft market, tour options for Fishing, Cage Diving with great whites, the Two Oceans Aquarium, the Robben Island ferries, bars, restaurants.
A must go if you are visiting cape town.

Something for everyone - if you are in Cape Town you will end up here at least once. Yes, it is touristy but if you are in Cape Town you will probably end up here (at least once) for a meal, to visit the aquarium, to shop, to stay or just to wander around. There is quite a large mall that quite frankly could be anywhere in the world. Great if you need something, otherwise not very interesting. Our favourite parts of the Waterfront were the Watershed building where there are all sorts of local crafts (some crafty some touristy) but at least it is not stuff you see in every shop in every country around the world. We picked up some really nice mementos and gifts here. We also loved the food market with the variety of stalls serving all sorts of food. Travelling with a 17 year old boy we are ALWAYS on the look out for food as he tends to ALWAYS be hungry.Casual, varied and inexpensive - PERFECT.We also had a lovely meal at one of the restaurants - lots of meat but that is to be expected as it was a steak restaurant.
Day out with a friend. A day out with a friend from out of town , seeing the sights , shopping & lunch. Good atmosphere , live local music. Variety of shops & restaurants. Parking available.

Good to walk around on a rainy morning. Goos place to spend a couple (or more if you like shopping) of hours. Plenty of shops ans craft stalls to look around. Beware the little units in the mall, they wanted R195 for a travel plug but the electrical shop just a few steps away sold same for R80. The area was very clean & safe and lots to see inside & out

You cannot miss this one. Must pay visit place. You can spend one full day at this place, with whole variety of activities and beautiful restaurants at offer. The waterfront is well designed with flavour of tourism and the actual port activity happening in background with business as usual. Aquarium is must visit if you have kids with you. Bunch of good resturants around as well, you can sit back and relax at the waterfront.

Dynamic Experience for all. The Victoria & Alfred Waterfront is a dynamic centre not only filled with a variety of resturants and shops, it offers a wide vairiety of other activities such as markets, movie theatres, boat trips as well as lively pubs that often play live music. Nestled under the Table Mountain, it is a must experience and see. Exceptionally beautiful!

V&A Waterfront is tourists galore, with prices to compare with care.. Variety of shipping, shopping and sight-seeing; this is what the V&A Waterfront is all about....tourists galore, prices high, parking frustrating and views of the Mountain breathtaking.

Great experience. Great for shopping, walking and eating out with something for everyone in the family.Beautiful ,relaxing restaurants by the water for lunch or dinner. Good selection of shopping - local and international.

Not to be missed. The V&A waterfront in Capetown is not to missed. It is first of all very safe, vibrant and full of life and energy. the Shopping is great with the food and vista not to be missed. It is easy to spend a day here,

Must see. Lots to do and see at the V & A very picturesque, safe and clean. Pricey but comes with the territory. You can go from high end shopping to the arts and crafts market, the aquarium, the ferry rides. It is a great place to see and discover in a relaxed atmosphere. Lots of performances by local dance groups and bands as you wonder about. The big wheel gives it a fair sort of feel.
Waterfront Cape Town. Lots of street entertainment and food. A wonderful afternoon and evening of walking around. Also, a bunch of boating tours around the harbour at very reasonable prices.

Great place to wander around. As visitor attractions go, this area is clean, safe and full of shops and restaurants. Everything from burgers to fine dining. Lots of touristy shops, but a nice mall also with every shop you could think of
You can see a shopping centre anywhere. It's a shopping centre - and the restaurants are not the best in the area - travel a little away from it for food.

A fun-filled, festive and buzzing place to visit and enjoy.. A traveller will be spoilt for choice from the vast array of activities and food places to eat at . There is also a huge shed type mall which sells arts and crafts and handmade local goods. I mostly enjoyed the new food court which is housed in another building offering the decadent food and food products , juices ,eats and treats. I was even amazed to find food products suitable for the Banting dieter. I loved the real home cooked freshness feel of the food, so unlike the regular fast-food processed products one usually eats as an in-between meal. The people of the Cape are happy-go-lucky party animals , so you would hear music and tricks being performed in the walkways . it is just so lave with activity . it is a "must-see" place

A destination in the mother city were locals also have fun. ... I love the ambience and atmosphere at the waterfront with lots to see and do. As a local I enjoy the variety of resturant and I keep coming back for more...

Great place to hang out in Cape Town. Lovely place to spend time in Cape Town one of the highlights with lots of eating option and bars to enjoy and relax and plenty of shopping opportunities and big wheel and other attractions all in one great area

Apartment highly recommended, Juliette B, #407. We booked this on line from Australia which was a cumbersome procedure as we wanted a 7 night booking, the minimum. We had to provide a bond and also sign a lease.However it was well worth it as the apartment is wonderful, excellent location, views, well equipped, quiet, private and so secure.We are only five minutes walk to the shops, restaurants, hop on and off bus, aquarium etc. All so safe and secure and amazing. Love it so much . Perfect place to stay in Capetown, reasonably priced and with a gym and a number of swimming pools and free parking. Excellent in every way.

Everything for a very good day out. A day in and around the Waterfront can be as variable as one wishes: Just stroll around the harbour side and enjoy seeing all kinds of boats, catamarans etc. Many of them also offers tourist trips. On a sunny day a helicopter flight is a good and surprisingly not too expensive option. Also watch out for the see lions in the water or on their -rather smelly- platform. Lovely but a bit more pricey food can be found in the Belgian restaurant "Den Anker", more typical food is provided in the Traditional Food Market. The central Mall offers a nice variation of shops. If lucky Table Mountain is visible without clouds. Watch out for the big frame from where one can take nice TM pictures. A bit outside the V&A Waterfront one can walk along the beach and enjoy seeing the surfers. Nice way to start one's holiday.
Lots of hype here!. Fascinating to wander around and see what;s there in the way of shops and restaurants, as well as the waterfront it self. Worth at least half a day.

Great place to visit!. I stayed 2 weeks and Cape Town and the V&A Waterfront was a place I visited almost everyday, and I always had something new to do!You can really feel safe there. you have great restaurants and is the place to buy souvenirs!Must visit!

Absolutely buzzing..... ...... with people, life, music & entertainment. So much to see & do you probably will need a couple of visits. Tremendous choice of places to eat to suit all tastes and prices are very good - just make sure you get a taxi /secure transport there..... walking is a bit of a 'no no'
Undergoing construction work. Was a bit noisy but still one of the nicest places to visit in CPT. Great restaurants but most a pretty pricey now. Beautiful views and certainly worth a visit
Shoppers Paradise. What a place to go. Everything under one roof and plenty parking available. Something for all in the family, young or old.

So much to see and do. The waterfront area is a wonderful place to spend your days or evenings. There is so much to see and do. The shop prices are not out of line, like you might expect in a trendy tourist area, nor are the restaurants overpriced.

Happening Place with Loads to Do!. Our travel agent had thoughtfully arranged for us to stay at a hotel on the V&A Waterfront - its a great place to be based as there is plenty to do in the area.It looks like the locals know this too - a shopping mall, plenty of speciality retailers selling souvenirs and the like ... as well as a regular change of buskers keeping the place busy and interesting.We also found that there was a great selection of restaurants in this area: we managed to enjoy several nice meals in the area (please see my other reviews) as there was plenty to choose from.There were plenty of families wandering about, so it looks like smaller children are well catered for (there was a playground being reconstructed while we were there) and a small ferris wheel adds to the attraction. A lot of the water based tours of Cape Town depart from the V&A Waterfront (for example, our tour to Robben Island) ... so if you're looking for something to do, you can always wander around and see what's on offer.A great place to start or finish (or as we did, spend the entire time) your holiday in Cape Town.
Busy and Touristy but Beautiful. It is easy to spend a ton of time here since there is so much to do. It is easy to find good restaurants and activities the whole family will enjoy.
a must visit. if you are in capetown then highly recommended to visit the V & A waterfront. nice place for shopping dining and plenty of activities going on too.

Familiar, but soooo different!. We stayed at the Cape Grace, so there was nothing about this spot we didn't like. You can't make a mistake here. Every attraction, restaurant and view is a winner. Very safe, very clean, very tourist friendly. It might make you feel like you are at any harbor side redevelopment anywhere in the world, but, hey, you've got continuous views of Table Mountain to let you know you are not in Kansas anymore!

Good for multiple visits. This became our almost daily visit spot during our stay. Thoroughly enjoyed the environment and the tons of things to see and do. There are so many awesome restaurants and you can walk around taking in the views, sit and people watch or go shopping in the huge mall!
Toursty but worth a visit. Vibrant and the epicentre of Cape Town's tourist areas. Lots of restaurants for every budget and taste. Definately take a sunset cruise from here!

Nice place but bad experience with non-metere taxis.. This was a great place to visit, dine and shop. All visitors must visit. A word of caution though. If you intend to catch at taxi from the V&A drop off point, the so-called guards would always call for non-metered taxi. Apparently these non-taxi owned the turf around the circular where one get dropped by. A metered taxi can drop you off but they are not allowed to pick up passengers. We had a bad experience as we did not want the non-metered taxi and when a metered taxi dropped off a passenger we got into that taxi. The non-metered taxi guy became aggressive and abusive towards the metered taxi driver. Hint. Walked outside on the main road and grab a metered taxi.

Lovely place . Lovely place in Cape Town. We really enjoyed walking around, looking at the entertainers and having a browse around the shops. There is a lovely atmosphere here and all the restaurants and cafés we tried were lovely. The big wheel was also great for seeing it from above
Nice history. Besides the nice restaurants in the area there is a bit of history to be discovered if you take the time. Awesome views of Table Mountain from the restaurants.
Always has a great vibe. Lovely vibe with music ,restaurants ,bars , coffee bars & great shopping with views of the sea & Table Mountain.A must for all visitors .

Dinner, shopping and views!. This is a great area for a little shopping culture and dinner. had an amazing afternoon went on a boat ride saw the trading post you will want to go here. floors of African art, masks, rugs if you can think it about a souvenir it is here. Very pricey and i do mean pricey but amazing to look at.
Lively and fun!. The are so many restaurants and pubs to choose from. The shopping is wonderful so expect to spend a while. Always free shows and lots of activities for the children.

Must visit on the list of things to do in Cape Town !. Must visit . It's a very vibrant place , has lots of food options and you can even do shopping and relax and stroll around . I love the place .it has few bars and pubs as well .

Fun place to spend a little bit of time!. This is a cute area with shopping and eating. It is especially pretty in the evening when it is all lit up. There are people playing live music and entertaining. Its definitely worth a visit for a few hours, but you don't need to spend a lot of time unless you want to do some shopping.

a must for a visit to CT. great place to visit - several times when in Cape Town with a wide range of restaurants and shops to cater for all tastes. from top of the range shops through to everyday shops. from fast food/takeaways to top class restaurants covering a wide range of foods. also worth visiting is the food market with a wide range of food available to suite a wide range of tastes - try the taste of Africa run by two ladies who serve great African food and fantastic prices -R40 for a great tasty meal of pap, beef stew, moroko and coleslaw
Disneyland comes to SA. A continually evolving artificial environment offering shopping and dining. Obviously successful, but not a representative of the beauty of SA.
Safe lovely environment . Great family places, loads of activities and shopping to do. U can't be here for an hour. yoU need atleast a day or two to experience it all. Lots of fun for all ages

Shop & Eat til you drop. Many, many restaurants and stores to see. We ate at several of the restaurants on the waterfront and enjoyed them all. Shopping was leisurely with lots to see, something for everyone. The mall area also has lots to peruse but we preferred to be outside on the waterfront. There is also The Shed (a bit like Soho in NYC) and The Marketplace (culinary specialties), also quite enjoyable to stroll thru.Take some time to familiarize yourself with the different areas, we went out sightseeing each day and returned here each day for dinner. We also stayed within walking distance to make it easier.Just in case you were concerned there is security visible everywhere.
Something for everyone. A large area with a shopping mall, fun for kids and adults. Also great just to sit around and people watch.
Nice atmosphere. We visitied visited the waterfront very often during our capetown trip. The place is really lively with lots of nice little areas. Lots of nice shops and restaurants.

Necessary stop in CT. Shops, hotels and posh private celebrity condos along the canal. Wide selection of eats. Good place to try hake and chips fast-food style. There's a nearby crafts market which I enjoyed more than the mall. The Two Oceans Aquarium is also here. Take the Hop-on Hop Off Tour. Definitely worth it.

Lots to do at the V&A Waterfront. At first I thought this was just another shopping mall and tourist trap (and it's both, for sure) but there's so much happening here that you can't help but visit a few times.
Lovely restaurants. Lovely restaurants and shops all in one area. Great day and night out. Food to suit all budgets and tastes.
A visit here provides lots of great opportunities for shopping and dining. A wonderful shopping experience with plenty of good restaurants - very characterful without being too touristy.

The only place in Cape Town you feel secure in the evening. If you have visited Cape Town, you understand. In the center of city everything is closed after 5 p.m. and you feel scared if you happen to be there. The waterfront is the only place you feel secure and may enjoy both shopping and good eating

A must see when you visit Cape Town. An extensive with a number of shops, restaurants, and attractions, the Victoria and Albert Waterfront is one of Cape Towns top tourist attractions. Considering staying at one of the excellent hotels: the Table Bay Hotel has been our choice for our three trips to Cape Town.
Pleasant day out. Spent the day at the Waterfront. There is lots to see and do and many eating options. Craft Market was a bit disappointing.

Beautiful active boulevards which includes a working dock.... Such a lovely boulevard of shops and the lovely V & A Hotel as well as a huge range of cafes and restaurants. It is a really fun and buzzy place to visit with a very extensive shopping mall with a great variety of brands. This is a great spot for local crafts and food. What is amazing is that the wharf area is still a working wharf so you will see large ships being worked on. This is just a great spot with a local active feel. Highly recommended for a stroll where you can find reasonably priced food and delicious coffee.

Comfortable living. The apartment block we were given at this gated residential condominium was called Falconier. It has an amazing view. The security level was tight. No one got in without the proper authorisation or electronic keys. It was fully equipped with good working condition appliance for self-catering and was clean. It was clean and extremely homely. To add to this it was walking distance to all the top-notch restaurants, the harbour front and even the aquarium. So in the evenings we did our own thing and explored the area. We even walked to catch the ferry from the harbour to Robben Island. The only complain I may have is a minor one. I felt that the cleaners weren't always through with their cleaning and I had to remind them a few times to change the sheets since it is part of their service to change it every other day. Perhaps it is a petty thing but if you are entitled to clean sheets every other day and you have paid for you, shouldn't it be fulfilled? Otherwise it is a fantastic place to spend your holidays with family or just as couples especially when you know you are completely safe.
Vibrant shopping, eating and drinking centre. Definitely worth a visit for some shopping and leisure time if that's what you want. Good vibrant feel to the area, especially at night.

Excellent all round family members place. Excellent all round family members place, lots of activities to do, from helicopter to boat rides, Cape Town Comedy Club, food market, excellent restaurants and shops.
Need to visit. It has everything. Shopping, restaurants, entertainment, a local microbreeary, ATM's, day tour starting place, etc.

Nice way to spend a Saturday afternoon. Visited the V&A this past Saturday. Shopping is great. The V&A Food Market is a must. A variety of different tastes for all. We tried the Hungry Herbivore (excellent Vegan food).

A must go. No matter if you want to go shopping, having lunch or just relaxing at a nice place with a coffee or some snacks - the v&a waterfront is definitely the rift r place for all these things. Getting there is very easy and even in the evening it's quite secure because of all the public safety guards. We have been in the cinema too, which was also very nice.

Abundance and variety of eateries and shopping. There is history and shoppes and loads of restaurants. Bridges to cross on foot and a wonderful museum about Nelson Mandela and Robbins Island. We walked over and over again for breakfast and dinner, shopping and more. Lots of security too. Don't miss it. Very glad we choose this location to stay.

Cosmopolitan & Chic. Very Cosmopolitan and upmarket. You feel totally safe in this area and you can also get to Robbin Island from here. The shops are limited for fashion if you like designer but the food restaurants are all very high quality. A lovely afternoon walking round in the sun with lovely lunch and evening meal options.

Great way to spend the day - but the shopping mall ruins the vibe. Overall, this is an awesome place to walk around, shop, eat and access the Robbin Island tour. However, the large mall really disappoints and should be avoided. Best to seek out the smaller shops, food stalls and kiosks in the surrounding area.

V & A Waterfront. V & A waterfront, a very very nice area. Went there every night. All kinds of restaurants and attractions, a small shopping center.
We enjoyed trying different restaurants every night.

V&A Waterfront. Located in my home city this is somewhere I have visited since I was a little girl. The V&A has so much to offer - many shops and restaurants. There are also many souvenir shops for the tourists. Walk along the harbor wall with an ice-cream and enjoy local bands that often play on the grounds.

Good Shopping. Great place to visit on a rainy day. We had a couple of rainy days in Cape Town so ended up at V&A. With all the shops and eateries in the mall, we caught up on our souvenir shopping and enjoyed a couple of meals here. They also have movie theaters and a great view of the water. Good selection of local and chain stores. Even better on a clear day so you can enjoy the view and walk around outside.

One of my most favorite places!. This is one of my most favorite places that I have ever been! Limitless activities, shops, restaurants and entertainment. There are offices for all of the activities in Cape Town so it is really easy to book them! And it is absolutely beautiful there, right on the bay with gorgeous views of Table Mountain. And it is very inexpensive! I was amazed at how cheap everything was for the quality. Some of the best quality I have found at restaurants and activities for very reasonable prices.
The place to be. Brilliant bars and restaurants so much to see and do. If you like rugby go to the springbok museum just across the road you will not regret it.

Nice buzz and lots of things to do. The V&A Waterfront in Cape Town is a waterfront with great facilities. Numerous restaurants shops and also boat trips etc from the waterfront. There are undercover parking and a very safe environment.

Large mall, nice setting. The mall itself is like any other large mall you may come across with the same shops and restaurants. What makes this one special is the setting. With a view over the ocean and Table Mountain this is a beautiful place to sit and watch the world go by.

One of the better waterfronts. Waterfront developments seem to be two a penny nowadays, a must have for any town or city with a stretch of water.Some are poor attempts to cash in and, metaphorically, mug the punters - this one is at the better end of the scale.Yes it has it's obscenely priced properties and it has it's shops, although they cater for all tastes from high end to the affordable.The same can be said of the restaurants from the ubiquitous fast food outlets to specialist seafood and African eateries they cater for all tastes and all budgets - with the more exclusive being eye wateringly expensive.It's an area where you feel safe, even at night and getting a taxi back to you hotel is easy and safe.

Upscale Shopping. Everything you could want in one location - along with great restaurant. Easy exterior access but little or few interior maps. Difficult to locate specific shops. Wish I had brought an empty suitcase !!!

One of the best options in Cape Town. The V & A is a safe place to wander around, see the lovely local crafts, go to the movies, see a great range of retail, and have lunch or dinner. Truly impressive!
Stay in a hotel in Waterfront, there is a range of options of all prices, the One&Only is my preference.

Large mall with restaurants and shops. Was convenient and quick walk from our hotel. Kids loved walking over there for a quick bite or snack. It was an easy option for us to dine if we didn't feel like going far from the hotel. Mall has just about every store you need.

Great dinner place. We went through the mall to the opposite end. There we found a restaurant outside. It was on the left side under the canopy, the steak was definitely the best I have ever had. The service was good also. The bathrooms were very clean.

WONDERFUL WATERFRONT AT CAPE TOWN.. The Waterfront at Cape Town is an amazingly vibrant place to visit for shopping, restaurants, and for entertainment. In two days we had dinner there twice, and saw street artists, singers, and street musicians. Went to a very noisy pub with a great band. Obviously a popular place for tourists and locals alike. Loved it, and every kind of food and drink available, and value for money.

Just go Ahead and Make it A DAY!. Plan to spend the day here with your family or friends.Perfect place to have an adventure, go shopping to your heart's content, eat until you pop, drink until the sunsets and into the night, take a cruise, sit and people watch,catch a movie, a comedy show,some history or just enjoy the sight and sounds of Cape Town! There has never been a more perfect place on this planet!Bring your wallet and your game face for the best day ever! p.s. And wear your walking shoes too!

A Must Go!. You can spend a few hours here shopping in the mall or stores and has many good restaurants. This is the place where you can access all of Cape Town's activities...from cage diving with sharks to helicopter rides

Plenty to do. The V & A whilst primarily a shopping mall has so much else to offer. Plenty eateries as well as boat trips in the harbour or out to sea. Helicopter rides, live shows etc. Nice outdoor walking and dining as well. I hate shopping centres but this one is worth visiting.

One of the best attractions in SA. Glorious outing when bathed in sunlight. The fully pedestrianised waterfront is a delight to walk around and uncover hidden gems. There are plenty of food outlets to suit all tastes and pockets. This is easily a full day's attraction and can be extended further through taking in boat trips.
Nice place to shop and eat. Enjoyed the shops along the waterfront. Fun to walk along the pier. Nice hotels in the area. A little pricey.
So busy yet so relaxed . We love going to the waterfront as busy as it is it has the most incredible vibe it is exciting and energetic yet it is so relaxing and the restraurants are great

Excellent Atmosphere. We browsed the shops, went to Robben Island from here and enjoyed the live entertrainers neat the "big wheel". A must for any visitor to Cape Town.
There also a prayer room at the V&A.

Bigger than expected. Loved the waterfront! Did some great shopping and some great eating! It was great to see so many different people walk about the mall and enjoy it. Initially, did not expect it to be as big as it was.

Shop shop shop... As if you are in all the countries of the world. V&A is most definitely the hub for tourists and locals. You will find a variety of shops local and international brand. V&A is a stylish shopping mall with tons of different eateries and coffee shops. The best about the v&a is that you are facing the harbour with the spectacular view of table mount. You don't have to feel guilty for going to a mall in perfect weather. You can enjoy a sunset cruise, walk to the watershed market or the food market, you can wine and done, shop till you drop or party the night away. As a South African I love going to the v&a as it makes me feel as if I'm part of a world community with all the different languages you can hear around you.

nice location lots to see. If like to shop and wander around the different small shops this is the place for you. We visited on a rainy day and was excellent to browse all the small stalls selling theirs wares.

Something for everyone!. There are a great variety of restaurants and shops selling clothing, African-made souvenirs, etc. This area is right on the waterfront. and felt very trendy, safe and welcoming.

Great place to visit. This place is good for all round entertainment. I do feel that they could spend more money on entertaining the visitors as the property has huge income revenues. Holistically there is so much to do at the Waterfront including Eating, Drinking, Movies, Sight Seeing and Shopping. The shopping can be pricey so be careful not to buy too many luxury items at this mall. Enjoy!
Shopping and eating.. Great place for eating, shopping, tours to Robben island, historical. Many restaurants, live music too. Fish is a speciality.
Nice visit. Nice stores - very touristy, but the views are fabulous. The local craft artists building was the best.

A must. It is the Eden of all tourists. Whatever you did during the day, it seems most tourists will gather here in the afternoon or evenings either for shopping, eating or strolling. Strolling along the water front or simply along the harbour canals is relaxing.

The place to be. It is the place where it all happens.Excellent choice of restaurants and shopping which open 7 days a week and practice quite good prices.As we went in Winter there was not too much entertainment though.
Lots to do. Great shopping and restaurants. The most visited tourist spot in South Africa. It is a working harbour as well. Wonderful mountain and sea views and lots to do.

Nice day out. Awesome shopping and not just all the brands there but some really unique African and more specifically south African goods. It not cheap so take a wod of cash but the restaurants are lovely and it is a whole day trip

Beautiful place.. Some very expensive shops in the mall, although they are mixed in with other types of shop too. Lovely fresh foods available in the food market. The mall is huge and fantastic to spend time window shopping.

Decent shopping mall with a mix of excellent eateries. This is a large, safe mall with a lot of good restaurants. I'd suggest browsing until you find your flavour and don't neglect the eateries not under the main shopping mall roof such as Den Anker.
Beautiful Waterfront. A great place to walk around with or without kids. There are great restaurants at all price levels. Some with great views. A wide range of stores to shop in.

Alright . Fun place to be at. Loads of restaurants and shopping to be done at the Waterfront. Always busy no matter what day of the week you go, but Sunday is the best day to go as local groups can be seen dancing or singing for visitors.
Shopping is a bit expensive though.

Good shopping. The shopping is very easy and convenient at the V&A waterfront. There are some amazing high end shops here as well as good branches of Woolworths. I chose to walk along the upper level as it's much quieter up there and the smart shops appear to be all on that level. We also parked in the Breakwater car park on an upper level and you can walk across the bridge into the shopping centre.

awesome views of Cape Town. Lots of activities at the V&A, the sea and a number of excursions to Seal island, helicopter rides and the big Wheel provides a panoramic view of the city. Lots of high end shops and local shops to cater for all tastes and budgets and restaurants. Entertainment is great with locals performing different art forms and music.

Fun place to see. This is a fun place to find a place to eat on the waterfront. Definitely touristy but fun. We went to a very good restaurant there unfortunately I don't remember the name. Go at sunset as it is a beautiful harbor

Great restaurants and shopping.. The restaurants in the area are all excellent and great value for money. There are designer stores of course, no shopping mall would be complete without them. The waterfront is otherwise full of curiosities and popular fixtures. There is a tableaux of Nobel Prize winners from South Africa that is worth visiting. Adjacent to this is an indoor food court with various ethnic foods, again very inexpensive and well prepared.

Something for Everyone. Not only is the area beautiful, but the selection of shops, restaurants, and more is quite complete. Tourist shops and attractions are mixed with quality shops at the mall. Fast food, elegant food, and all in between is available. A must for anyone visiting Cape Town.
Must do in Cape Town. Nice restaurants, shops. Amazing atmosphere. You should definitely visit the waterfront in the evening.

Shop, Eat, Walk, Drink, Enjoy!!. One of the most convenient and safe locations in Cape Town. The V & A Water Front is beautiful place with nice waterfront views and table mountain in the backdrop, a picture perfect place. Its one of the most popular destinations amongst tourist for souvenirs shopping, mall, food joints and ofcourse the waterfront itself. Will easily spend a day without realizing. Worth it

Mixed feelings. I'm not gonna lie, I totally get how interesting the V&A is for the economy of Cape Town. But unfortunately it is a place only for the rich people of the city and for tourists. I was sad that it didn't do much to provide for all levels of population to come.It was nice enough. There's lots to do. Go there. I'm a grump and I wasn't too impressed.

Beautiful Waterfront. The waterfront area is very beautiful but quite touristy. There is a huge mall with many shops and restaurants as well as a small amphitheater for outdoor concerts and impromptu dance and music groups performing for the tourists. Be sure to walk around and see the statues in Nobel Square and take a photo in the Table Mountain "frame".

Great place to shop, eat, and enjoy yourself. Before going to Cape Town we thought we would go here for a quick visit. We ended up going here every day we were in the area. This is a nice relaxed place to just have fun, shop, eat dinner in the foodcourt or any of the dozens of restaurants.Very nice, do not miss it if you are in the area!

A great attraction. The V and A waterfront is a popular tourist attraction and always has many visitors.There is so much to see.Beautiful Boats all day long,plenty of birds flying around,a multitude of shops and restaurants,coffee places etc.I would go there again and again.Very relaxing too.Its a one of its kind place in Cape Town.

Something for everyone. Sat on the waterfront with a fabulous view of Table Mountain (weather permitting) the V&A waterfront offers a bit of everything. For the history fans you can take a tour and see the battery and the clock tower, nature lovers can see seals in the harbour water and visit the snake trailer for 15Rand, foodies will love the range of restaurants (my fave the tribakery even serves marmite on toast!). Shoppers can spend days browsing in the giant covered mall picking up everything from shoes to souvenirs. A smaller boutique style mall offers more unique items at reasonable prices. Good transport links, the gateway to Robben Island and the starting point for Big Bus Tours - this really is a must see place when in Cape Town.

Always enjoyable. There's a lot to like in the V&A, it's central, safe and has something for everyone. A huge choice of shops, restaurants, fast food and 2 multi screen cinemas.Not the cheapest shopping in Cape but a good place to spend a few hours.

Great waterfront!. It's a great waterfront, you can walk around and explore, they has free concerts on Fridays and Saturdays when I was there. It is also pretty safe to walk around by yourself, I never had any problems. There are alot of great restaurants, outside entertainment, and markets.

Nice Development. Many nice shops and restaurants. Reminded me of malls back in the U.S., but it was still fun to hang out here. I would recommend the Waterfront if you want to relax and do some great shopping in your free time.

So much to do!. This is a lovely area with plenty to do. The shopping is great, lots of high quality souvenirs and goods available at a low cost compared to what we pay in North America. The area feels safe and it is very clean.
Great food and shops.. We went back a number of times to pick up forgotten necessities and to just be tourists. The food choices were great as were the shops. Definitely worth visiting.

Hidden Gems. If you like me enjoy spicing up a business suit with a lovely scarf, do keep an eye open for the scarf stand in the V7 A. picked up two lovely scarves this evening for R 120.00 for the pair. For our international travellers $ 10.00 or GBP 6.00

Shopping and dining at the V and A Waterfront. Similar to Bangkok's Asiatique waterfront made of many state of the art shops, entertainment and restaurant outlets. Good to spend half a day there. Went to the movies, did some shopping, visited a barber and had some food.

My favourite place. The best place for turist, good views of Table Mountain, Clifton Hill and Devil peak. You can find a good food market, shopping mall, boat to many kind of trip even to island to see the prision where Mandela stayed for ages.
Fun. The waterfront is a hip, fun place to walk, shop, dine and people watch. The hotels in this area are great, as well.
Classic waterfront. Good restaurants, live music, and shopping malls. There are also some souvenir shops so if you need to pick up some gifts for family back home, you can do it here.

Cape Town holiday. What a great buzzy place . Lots of eateries, markets, mall shopping and many more attractions (ie) the big wheel. The area appeared safe pretty much any time and the walking access round the water front is great.

More than a Wharf. My best recommendation is to get a map. There are so many great shops and eateries that can be overlooked without a map or a guide. Be prepared to spend a good part of a day there - and get on the carousel!

Sail, Walk, Shop, Eat and Have Funnnn.....!!!!!!. We had a shuttle service from our hotel. You can walk outside near the water or on the other side of the mall. The shopping mall is big enough and has good choice of stores. We did a short sailing trip in one of the boats from waterfront. Mall has good choice of restaurants. The mall is safe. People singing in the evenings and entertaining people outside is great. Overall recommend visit to this place.
VA Waterfront one of the most beautiful places in this world.. guys, my wife and I loved this place especially the sunsets early this year 2015. This is one of the most beautiful places I have seen.

Don't go during Tourist Season. While the V&A is a located in a great spot and has many shops/restuarants/attractions it is a tourist trap. During December holidays it is busy and over-crowded and pricey!!!Otherwise in the quieter months it's pretty decent and the prices go down...slightly The live performances and being by the water are the selling points for me.
One stop shopping.. Visit the V&A on a regular basis and it never disappoints. One stop shopping. You can find just about everything.
Shop and eat. Safe and lots of shops - a lot of American brands. May be a little pricier here since it's by the waterfront and caters to a lot of tourists. Also house a lot of different restaurants.

Fun ferris wheel photos. This is an attractive, but touristy area of Cape Town. We ate meals there twice because we were staying nearby, but I wouldn't feel compelled to visit this area if time was limited.
V&A Never Disappoints. Shopping is always a pleasure, there is a few excellent restaurants, you never get bored at Victoria & Alfred Waterfront
Plenty of Choice and Places to Eat & Drink. Great place to eat, drink and watch the world go by. We ate most evenings at the V&A waterfront. So much choice and the food was of a very high standard.
Pretty and convenient.. It's pretty and has everything you may need, grocery stores, clothing, the cinema. But be prepared to pay slightly more than elsewhere.

Most happening part of Cape Town. V&A waterfront is undoubtedly the most lively and vibrant part of Cape Town. There are lot of activities here, especially for the night time when you won’t be able to enjoy the traditional attractions like Table Mountain, Beaches or Gardens. There are lot of waterfront side restaurants with amazing good, a huge ‘Victoria Wharf’ mall with upscale as well as affordable brands good for shopping and a large number of shops selling souvenirs which you might find difficult to find elsewhere (given these are organized, you will not find so much variety elsewhere). We were staying close to the V&A Waterfront (Portswood hotel) which is a stone’s throw away and had great nights at the waterfront. One can go on a lot of sea cruises. We did the Cape Wheel tour which is good for some aerial views of this part of the town. In the morning time, you can go out the mall and near the seafront which has some amazing views and presents great photo-ops. All-in-all, a lovely place in Cape Town

What a gem. To find a working harbour that so linked with a vibrant tourist attraction is scarce. The place is upmarket and you can spend a day just browsing all the alleys and boutique stores. Have a drink at the many bars and restaurants. Go out on harbour tours with a boat. So much happening. From the ultra high end price bracket to everyday average price ranges. There is always something happening 24/7.

Beautiful restaurants in spotless surroundings. We spent a week in Cape Town doing "tourist stuff" and then every evening tried a different restaurant on the Waterfront and afterwards walked around the shops. The Waterfront is very clean and families are everywhere. Restaurants are superb, but i recommend you book. The Waterfront is also very busy, all day and evening.

A wide range of shops, eating places and activities. A very good attraction for those who enjoy cities and shopping. The range of shops are wide, from chain to speciality and curio shops. Good for browsing. There are also a wide range of eateries from take-aways to upmarket restaurants. More attractive architecture and setting than the majority of malls. Buskers and events add a lively vibe. However, if you are looking for a specific shop or restaurant, directions non-existent as far as I could see. There is an information kiosk, but in the absence of a map this is not very useful.

Awesome first place to visit when you are in Cape Town. Buzzing with tourists, perfect place for one to try out various SA cuisines. We went on the Seal Sight trip on our first day there. Was around 45 minutes but worth every minute of it. you get to see the entire V&A waterfront. Also a perfect place to hang out late as well. Place is filled with security so you feel a certain level of safety as well.

beautiful place with many restaurants. One of the main attractions in Cape Town. Although a bit touristic, it has good atmosphere with many good restaurants. There are also many tour agency selling different tour packages. We ended up going there almost every night for dinner.

A special day at the V&A Waterfront!!. Vibrant & cosmopolitan, the Waterfront is bursting with colour & people, music & exciting events...A surprise around every corner! Beautiful & bustling restaurants to suit whatever your taste, fantastic shopping, concerts at the amphitheater, boat & yacht trips , buskers & mime artists as to keep you entertained as well as the big wheel to view the city from a unique perspective!! Enjoy strolling through the newly renovated Watershed with all locally made SA products or try delicious fresh tastes at the Food Market Emporium next door!! Sit at one of the outdoor restaurants and listen to the sound of the sea birds, boats coming in and out of the Harbour & take in the colors of the water & Table Mountain as a magnificent backdrop! With so many choices of great things to do, you leave looking forward to the next time !!!
Fantastic honeymoon destination. Stayed here on honeymoon and had a great trip, felt very safe security on every corner. So easy to book activities such as helicopter rides, fishing, tours etc

Good to check out if you are already in the area. Good to check out if you are already in the area -- has a wide variety of shopping and restaurants. However for most tourists who visit cape town for the nature and wineries, this can be a skippable attraction
Nice for a wander.. The food shed is really good down here and its nice for a walk. It was quite far from our hotel so needed transport to get here and the restaurants were a little overpriced.
Beautiful Place. Lovely development. Good for shopping and sight seeing. There is also a lovely food court. Must visit place if you are in Cape Town
Waterfront. Wonderful restaurants and shops ... Jazz on Fridays nights in open air amphitheater . Very safe and interesting place... The watershed craft stalls were great.

Home. Being away from Cape Town, and living abroad for the past two years, has made me realise all over again how beautiful the city is. My first visit back to the Waterfront was one of happiness and of feeling that I was home. The mountain, the sea, the boats, restaurants, shops and people... A truly unforgettable experience.

Scenic and fun. Good shopping, nice restaurants, watch out for traffic when walking around, cross streets at your own risk.
The mall itself is cookie cutter, but the Watershed nearby has some interesting authentic South African items to buy.

Visitors Paradise. One of the few places in Cape town that I will never get tired of . There's a variety of things to do and all under one roof Reataurants , Shopping ,Luxury Hotels,and Banking . Definetly a must to anyone visiting Cape town for the first time .

Great place to wander. A friend and I wandered around the waterfront for a couple of hours - incredibly beautiful place with loads of lovely shops and a great view of table mountain behind the city. The best thing we found: the food market - the food is incredible (i recommend the Hungarian flat breads). The African Trading Port is also really worth a look.

Everything you need. The waterfront is unsurprisingly a real magnet for tourists and locals alike, and it is easy to see why. There is absolutely everything you would need, from eating (fast food to fine dining), bars (cocktails to pubs) and a huge amount of shops. One overriding thing I would say about the waterfront area is that it feels very safe, and that is something that cannot be underestimated. There is a visible security presence and a friendly atmosphere. A really good place.

Shopping, dining, and much more. Lots of restaurants, stores, mall, ferrous wheel, marina and ferry to Robben island. We stayed at Cape Grace which was close by. Be sure to visit the watershed area for shops. Great seafood.

Great variety of shops, restaurants and entertainment.. Great variety of shops, restaurants and entertainment. The view of the harbour is also really special. Prices are definitely inflated, but it comes with the nice ambiance of the place!
Exciting Capetown. The waterfront is fun both day and night. Excellent malls and restaurants to choose from. Take a stroll through the Company Gardens to view flora and fauna,

A lot to enjoy at Waterfront!. You need a full day to see and enjoy.Aquirium,large wheel,shopping at the shops.Enjoy a boat trip to Robben iland from Waterfront.See art excibitions.Enjoy the food at all types of restaurants and have a lovely harbour view..

You need lots of money!. Very expensive attractions, but one of the best bars in South Africa, Ferrymans, especially draught.
On the same note, the Springbok museum is a must for all rugby fans, worldwide.
Great entertainment for the family. Spend the whole day, and have a big wallet.
Must visit. if you are visiting Cape Town, you must visit the V&A waterfront. It has an amazing selection of shops, restaurants, coffee shops and a market for you to explore.

Perfect for non-South Africans. A great place to visit if you are not shopping with Rands. Sadly the centre has become very expensive to cater for international visitors.
