If you are a window shopper then you are in for a treat because of the vast selection of high end shops. The restaurants have also hiked their prices which leaves the food court. Parking is pricey. Why can't South Africans receive a tourist discount in their own country to encourage us to travel and explore this magnificent place?

Always worth a visit. We visited the Waterfront a few times on our last visit to Cape Town. Have a cup of coffee at Woolworths overlooking the harbour or visit Gibson's for "the greatest" burger in Cape Town (Monday 2 for price of 1 special!).

Always worth a visit. Best shopping attraction in Capetown. One of the only working waterfronts in the world, the venue offers something for everyone. All levels of restaurants from family to top world standard eaterys certainly enough to do to spend a day at V@A.Big wheel, helicopter flips, boats to robin island, pleasure cruise, aquarium, craft market, food market, comedy club and much much more.Top international fashion brands, including Zara, Tooshop, Mango, Aldo, Guess, and H@M opening before Xmas 2015.

V&A Waterfront, Cape Town - 1 Stop Shop. The V&A is a great place for visitors to have a number of different experiences in Cape Town. They have shops to dream of, high end brands as well as local SA retailers. There is a buzz at the Waterfront, tourists and locals alike love spending time there. They have various restaurants and takeaways to choose from when you want something to eat or if you just want a sundowner, there are various bars to choose from as well. They also have the aquarium, the big wheel, various boat rides, etc. There is also a market that is open daily. Ample parking and loads to see and do. Definitely add the V&A to your plans when visiting our beautiful mother city, Cape town.

Still a great Venue with plenty to do. This venue has shops, restaurants, a mini "Big Eye of London" and much more. It is frequented by locals and tourists and is a must see for visitors to Cape Town. The restaurants range from Fine Dinging to Fish & Chips. Each venue or attraction deserves its own write up but if you in Cape Town, it's worth a visit

Shopping to meet the needs of everyone.. This shopping center is great for the whole family. There is an abundance of stores and they all offer amazing stock. If you are a tourist, look no further. This is a great place to collect all your gifts for your friends and family.
Excellent place to stay. We stayed in the V&A waterfront area and had a great time. It was close to plenty of eateries, shopping and a grocery. Perfect base for exploring cape town.

I hope to return there.. I spent a few evenings in this area in December. It's probably the best time to holiday in Capt Town for the European. Great place, close to the city center. Pleasant restaurants for any money. A lot of attractions, great atmosphere and spectacular views. Very friendly service, variety in restaurants and bars. I hope to return there. I would recommend ...!

Waterfront with a view. Whilst on a tour of South Africa, my wife and I visited the Waterfront in Cape Town. It is a modern development full of designer label shops (unfortunately at designer prices) but it's good to take a look around. There are a good selection of bars and some really excellent restaurants and the prices in these are happily very reasonable. Along with some friends we chose to eat at Baia seafood restaurant on the upper level where the food was EXCELLENT with very good service and a good choice of wines. The view is good too - overlooking the harbour and with a view of Table Mountain.

A great afternoon. Many South Africans told us not to bother coming here as it isnt "true South African and too touristy". I'm glad we ignored these comments as we had a wonderful afternoon here, wondering around looking at gift stores and food stalls. We had a beautiful seafood lunch on the waterfront, and went shopping also. There were many, many shops from well known stores to stores we had never seen before. We did the Rugby Museum, and the Cape Wheel which was also worth doing, though perhaps over priced for what it is. All in all, I definitely recommend this for all!

Family holiday June 2014. A lovely place to hang out great food, shopping, photographic backgrounds. All in all great. The big bus stops here, you can go out for boat tours to robber island from here. Always carry a beaney and jacket as it's always windy.

Something for Everyone. One could spend an entire day shopping, eating, riding the ferris wheel or taking a cruise--all accessible at the V&A Waterfront. The shopping mall is divided into two wings--one with high end shops, the other with a collection of local and international mid-range brands The lower level houses a large grocery store which stocks everything you can imagine.Scattered throughout the mall and overlooking the wharf are dining venues ranging from seafood, Italian, Belgian to burgers--something for every taste. Along the wharf are freestanding buildings with more shops and restaurants. Two hotels are also located on the waterfront. For entertainment you can ride the ferris wheel or take a harbor cruise. It's a great place to spend time and, if you wish, money.

Shopping at V&A Waterfront. I had a wonderful time shopping at V&A Waterfront, they have variety of high class shops and restuarants. It is also closer to boats to Robben Island, aquarium and red sightseeing bus.

cape Town's Victoria & Alfred Waterfront. Has everything from within Africa and around the world. from Art to food to entertainment, shops and malls galore. Fine dinning to Grub n Grills. aromatic coffee houses to exotic teas. Wheelchair friendly and all. spend at least a couple of hours and visit often. much more to see then just one day visit.

Dont miss it.. One gets a different experience depending on what time of the day you visit. Evenings and night it buzzes with great energy, music and food smells and the sunsets are lovely from here.Daytime visits better for shopping there are plenty of shops selling individual local product, avoid the shiny corporate shops and head for the craft areas. Food in some of the cafes can be rather dodgy!
Restaurants and Shopping. This is the greatest place for shopping and food in Cape Town. There are also some nice attractions, like the aquarium. Definitely someplace to go on your next visit.

Nice shopping and resturant area. Nice shopping area at the harbor. A good selection of shops and resturants, and good access to tourist trips like Robben Island, Helicopter tours, The Two Ocean Aquirum and the Hop-on/Hop-off buses.

Yeah, a shopping area, what's the big deal. So why is this an attraction. A shopping mall in the harbour. What's the big deal? There are some nice restaurants otherwise the same shops you see all over the world.

Love love love. The feeling of this place is amazing! It feels like you are in another country. The restaurants are a little bit more expensive and the waiters a bit snooty. But the vibe with the tourists especially on a public holiday is electric!Love this place!

A must do when in Cape Town. The V&A Waterfront is an absolute must do when in Cape Town.With many shops and restaurants, the vibe is always great and the buskers will keep you amused as you wander around.Live music gets the feet tapping, boats are always interesting and the Big Wheel is a must do for fabulous views.Do not miss this experience!

amazed. the road from hotel to there was confusing for me, but it was worth the confusion. Had so much fun. The mall itself was also confusing everything looked the same but in a different way. They have everything there, no need to rush anywhere when you are there

Views second to none, but be careful. my experience involves very nearly being ripped off. i spoke to a gentleman who was attempting to sell me a shark diving experience and i would have obliged had it not been for a last minute tap on the shoulder from a more experienced company who told me to be wary. the day i attempted to do the dive was too windy, but i didnt know this initially, and was told by the vendor that i should pay now and return in 2 hours to go on my voyage. however, having been informed of his intentions by the respected companies (located opposite, underneath the restaurants) that he would take my money and run i decided against the idea. as it happened i did return 2 hours later to look for a late lunch and lo and behold, the vendor had disappeared. if you are looking to do any of the activities, please take care in choosing the business you go with as you could be scammed.

Steeped in History. Our final day in Cape Town was spent at the historic Victoria & Alfred Waterfront, South Africa’s oldest working harbour, now a bustling shopping, dining, entertainment venue set against a stunning backdrop of the Table Mountain on one side and the ocean on the other. It’s a lively venue with lots to see and do such as the Aquarium, Victoria Wharf Shopping Centre, South African Maritime Museum, etc.etc. Definitely a must place to visit.
Outstanding tourist hangout.... Very nice and clean area to shop, eat and hangout. Great outdoor dining available, where you can take in the day or people watch. Enjoyed it...

Far to polished and tourist for my taste, but the food hall is worth a bite.. I visited the V&A Waterfront many years ago when it was funky, rough at the edges and fun.It is now nothing but high-priced rows of shops aimed at tourists. Prices areridiculous. But some of the stalls in the food hall are reasonable.The aquarium and snake trailer very nearby are more likely worth your time.Dr. Melanie Bryan, Hong Kong

Fantastic Day , Night or Week Long Trip Venue in Cape Town. Always Fantastic. Do not visit Cape Town and not look up the events they have on here. It is not just a place to visit for a meal. Dont miss the Tea Shop! Fantastic idea.... There is always something on at the V&A Waterfront. And dont forget to book your Robben Island trip which leaves from the VA& . Too many great restaurants to review.

Good place to visit. With many restaurants to choose from and a wellness centre with lots of handmade gifts a trip to the waterfront is worth it. There's also the aquarium and Robben Island museum nearby. The tourist red bus stops right by the aquarium and wellness centre making it easy for tourists.

Great place to shop, eat, have a glass of wine, people watch, and enjoy the view.. As in so many places in Cape Town, the area is beautifully maintained and laid out. There are lots of places to shop or just sit and have a glass of wine while looking out over the water. The V&A mall is a great place to shop. It's spotlessly clean, has lots of attractions, as well as some excellent places to eat.The Victoria and Albert Waterfront is a must see while in Cape Town.
Definitely the place to be.. Definitely the place to be. Loads of shops, bars and restaurants. Security is high. Ate here most evenings. Fantastic setting with table mountain overlooking the harbour.

Very Nice Upscale Visiting Area. This area is a perfect place to visit on a sunny weekend. It is full of CT residents and tourists. It is very clean and you can feel the investment made to this beautiful waterfront. There are many shops and restaurants around. Moreover the V&A shopping mall is also very nice. It is a recommended spot for CT visitors.

Great for people watching. Great to grab a bite to eat and do some people watching. Prices are on the expensive side. Can get extremely busy over weekends and public holidays. There is ample parking as well as cabs should you require one.

A must do in Cape Town!. A must visit when in Cape Town. It's a great mix of shopping, restaurants and activities and also one of the best views of the mountain. Try Karibu restaurant for some great local dishes, Vovo Telo for breakfast and visit the Watershed for craft type shopping.

Search for the hidden treasures. The V&A contains more than just the shopping mall. One has to venture out and search for the hidden gems. Be sure to visit the Clock Tower precinct - cross the bridge and explore a bit further. Visit the Scratch Patch, Red Shed, walk to the Aquarium, have a drink at the One & Only, enjoy high tea at the Table Bay, sit down for some fish & chips at the water.

Waterfront Overrated. I had read that the V&A Waterfront was the #1 tourist attraction in South Africa. Having been there, I'm a bit surprised, as it's highly commercialized and didn't really stand out in my mind. We had a terrible drink/dinner experience, including some awful seafood that we were told was fresh but wasn't, and otherwise it struck me as a lot of shopping. If you want to shop and have a touristy meal by a lot of cool boats, then this is your place, but having spent more time in Cape Town I think you have a lot better options for great food and drink, as well as awesome seaside spots. I hear the aquarium is amazing though.
Great food area. Great place to shop and especially eat. Had some fantastic food. Don't buy anything in the area, very much tourist prices.

Fun and shopping for all. Perfect place to have fun with family friends. The waterfront always has a great vibe and it's always buzzing with excitement.I, personally, always enjoy my time at the waterfront. Be prepared for a waiting time to be seated at restaurants, during peak-times.
Dinner spot. The Spot to have lovely Dinner at Night. Several restau's arround with lots of Shops for Everyone... Mall at habour with maritime flair
fun in the sun!. A fun place to walk around in the sun, have a fewdrinks and explore the markets close by. Great place to look for and go on many trips in and around cape town.

Hidden gem among the gloss and noise. Typical glass enclosed several-story mall on a working waterfront. Chain restaurants and shops. But walk a bit along the harbor and find the Africa Trading Post. Tourista items galore on the first floor. 2nd and 3rd floors have museum-quality African art from many cultures. Fill your eyes.

Victoria & Albert Waterfront, Cape Town. This area was redeveloped some years ago. It is buzzing but can be crowded! There are many bars, cafes & eating places, most of which are quite expensive. It is quite enjoyable to sit & watch the world go by. Parking nearby is not easy but the area can be reached by bus, including the hop on hop off bus.

Cape Town V&A Waterfront. This place is a hype of activity, with people everywhere. From the humongous shopping mall to boat trips, which include the Roben Island excursions. There's everything for everyone. You can spend the whole day there without feeling bored. Its a good place to unwind, whether in one of the many restaurants, boat riding, viewing cultural activities that vary daily, shopping from exclusive shops, observing and taking photos with key points such as Table Mountain, The New Stadium, Roben Island as background or just enjoy walking around with a sense of security. This is one place one should never miss visiting when in Cape Town.

Victoria & Alfred Waterfront. We first passed through the Victoria & Alfred Waterfront on our way to Robbens Island. When we had finished the Robbens Island tour, we walked through the area and had dinner at a fish restaurant across from the Robbens Island gateway building. The V&A waterfront is pretty typical, in that it is very much a "tourist" focused area. It is worth a visit and if the day is clear you can see Robbens Island from the dock.

Reminds me of Darling Harbour in Sydney. I loved Victoria and Alfred Waterfront. If you don't have a clue what to do in Capetown then you could just sit here and watch life drift by. There are some great shops here but they are rather highly priced. I got carried away in one clothes shop and spent a bomb when I converted back to Australian dollars. I think that this area is definitely a tourist trap as the rest of Capetown is extremely reasonably priced. However, that said, it is a great place to sit in the outdoors café and have a coffee and bliss out. It definitely reminded me of Sydney's Darling Harbour and I think that I might even have been told by someone that the area was actually modelled on Darling Harbour. I am feeling like going back there just by writing this review. Definitely come here when you go to Capetown.

Scenic with lots of shopping and eating. The waterfront at Breakwater is very nice for a visit. By the water with lots of shops, you'll enjoy your time here. Here is where you also catch the ferry for Robben Island. They also have a bug ferris wheel. At R100 quite pricey but you ride for 12 min. Great restaurants are also there. We visited the waterfront many times during our stay. Must visit for families and couples.

Shops and Restaurants with a view. This is a nice place to go with a lot of variety for shopping and eating. I felt very safe. Be warned though, things tend to close when the mall does, so go earlier. Be sure to do the ferris wheel too.

Good for shopping. Some excellent shops in the Watershed at reasonable prices. If you want to avoid the hassle of Pan African and Greenmarket and don't mind paying slightly higher prices for better quality and more contemporary African art, then the Watershed is the place. Other than that, some nice waterfront to walk around and see and take pictures of the Table Mountain, etc. Lots of eating options too and the Food Market is a great place to stop by to eat and shop for ingredients

Always fun!. There is never a dull moment at the V&A and it seemed like Christmas on a winter's Sunday - so many people all out enjoying themselves. Shopping, eating, watching the buskers or just relaxing with a drink - it's the place to be.Favoured by locals as one of our many great spots to visit.If you enjoy photography you will love the many scenes and spectacular views of Table Mountain.

Lively home base. The waterfront is full of action. People from all over the world (and South Africa) are here to enjoy the atmosphere of tourist/working harbor. The restaurants are great and cover most tastes. The hotels range from very nice to truly elegant. Performing artists are nearly constantly in the square next to the shopping center.There is a lot more to Cape Town than the waterfront, but it is a great place to use as home while in the city.

Must visit. Gives a good vibe of Cape Town. Has got plenty of restaurants and bars as well as a mall for all your shopping needs.
Next to the harbor, it is a good place to relax.

Best Restaurant and Live music in the Waterfront.... We often visit the Waterfront (every second week) it is THE place to be! The highlight of our visit is the best live music and restaurant in Cape Town, take a ques...Live entertainment and sing along, you eat from a well dressed menu, try the peri peri chicken livers on flat bread it is awesome!!! let me shout it out the name of our favorite place, FERRYMAN'S!!!
great spot. no matter at morning or the afternoon, it always has a magical to take the photos there. but in winter it will quite cold to walk there at night,
Lovely Place. Loved this area, lovely bars, cafes and restaurants. Lovely place to spend the afternoon over a few wines
Food Art and Tips!. A great view of the city, excelent restaurants, art everywhere! A mustsee place for sure! The tips for night events are awesome in the pubs there!

What a fun place to visit. We went to the waterfront and were so surprised by what a vibrant place it was. There is a lot of shopping available with really great souveniers to bring home. Loads of restaurants and live music. It was a beautiful place. It is where you catch the ferry for Robbin Island.
Great Place. Nice place not matter day or night to grab something nice to eat from a wide variety of restaurants.
This place has it all!. MY favourite place! Full of restaurants, entertainment, shops and more! I can browse for hours then grab a cocktail by the harbour!

super place. awesome. Think chicago or San Fran broad walk , but a fraction of the price. We didn't pay more than £25 total for both meals and drinks. Make sure you visit the waterhouse in the V and A. its all small SA entrepreneurs and the prices are good

A place for everyone and for almost everything. There are so many things rolled into one area at the V & A Waterfront that it's impossible to rate everything. I go there often but I still haven't discovered all that it has to offer yet. As a shopping complex, it's fantastic even if if the shopping area is not very big. Unfortunately a few nice shops and restaurants have had to close due to lack of funds or lack of public interest. In any case, always worth a visit whether it's to shop, catch a movie, stay at a hotel, go dining or to get a drink. Opeingin hours for shops are also usually longer than in other areas of Cape Town, especially on weekends. There are also major attractions there including the big wheel and the Aquarium. There is ample and cost-effective parking. The New Year's Eve fireworks are spectacular and can be seen from all the neighboring areas.
Heart of Cape Town. Great place to wonder around. Feel quite safe there and there are lots of shops, things to do and good eating places
V & A H20 front. Great shopping, eating, playing,hotel and commercial center. Tours, buses, boats leave from here. Another must do.
Safe and interesting. The area is interesting and safe to walk around. There are loads of shops and restaurants, plus a few attractions too. It’s certainly worth a trip down.
perfect day out. so much to see and do - should be high up on your list of places to visit in Cape Town. Don't miss the waterfront craft and arts market and the adjoining eatery

A vibrant and interesting place.. A vibrant and friendly place. There is a really good shopping mall as well as a varied choice of eating places, depending on how much you want to spend and what kind of food you like. A trip on the big wheel is fun and gives you a wonderful view of the whole of Cape Town and Table Mountain and the bay. There is plenty of interesting street entertainment, lively bars, some with live music. It is also very safe, which makes it relaxing to wander through.
Always a Positive Experience. The Waterfront continues to grow. Pleasant and safe place to shop, dine and be entertained. Lots of good dining choices and a huge variety of shops. Love it.

Great place to hang out. This is a great waterfront. Full of life and activity the whole time. Lovely bars and restaurants as well as loads of shops. Great mix to keep whole family occupied. Loads to do from boat trips to the acquriaum.

Not enough time. V&A Waterfront is a great place to be, if you want to spend either a few hours or a few days.Great shops for every budget and every taste, a wide offer for dinning, African handcraft and much more.

V & A Waterfront. Touristy, but very nice. Many upscale gift shops and restaurants, but also great fun for kids and families. Lots of specialty foods. The ferris wheel is super fun. From the waterfront, you can catch the ferry to Robben Island. You'll see the beautiful clock tower, and you can visit several museums including the aquarium and the Diamond museum.

Good for a day. Good to spend a day there, many stalls shops and restaurants, next to the mall, easy access to hop on hop off busses and if you are looking to do a cruise. Also many street artists doing performances, and sculptures of madiba and tutu and other men
Lively and Cheerful. Very nice place, with lots of shops, restaurants, and cafes. The atmosphere is very lively and cheerful, and you can stay there a bit late if the weather is nice.

Tourist Heaven. If you are staying in Cape Town this is the area you want to stay in. It is safe day and night, you can walk everywhere, there is plenty of shops and a great selection of restaurants from seafood to Dutch cuisine. Robben Island attraction ticket entry point is here as well as museums, the Cape Wheel, great views of Table Mountain, Lion Mountain and Signal Hill. The Q & A hotel is right on the waterfront and a few minutes up from there is the Victoria Hotel where we stayed. Plan to stay at least 3 days so that you can do the peninsula day tour, Table Mountain and Robben Island. If you have time do go to the Botanical Gardens.
Cape CBD at its best. Very busy but definitively a good place to go for a drink or to buy more fancy stuff. Take a hat and enjoy the waterfront.
Average , waste of time. Disappointing place there nothing to do , view is average not more than average there many other places worth visiting

Pristine Views. The V and A Waterfront has continued to be one of the best attractions Cape Town has to offer. From stunning views of Table Mountain, Lion's Head and Robben Island, the plethora of bars and restaurants to lazy shopping, this is a place not to miss out on when you visit Cape Town. I would thoroughly recommend at least a day's visit and you would probably return for more!

Nice places to eat / Comedy Club. We went twice on our visit. Once to the food court (nice selection) in the mall. Also a huge mall looked around. Boardwalk always had something going on. Nice, clean and felt safe. At night went to the comedy club and dinner at a Belgium type of restaurant which was really good.

Super Place to Visit!. After visiting yesterday, the Waterfont, has still not lost any of its charm and excitement. Being a local makes one feel as if you are on holiday. It is so well kept and there are so many places to visit, and places to relax and eateries. The setting is just so beautiful with Table Mountain in the back ground. We went to a movie and then had a great meal of Fish and Chips at Mitchell's Tavern. The whole places is well worth a visit, and locals who haven't been for a while, do yourselves a favour and pay it another visit soon.

Fabulous. We stayed opposite the V and A but spent a lot of time eating, drinking, shopping and just relaxing in the V& A. It is extremely popular with locals and tourists but did not seem to be overly crowded at any time.A great heart inthe city.

Treat Yourself. Everything here in one spot, shops, bars, restaurants. We spent 2 days exploring this beautiful part of Cape Town with views to Table Mountain in the foreground. Ferris wheel ride a must !
Perfect downtime area. Tremendous shopping eating drinking area very well kept looks new its so clean,pricey art work though try African trading port on 3 floors (Behind Den Anker Restaurant)

Fantastic place!. The Victoria and Alfred waterfront is the most fun place and full of life in Cape Town. There are many people, sounds and music, good restaurants, and a lot of joy. The shops are especially good and the V&A Mall offers all that you may need. Fantastic in a word
Shopping Heaven!. Amazing views. Has all of the branded clothing and shopping areas in the Mall. Food places are exquisite. Neat and clean.
A must for all the family. A must if you are in the area - things to do, places to eat, shopping and just worth a walk - no one is too young/old!

Best part of Cape Town. I always stay in the V&A Waterfront area as it is close to everything.1.The city sightseeing buses leave from here2.the ferry for robben island leaves from here3.You can spend 1-2 days just exploring and doing stuff at the waterfront itself.4.It have the great Cape Town version of the "London Eye"5.Great cosmopolitan/holiday vibe day and night.6.No need for taxi's.You can walk every where.
The views. It has luxury shops, excellent restaurants, great hotels and but most important it has the best views in the world, from Table Mountain, the ocean and the the city.

tourist mecca. this is Cape Town's tourist fulcrum, but locals use it a lot too, because the shops/stores are good and so are many of the restaurants. You can take a boat to Robben Island from here and go on various other boat excursions. Usually there are musicians or performers busking. You will not find it hard to find souvenirs!!! A new art museum called Zeitz MOCA will open here soon to feature contemporary art from Africa.
The place to be. The V&A Waterfront is one of the reasons why I am in love with Cape Town. It is a very vibrant place and there are always people and endless possibilities!!

Great place to relax. Lots to do and enjoy with shops, bars and restaurants abounding. Also a ferris wheel and playground for all ages right in the centre of the complex. Or just walk around and watch the visitors, boats and sailors going about their day.

An afternoon filler. We went there to fill in an afternoon while in Cape Town after coming back from Robben Island. It is a huge shopping precinct with shops ranging from high end to the practical. The restaurants also range from good restaurants to snack bars (there is even a McDonalds!!). It is fun to walk around the shops and watch the locals. There are a number of "curiosity" shops with souvenirs , etc just outside the mall. The V&A waterfront has docks for small to medium ships as well as a dry dock. It is easy to wander around, or just sit with a coffee while the "better half" goes shopping.
Relaxing. A beautiful place to shop, relax, have a few drinks at open air cafes. We got all our souvenirs here. Just stroll around. Soak up the atmosphere. Great restaurants here too.

Must do experience. To be able to sit on the V&A waterfront enjoy a pleasant meal in any one of a dozen restaurants and listen to jazz played in the open air was just wonderful. The V&A is the lively hub and the heart of Cape Town which you must experience if visiting....

Lots to Do. This is a great place to while away a day.With all the wind and rain stopping our planned activities we spent a day here going to the Aquarium, the markets and the mall.The outdoor restaurants we went to were lovely with lots of atmosphere in the old buildings and great food and service.The market style shops in some of the old buildings were great with some great shopping and definitely with a flavour of Africa and especially Cape Town.Not for the faint hearted in wind and rain - take the coat and umbrella to make sure you venture out past the mall.The mall had lots of shopping but it could have been anywhere in the world.

Touristy place with good range of shops and restaurants. We had dinner here 3 nights in a row as was close to where we were staying and had some nice restaurants. It's not the cheapest place in town but is nice and new, seemed to be a safe area for tourists plus had good shops to visit.

Best Waterfront - something for everyone!. Wonderful variety of excellent restaurants and similarly a marvelous choice of shops from designer to hippy. The craft market, the alternative health centre with great massages and other treatments Lots of entertainment for kids, including the big wheel with great views of Table Mountain. Numerous boat trips where you can visit Robben Island or go on a sunset cruise, etc, etc.

Really buzzing and busy. The shopping is great. Wonderful choice and quite a few to international designer label to be found. I think the mall needs more lifts because they always seem to have one or more out of working order.
Beautiful Cape Town. A variety of sound, colour, restaurants, shops. A real vibrancy that one will only find in Africa. An added bonus is the view of both Table Mountain and the sea!
Bustling with activity. The selection of restaurants and activities here is amazing. There is a great vibe here and the view of table mountain are spectacular.
Good food and great shopping. This is a great place to buy souvenirs. It's also great to pamper yourself with good food in a beautiful setting.
Loved it.. Can't really add anything that hasn't been said, but I would say spend a full day here rather than rushing it. There's plenty of little gems, and the city centre isn't far away either.

A lovely shopping and dining precinct. The Victoria & Alfred Waterfront is an area full of quality shopping and dining and, as well, the area from which one catches the boat to Robben Island.Many of the sorts of handicrafts that I saw at Green Market Square were also available from stalls in the Watershed. As I am not really keen on bargaining, I found purchasing things at the Watershed to be a more comfortable experience.Some hotels offer free shuttles to and from the Waterfront area. If you are planning on taking a taxi, make sure that your driver turns on his meter.

Awesome Experience. I went on the ferris wheel, saw the whole of the V&A waterfront from high up. it was a beautiful scene. Went food hunting and sampled a few restaurants in the waterfront ill i was stuffed. And to cap it, a rainbow was sitting right above the table mountain,......i wondered if there was a pot of gold at the end...lol

Taxi Service Rip Off. V&A is a nice enough place to visit, with some good stores but the taxi service is a rip off. More than once I have gotten into a taxi with a V&A Taxi registration number, the door says R10/km and the meter is definitely running much faster than that. A 3.5km trip has cost me upwards of R70. I have tried emailing the office, and got an automatic response but no other reply.

Tourist favourite. Definitely the place which most visitors to our beautiful city enjoy by far the most - from branded apparel houses, exotic fragrances and world class eateries to choose from, it is the jewel in the crown of Cape Town features.

Very nice attraction. Lots of shops and activity going on. Many restaurants to choose from as well. The ferris wheel is fun. Nice play area for kids. Definitely a place to stop and spend some time (and money!).
Chilling. Great place to take in the energy of Cape Town. Wonderful restaurants and Shops. Recommend to go if weather is not good for other activities.

Lots to see, smell, taste and feel :). A lot of shops to see and shop, lovely restaurants, lots of things to do.... beautiful and makes one homesick if you no longer living there, such a shame there's so much crime otherwise would have enjoyed it more instead of being on Alert all the time.......
Fun place to hang out. Nice selection of shops, restaurants, plenty of things to entertain yourself and your family. Easy walk from the One and Only Hotel
Amazing. The worlds best waterfront so much going on amazing restraints shops attraction and most importantly amazing and friendly people!

Cape Towns hotspot. Gateway to the Cape and the restaurant scene. Generally plenty secured parking or arrive easily by my-citi bus or taxi. From the V&A you can explore Robben Island (the prison where Nelson Mandela was incarceeated for 27 years) . If adventerous or need to save take a helicopter flip over the peninsula ir even the winelands. You can be dropped off with the red citi-hopper or a take a trip on the ferry wheel. Then see any one of the current movies, eat in the many varied restaurants from coffee shops to the food court. Then there are the family restaurants and the more upmarket establishments. You can then shop at all the brand name and local chain stores . Popular locals include woolworths, clicks, Pick n Pay, clothing, book, jewellers, luggage and more. Don't forget to visit the aquarium, open markets, a cruise around the harbour or Clifton or even Hout Bay. Plenty Hotels in the area from BUDGET to Five Stars. It's more the destination than the local shopping centre. There are more affordable and varied shops at he large Canal Walk shopping centre which is almost a must. If it's school holidays leave the kids at Ratanga for entertainment and rides.
Great Shopping. The V&A is great for shopping and dining. Lots of great international brands available to choose from. Great views of table mountain too. Good food market, the watershed is amazing.

a touch of madness but still great. This place is great to visit - although its kind of madness in terms of the number of people there are great shops, and then delicious restaurants and there is often entertainment to watch outside while in sight of the water -

Excellent shopping and dining experience. We stayed close by at a Waterfront Apartment...very nice, safe and fun place to spend some time. Some historical and educational sites and information if you keep your eyes open for markers.

variety the cleanliness and the positioning makes this a happening place the seafood suchi bar is excellent. Well laid out ,clean the variety and of course the stunning views all make the waterfront the place to be

Something for everyone. This is another area that has something for every one. The wharf itself is great with lots of cafes, bars and restaurants. The fact a shopping centre is also part of the wharf is a bonus too. Great shopping I might add. This is also where you catch the boat to Robben Island (remember book in advance, we didn't and sadly missed out). Lots of free entertainment too. Some really old African artefacts for sale in the three story building (level two and three) is definitely with a visit. We will be back!

Shopping - Dining - Boat trips. Buzzy vibe. good to just shop or spend a whole day visiting.Good shoppingSuperb choice of restaurants from fine dining to fast food.Great harbour side vibe.Food market is awesome.Two Oceans Aquarium is excellent for all ages.

A world of experiences in one harbour. This shopping center is one of the best that Cape Town has to offer. You will find a variety of specialist Fashion Houses and eating places that allow for an entire days shopping.The old Pump House has a selection of specialist foods to tempt any palate. The Fashion Houses will keep your credit card happy and contented.
Cruising and shopping.. loved all the food and the variety of shops. We ate, bought souvenirs and booked an helicopter flight.

More to it than meets the eye. Great hotels, restuarants and shops all of international standard. As a local, for me the boat trips, speed boats and helicopter flips is a great way to see the city from, is generally affordable and a whole lot of fun.

You'll be surprised at how much there is to do here. It's got everything you could ever want! Shops - mainstream and quirky, food market, indoor market, big wheel, restaurants, spectacular views and more. We spent so much time at the Waterfront - taking helicopter rides, sampling food, shopping and sitting watching the street performers. A lovely spot to spend time.

trip of a life time to south africa!. A Perfect location for a hotel and restaurants... there is not an evening that goes by where you can't find something to do. shopping is top notch, as well as too many restaurants to choose from! its a favorite for locals and tourists!

All of your shopping needs taken care of!. A shoppers paradise with almost every store you can imagine.
Good choice of different priced eateries too and a lovely atmosphere. At weekends there were street entertainers. Fun place to hang out especially in the evenings.
Check out the Tanzanite stores, such a beautiful South African precious stone.

Lots of things to see and do. A must for any visitor to CT. This is one of CT landmarks. Luxury hotels and private appartments. Many shops with artifacts but also all kind of retail goods. Don't miss the little food area between V&A hotel and the aquarium. There are some very delicious food there and great variety.The harbor is very interesting and you may just spend hours watching boats going and coming.....Spend one day and an evening at the Waterfront to experience it all.
overated crowded expensive. really have not much praise for this overexploited and over commercialised section of Cape Town. Can't see what the attraction is ??

we experienced lovely weather during a winter season. Waterfront was not so busy, enough tyme to relax.went for a boat ride.It was awesome as well as a ride on the wheel.the court yard was nice and clean . various take aways to buy food from.
Brilliant atmosphere. A very vibrant atmosphere and all the shopping experience under one roof. Staff at the shops are very friendly and helpful

Cape Town waterfront. This is an upscale area where you do not need to care too much security because there is a security guide almost every aisle. Also try the ocean basket restaurant. It's a local family style restaurant and prices are reasonable

Shop till you drop. Not for nothing this shopping precinct is regarded as one of the best in the world. Lots to do and many shops if you like that sort of thing. The many eateries offered are on both sides of the center and allow you cameos of the very beautiful Cape Town.

Heart of Cape Town. The V and A waterfront has become the heart of Cape Town. It was developed in the old docks and is still part of a working harbour. The V and A consists of a large shopping mall, as well as many outside restaurants and attractions, including for example, the Mandela Gateway from which the ferries/ hovercraft to Robben Island depart. Shops are open to 9 p.m. (Later in the height of the summer season) and the waterfront is always buzzing with activitity, especially on weekends and school holidays.

Great local food and shopping. Lots of food venders cooking their local specialties. We had small portions of a few of them. Venders were eager to give us samples also.A good place to walk around ,and take in the sights

Great authentic items. This has all local South African items. Some very good designers and craftsman. Great clothes, place mats, leather goods, good quality. Great restaurants, a ferris wheel, beautiful clothing.

One stop entertainment. Amazing ambience,beautiful picturesque views ,shopping galore_just the perfect place.
Spoilt for choice when it comes to eating out.

A shoppers paradise!. Fabulous ..... but oh so expensive!!!!! All the shops you can wish for - restaurants a plenty! Food quality overall is vey good - beautiful place to shop and relax! Amphitheatre has some pretty spectacular shows daily and well worth watching!

a great place to visit, eat and shop. Selection, selection, selection and location, location, location: a perfect place to enjoy a taste of Cape Town, set off for a sail, have a romantic drink at dusk.
Really nice. Such a nice place to take a walk: great atmosphere with musical demonstrations, a lot of restaurants (Might be a little bit expensive), great view on the sea.

Winter at the Waterfront. The Waterfront is popular for a reason. A great vibe all year round. Winter is a good option too as the crowds are more manageable. We watched the sunset while taking a ride on the wheel, with views over the harbour and Table Mountain from on high.Having a drink at Ferryman's while listening to live music is a winner too.

The best spot in Cape Town. We spent most of our evenings in this lively place exploring the restaurants and listening to the local music being played - a bit of a Covent Garden experience in the sun! This place is lively, has great shops and restaurants and is the place you leave via ferry to Robbin Island. It is easy to get to by taxi and there are loads of taxis leaving it to take you elsewhere when you are ready\.
Cape Town. Lovely place and lively. Street entertainment. Plenty of eateries and bars. Lovely day or night. Very clean anf elt safe
Nice nightspot. This is a nice little nightspot and a great place to have a drink in the evening. Also, the point from where most of the cruises and helitours operate from

like an American mall. We were sorry we spent the time on the waterfront rather than going to some other museums or looking at shops downtown. the shopping is more like a big American mall with many of the same stores-not unique at all.

Eat & Shop. This place is great for eating and shopping. Don't expect to make bargains. The shopping center hosts stores with international brands. There are also some local stores but you might find the same things at the downtown market for a different price and ambiance.

Food & Craft Market Great, Mall - not so nice. The mall itself was nice but why visit if you are traveling all the way to Capetown. I suggest hitting up the 3 main real attractions (the Ferris Wheel doesn't count) - The Food market, the craft market and aquarium. The food market it small and quaint but they have enough diversity and tasty treats to make it worth it - especially if you want to get a flare of local street style foods. The craft market is unlike the cheap souvenir shops as everything seems be well crafted, hand made, local and has a truly artistic/craft skill involved. I did not buy anything as it was a bit expensive and when i tried to bargain, the price was not reduced nearly enough to what I was willing to pay.

Great place. I think the Waterfront is an amazing place to visit in Cape Town. It has a great atmosphere where you can take a seat on the jetty on look out into the bay and Robben Island, or you can go into the shopping center for food and shopping. Very impressed with this location.

Things to do .... Hectic mall in the gorgeous cape where you can find anything and everything and almost everyone ...from anywhere. Not the greatest food experience at Quay 4 but perfect photo op views and views!!
Lovely place. It is very peaceful here at the Waterfront..many wonderful shops, great eateries..great view of Table Mountain.. people are very friendly..some street musicians, must see in Cape Town!

V&A stroll. Nice area. Lots of eateries, shops, live entertainment. All backdropped by the V&A mall. Sail and power boat rides are inexpensive. Check out the old waterfront clock tower and tidal gauge. Several blocks of strolling and people watching.

Entertaining family from new zealand. On a awesome sunny July day outing to the Waterfront...soooo many amazing things to delight from yummy ice creams at the creamery to delish sushi at willoboughs...Family outing for all to enjoy,shopping,entertaining and the hop on hop off red bus.Best kept winter secret in Cape Town .
Cosmopolitan. Large shopping mall, lots of restaurants, cafes and bars. Sit and have a drink and watch the people stroll by. Music goes on all day, lovely relaxing place.

Lots to do. You need to go here often. The sea view is stunning, there is just so much to see and do, it's an absolute delight.There are buskers and shows at the ampitheatre, restaurants, movies, book shops, wine sales, place for the kids to play, food, food, food, yachts, seals... the Aquarium, the market... Go often :)

Still some of the best shopping in Cape Town. Each country has shopping malls , but few surrounded by restaurants that either look into table mountain , the Atlantic Ocean or a working Harbour Enjoyable every time

More than just a shopping precinct. So shop till you drop and then shop some more - but do not miss out on the craft shed! High end, top quality locally produced offerings which are not only for tourists. Take your pick of food: food market for casual eateries or top end restaurants situated in and around the complex. (Give the fast food court a miss, there are much better options.) Sit yourself down somewhere for coffee or a craft beer, take in the atmosphere and look at the view - the waterfront or mountains. The choice is always yours. In the amphitheater there may well be live entertainment to add to your enjoyment.

V&A Waterfront is wonderful!. Beautiful shops and restaurants, amazing view of Table Mountain. You can spend the whole day here just walking around. If you are looking for high end shops or local curios, they have it all! You also depart for Robben Island from here, so it's a good place to have early morning breakfast or lunch / dinner when you return.

World Class destination. . I have travelled all over the world and have loved every minute but nothing compares to Cape Town. The waterfront is a fabulous environment. Not only for its shopping, the restaurants are excellent, take a boat trip, meet the harbour Seals. Waterfront has absolutely everything you could need, family, children all catered for. Recently the blue shed art and craft emporium was opened with an exceptional array of localy made goods. This is an absolute must visit.

A shopping centre pretty much. A purpose built shopping centre in Cape Town. Whaat makes it special are the surrounding restaurants and buildings. Parking is always easy and plentiful. I do always find the shopping centre a little overcrowded every time I go. Plenty of shops, loads of food places and a cinema. If you get a tip off a cruise ship is arriving run for the hills, seems to small to handle such a rush of people.

Relaxing & beautiful.... Loved this space, so many options for shopping & eating! It is a little for the tourist market BUT well worth visiting & doing activities like helicopter ride & Robben island boat ride!!!!

Very nice. This is a lovely harbor with many shops, restaurants and a few hotels. There were several different types of sightseeing and fishing boats here. We sat on on the harbor and enjoyed watching all of the activity while cooling off with a local beer. We had just purchased a large diamond so we were also basking in the joy of our great purchase.
V&A Waterfront. A great shopping and entertainment centre, lovely restaurants and great entertainment. You can go there everyday and have some new experience just loved it.

The V&A waterfront has everything for a tourist to enjoy.. Whether it's retail or food or entertainment you can find all at the V&A. My favorite restaurant is the Harbour House where you always get fresh fish prepared to a world class standard. However all the other restaurants provide excellent cuisine and Quay 4 has the best vibe. As a shopping center it is world class.The V&A is also a good standby if the weather turns nasty and the Cable Car is not operating or outdoor pursuits are not possible. Quite easy to spend a whole day or night there.

Everything you need with a touch of luxury. From Pick n Pay to, fine dining. This charming place has everything! Varied restaurants to suit your pallet and pocket. The service at every store is lovely and you can find exactly what you're looking for with a quick walk around the mall.

A unique mall experience. We were advised to visit this mall and were told that much research was put into its inception to assure that it would be unique as well as functional. It is both. It has many beautiful shops and a wide range of restaurants and food options. The crowds were lively and there was music playing to entertain. It definately should be a part of your Cape Town experience

Good food and plenty of shops. Waterfront charm abounds in this lovely harbor. We found a pretty restaurant and dined in the open air under umbrellas. There are plenty of dining option from which to choose. When night fell the deck braziers provided ample warmth. It was our last night in Cape Town and we didn't want the evening to end. There were stores and curio shops to lure visitors; a little something for everyone. We just drank in the outdoors with our eyes and had a wonderful, magical time and, as always, enjoyed talking with strangers.
Scenic Waterfront and Great Restaurants. Loved the craft market and the great assortment of restaurants. Enjoyed two beautiful afternoons here.

Nice break for the kids.. After long travel days, it was nice to take the kids here and let them frolic. They loved the little playground, the ferris wheel and the music. We did a little souvenir shopping in the mall and let the kids have some fast food. Restaurants and cocktails were a little higher-priced than elsewhere in Cape Town (as places like this often are) but it was a nice afternoon for all of us. Always good to have a clean, safe place to let the kids have some fun.
Willoughby's was a very nice place to eat. Willoughby's is a great restaurant - it doesn't look anything special but the food was fantastic washed down with a few SA wines
beautiful mall. interesting shops lovely layout also access to boat trips ,craft market lovely ,only people at nu metro cinema very rude stood there for 15 min before they reluctantly helped me

Unlimited choice in one of the world's most beautiful settings!. The V&A is always a WOW place. After nearly a quarter of a century of its existence, I have personally only tried perhaps 20% of all it's vast eating and drinking choices, and barely scraped the surface of its staggering shopping selection. Of course not every eating venue offers value, service and good food, but it is still a place worth visiting!

Great shopping Atmosphere. A great place to shop for local treasures but you need to look around for a bargain. The malls are typical and expensive but there are bands playing people walking around and great food available. It became the hub of our time in Cape Town as parking was plentiful and reasonable. The tour buses, aquarium, and Robben Island boat tours are all within walking distance

Festive and fun. As usual, the Waterfront delivers consistently great vibes. The area is probably the safest in Cape Town, and the variety of restaurants, pubs, and shops is vast.They have impromptu entertainment which is free to watch / listen to, but a tip is expected. Please donate if you enjoyed their show. They definitely add value to the experience!Even the parking is consistently affordable!
A must if you visit Cape Town. Cape Town must see!! Great restaurants, bars and shops. All in one from grocery, clothes, curios to yummy food. Lovely vibe and great view of table mountain!

A beautiful Shopping and Dining Destination. I love The Waterfront and cannot get enough of it. The shops are great and such good value, but it is the vibe that you get here. Live music, great restaurants and fantastic service throughout.
Touristy, efficient for shopping. Even though this is a touristy Place, it can be good if you need to get some shopping done, eat food, Catch a Movie and just stroll among the shops.

Just right. Love the ambiance and outdoor feel. Nice vibe and needs to be done slowly to be enjoyed. Rather expensive to buy curios but much to,see and do. Just a walk around lifts my spirit. And of course on a clear day just to stand and take in the magnificent mountain is enough to oft the spirit and refresh my soul.

Lazing in Cape Town. The Waterfront is a nice place to visit, where you can have a quiet beer looking at Table Mountain, or eat in one of the restaurants. I recommend the fish straight from the Oceans. And you can look out to sea, or take a trip round Table Bay, or, if you have half a day to spare, you can go whale watching.
Beautiful place. This place had great food, good shopping and friendly people. It is a nice enjoyable place to spend the day or evening at. There are many choices of food here.

The waterfront. We went at dusk and had drinks in one of the bars there with an amazing view. We looked through the shops and had a meal overlooking the water, a great view and good feel to it. Would definitely do that again.

Tourist central. A waterfront shopping area. For tourists. There are a lot of restaurants to choose from, but too touristy for my tastes. Nice to wander around for an afternoon to get over your jet lag, but there is so more more to discover in Capetown!

The heart of Cape Town.. This is a very vibrant part of Cape town . Every shop you can imagine. Lots of eateries. You can just sit and watch the world go by or partake in the retail experience. Beautiful setting. And the bonus is , if your lucky, sometimes thier is music in the middle of the V & A which will certainly get you feet tapping
So much fun. Great place to walk around and get trinkets for home. I enjoyed the arts fair the last Wednesday of the month. Had a great time.

Touristic. Built mainly for the tourist, the Victoria and Alfred Waterfront offer multiple food outlets, shops and a gateway to many tours and attractions. Its a very safe area to walk around and enjoy, a great place to relax a little bit from the outdoors. Lots of shops to discover and lots of things to do as well. You will pass through here for sure...

Microcosm big on the senses. A visit to Cape Town will not be complete without spending at least a few days in the V&A Waterfront. There is always something to do or see here for just about everyone. There is a theme park and playground for very young children, several museums for the history buffs, an ocean aquarium for all and various companies that offer boat and walking tours. Also, there is an abundance of shopping malls and stores that sell just about anything -- from trinkets to clothes and more. And more importantly, there are enough places to eat -- depending on what your palate dictates as well as your budget.One cannot say they have visited Cape Town if they have not at least spent a day exploring the Waterfront -- satisfying their senses!
Heart of the town. once you been there you are at the centre of cape town with entertainemnt places and connection to any other attractions.

a breautiful place made for turists. if you are looking for the hart of the city, this isnt it. But its a very beautiful place to walk, i did it everyday and it has lots of restaurants to choose from and stores selling anything you could possibly need.

aquarium at Water front world class.. This is a very commercial area, real tourist trap.
Many major shops, great choice of restaurants, from reasonably priced to up-market.
Interesting markets with lots of variety, and the Aquarium is world class, beautiful and should not be missed. Don't leave to little time to enjoy it!
Shopping. The best area for African Art at good prices that we found. the V&A Hotel was also a great place to stay with great rooms and a very cordial staff.

24/7 at V&A Waterfront. When we travel, we always forgot the time.
You don't have to worry the shop close at 5pm at that mall.
All the shops only close at 10pm every day! That's so good for the travellers
Great Beer. If like me, you enjoy a German beer or 2! Then hit the Paulaner Brauhaus on the V&A, it is as close to Munich as you can get without actaully being there.
Breathtaking... Beautiful and huge mall, tonnes of water activities and a refreshing water front. I went there twice and each time there was something new and exciting about the place.

Everything you could wish for. The V&A Waterfront echoes San Francisco's Pier 39 and Sydney's Darling Harbour. I think it comes out ahead of both for scenery and price. Top quality restaurants at easily half the price for the same in other places. Amazing backdrop of Table Mountain and lots of activity. Bustling, but in June, not too crowded at all. Obviously summer would be different, but this is a great time to visit.
Crowded shopping and family place. Crowded with rather limited shopping options.Good for food and grocery shopping at either Woolworths or Pick and Pay. Love the food and Mugg and Bean.

Relaxing fun afternoon. Many restaraunts and shops to visit.Lovely old clock tower and many other places.Memorial of the new South Africa, with statues of the "big 4 individuals" who were instrumental in changing South Africa into the Rainbow Nation in the '90s - at Nobel Square
SHOPPING Galore. Everything. Had a wonderful shopping spree there the whole weekend. Spend and more spending equals a Happy Lady :)
Must go. If you're going ti Cape Town, this is a must. It is the main place for eating and shopping. It's buzzing. Just be weary for pickpockets though...
shopping. An Awesome place to do shopping. They also have waterfront restaurants which are really good. The overall ambience is really good. Must visit place.
Always good to visit. The shops, the live music and entertainers and the location always make this a favorite when in Cape Town. You wont be disappointed. Go early to avoid the crowds...

Many things to see and do. We ate lunch next to the playground which is located in the square at the V&A which was perfect. The Eye in the Sky was amazing felt like it was too short at 12 minutes though! The Gemstone World ( Scratch patch) was a favourite with the kids (4y &2y) and the Aquarium well worth the time spent there

V&A Waterfront, my absolute favourite shopping paradise. If you can't find me over a weekend, go to the V&A Waterfront and you will find me there doing something, from dining, movies or shopping.If I miss a weekend I feel like I abandoned my favourite place in Cape Town. If in our beautiful city of Cape Town you have to make the time to visit this icon of all icons in the mother city, a must experience for all visitors to our beautiful city.I need not say another thing, please come and experience it for yourself. Kind regardsFerdie Liebenberg

Nice place. Nice place to stroll and window shop:) The hotel is magnificent and the mall looks wonderful, not to mention the huge ferris wheel that lights up at night! I'd also highly recommend taking one of ferries out into the waters. We had a hillarious guy who operated the boat and talked to us about the entire waterfront and everything else during our boat ride. You'll even get to learn about "guano" ! The ferry ride is much longer than expected. If I remember correctly, ours was well over half an hour. They literally show you the entire harbour from the ferry. Strongly recommend!

A visit to Cape town and not see the V&A Waterfront will be a sacrilege - A must for everyone - very cosmopolitan -. A day or a week at the Waterfront - you will always discover something new - something to do and see for everyone, young and old, single or married - a place where you can forget about your worries and your cares - excellent scenery and entertainment a not to missed highlight on your travels not to mention all the world class cuisines and coffee bars - summed up - JUST BRILLIANT ...

Bustling place. There was always something happening here; live music, performances, and lots of people . This was a short walk from Table Bay Hotel and my husband and I often found ourselves ending up here at some point during the day. It is certainly an upscale venue designed for tourists, but it also felt very safe for wandering around in the early morning and late evening.

Foreign vibe. We always like to visit the Waterfront when we feel like travelling as you are likely to spot foreigners. I rate this SA landmark one of the top working waterfronts to visit in the world.
Waterfront fun. Everything you are looking for you will find at the waterfront. The restaurants are exceptional. I love Cape Town.

Always a winner outing. As a local we just love to visit the V&A. There is always something new going on in the arena and there are so many restaurants to visit. Huge craft market and a Ferris wheel and during holiday times there are programs for children. There are awesome boat trips and helicopter rides as well.

A visit that will never be forgotten. This is an experience that you will never forget. Theres a big variety which will please any person visiting. Never ending fun, shops, entertainment and bars as well as restuarants to choose.

A day of food, fun and shopping. The atmosphere & buzz of this place both day and night was absolutely brilliant. Plenty of places to shop, dine, and be entertained. Spent a entire day there, lots of great spots for pictures and the ride on the big wheel gives you a nice overview with table mountain as a backdrop and the dock. The lovely craft shops and of course the two aquarium is a must see

Exclusive shopping and fine dining. Worth the visit if you enjoy exclusive shopping with most brands available here. Various restaurants offering the best in dining here, however mostly costly. Busy revamping most of the outside flea market spaces and a bit chaotic at the stage but still worth spending the day. The big wheel is an option for breathtaking views!
Visiting the V&A Waterfront. The V&A is since for a day visit. Mostly shopping! I find certain shops to be pricey especially the jewelry shops.

Great Vibe!. The Waterfront as a great place if you are looking for a great place to people watch, grab a meal or take a cruise into the Cape town bay. There is always a lot of people around and many shops to suit all tastes. Some of Cape towns best restaurants are based here. Overall there is a bit of everything for everyone at the Waterfront.
Touristy. Fun afternoon activity for shopping and riding the Ferris wheel. I think every tourist in Cape Town goes there. Restaurants are mediocre at best and everything is over priced

Nice place to visit. The center is right by the water - it is a nice location. One can walk out onto the promenade for a good walk by the sea.The center itself has an array of shops and restaurants with a wide choice of cuisine (both partially open and indoor dining options are available in most restaurants). On a good day, you should get a good view of Table Mountain from there. There is also a lot of street activity happening around the place - it is indeed a nice place to hang out.Overall a touristy place - worth the visit
V&A. Great variety of restaurants. Beautiful ocean views. Interesting shops for tourists. The only downside is that it is very expensive for the locals.

Beautiful waterfront, something for everyone !. No trip to Cape Town would be complete without a visit to V&A Waterfront! Colorful, with great food and shopping opportunities . Plan to spend a few hours to enjoy walking through all the shops. Sit and just enjoy the view and people watching. Great place for couples , families and singles alike , there is something for everyone there.

Dinner at Waterfront. What ever time of day I love the V & A Waterfront. So much life going on. Sometimes live music free. Amazing shops, so many restaurants all good. Right by the sea with the amazing view of Table Mountain. Not sure where to go, go there!

Great Place to Spend a Day. The waterfront was filled with things to do and see from boat rides to a Ferris Wheel to Nobel Square. Our favorite spots were the Water Shed which housed stalls where South African made goods were sold - e.g. woodcarvings, batik pictures, clothing, jewelry, pictures made from used tea bags, etc. Many of the items were made by cooperatives of individuals in small communities. There were also many other shops with souvenir and locally made items, restaurants, and Two Oceans Aquarium which is a small aquarium with an excellent kelp exhibit and rockhopper penguins.

Family day out. Popular tourist destination in Cape Town. Huge variety of restaurants, pubs and shops for all tastes and budgets.Craft markets, music, cinema and entertainment for kids.Harbour atmosphere with boat trips and dry dock. Fun to visit, but during December summer holidays parking is a nightmare and all restaurants are over full.Out of season visit recommended.

Close to our hotel. We stayed in this area at the Radisson Blu, its mostly an industrial area with lots of construction, although there is a water front are filled with shops. This is not an area that deserves a lot of time, there are much nicer places in Capetown. Maybe when all the construction is complete it will be nicer!

Much to see and do.. The V&A Waterfront has something for everyone....interesting shops as well as souvenirs for tourists and a drugstore for forgotten items. The restaurant scene is superb with offerings to suit every pocketbook. It's a very lively scene and litter free.
Always a great place to shop. Always a great place for shopping and dining. Great restaurants, entertainment and things to do for all ages.

victoria & alfred waterfront. The atmosphere & buzzing of the place both day and night is brilliant. Plenty of places to shop, dine, and be entertained. The people of africa were very friendly and polite. No shortage of transport. ( even though our hotel provided this for us.)
Great scene. Something for everyone. Awesome scenery for photo opportunities, great restaurants with something for everyone

The South Street Seaport of Cape Town. This waterfront area has a lot to offer in the way of accommodations, shopping, museums, restautrants, gathering spots, a swing bridge, amazing soapstone carvings, the gateway to the historic Robben's Island, where Nelson Mandela spent 18 years imprisoned, looking back at Table Mountain, etc. it is a logical this to make this waterfront area a tourist attraction, and luckily there are some shops here, outside of the main mall, that are dedicated to African arts and crafts, jewelry, and other indigenous arts. While you're in Cape Town, don't let this be your only shopping experience-- the Old Biscuit Mill, and it's Good Neighbors Market, with delicious, organic food stalls open Saturday only, are well worth the trip to the Woodstockneighborhood, and seem less touristy and more organic. Enjoy both!

fantastic for food and entertainment. Very expensive - you can get better deals at Canal Walk, however - great for restaurants, bars and touristy stuff - make sure you explore. There's some great hidden gems in some of the street vendors and cafes.
Beautiful Waterfront. There are plenty of shops and restaurants here also right at the harbor so you can watch the boats and relax.

Much to See. The waterfront has something for everyone. While shopping options are many, there are a number of other options; the aquarium, the harbor, music performers, different cuisines, just to name a few.

BEAUTIFUL HARBOUR & SHOPPING ARCADE. Alfred water front has so many things to offer to a traveller beginning from shopping some of the finest brands to a cruise down the Atlantic ocean on a catamaran.
Must-see. You cannot visit Cape Town without going to the V&A Waterfront: loads of entertainment, shopping and restaurants

Not your typical waterfront!. I tend to avoid places like this as they are almost always tourist traps. Not the case in Cape Town.
The V&A Waterfront offers lots to see, do, and eat. Best part is probably the scenery and Table Mountain backdrop.
For full story and pictures see here - http://www.thislifeintrips.com/cape-towns-va-waterfront-not-be-missed/

so much to do. need 3 days to see it all. Waterfront has shopping, diamond museum, robben island info, great meals, and beautiful scenery. We traveled with Gate1 travel which gave us free time to visit, great hotels nearby and city tour and transportation with Gate1.
Best travel value and great things to do at the waterfront.

The waterfront is not just a mall!. I've always thought of the Waterfront as a terrible tourist trap mall, primarily since I've always approached it from the underground parking areas. In the summer is it certainly packed with tourists and all of the trappings of tourism, but for the last 5 months I've been working near the Waterfront and decided to explore a bit. If you approach it from the Cape Grace Hotel, you can walk along the canal, past the grand floating mansions of the rich, across the charming little drawbridge, past the dry dock where they might be cleaning tugboats or fishing boats, then approach the tourist area welcomed by the statues of Mandela, Tutu, DeKlerk, and Luthuli in Noble Square. There is a great food market featuring a slightly more healthy and fresh fare than the fast food stalls inside the mall, and the recent remodel of the Design Center is a terrific showcase for crafts and handmade goods. You can escape the mall entirely, by staying close to the water, heading to the Clock Tower, and walk alongside the docks past the construction site for the Zeitz Museum of Contemporary African Art, due to open in 2017. I've loved this walk during my lunch hour!

Shop, eat & be entertained. The V&A is home to some of Cape Town's best restaurants and hotels, it's definitive collection of luxury retail brands, and big attractions like Robben Island cruises, the Two Oceans Aquarium (no nasty dolphin shows or captive whales!) and sunset cruises to nearby Camps Bay and Cape Town's Eye (not as big as London's but well worth the ticket price on a clear summer's evening). It's essentially a vast shopping mall set in Cape Town's very pretty working harbour with picture postcard views of Table Mountain and a strategic set of attractions dispersed between the shops, restaurants and hotels. There is plenty for everyone to do: families, couples and friends too. In summer, there are often quality performers in the public spaces - dancers, majembe bands and even acrobats. That makes the V&A a very popular and busy place that can occasionally be quite pricey. All in all, as long as you know you're going to a beautiful, busy, well-planned mall, I think it's a great collection of attractions in a gorgeous setting and highly recommended.

everything in one place. hotels shops restaurants aquarium all in one place. love the waterfront. I have watched this grow over 30 years when it started with just an old train carriage selling fish and chips! that's long gone to be replaced with high end shops and 5 star hotels. The cruise ships stop here all year round and you can spend a whole day being entertained and not spend a cent. highly recommend

Cape Town. Attractive waterfront with many stores....food...shopping...playing...and more.One can spend all day here and be pleasanly entertain without spending much cash.Hop On Hop Off buses cruise near by....highly recommended to ride the full circle...then choose stops.My Favorite stop was Table Mountain....and the outdoor market in town.

A surprise. Not an ordinary mall... There is something unique to the V& A (as the locals know it). From live performances in the amphitheater to a ride on the big wheel. Some excellent food in a choice of restaurants. Well worth a visit.
Fantastic shops and restaurants. A well kept shopping and dining area with many good shops and restaurants.You cannot fail to find food that you like!

Visit new Food Market. The best thing about the waterfront is the new Food Market en-route to the Aquarium. Browse, sample, eat or stroll. Loved it. Don't bother to try the Sea Kale, it's rather tasteless. All sorts of fresh an interesting food on offer. Go see!

GREAT EXPERIENCE. Very interesting experience lots of street entertainment which creates a great atmosphere. Good range of shops and restaurants plus excellent craft markets which sell good quality local products. Allow a couple of hours plus time to eat if you really want to appreciate this place.

The beat of the city. We've been going to the V & A Waterfront right from the start in the late 1980's. It is actually our regular haunt when we want to experience the beat of the city. It's is also great to experience all the different nationalities visiting. This is not a stagnant site and even if you go on a weekly basis, there will always be new things to see and do. World class stores, Table mountain, the aquarium, the best craft, live music and artists, great restaurants, simply the best hotels - the V & A waterfront has it all!
Something for everyone. Shopping, Curios, Massages, Crafts, Restaurants, Aquarium, Seaside yacht rides. You have to go, there is something for everyone
Fun Place. there's many restaurants lining the waterfront. The shops aren't spectacular, but its a nice place to hang out and people watch. Its also the base to Robben Island.

Great food. I expected a waterfront similar to those found in southern California. However, the V&A Waterfront was much, much more. I had meals at two wonderful restaurants, took a trip over to Robbens Island, rode the humongous ferris wheel, and visited a few of the very many shops. It was a wonderful way to spend the end of my four-week African holiday.
Sunday afternoons should always be like this. With a huge selection of bars, restaurants and shops there can be no finer way to spend a Sunday afternoon relaxing

Fab restaurants!. Good selection of top-class eateries; sushi, steak, sea food, everything you could want. The good sterling/rand exchange rate (18 ZAR=£1) meant that the best restaurants were about a third of London prices. Service was excellent. A great area to wander about, completely 'safe'.
Great mall. it is located on the water which is a great setting. beautiful, modern mall which great stores, restaurants, and a movie theatre

Dazzling!. The V&A waterfront is a frenetic place with so much eye candy, it's almost overwhelming. It's overlooks a working port, so there are boats coming and going all the time. There are shops, malls, museums, restaurants galore, buskers, a huge observation wheel, an aquarium ... you name it and you'll find it there. Well worth a visit.

Allow LOTS of time!!!. This place is amazing.
It has everything you could want. Shopping, eating, entertainment, tours, local art & craft and just so interesting to sit and watch the harbour.
Allow lots of time to visit as there is so much to see and do. Even if you're not interested in shopping.
NOT to be missed if you're in Cape Town!!!!

Shopping destination. The shops in the main mall area are largely generic. Make sure to visit the hand crafts building which is on the other side of the Ferris Wheel. Many restaurants in the area as well.
Good place to spend a cold day!. It is a good size mall and easily accessible. There are a variety of name brand stores, some good restaurants, tons of banks and atms and a movie theater.

An attraction that has lost its sparkle!. |Spent some time at the Victoria & Alfred Waterfront. Items are priced for the overseas market, lots of construction and closed shops.
From being a very viby place a few years ago it in now just a shopping mall in the harbour. Very sad!

Great place to watch the world go by. As good as waterfront as I've seen, some great bars and resteraunts, superb view of Table Mountain, access to Robben Island, lots of shops, alternatively just sit and people watch.
Exactly what holidays are all about!
Great place for shops and restaurants. The prices can be a bit high because it's a touristy spot, but the views of Table Mountain from the waterfront are amazing!

A must, one of the best Waterfronts in the world.. Do not miss this experience, shopping, restaurants, best views, best atmosphere, music, air flips, boat trips, walk in an atmosphere of a mixed world of cultures.The mix of outdoor and indoor is just the best.Talking about a view, you are walking amongst thousands of people that are all in a dream world as they walk past talented sports tricks or diverse musicians and this great view that surrounds the outside of the Waterfront.Been goin there for the last twenty years and never get bored with been there as I will enjoy a new thing every time.Love, love love!

We went the day the cruise ships were in. Brilliant atmosphere. The place came alive with street entertainment, the Hotels were buzzing with outside café experiences and the swing bridge entrance was great to see. The unique shops were a great hit with the tourists and quality.The boats leaving for Robben Island

Total Diversity. It was amazing to see at the V & A Waterfront a total diverse population living in total harmony. The shops was beyond International standard. The Waterfront was hygienic clean and proudly South African.

Best waterfront in Africa. Amazing amazing amazing!Every time I went to Victoria and Alfred Waterfront it give me different colors. Nice and calm in the morning, lively in afternoon, busy in the evening. Music people restaurants bars shops....everything just like in town jungle!!
happening place. must visit for any traveller to this beautiful city. evenings are amazing, just watch the sun set. the bay area is joyful and fun filled with lots of music and food in the evning

Great waterfront park. An excellent shopping zone and a pretty waterfront park. Nicely located near the Port for cruisers. Stock up on food in the supermarket while shopping for souvenirs or just enjoy the sights.
