The Port of Cape Town is deemed to be one of the busiest shipping corridors in the world. 5) Cape Town was named the World Design Capital for 2014 by the International Council of Societies of Industrial Design.Well, I don't know if I was capable of describing how much I like Cape Town, but by far is one of the trips that I will remember forever.

Great place to shop and wander. If you are in Cape Town this is a great place to visit, shop,eat and wander - we love it. If you are self catering there is a a very large well stocked Pick and Pay Supermarket .The other thing we liked was in the carpark - there are lights above the bays - red if they are taken and guess what -green if empty so no need to tool up and down.

Vibrant. The waterfront has shops, craft areas an aquarium boat trips and a most fantastic atmosphere all of its own and views of Table Mountain Lions Head and Signal Hill.Also plenty of excellent restaurants. Most of all - very safe for tourists, night and day.

Nice place. This is a really good area. The shops are good, the ones on the waterfront are all nice little individual ones. It is also a good place to eat, loads of choice food wish.
It is very safe lots of security. We sat overlooking the Marina watching the seals playing.

Wonderful Waterfront. Trendy place to shop and eat. We especailly liked Mondiall and would highly recommend that as an eatery. Great just to sit and sip a cocktail or a beer and soak up the waterfront atmosphere.

Great view of the V&A!. The get a birds eye view of the Victoria Alfred waterfront... We were able to see for miles and take some amazing pics of the V&A waterfront, Table mountain, Cape Town Stadium and even Robben Island! The Cape Wheel offers 30 fully enclosed air conditioned cabins that will take you 40 metres above the ground in safety and comfort on the 12 - 15 minute, 4 revolution ride. A bit pricy for locals at R100.00 a head, but still well worth "ticking of your bucket list".

Wonderful to visit. The Waterfront is a special place to visit The ambiance of the place make it a main tourist attraction Try the big wheel and see far around you, Try the shopping centre or movie theatre There is an amphitheatre where you can sit and whatch for local music talent . Walk and sit next to the sea and watch the ships , Dont forget the many restaurants Surely you wont be bored at the waterfront
Loads to do and see. Shops,restaurants,bars all good quality well worth a visit............................................
Lots to see. A vibrant shopping and eating area with lots to see and do, and with some fantastic restaurants. Very safe and hassle free.
Always something to see. Great place for shopping, eating, chilling out and just people watching. Whatever your budget you will find something suitable.
Nice. Lovely Place for dinning, shopping, night life, and new years eve. we couldn't stop going back there! place of attractions are endless. This is not to be missed.

Stunning venue . The V&A is such a great place to visit. With stunning restaurants and shops. Just don't ask the taxis outside the mall to take you anywhere. They are shark's. Charging you a minimum of R50. 00 to take you just up the road it's a shame that they steel holiday going people money.

loved it.. this place has all you will ever want and need when it comes to shopping and eating. it had shows at nite things for the kids and for adults. you really do need a day there to its self if not more. you can get the tourist bus and tours from here so you may find you go there to start and end you day trips. enjoy
Amazing Place!. Very lively place with good music and street performers to keep one hitched! The go to place for everything.

The Gem of Cape Town. With its extensive array of upmarket shopping and dining options, the V & A Waterfront is a must see for any visit to Cape Town. Water activities include short harbour trips, longer sunset cruises or daily ferry rides to Robben Island. The shopping mall houses an art and craft market, cinema complex and good choice of food establishments, coffee shops and restaurants. Take a ride on The Wheel, walk around the Two Oceans Aquarium or simply soak up the sights and sounds of the harbour and Table Mountain backdrop. A number of hotels, offering luxury accommodation, conference and spa facilities are also conveniently based in the vacinity.

The glitzy face of Cape Town. Lovely restaurants with the high end shops and boutiques. The waterfront area is a great place to take a stroll around and have a tasty lunch or dinner. We ate in a couple of restaurants there and enjoyed the experience. Lovely overlooking the water.

If you miss it you didn't come to Cape Town. The heart beat of the Mother City, the V&A is the must place to visit. It has something for everyone and anyone. Great restaurants and bistros, shopping, sightseeing trips, the Wheel, Two Oceans Aquarium, etc etc. Where else can you see statues of four Nobel Peace winners. All with Table Mountain as a back drop.The re development of this old dock area of Cape Town has proved to be making of Cape Town as an international tourist destination and it is still going on. Each time we visit there is something new for the visitor, long may it continue.

Worth a visit. This place is a real buzz. Huge variety of great shops, talented street performers, lovely selection of cafes and restaurants. Loads to see and do. Soak up the atmosphere, people watch, sit in the sun, shop till you drop, have an alfresco lunch - the choice is yours

Something for everyone. The Waterfront is a great example of redevelopment done well. There is something to satisfy all tastes; huge variety of restaurants, shopping, boat tours, aquarium, history, street entertainers etc. We particularly liked the watershed with lots of local arts and crafts, the food hall and the Nobel peace prize winner statues

BEST LOCATION IN CT. right in the middle of the action ,next to the best seafood and sushi restaurants in CT , good service ,spotless, great breakfast with champagne and oysters included, excellent value overall,get the attic rooms for a great view .
Nothing special. Nothing really more than a big mall by the harbour. Not really worth its fame. The only good thing is the view of table mountain. I wouldnt go there again.
beautiful. must go there, dont do the big wheel its a waste of money. all restaurants and enviroment is terrific.

ALWAYS GOOD TO GO. No matter what time of the year, this is a must for every visitor visiting Cape Town. There are plenty good restaurants and lots of sight seeing to do. they also offer boat trips, the Aquarium, The Red and Blue Bus (hop on and hop off busses)If you would like to do shopping, that is also a very good option.

Nice choice for restaurants. Visited V&A over Christmas period . It's a big mall located in the Harbour area , filled with loads of shops and restaurants .If visiting , best time to go is just after New Year when there are loads of sales for shopaholics at the numerous brand name stores. Food choices are massive but be prepared to wait for tables if you have not booked .Restaurants are more pricier but if you head there between 4 and 6 pm , some offer half price sushi and cocktails .There is always some entertainment at the Waterfront especially for the kids . There are a number of charter boar companies offering rides along the coast line - unable to give prices . Plenty of parking available .

A really interesting and enjoyable place to go. On the Red Bus tour on our first day, the commentary suggested that the V&A Waterfront was modelled on Sydney and San Francisco but that they thought they had taken it a little further. That made me wonder if this was just a bit of hype. However, our first (because there will be others before we finish our holiday) venture into the Waterfront was a wonderful experience. The first place we visited was the Market on the Wharf and we were completely blown away. A bewildering array of wonderful smells and stall after stall of fantastic food, all beautifully presented. No one hassles you - you can taste many of the goodies on offer before committing to a purchase. Friendly people and lots to see. Next, we visited the Watershed which has a huge range of crafts, clothing, jewellery, ceramics and the like on offer, all in a big light and airy space - no tat anywhere. Again, really helpful, friendly people. We could have spent another couple of hours there alone. We emerged just in time to catch the last couple of songs by a band called the Parletones that were doing an impromptu, free concert in the Amphitheatre. Finally, we had a good look around the Victoria Wharf Shopping Centre which, on the surface, was 'just another mall' but actually turned out to be a really interesting place to window shop and people watch. We're nowhere close to having seen all that the Waterfront has to offer - but we'll be back to pick up where we left off. Highly recommended.

Pleasant. The V&A is a very central point in CT to get to other destinations such as the wine tours, hop on hop off, RObben Island tours etc. So once there, it makes sense to spend upto 2-3 hours shopping around the waterfront, and trying their new food market warehouse. It is pleasant and has many high end brands for luxury shopping.

New Years eve. Maybe it worked for some people,after all its a free entrance event,but was for me and my friends the greatest let-down.Nothing seemed sincere,with a compere who just......and a music band that did anything but create cheer........I came into the New Year thinking,Waterfront,you lost a great opportunity to make a local proud and entertained,I was ashamed to have convinced my friends to support you.

A great way to spend a day. Victoria and Alfred waterfront has access to Robben island, many restaurants, shops (mall), art galleries, food centres, in short, all you will need for a nice day in Cape Town. Nearby Two Oceans Aquarium, Victoria Wharf mall, Waterfront Craft market (highly recommended) and Clock Tower square all within walking distance from each other (max 15 minutes).

Theatre of Culture. Many countries, global citizens, multiple nationalities and flavours of clothing, food, attractions and sights.Always busy and high with energy. The views on Table Mountain frame a perfect South African picture. Great stuff!

Big...so sort out where you want to go.. The V&A Waterfront is a big place so you shouldn't just browse 'cos you're likely to miss places and not enjoy all the shops on offer. Do your homework and plan the visit.This last trip we planned to see The Hobbit an 12.00 so got there at 9.00 to have breakfast in Mugg and Bean and then mooched around Exclusive Books and the DVD store and then into the Apple shop and then Incredible Connections. Job done.After the movie we bought some food in Woolworths and then off home.There are dozens of clothes shops there and the list goes on. It can get very busy at holiday times so being early doesn't hurt.It's the best shopping in Cape Town and is a great place to eat and drink. It's pretty much got it all. Enjoy.

Must see in Cape Town. Plenty of fun. A huge shopping mall, many restaurants, fine dinning, souvenirs, local food and shows, unique spots to see the amazing Table Mountain including a gorgeous ferris wheel. Need to say anything else?
I love the Waterfront. A really buzzing place. Great restaurants and bars. Nice shops. Harbour cruise great fun. Best place to stay- Cape Grace or the One and Only which had the best pool.

Beautiful tourist experience.. This is a very beautiful picturesque waterfront mall in the heart of Cape Town . I visited this mall many times during my stay in Cape Town over the Christmas period. It has the Two oceans aquarium ,the boat cruises to Robben Island start from there and you can book most activities here. There also have the "eye of Cape Town . The waterfront is a tourist hub. It was packed with people most of the time. The views of the table mountain were stunning. There is a small harbour were boats take off from. The main attraction for me were the many restaurants were we sat at ocean basket resturant and enjoyed a meal as the sun set. It was windy at the resturant but we endured just to enjoy the views. They were various people doing all sorts of entertaining activities from traditional dancing , ball juggling , fire spitting . We were warned that thieves are rampant at these activities. For the discerning shopper there are many shops in the mall. The price of goods at most shops is inflated .I went to the statues of the Nobel price winners . There are statues of Nelson Mandela , Archbishop Emeritus Desmond Tutu, W de Klerk and a forth guy. There were the architects of the new South Africa. The only disappointing thing was how the statue is Mandela remotely looked like him.

overall an amazing place. the aquarium the new watershed , the attractions , a fabulous place. yes in some areas very touristy, often overcrowded, but everyone can find the right corner and the best food . a unique place, a must see

Great place to spend a few days. We stayed at the Cape Grace hotel in the V&A Waterfront area. Such a great place for shopping and to eat and drink. Good selection of restaurants; seafood is a speciality with plenty of choice. Prices are low if you are from the UK. Well worth a visit.

Touristy but really fun with great restaurants and a new craft area. We were there at Christmas and it was crowded, but you've got to love the Waterfront in Cape Town. Touristy yes, but there are several very good restaurants, a gorgeous view, and a new building filled with vendors selling distinctive foods, arts and crafts. I had a foot massage that was fantastic—go upstairs and there are several stalls for massage and accupressure. If you've never been to Cape Town, walk around the Waterfront and eat at Belthezar and you'll have a lovely evening.

Good vistas but very touristy. The V& A Waterfront has wonderful vista's over table mountain however i find it to be very touristy .The prices at restaurants and markets are really overpriced,good for window shopping for wallet but not much else

Awesome place to hang out. If you feel like chilling or hanging out, this is the place to go! A beautiful place to watch the sunset, relax, and spend time either buying things from the shops, chilling with friends, or eating in the restaurants

Great place to stroll and people watch. Right on the waterfront and bustling with people. Many restaurants, shops, Ferris Wheel, hotels and more. Can spends days here. Yes it was full of tourists, and prices may be a little inflated, but it's still a great place.
Nice shopping. . People say it's a tourist trap, well of course it is. Plenty of interesting shops and reasonable restaurants. Certainly worth a look.

Start your visit to Cape Town here. A restored area of the Cape Town waterfront facing on to the harbour and the Marina, and close to the stadium. It's full of restaurants, cafe's, shops, markets and close to a large shopping Mall. Loads of places to shop, lots of restaurants to sate your appetite and, best of all, its just a great place to stroll through at any time of the day or evening. There's even a Big Wheel. Window shop, watch the people, enjoy the sights of the boats in the harbour, have snack, enjoy a meal. There's even a selection of hotels to stay in to really enjoy the location.Just a great place to hang out even if you don't want to shop or eat.It's the starting point for cruises, the departure point for trips to Robben island, and the first departure point of the "Hop-on, Hop-off" bus. Make it the key to your visits to Cape Town.

Everything to do at the Victoria & Albert Waterfront. At the end of our visit to South Africa and Namibia, we stayed for several nights at the Waterfront Village Apartments on the Victoria and Albert Waterfront Cape Town.This is our third visit and during the last ten years the V&A waterfront has become a more diverse and culturally exciting destination.There is so much to do. Whether it`s taking the ferry to Robben Island, experiencing the fantastic V&A Food Market, visiting the aquarium, or the Red Shed Craft workshop there are a host of attractions. There are even seals in the dock who love to show off to the yachts around them, and a Big WheeL to experience.Hungry. There are 40 restaurants to choose from and every type of cuisine imaginable. The Waterfront Village Apartments with their views over the marina are an ideal place to stay. Security is good and they are very well equipped. If you fancy a night in, there is a "Pick and Pay" supermarket where you can stock up on convenience foods and wine.We were there over the weekend and there was a great Jazz Festival at the North Wharf.

Everything you need in one place!. Living in Cape Town I have the luxury of having the V&A on my doorstep.I could literally go there every weekend. The vibe, location and millions of things to do make this place one of the ultimate attractions of Cape Town.The best time to be at the waterfront is during the festive season. When it is this time of the season the place is buzzing from live music being performed by the locals to having a nice lunch looking over the sea with Robben Island on the horizon.If shopping is your thing, well you need to look no further. With 100s of shops to choose from you will never walk out there without getting the items you needed.If non of the above are your thing you have sunset cruises, helicopter rides, big wheels, fast paced power boats, Aquariums and many more sea activities to choose from. You can also enjoy a movie at Nu-Metro if you feel like being indoors and catching a movie.The location is fantastic as well with having Cape Town's popular long street right down the road so you can enjoy a bit of the club life or you can pop over to Green Point and check out the awesome Cape Town Stadium.You can even catch a taxi to Signal Hill to watch the noon gun go off or walk up the amazing Lions Head to watch the sun go down. It is also a quick trip to the popular Camps Bay main road where you can sip on some cocktails and enjoy the sunset.All in all this place is in the perfect location and has the widest range of activities than any other place in Cape Town. The V&A is a perfect starting point for anyone wanting to experience Cape Town and I would recommend it to anyone without a flinch. There is an abundance of parking as well so if you driving there, you will not get to flustered when looking for a place to park.

shops and restaurants. This is a very modern area without much charm, but a pretty view of the harbour and some of the best restaurants in town. Difficult to park, generally need to walk through a mall to get anywhere.

Terrific place to visit, shop or dine. We walked there today from out hotel. Wonderful variety of restaurants and shops. There was some kind of circus show. There were musicians. Lots of boat traffic in the harbour. Great day.

lawtev62 GOOD SHOP AND RESTAURANTS. Victoria and Alfred waterfront is South Africa most popular shopping with the best reastaurants in Cape Town .
The address is:
Breakwater boulevard
Victoria and Alfred waterfront,
Cape Town,
8002, South Africa
Phone:(+27) 21 408 7500
You will be surprised to see this shop and good restaurants.

Romance by the front . The tip of Africa has never looked so good. This is the place to be if you are looking for a vibrant and colourful spot with a fresh sea breeze. Amazing food from incredible little corner restaurants!!

Walk with the family. A perfect place to enjoy a drink or dinner by the water or spend time around people. A lot of shopping, and easy parking. A playground for the kids so they don't get bored! The place is lovely .

Varied Sights and attractions. The waterfront has evolved over the years and now offers a great mix from the practical to the exotic. There is a huge variety of shops from day-to-day supermarkets like Pick n'Pay to designer boutiques and handicrafts outlets. Restaurants cover all interests and wallets with the excellent Spur Steak house, pizza outlets, fish restaurants and the high class Hildebrand. Craft warehouses the Blue Shed and Red Shed showcase local handicrafts although they have lost some of their original spontaneity. The maritime museum complements the day-to-day ship repair work continuing in the dry docks alongside the luxurious modern hotels. The aquarium is also a splendid attraction and don't miss the Scratch Patch for semi-precious stones.

V&A Waterfront - excellent venue for food, fun and good company. A wonderful venue for food, fun, and good company.Food: Absolute wide variety of tastes across the globe. Halal food available for sure!Fun: Kids rides, big people rides (Cape Town Eye), etcCompany: Loads of entertainment and a great atmosphereSafety: patrolling guards visible all the timeParking: Ample and safe

Lovely area!. The Victoria & Alfred Waterfront is a beautiful, buzzing and wonderful place to visit. Pretty houses, great stores, a lovely waterfront, fantastic restaurants, shops, cafes, bars, and so much more. This is a superb part of the Mother City and must-be visited. Highly recommended!
smashing place soo great!! Lekka!!!. this quay is amazing it has sooo many shops catering for all needs from designer to basics!! food out lets are great and thing you can see are really interesting.

Not just the tourist centre but also a good place t people watch. I have been t Cape town many times over the years and still visit the Waterfront as a matter of course, great Restuarants, she good hotels that I have stayed in. Over the years, but also a working port.This time an walking into. The area past the Cape Grace, watching Dragon Boat racing between three teamd into the Marina, big ships being pushed into place by tugs. And then I see the new watershed craft market - well worth a visit.All in a great place whether your first or your hundreths visit
Not to be missed if in Capetown. Excellent variety of shops, restaurants and museums. Can easily spend a few days meandering around here. Plus the views of the ocean and Table Mountain are stunning!

What a buzz!. Whenever family and friends from elsewhere in the country come to visit, going to the Waterfront is on the list of must do outings. It is the perfect venue to stroll around leisurely, while browsing through the markets, shops and the like. Having a delicious meal in such an exquisite setting, cater for the whims of most. This is a place where one truly winds down, whether you take a boat ride or just sit and watch the seagulls ready to snatch up something to eat. And, needless to say, with world renowned Table Mountain as the back drop, what more can you ask for?

A day's experience to enjoy. The Victoria & Alfred Waterfront is a destination to be experienced by all travellers….definitely the best I have been to. The Waterfront is not just a shopping mall, so set aside a few hours to take it all in. A choice of restaurants, shopping for all, with the brand new Watershed Market to top it all and many, many other attractions for the whole family. Explore the Waterfront and you will be surprised what it has to offer!

One of the best attractions in the world. The V&A Waterfront has it all. Great shopping , dining , cruises , working harbour experience , hotels , views , markets and constantly building to improve what it has to offer. Fortunate to live nearby and this is our second home. Best in the world!
Great Shopping, Restaurants and Views. A one stop destination for shopping, eating and just taking in the views of the harbour, Table Mountain, Lion's Head and Devil's peak.

You can't come to Cape Town without a visit!. A visit to the waterfront is an absolute must if you come to Cape Town. Personally, I'm not a big fan of shopping, and if I was then I'd probably shop elsewhere as the prices here are much more expensive than anywhere else in the city. However, it's still a great place to eat out, catch a boat ride or simply stroll around taking in the sites and street performers. Parking is really cheap, too (by UK standards!).
Must see in cape town. Very nice place to start exploring in the afternoon. Once dusk sets in, feast in one of the many restaurants. Was there during Volvo Ocean race.

Nice vibe in the evening. The waterfront has a nice vibe in the evening. Great for shopping and eating out. Boat trips and helicopter flights departs from the waterfront. Tickets for these can be bought at the waterfront.

Love the Waterfront. We have been to Cape Town twice and elected to stay near the waterfront on both occasions. We love it there. There is so much to do, including shopping, eating and just walking around people watching. We can't imagine staying anywhere else. You can see Table Mountain, visit the Nelson Mandela museum and visit Robben Island. Do not miss the V&A Waterfront when you visit Cape Town.
Something for everyone. The V & A Waterfront has many restaurants which is great for everyone. We found some great places to eat and the shopping was good too. Nice way to spend a few hours.

Great! Loved it!. Here is an area that has something for everyone and you will never be bored no matter how many times you return. Firstly it is clean with many seating areas. The views are great and you can see Table Mountain and even Robben Island. The marina is lovely and you can even get a cruise. The atmosphere is electric with live bands, people dancing and a ferris wheel. If you love people watching, this is the go to place. Other options are the rugby museum and a visit to the famous Shimansky diamond factory. The shopping is also great but for souvenirs, I would stick to Green Market Square where you can bargain and get cheaper prices for the same merchandise. However, if you have a time constraint, this is great one stop shopping. You will also find many crafty places as well as high end stores.There is a huge selection of dining possibilities from sit down nice restaurants to fast food.So much to do and so little time!

Poor Maintenance. Not having visited this development for some time , I was surprised at how it has lost it's previously pristine look. The mall itself is looking good but all the outside areas were grubby and poorly maintained,balustrades chipped and needing painting, wooden benches in great need of refinishing showing peeling varnish or bare wood.The visit was during the Volvo Ocean Race which is a very prestigious event but still nothing had been done to maintain the various areas, very disappointing

A shopping centre for all ages, tastes and financial levels!. If you don't mind the expensive parking fee, then this is a shopping centre for you. There are the Luxe brands e.g. Louis Vuitton, Gucci, Chopard, you name it, and the High Street brands, e.g. Mango, Top Shop, Zara etc. Then there are hundreds of restaurants and fast food outlets to feed the entire family. Cinemas too. What more do you want? The outside open parking spaces are cheaper for longer term sojourn, but they get filled up quickly. If you spend over a certain amount at Pick n Pay, you get free parking for 1.5 hours. Enjoy.

Nice Mall. You can find everything you need at the same place. It's a big mall with the Table Mountain as background.Prior to traveling to the game reserves, I could find there all that I needed (pharmacy, clothes, souvenirs...)

Great place to dine, shop,relax and view. Victoria & Alfred Waterfront is a great place to visit. Not only can you shop till you drop, eat till you sleep but also find great views of Table Mountain and have fun in the sun.

Good shopping and dining at V&A Waterfront in Cape Town. When in Cape Town, one invariably would visit the V& A Waterfront Complex in Cape Town Central for dinner or lunches and shopping. The v&A Waterfront is about 2-3 kilometres from the Cape Town Central district. There are numerous good dining establishments in the complex which serve various cuisines including Malay Cape cuisines. Seafood restaurants abound in the complex, and one can have a good choice of where to eat. Shopping will tend to be more expensive that other places in Cape Town. A number hotels in Cape Town Central have shuttle service to and from the V&A Complex thereby making the complex easily accessible to tourists.Good meals can be had at the V&A Waterfront of Cape Town. A good place to visit but not a must.
Nice place for shopping and also to eat. It is a nice place for shopping; to eat and also for site seeing! I can spend hours walking on the docks! Really nice!

Interesting place to visit. There is so much to do around this place. It is also one of the most crowded and popular areas around so you need to be prepared for crowd. There is something for everybody. Sights to see and gasps. Shops and restaurants to sit and relax and fulfill your souvenir quotas. The whole waterfront in itself is pretty much active. It is a place where you can see the true spirit of Cape Town.

What is the attraction?. Take away all the overpriced restaurants and souvenir shops at the V & A Waterfront, and what is one left with? It is badly laid out, with an absence of clear sign posts and guide maps to show where one is, or wants to go. We visited the Waterfront a few years ago and when we went there earlier this year, it seems to have taken a giant leap backwards. This is one place I will certainly never bother to waste my time visiting again. In my opinion, it is badly run, full of money-grubbing, overpriced shops offering very little of interest.

Relaxation. Contrary to some reviews a enjoyed staying close to the V & A and found surprisingly some of the best boutiques that I had visited 4 years ago still presented very high quality goods. The only disappointing side was the installation of and Eye in the Sky type structure which reminded me of a fairground and was too intrusive although undoubtedly gave a great view of Table Mountain .The harbour is as busy with ship building etc but still retains the pristine waters as previously.

All weather stop. The V&A Waterfront is a hive of activity for tourists and locals alike! If you do not like crowds, stay away as this is a very busy place, especially at weekends and in season. There is something for everyone though and you can shop, browse, have coffee, go to the movies, enjoy the view of Table Mountain, or look out to sea and spot Robben Island which is visible too. If you want some "quiet", buy an ice-cream and head for the "Clock-Tower" and sit and watch the world go by, literally! You will spot a seal or two and if you are lucky and in whale season, a few of these majestic creatures can be spotted while you look out to Robben Island.Plenty to do and see, you just have to go with the flow.

One stop shop. Everything you need is at this mall. Plenty of stuff to keep you busy when you are tired of shopping in this massive place. Take a boat trip on one of the boats in the harbour, go for a spin on the big wheel, go visit the two oceans aquarium, get some thing to eat in one of the fabulous restaurants.

A must-see! And return for more!. Whether it's strolling around, ice cream in hand, celebrating a special occasion or serious shopping, the Waterfront has lots on offer. Our family enjoys the boat cruises and the scenery astounds us every time. Most of the restaurants offer fab food and great dining experiences. The live music and seals create a holiday atmosphere. It is always busy with tourists, locals, business people and uptown mommies catching up on their retail therapy.

Great Food. There is a bottle shop ( wine spirits etc) near the square and wine for $3A a bottle, very good quality wines.The Irish or British restuarant near the tourist office, special 2 steaks, salad chips and a bottle of red wine $25A for 2 people, the food was excellent and great value.The shopping centre there is reasonable priced.
Fun. It is for tourists as most waterfront type "malls" are, but, nevertheless, fun to walk down from our hotel nearby to do some souvenir shopping and have a drink or meal.

Fun Day. The V&A Waterfront is a fun way to spend your day in Cape Town. You will see a working seaport with boats coming in and out, lots of shopping -- everything from upscale mall to handcrafted local artisan work. There are museums in walking distance, and you can catch the hop-on hop-off from here and take tours of the whole city. Any kind of restaurant you might want is to be found. Bathroom facilities were convenient and clean.

Another tourist spot. Most of tourists have to come here. It's pretty much like shopping mall you can see everywhere. This is the biggest place, in my opinion, for shop in cape town. I would say it's an up market. Most white guys and tourist like to come here and even go for grocery shopping, but not local - black or color- people.There're many restaurant, Thai, Chinese, Vietnamese, Italian, and more.

Not Appealing. The waterfront is pretty but felt like being at an unpleasant combination of Times Square in NYC and Disney. Between the crowds of tourists, overpriced retail stores and general lack of South African character, I felt my time was better off spent elsewhere. It's fine if you want to shop at the same stores that are in the US, but I recommend ditching the waterfront and checking out the beautiful seaside towns along the peninsula.
Beautiful!. I loved this place! There are many options of restaurants, small shops and entertainment. It is very beautiful and pleasant to see and stay!<3

The choice is endless. The Victoria & Alfred Waterfront is a mecca for tourists & offers all kinds of eateries from simple coffee shops to gourmet restaurants. You can have breakfast, lunch, dinner combined with as many coffee breaks as you want as you browse the hundreds of shops in the Mall; eats, drink, inside or outside, there is something for everyone at the V & A Waterfront.

Fabulous. This is a great place to dine, shop, and people-watch. The indoor mall is huge but predictable. The restaurants, both in and out of the mall are outstanding. Outside is where the action is, though. There's a giant Ferris wheel, street entertainers, and small shops everywhere. We found the best prices and most interesting authentic African art and artifacts at The African Trade Market.
Decent mall.. A nice selection of shopping, not many luxury brands to choose from... Was anticipating much more fruitful shopping.

Nice harbour experience. There place has a lot of shops but the restaurants and boat rides in the harbour is the best. There are different price options as well for both, so take a stroll and see what is available before you make a choice.

Great place to visit when in Cape Town. This is a must see stop when in Cape Town. It is very scenic with lots of great places for food, drinks and shopping. Also great for people watching.This is also where you catch the boat to Robben Island. It is one of the stops on the Hop On/Off Bus too.You can't go to Cape Town without stopping at the waterfront.

Enjoyed the outdoors less the indoor. The indoor mall mostly had stores that I can find also in the US. I did enjoyed the few local stores and visited the local supermarket downstairs, but I spent more time outside, where there was a beautiful marina view with nice restaurants with outdoor seating along the boardwalk. Lovely occasional performances by local artists and bands along the boardwalk. Definitely a must do while in Cape Town.

Commercialized tourist trap. Okay I don't like shopping malls, but the V & A always means I get lost trying to find parking thanks to the brilliant lack of signs coupled with massive suicide tourists and the normal CT drivers, who are never laid back when it comes to their shopping. Over priced restaurants with commercialized food and frantic foreigners make it my least favourite place to hang out unless it is raining or you need to catch a boat. Allow plenty of time to get to an appointment there.

Nice, but Skip if you Live in a Big City. The A&V Waterfront is a pleasant mix of high-end shops, restaurants and posh condos, but having lived in port cities before (San Francisco, Liverpool (UK) and Hong Kong), it wasn't that special for me. Our time in Cape town was limited, so we didn't spent much time here. In my opinion, A&V Waterfront is great if:- You want to retail shop (but shops in US and UK are similar)- Eat great interntional food at quality restaurants - Buy Souvenirs (pricier)- Get cash from ATM- Have time to kill and want to relax in a nice coffee shop or bar- Go for a stroll on the promenande- Find info about HOHO bus as main office is thereIf time is limited, I would give it a miss, and visit other attracts.
Great vibe. The Waterfront pulses with the Mother City vibe and offers loads of great food experiences, entertainment and shopping.

Great for tourists & amazing food. We stayed in the Lawhill Apts in the Marina and went to the V&A pretty much every day. They do have security around r waterfront which makes it safe to go at night time as well as during the day. There are some beggars who will not leave you alone if you have food in your hand. One followed us all the way next to the aquarium until we got close to a security and finally he stopped. Other than that, the V&A has great shops and restaurants. Highly reccomnded: Cafe Alfredo for breakfast brunch or lunch and also the Market on the Wharf as well as ferrymans. I would skip Mondiall unless you want to pay for the view because the food was overpriced and not that great. The V&A is also a connecting location for the Robben Island tour. Great great location.

Great place to stay. We stayed in an apartment on the marina and walked to the waterfront each day/night to shop and eat. There are so many places to eat suiting all budgets. Shopping also covers all budgets. The waterfront is a very safe area for tourists.
Huge selection of shops and restaurants. If in Cape town , this is a must. You can do all your shopping conveniently and relax in the many restaurants. Don't miss a visit to the oceanarium.

Touristy. Decided to pop by for a quick walk and lunch while waiting for my hotel room. This is basically a touristy waterfront area with many average restaurants. The 2 oceans aquarium is also a short walk away. Probably nice for a quick walk but nothing much else there

Simply Beautiful!!. How beautiful it was to walk along the piers to all of the restaurants and shopping taking in the views of the Atlantic Ocean and Table Mountain. The Waterfront was in walking distance from our hotel or easily accessible by the Hop on Hop Off Bus or taxi. It was in a nice location nearby the aquarium. There were shops with clothing, beautiful artwork and countless restaurants with excellent food. There was plenty to do in the daytime and also it was just as beautiful lit up at night. An ampitheatre was there that seats a large number of people to enjoy the music and other entertainment. Bands were playing, people were singing, and dancers were dancing along the way which made it excellent for nightlife. Would love to go back and do it all over again!

Window shopping.... Great place to have a break from the usual holiday. Plenty on offer to take home. Some of the items were very expensive, so be prepared to ask/ negotiate. Plenty of great places to eat, at whatever price range suits your pocket. Always felt safer here than in the cities
Wonderful Experience. Buskers. Lots of places to eat. Plenty of shopping and very beautiful. Don't miss it. We visited May 2010 and the weather was gorgeous.
Alright. Do not understand what the hype is about. This shopping centre is very average with a few restaurants and cafes. Worth a visit if you're hungry and want the odd bits and bobs.

No visit in Cape Town can be a visit without a visit to the V&A. The V&A is a must. Perfect location..excellent restaurants..many quality shops. Also offer lost and lots of oppetunities for excursions. The waterfront is very well managed ..is safe and clean. We spend time at the waterfront..at least twice a month...for many, many years allready.

Restaurants and shopping area. We thought it miwould be more touristy than it was, but it did have its fair share of tourist stores. There was nothing outstanding about the restaurants, they catered to the tourist crowd and were crowded. It's worth a visit if you want to by some trinkets, but find someplace else to eat that isn't in a hurrry to feed you and get you out so the next groupo can come in.

V&A Waterfront Cape Town. We stayed in the Waterfront area fo 5 days, Good restaurants and very safe environment. Lots of shops as well. Sunset cruise was fantasticWould definitely recommend the waterfront as a base when visiting Cape town

Overall shopping experience. Always a pleasure to visit the V&A Waterfront whether you are a serious shopper or just running in to get something quick, the convenient new basement entrance to Pick and Pay makes it easy to just hop and skip in for a quick shop.The movie theater sports a new addition called Scene where you can lounge in a huge lie down chair and enjoy ordered in delectable food and coffee, I think is is the way movies were intended to watch, what a huge spoil (perfect for a gift)You can do serious Mall walking in the V&A there are enough space to give you a good workout.The only thing lacking is a store like Game or Hi-Fi corporation, could find nowhere to buy a Dvd player or TV extention.

something for everyone. Fantastic restaurants to suit all tastes and pockets, friendly pubs, shops that sell everything at good prices, entertainment, the Cape Eye (just like London), great views of Table Mountain, centre pick up point for all trips.Friendly people from all over the world.

After Table Mountain, the best place to visit.. Once you've done the obligatory Table Mountain, and visited Hout Bay, this is the best place to set up camp.It's the really vibrant quarter in CT and boasts loads of great bars & restaurants.You can even book a dinner cruise around the inner harbour!Okay, it suffers the usual fate of being a tad more expensive than other spots, but CT is so cheap anyway, that you won't notice.

Shopping, eating...and more shopping. Nestled in the great working harbour, overlooked by the beautiful Table Mountain, the V&A Waterfront caters for all; shoppers, non-shoppers, adults and children. You can shop to your heart's content, people watch while sampling any of the fabulous South African wines & beers, be entertained by the many pop-up street entertainers and enjoy the harbour seals, the sea breezes and beautiful panoramic views
Relax, take it easy!. Full of shops and restaurants. You may spend there a nice half-day of relax between a diving with the sharks and a strong hiking on the Table Mountain.

Tourist prices. A nice outing with lots to do see and eat but beware it is expensive. There is always lots of tourists and busy. The flea market and Aqwarium is expanding when we were there and there were allot of building activities causing a bit of confusion with the roads around the waterfront.

Humming with activity. A wide variety of shopping and activities in a safe environment. Lots of shops although not cheaper than UK prices on the whole. Lovely markets with brilliant artwork and local food to try. Great music, lots of activities to choose from but not too pushy and generally friendly with very visible security.

The only place to shop!. The V @ A Waterfront is the only place to shop in S. Africa. Great prices and you will find any type of souvenier to bring home with you. Also some excellent restaurants and most hotels have free shuttle busses to the waterfront. Though it is only about a 15 minute walk from Cape Town central to the waterfront.

Lots to do and very safe. . You must go to the waterfront when visiting Cape Town. Although it is very touristy, there are some really great boat trips down by the docks and some lovely restaurants and shops. You can get the hop on and hop off bus which takes you around the most historic places and gives you a tour and also visit robben island.

Shopping de lux. Anything you'd ever want to buy, can be found right here under one roof! Shopping, movies, restaurants, speciality stores, pharmacist, clothing stores, toy stores, book stores. Lots to see and do.
Amazing. Lots to do and lots to see. Things you dont see every day. You can pick and choose from a variety of restaurants

Good shopping/eating, but it's a mall after all!. This is a very attractive mall area which has really modernised the whole V&A waterfront, I would imagine. There are a wide range of shopping opportunities from chain stores and designer shops to an artisan craft market; the range of eating options is equally large. Some great street performers around as well, also activities for little kids such as an imaginatively designed play area and face painting. Definitely worth a visit but don't think this is all Cape Town has to offer...

Its not Albert. For Brits to be told V & A stands for Victoria and Alfred is very confusing until you are told he was her second son and involved in rge bbuilding of certain aspects in the 19th century. FFull of restaurants and shopping it is perhaps not an authentic experience but worth a visit nevertheless
All you could ask for and more. Look here you have a world class experience awaiting you/ Explore and see and experience and taste for yourself. You will most definitely not be disappointed A MUST
Best spot in CT ground. This place is a must go. Definately, you have to include it in your city tour. Close to the magnificent Green Point Stadium, host stadium for World Cup 2010.

Overall awesome. On our trip to Cape Town I think we spent the most amount of time here. V&A has a variety of shops and restaurants - all in various price ranges depending on your budget. The food hall was great and the curio shops were a nice look through.There's some performers by the wheel that provide some entertainment. Overall I felt very safe there but beware of some people who try to talk you up for money on a guilt trip.There is a great photo area of Table Mountain. It was a central and easy location for us to start our hop on hop off bus tour.Try one of the harbour cruises - bring sunscreen, a jacket and a hat for that.Our only negative was that our Robben island tour was cancelled due to weather - but that was understandable. Two Oceans is a good rainy day activity

Interesting mall. It was interesting to see where the wealthier locals/tourists shop...lots of restaurants to choose from and all the big name stores you know. Interesting to wander around for a bit, but not worth a whole lot of time.

Historic Waterfront Shopping and Eating!. We are staying in central Cape Town for five days and plan to come here each night not just because it's fun, it's very historic and it has great shops and restaurants but also because it is probably the only safe place to walk at night in Cape Town. Security is everywhere which gives you a good feeling, but we are on our third night here and we feel secure walking everywhere. Fabulous array of shops, great variety of restaurants including a food court and more upmarket restaurants (even the most expensive ones are very affordable for American and European wallets) and just a R50.00 cab ride away from our hotel. Fortunately the shops are open until 9 p.m. every night so you can grab dinner and still walk off your meal by visiting the nice variety of market stalls, African gift shops as well as upscale clothing shops - everything from a book shop to Guccii here at this waterfront shopping complex. My hubby spotted seals in the harbour earlier today. Also the boats to Robben island go out of here so it has something for everyone. Do take the time to read the 30 historic markers which tell of the history of this working port or take the daily guided walking tour at 11 a.m. which needs to be booked in advance. There is also a large ferris wheel and live music every night. Great place to hang out and tons of great clean rest rooms/toilets everywhere. Taxi's are easy to get at any time of day or night.

Something for everyone. An excellent mixture of shops, services, hotels and restaurants. Although on several floors and with many wings the excellent signage keeps you from getting "lost". There is security present near the ATM stations. The CBD is a $5.00 or 50 rand ride away.

A nice place to walk around and enjoy Table Mountain views. We visited for lunch and a nice walk around the water front. Great views of Table Mountain and the cape town area. We also went for a sunset boat ride out of the harbour, there were humpback whales right in the harbor that would've been viewable from the pier. a nice place to stop by, but not a must visit.
Nice developed area. Nice developed waterfront area. Full of shops, restaurants, cafes and anything else you can think of. We walked around and took pics for a while on a cold day in Cape Town.

Place to be while in Cape Town. Probably every visitor to Cape Town will be and has to visit this place being the hub to many activities, fun, shopping and eatery joints besides being the best place to hang out.

Enough parking finally. I really enjoy visiting the v&a since there is now enough parking. It is about R10 for 2 hours if you park in one of the parking lots which are outside the main building.
Check out the winter restaurant specials on Cape Town Best (.) Com before eating anywhere.

Lots to do - shopping and history together. This is a great area to visit - shopping, restaurants, grocery stores, historical plaques, places to see street entertainers, a Ferris wheel, and places to just sit down and relax and enjoy the view of a great harbour. It is a very safe place to walk in and there are security people around to help with directions if you get lost. Allow several hours to visit the entire site and enjoy what it has to offer.

Picturesque waterfront with Table Mountain backdrop. There is something for most people here. History, architecture - old , new, re-purposed, lots of shopping opportunities, plenty of eateries to suit all tastes. A few museums are scattered around the complex too. Nothing quite like looking up at Table Mountain from the yacht basin. There are also boat tours on offer from short harbour cruises to longer sunset cruises around to the popular Clifton / Camps Bay waters. The V & A also has a heliport for helicopter tours, including an opportunity to fly in a Huey on a 'combat' flight. There are great kid friendly options and a play park. All in all a great day out for the entire family.
Cape Town is beautiful. Cape Town is a beautiful and quiet safe town. It does not really feel like an African city, but more European.

Good view with table mountain. At sunny days, you can see beautiful table mountain view from Victoria Waterfront. And at the sunset, the red light would shine at table mountain, that is impressive. Victoria Waterfront also consist with plenty stores and restaurants. you may spend hours to stay in this place.

Shopping and so much more!. A beautiful waterfront where people swim, seals linger and no pollution. The draw bridges are cool and the shops wonderful. Call ahead if you want to see Robben Island. It's probably booked up. It's not well managed, but if you can get it, go for it.

Good for a visit. The V & A Waterfront is a nice place to spend time before or after a trip to Robben island or if you have a couple of hours to spare while in Cape Town. The views towards Table Mountain, Table Bay, Robben island and the Cape Town stadium are excellent, and the shopping inside Victoria Wharf is very good. There is a lot of parking nearby and the Nobel Square is a beautiful spot overlooking the port. When we went there was a couple of local music groups performing lovely South African music outside the ferris wheel, which was an added bonus.

Wonderful relaxing beautiful place!. Table Mountain at you back, the ocean and the constantly changing harbour at your front w a wide selection of restaurants, shops and treats to choose from. Great people and there is something for everyone and you really feel the spirit of Africa in the beat of the outdoor musicians. Good fun!
Nice Area to Stroll and Shop. Great area to people watch and buy locally made items. You can also rent water craft or take a cruise. It's an area you must spend time in while visiting Capetown.

Family Visit worth it. Loved the ease of shopping late and night and we could decide at an instant where we wanted to eat. Had visitors from Mosselbay and they loved the visit. Particularly liked the wheel outside andthe vibe surrounding it. Always good for out of towners.

A fun place although it could be anywhere.. Always a fun place to visit when in Cape Town. Reminds one of the sophisticated side of South Africa. Good eateries and attractive stores in a water side setting with a great backdrop.

Worth an afternoon. The V&A is a great safe place to go shopping and socialize with friends. Some places are a bit expensive, but there are some wonderful stores and good dining options. The Two Oceans aquarium down the street is also worth visiting for a few hours.

a place to do everything. you can shop for clothes, souvenirs, food, flowers, pharmacy, apple store, cell phones....good bookshops which, for me, is a must. some good restaurants, some with a high reputation that are not so good any more, check out menus and prices before sitting down. venue also for movies, boat trips, fast foods, music store, upscale shopping, hotels...and much more. a must for every visitor to cape town, don't miss it.
Leisure and shops. The V&A waterfront is a good place to go after a day of travelling. Lots of shops and lots of restaurant (all sorts of prices).

Mall with a view. Victoria & Alfred Waterfront is essentially a large shopping mall but with one of the best views possible. It has panoramic views of the Atlantic Ocean, Cape Town and Table Mountain. The mall is reasonable mix of shops. You can certainly pick up interesting local gifts and jewellery. I also saw Chopard and Dunhill but nothing else in terms of high end. There are also a range of restaurants from fast food to formal dining.Like all malls, it is an artificial and somehat contrived environment, that bears little relation to the majority of Capetown. One thing to note is that Victoria & Alfred Waterfront seems to take security very seriously. It's like being in an airport and some people may find this a bit weird.In conclusion I don't think that a casual visitor to Capetown would need to leave the Victoria & Alfred Waterfront, except for outdoor activities and to visit sites outside the city.

Just another mall. The waterfront is basically a mall, has some good shops, supermarket, food court, and restaurant. It is also a place to go to in the evening in CT, as the area is totally safe. However if you dont want to spend the evening in a pub or shopping, there is nothing much to do, especially during the winters. There was also a wheel (Cape Town eye) for good views of the city, but again I thought it was disappointing. Overall the waterfront wasnt very exciting.

Excellent mall. . wonderful shops. . super friendly staff!. We were wonderfully surprised to find this mall on the waterfront. Beautiful locations. . .amazing variety of shops - both high end and others that were affordable! Great variety of restaurants. . a must-see in Cape Town!

Great views, great entertainment. The Waterfront is one of Cape Town's most marketed tourist attractions. Very basically, it's a massive shopping mall extending to various split-levels outside and two levels inside. Retailers are varied, from the plethora of restaurants to meet the middle to upper budget pockets to the clothing shops and supermarkets. There are movies, crafts, pubs, fast foods, speciality shops, and even boat cruises and helicopter rides (if you have loads of money!).And of course, the aquarium is well worth visiting, as is the open-air "theatre" where planned an what seems to be impromptu shows of dancing and music appear from nowhere, all free to watch, although the performers to request a donation. Please donate if you enjoyed the show.And of course, there's one of those huge frames around a view of Table Mountain into which you can climb to have your photo taken! Or if you don't want the frame, just go to the right of it and voila! The majestic Table Mountain!

do you care ?. Why don't you read the reviews on tripadvisor for Quay Four restaurant and go and do something about it - it reflects on your entire waterfront experience and leaves one with abad feeling about the whole place which it does not deserve.Just read the reviews then march down there and sort them out !

The Gem of Capetown. This is a place where you can spend the entire day and yet come again the next day without getting bored. There are so many activities happening here that you just can't have enough of this.

Great Venue both for Locals and Tourists. often we are under the misconception that the waterfront is for tourists only and this is so wrong. What separates the Waterfront from other shopping centres is the fact that this attraction is an outing or experience rather than just only a shopping trip. Expensive parking and shops is generally the reason why locals do not frequent the V&A. The parking is R10 for 4 hours after 6.00pm. The major retail groups are there. All in all, the Waterfront has so much more to offer than any other mall.

Nice spot. This is a good place to go walk around and there are nice views of Table Mountain (just like everywhere else in Cape Town). There are lots of restaurants, shopping, and a market with some good food vendors.

Great Cape Town attraction. The V & A Waterfront is a great place to get a taste of the Mother City. There is so much to do, and shops close very late. I love their open air performances which breaks the monotony of shopping. There is just so much to do and to cater for different needs.

V&A Cape Town - A Must Visit. Probably one of the most impressive active Waterfront complex in the world. Combines every type of entertainment while being in a natural working harbour. There are quality shops and restaurants for every taste.

The most beautiful place to stay in CT. We stayed in an apartment at the V & A waterfront in February. The backdrop for the apartments was stunning. It is nestled below table mountain which you can see when you step out of your apartment and a beautifully clean canal runs right through the middle of the grounds. The apartment itself was very spacious, clean and comfortable with a balcony big enough for sunbathing and enjoying meals. Actually getting into this lovely place was another matter. When we arrived on a very hot Sunday morning we were told we couldn't check in for another 2 hours. We decided to get lunch at the waterfront then head back. However when we arrived back 2 hours later, we had to wait another hour before we were shown to our rooms. Therefore the first day felt like a lot if waiting around in a very small and cramped reception area with not much communication from staff.Despite this setback, our stay at the V & A waterfront was superb.

Must see!. My sister and I enjoyed spending time at the V&A Waterfront. There are tons of shops. Some typical touristy shops but also some offering unique items. We made several purchases. We also enjoyed the indoor market. There were tons of stalls offering a variety of food and homemade items. There are a ton of restaurants. It is so much fun to sit outside and enjoy the fantastic view of Table Mountain.

Depends on what you want. The Victoria & Alfred Waterfront is a massive mall with shops selling goods of leading brands. There is a rather high priced food court where you can eat for ZAR 100 per head. You can walk out on to the waterfront for a view of the harbor. There is an open air amphitheater where you can watch popular programs (there was a rugby match on when we were there) on a huge screen. There is a few rides.

World's Top Harbour Views. This should be one of the Top Ten attractions in Cape Town. There are fabulous restaurants, shopping, boat tours, Two Oceans Aquarium, entertainment and more with views of Table Mountain. This is a must visit destination if you are in town for even a short visit.

A must do for everyone, young and old. Enjoy a ride on the big wheel and see Cpt from up high. Shops galor, affordable and top end too. A fantastic little fish and chips shop tucked away under the walk way, that sells the best affordable sea food. Take a boat trip out the harbour. Or simple just get a ice cream cone and sit and enjoy the people and the view. The most stunning views of CPT, so don't forget ur camera.

its a must visit place. I go for the restaurants but there is something for everyone day and night. We loved dining at the new restaurant Mondiall. British owner, Patrick adds a chic upper class London touch and ensures that food is tops. As he is good looking, the bar is always packed with beauties.

Great place to dine and stay. Rhino Africa recommended us to stay at the V&A and we totally agrees. Lots of stunning restaurants, a decent shopping mall, crafts sheds and such a beautiful place to take nice photos. We went to V&A every night in this cool winter to enjoy the good food and shop around. Feels safe to see policemen patrolling around every evening. If you are worried about safety and ponder where is a good place to stay in cape town, you know where to go.

One of the most beautiful waterfronts in the world.. The Victoria and Alfred waterfront has an incredible charm and vibe because of the combination of the beautiful buildings, the wonderful landscape of the Atlantic Ocean ( one can see the infamous Robben island very clearly) and the Table mountain and Lions Head ,the tourists facilities and many attractions around,and the working harbor with the basins where ships get repaired....there are shops till you drop, craft markets,food markets ,restaurants for every pocket ,cinemas ,one of the biggest aquariums in the world,museums,and you can organize from there boats tours and even helicopters tours....of course there are a lots of tourists, but CapeTown is very touristic and beautiful and the V&A waterfront is something you can't miss as tourist..however there are lots of Capetonians and locals who love to spend the weekend there and profit of the restaurants and a variety of entertainment is provided. The vibe is exhilarating and you can stroll around for hours until your feet are burning....if you are new in South Africa you can visit the nice big supermarket in the basement of the main building,next to the parking ,to learn about local food and wines and buy them at supermarket price..Don't forget to have your picture taken in the Nobel square ,with the bronze statues of Mandela and the other prize winners ...Go also to the nice Clock tower and if you don't want to take a trip from there to Robben island ( booking is advisable )visit at least the little museum .....and look carefully in the water...yes...what you see are seals swimming and playing

Touristic but beautiful!. The V&A Waterfront is a touristic, busy but beautiful place!It's easy to: park over there, organize a taxi, reach by bus, ... !You can park your car at the seaside in front of the shopping center, an overnight stay costs you more less R50. There are some nice shops and good restaurants.By far my favorite: the Belgian restaurant / bar Den Anker!!There is so much to do: musea (Mandela, rugby, ...), the Aquarium, restaurants & bars, shops, live music, the Ferris wheel, boat trips, ...If you plan a trip over there, don't leave before dark! It gets super cosy when it gets dark, a the little lights and the busy bars give you a nice feeling.Excellent place to go to for: family, friends, couples, party, ;..

The Waterfront Vibe. One of my favourite places to spend free time, whether shopping having a coffee or a meal. There are a myriad of languages heard - very definitely an international visitor destination and no visit to Cape Town should exclude a few hours, preferably sitting outdoors and watching the harbour at work. Many excellent restaurants - favourite is Willoughby's for sushi or fish - and a coffee and a light meal at Mugg & Bean. Shopping experience is great with many choices with a Made in South Africa clothing/jewellry available. One gripe is the cost of parking, especially for locals, but there are cheaper options without having to park underneath the Waterfront Shopping Centre with easy access to the centre itself. Summer is a beautiful time to just wander and breath in the good vibrations
nice view of table mountain. nice place to walk around, go food tripping, shopping and glimpse of the table mountain... however, quite expensive..
A Must-Do on a tourist's wish list. Plenty restaurants, good shopping opportunities, ample parking, good hotels - a must-do on any tourist's agenda.

My Visit to the Waterfront. This a very nice place to visit and maybe catch a bite to eat and enjoy the views. There are lots of shops to while away a few hours and spend a few Rand. I enjoyed it very much!

IStore - Apple Store - WaterFront Mall. I had a really bad experience at I Store (Apple Store) at Waterfront Mall in Cape Town. I bought an Iphone 5S on my last trip day, the salesman guaranteed that if I had any trouble I could solve it in Apple Brazil, which is my country.When I came back to Brazil, I opened the box and the phone had a dent on its back. I called Apple Brazil and they said the African store should replace the phone. When I contact the African Apple store (I Store), they said I supposed to pay all the costs to send the phone back to Africa and also wait several days to have another phone.Never buy anything in this I Store (Apple Store) in Cape Town!!!!!

very safe to go to by night. you can go for shopping, enjoying the spectacular view, having a meal, or listening to the African music in the streets or in any restaurant. you can spend hours wondering around. it is very safe by night, but going back to your hotel, please get a METER taxi, not any other ordinary taxi.

Beautiful introduction. Our first trip to the African continent and we commenced with a seven night stay at the V & A Waterfront Hotel. The room was spacious and comfortable and next morning we sat outside to enjoy the magic views of Table Mountain. Breakfast buffet was delicious and additional menu for orders. The staff were friendly and helpful. Wi-fi reception was not always easy to access. The nearby shopping mall was wonderful. And such a variety of restaurants with good dishes, staff and prices.

Spectacular mall with magnificent views. This mall is in a setting that will take your breath away. It is located between Table Mountain and the Atlantic Ocean, offering you the best of views from a number of restaurants. You can hop onto a boat and explore the harbour, or even visit Robben Island. There are a couple of museums, i.e. the Springbok Museum. Or you can visit the aquarium, where you can take a dive in the tank, while your kids are being kept busy in a special room with an opportunity to view some sea lions both below and under the water. Relatively new is the hydroponics and aquaponic gardens, from which some restaurants pick their food 100% fresh. At times, there are special exhibitions, i.e. art exhibits. There is just too much to mention, but you can easily spend a full day in this spot alone.
Nice!. Nice place to spend a day or evening. Ample of choices for cafes, restaurants, fast food joints, shopping.

Well worth spending a day here!!. All visitors and tourists alike should put aside a day or two to visit the Waterfront with so much to do like eating, shopping and taking a boat ride either to Robben Island or a katamaran around the bay, what a wonderful day we spent doing this. You could also hire a helicopter for either 1/2 hr or 1hr and that is a fantastic way of seeing all. With Table Mountain in the backdrop what more could one wish for. Restraunts are fantastic and from Pub to sea food emporiums.... you are spoilt for choice.... if coming from abroad the exchange rate is superb hence you could shop till you drop..... enjoy as much as i did....

Lots of tourists and tourist attractions. Well, this was one of the first places I visited in Cape Town. I'm not really into "tourist set up places" as this place is. Lots of shops and restaurants. There is the harbour, right, but it's not that impressive. I liked the frame they put up so when you look through it, you look straight up to Table Mountain. I also stayed and had lunch at one of the restaurants and looked at all tourists, doing tourist stuff. That was quite funny aswell.

Not To Be Missed. Capetown is a tourist mecca and one of the sites that must not be missed is the Victoria and Albert Waterfront area. The variety of food is stunning and every beer can be tasted, many of them local and absolutely superb. One can easily plan a short visit and stay all day. Shopping is diverse, the ferries to Robbin Island start from here and parking is easily accessible and very inexpensive. It is the ideal venue to meet friends and to "chill out".

A nice tourist area. Victoria & Alfred Waterfront is a nice tourist area in Cape Town with lots of hotels, restaurants and shops. The atmosphere is very nice and the area is safe, but isn’t the real Cape Town. That you must find somewhere else. I stayed here for 5 days and I liked the area very much.

One of the must do sights.. This is one of the must see attractions in the city, we chose to revisit for the spectacular views of table top mountain as the sun goes down. Really easy to find, we drove from the city centre and found plentiful covered secure car parking at a reasonable cost. From the car park it's a short stroll to the excellent bars and restaurants. Most of the restaurants have wonderful views, and when it turns chilly have blankets and patio heaters, when we visited although it was not cold, a particularly strong inshore wind, made outside dining a challenge. There is a wide selection of shops in the covered mall, most aimed at wealthy tourists, currency exchange booths are also in the mall, none of these display their rates or commission charges clearly. We arrived at about 4pm and left shortly after 9pm having really enjoyed ourselves.

ooooh shopping. girlies this is shopping heaven - MEN can sit at the bars and restaurants of which there are plenty and girlies shop shop shop - it has all the shops you can wish plus stands who will massage your head hands feet - you can then relax in a bar soooo cheap and then eat yourself stupid and then go and dance to the street entertainment - this is shoppers paradise and what a setting with table mountain in the background - perfectionthere are also plenty of boat trips sunset cruises pirate ship and helicopters rides - swim with sharks (uuugh nothing worse can I image but if it floats your boat it is there)a brilliant place to visit and perfectly safe for singles

So much to see. During our 6 day stay at the Winchester Mansions Sea Point, we visited the waterfront on 2 occasions. First time we strolled along the promenade for about 5 km, taking in the breathtaking sea views & little beaches along the way, the 2nd time we took a 5 min taxi ride for R50 ( excellent value with an exchange rate of 18 rands to 1GBP)The waterfront is huge working concern, servicing the tankers & container ships & at the same time offering everything for the visitor - from designer stores, boat trips, helicopter rides to brewery pubs, fine dining, bars & cafés - all with the spectacular backdrop of Table Mountain.Spoilt for choice, we opted for Mitchell's Brewery pub where my husband tried the famous " karan beef ", best ever apparently, whilst I ordered chicken curry - how I wish we could get this flavour at home. 4 drinks plus 2 meals came to less than R300, great value for money.We assumed we could take the local bus service back to the hotel, however, on boarding we were told you cannot pay cash. You have to purchase a ticket at the waterfront office which is next to the Aquarium. This then lasts for several journeys on any bus route - we opted for another taxi but I suspect that tickets would be a good option, as there seems to be a service to all the local attractions.For the ladies - if you visit the Mall, check out Woolworths - I thought I was in Debenhams, it's such a grand store!

Great place to experience waterfront Cape Town. We spent a lot of time here during our stay in Cape Town. This has it all – great views, great working waterfront, great recreational activities (boat rides, helicopter rides, fishing, etc.), excellent shops (there is an actual mall here), and great restaurants with wonderful views. There is also entertainment, with an outdoor amphitheater, ferris wheel, schedule musical events, and also ad hoc performers. You can also get the boat to Robben Island from here. After dark, the bars are a fund scene. You can easily spend a whole day or evening here.

The Kohinoor in the crown of Cape Town.. Waterfront. This is THE place to be when in Cape Town. It is an eclectic mix of modern, tradition, natural and man made beauty. Everything is just perfect . The view of the bay, the tabletop mountain, gourmet restaurants and cafés at the waterfront, live performances in the small open air amphitheater, the mall housing almost all brands....and above all , the Hotel we stayed in. This is one place you should swear you would not miss on your trip to Cape Town. This is the best of Cape Town. Highly recommended.

A great place to shop, to stroll, to dine and drink in the sights. The V & A Waterfront is one of Cape Town's wonders. High end shopping, fine restaurants, galleries featuring the work of local artisans and beautiful surroundings combine to delight travelers and locals alike. Food options abound, from an American-style food court to finer dining on the upper floors. And whether you are are shopping for Levis or Gucci, you will find a good choice. Prices can be expensive, but with VAT refunds, international travelers make out just fine.
The Place to stay. Stayed in a holiday rental, Home from Home. Stunning apartments, amazing views back and front, Harbour & Table Mountain. Great shopping and brilliant bars and restaurants.

Something for everyone. A great place to hang out, meet with friends, eat, have a drink, sightsee, shop and even buy groceries. A wide array of beautiful crafts on display and for sale in the Red Shed adjoining the mall. Ferris wheel for a great view, live music, ample parking, seal watching, sight-seeing helicopter port, tours to Robben Island... the list goes and on and on. Even face painting. Helpful agents present in the tourist information centre and also the starting point for both blue and red hop-on hop-off sightseeing busses.This is a must-see for visitors to Cape Town. It's easy to spend an entire day here just hanging out, people watching and enjoying the incredible views of Table Mountain while listening to great live music and enjoying this beautiful city.

something for everyone. Whatever you want - food, snacks, coffee, exotic clothes, original souvenirs, its all here.Signage is brilliant, security is all you could wish for and you can wander in safety. There are huge car parks surface and underground where you can park for as little as R10 (four hours).Go along and have fun!PS useful but not cheap Internet facility R50/hour at the time of writing.

Surfing the V & A Waterfront!. What a beautiful place to chill for the day! The views are terrific. I loved the marina, and there are so many places to sit and eat. A ride on the big wheel will give you a wonderful view of the area. Not really a place for shopping for those on a budget though, but you can pick up small items from the craft stalls! This is a place that is always buzzing with activity, and you can comfortably spent the entire day without getting bored.

Lovely place to stay very relaxing. Stayed here on a business conference with suppliers. Had a lovely 3 nights stay. Staff were very laid back but exceptional at the same time, very much the South African way. This hotel is superbly positioned for a great stay, within easy walking distance to local mall for shopping and excellent restaurants

Great place to visit. The V&A waterfront is great for all the family. Fantastic views of the marina, lots of places to eat & drink + people watch & shopping to suit most purses. Don't miss the authentic African market there, some amazing items to see even if you don't buy.Have a photo taken with the life size statue of the elephant & just opposite there is a small kiosk that sells the most wonderful ice cream. There is also a good aquarium there.

Dont miss it!. My first stop in cape town was in its centre. And I hated it.... Felt insecure. Then I changed of hotel and have been enjoying the area around (VA waterfront). It has many ppl around, many options to eat and shop, beautiful views, and here I fell segure (I even walked at night). I ate outside (which was expensive, but had a great view), but I also ate inside the mall and I dont think it was expensive! I need a new booking for the last days of my staying in SA, but I just cant get any not close to here!

Amazing area, great people watching. For those who like to have somewhere nice to sit and chat with whoever they are with, or even alone, and watch the world go by the V&A Waterfront is the place for you. Some great eateries, coffee shops and pubs - something to suit everyone's tastes I'm sure. My husband and I can while away the whole day just wondering around at the Waterfont area.
Relaxing. Magnificent view of the marina while dining on a sunny day with birds flying around. Restos have a good variety of cuisines and service was good as well.

Great place to visit. The V&A Waterfront is one of Cape Town's main attractions. For visitors however the prices of all items are inflated, so if you don't need to buy something here don't do it. Many of the curios can be found much cheaper elsewhere such as in Hout Bay harbour. There are many good restaurants catering for everyone. Lots of shops, but as indicated do be careful of the prices especially the African curios.

Very Nice to Spend Time with Family and Friends. Whenever I am in Cape Town and have some free time, this is my first choice to spend some time. There is something for all age group. Variety of eating places, activities, entertainment and shopping. One can spend entire day at this place. Most of the hotels in Cape Town offer shuttle service to V&A Waterfront.

Lovely for passing time and doing whatever. Its a marina, divided into 3 segments with the smallest being the accessible one.Trendy with many activities, from fares wheal to shopping to the aquarium near by, to exploring trip options to food, bars…etcYou get Robbin island tickets from here (On the bridge) you can pualso explore many activities and tours that

You can't go to the V & A too many times!. Once again another group of family visitors had a fabulous time at the V & A Waterfront. From 4 to 60+ everyone has taken away a memory and probably a purchase too.There really is something for everyone and you can spend as much as you want, even a takeaway coffee and a free seat to watch the seals is a great experience. The choice of restaurant is great. Atmosphere second to none. After 10 or more visits it's still great

Something for everybody. The V&A Waterfront covers a lot of ground.
