Too touristy. We found the Waterfront area very tacky with all the fastfood restaurants, cotton candy and a mini London Eye. There were also some good restaurants and a shopping mall. Good restaurants V&A Hotel, Ruebens at the One & Only Hotel.
Vibrant. You can't miss the V & A Waterfront it is such a vibrant place to be. There is entertainment round every corner and a variety of restaurants to match every pocket

Great Shopping. All the famous stores under one roof. You can also go on various cruises and helicopter flips which is a must in order to get a birds eye view of Cape Town. Also grab a bite at the Dodge Diner. The steaks were great and the service was even better.
lot to choose. easy to drive to and park(very cheap) make sure that you have an idea what to do before you visit. we missed the best bits for us because we were too unprepared.
People Watching Heaven!. The V&A Waterfront is a great spot to chill out with friends over a glass of wine and some nice food, not to mention it's a great spot for watching the world go by.
The Place To Be. V&A Waterfront is the place to be for shopping, wining and dining in Cape Town! We were there also on New Year Eve and got to see the colourful fireworks.
Popular place. THis is a must if you are a visitor to Cape Town. All the amenities, great shops, good vibe! JUST DO IT!

Go there- relax - and enjoy yourself.. Make sure you book an entire day to spend at the Waterfront. There is so much to do and see, you will need at much time as possible. Don't be in a hurry to go home when the sun goes down. Get a table at Quay 4, sip cocktails and watch the sunset. You may even be lucky enough to see the dolphins.
Shopping. Shopping and movies at the V&A is always fun. plus the wine shops have great variety - loved it!!

Bustling!. Lots of shops and restaurants, of course, plenty of street entertainment - and the very oddly named Wheel of Excellence ride. We hadn't expected to see seals basking on the boardwalks at quaysides. A very pleasant place.

Touristy but fun. There is a mall with the typical chain stores, plus lots of boutiques with souvenirs. There is a ferris wheel, street entertainers, live music, open air pubs - something for everyone. This is where the ferry for Robben Island takes off. And the best is the giant lego like red scupture made of coke crates!
I kept coming back here. I found myself returning each day at some time to the Waterfront area. Many things to see, many restaurants, street entertainers. Very lively place.

Typical Touristy Area. No locals go/enjoy going here.
It is generally overpriced, but has whatever you might want to purchase.
The views of the boats in nearby Cape Grace are nice.
Great restaurants!. Lots of great waterfront restaurants, a huge mall, and plenty to see, with a gorgeous harbor and Table Mountain in the background. Well worth a few evenings, or an afternoon.
Well worth a visit. Great for relaxed shopping and the cafe bars are excellent. We love Den Anker and the views of Table Mountain.

Loved it!. Definitely one of the highlights of Cape Town. The area is full of things to do - shops, great bars and restaurants, activities, etc. We had a sushi lunch down here which was fabulous (half price!). On a trip to Cape Town, I'd definitely recommend leaving the best part of a day just to wander around and enjoy the waterfront - great fun, gorgeous and just a very nice place to be.
A shopaholic's dream. Wide range of activities. Lots of shopping, for anything. As well as movies, eating, sitting outside and watching folk, boat and helicopter trips.... The list is endless
A Gem. The Atmosphere, the food and not being rushed staff professional
Family Friendly Top Shelf Venue. Great restaurants, wonderful shops, a lot to do ina family friendly and safe atmosphere.

Only for foreign money. V&A Waterfront is a wonderful place to go have a meal, experience the waterfront life etc. but it is in my view as a local very overpriced. It is aimed at the foreign tourist with the exchange rate at his favor. Don't get me wrong, the shops and boutiques there are top notch, but too expensive for me. Parking is plenty but also a tad expensive. Facilities are very good and there is plenty to do, eat and drink.
like a funfair in summertime. tons of restaurants and shops. free live music acts and the most scenic place in the whole of africa (if it's warm and the sun is shining :-))
Typical waterfront development - but well done. Lots of things to see and do, shopping and eating are the main points of interest

Where your visit to Cape Town Should Start and End!. This area has it all, striking beauty, mesmerizing view of Table Mountain, vibrant tourism scene, amazing histoical roots, a modern makeover, entertainment and street performances, lovely local, a mosaic of cultures and races from all over the world, insanely number of shops restaurants and some museums. It is the place to be, and I highly recommend finding a hotel or a furnished apartment in there, which won't necessarily break one's budget. It is the embankment point for all your sightseeing adventures throughout the city and the Western Cape. From there you can go for the ferry ride to Robben Island, spend a few hours in the Two Oceans Aquarium, or may be book a diving with Sharks adventure if you feel crazy. Many restaurants in and around the area and the new Stadium is not far away. It's also a very safe area for tourists with around the clock police and safety guards circling the area. I left the cinema once or twice fairly late at night with the wife and walked for 10 min to my apartment without ever feeling unsafe.It is a place that I only have great things to say about, and since I have been there once, I doubt that I would ever stay anywhere else in the city if I ever got the chance to visit the amazing city once again.
Excellent shops and restaurants. Also wonderful views of Table Mountain from most of the Waterfront. Great place to wander around and eat, drink and shop!
Fun place. Fun place to wander around, do some shopping, have a bite to eat and stop for a beer whilst soaking in the views
Shoppers delight. Plenty to do - shops/restaurants/people watching. Superb place.

Bustling lively Centre. There was so much to see, many many shops, lots of quaint little craft shops, a true african experience. Quite a few of the boating trips commence from here, there is also the Aquarium close by as well as the scratch patch. Too much to see and do for just one day.
Wide variety, nice restaurants. A bit of a tourist trap, but still well worth a visit.

Majestic and a source of inspiration to the people of the Cape Town. This majestic mountain at the edge of the city bowl and bordering the Atlantic ocean is one of the seven natural wonders of the world and is a must see when visiting Cape Town. A state of the art cable car transports passengers from the base to the top of the mountain that offers crisp fresh air and majestic views across the peninsula - special moments and memories to savour - great restaurant at the top to relax and resfresh
Waterfront. I love the "Waterfront", so good for shopping and dining, much to see and more to do. The athmosphere was genial.

capetown, south africa. Just returned fron a 15 day visit to Victoria Falls and South Africa, outstanding trip! Our third trip with Gate One travel, and as usual, they did a great job. Capetown is one of the most beautiful cities I have ever seen and the attractions and food was outstanding. Overall, the cost of food, etc, is very cheap compared to Europe.
Great Food. Try the Bar on the Marina at the Cape Grace Hotel, also the Signal Restaurant and Baia.

Could be anywhere in the world!. Clearly a created environment for 'the tourist' with a shopping centre (containing all the international shops as seen everywhere else!) and an array of different restaurants (some better than others) serving everything from Italian/Thai/Indian/Fish/Steaks etc.
Worth a visit but not a MUST see if time is limited

Good shopping and restaurants. What's nice about this area is that it is safe to wander around at night. The malls have very interesting shops and restaurants and there are lots of comings and goings with all the trip boats.

Shopping mall on the harbor. The waterfront is fairly busy and crowded. The shops are pretty good, but largely very expensive. It is basically a big mall on the harbor. However, it can be fun to spend a few hours here first going to the aquarium then coming for a ride on one of the ships and ending with an ice cream and a mini show from one of the many street musicians at the waterfront. There is definitely a lot of action at the waterfront, so if you are looking for a lively atmosphere this is the place to go.
Super Expensive. Prices that can compete with London. Breathtaking!
Large Mall. Good restaurants and very nice market for tourist.

Lots of shopping, but very very crowded when busy. Shopping galore in the V&A waterfront, with lots to do, lots to see and lots to shop and eat. It can get very crowded around lunchtime in peak periods, so best make a reservation if need be. You can also take boat rides out around the harbour, see wildlife (seals etc), or just have a relaxing cruise around the harbour. Many shops and parking available, and also the aquarium is nearby for the kids.

Nice waterfront experience. The V & A Waterfront is a great way to spend an afternoon in Cape Town. It has lovely shops and a lively atmosphere with so many great restaurants to choose from. There are 2 craft markets with lots of indigenous goods to choose from for souvenirs. The stores in the mall range in all price points and there seems to be something for everyone.

Perfect shopping location. Fantastic shopping Mall and arcades set around Cape Town harbour. Beautifully designed and built to create a really elegant location being a mecca to tourists and shoppers. Plenty of great restaurants and bars/cafes plus entertainment in a safe location.
One of our favourite places. We loved the atmosphere. We went there in the day & night.

shopping? food?. this is the place to visit for gifts,food,pics. the red shed market and the waterfront craft market are musts,had a nice meal at the quay four and two wonderful meals at the city grill / Greek fisherman.

Location, Location, Location. Everything you could want in one crowded, noisy, area. The selection of restaurant and shopping is overwhelming, & many tours leave from the waterfront. Hotels here are ridiculously overpriced, but a taxi to the waterfront is very inexpensive, so stay in another area.

Superb restaurants!. There is quite nothing like dining outside in the open pavillions of each restaurant, enjoying the sights of the harbour. Sit closer to a heater if you feel the cold :-).....pricey but worth the spend for the quality of the food, service and ambience.

Need more than one day to experience!. The waterfront is cram full of shops, restaurants and sites, as well as tourists. At night there's a lively atmosphere, lots of people and police presence (pickpockets). You need a lot of time to see everything here.

On Every Itinerary. The V&A is Cape Town's most visited attraction. Central from everywhere in town, it's a very pleasant retail and dining destination to stroll around in the day or evening. Most important though is that it is the location of the Nelson Mandela Gateway, departure point for the the tours to the infamous Robben Island - a trip everyone should experience.

Dangerouse_ you'll want to keep coming!. It really is fantastic what C. Town have done with their old docks. Bigger and better than San Francisco There is lots to see & do, and masses to buy! Don't miss the Aquarium
Waterfront worth visiting. The waterfront has excellent offerings of shops, restaurants and boat trips to the sea.

Commercial Paradise. Not very busy even though it was the height of summer. Very commercialised with so many restaurants to choose from. No shortage of entertainment on the streets. Beautiful views of the bay.
Shopping centre. Some fantastic restaurants at relatively cheap prices but shopping not up to London standards

Not Africa but lively and relaxing. Came here day one of our first trip to South Africa 5 years ago. Back this year after seeing much more edgy parts of the country. A great and safe environment to explore shops and loads of restaurants. Shops not the cheapest. Don't judge Cape Town shopping by the V & A alone. It's a little too much like some American Harbour (Harbor) complex, but a pleasant place to hang out.
Well designed and pleasant. Some restaurants expensive and not outstanding. Shops nothing special. However can spend a pleasant half day there
Worth a visit. Lots to see and do and as a city well worth a visit.
Cape Town central Mall. Great shopping experience though bit pricy but some nice restaurants and views.
Great place to visit. A real buzz, lots of shops (though inside so if wanting sunshine not great) and great places to eat and drink. Lots going on and great views.

Idyllic Tourist Buzz. Listen to the buskers, get lucky with a concert at the open-air amphi-theatre, take your pick of cuisine from one of the many eating establishments. Take a cruise. Shop! Most of all, wonder around and enjoy the high-energy atmosphere set amidst tastefully restored harbour architecture. A fun place to meet friends or just hang out and enjoy the Cape Town vibe.

Good meeting place. We were travelling to South Africa with friends in January 2012 and were in separate locations for 3 nights. We found the V&A Waterfront to be an excellent area to meet up for dinner in the evenings. It has all the bars and restaurants you could wish for and is the central hub for much of the transport system, including the "hop-on-hop-off" buses, and the taxi drivers all know the area very well. Oh, and its a wonderful place to view the harbour life and Table Mountain, which dominates the horizon.

Pulse of Cape Town. A trip to the V & A Waterfront on any given day will prove to be time well spent for a visitor to Cape Town. There are various attractions namely, excursion by boat to Robben Island, boat trips around the harbour, sunset cruises, Red Shed gift & curio market and my personal favourite......many, many restaurants to choose from, depending on your taste in cuisine :-)

Pretty and touristy. just beware of what you buy at this very pretty harbour and shopping centre - the prices are very inflated. I didn't find the food that great either, but only tried a couple of restaurants before deciding to eat closer to my guest house. Great beer and burgers at the pub - I've forgotten the name!
One of the best photographic views of Table Mountain. Have a beer at Den Anker and take a photo of Table Mountain with the sailboats in the foreground!
Something for everyone. Full of restaurants of all kinds, more shopping than any credit card can handle, and lovely views of the mountain. Great place to visit.

Pleasantly Surprised. From reading some reviews on TA, I was expecting a tacky, overpriced development. However, we were pleasantly surprised. We stayed at the nearby Radisson Blu Waterfront and V&A provided everything we needed. There were plenty of shops, restaurants, bars and restaurants. The boats to Robbin island also depart from this area along with the red tour bus and other excursions. A essential hub for your travels around Cape Town.The shops we had used were not overly priced compared to shops outside the waterfront and the same can be said of the restaurants. Everywhere was safe, clean and we would certainly return! As a side point, we went to eat/drink in the city centre after going to the muesums in the area. To be honest, the atmosphere in the city centre wasn't very inviting and we much preferred the waterfront. In addition, the prices weren't that different contrary to other reviews.

Very nice, but not sure I'd want to stay there. The V&A Waterfront is definitely worth a visit, or two and not only because trips out to Robben Island begin and end there. Very commercialised but for the most part tastefully done. A huge choice of eateries and shopping opportunities but you pay the price for it. Better value is obtained elsewhere in the City.

something different to do and see every day. The waterfront is a hub of activity, from boat trips to street performers, snacks to gourmet meals. It has a restaurant to suit every budget and every taste in food. There are high street stores to luxury designer names and a variety of gift shops. You can take a boat trip, sunset cruise, helicopter ride or go cage diving with sharks. We stayed in apartments in the marina complex which is a five minute walk and very secure, you feel safe walking at night although you do have to keep your wits about you for beggers etc although there are security guards dotted around the waterfront and surrounding areas. Would recommend a stay or just a quick visit if in Cape Town.
Give it time. While we were there, it was in the midst of a remodel and becoming something much better than it is.
Lively. Take a picnic and enjoy the lively street performers.

Tourist treat.... Plenty to see and do around the Victorian harbour. A good selection of eateries, priced at all levels. We had three beers at the One and Only hotel, priced at 80R which included 'posh' nibbles. The bar makes a nice bolt hole away from the 'usual' tourist spots.

Positive Energy. We live in South Africa part of the year. We usually visit the A&V Waterfront when we have visitors. Our guest wanted to visit twice so we did. It turned out to be a most pleasant experience. We watched a variety of street performances... some quite good. Singers, small instrumental groups, acrobats and the like. Opportunities abound to sit on a terrace and have a drink, eat a meal, watch the huge variety of small or large boats move through the harbor, "seal" watch or shop until you drop. People are friendly and there really is something for everyone.
Lively and lovely. Lots to do, see, buy, eat, hear, watch.....you cannot be bored here.

Fabulous city and restaurants. This place is great for meeting people, loved ones. We went there for dinner most nights. Fantastic restaurant, many choose from. Recommended. During the day they have heaps of shops and there is markets there.
A Must. Lovely place to eat and shop. A must when visiting Cape Town so much to do and see.

Great cosmopolitan Cape Town vibe. Lovely shops, good restaurants, nice amphitheater which generally has a concert or performer playing in the afternoons/evenings. Soak up Cape Towns vibe here first! Gorgeous views.
A bit underwhelmed. Not as good as the hype, mainly over priced restaurants and touristy shops, interesting for 1 visit, nothing more.

Great vibe, excellent shops and restaurants. Very relaxing, great place to shop for unusual gifts. Unique restaurants with fabulous food, great views. Who wouldn't want to spend the day there? Trips leave from there to go to Robben Island.
Weekend Breakaway. Liked everything, we walked around the flea market, visited the aquarium
Not enough time. Didn't see enough of it to warrant a higher rating - sorry!

Expensive. The V&A Waterfront is a great venue should you wish to do some window shopping and have a fantastic view of Table Mountain. Other than these two things, the Waterfront is a tourist hub and very expensive. Should you wish to dine or have a few drinks, rather go to Sea Point or Green Point, just up the road where things cost almost half as much as at the Waterfront.

Sea. Mountain and sky. This is a fantastic place - in the city but with an outstanding view! Cocktails at sunset or a sunset cruise... or just sitting at one of the restaurants soaking up the sun and enjoying people watching.

Lovely place to people watch. We spent all 4 evenings here and had some fantastic food and wine. The atmosphere is great and very safe. It is a must whilst in Cape Town, the view of Table Mountain is spectacular.

Tourist attraction in a working port. The V&A has a mix of modern shopping mall, arts and crafts, street entertainment and an observation wheel couples with views of table mountain, the Lion and Signal hill. if. You are there at 12 you can hear the midday canon fire on signal hill, and see the smoke.We like relaxing with a cold drink at one of the cafes on the waterfront watching the. boats manoeuvring. The Baia restaurant is really lovely too

Totally AWESOME!!. From the last time that I visited, it has a ton of changes and additions. All of which enhance the Waterfront! The place is so alive and rich with culture. The scenery is amazing and there is always something different to see.
brent cross by the sea. very nice setting in harbour a cleaner and bigger version of brent cross plenty of shops and restaurants
Special. Lots to see and do with many shops, restuarants and entertainment. Good atmosphere and free entertainment by good performers. great place

woowww. This is a very nice place. Our hotel was in Waterfront so each night we walked to there and enjoyed the night. There are a lot of shops and nice restaurants, live music. And Robben Island tours take off from there too. Waterfront is a must in CT.

Great place to spend your time and to taste the food and spirit of South Africa. Waterfront is a nice place where you can do everything, shopping, windowshopping, walking around, having a drink or meal. There is always a lot of tourists and it is pretty crowded. You can find everything from souvenirs to most expensive diamonds, tanzanite and brands like boss, louis vuitton etc. There is something for everyone. There is always great intertainment in front of the mall , you can find many tour desks there and you can spend very nice time. Worthy to go there :)
Stunning place in the evening. But fully dedicated to tourists. So expect high prices. Plenty of nice terraces and different restaurants and bars. Very lively in the evening
Lunch here. The Greek fisherman- great lunch overlooking the wharf.

Victoria & Alfred Waterfront. Large variety of restaurants shops and entertainment! People from all over the world visit the V&A Waterfront - close to the stadium, city and CTIC. Beautiful views of the harbour, noisy restaurants where everybody enjoys the atmosphere..

Got to love shopping. The V & A Waterfront caters for everyone, a ferris wheel ride for the family, great shopping for the shopaholics, lots of restaurants to indulge in a special meal, special shows throughout the day to keep you entertained, very close to the diamond museum (a ladies best friend)... easy to spend your entire day there. Very close to the 2 Oceans Aquarium and the Art and Crafts Market (literally 5 minutes slow paced walking)... all in all there is something for everyone (regardless of age) to do !!!
just another shopping centre. It is nice, but in the end it remains just another commercial shopping centre.

An artificial creation. this area is totally artificial. You can see that everything in here was just built. It has little to do with a real waterfront you would expect. It is actually an artificially created marina, surrounded with expensive looking apartments and an artificial water canal. Very crowded from morning till evening. Good place for people watching.
The best centre in Cape Town!. Everything from basic retail stores to designer stores - something for everyone!

Great shopping, food and entertainment!. One could spend an entire day at the V&A Waterfront and not get bored. From a variety of restaurants, to quaint shops and large retail stores, and live entertainment, this place has it all!

world famous but it is a mall. Maybe it is the most exciting and beautiful shopping mall complex in the world and it has its uses for tourists - contained, safe, easy, accessbile etc However if cape town isn't quite south africa as many claim, the V&A isn't Cape Town exactly either. It's well patrolled to keep aybody deemed undesirable out. Prices are significantly higher than elsewhere. Just as an illustrative example - at the Garden Centre you can get a digitalphoto print for about R3, at Canal Walk R2.50, at the V&A you'll pay R4-R5. It's a sort of "Disneyland" for tourists. I live in Cape Town and might venture in there twice a year if someone holds my hand!

A mall within a mall!. You cnanot come to Cape Town and not visit the V&A Waterfront... with is many shops, restaurants, curious, entertainers as well as thousands upon thousands of people, its a great vibe and place to spend an afternoon for lunch.With many attractions it becomes the perfect place to choose accommodation with its many hotels in and aorund it and taxis, buses all stopping along route.You will find the aquarium as well as the clock tower within the V&A Waterfront.

Fun Place but not really Cape Town. Plenty of restaurants, fun pubs, live music, the odd sailor or two on shore leave!! My advice is go and enjoy then get down to Long Street & experience the real Cape Town of 2012, it is absolutely buzzing at night, great experience, bit like Havana.

A Must. A Must on a visit and has to be No1 attraction in Cape Town. Perhaps a bit OVER developed as there are so many of the same Arts and Craft stalls There are a plethora of food outlets and restaurants so you are spoilt for choice.

cape Town still remains one of the best cities to visit. Visited Cape Town with my family and loved every minute. the food, people and landscape are unbeatable. We felt very safe and would certainly want to go.

Not as bad as people say.... We had this place hyped by locals into a tourist death trap-- Not so! The shopping was pretty good and in a number of instances the prices were cheaper than we had found in other parts of the city. Parking is easily found in the garage across the street. The lunch we had at the brewery was no good at all. The V&A wasn't a destination in itself for us but if you stop in there while going to the Aquarium it is worth it.

Refreshing. Allow a half day to leisurely amble about the waterfront. It has recently been given a major "face lift," and is immaculate, with stores and restaurants resplendant. It is also an active harbor--something they will also, rightfully, tout. Makes for a very feel good morning or afternoon. Maybe do it after going to Robbins Island. You'll be right there.

Great place to drink wine and dine. Been several times and always end up sat outside Quay 4 bar/restaurant. The whole of the waterfront is great. Lots of shops, bars & restaurants to visit. It is a fantastic place to relax with a bottle of wine and eat fine food. A top attraction for cape town.
Fantastic Place. Good restaurants and good bars. Nice place to spend some time both in the evening and during the day.
Great atmosphere.. Vibrant atmosphere, lots of music, friendly crowds, good security, plenty to see.Good choice of restaurants but often higher priced than elsewhere.
The place to be. Loved the entertainment, the shops, the seafood restaurants, the wharf, the energy!
Great place for so many things.....!. boat rides to see the seals; origin point for the trip to see Robben island; GREAT restaurants; See the Acquarium; SO much to do !
nice but typical waterfront. take a harbor cruise. the mall is nice with good shopping and lots of alternatives to eat

Interesting safe place. We went here a couple of times - during the day and night. It is such a difference from the main city as you feel safe just walking around free from any unwanted people. There is a nice vibe and some good resaurants - city grill in particular.
A must do. A visit to the V&A Waterfront is a must when visiting Cape Town. The center offers great shopping and the setting is great! Great restaurants in the area as well.
You will love it!!. Stunning location, interesting shops, great restaurants and lively vibe all make for a fantastic trip out. don't miss it!!

Very safe tourist hotspot. Great spot to start an African/Cape Town adventure. It is a real tourist hotspot but has some substance to it with great restaurants, bars and shopping. Most of the touristy stuff starts down there such as the Robben Island tour and the Red bus tour.Parking is very safe and cheap. Word of advice, park in the secure car park opposite the flea market. R20 for 4/5 hours versus R60 for same time. Not much in euros but an easy saving.

our favourite spot. we spent a lot of time on the V & A Waterfront. The vibe here is amazing. We ate at good restaurants, enjoyed being on decks with cold drinks enjoying the harbour breeze and activites. The shopping is non-stop if that is what you might like.
shops. fab shops designers fab food fab handy for lifts to all shops safe as well
A must to visit. So much to see and do. A shoppers paradise. Street entertainment really special. Wonderful restaurants to sit and watch the world go by.
Love it. Wonderful area full of energy and music and full of friendlsy people. Great restaurants.
Great Shopping and Eating - very near to Waterfront Hotel. Great shops, restaurants and small shops for tourists. Pick n Pay supermarket - very cheap food and wine

lots to see. a good place to wander round,plenty of security guards so feels safe even if alone.
lots of street entertainment, and good choice of restaurants and cuisines
Very cosmopolitan. Great eating and drinking holes! lovely walks and views
Big mall, lots of restaurants. Many things around the VAW. The place to visit if you are looking for shopping and dinning!!

OK. Good selection of restaurants. Some of the independent and craft shops are worth visiting and o some unique souvenirs and art. I would say I was slightly disappointed in the V&A. It's very much a tourist area but there didn't seem to be much too it or a lot going on when we visited in September 2011. Arriving from the UK, as we were, we found the main shoppig centre to be very expensive for clothing. A lot of the brands were available back home for a lot less money.Worth a visit though.
V&A is it, man.. This is WOW!!!! Lots of fun, i never want to leave V & A even at night. It's so colorful and pleasant, my child had lots of fun.

Amazingly beautiful - a must see and experience. Make sure you walk around here, eat, drink, and experience this amazing waterfront. We went here every evening for our 4 days in Cape Town and each evening was more beautiful than the next. The back drop of Table Mountain is incredible and the old, yet maintained, infrastructure in the harbour is spectacular.
Secure and beautifull.. A good place to walk around. There are aquarium, mall, boats tours, etc.
V&A Waterfront offers something for everyone. Lots to see and do. Great variety of shops, many on the pricey side. Great restaurants. Awesome view of Table Mountain.

So much to do. You can wander round all day without getting bored. Lovely views of the boats with Table Mountain as a backdrop. Entertainers one after the other. Excellent shopping and so many restaurants it makes choice difficult.

wonderful place to wander. Lovely wharf setting to walk around with plenty of shops and restaurants, live music and dancing and a fantastic shopping mall. if you get bored with that there is always the seals to watch in the harbour and the boats coming and going
Exciting with great food and shopping. Lots of entertainment in the square to enjoy for free each early evening.
For Shopaholics and the Table Mountain vistas. Lots of attractions which include African craft shops, other outto go.lets, great restaurants and generally a relaxing place

I actually did most of my gift shopping here. It is hard to give a visual with words but we ended up here all 4 nights as we just enjoyed it so much and there was always something going on. Lots of shops and even though we also visited the stalls and shops in the CBD near the train and bus station- I found my nicest gifts here and some great prices. There is a souvenir type shop near the ferris wheel that is especially fantastic.
great day out. loved the vna. great shopping especially at woolworths and lovely eateries. there was a buzz in the air and lots of outdoor entertainment.we actually came here twice.

Great place to see. We always go here when in Cape Town, it is a great place with lovely shops, very safe, good choice of restaurants most looking over the water, there is a much smaller version of the london eye and street entertainers, it is also where the aquarium is good if its a rainy day.

Touristy, busy, fun. Good shopping and eateries, and definitely a buzz about this place. Very touristy, but an enjoyable experience none the less, particularly if you treat yourself to a restaurant meal. Grab and ice cream, wander around, listen to some live performers and enjoy!

Christmas in Capetown. We visited Capetown over Christmas with our daughter.Our first Christmas away form home ( Massachusetts).We toured the waterfront over the holidays, ate at Emily's on Christmas Eve, excellent dining, and took a harbor cruise on Christmas night. The whole area was bumping with thousands of people. We took a ride in the ferris wheel, toured the waterfront shops, snacked in all the resaurants, sipped wine in the wine bars.Had a great time!

Concentrated shopping. If you go nowhere else then you will have the opportunity to purchase everything you may need but at a distinct tourist cost.Contrary to what some will tell you, Cape Town is not a dangerous city. If you apply the same common sense that you would at home then it is just as safe. Yes, there are townships that you would be foolish to try to explore but the City has other wonderful things to see and do. Shopping is cheaper away from the Waterfront and you can actually see the difference between the rather false cruise line ambience and the real Cape Town.Whilst all of the shops, restaurants and trips are concentrated in a single place, there is a whole city there to explore. We liked the facilities but did prefer to strike out on our own and get the real experience.
World-class restaurants and shops. This is where most tourists end up as it should not be missed. Plenty to do here.
Lots of fun. A lovely combination of site seeing, fun activities, shopping and really good restaurants. All under 1 roof.
It is a mall. If you like malls then go, but there is more to cape town than this.

Good to "look" but expensive to "buy". The Waterfront has a wonderful atmosphere, especially in the area around the amphitheatre. There are often musicians around and it is a lovely place to spend a lazy afternoon – if the weather is good. The major retail shops are all there and their prices are pretty much the same as anywhere else; but the “tourist” shops and boutiques can be very expensive compared with elsewhere. There is plenty to do with boat trips, aquarium, craft market, putt-putt, movies and plenty of restaurants for every palate and price. The Waterfront is DEFINITELY worth a visit, both for locals and for tourists.

Fantastic place!. This place is more than just a mall, I assure you. I mean, it's huge, you could come here or a jog. There's a shop of every kind possible and the restaurants are pretty good too. You can take walks in the area just outside, it's really nice, or eat a burger outside, right next to the water, with birds waiting to eat your crumbs.

Needs a revamp - but okay.. This place has not changed in 15 years. The shopping during December did not offer great bargains or discounts. The cinema, Metro Cinema was a shocker. The popcorn was the worst I have ever eaten in the world. The cinema we sat in wasn't digital, not expecting it to be, but it is exactly as it was since the day it was built, no improvement on sound or visual display.. what a let down.if you want a good coffee, Woolworths offers a nice cuppa.The Waterfront offers things to do, it is okay, but there are other newer shopping centers around that offer more, example "Canal Walk", which is an improvement from the Waterfront.Anyway, some might enjoy the overpriced shops at the waterfront - I didn't.
Excellent place for shopping and eating. Plenty to see and do at the Waterfront. We had lunch a couple of times here, plus visited the Aquarium and shopping..........marvellous
Lots to do. Can't get bored here with so much to do and very nice restaurants
Overrated. I personally think the whole mall is overrated. It is very expensive. Their target market is more overseas visitors.
Tourist attraction. Upmarket, loads to do, brilliant working harbour/waterfront (but expensive)

Great place for 1st visit to Cape Town. We chose to spend our first 5 nights in South Africa at an apartment in the V& A. It was really good to be able to walk into the buzz of the Waterfront with such a huge choice of restaurants catering for both informal and formal dining as well as bars, shops, supermarkets etc. It was also fun to see the working Harbour. you are also ideally placed touch up the open topped buses which cover a huge area or if ou have a hire car , you have secure parking and can exit onto the man routes with ease. Loved It!
Plenty to see and do. Lots of shops, restaurants and activities on offer, or just stroll and soak up the atmosphere!
Exciting with a great vibe. It has everything you want in one place and the vibe is so nice music in the streets and lots to do , see and eat
Shopping & entertainment. Seems deteriorating lately after having been sold by CPT Municipality to some UAE investors.
touristy buy pretty. losts of shops and restaurants typical tourist stuff, but stil scenic
Best place for restaurants and shops. The V&A Waterfront is probably the best option if you want to find souvenir shops, restaurants and have a nice view of the Table Mountain.

Fun place to visit. The Victoria and Alfred Waterfront was a shuttle ride away from our hotel so we visited the place each evening after a full day of activities. It was a busy, but very pleasant place to relax, look at shopping possibilities, have dinner in one of the numerous restaurants and just observe life at the waterfront.
Typical mall. Great mall that's similar to others. Awesome backdrop with Table Mountain. Good restaurants and shops.
Tourist trap. I hate malls in SA as they feel very closed off from reality and V&A is no exception. Also the parking fee is outrageous.

Nicely done but to touristy for the real traveller.. Nicely done, lots of restaurants and very clean.
For me this was a bit too much of a tourist area, but worth a visit.

Tons to do. Definitely worth visiting in Cape Town. Quite a few really excellent restaurants and easy to walk everywhere. Also a great place to get on the open top bus which was a great way to see the City and beaches.

Happy Travellers. There is so much to see,there are so many restaurants,coffee shops bars,you are spoilt for choice,you need to spend at least a day there to have any chance of seeing it all.I can really recommend the big wheel,all the capsules have aircon and the view is amazing

Good choice of restuarants. We went to the V and A Waterfront on various days during our months stay in Cape Town, more often than not to find somewhere to have a meal. There is a good cross secction of restuarants and fast flood outlets. The ferry to Robben Island is situated at the waterfront, and a marina. Circular Quay Sydney it is not, but it is a great place for an evenings stroll, or somewhere to kill a couple of hours in the afternoon.
over rated, pricey and a bit too touristy. It's pricey, touristy and busy. Good for the last minute shopping before leaving for home. On positive side it's a buzzy place and loads of life.

The Best Seafood and so much choice!. If you like seafood you must visit Victoria & Alfred Waterfront! Lots of restaurants with so much fresh fish and seafood and the prices are more than reasonable. Lots of other things to see there too!
Great safe place. Even through we were told to be careful in Capetown, the V&A Waterfront was very safe with lots of people around all the time, plenty of entertainment and fun
Aquarium. Lots to see & do & so many options for eating (take away & sit down). A definite must is a visit to the Aquarium. If you are lucky, you can see the shark & penguin feeding.
Nice array of shops and attractions. very touristy but enjoyabletake a late afternoon/eveing sundowners cruise

scenic and just great to visit and shop. love all the shops and restaurants with great seafood sometimes it can get a bit busy but thats whats great about the place, very friendly people and nice shows sometimes

Very touristy. This is a very nice walk and visit for a meal. You obviously pay more as it is made for tourists but a nice evening out and some good quality restaurants are here. Balthazar was excellent!
Buzzing. What a wonderful location bars shops and restaurants galore great of a day even better of an evening

Relaxed atmosphere plenty of restaurants. The V&A is perfect for a stroll. Lots of nice restaurants and shops. Definitely worth a visit. A visit to the Victoria shopping mall is worth it, if only to cool off out of the sun :-)

Great place, full of atmosphere. A must when visiting Cape Town, something for everyone.
We did a 30 minute helicoter tour from the Waterfront which was amazing!

Not what it's cracked up to be. I have traveled to South Africa many times, and have visited the waterfront on at least 8 occasions. This last time I must say that I was disappointed. The area is very busy and crowded, and much of the entertainment and shopping is second-rate. The vast warehouse formerly full of interesting shopping is now full of cheap junk. There are many nice jewelry stores with appropriately high prices.Here are the pluses:- lovely view of table mountain- interesting eateriesMinuses:- not the place it was 2 years ago- very crowded- we were intimidated for money by a security guard- we took a sailing trip on a catamaran but were overwhelmed by a huge  crowd of noisy children, most of whom threw up on the deck.- the boat trip to Robben Island was a disappointment as it was very crowded, and with continuous loud singing by other trippers. Mandela was a national figure, but I did not believe all the tales told by the ex-inmates.
Entertaining. Loads of fun stuff to do. Shopping, restaurants, sight seeing, movies. Great place to hang out and have fun

Scenery and Shopping at its Best!. If you're at the Alfred and Vic Waterfront, you're in the heart of the action in Cape Town! From here you can catch a tour out to Robbin Island, do some shopping, people watch or sip an espresso. It was in walking distance to the hotel that I stayed in, the Protea Hotel, Breakwater Lodge (an affordable hotel, that used to be a prison; not creepy at all; actually really neat). There is an outdoor entertainment area where they have concerts in the summer. The back drop scenery is Table Mountain on one side and the beautiful Atlantic on the other side. There are many street performers doing anything from quartet singing to playing instruments. I really enjoyed the entire atmosphere and recommend an espresso and people watching at Cafe Europa.

Buzzing Vibrant Hub. Staying in apartments with my family attached to the waterfront we used the facilities daily for 5 days during our stay in Cape Town. Being from Sydney the fireworks on New Years Eve was slightly underwhelming but entertaining none the less. There is an abundance of eateries, shops and attractions that kept us entertained and fed very well. It always felt safe and there were always street performers that added to the vibrance.
a big commercial center. This is ok on a rainy day or if you love shopping and tourists.
The Wheel. Remember to go on the Wheel, both in daylight and at nigh. Great Africana shopping, too!

A world on its own. The V&A Waterfront is an amazing place and you can easily spend the whole day exploring it and all its attractions. I try to visit it every time I go to Cape Town, even if its only for the view across the waterfront towards Table Mountain. On this visit I went ot show the kids Nobel Square and the Crate Man. We also took a walk through the craft market and went on the big wheel to enjoy the magnificent view from the top. Truly one of Cape Town's top attractions.
First class atraction.. Quality shopping, a vast array of dining options - something to suit all tastes and budgets. Spoilt for choice - prices are very reasonable.

The best Waterfront. very busy tourist attraction with incredible view of the harbpur and table Mountain. Great for shopping, dining, accomodation and mingling with a very cosmopolitan crowd. This attraction is iconic of Cape Town and a must visit for all. Excellent for seafood and great atmosphere at night.

Always A Nice Place to Visit. Every time I come to C.T. I have to visit. Great place to shop, eat, enjoy entertainment and just hang out with friends. If you enjoy healthy food, visit Melissa's. The best soups and sandwiches, and the all time best red tea cappuccino.
Shopping and dining paradise. We could spend hours in W&A Waterfront without getting bored.

Convenient for shopping and dining. This former part of Cape Town harbour has been turned into a giant shopping mall with a wide variety of restaurants to cater to various tastes. No trip to Cape Town is complete without visiting the V&A waterfront but, once there, you may find it very similar to similar places in your home country...

Fun.. Beautifully designed and executed by a team under David Jack, who knew how to create an area of fun and beauty. Inevitably prices at the Waterfront are more steep than elsewhere in Cape Town. Some good restaurants - some very ho-humif you want a luxurious meal try the Table Bay hotel.
Atmosphere. Lovely atmosphere and a tourist paradise...Shopping in the Alfred Mall, restaurants all over the waterfront and lots of arts and crafts...This is Cape Town

Mixed Feelings. This is a very big 'mall' both indoors and out. It has some decent restaurants but most are average food but full of people anyway. Our favorite restaurant for the food was Harbour House (relatively new when we were there). It is an ok place to go for an afternoon if you have a lot of time in Cape Town. If you don't then there are other better options unless you want to shop.
What a buzz!. So much going on around the Waterfront area. Great restaurants and attractions.
Shopper Paradise. Large centre will a abundance of lovely stores, being season it was very busy

Nice way to spend a day in Cape Town. Don't go in season, it is a bit crowded, but we usually go during quieter times and then it is really great. There is a variety of restaurants to choose from, and you can shop till you drop with lots and lots of different stores, from brand names to chain stores. All of this is part of a real working harbor. Highly recommended!

A Multicultural Street Fair!. Spend an afternoon at the V&A Waterfront and you'll come away with a sense of the spirit and flavor of the new South Africa. Everone is there: all ages, all colors, all continents. There is music and shopping and eating and just watching the crowd. In summer there will be a crowd, but even in winter, when more happens indoors you'll want to take in the scene.
Shop till you drop. My wife loves to shop and shop she did. This place was great and be sure to stop into the Mugg and Bean for a bite to eat.
Too touristy and way overrated. There are some nice shops to mooch around and boats to see but thats about it! There didn't seem to be any decent restaurants- just lots of cheap food of no quality.
Enjoyed meandering around the harbour!. Enjoy a few hours meandering around. Lots of excellent restaurants, plenty of shops, full of atmosphere. Something for everyone. Very relaxed.
Vibrant. Chic and cosmopolitan, a good range of high quality restaurants and shops, and always lots of entertainment groups
Delightful. Another must, it is the part of the citty which buzzes with action, bars restaurants, shops, boat trips.

Great complex. Safe for even solo travelers. Lots of nice shops, pubs, attractions, the Aquarium, the ferry to Robben Island, live local entertainment every day, and fabulous restaurants. Try Willoughby's for sushi and fresh fish. Baia for Portuguese style seafood. And my favorite fish is Kingklip - one of South Aftica's, most popular and delicious fish!

Lots to do at the waterfront!. The best part of the V& A waterfront was the entertainment that was connected to the waterfront, and the craft markets that are there. The red shed and another market are there with unique items that you wont find in other places. You can also catch a quick cab down to Mouille Point and Sea point. Beware, that time will go by so fast while you are there. Also, the Cape Town Market is not that good, and you will be better served at another resteraunt outside of the waterfront area..
Busy but pretty. Lots of shopping and lots of people. Parking is a little challenging so opt for a cab or park further away and walk.
Great place to wander. What a great place to hang out, it has everything going on there. Entertainment, great food and especially the beers,
Good life!. Brilliant night life, fantastic atmosphere and top food! Excellent!
an institution. although the waterfront has become a tourist trap it still is a must to see , you cant beat being down in the docks watching seals listening to the coon carnival

atmosphere is great. no stop to cape town is complete unless you have visited the victoria alfred waterfront.
one of the few working harbours
the place is so alive
the choice of eateries is fantastic.
the architecture, design and layout are simply impressive
a definite must see, and with the number of people visiting it is no wonder it so so popular

Shopper's Paradise. Anything and everything here...a good variety of restaurants to please anyone, shopping mall with bargain up to designer goods and hotels situated right on the site. A very very busy area at any time of day so be prepared for crowds.

Great!. Lovely mix of old and new. Great restaurants with an enormous choice of food. wine and drinks. Lots of shops selling almost everything you could think of. We visited on more than one occasion and there was always something different to see. It seems to close down around 9 to 10pm in the evening though, but this is about right to get back to your hotel or accommodation before dark sets in.If you get the chance, have a sunset cruise on 'Tiger 2', champagne and nibbles as the sun goes down over the sea. Worth every penny.

V & A Superb. Excellent range of shops and the retsaurants, three of which we used had impressive views of Table Mountain. Pia ladies clothes shop has some unique designs and is worth a visit. Good to see some independent stores rather than the run of the mill standard chain stores.
Shoppers paradise. Not quite my scene, but a world class establishment. Great shops and restaurants in a working harbour environment. Better than Darling Harbour in Sydney

So much to see, too much to do. Unless you set aside a full day, preferably 2 days, you will not see everything the magnificent V&A Waterfront has to offer. Set in the huge harbour of Cape Town, the Waterfront offers literally hundreds of Restaurants and bars, endless upmarket shops and spectacular views over the City of Cape Town and the sea. There's something for every conceivable taste, budget and preference. Most catering establishments have outdoor seating, allowing the enjoyment of Cape Town's superb weather. No visit to Cape Town is complete without seeing the Waterfront.

Cool place to hang out. Its a good place for anybody, family, couples, young and old. There are great restaurants, shops and other activities there. However its nothing I havnt seen before. I went there 3 time so I definitely recommend it

Something For Everyone. An abundance of shops and restaurants for all pockets and tastes. There is a main shopping mall with shops selling local and international labels.
Restaurants serving a la carte and table d'hôte.
Attractions to include an African market and the Aquarium.

Shopping and food. This place is a mecca for shopping, eating , wining and dining. It is really busy on bank holidays so avoid and go long street or short market street for food.I liked mitchells brewery and we had good food at tasca but to be honest found the other restraunts full of posh people from cruise ships who did nothing but moaned.
Touristy Waterfront is nice for an afternoon visit. Some good restaurants and sights. But very popular with tourists and locals.

A lovely area. This area is very nice and a must see. However it is mostly high end shopping and eating which is not my thing. There is a big wheel which is fun and the street performers are very good.
Over-rated. The V&A Waterfront is very over-rated. It's designed for tourists and is a rip off at the best of times.I did, however, take a cruise to Sea Point and back, which I thoroughly enjoy.
lots to do. very cool place. lots to do. very nice restuarants and crafts markets.

Not much to see. Had expected a picturesque cafe scene, so the commercialised shopping mall and fast food shops was disappointing. The shopping mall itself was fine if you are looking for that but little else in the area that we could find to make this a place to recommend

Beautiful but avoid on weekends!. The Waterfront was one of my favourite places to come during my 2 months in Cape Town. It has a certain San Franciscan feel to it with the coloured buildings around the harbour, the seals in the water and the boats sailing in and out. It's very relaxed, and sitting outside the mall watching the big screen or just enjoying some lunch was extremely nice. The mall too is VERY big and good for all kinds of shopping, and of course it contains two cinemas as well. My only warning would be not to go on the weekend! It gets so terribly crowded, especially outside in front of the mall. A week day morning is much nicer to enjoy the buildings, shops and sights arounf the waterfront.

Great place to wander by the water and get something to eat. The V & A waterfront is a wonderful place to spend a half day wandering by the water, enjoying the sites of Table Mountain, window shopping and getting something to eat and drink. There are literally dozens of good restaurants here so you'll have plenty of choices in all price ranges.

Good for the shopaholic. Its a great destination. Good shopping. Surpised at some of the high end stores that are in V&A. Allow a couple of hours if you want to go through the entire mall and all the other areas around.

Lots to See and Do. This is a great tourist stop. Food and shopping all in one place. There are some interesting little shops, as well as bigger more mainstream shops. The prices weren't outrageous and we went in a small group during the day and felt perfectly safe. A great leisurely way to spend an afternoon (or evening) in town, especially if you've been doing a lot of exploring up and down the Cape and need some downtime...or if you're traveling with less adventurous companions.

Terrific place tol shop and dine. You can do it all at V & A Waterfront. The shopping mall has some beautiful shops to buy African artifacts, both souvenier-y and nicer stuff for home decorating. A fun place to walk around, choosing an outdoor cafe or restaurant to dine at. Boats leave here for various tours as well. The gigantic ferris wheel is not-to-be-missed for a bird's eye view of the city.

Lovely area to chill out!. We had a couple of great meals and evenings in this area- there is also a cinema if you need some down time. You can go on the Ferris wheel for views over the harbour, arrange a boat cruise, shop or do a brewery tour...fun, fun, fun!

Cape town at it's smallest. If you enjoy spending money and being surrounded by tourists from all over the world this is the spot for you.  The wheel is nice to visit at night the boat tours are affordable but do not offer the excitement of boat tours in other locations.We spotted some seals and a dolphin on our 90 min boat tour. The aquarium which is also located here is worth to visit. You can spend a whole day at the waterfront however make sure to bring plenty of money with you.

A Tourist trap. I am very surprised to read the other reviews here. We found it a tourist trap, commercialised and noisy at nights. One also doesnt feel safe there. There have been a number of muggings.,
Best place in cape town. Shopping haven and awesome restaurants plus it's on the habour so might as well cruise while there.

Another must for Cape Town visitors. Even when the Waterfront is busy and bustling, you have a sense of peace as you roam around. We take every opportunity to wander around there and love to check out any ships and boats docked by the Table Bay Hotel. The World resident ship was there for a few days around Christmas to allow it's passengers and residents time ashore to experience this wonderful city.Shopping caters for all pockets as do the restaurants and eateries and there are all types of cruises and boat trips around the Cape Pensinula and out to Seal Island.
stunning atmosphere. one of the best places in cape town, the best atmospheres and view
amazing. SUCH MUCH THINGS TO DO .. shops, eats, coffee shops,. Beatiful place to run too

Great atmosphere. This is a wonderful spot in Cape Town - lots of shops, restaurants, street performers and so many things to do!
I spent a whole rainy morning in there and I think it's the best retreat on such miserable days
Shoppers heaven - diners delight. All in all something for everyone. During summer holidays extra activities are also presented on the squares.

World-class setting. World class setting and the V&A is well worth a visit. Shopping centres are shopping centres, yet it has some great curio stores, and other shops to spend the $ - leave it for a rainy day or when the weather is not cooperating, well worth it with some nice local restaurants

Some say a tourist trap. But when your thousands of miles from home, it is easy to find and a wide variety of shops, sights and good food. You know you are paying a little more than you would somewhere else in Cape Town, but, overall it isn't unreasonable. Then again my reference point is New York City.
Lovely waterfront shops. If you enjoy shopping and a waterfront then this is for you. Loads of good restaurants inside and outside.

Beautiful. The waterfront was great for shopping and dining. We found our best shopping here and there were many options for dinner- very romantic. We rode the ferris wheel which gave us beautiful views of Table Mountain. Definitely a good place to go in Cape Town.

very convenient place. We spent a lot of time in V&A because the place is lovely, we even watched The Twilight movie the day it launched in Cape Town! Overall the place is pretty happening, also it closes at 9pm everyday, giving me more time to shop.
Nice, but not outstanding. The facilities are laid out in an odd, almost random order. You're walking along and its not quite clear what the organizational plan was intended to be.
too much "disney" for our taste. Large shopping mail with lot's of security agents, maybe it's more exiting in summertime. ......

Shopping mecca in harbour setting. Sad but true, one of the most visited spaces in Cape Town is this "shopping centre" in the old harbour basin, with it's backdrop of Table Mountain. The saving grace is that it's not just another mall, but offers loads to do from the Aquarium, historical buildings and museums and obviously 100's of eateries, pubs, wine bars, movies etc etc. So, yes - it's a tourist trap, but you can navigate your way through it and have a day made up of activities which don't have to cost the earth - and shopping to die for!
Oysters and Champagne. We had Oysters and Champagne while gazing at the most awesome view in the world! What a great experience!
Somewhat overrated. This place buzzes but we fund nothing particularly specal there.
Liked the choices of shops and restaurants.. Great choices in shopping and eating. Nice views. Loved Baia for lunch. Great place to go in the rain.
waterfront. Even though commercialized; it should be part of your tour.
mostly for tourists. the V&A waterfront is not Cape Town specific, a lot of cities have shopping malls and restaurants, may be the view up table mountain is special!
Spoilt For Choice!!!. There is a wide variety of restuarants within the V & A Waterfront.

Great shopping, eating, looking.. Whether you are going to the V&A Waterfront to join a harbor cruise, shopping or just sight seeing, you will be very glad you did.
The shops are quite unique, everything from low cost trinkets to one off pieces of art and everything in between.
Restaurants everywhere, all with quality food at a reasonable price.
V&A Waterfront is pretty touristy. If you're in Capetown, you should visit the waterfront. But I don't recommend spending a lot of time there.

A wonderful place to be. Easy and safe to walk around - great shops - restaurants - attractions. Friendly people Wonderful views of the harbours and almost completely free of litter, both on land and in the water. A place to sit and watch the world go by.
so much to do!. not much I didn't like as there is a lot to do and buy - is nto cheap but you have to hunt to find good prices I think
All the shops you can think of in a lovely setting. whether is a stroll along the marina to look at boats, a lunch to people watch or a days shopping the Marina has it all.

Busy, nice atmosphere. We wandered around the shops here, and also went on the observation wheel (called the wheel of excellence). We were lucky enough that the World Ocean Race was on the day we were here - and the boats left the harbour at 1pm. Be prepared for aching feet!!

Awesome place for Nice dinner and shopping. Hi All ,
This place is very similar to a place in Sydney called Darling harbour and definitely worth a visit if you are in Capetown . This is the perfect place for Shopping and visiting Aquarium and Getonto any Capetown City Sightseeting tours...

A must for all Cape Town visitors. The Waterfront has so much to offer visitors and locals alike. There are an abundance of shops, restaurants and attractions and it is a stunning setting from which to photograph Table Mountain. It is the gateway to Robben Island. There are 2 craft markets, the Blue Shed and the Red Shed, where you can see crafters at work; there is an aquarium, various boat trips, cinemas and a small amphitheatre where you will always find entertainers, as well as at other strategic spots around the Waterfront. Scratch Patch, where you can sift through thousands of semi-precious stones is popular with adults and kids. The Waterfront always has a great vibe!
Touristic. The opposite to Africa...absolutely touristic.

Safe, with a great buzz. We spent a lot of time here. Could be anywhere but we felt safe and the place was buzzing with street entertainment. The restaurant food was all good quality and quite reasonably priced at the exchange rate we had. The shops were amazing, even if it was a case of looking rather than buying!

Buzzing atmosphere. There is always something happening at the V&A; this trip was no exception. The Volvo Ocean Race had just landed in town and there were activities aplenty. The restaurant offering at the V&A is fabulous and I certainly have more places to try. There are many great bars to choose from, which are fabulous on a warm afternoon with Table Mountain as your backdrop. Seal watching is another great way to spend your afternoon.

Nice to pass an hour or so. A pretty waterfront with loads of restaurants, shops and craft stalls. Good to pass an hour or so browsing or to get something to eat. Quite touristy - I can imagine it being great fun when the Volvo Ocean Race comes to Cape Town.

Touristy but a nice & welcome change of pace. I visited the V&A Waterfront a few times when I was in So. Africa. It is very safe with pleasant shopping and restaurants. I would not say it is particularly unique or authentic but enjoyable none the less. There is a great flea market and craft fair regularly held in one of the buildings near the main mall area which is worth a visit.
A must to visit and enjoy. Sea, sun, shopping, entertainment, food paradise and greate ambiance

Shopping. The shoppingsenter is made for women. You can buy anything you can think of. From clothes til juwelry and from books til souvenirs (its a mans nightmere). The waterfront has some good bars and restaurants. You can book helicopter flights and catamaran boattrips. Boat til robben island goes from the waterfront.

A pleasant place to stroll!. The V&A Waterfront has restaurants and shops, a nice place to stroll and spend an afternoon, evening. Cruise ships can be seen in Port, sit outside at one of the numerous restaurants that offer outdoor dining. There is entertainment, shops for all of your souvenir needs, very safe, just a great atmosphere.
Full of great places to eat. Relaxing walk with lots to see and grat places to eat.

Exciting Atmosphere with Lots of Nice Restaurants. We really enjoyed the bustle at the V&A Waterfront. Its a good place to spend the evening after having a tour of Capetown. There's a huge mall and Craft Shops (although quite expensive). Generally makes for a good hangout and a melting pot for tourists and citizens alike.Lots of eateries/ restaurants to choose from. We really loved the outdoor sittings that provided a view of the habour. There was also a variety of boat tours available and a huge Wheel that shows a aerial view of the environment. A huge Christmas tree was also on display at the time of the year..... It was quite chilly in the evenings so most of the outdoor restaurants provided blankets and outdoor heat lamps for their guests... really nice

best shopping !!!. loved it! lots of shopping, lots of music, restaurants, bars, stores, crafts...everything in one place and the view is amazing! kids loved the seal plattform where you always find one, 2 or more seals being lazy .....2 oceans aquarium is right there and it is a perfect option for a rainy day if you have kids

Gregarious at heart?. If you like to be amongst lots of people from all walks of life,If you like many resturants and shops just a step apart, if you like the freshness of the sea, if you are interested in the hustle and bussle of a working harbour,then Victoria and Alfred Waterfront is for you. If you prefer a quiet and calm environment, then stay away from here.

The Place To Be. Our hotel was on the V&A Waterfront and the area had everything we needed.We were out and about during the day but in the evenings we stayed in the Waterfront area, plenty of restaurants, shops and a big mall. No need to go anywhere else.Plenty of security about at all times and the place did have a bit of a buzz, particularly at night.

Great for Visitors. A safe and secure location for visitors. A wide choice of restaurants to suit every taste. Shops open late. Good parking facilities. Great views of Table Mountain. Always worth a visit when in Cape Town.
Capetown,Nov 2011. Tons of restaurants and just a wonderful scenery. The mall has lots of stores and also has a restaurant there called Willoughby. Wonderful food.

Tons of great restaurants, nice atmosphere. Whatever you feel like eating - you can almost be sure to find it here.. however, since in South Africa do yourself a favour and go for some springbok carpaccio..
Almost as god as SFrancisco. Busy pretty waterfront, good food, plus very safe. Even good shopping for grandkids.
Exciting waterfront. An exciting and well worthwhile place to visit. Fabulous restaurants, interesting shops and all in beautfiul surroundings.
fun but just a shopping centre with outdoor life. parking etc is great but atmosphere is slightly disneyland.
Nice but touristy place. Fine walk-around spot. Very touristy. Not real Cape Town but good to grab a bit and do some shopping.

Yummy and great shops. The restaurants are worth visiting , and you can get your souvenirs here for a great value . It was wonderfula nd relaxing to sit in the sun underneath big umbrellas and watch the Volvo Worldrace teams enjoying there lunch too . What a fabulous place - this is the Capetown Tourists need to see ! The salad we had were lekker and the wine excellent . All and we took a tour on an ancient steamboat , very small one and saw the harbour from the sea .

Everything you'll need while in Cape Town. V&A Waterfront is a top-rate shopping and dining experience. While it doesn't offer all that much in the way of a true African experience, it did provide plenty of creature comforts for this visiting American - including a Haagen-Dazs, a great bookstore, good (if over-priced) restaurants offering wonderful outside seating & views, and lots of shopping possibilities.Don't miss the huge ferris wheel and be sure to take in the free outside musical entertainment.
Beautiful. Something for everyone at every price point. Great food and a variety of shops.

Lively Eating Out. Very vibrant friendly, disliked beggars hanging around . View spectacular the harbour, Table Mountain especially at night when all lit up. Parking a problem when busy, not enough signage to indicate parking area full. Some eating places suck and should upgrade Kentucky needs face lift.
Gorgeous place. Shopping, eating, watching the day go by... it's all here. Lots of good seafood restaurants.
Busy. Lots to see and do, and many great restaurants. Also good shopping and just a great place to relax and "people-watch."

Shop till you drop. The waterfront shops range from a U.S.-style mall to a very large arcade of native crafts. Some of the art work is very good, but there's also plenty of the same kind of schlock you'd find in any tourist trap. Having said that, it's worth a visit.
It's a standard mall with some great restaurants. Try Karibus and City grille for some of the best meals in town
Beautiful.. This is the most touristic area, it's worthy for sure, but move your but out of here and visit other areas of the city

Almost the most popular place to visit after the mountain.. So many shops, so many restaurants of top quality you could go every day and always enjoy the visit. Lots of walking if you want exercise, often entertainment, boat trips around the harbour or short trips out to sea. Some top class expensive hotels, even a pub with draught beer brewered on site.

Everything you need. Well what's there to say? One can spend even a whole day there . There are shops, restaurants and bars on the harbour with a beautiful view. There is also a very helpful Tourism Board where you can get a lot of information about the whole country. There are movie theatres and from there you can take the boat to go whale watching ( only if you don't get sea sick that is) or to go to Robben Island. My favourite restaurant is in the Waterfront: Willoughby's and Co. Try it .
The waterfront. All your souveniers and entertainment in one spot. Newly erected big wheel is absolutely magnificant

Overrated, a shopping mall in a lovely location. I was quite dissapointed, as the V&A Waterfront is basically a mall with a view. The Waterfront area is beautiful and I would recommend buying a frozen yoghurt from Marcels and taking a walk around the harbour area, but the mall is quite pricey an not very special at all. There is a nice selection of restaurants, but not the best that Cape Town has to offer by far. You get the impression that the restaurants and shops are priced for tourists, without offering an authentic Cape experience.

Variety of Restaurants - like a big food court. At the waterfront there is something for everyone. Entertainment in the plazas, lots of different stores and any kind of restaurant you could possible want to eat in.
well you have to go there, don't you. I gather some people never go anywhere else. It's safe, amusing and good for shopaholics, with good restaurants. But there's a lot more the Cape Town than this
very nice to stroll around. there is a great "wellness" centre part of the crafts market and i highly recommend the body realignment service there
Huge shopping area and good restaurants. Can find almost anything in the shopping centre. Good for browsing and shopping
Unforgetable place. Anyone traveling in Cape Town cannot miss this place. Shops, restaurants and a wonderful athmosphere that makes us dreaming about coming again.
Great Vibe. What a fab place to chill out, great restaurants,great atmosphere from the street entertainers.
Very impressive. I loved the V&A it is very comtemporary. Nice restaurents with a nice atmosphere. You can't visit Cape Town without a trip to the V & A.
nice place. Great place to spend time here , lots of shops, restaurants and bars. Various trips on boats from here.Live music street bands and acts.
Nice way to chill at the end of a busy afternoon!. Just being able to chill on the steps of the amphitheatre, listening to the local bands playing!
International Standard. Great shopping, variety of attractions, eateries and entertainment. Great to see what an international representation their is.
Shopping paradise. This Mall has all the shops that you would not find anywhere else, be sure not to miss it.
Perfect. Just the right place to go to for a little expensive shopping, great dinner (lots of restaurant choices) and then just for sight seeing.
Great area for shopping and eating.. Could be feeling as expensive compared with restaurants outside the area, but still worth it. We had 2 nice dinners, one at Beltahazar and one at Harbour House
Great area for shopping and eating.. Could be feeling as expensive compared with restaurants outside the area, but still worth it. We had 2 nice dinners, one at Beltahazar and one at Harbour House
a mall. Full of tourists shops and restaurants. Nonetheless, the small boat harbor is photogenic; the ferris wheel impressive and the "lego man" fun to see
Lively. Full of great shops and great choice of restaurants

well built with everything you need. everything I needed for a flying visit; bank, postard shops, trip to Robben Island, ferris wheel, restaurant, supermarket, bars, taxi stand. I was a bit worried about being out alone but there is tons of security so felt fine. Many street performances, saw a group perform in the evening on the stage at the watefront, had dinner and sat watching a band with a nice glass of wine at a bar, Really lovely.

Nice And Relaxed.. This is a modern development of shops, bars and restaurants which is an extremely calm place to visit. You'll probably see seals and will definitely see some fantastic yachts in the marina. A great place for a stroll by the water-side.
Must visit spot in Cape Town. Great shopping. Great restaurants (don't just choose the first one you see - browse around). Great social scene.

interesting and expensive. the V & A is a good place to wander around but the restaurants are expensive and touristy especially Quay 4 better to go to places like Tyger valley in the Northern suburbs if you want to shop and get value for the rand.

Great Vibe. The V&A Waterfront is usually bustling with buskers of all shapes and sizes, great atmosphere and loads of restaurants. The restaurants and shops are pricey but if you view the menus you can still find something reasonable. Week-ends are the best time to visit for the buzz and vibe as the locals come out in force at this time. Look for those restaurants - they are usually cheaper.It a great "people watching" place and the shops sell some beautiful things.You can take boat trips - either just around the harbour or a sunset cruise. There are many on offer. The V&A Waterfront is well worth a visit even if you only sit down for a cup of coffee.
Nice place to be. No visit to Cape Town is complete without a visit to the Waterfront.Lots to see and visit.We loved the atmosphere there and we saw some seals in the water!
great wine and people watching. something for everyone - sundowners, shopping, seals, good food - great entertainment

Sensitive rejuvenation of old docks. The area has been sensitively revamped and has retained its historical impact. Whilst it is very touristy there are some good shops and places to eat. Lots of opportunities to purchase souvenirs, most of which are very samey, but more individual pieces are available if you're prepared to be discerning. The Nobel Peace statues left me with a much greater sense of South Africa's recent history than the Robben Island trip. The street entertainers were great - opera meets marimba!

Dockside experience. Very well converted dockyard area with facilities for all budgets. Plenty of street entertainment. Extra bonus of boat and helicopter trips. We went on a catamaran and came back into harbour with three whales being escorted out by the harbour pilot. What a bonus

Loved it, safe and pretty. My boyfriend thought the V & A was a bit too perfect, like Disney World or similar. However, I thought the cleanliness, safety, shopping and general well kept lay out was fantastic. Gorgeous places to eat with views everywhere, and it was the only time in Cape Town I felt safe walking around alone. Highly recommend

V&A Waterfront. An interesting place to visit. We visited during the local school holiday period and there were lots of people about enjoying the sunshine, music, food and shopping. We visited on our first day in Cape Town and it was not immediately apparent but as time went on and we visited other places we realised the prices of merchandise in the waterfront shops was generally pretty reasonable.

Tourist Trap. The V&A is good and safe place for shopping or a boat trip but it is a big tourist trap. I found the restaurants to be quite over priced for the quality. There are many other great places in the city to go for dinner, so don't fall into this trap.

Lovely location and views. Worth visiting the V&A for a bite to eat and drink and get your shopping in. Shopping is a little bit more pricey than what you usually get in South Africa. There's often a few street performers out for some entertainment too.
just ok. tacky and people approaching for money. avoid late at night.
Totally Cosmopolitan. Beautiful restaurants, bars, views and shops, what more could you ask for :)

Good for shopping, drinks and food. This is a very safe place both day and evening. You can walk around with your camera out all the time without feeling worried. There are also lots of shops, restaurants and bars. Although it is still a working port area there is lots to do for tourists.
Ok. Nothing special all a bit prefab but excellent fish restaurant, Willowbys in shopping centre.

Great bustling centre of Capetown. We spent a lot of time in this area as it had fabulous shopping and restaurants with easy parking and a beautiful modern setting...... it is a must for anyone visiting capetown. Willoughby & Co and Melissa's cafe are exceptional......
Lots going on. Great choice of places to dine or to shop as well as many sightseeing/tourist options (boat cruises/helicopter rides/aquarium etc.)

We expected "great" and instead experienced "OK.". Perhaps our expectations were too high, or perhaps it's because we were there in the cool off-season, but we were disappointed. We LOVED the Cape Garden Tour, but the waterfront was a meagre offering of mall shops and overpriced restaurants. The nobel peace price (4) statues, however, were memorable.

Vibrant city be the sea. Victoria and Alfred Waterfront is one of the top three attractions of South Africa, along with Table Mountain and Kruger Park. It is not only a shopping and dining experience, although there are many malls and good restaurants. This is a European waterfront with an African touch which makes it distinct.
